description:
#FREEDOM started as a joint venture of Barry Hansen Jr, Greg Cristallo, Angus Sinclair, David Hitchings, Eric Phillips and Harris Decker. The company now consists of eight partners and has recently moved into a new facility to begin production.

Established in 2012, #FREEDOM Craft Brewery (pronounced "Hashtag Freedom") features modern beers brewed using traditional methods. Our brews are all natural and our flagship beer is created entirely of American grown ingredients.
name: #FREEDOM Craft Brewery

description: (512) Brewing is a microbrewery located in the heart of Austin, brewing for the community using as many local, domestic and organic ingredients as possible. We use USDA organic 2-row base malt because it's the right thing to do. We self distribute because we can and we're draft only to keep the product fresh and to reduce disposable packaging. You can taste the passion in our products and we appreciate all our local support.
name: (512) Brewing Company

description: We started back in 2006 with three guys and one simple vision.. brew beer, drink beer and have fun doing it. Since then we have grown but our focus will always stay the same... Rough morning? Grab a beer. Powder day? The "gone skiing" sign goes up. Too hot to work? Mandatory company float. You get the picture... here's to living it up with a beer in hand!
name: 10 Barrel Brewing Company

description:
Come out and see us at the cider house, where all of the action happens! Meet our team, see our process, try all of our ciders while enjoying the atmosphere of our beautiful tasting room!

We are located in the west of Los Angeles County, surrounded by the hills of the Malibu Coast.....America's newest wine appelation!
name: 101 Cider House

description:
Just a bunch of reckless boys who aren’t afraid to put the cart before the horse, twist every arm, break every sweat, and genuinely fake it till we make it. Because in these troubled times, creating and sharing beer with the world just made sense, if we could do it our way... with visual aids and a soundtrack.

At 101 North, we believe progressive is a beer style.
name: 101 North Brewing Company

description: 10K Brewing offers a rotating selection of craft beer and entertainment in Anoka, MN.
name: 10K Brewing

description: Grant County's first brewery, we are nestled in the city of John Day, Oregon surrounded by beautiful mountains, rivers, and ranchlands. Stop by for a cold pint, or to fill a growler or two. In addition to our own beers brewed on site, we also offer a number of guest taps from small breweries around Oregon.
name: 1188 Brewing Company

description: 12Degree Brewing is an artisanal, Belgian-inspired brewery located in the heart of Old Town Louisville, Colorado.
name: 12Degree Brewing

description:
We are a three-barrel brew house born from the shadows of long tenured Portland restaurant, Philadelphia’s Steaks & Hoagies. The brewery addition was added back in 1994 but operated quietly as Oregon’s smallest micobrewery for many years. With the more recent additions of David Vohden and Cameron Moore, we have refocused our efforts on producing and sharing a constantly changing lineup of fresh quality beers from right here in the Great Pacific Northwest. Vohden oversees all brewery operations which he has met with great success. Most recently of which was a Silver Medal for our Woozy Weizenbock at the Great American Beer Festival. We see our recent efforts bringing exciting results.

We reached completion of a 3,500 sq ft. addition to expand our brew house in the Summer of 2013. Vohden and Moore finished installation of the glycol system just in time to quench the thirsty demands of the 2013 Oregon Brewers Festival with a crowd pleasing Traverse Cherry Wit Bier. In addition to the brew house expansion we have added four 7-barrel fermentation tanks for an eventual all around 7-barrel system upgrade. A Cellar was also added for barrel aging, sours, and other delectable experiments.

Although most of the square footage was utilized for brewing purposes. We were sure to save some space for all you beer drinkers. A mezzanine gives an elevated view down onto the open brewery floor. If you happen to drop by on a brew day you too can enjoy the sweet sensory overload and watch the action (or lack thereof). A beautiful black walnut bar, fully stocked with 13 drafts faucets was added to accompany the additional seating area and to cater to private events. However, the new bar and brewery seating are always open to patrons except in the case of private events. Another 60′ TV was added to the new mezzanine area and we continue to play all major sporting events. Go Blazers!

Some would say our legendary steak sandwiches and two dozen rotating taps are a match made in heaven. Please join us and stop by to see what’s new!
name: 13 Virtues Brewing Co

description:
History books tell us that local Vermonter and beer enthusiast Ethan Allen was a leader inthe effort to make Vermont the fourteenth star on the U.S. flag in 1791. And those textbooks are right; especially about the 1791 part.

Today, in Franklin County, Vermont, Army veteran Steve Gagner is honoring his home state and passion – brewing great beer – with 14th Star Brewing Co.

14th Star is Steve’s 1,200-square-foot nanobrewery on Lower Newton Street, in St. Albans City.

Nanobreweries make less than four-barrel batches, and as of your eyes hitting this paragraph, there are still less than 100 nanobreweries in America.

What makes 14th Star stand out? Well, it’s about the only brewery in Vermont that’s located above Burlington. Period.

But that’s not it. Not entirely.

You see – this is your beer. Oh, sure, Steve plans on starting you off with one-barrel batches of pale ale, brown ale, and Belgian white. There will be more, of course, but that’s up to you. So tell Steve what style beer you want in your 14th Star growler at: steve@14thstarbrewing.com.
On our end, we are readying to open our doors. Our goal is this July. (Check out our Pint of Progress on our home page.)

We can’t wait to watch you let your hair down and lift your glass, Vermont. We’ll enjoy that. And remember – this is your beer. You enjoy it.
name: 14th Star Brewing

description:
16 Mile Brewing Company, Inc. opened its doors in July 2009 to the public. It is owned and operated by Brett McCrea and Chad Campbell.

The 16 Mile Brewing Company name harkens back to the late 1700’s when Georgetown was still known as Pettijohn’s old field, a rather isolated town, centrally located in Sussex County. The area was “16 miles from anywhere” in the county and was the best place for farmers, merchants, and politicians to meet to conduct official business. Georgetown replaced Lewes as the County Seat when numerous petitions were sent to Delaware’s General Assembly requesting that the move be made to accommodate all county residents. (For more information see “16 Miles from Anywhere: A History of Georgetown, Del., by William J. Wade.)
name: 16 Mile Brewing Company

description: 18th Street Brewery is a brewpub in the Miller Beach neighborhood of Gary, Indiana in late 2013. Conveniently located off the Dunes Highway and the Metra 'Miller' stop, 18th Street specializes in both big and small beers, from 9.5% barrel aged Double Milk Stouts to 4.5% Session Pale Ales. We have a kitchen that specializes in small plates, salads, sandwiches, and seasonal offerings. Our large, open front room is great for families. In January of 2014 Drew Fox was named 'Best New Brewer' in Indiana by  Ratebeer.com. Our Double IPA, SINISTER, was named 'Best Fall Brew in Indiana 2013' by VisitIndiana.com.
name: 18th Street Brewery

description: We began building our dream in 2007. We have improved our recipes, gathered feedback, made changes, and sampled our products. We have one concept. We want to Make great beer. Not beer that tastes like a bitter plant, or a leather belt. Not clear beer that has been mass produced and over filtered. Just wonderful, fantastic beer, for the many. All from a very small space. 192 square feet to be exact. We have packed only the essentials into our brewery. We make every batch by hand and we nurture it every step of the way. Great beer is what we work for, and great beer is what we enjoy.
name: 192 Brewing Company

description: 1974 Brewing Company is a nano brewery in planning, founded in 2012. We began brewing in late 2008 on a hobby scale with all grain 5 gallon batches. In late 2011 we moved up to 10 gallon batches. Brewing is not only a hobby but a way of life for us, once we started we just couldn’t seem to stop. We really enjoy the process of making the beer as well the finished product. Some of the success we have had in home brewing competitions has only given us confidence and motivation to take our hobby further. We plan on expanding our system to produce 7-10 barrels per batch in 2012 as well as filing the necessary paperwork to begin a legitimate brewery, distributing our beers to the public.
name: 1974 Brewing Company

description:
Opening scheduled for January 2016.

Being born and raised in White Sulphur Springs, owner Barry Hedrich had a great appreciation for the hardworking, rural lifestyle known to many in the area. With its high elevation and cool evening temperatures,the area is known for its high quality wheat and malting barley. After their children left home, Barry and his wife Chris decided it was a good time to start a new hobby – brewing beer. After a couple of years of testing, (much) tasting, experimenting with doing our own malting and researching the industry, we decided it was time to take the next step and open a brewery.

The name 2 Basset Brewery was born out of the many similarities between basset hounds and our love of a good beer. Bassets are friendly, easy going, very social and they love to relax. Most of all, they make us laugh. These are some of the very same reasons many of us gather with family and friends over a great tasting craft beer.

We are proud to be crafting brews featuring locally grown grains, malting them ourselves and utilizing other Montana ingredients. Owners Barry and Chris Hedrich and their basset hounds Stanley and Leroy look forward to seeing you in beautiful White Sulphur Springs.
name: 2 Basset Brewery

description: Damn Fine Cider. Boldly Crafted in the Pacific Northwest. Fresh-pressed 100% NW apples. No added sugar. Nothing artificial.
name: 2 Towns Ciderhouse

description: 2 Witches Winery & Brewing Company, located in Danville, Virginia, is a combination farm/urban winery and picobrewery. We are affiliated with 2 Witches Vineyard located in Chatham, Virginia. We hope to open in May 2013.
name: 2 Witches Winery and Brewing Company, Inc.

description: The 21st Amendment Brewery offers a variety of award winning house made brews and American grilled cuisine in a comfortable loft like setting. Join us before and after Giants baseball games in our outdoor beer garden. A great location for functions and parties in our semi-private Brewers Loft. See you soon at the 21A!
name: 21st Amendment Brewery

description: Here at the 23rd Street Brewery, we pride ourselves in creating and offering ales and lagers of exceptional quality. Often in the micro brewing industry, quality is compromised for quantity. We brew handcrafted, small batch beers to ensure freshness is as crisp as it is clean. We use only the finest domestic and imported barley and hops to brew beers of tradition and beers of distinction. The brew house we call home is a 15 barrel Pub Brewing System located on the upper level of the impressive brewery interior. In the past year, we have doubled our production to exceed 1000 barrels (2000 Kegs) per year and have begun distributing to other bars and restaurants throughout Kansas.
name: 23rd Street Brewery

description: Two Kids Brewing Company is San Diego's newest Nanobrewery! Now open, we're serving the finest in tasty and unusual ales, sans snobby attitude.
name: 2kids Brewing Company

description: We are a micro that will be making beer that is big on flavor and aroma, the way beer should be. There will be several styles and a continuing line of seasonal and special beers that will be produced throughout the year.
name: 2nd Shift Brewing Co

description: 3 Beards Beer Company enables undiscovered artisan brews from all over the world to be locally brewed and freshly distributed. We focus on talented individuals who have the desire, but not necessarily the means, to share their creations with other enthusiasts.
name: 3 Beards Beer Company

description: 3 Daughters Brewing will be opening fall of 2013 with several exciting new craft beers. With our 30 barrel brewhouse, we will have the capacity to serve the Tampa Bay market new and innovative flavors in our Beach Blonde Ale, Brown Pelican Dunkelweizen and Summer Storm Stout. Keep an eye out for the 3DB brand in your local restaurant and stay tuned for the opening of our tasting room coming soon.
name: 3 Daughters Brewing

description: Drie Fonteinen is the only remaining traditional geuze blender in Belgium, using only 100% spontaneously fermented lambik beer, aged in oak casks, with no artificial sweeteners or other additives. The blendery is connected to the very popular Drie Fonteinen Restaurant in Beersel, on the outskirts of Brussels. The proprietor, Armand Debelder, buys pure lambik from three breweries in Belgium, ages them in oak, and blends them, employing the skill, knowledge, and supreme passion for real geuze that his father handed down to him. Drie Fontenein’s Geuze and fruit Lambiks (cherry, raspberry) are rare, highly prized, and indisputably among the best of Belgium.
name: 3 Fonteinen Brouwerij Ambachtelijke Geuzestekerij

description: The mission of 3 Freaks brewery is to offer small batch hand crafted beer that is truly flavorful. This will be provided to our craft beer family in a laid back atmosphere where we love to talk beer. And yes, you are part of the family. We are a humble brewery and don't have all the answers but we still love to talk beer.
name: 3 Freaks Brewery

description: We strive to make a quality, flavorful brew that all tastebuds will enjoy!
name: 3 Guys and a Beer'd Brewing Company

description:
We will be opening the restaurant Friday, August 24, preparing for the NY brewery license after. 

We will offer fresh meats both outside in the BBQ and inside the restaurant. We will use local produce as much as we can, from local Finger Lakes farms. 

We will strive to be family-friendly in price & atmosphere, offering local favorites (BBQ etc) and quality musical entertainment.

Smoked meats, handmade sausage & cheese, homemade pasta & flatbreads.

Craft — Flavor — Quality
name: 3 Herons Brewing Company

description:
3 Ravens began in 2003 out of necessity, when a local hotel stopped serving traditional English style cask conditioned 'Real Ale' from beer engines.

Faced with a critical lack of supply, a group of passionate engineers (led by home brewer Ben Pattison), built a microbrewery and accompanying bar downstairs and began handcrafting a range of their own "real ales" as small batch 300 litre brews. Hailed by the engineers and beer judges alike for their robust flavour, the ales received immediate return, taking Silver and Bronze medals at the Australian & International Beer Awards. 3 Ravens hit the shelves of local restaurants and bars and demand soon outgrew supply. In 2005, the brewery was upgraded to 1200 litres to help service a growing list of stockists and a swag of thirsty engineers!
name: 3 Ravens Brewing

description:
All families have their stories: tales of grandparents and great-grandparents and the incredible things they accomplished, or lived through, or overcame. My family was no different. I grew up hearing stories that cascaded across a broad plain of topics, but the ones that fascinated me most centered around the Kingsbury Breweries.

Back in 1926, the Kingsbury Breweries, then known as the Gutsch Brewery, declared bankruptcy. It was a tough time for breweries across the country as Prohibition was in full effect. Many breweries failed during that time, and the Gutsch Brewery was on its way to joining them. It was at this time that my family took the helm of the brewery. Soon after, they changed the name to the Kingsbury Breweries, expanded coast-to-coast, and turned the brewery into what we remember it as today.

I grew up hearing stories from my father, who, as a child with his father, would go around the various Kingsbury Breweries, see the brewers hard at work, and watch the customers enjoy a beer in the Ratskellar. This is where my interest was first piqued by the great world of beer. Many years later, thanks to a brilliant gift on my wife’s part, I started making my own beer. From that point forward there was no turning back. The hobby turned into a passion, which turned into an obsession, which turned into quitting my day job and opening a brewery.

This is my Really Cool Waterslide - my choice to take a dream and make it my reality. Thank you to all those who have helped me get here.

- Grant Pauly, 3 Sheeps Brewing
name: 3 Sheeps Brewing Co

description: three sons
name: 3 Sons Brewing Co.

description:
3 Stars Brewing is a DC based production brewery founded by Mike McGarvey and Dave Coleman to provide the community with great, fresh, local craftbeer. 

We are looking forward to opening our doors in 2011. In doing so, we will proudly brew beers that push the limits of conventional brewing while still providing our customers with great, fresh, local craft beers...contact us at info@3starsbrewing.com
name: 3 Stars Brewing Company

description: 300 Suns Brewing was really just an idea brought up years ago, that kept surfacing every time a brewery was toured, a GABF was attended, a new craft beer was tasted, a bottle of homebrew was shared on the back deck in the cool summer evening air. It was just a dream and one day (gulp), we worked up the nerve to make it a reality. We wanted to put our time and our work into something that brought joy to others the way those moments brought joy to us. And we wanted to give our community very meaningful ways that they could become part of the shaping of our brewery.
name: 300 Suns Brewing

description: A specialty brewery in San Diego, California. Dedicated to bringing new and exciting craft beer and constantly updating its selection.
name: 32 North Brewing Co.

description: Our vision was born out of enjoyment for the binding elements of life. The spirit of community sharing; Drink, food, conversation, space, and ideas. We carry a strong appreciation for the boundless limits created by hard work. We’re influenced by the natural elements of our surroundings, fueled by creative thinking, and driven to make the highest quality product.
name: 33 Acres Brewing Company

description:
The 350 Brewing Company has spawned from the ashes of our failed Collegiate careers at Northern Illinois University. Let me explain. 350 Augusta Ave. was our address in Dekalb, IL. At the time, your founders Todd and Erik spent more time on projects like way below average punk rock bands in the attic, and a Hardcore Wrestling Federation called WCVF (this took place in our kitchen), instead of focusing on classes like Humanities 227 in DuSable Hall. I mean, have you ever choke slammed one of your best friends into an oven pre-heated to "550 degrees"? Well i have, and that was just a random Wednesday night. This raw energy (stupidity) and creativity is what eventually drew us to the Craft Beer scene. That’s what craft beer is…a creative and fresh twist on a beverage that has been mass produced and shoved down our throats for much too long (carefully stepping down from soapbox). Why not name our Brewery after the point in our life when we were most creative? Well…..we did. It was during these times we were also introduced to good, quality beer.

Once NIU had enough of our shenanigans, Erik went on to continue his education while I submerged myself into the cesspool known as corporate America. I feel dirty just talking about it. Over the last decade, my soul has been slowly rotting and exiting my body so there was a need for this creative juice to be squeezed once again. Since wrestling and punk rock was now out of the question, brewing beer quickly became that much needed release from the Groundhog Day that had become the norm for us. Erik like most homebrewers started out brewing with extract several years ago and quickly rose to the challenge of all-grain batches. Erik, the 350 Head brewer, has been very successful when entering brewing competitions walking away with multiple awards for his Porter and Patersbier. Myself on the other hand have had a love for flavorful craft beer for many moons, and once I learned of Erik’s brewing expertise years ago, I too became emerged in this brewing lifestyle. It was a match made in heaven. Erik brewed awesome beer, and I was awesome at drinking and sharing that beer!!! 

From that point on things just sort of clicked and for the last 2 years Erik and I have been researching and concocting this master plan of opening a brewery. The time has come. We want all of you to enjoy this journey with us. Tinley Park has always been our #1 choice for the 350 Brewing Company. Downtown Tinley Park embodies the spirit of 350. With great electricity in the downtown area, coupled with an amazing artistic feel, will definitely pair well with our vision of always making sure a visit to our brewery is an interesting experience. We feel Tinley Park is ready for a neighborhood brewery. It really was an easy decision based on Tinley Park’s sense of community and passion for supporting local products.

We are looking forward to joining the family of incredible Illinois Brewers. We should all thank our lucky stars that we live in a state with such high quality Breweries.
name: 350 Brewing Company

description:
We started out years ago brewing in our garage. Friends and family would always come by to hang out, drink our beer, socialize and watch whatever game was on. Soon our garage was filled with so many people we decided to find a bigger one and open it up to everyone! We took a chance and opened a nano-brewery and tasting room. Now we can offer our beer to current and future friends in our community! Visit our website for our beer menu, more info and updates. www.38statebrew.com

We're located in Littleton, Colorado. So whether you're a local or just passing through, please stop by, take a load off and sample some of our tasty brews. Trust us... you will not be disappointed! Cheers!!
name: 38 State Brewing Company

description: A small brewery and taproom in Worcester, Massachusetts.
name: 3Cross Brewing Company

description: Historians sometimes disagree as to the origin of the 3docs, but all agree on their mission to bring an impressive beer and spirits selection, while enjoying great live music, is a noble endeavor. Each member of the 3docs has been trained at birth to be an expert in the arts of liquid refreshment, brethren of the oldest and most prestigious society in the world — a society that is so secret, if it were revealed to you, the next thing you would hear would be a knock at the door, which would be followed by eternal enlightenment. But alas, I have said to much. To know the 3docs is to know their heart. Just as cavemen enjoyed fire, the 3docs hope that you will enjoy 3docs Brew House.
name: 3docs BrewHouse

description: 3rd Wave Brewing Co. is a dream between to friends who love the beach and love to brew beer. We hope you visit us often and enjoy Good Friends, Good Waves, Great Beer!
name: 3rd Wave Brewing Co.

description:
4 Brothers Custom Blended Craft Beer evolved from a combination of passion, innovation, experimentation, configuration and fermentation; followed by extensive libation and imbibition. Yep, brewing blended beer is damn hard work. Especially the tasting part. Cheers for Libations!

Until we 4 Brothers started the process of evolving our avocation into our vocation, there really hasn't been a true innovation in the beer industry in years. Maybe since the monks first put their quills to parchment and recorded their initial beer recipes.

IPAs, Porters, Pilsners, Lagers, Browns, Reds, Blondes. All magnificent purebreds. 4 Brothers is the World Class Custom Blended Craft Beer, combining the best qualities of each.

Our signature beer, Sibling Rivalry, combines the taste profiles of a darker beer, a lighter beer and a hoppier beer to produce an incredibly drinkable and delicious beer.

4 Brothers custom blended craft beers are perfect for enthusiasts, fun-lovers and those who don't take themselves too seriously. Yep; drinkability, flavor and authenticity. And we think that is something to shout about, despite the monk's vow of silence.
name: 4 Brothers Blended Beer

description: 4 Hands Brewing Company, located in the LaSalle Park neighborhood, will provide the craft beer enthusiast a handcrafted portfolio inspired by the American craft movement that pushes the limits of creativity. Our barrel -aging program will produce a truly unique line on beers. The use of wine and spirit barrels containing an array of fruit, herbs, and spices in conjunction with wild yeast strains will enhance the flavors to produce a one of a kind beer.
name: 4 Hands Brewing Company

description:
Rumour has it that you can’t keep an old monk down on the monastery once his yeast has gone viral.

Say what? Are you asking yourself, “What the hell are they talking about?”

processIt goes like this. British monks loved to put their bald heads together, eat gruel and make killer good beer. Let’s face it. This was the Middle Ages, the insulation in those drafty monasteries sucked, so beer making kept them busy, and after a few pints, who gave a damn about the cold.

But these dudes were on to something. Using only barley, wheat, hops and pure water and being tight-assed about things like purity (they were monks after-all), they developed a system for making beer that has stood the test of time. And you thought ancient purity laws has something to do with chastity.

That same British monk-inspired beer yeast begat yeast off-spring. It is from this very same yeast that we make our beers. How’s that for a DNA profile?

But we’ve taken things a step further. We use the Peter Austin Brick Kettle Brewing System. For you non-beer geeks Peter Austin was The Granddaddy High Brew Master of Microbrewing. This was the man who started it all.

The Peter Austin system is a direct-fired, brick clad, copper whirlpool and hop percolator, and you cannot buy it at Costco when you get a Vitamix. The Austin system is a rugged, reliable and easy to operate, clean and maintain.

There are more than 100 Peter Austin Brewing Systems installed worldwide, but Four Mile Brewery is the only brewery in Western North America using his system.

Although Peter Austin has left this mortal coil for a beer garden in the sky, his gifted protégé carries on his vision.

Alan Pugsley is our Brew Master at Four Mile. Pugsley is not just our brew master. He travels around waving his frothy magic wand amongst all his other projects around the world. What is distinctive to Alan’s process is his know-how when developing beer recipes. His recipes honour true British beer making while masterfully tweaking things to incorporate regional ingredients while developing taste profiles that appeal to local palates.

As Peter Austin taught Alan Pugsley, so too did Pugsley teach our own resident brewer, Doug White. White is part of the family clan at Four Mile. In 1985 he headed off on a beer quest walk-about.

He got as far as England, Ringwood Brewery and Alan Pugsley. He apprenticed with them, and then, upon his return, took further training the University of California, David Campus, in brewing sciences. For White, craft brewing is a hands-on art form, and the proof, dear drinker, can be worshipped from dainty sip to gusto guzzle.
name: 4 Mile Brewing Co.

description: The 4 Noses Brewery is a family owned and operated craft brewery and tasting room. 4 Noses has a passion for creatively brewing our unique interpretation of classic styles. Using ingredients from around the world, 4 Noses combines traditional styles with nontraditional flavor profiles to give the beers our own distinct personality.
name: 4 Noses Brewing Company

description:
4 Paws Brewing LLC is a microbrewery established in Chicago, IL. The brewery will be located in the Uptown/Edgewater neighborhood at a site to be determined. 4 Paws is hoping to be fully operational by 2013!

We believe in our company, what we stand for, and most of all the beers we serve. We would never make anything we wouldn't drink just to turn a profit and we would never say anything or do anything to compromise our core beliefs. We hope that our supporters and friends join us in believing in 4 Paws too!

So why 4 paws you might ask? The short answer is our little dog Sadie. Sadie is a rescue dog that we adopted over Memorial Day weekend of 2010. She's a big part of who we are and what we're all about. So that's how we got our name, but what are we all about?
name: 4 Paws Brewing

description:
“Handcrafted beer brewed naturally” means in a nutshell that when you drink our beer you are getting the best of natures goodness.

Drink beer, make it good beer, sip it slowly, so your tastebuds dance in your mouth.
name: 4 Pines Brewing Company

description: Coming January 2015
name: 4 Seasons Brewery

description: Forty Arpent is a Louisiana Brewery using traditonal brewing techniques, with local ingredients, to make new flavor profiles uniqe to the Gulf Coast. Our take on an Irish Red Ale (Creole Red Bean And Rice Ale) will truly make Monday's Special something to look forward to.
name: 40 Arpent Brewing Company

description: Currently in planning.  For info contact 40NorthBrewing@gmail.com
name: 40 North Brewing

description: 406 Brewing Company with brewer Matt Muth
name: 406 Brewing Company

description:
Certain locations around the world hold within them an unspoken power. They’re where wars were fought, fortunes lost – and found – and where legacies are made.

And, these places happen to be connected by a common thread. Unseen to the naked eye, yet felt in its magnetic persuasion. It is the 42nd Parallel. Crossing Russia, Italy, France, and Spain. And Great American cities like Boston, Detroit, and Buffalo. It’s the border of California and Oregon, New York and Pennsylvania, and, in many instances, countries including the United States and Canada.

And when it comes to beer, the 42nd parallel is unparalleled as well. Some of the world’s best hops grow along it, and in the late 1800’s and early 1900’s, it’s where New York State hops grew bountiful and full-bodied. This tradition – and the legacy of arguably the most important parallel on earth – have found a new home, and a new future, here: at 42 North.
name: 42 North Brewing Company

description: Owners David and Brenda Simmons had a plan to expand their winery business with a restaurant. Several of the wine customers are also beer drinkers. What better way to satisfy all customers than to offer fresh locally produced beer. Opening in Sept. of 2012, 450 North Brewing Company will open as a Brewpub with a full service restaurant.
name: 450 North Brewing Company

description: Welcome to Gresham's favorite locally-owned brew pub and restaurant! Come check out our state of the art facility in the heart of downtown Gresham on the corner of 4th and Roberts. Whether you come for our locally brewed beer, our family-friendly restaurant, our incredible sports bar, or our unparalleled meeting space perfect for private parties, rehearsal dinners, meetings and more, 4th Street Brewing is the perfect choice for any occasion.
name: 4th Street Brewing Co

description: Texas' first worker-owned cooperative brewery, opening soon. Come join us as we craft new faces for traditional styles and bring radical brewing to the forefront of the Texas craft beer scene. When all other beers fail to intrigue, try a 4th Tap.
name: 4th Tap Brewing Cooperative

description: Microbrewery with a cafe to feature our wide range of beer styles matched with local organic eats.
name: 4th Way Brewing Company

description: 5 Points Brewing Co. is located at the Historic Mission Brewery Plaza in San Diego. Built in 1913 as the Mission Brewing Company, the brewery operated until the eve of Prohibition in 1919. 5 Points Brewing Co. has restored the brewing tradition at this great location and is proud to serve fresh Ales and Lagers to thirsty craft beer enthusiasts. We keep 10 brewery fresh beers on tap at all times with seasonal and specialty beer available throughout the year. Our tasting area is located in the brewery so you can enjoy a real craft beer experience, right where it happens! Our team looks forward to sharing our brewery and beer with you, Cheers!
name: 5 Points Brewing Co

description: The first Latin microbrewery in the US, 5 Rabbit is all about making the best beer. At 5 Rabbit we celebrate the centuries-old myth behind Latin drinking culture with an innovative concept that revolves that uniquely Latin attitude towards life that has so captured the imagination of the world. It additionally sets out to become an integral part of the local Hispanic community and aid in its advancement. 5 Rabbit is locally brewed in Chicago, Illinois.
name: 5 Rabbit Cerveceria Inc

description: 5 Seasons Brewing is passionate about serving local produce, all-natural meats, and artisanal cheeses. We believe in conserving the spirit of the farm and supporting local farmers. We are also acknowledged as the center of Atlanta’s beer culture.
name: 5 Seasons Brewing Company

description: We are a small batch nano-brewery located "down around" San Antone. Our primary focus is limited releases each season brewed with the freshest local ingredients we can get our hands on.
name: 5 Stones Artisan Brewery

description:
Our entire purpose is to say "Thank you" to all of the active Troops and Veterans in our Country who have served so selflessly to protect and preserve our dear Nation and precious Freedom! Of course, our gratitude began close to our hearts with our own fathers, grand-fathers and uncles, and quickly spread to friends, neighbors, and colleagues.

We searched for a way to carry out our goal, we decided to find an avenue that would facilitate wide-spread reception and the ability to give back repeatedly. What better way than a great tasting lager? As predicted, the reception to our mission has, indeed, been overwhelmingly positive and dynamic. As we share our idea, everyone invariably expresses their gratitude for the fact that we are providing a manner in which they can give back on an individual and personal level. Surprisingly, Troops and Veterans have said "Thank you" back to us!
name: 50 Back Brewing Co

description: 508 Restaurant and Brewery, Bar and Mediterranean American Rustic Cuisine SOHO, NY
name: 508 Gastrobrewery

description: Attention Beer Lovers, what you've been hearing is true! Lake Orion is about to have its very own microbrewery – 51 North Brewing Company. We will be located at 51 North Broadway, hence the name. Mary and Don Gindhart lead a small group of beer-loving, business-minded individuals that share one purpose – to create a microbrewery like no other. We will have an amazing lineup of hand-crafted beers, wines and meads, all made in-house. Along with this diverse group of drink selections, we will offer unique food pairings to complement these libations and provide high-quality entertainment and service. All these ingredients add up to a destination perfect for individuals, couples, families and friends.
name: 51 North Brewing Company

description: Exceptional Folks Drink Exceptional Beer
name: 515 Brewing Company

description: We make unique beers the traditional way. Beer is our passion. We use only the highest quality ingredients and make small batches to ensure that we supply our community with the purest, freshest, highest quality beer possible. Fresh beer always tastes the best! Small scale, local distribution is our way of ensuring our product is in its prime when it gets to your glass. We have a number of staple beers plus we will be providing a rotating line of seasonal and specialty brews. As we say.....Great Beer, Born Here.
name: 51st Ward Beer Company

description: With our team, a small group of business and friend collaborators, we intend to use the production of craft beer, through community involvement, to expose our strengths, talents and develop ourselves. We desire to enjoy life fully, with a passion for local craft beer, the NE Minneapolis community, personal growth with our friends/family and to God’s mission through honest relationships and accountability.
name: 56 Brewing

description: 57 Brew Pub & Bistro is located in Greenville Michigan. We are excited to bring this new establishment to our community. We feature our own locally brewed beers on site, and our Bistro features a full menu of American Cuisine from appetizers, soups & salads, Burgers, Sandwiches, Entrees & Desserts. We opened in late October 2012! Stop in and see us soon
name: 57 Brew Pub & Bistro

description: Opened in June of 2003 in historic Downtown Sedalia, Missouri. The 5th Street Brewpub is a restaurant with a full bar featuring our own handcrafted beers. Our brewing system came on-line in February 2005. We have pale and red ales, a great dark porter, and are currently producing other seasonal beers. We are also proud to serve the major brands brews as well as specialty brews from other handcrafting breweries.
name: 5th Street Brewpub

description: 603 Brewery was founded in 2012 by long time college friends.  As home brewers, who met while studying engineering, they set out to design high quality, hand crafted beers.  As demand for the beers increased, the vision to launch a microbrewery was developed.  With a focus on quality and versatility, our hand crafted beer is brewed using the finest ingredients in small batches.
name: 603 Brewery

description: In the heart of the Northeast Minneapolis Arts and Brewery District, 612Brew calls Central and Broadway home. 612Brew produces small-batch beers to satisfy both the weekend beer drinker and the craft beer drinker with a discerning palate. Enjoy the local brewing culture while sipping a pint in our taproom, then look upon our mirror-polished tanks or sit in the courtyard amphitheater and rain garden. Come on, Minnesota. I'm Thirsty Already.
name: 612Brew

description:
7 cent Brewery is owned and operated by three engineers who are beyond passionate about beer.   We are inspired by the craft brewers before us who have challenged the palates of beer drinkers, been brave enough to brew something unique and not follow the status quo of the beer world.
The core philosophy of the brewery is to make beer that excites us and to make beer that we love to drink.  In no way will we let supply, the market or budgeting compromise the quality of 7 cent beer.  If other people want to drink it, bathe in it, rub it on their hips and let it eat through to their liver, freeze it into ice blocks in winter and skate on it, then melt it in spring time and drink it, or whatever they decide to do with it, it’s all an added bonus for us.
name: 7 Cent Brewery

description: The 7 Devils Brewing Company is a small craft brewery on a mission to bring the inspiration of our coastal area to the tap. Walking through our doors should create the same restorative feelings of walking toward the shore. We wish to be a sustainable business that is socially, ethically and environmentally responsible and provides a place where passionate people converge to create a positive environment and inspired products. Our goal is to enhance the community in which we live and succeed financially so that we can provide family wage jobs for creative people in a progressive workplace. With core values of efficiency, ingenuity, pride in craftsmanship, environmental and social responsibility and superior customer service, the 7 Devils Brewing Company is crafting the change we wish to see in the world.
name: 7 Devils Brewing Co

description: We are a small craft brewery combining a fundamental passion for great beer with decades of experience from the industry. Our Brewmaster is Norway's grand old man of brewing – and several times Norwegian homebrewing champion – Gahr Smith-Gahrsen. Our goal is to produce classic, yet innovative beer that will put Bergen on the international beer map.
name: 7 Fjell Bryggeri

description:
Brewpub in Eagle Ranch
We carry wine, spirits, guest beer, and of course our own.
Beer styles range from easy drinking summer pils, to outrageous hop bombs. There's a style for everyone here.
name: 7 Hermits Brewing Company

description:
Formed in 2008 by Travis Guterson and Mike Runion, 7 Seas Brewing is an innovative craft brewery, making audacious, yet technically well-executed beers; utilizing cans rather than bottles; and championing environmental stewardship.

Having survived a fire at our original location which delayed our opening by six months, we now occupy a 3,000 square foot brewing facility superbly located in Gig Harbor, Washington.

At 7 Seas Brewing we strive to brew, innovate and perfect the Ultimate Proper Pint, one that will invoke an emotional, contemplative response from the drinker. It should cause them to smile, knowing that in our homogenized, cookie cutter world of consumerism, there are still people crafting something of integrity and authenticity.
name: 7 Seas Brewing Co

description:
75th Street Brewery is Kansas City’s first and best brewpub that opened its doors in 1993.  Located in the historic Waldo district, the Brewery is home to live, local music (including Kansas City’s own Brew Jam every Sunday, and live Bluegrass music every Wednesday).

The Brewery boasts award-winning hand-crafted beers (fresh growlers to go every day) and a made-from-scratch menu. 75th Street Brewery has received local, regional, and national awards and accolades, including the 1999 Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup for the Red-Eye Rye Beer.

75th Street Brewery features beers brewed from the great traditions of England, Germany, Ireland, and Czechoslovakia. We also offer special seasonal styles with influences from around the globe. Each of our beers is produced from the finest barley and hops in the world and includes only four basic ingredients: Barley, Hops, Yeast, and Water. No additives or preservatives are used. Because our beers are handcrafted in small batches and kept cold, no preservatives or pasteurization are required. You are guaranteed a fresh and natural pint of beer every time. Cheers!
name: 75th Street Brewery

description: A Community Supported Brewery (CSB) in Dover, NH. Specializing in high quality, hand crafted American and English style Ales.  Enjoy a paring of our great beers with our amazing locally sourced progressive American pub fair!
name: 7th Settlement Brewery

description: Belgian-style beer, IPAs, second use spirit barrel aged beer, oak aged sour beer.
name: 7venth Sun Brewing

description: Tiny brewery on same site as the unique 8-sailed Heckington windmill. Beer brewed from barley grown in nearby fields, malted then ground in the on-site windmill.
name: 8 Sail Brewery

description:
A microbrewing company based in Marlborough, New Zealand.

To produce mindblowing beers that will wow craftbeer lovers, excite fellow beer geeks and educate the mis-guided who still believe that
name: 8 Wired Brewing Company

description: Come get your beer geek on at 8-Bit Brewery. Hand-crafted beer with a nostalgic 8-bit theme.
name: 8-bit Brewery

description: German & American fare served in a casual atmosphere with a large selection of craft beers on tap.
name: 8th Street Ale Haus

description:
A crafty brewery in HouTex. Our proximity to Minute Maid Park, Toyota Center & Dynamo Stadium, makes 8W the craft beer for the home team. 

We are dedicated to brewing fresh, tasty artisanal ales.
name: 8th Wonder Brewing Company

description: Hoboken Born, Jersey Brewed
name: 902 Brewing Company

description:
903 Brewers was founded on a simple idea; make great beer for a great community. With that idea in mind Jeremy and Natalie Roberts began building the foundation for 903 Brewers back in 2011.
 
Jeremy Roberts is not only the founder but also the head brewer. He spent years perfecting his recipes and letting the community decide what beers they wanted from their local brewery. He fearlessly concocted hundreds of different beers to see what new flavors he might come up with. Not all were a hit, but that is how you find a gem. Do you have an idea for a beer you’d like to try? Let him know, he just might try it out.
 
903 Brewers officially opened its doors in June of 2013 and introduced to the world The Chosen One Coconut Ale and Roo’s Red Ale. Since that time they have released many new and exciting beers. Starting fall of 2014 you will be able to find their beers in 22oz bombers.
name: 903 Brewers

description:
961 Beer began during the dark days of the July 2006 siege on Lebanon. Tired with the lack of quality beer in Lebanon, Mazen Hajjar and his friends started to brew beer in his very own kitchen. The first batches were brewed in 20 liter kettles. Granted that war and blockades are not the ideal conditions to start a company, alongside everyone telling them they were mad to even consider it, they went ahead with it anyway. They decided that brewing a good beer for a great country was what they wanted to do the most.

When 961 Beer officially began brewing they were one of the smallest breweries in the world, and the only microbrewery in the Middle East (and still are). Although 961 Beer now brews nearly 2 million liters per year, they still insist upon making beer using the very same principles: traditional techniques, quality ingredients and love.
name: 961 BEER

description:
Located in the Îles de la Madeleine , L'Etang-du-Nord in a former fish processing plant, the microbrewery A l'abri de la Tempête (Shelter From The Storm) enjoys a prime location on the seafront, with breathtaking views to the west. Before you go to relax on the beach or after a busy day of sand and salt water, take a refreshing break in our tasting room.

A l'abri de la Tempête promotes the use of local raw materials in the design of their beers. That began with the transformation of barley malt, it continues its momentum with the harvest of flowers, seaweed and fresh herbs. The use of local resources is a guarantee of authenticity and freshness that contributes to the design of unique beers and sleek.
name: A l'abri de la Tempête

description:
À la Fût microbrewery is located in the heart of the small town of Saint-Tite, in the beautiful region of Mauricie. Whether you're a connoisseur or, conversely, whether you want to introduce you to the pleasures of craft beer, enjoy our delicious beer.

Our Brewpub, which can accommodate more than 60 guests, is distinguished by its relaxed atmosphere and picturesque views. Built in 1865, the place has a rich history which is one of the oldest buildings in the municipality. Moreover, it served as a general store in the time of the Daughters of Caleb. We find today all the architectural style of the time.
name: À la Fût
A Taste of Long Island Craft Brewery

description: Handcrafted and brewed to excellence, A1A Ale Works goes to great lengths to serve each guest the freshest beer possible. This commitment to serving nothing but the finest and freshest beer has led to numerous awards.
name: A1A Ale Works

description:
When Helmut Schwichtenberg, a descendant of the Degraa Family, secured the trademark rights for DEGRAA in 2007, he laid the cornerstone for a new era. One year later, he commissioned an extensive market research study that showed what a beer from Aachen should taste like.

His father, Karl-Heinz Schwichtenberg, was the last DEGRAA master and manager of the DEGRAA restaurant near the town theater for over 20 years. His grandmother, Käthe Schwichtenberg, ran the DEGRAA am Hansemann – better known as the “Os Oche” – for over 25 years. His great grandmother, Katharina Vonderbank, née Degraa, was the head of Josef Degraa Erben KG until her death; Josef Degraa Erben KG had been founded by her father, Josef Degraa, in 1888.

Ever since that time, the DEGRAA brand has been well known, even beyond Germany’s borders.
name: Aachener Brauhaus Degraa

description:
Aarhus Brewery makes special beer for enjoyment! That is to say that art is not so advanced as to result in afskræmmende and can only be drunk by connoisseurs. Anyone who wants to try something new, you will find joy in Aarhus Brewery products.

Aarhus Brewery makes special beer with between 5 and 9% alcohol, bottled in large 60 cl bottles. There will be a beer which will be suitable as an aperitif beer, which beer will be suitable for fish and meat dishes light, and there will be dark, heavy and bulky beers, which are suitable for meats and cheeses.

It builds both fixed beers and varying seasonal beers. Read more in products.

The brewery is purely a production brewery that produces beer and brave this in bottles and kegs. There is not affiliated catering to the brewery. On the other hand we do tours for small groups of between 15 and 75 people.
name: Aarhus Bryghus

description: Aass Brewery was established in 1834 and is the oldest brewery in Norway today. It is located in the city of Drammen, approximately 25 miles south of our capital, Oslo. You will spot it at the banks of the Drammen River at the very same place as it has been since 1834. The annual production of beer is aprox. 10 mill liter (85 000 barrels), and together with the production of 18 mill liters of soft drinks and mineralwater it gives employment to approximately 150 people.  You may wonder how we got our name ? It was a young fellow with the name Poul Lauritz Aass that bought the brewery in 1860. Since then it has been in the same family, and is today run by the 4th generation of Aass. (By the way - A real Norwegian viking would pronounce it Ouse)  The brewery is proud of its history. To us the quality of what we produce has always been and always will be the main issue. In 1516, Duke Wilhelm of Bavaria established a law admitting only malted barley, hops yeast, and water as ingredients in the production of beer. The law is known as the purity law and Aass Brewery is still loyal to Duke Wilhelm of Bavaria. In Norway the brewery is known for outstanding quality and large number of different beer types.
name: Aass Brewery

description: Overlooking beautiful Keuka Lake, we brew many different Belgian and Farmstyle craft beers for the Penn Yan and surrounding Finger Lakes areas.
name: Abandon Brewing

description: Beer Maredsous is a beer Belgian of high fermentation brewed by Moortgat. Curiously, this beer has never been produced at the site of the abbey Benedictine of Maredsous. to Denéein Namur province. However, we can enjoy the on-site in earthen mugs. Since 1963, the abbey has entrusted the production and marketing at the brewery Duvel Moortgat located Puurs (province ofAntwerp), (which also gives us the Duvel) under the control of the monks. The beer is filtered before bottling, giving it very clear.
name: Abbaye de Maredsous

description:
Founded in 1997, Abbey Ales is the first and only brewery in the historic City of Bath for over forty years, and is the initiative of experienced brewery sales and marketing manager Alan Morgan.

Bellringer is the only cask beer continuously produced at the Abbey Brewery, a golden 4.2% abv best bitter.

Successfully launched at the Bath CAMRA beer festival in October 1997 Bellringer is now the top selling cask bitter in the World Heritage City of Bath and is as popular with the many visitors to the Georgian City as it is with Bathonians.
name: Abbey Ales Brewery

description: Miami Beach's world famous Abbey Brewing Company is home to award winning, hand crafted beers, friendly service, and a down to Earth atmosphere. One of the oldest bars in Miami, it has the old world charm of a traditional European pub
name: Abbey Brewing Co

description:
Abbey Brewing Company, located in Abiquiu, New Mexico, is the producer of Monks' Ales starting with Monks' Ale released in 2005.

The brewery is located on the grounds of the Benedictine Monastery of Christ in the Desert.  The monks do not allow visits to the brewery.
name: Abbey Brewing Company, LLC

description: The Valley Inn & Abbey Wright Brewing Co. have a superb selection of our own hand-crafted beers. We also have 22 beers on tap, and a huge selection of bottled beer from around the world.
name: Abbey Wright Brewing Company

description:
We are proud to be a successful small business in and from Sheffield.

We were lucky enough to get in on the ground floor of the revival of craft beer, and canny enough to grow continually throughout our existence.

We have established Moonshine as a very popular local beer and all of our regular and special beers have a following somewhere - sometimes in the most unusual places!

We have one pub of our own, The Rising Sun in Nether Green, Sheffield where you can always try one (or more!) of at least six of our beers that are always on show alongside up to seven beers from other small breweries. Nearly all of these are sourced by swapping with like-minded brewers, proving that we like to share our love for all things beer related.
name: Abbeydale Brewery

description: Aberdeen Brewing Company
name: Aberdeen Brewing

description: Abide Brewing Company is proud to be the first brewery in Newnan, Georgia.  Local residents Matthew Kapusta, Evan Scanlan, and Philip Leonard developed their craft while home brewing.  Together in 2013 they decided to follow their dreams to start a local nano-brewery that focused primarily on quality, flavor, and the unique techniques of brewing.  After learning about the project, Yokogawa Corporation of America added their support by manufacturing and installing a Brewery Automation and Control System.  In early 2015 the first beers were released into the local market.  Abide’s desire is that their community would “accept without objection” Local Craft Ales.  Cheers!
name: Abide Brewing Co.

description: Abigaile is an effort by Hermosa Beach local Jed Sanford to bring a distinctive take on the American brasserie experience to Hermosa Beach; all in a communal setting that celebrates the location’s rich history as a gathering place for locals from all walks of life.
name: Abigaile Brewery

description: Inspired by the hop heritage of nearby Wye and with a particular interest in the flavours of the hop varieties that have been developed at Wye in the past, Abigale Brewing Company craft their ales in the heart of Kent using the finest quality ingredients.
name: Abigale Brewing Co

description:
Founded in 1986, the Abita Brewing Company is nestled in the piney woods 30 miles north of New Orleans.

In its first year, the brewery produced 1,500 barrels of beer. We had no idea what we started. Customers loved our beer! By 1994, we outgrew the original site (now our 100-seat brew pub) and moved up the road to a larger facility to keep up with demand.


We brew over 160,000 barrels of beer and 10,000 barrels of root beer in our state-of-the-art brewing facility. Our lagers and ales are brewed in small batches, hand-crafted by a team of dedicated workers with only the highest ideals of quality. This pride, along with our brewing process, is what creates our great brews.

We are privately owned and operated by local shareholders, many who have been with us since day one.

Abita uses only the finest ingredients – British and North American malted barley, German and American yeast strains, Pacific Northwest hops and the pure artesian water of Abita Springs.

In Abita Springs, we are blessed with the purest of water. Drawn from our deep wells, our pristine water is not altered in any way.

Abita Beer has no preservatives, additives or stabilizers and is cold filtered. The result is beer that is the finest and freshest tasting as proven by our loyal customers and great chefs of the south who use Abita Beer in their recipes.
name: Abita Brewing Company

description: The Able Ebenezer Brewing Company opened it's doors in the summer of 2014, when former US Army Officers and aspiring entrepreneurs set out to pursue their ambitions. Motivated by their combined abilities, inspired by local New Hampshire revolutionary history, and driven by their love of beer, the Able Ebenezer Brewing Company was formed.
name: Able Ebenezer Brewing Co.

description: The brewery was founded in 1856 by Lieutenant Per W Luthander. The brewery was purchased in 1898 by brewer Axel Herman Johansson and it is still owned by the family. Despite, or perhaps because of, that we are the country's oldest family brewery, we have always focused on development. Our large production investments have resulted in one of Europe's most modern breweries, with the high and consistent quality is guaranteed by our own water source since 1856.
name: Åbro Bryggeri

description:
As the world grows in its understanding of what beer can and should be, no longer imprisoned by the tasteless, unfilling beers of the recent past, it craves beer made with sincere passion and an unwavering boldness of flavor. And to provide that beer is our mission.

Focusing on Old World styles and New World hops, we are creating a fusion of flavors and aromas to titillate the palate and arouse the olfactory. British, Belgian, and German styles will dominate our taps, while sours will be fermenting and aging from early on.

Absolution Brewing Company is a labor of love for three friends that have a passion for delicious craft beer. Nigel is an English gent that found his way to the West Coast more than two decades ago. Steve is a local boy, born and raised in the South Bay Los Angeles area with deep ties throughout the community. Wes is from the swamps of Louisiana and discovered Southern California via the Navy. Individually, we are but mere beer drinkers in love with the craft. Together, we are a team dedicated to fulfilling our dreams to bring the best beers to the world that others may feel the passion on their palates.
name: Absolution Brewing Company

description: The AC Golden Brewing Company is a subsidiary of MillerCoors, a joint venture between SABMiller and Molson Coors Brewing Company. Its purpose is to serve as a specialty brewing arm of MillerCoors, in the words of president Glenn Knippenberg, "Our mission for AC Golden is to be a brand incubator for what is now MillerCoors". The AC Golden Brewery operates in the former pilot brewery of the Coors Brewery. It debuted its first beer, Herman Joseph's Private Reserve, in 2008. The company began brewing its seasonal beer, a Vienna Style lager called Winterfest, in 2009. In April 2010, AC Golden introduced Colorado Native Amber Lager in Colorado, an amber lager made with 100% Colorado ingredients. In 2014 the brewery introduced Colorado Native India Pale Lager. In 2015 Colorado Native Golden Lager was introduced, along with Colorado Native Double IPL, Colorado Native Saison, Colorado Native Olathe Lager, Colorado Native Oktoberfest and Colorado Native Winterfest.
name: AC Golden Brewing Company

description: Nestled in the fertile Carson valley, Acadian Farms is a small family farm and nano-brewery. We believe the old adage, "You are what you eat", so we organically raise our vegetables and animals. We use certified organic barley & malt in our beers and we bake our artisan breads with all natural and/or organic flours from Bob's Red Mill.  Our farmstead cheeses are made with raw milk from grass-fed goats at a local dairy. We invite you out to the farm for a pint and views of the beautiful Columbia River Gorge!
name: Acadian Farms

description: Achel brewery or Brouwerij der Sint-Benedictusabdij de Achelse Kluis is a Belgian Trappist brewery, and the smallest of the seven currently approved Trappist breweries. It is located in the Abbey of Saint Benedict in the Belgian municipality of Achel. It brews five trappist beers
name: Achel Brewery

description:
Established in May 2003 by former chef Dave Hughes and his wife Judi, Acorn Brewery is located to the east of the Pennines in the village of Wombwell, Barnsley.

Having worked for Barnsley Brewery as Head Brewer for two years, Dave decided to go it alone, purchased a ten barrel brewplant from the Forester & Firkin brewpub in Stafford and moved it to premises in Wombwell.

 Following a lot of hard work by Dave and his assistant brewer Steve Bunting, and despite some initial set backs, the brewplant was commissioned and production of Acorn Brewery Barnsley Bitter began on 4th July 2003, using the same yeast strain as the original Barnsley Brewery, founded in the 1850's. Since then, sales have grown steadily and the range of beers has increased.

Acorn Brewery has developed a popular Yorkshire brand and is currently supplying over 300 free trade outlets and 3 national wholesalers.  

There are currently three award-winning beers permanently available, as well as regular seasonal brews.
name: Acorn Brewery of Barnsley

description:
Acoustic Ales Brewing Experiment is located in the historic Mission Brewery Plaza along the I-5, just north of downtown San Diego and just a hop away from the San Diego airport.

The original brewery housed in this building was shut down during Prohibition. The Old Brewery has now been expertly reconditioned and is up and running with a 
15-barrel brewing capacity, not to mention producing some exceptional beers.
name: Acoustic Ales Brewing Experiment

description: BzZz Loves You
name: Acoustic Draft Mead

description:
In 2011 a plan was hatched. Two flatmates Hayden and Fraser decided that they would start their own brewery. A month, and many beers later Ad Lib was born. The first beer UCom was made at the Twisted Hop, but due to the February earthquake this beer was never released.

The quake only reinforced Ad Libs' belief, that they should continue, and a new premise and new inspiration was found. The good blokes at Wigram brewery gave them a hand and the magic that is Ad Lib Brewing finally reached you!
name: Ad Lib Brewing Company

description:
Based in Shepton Mallet in the heart of Somerset, our cider mill has been pressing cider of exceptional quality for over one hundred years.

Addlestones was first produced by our team of master cider makers in 1986, and is so popular amongst our loyal consumers; it is now the UK’s leading specialist draught cider.
name: Addlestones

description:
Adelbert’s Brewery is committed to brewing Belgian-style, bottle-conditioned ales for people to seek, savor, and share with others.  We believe quality beers require quality ingredients and a painstaking attention to detail throughout the brewing process.  

Adelbert’s uses Bohemian old-world floor malted barley, low alpha Noble Czech hops, and fresh yeast propagated at the brewery. In our seven vessel brewhouse, we use a time consuming, multi-temperature decoction mash technique which extracts a more complex flavor from our grains.

We produce a gambit of hand-crafted Belgian style ales right here in Austin, Texas. With our vast array of beer styles, you're sure to find a brew that suits you.
 
Our Belgian-Style Ales include:
Naked Nun Wit
Black Rhino Black Ale
Scratchin' Hippo Biere de Garde
Philosophizer Saison
Dancin' Monks Dubbel Ale
Tripel B Tripel Ale
The Traveler Belgian IPA
Flyin' Monks Quadrupel Ale
 
Also, look for our Barrel-Aged "Vintage Series" where we age one of our eight ales in oak barrels for an extended period of time.

Although our selection of beer is great to enjoy by itself; each of them also pair perfectly with just about any food. From spicy Thai food to a backyard barbecue with ribs and brisket, to a formal dinner with steak or seafood and a dark chocolate dessert; our artisanal Belgian-style ales go with pretty much everything. Please share pictures and recipes that you've either used our beer to cook with or have enjoyed right alongside them!
name: Adelbert's Brewery

description: All of our craft-brewed beers are made on the premises using only the finest malt, hops, yeast and water. We currently produce these beers on a 15-barrel Bohemian copper brewhouse. Our fermantation capacity is 60 barrels (1,860 gallons), with an even larger serving capacity in our cold cellars. We invite you to taste hand-crafted beer at its finest. Look for Adirondack Pub & Brewery's hand-crafted beers at great establishments throughout New York State.
name: Adirondack Pub & Brewery

description:
The Adkin Brewery was originally founded as a hobby in early 2000.  It is a true example of a small cottage brewery, and is run by the sole proprietor, Mr Shaun Cunningham, from the garage attached to his house on a housing estate in Wantage, Oxfordshire.  All of Shaun's beers are produced using only natural ingredients, most of which are supplied by Best Mates Brewery, Ardington and Ken Thomas of Arkwright's Homebrew in Highworth, near Swindon, Wiltshire www.arkwrightshomebrew.com.

At the moment, Shaun still has a full-time job.  Despite the restrictions placed upon Shaun in terms of both time and space, you can see from the photographs just how much can be achieved in a small, basic garage.  As for the quality of the products, well, that speaks for itself!
name: Adkin Brewery
Adler-Brauerei Max Haag Nachf Wolfgang Haag

description: Brewery with restaurant and beverage market. A special feature on offer is oat beer, which is brewed seasonally.
name: Adlerbrauerei Brehm

description: Admiral Sasquatch is a proto-brewery at the moment. We're doing test batches and figuring out how best to get our fine, quality brews to the thirsty of Chicagoland.Keep your eyes peeled for us! The Admiral loves beer, and he loves you! Drink up!
name: Admiral Sasquatch

description: Adnams is one of England's oldest and most respected breweries, but despite its rich heritage and enduring fame, Adnams is not a company willing to rest on its laurels. Its continued commitment to quality and innovative packaging designs has made it Britain's fastest growing brewery over the last two years. To top it off, Adnams' head brewer was recently chosen as Britain's Brewer of the Year by a panel of his peers. The aggressive team at Adnams is raring to go and keen to make a mark in the U.S.
name: Adnams Brewery

description:
Adroit Theory Brewing Company is the newest nano-brewery in Loudoun County Virginia. We make esoteric beers with an emphasis on barrel aging.
CONSUME LIFE / DRINK ART
name: Adroit Theory Brewing Company

description:
We started officially brewing in January 2012, though we brewed for ourselves long before that. With so much great feedback we concluded it would be a crime not to share our passion for beer with everyone. We've been heavily influenced by so many beers particularly by breweries from the 1800's that have now long-since closed their doors. Heritage is important to us and all our beers are made with a definitive nod to the brewers and breweries of former times. If we can develop great beer and give people a history lesson at the same time we would be two very happy brewers!

We regularly produce a range of four core beers (North, South, West and East) and North Pole is brewed for the festive season. We also brew a new limited edition beer each month, produced in small batches and aimed the drinker wanting something just a little bit different. You can find reviews of our core range here, and the first of our limited edition beers here.

So, join us on our Adventure! Be it bottle or cask...
name: Adventure Brewery

description: Adventure Brewing Company makes great craft beer in the Stafford and Fredericksburg, Virginia area.
name: Adventure Brewing Company

description: Aeronaut is a craft brewery and foods hub under one roof. Here, our inspired team of brewers and scientists collaborate with New England farmers and food makers to drive the invention of craft beers and spur a renaissance of local victuals and industrial revitalization.
name: Aeronaut Brewing Company

description: AF Brew is a travelling brewery with no address. Our beers are craft beers, and we're always trying to be one step ahead of the local trends. We are beer-geeks ourselves, and we love good beers. We want all of you to become a part of this story.
name: AF Brew

description:
After 27 years of steady brewing, we thought it would be fun to share the results of the brewing experience with others.  We are a small brewery, and are truly “hands on” every step of the brewing process.  Our goal is to produce the best, most flavorful, most memorable local beers possible.  We think we’ve met that goal, & hope you’ll agree.

At Aftershock, we believe there are two different approaches to brewing.  The most common approach used by the major breweries is a ‘scientific one’.  All stages of the brewing process are closely monitored to ensure a consistent, if tasteless product.  Computers and other high tech equipment are more in control than the brewer himself.  With this approach you get ‘scientific’ beer.  The other approach is a more artistic one, while still respecting basic laws of science, and the need for spotless cleanliness.  That’s the approach we plan to always take at Aftershock.  At the risk of losing an undetectable amount of consistency, the result is beer with much more character, subtle nuances, and awesome flavor.  Don’t take our word for it; check us out.
name: Aftershock Brewing Company

description:
Louisville's only brewer-owned brewery is, like most worthwhile undertakings, the product of dissatisfaction with the status quo. The Louisville area has had a number of quality brewpubs for some time now, but still there was simply not enough beer! Against the Grain is an effort to help solve this problem. We maintain a diverse array of beers covering all of the major categories of beer flavor while generating an endless stream of innovative new brews. In short, everything is "specialty" Boredom will be extremely difficult.

Our food is designed with same philosophy as our brewing. Fresh and interesting smokehouse fare with a gastropub flare lets us bring you the very best flavors to stand alone and to compliment our beers. Regular menu changes allow us to take full advantage of the best seasonal ingredients, our chef's whim, and optimal pairing with our dynamic beer list.

Throw your preconceived notions right the hell out the window. We aren't just another brewpub. We are Against the Grain!
name: Against The Grain Brewery

description: Agassiz Brewing Company
name: Agassiz Brewing Company

description:
AGNER & WOLF Brewery Corp. was incorporated in 2012 with only effort of two enthusiastic people, Erwin and Nataly Agner , and whose dream of childhood, to have their own brewery, has come true.

Living in the USA but having German roots, we had not another way  but to brew German beer according to the traditions and the law of purity of 1516,  which would be classical in its base and stylish per se.

Our lineup represents four types of beer: Hefeweizen (Wheat beer), Altbier (Ale), Marzen (Red Lager) and Schwarzbier (Dark Lager).

Our strategy is in the brewing of beer of high quality, which we could drink by ourselves with a great pleasure and would be proud to offer others.

Our goal is to diversify the US beer market bringing in it the European style.

We want the American consumers to have an opportunity to taste other types of beers, which are different from those, to which they are accustomed to, and be a part of the great European beer family as well.

Our company is young but perspective, and though we are just in the start of the long way to the pinnacle of success, we are sure that in the time soon our beer can get its admirers.
name: Agner & Wolf Brewery Corp.

description:
Agrarian Ales strives to provide the Southern Willamette Valley with beer brewed from the finest ingredients possible. We use exclusively the hops consciously grown on our own farm, as well as any other farm bounty we can put into our mash tun, brew kettle, or fermenter! Our ultimate goal is to grow every ingredient that goes into our beer.

We are on 25 acres North of Eugene near the beautiful Willamette River. We make beer that reflects our connection to the Earth.
name: Agrarian Ales

description:
Ahnapee Brewing first opened its doors in 1868 in the city of Ahnapee, now named Algoma, as a premier producer of Wisconsin craft beers. Bohemian immigrants brought skilled craftsmen to erect Kewaunee County’s first sizable building.

Beers were produced under the supervision of the head brewmaster, Henry Schmiling, the great- great-great-great uncle of the current owners. The Civil War veteran sold barrels of Wisconsin craft beers by horse and sleigh, rail, and the schooner, “Whisky Pete.” Schmiling’s Ahnapee Lager was known far and wide for its Wisconsin-made quality. Hops blight put the original brewery out of business in 1886.

A new chapter in the brewery’s history began in the summer of 2013. Fueled by the dreams of our General Manager and Head Brewer, Nick Calaway, we picked up where Henry left off. This time Wisconsin craft beers are produced in small batches and feature full-flavored beer, some with aging potential, served in the Tap Room two doors down from von Stiehl winery at 105 Navarino Street.
name: Ahnapee Brewery

description:
Founded in 2008, Airdale Brewing is a craft beer company located in San Diego, California. Founded by a former Naval Aviator and a veteran southern California craft brewer, Airdale strives to create well-balanced, unique, flavorful beers that embody their mantra of, "Work Hard | Play Hard"

Airdale Brewing Co. is working to bring its line of premium craft beers to every market available. We intent to do this by producing quality beers that stand on their own as true examples of artisan american ales.
name: Airdale Brewing Company

description:
Friendly service and tasty beer make us a favorite of locals as well as beer enthusiasts from all over. 

Special and seasonal beers make a frequent appearance. Our tap room has bar seating as well as small tables. On sunny days, garden seating is available.

Airways opened on March 4, 2010. Founder and brewer Alex Dittmar has had a lifelong passion for 60′s era jetliners. Airways is a combination of his love for airplanes, good beer, and a connection with people from all over the world.
name: Airways Brewing Company

description:
Akasha Brewing Company was founded by Dave Padden and Wesley White in early 2015.

Known for his attention to detail, consistency and innovation, our head brewer, Dave has forged a reputation for brewing award-winning, hop-centric ales. And whilst Wes has been a fan of Dave's beer for years, he brings bag loads of enthusiasm and management experience to the table. The third member of the team, Ben Galanos, has worked in various sales and hospitality roles for nearly 20 years and is an unapologetic craft beer fan.  

Needless to say, the Akasha team is made up of like-minded, passionate beer enthusiasts. Our culture is pretty simple: brew the beer that we love to drink and, most importantly, have some fun while we’re doing it. Basically, for all of us here at Akasha, beer is our way of life.

The word 'Akasha' refers to the 'fifth' element. The 'unknown factor' that combines the four elements of Earth, Water, Fire, and Air. And we bring this concept to the craft of brewing beer. Whilst most beer is made from the four basic ingredients of malt, hops, water, and yeast, it is this 'fifth' element, the Akasha, that instils the spirit, the soul and the magic, to create a beer that is truly special. Something that we can be proud of.
name: Akasha Brewing Company

description: Aksarben Brewing Company
name: Aksarben Brewing Company

description: Alameda Brewhouse is a brewpub in the heart of the Beaumont Village in Northeast Portland. We have been in business for nine years, offering hand crafted ales and freshly prepared food. All of our beers are produced on location in our 5.5 BBL brewhouse under the watch of headbrewer Carston Haney. He produces a wide variety of beers, from the light, refreshing Siskiyou Golden Ale to the deep, impenetrable Black Bear Double Stout, which won the Gold Medal at the 2003 GABF and the Silver Medal in 2006 and 2008 in the foreign-style stout category. In addition, there is always at least one seasonal beer on tap to fit the mood of the season and one selection served on nitrogen.
name: Alameda Brewing Company

description:
Alamo Beer Company is the brainchild of Eugene Simor of San Antonio, Texas. Handcrafted just a day’s ride from the Alamo. So the next time you’re in town, remember to raise some ale.

We deliver pure & honest Texas beer. A smooth and refreshing golden ale brewed with a fiercely independent spirit.
name: Alamo Beer Co

description:
Alaska has a rich history of brewing. From the explorers of the 1700s through the Gold Rush, many a thirsty Alaskan has been able to enjoy locally made beers.

In 1986, 28-year-olds Marcy and Geoff Larson reignited that tradition when they opened the Alaskan Brewing Company, the 67th brewery in the country and the first brewery in Juneau since Prohibition. Alaskan beers reflect many of the same characteristics of beers that were brewed here during the gold rush era. From the historically based Alaskan Amber recipe to alder-smoked malts and Sitka spruce tips, Alaskan beers reflect Juneau's local brewing history and innovation.

Marcy and Geoff were drawn to the beauty and adventure of Alaska, but finding a livelihood that would allow them to stay was a challenge. "Why not start a brewery?" a friend suggested. Other than the extreme financial and logistical challenges of brewing beer in the Last Frontier, they couldn't think of why not.

Maybe the idea wasn't so far-fetched. After all, Geoff was a chemical engineer and a homebrewer and was married to Marcy, an adventure-seeking accountant and aspiring bush pilot. Together they brought a unique skill set to the task of opening a brewery in Alaska.

While researching brewing in Alaska, Marcy unearthed shipping records from Douglas City Brewing Co. (1899-1907) that listed ingredients for its popular beers and a newspaper article that described the way it was brewed. Geoff homebrewed a batch of the Gold Rush-era brew and they could see what made it so popular. That beer is now known as Alaskan Amber.

In December 1986, Alaskan Brewing Co. officially began operations when Geoff, Marcy and 10 volunteers spent 12 hours hand packaging the first 253 cases of Alaskan Amber for distribution in Juneau, Alaska. From that very humble beginning, Alaskan Brewing Co. has grown to become the most award-winning craft brewery in the history of the Great American Beer Festival and expanded distribution to 14 states.
name: Alaskan Brewing Co.

description:
The first batch of beer was made in the Lindberg household in 1981 and 
involved both Brian and Barbara. Brian made the beer and Barbara tolerated it. 
The first two batches weren't anything to brag about. 

Several years went by without trying another batch until the craft beer industry 
started taking hold in America.
