We started with five gallon batches, then went to fifteen gallon batches, doing 
one to two batches a day. We also started thinking about finding a building
that we could take this hobby to and get the equipment we had accumulated 
out of the garage. 

In 2012, we moved to Skean's Block, on the north side of the historic Albia 
square, which was built in 1889 by Elmer Skean and first served as a grocery 
store on one side and a boot store on the other. The whole building was 
remodeled in 1996, as part of the Bates Foundation.

We feel like this is more Albia's business than our own. We are watching 
over the building and enjoying our hobby of making hand-crafted beers. 

We want you to feel at home when you arrive and like you are stepping back in 
time. Ask us about the photos of Albia on the walls, as well as our ancestors.
name: Albia Brewing Co

description:
San Francisco's exciting sights and extraordinary cuisine have been captured for your enjoyment at Alcatraz Brewing Company!

Take a virtual vacation to San Francisco every time you visit one of our locations across the U.S. See scale replicas of the Golden Gate Bridge and a Chinese pagoda while sampling foods from famous Bay Area neighborhoods. Enjoy award-winning, hand crafted beers and cask ales. And be sure to leave room for our signature "The Rock" dessert.
name: Alcatraz Brewing Co

description: Founded in 1865 in Riga, Aldaris employs more than 400 workers, and is the biggest brewery in Latvia. It brews a range of beers, mostly pale lagers. The most popular brands include Luksus, Zelta, Gaišais (Light beer), Pilzenes (Pilsner) and Porteris.
name: Aldaris Brewery

description: We want to take the fear out of craft beer. Well crafted beer thats easy to drink. Craft beer for All!
name: Aldus Brewing Co.

description:
At ALE ASYLUM, we brew beers in the tradition of our friend Crusty Oldbrewer who sent us on this path: brew honest, brew like you mean it. Thus, our beer is brewed and bottled with our own hands on Madison’s East Side. In fact, ALE ASYLUM operates the only bottling facility in Madison.

ALE ASYLUM is unfiltered and all natural. We use no additives, preservatives, fruit, horse hooves, fish guts, or extracts. Our ingredient list: water, malt, hops, and yeast. This is what we mean when we say our beer is FERMENTED IN SANITY. You know who makes it, you know what it’s made with. You know after having one you’ll want another.

We brew traditional, bold beers for those who demand quality and consistency. To those people we say: raise a pint, because you believe how we believe.
name: Ale Asylum

description: Located in San Jose California, we founded our brewery the principle of creating high quality, low volume, hand crafted beers. Ale House Brewing will take beers back to what they are meant to be - full bodied and flavorful. All of our beers are aged on oak to enhance the flavor profile and extract some of the natural sugars found in the wood. We invite you to experience our beers!
name: Ale House Brewing Company

description: The idea for Ale Industries started on the front porch of the Old River house, on Hammer Island, CA. Steve and Morgan brewed together almost every weekend, through scorching summers, wind and rain, and one time even through a flood! During the week they both worked at the local craft brewery, and learned how to turn their dream into an actual production brewery. Morgan sold the river house, and Steve sold everything he owned, then the two started down the path to Ale Industries.
name: Ale Industries

description: Ale Syndicate Brewers is one of Chicago's newest breweries. Located in the Logan Square community, Ale Syndicate is dedicated to making craft beer worthy of Chicagoans. Ale Syndicate's founders, brothers Samuel Evans and Jesse Edwin Evans, aim to produce their unique take on traditional styles of beer, such as IPA, porter and session ale. Learn more at alesyndicate.com
name: Ale Syndicate

description:
Fritz3Flavors, rather than a - Beer can be more than required by the Reinheitsgebot and enjoyment is not linked to Community, insurance or even special offers. For a long time the beverage beer in German lands was drunk critical, but now it's time for more flavor and more conscious enjoyment. The not-not so new impetus to the beery diversity finally reached now the curious German beer drinkers. In fact Craft Beer was born in the early 1980s in the United States and is nothing more than a return to flavor beer diversity and creative crafts.

This is exactly what Fritz Wülfing: New to create copy instead of familiar things. How many brewers of craft beer scene he brews with passion many different and especially innovative beers. There are not only IPAs and Stoutvariationen, but also completely new creations such as Goshen and other beers with historical background. All in one: different and delicious!
name: Ale-Mania

description: Coming to Chicago in 2013
name: Aleman Brewpub

description: Forged in 1995, AleSmith is an artisan microbrewery that specializes in handcrafted ales in a variety of styles. Deeply rooted in the amateur and craft brewing communities, AleSmith ales have continued to garner national and international awards and acclaim, as well as a loyal and rabid following among beer enthusiasts.
name: AleSmith Brewing Company

description: AleWerks Brewing Company is located in the heart of the early colonies in Williamsburg, Virginia. Established in 2006 we have rolled out a broad range of beer offerings and quickly established a reputation for fine beer. We operate a direct fired brick-clad Peter Austin brew house and ferment all our beers in state-of-the-art conical fermentors.
name: Alewerks Brewing Company

description: Enjoy a uniquely brilliant atmosphere in the heart of downtown Findlay at Alexandria's. Alexandria's is a wealth of micro-brewed beers, a great entertainment schedule and a palette pleasing menu is all pulled together by the culinary genius of world renowned Chef Michael Bulkowski. Welcome to Alexandria's. Dine and Delight.
name: Alexandria's Brewery

description: Ali'i Brewing Company
name: Ali'i Brewing Company

description: Alibi Ale Works a craft brewery located in Incline Village, NV on the North Shore of Lake Tahoe. We are producing a wide range of beers with pure Lake Tahoe water, and our goal is to keep your taste buds intrigued with diverse and interesting flavors.
name: Alibi Ale Works

description:
Brewery was founded in 1864 and is the oldest operating brewery in Belarus.

Today "Olivaria" produces 16 varieties of beer under the brands "Alivaria" and "Brewery". The portfolio of brands includes drink female " Eve ", owned by Carlsberg Group .
name: Alivarya

description:
All Saints Brewing Company is a new craft brewery in Greensburg, PA. Our mission is to build a brand focused on selling locally manufactured craft beer, for beer people, by beer people. Consistently good tasting craft beer, brewed locally and with Western Pennsylvania pride and passion.

Our brew house is a 7 bbl system which was originally installed at the Red Star Brewery in Greensburg, PA. The system was expanded when brought to All Saints Brewing Company. This expansion allows us additional capacity in addition to providing the opportunity to brew a number of diverse craft brews along with seasonal specialties and Jeff’s world famous barley wines.
name: All Saints Brewing Company

description: Allagash Brewing Company was founded by Rob Tod in 1995 as a one man operation dedicated to hand crafting the best Belgian inspired beers in the world. The first beer brewed was Allagash White, a spiced wheat beer and now our company flagship available in 17 states. We love beer, we love working with each other, we continually push the limits of beer and ourselves, and we grow as a profitable and sustainable company (and as individuals), without compromising our values or purpose. This passion has helped us push Allagash to the forefront of the growing Belgian beer category. We’ve won countless awards for our beer (11 medals including 4 gold since 2002 at The Great American Beer Festival & 10 medals including gold & silver in 2012 since 1998 at the bi-annual World Beer Cup), and received acclaim in the press (Gourmet, Bon Appetit, Men’s Journal, GQ, The Wall Street Journal and Saveur). But perhaps best of all, everyone in the Allagash family loves working here.
name: Allagash Brewing Company

description:
Alley Kat Brewing Company is a craft brewery that's mission is to produce oustandingly flavourful, fresh tasting beer of exceptional quality.

Longest running microbrewery in Edmonton and the fourth oldest brewery in Alberta.
name: Alley Kat Brewing Company

description: The Allgäuer Brauhaus AG is a traditional, today Radeberger group owned specialty brewery from the Allgäu region with headquarters in Kempten. The company brews a wide range of specialty beers.
name: Allgäuer Brauhaus AG Kempten

description:
The Alligator brewery is a one-bbl in-house brewpub. We usually have at least ten or more rotating beers on draft at any given time.
Our focus is on the integration of new styles and old-world brewing methods, with a mindset somewhere in between mild reverence and gleeful irreverence.

Alligator is, for now, a very small operation, but we’re working hard to keep things interesting.
name: Alligator Brewing

description:
Welcome to our little microbrewery in the heart of downtown Lexington. People often ask us why a global company that’s in the business of science also owns a brewery. Well, to make a long story short, my forefathers in Ireland had their hand in the brewing business and crafting beer casks when barrels were made out of wood.

Today, my own family is in the business of making yeast that happens to also go into the making of beer. So, it was a natural for us to revive the brewery that has been in Lexington since 1794. Welcome and enjoy.
name: Alltech Lexington Brewing and Distilling Company

description: Alma Brewing Co features artisan craft beers and wines paired with a simple fresh food menu.
name: Alma Brewing Company

description: Our artisanal ales are brewed in collaboration with select Northern California sustainable farms. Each limited release is a unique beer to be enjoyed with friends and savored around the seasonal table.
name: Almanac Beer Co

description:
This Original Hard-Cider has been made on our family-owned farm in Flushing, Michigan for well over a hundred years. It was first pressed back in the 1850's. Not much as changed in the process since then. We use the same apples from the same orchards as my great-great grandfather did before the time of the Civil War. We are proud of that. It gives us a sense of history.

The cider has played an important role in the ongoing history of our farm. The sale of cider actually saved our farm during the Great Depression. And, during the Prohibition people came from far and wide for our "Special Farm Cider."
name: Almar Orchards

description:
Aloha Beer Company embodies the classic Hawaii lifestyle. With the generous spirit of Aloha as a namesake, this is a premium beer that combines the smooth balance of ohana with the refreshing, hang-loose attitude of a Sunday barbecue. Every bottle of "Hawaii's Beer" is a heartfelt "wish you were here" message from the Islands of Aloha.

We can't create a Hawaiian sunrise, but we can brew the next best thing.
name: Aloha Beer Company

description: It is Alosta Brewing Co.’s mission to produce quality, craft ales and lagers, while incorporating the rich history of the San Gabriel Valley and outlying communities, into our products.
name: Alosta Brewing Co.

description:
Aggressive Ales. 
Alpha Brewing Company is a St. Louis Microbrewery.
name: Alpha Brewing Co

description: Established in 2012 and proud to be one of the few New York City breweries. NYC has had a rich brewing history that reaches back over 100 years. This has given ACBC a strong foundation on which to build and offers a challenge we enthusiastically embrace everyday. We started as two roommates in the Alphabet City neighborhood of the East Village of NYC brewing beer in our kitchen and are excited to be on the verge of opening a brew pub there in the near future. We love beer and love sharing our beers with friends and that's what our style of brewing is all about. It's about camaraderie and the group experience. We provide brews for the table that everyone can gather around; brews perfect for the meal you're about to have or the story about to be shared - brews for celebrations and brews for collaboration - we brew for you.
name: Alphabet City Brewing Company

description:
Alpine Beer Company opened its doors in the fall of 2002. Years before, an interest in craft brewing developed into an actual goal for the future. There were years of home brew competitions, brew science classes, and extended beer runs thinly disguised as vacations. 
The brewery went through an expansion starting in late 2008 and became operational in mid 2009. Four double sized fermentors were installed in an old garage behind the current brewery. A cold box was erected adjacent to the garage and a bottling machine with a nice labeler are housed there too. There is a small barrel shed on the shady, north side of the garage.
name: Alpine Beer Company

description: Alpine Dog is a term coined for Coloradans. While we do love our dogs, this term goes deeper than that. It is a reflection of the people. In Colorado we love the mountains. It's where we go to play; it's where we go to exercise, relax, make friends and have fun getting away. Whether its crushing single track on a mountain bike, tearing up the slopes on skis or a snowboardi, hiking one of CO's 54 1...See More
name: Alpine Dog Brewing Company

description:
The company was founded in 1877 by Johann Gottfried Glauner by the lion was still brewing firmierende company bought as, and thus reactivated the former monastery brewery. 1880 was the company over to Carl Albert Glauner. 1906 was renamed to Alpirsbacher Klosterbräu. The company was and is consistently in the family Glauner. The Executive Board comprises the Managing Director and Carl Markus Schlör Glauner and three new officers.

The Alpirsbacher Klosterbräu Glauner GmbH & Co.KG produces and sells beer. In addition, the company acquires and manages investments in industrial and commercial enterprises. The company, with special Alpirsbacher quality leader in Baden-Wuerttemberg export beer market. It employs 80 staff and has annual turnover of 20 million € (2007). Seat and the only production site is Alpirsbach.

A special feature of the brewery is a special pipeline , which spatially separate the brewery bottling combines.
name: Alpirsbacher Klosterbräu

description: Livermore is no longer only wine country! Altamont Beer Works is Livermore's future local brewery; owned and operated by Stephen Sartori and Greg Robles. Keep posted for updates and opening projections. Cheers!
name: Altamont Beer Works

description:
Brewer Gordon Kear, former brewer for Flagstaff Brewing Company for the past six years, and business partner Ben Wiggins wanted to bring more coolness to West Asheville. Their way of doing it, build a brewing company and bar with all the best Asheville has to offer. Known locally as “the bar”, the Altamont boasts a wide open floor plan with regulation ping-pong, a foosball table and single disc-golf basket. The place hosts a variety of musicians and dj’s weekly plus open mic-night every tuesday. While the brewing facility is still a work-in-progress, the Altamont has some of the finest locals on tap.

We're here make great beer people enjoy and provide a great place for drinking it! The Altamont is not your average bar. Kayaks are stored behind the bar, cyclists can ride right in, and dogs lounge around, asking for pretzel handouts.
name: Altamont Brewing Company

description: With the start of the brewery in November 2009, Wittenberge began brewing it's own beer after nearly 20 years. Three beers are produced here and served on tap: a mildly bitter beer, a full-bodied and a special dark beer with a higher Spezialmalzgehalt and stronger hop aroma. All three beers have an original gravity of approximately 12% to 14% and an alcohol content of about 5%. Our brewery consists of a two-vessel brewhouse, which can be seen in the tap room.
name: Alte Ölmühle

description:
Our brewery, which is nestled inside of our dining room walls, is primarily an ale producing brewery. Ninety five percent of all the beer we brew at Altitude is ale, including our award winning 7200’ Stout and Rosebud Strong Ale.

Our beer is brewed using single step and multi-step infusion mashing, which is patterned off the British brewing tradition.  All of our beer is made from four basic ingredients: malt, hops, yeast and water. Our recipes use American malts, hops from Europe and America, and yeast cultured from the traditional yeast stocks found throughout the world. We do not filter our beer.

We brew over 20 styles of beer throughout the year. We offer eight beers on tap year round and we pour up to three specialty beers at any given time.

We invite you to try Altitude’s microbrews and we hope you’ll like them as much as we do!
name: Altitude Chophouse & Brewery

description: Our 10 barrel brewpub specializes in West Coast-style, hop-forward ales & lagers, Belgian inspired ales, and a variety of experimental styles. On the hoppy side, we particularly like showcasing the intensely tropical, citrusy, and earthy-green aromas and flavors of newer varieties from the Pacific Northwest and the Southern Hemisphere. We also like experimenting with Belgian yeast – the floral, fruity bouquet and soft, peppery spice created during fermentation make Belgian ales truly unique, and are often the best styles to pair with food. AND they make excellent barrel-aging candidates, some of which can be seen on display in the brewpub.
name: Alvarado Street Brewery & Grill

description:
Our small microbrewery is located in a picturesque industrial neighbourhood near the Danish capital, Copenhagen, and the airport in the city of Taarnby. There is absolute no doubt that we run the safest brewing enterprise in the country as our premises used to be an air-raid shelter. Our premises have also been used for storing bibles, hence reigns an atmosphere of divine tranquillity only otherwise found in Belgian monasteries. Well...
 
Founders of the brewery are the two friends and dedicated home brewers Mr. Morten Valentin Lundsbak and Mr. Jacob Storm, who since the opening of the brewery have achieved diplomas of their skills as they have become Diploma Brewers at the Scandinavian School of Brewing.
 
It is our ambition to cater to all beer lovers - every time, which is why we only use pure ingredients during the brewing process. We make no shortcuts by using artificial additives to speed or help the processes. Furthermore, we have deliberately chosen neither to pasteurize nor filter our beer as we would like to preserve the best possible flavours and aromas.
 
We allow the beer to mature completely in the bottle before releasing it to the market. This process implies that a natural sediment may remain in the bottle. This sediment can easily be consumed, but if an aesthetic beer experience is desired, pour the beer gently into the glass without the sediment. And preferably use a high pour to get the full and frothy head as well as to release all the pleasant aromas from this well-brewed beer from Amager Bryghus.
name: Amager Bryghus

description:
Amalgamated is a craft brewery and micro distillery in St. Louis, MO. 

We offer a great selection of craft beer from our own brewasters, as well as from other distinctive craft brewers across country, in our three restaurants/brewpubs. We also distill handcrafted spirits, including 85 Lashes rum, which can be found in restaurants and liquor stores with good taste across the St. Louis metro area.
name: Amalgamated Brewing Company

description:
Ambacht Brewing makes Belgian-inspired ales using local organic ingredients. Our base malt is Great Western Malting's Organic 2-row and our hops come from the Willamette Valley. We bottle condition all our ales with northwestern honey (usually blackberry!).
Ambacht is the Flemish word for hand-crafted and our 5-barrel brewhouse is definitely hands-0n. Stop by for a visit!
name: Ambacht Brewing

description: Ambev, formally Companhia de Bebidas das Américas (official English translation: "Americas' Beverage Company", hence the name "Ambev", formerly styled as "AmBev") is a Brazilian brewing company. It is the biggest brewery in Latin America and the fifth in the world. It was created on July 1, 1999, with the merger of two breweries, Brahma and Antarctica.
name: AmBev

description:
It has been said that America’s Brewing Company is the epitome to the American Brewing Tradition; not just creating quality, handcrafted, small-batch brews but creating beers that have won three consecutive Gold Medals at the World Beer Cup Competitions.

In the 20th century (1996) the Roundhouse started bottling the Payton Pilsner, Honey Wheat and Rootbeer.  Now in the 21st century (2009), the beer selection has increased enormously!  Because you asked for it, now the Roundhouse also bottles: Payton Pilsner Light and Aurora Amber Ale.  This diverse selection of beer is now available not only in six-packs, but in four-packs as well.  Now you can enjoy...
name: America's Brewing Company

description:
The beer is from the heart of the state, Detroit. In the oldest neighborhood in the city limits. After all, what a better place to fill bottles than a place called Corktown? At Brew Detroit on Abbott Street, a dedicated group of Detroiters brew for its neighbors and brew to bring manufacturing back to The Motor City.

Although Brew Detroit crafts carefully with these suds, don't call Badass a craft beer. Because it most definitely isn't a snifter pour. There's no flowery finish. It mocks oaky undertones. Instead Badass, is well, badass. It's approachable. It's priced right. It introduces itself as a light beer and follows it up with a full punch. This is the beer perfect for backyard barbecues, cases on the pontoon or a keg on the porch. Let's put it this way: this beer was brought up to go down easy.
name: American Badass Beer Company

description: American Brewing Company has been providing high quality, full flavored craft beers for the past two years. Our master brewer is Skip Madsen, an award winning, esteemed craftsman with deep roots in the history of micro brewing in the Pacific Northwest.
name: American Brewing Company

description:
American Dream Brewing is a craft brewery coming to Simi Valley soon, offering quality, handcrafted, fresh, brewed beers for both wholesale and retail distribution.  We will have an on-premise tasting room to experience the full flavor taste of our craft brewed beers. We create both traditional beer styles as well as new styles with unique twists.  

American Dream Brewing Company understands the passion that surrounds beer.  We pour that passion into every drop of our beer.  It’s that love to enjoy the best tasting beer that we use the highest quality ingredients.  

We look forward to inviting you to enjoy the American Dream by drinking our beers and celebrating life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness!
name: American Dream Brewing
American Honor Ale House and Brewery

description: Our classical revolutionary heroes including Henry, Franklin, Jefferson, and Washington set forth a paradigm to enable American prosperity and the creation of the greatest civilization in history. At American Honor Beer Company, our brews serve as a rallying point for those who cherish and commemorate America’s founding principles. General Liberty raises a toast to each and every American who honors the individual's natural rights to life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness.
name: American Honor Beer Company

description: American River Brewing was formerly known as Brewers of Auburn and was sold to Hoppy Brewing before the Oatmeal Stout was brewed.
name: American River Brewing

description:
NESTLED near the American River in Rancho Cordova, CA and located in a revitalized warehouse along Trade Center Drive is American River Brewing Company.

The dream-come-true of founder/brewer David Mathis and Head Brewer Andy Armstrong, American River Brewing Company encompasses the life-long passions of beer and the art/science of brewing.

Plans for the brewery began in 2010. After more than 15 years in the commercial brewing industry, we embarked on locating a useable location to house a production level brewery that would include a tasting room and space to grow. After an exhaustive search a home was found and construction began in the summer of 2011.

The original scope called for a modest 7 bbl brew house with tanks enough to manage 2000 bbl of production per year. After much re-thinking and soul-searching the brewery was increased in size to 15 bbl and room to grow to 10,000 bbls production per year. By October 2011, we started to formulate the first recipes.
name: American River Brewing Company

description:
Hudson, Wisconsin Brewery, inspired by the spirit of American heroism and individuality represented by US aviators of World War II, American Sky aspires to be a great American brand known for inclusive, timeless beers that appeal to not only microbrew fanatics, but also that common thread inherent in all beer- drinking Americans.

Stop in our taproom, The Hangar, to have a pint, fill a growler, take a tour or shop our merchandise room. Hours of operation are listed above.
name: American Sky Brewing Co.

description: At American Vintage Beverage Co., brewing great tasting teas is an art and a passion. We start with a blend of American and imported teas, and slow steep them to release and blend the flavors right in the kettle.
name: American Vintage Beverage Inc

description: Amherst Brewing Company is a full-service brewpub located in downtown Amherst, Massachusetts. Our 10-Barrel brewery is visible from the bar and produces some of the finest ales and lagers for serving in our 150-seat restaurant and 100-seat lounge and game room. Brewery tours can be made by appointment. Our giant, brass-top bar seats over 30 people and is fully stocked, including Single Malt Scotches and Small Batch Bourbons. An additional 40 seats are available on our seasonal patio; the best place in town to relax and enjoy an ABC draft or specialty brew while watching passersby. --From Amherst Website
name: Amherst Brewing Company

description: Amicas’ award winning brewery produces a wide spectrum of ales and lagers to accompany your meal. We’ve got delicious beer selections on tap, as well as our foamy house made root beer (made with honey and real vanilla).
name: Amicas Pizza, Microbrews and More

description:
Brewing handcrafted beers in Portugal since 2014. Small batch production / High levels of quality.

Based in Oeiras - Lisbon - Portugal

The "Amnesia Brewery®" was born in the summer of 2014, influenced by the American Craft Beer Movement, and the "explosion" of beer festivals and Micro / Nano Breweries in Portugal, willing to break with the lack of beer culture in the country.

Our beers are not filtered or pasteurized, has no artificial colors or preservatives, and the gas is naturally produced in the bottle.

The primary objective is to offer fully handmade high quality products, using 100% natural ingredients.
name: Amnésia Brewery

description:
Alex Pierson and JC Hill got their noses in the restaurant business in 2009, opening the first California Kebab at San Diego State University. After a few years, it was clear they needed to spread the kebab love elsewhere, and decided on a run down old resturant site with an ocean view..

Craft beer has been a part of the concept since day 1, and JC's severe homebrewing addiction ignited the need for their own brewing system at the new establishment - Amplified Ale Works was born. Why Amplified you ask? Two parts – one, our obsession with live music (a band was formed between CK staff in 2009, playing in JC’s garage ever since), and two, our take on the meaning of Amplified- to us, it means intensifying the craft beer experience by staying true to our homebrewing roots. We hope to see you soon at CK Brewpub enjoying a fresh ale on our biergarten patio at the beach. Prost!
name: Amplified Ale Works

description: The brewery was founded on June 11, 1870 in Amsterdam and named after the Amstel River, the waters of which also served for refrigeration. By 1872, Amstel was annually producing 10,000 hectoliters. For the purpose of storing the beer, winter ice from canals was kept in special double-walled cellars. Originally, the beer was mostly drank in Amsterdam. From 1883, it was also exported to Great Britain and Indonesia.
name: Amstel Brewery

description: Makers of Toronto's finest craft lagers and ales.
name: Amsterdam Brewing Company

description:
The Anacapa Brewing Company is Ventura?s only restaurant and brewery, or “Brewpub.”

We serve fresh, hand-crafted ales and lagers produced in our 12-tank stainless steel brewery by our Head Brewer Jason Coudray.
name: Anacapa Brewing Co

description: Our brewers focus on high quality ingredients, a carefully controlled process and delicate handling to provide one of the best beers you will find in the industry. We operate a seven barrel brewery designed and installed by Sound Brewing Systems of Seattle with vessels fabricated by Ripley Stainless in British Columbia. Our brewery features a cold room specially designed for lagering to provide our beers with a traditional character and complexity.
name: Anacortes Brewery

description: We’re a 140-year old company that just opened. That’s right! The first Anaheim Brewery opened in 1870, in downtown Anaheim. We took a 90 year break after National Prohibition closed the taps in 1920. Today, the home of the Anaheim Brewery is the Packard Building, a 1920s structure within the city’s Historic District. Located at 336 South Anaheim Boulevard, the Packard Building is one of the anchors for Anaheim’s Colony Marketplace. Stop by our Tasting Room and enjoy a glass of “Famous Anaheim Beer!” .
name: Anaheim Brewery

description:
Anchor Brewing Company’s roots date back to the California gold rush making it one of America’s oldest breweries. Its Anchor Steam® Beer is San Francisco’s original since 1896. 

In 1965, Fritz Maytag acquired and revived the struggling brewery at a time when mass production of beer dominated and seemed unstoppable. Maytag started a revolution in beer that originated today’s craft beer movement. 
An undisputed icon, Anchor is America’s first craft brewery where beers are handmade in our traditional copper brewhouse from an all-malt mash. At Anchor, we practice the time-honored art of classical brewing, employing state-of-the-art methods to ensure that our beers are always pure and fresh. We know of no brewery in the world that matches our efforts to combine traditional, natural brewing with such carefully applied, modern methods of sanitation, finishing, packaging and transporting.
name: Anchor Brewing Company

description:
Ancient Lakes Brewing Company where we are passionate about making beer and work hard to brew beers that look good, smell good and taste good! Ours is a very small manufacturing brewery located in Grant County, just north and west of Quincy, Washington. Founded in August, 2010 by three families from the Quincy area, the Ancient Lakes Brewing Company currently has one brewer.

Our 2/3 barrel brewhouse produces small batches of beer that take about three weeks from brew-day to packaging-day. We hand-fill our Cornelius and 1/6 bbl kegs and hand-bottle/hand-pack each case of 22 ounce bottles.
name: Ancient Lakes Brewing Company

description: Imagine a place where ancient knowledge meets modern concepts, where tradition meets the distinct, a place where two elements fuse as one, a place so exhilarating it escapes the imagination. This union is only possible because of the long-standing tradition of the Andean people committing themselves to the Pachamama - Mother Earth.
name: Andean Brewing Company, Inc.

description: We carefully craft our world-class ales using only the finest ingredients; premium malted and roasted grains, hops, yeast, and pristine Boonville water straight from our own unique aquifer, and we never heat pasteurize or sterile filter our beers. Our tradition of carefully crafting inspired, flavorful, ales of the highest caliber has earned numerous awards, a loyal following, and our two-time placement among the World Beer Championships® as well as a 2011 Gold Medal at the GABF® for our Brother David's Double.
name: Anderson Valley Brewing Company

description: Andy Hazen is a workhorse of a brewer. From start to finish, he is a one-man operation. The former cabinetmaker is also a self-reliant Mainer through and through. He was originally an all-grain homebrewer who decided to take it to the next level when his friends expressed interest in his beers. He designed the 12-barrel brewing system himself and enlisted a local welder to help put it together. Hazen notes that when you live in Maine, you have to find some service to provide to others in order to survive. For him, brewing is the service he provides to his local community. Located in the rolling hills of Lincolnville, Maine, Andrew's is housed in a renovated farmhouse next to Hazen's home. Finding the brewery is more than half the battle. Have no fear, however, as everyone knows about Andrew's. Also, be aware that due to some thieving souls, the brewery no longer has any signage to announce its existence to the visiting public. The only indication that a brewery exists in the farmhouse are the occasional keg deliveries in Hazen's front yard. And Hazen hasn't been quick to replace the sign either. While he welcomes visitors, you have to remember to clear a path for the busy brewer. Like many other unsung small brewers, running his 5OO-barrel per year brewery is a seven day a week operation for Hazen. Watching Hazen run the brewery is a little like watching Willy Wonka run the Chocolate Factory. When I visit him during a bottling day, Hazen runs between the bottling line and the packaging supplies in a hurried yet methodical manner. He stands up bottles on the line, starts the machine, slides his way across the brewhouse to the packaging materials, and hand assembles the six-packs that will hold the soon-to-be bottled beer. Andrew's beer is straightforward, unassuming and entirely enjoyable. His product line includes the St. Nick Porter, the Northern Brown Ale, the English Pale Ale, and the summer seasonal Ruby's Golden Ale. A celebration of the Amarillo hop, Hazen's English Pale Ale is a delightfully balanced product that neither over or underwhelms the palate.  from beerscribe.com
name: Andrew's Brewing Company

description: Located in the town's first jail at Calaboose Cellars.
name: Andrews Brewing Company

description:
Andwell Brewing Company is a true family business, run by Adam Komrower and his wife, Helen.  Andwell’s brewed its first beer in October 2008. Since then, Andwell’s has established a reputation for consistently producing beers of the highest quality

Andwell's run guided Brewery Tours where you can discover some of the secrets of brewing, touch and taste the floor-malted hand-raked barley, take in the sweet aroma of hops and sample some of Hampshire’s finest beers.
name: Andwells Brewery

description:
Angel City Brewery is excited to be part of the brewing renaissance of Downtown LA by bringing old-world, small-batch, craft brewing to the new world of the expanding Arts District. We are committed to the continued growth and revitalization of our neighborhood by being an interactive and supportive partner to the arts and business communities, as well as the burgeoning craft beer movement in Los Angeles.

Angel City Brewing was founded in 1997. Starting modestly, Angel City quickly became a leader in the LA craft beer scene. In 2004 Angel City bought an 8,000 barrel German-made brewery in Alpine Village near Los Angeles on EBay! and lovingly restored the facility. In late 2010, Angel City relocated the brewery to the historic John A. Roebling Building in LA’s Downtown Arts District. The vision was, and remains, to give this great city a great brewery.

On January 5, 2012, Angel City Brewery was acquired by Alchemy & Science, a craft beer collaboration led by Alan Newman and Stacey Steinmetz, formerly of Magic Hat Brewing Company.

Since January 2012, we’ve undergone massive renovations, including the addition of a new mustache bar. We began brewing in April of 2012, and started popping up in local LA bars and restaurants soon thereafter.

In February 2013, we opened the doors to the Brewery and Public House, but with limited hours as construction continued. We offer an ever-rotating selection of Angel City beer on tap, which includes a number of beers exclusively available at the Brewery. In addition to pints and flights, we offer brewery tours, events, and a great place to gather with friends. We have a small on-site retail store as well. Outside food is always welcome, and there are a number of great locations in our neighborhood that offer take out. In addition to the neighborhood cuisine, our parking lot has become a hot spot for food trucks, with one parked outside nearly every night we’re open. On May 5th, 2013 we had our grand opening with our first ever Heritage Festival. We’re now seven days a week for brewery tours and tastings, and we have full roster of weekly events.
name: Angel City Brewing

description:
The ultimate plan at Angry Chair Brewing is to brew beers that we like to drink. Right now we like to drink more sessionable styles: hoppy pale ales, Berliner weisses, low ABV saison, and other easy-drinkers. We plan to lean on these styles for our core beers. However, one thing we absolutely believe to be true is that the public will be choosing our “core” beers for us: if you like the beer, we will keep brewing it.
We’re going to have an extensive barrel-aged program as well, especially for sour beers.

We definitely hate being boring and doing boring stuff so you can look forward to experimentation and unique projects.
name: Angry Chair Brewing

description: A new craft microbrewery set to open in early 2014. "Passionate about beer, serious about our passion!"
name: Angry Erik Brewing

description:
Old time service station turned brewpub, Angry Hanks is in very close proximity to the other brewpubs in town, making it very easy for a pubcrawl. With garage doors that open onto their wood-fenced patio, Angry Hanks has a unique service station ambience. 

Head brewer, Mohr worked at Red Lodge Ales for five years before moving to Billings and opening his own brewery. Providing outstanding selection and quality with 8 ales on tap including Anger Management Belgian-style Wheat, Angry Hank's Blonde, Street Fight Imperial Red, Dog Slobber Brown and Head Trauma IPA as well as seasonal beers.
name: Angry Hank's Microbrewery

description: Welcome to Angry Inch Brewing. We are a soon to be micro-brewery located in the heart of Downtown Lakeville, MN. Construction is under way, permits filed and equipment ordered…now we wait…this is the boring part. But to keep us busy we are looking forward to being a presence at four exciting events before we even open our doors!
name: Angry Inch Brewing

description: Once upon a time cider was the drink of choice. We've been making ciders for decades... now we want to share them with you. Branch out and experience our Angry Orchard.
name: Angry Orchard

description: Anheuser-Busch operates 12 breweries in the United States, 14 in China and one in the United Kingdom. Anheuser-Busch's operations and resources are focused on adding to life's enjoyment not only through the responsible consumption of beer by adults, but through theme park entertainment and packaging.  In the United States, the company holds a 48.5 percent share of U.S. beer sales. Worldwide, Anheuser-Busch's beer sales volume was 128.4 million barrels in 2007.  The St. Louis-based company's subsidiaries include one of the largest U.S. manufacturers of aluminum beverage containers and one of the world's largest recyclers of aluminum beverage cans. Anheuser-Busch also has interests in malt production, rice milling, real estate development, turf farming, metalized and paper label printing, bottle production and transportation services.
name: Anheuser-Busch InBev

description: Anspach & Hobday has crafted a range of core beers. These are complimented by our Experimental Series of beer styles we’re working on and one off specials like our recent Oktoberfest beers.
name: Anspach & Hobday

description: Anthem Brewing Company strives to create World Class beers that blur the line between the Old World and the New. Our beers are our anthem to the world.
name: Anthem Brewing Company

description:
Our journey began with the opening of Benny's Pub 5 years ago. We have become known for our excellence in customer service and our strong passion for creating the best experiences and memories for our patrons. We are an American version of the throw-back 'Public Houses' that were the forefathers of today's 'Pubs'. We create delicious soups from scratch, unique sandwiches and dinner entrees using the best local ingredients.

Crafting delicious beer was the next natural step for Benny's Pub. Our loyal customers are passionate about the food and beer they drink- and we promise to deliver. Consumers want healthy, organic produce and food- and they want it to be local. Our menu highlights local meats, fresh cheeses and now hand-crafted beer brewed right in front of you.
name: Antietam Brewery

description:
Aphrodite’s Rock Brewing Company is a small craft brewery nestled amongst the beautiful hills of Paphos on the west coast of Cyprus.

Cyprus is a deeply historic island where modern travellers can retrace the footsteps of figures as diverse and interesting as Saint Paul, Alexander the Great and even Leonardo da Vinci.

Cyprus is a place of great historical importance in brewing.  Less than 10km from our brewery are the 3,500 year old bronze-age remains of an ancient traditional brewery which would have been tended by the wives of the Cypriot nomadic hunter-gatherers of the time.

We now continue that same noble tradition here in Cyprus and are committed to brewing our handcrafted beers in small personally-tended batches using mineral-rich spring water from our own well.  We deliver these to you fresh and in the peak of condition for an uncompromising taste experience.

We hope you enjoy drinking these beers as much as we enjoy brewing them for you…
name: Aphrodite's Rock Brewing Company

description: Apocalypse Ale Works is the first brewery in Forest, Virginia since Thomas Jefferson brewed in the 1800's at Poplar Forest. In addition to a brewery, we also have a tasting room, where the public can try our products. We are located in the old Forest Volunteer Fire Department, beside Pints O'Plenty. The brewery will sell kegs all over the state of Virginia, with an emphasis on supplying the local restaurants first. Eventually we will expand to bottling our beer. Our mission is to brew quality beer for all palates. The end of bad beer is here!
name: Apocalypse Ale Works

description: Brewery and Taproom in Louisville, KY brewing beer for the masses and for your survival. Drink beer til the end of the world!
name: Apocalypse Brew Works

description: Appalachian Brewing Company is located in a historic downtown building. We are proud to be the first brewery in the Pennsylvania State Capital since 1951. ABC serves fresh innovative cuisine to match our tremendous handcrafted ales and lagers!
name: Appalachian Brewing Company

description:
The Appalachian Mountain Brewery (AMB) is a craft brewery located in the heart of North Carolina’s High Country. Home of the Appalachian State Mountaineers, Boone has countless outdoor activities at your fingertips: rock climbing, hiking, biking, kayaking, skiing, snowboarding, and more! AMB supplies fresh, flavorful beer to the High Country, while maintaining a strong emphasis on both sustainable values and the local community.

Although our craft is beer, AMB is much more than a brewery. Our founding principles go well beyond the pint glass and focus on ideals that strive to empower individuals, support local enterprise, and give back to the greater Appalachian region.  This can best be summarized in our motto:  ”Act Local. Drink Local.”

We will set a new precedent within the brewing industry through an intimate knowledge of the science behind sustainability and a strong desire to improve the current status quo in the field.  We will utilize photovoltaic solar panels, native rain gardens and wetlands, rain water harvesting, and local farm collaboration. Through these efforts AMB will make the highest quality beer while maintaining the highest quality of respect for not only the local community but also the planet at large.

Act Local. Drink Local.
name: Appalachian Mountain Brewery

description:
Named after the Arkansas state flower, this 8,500 square foot, 250 seat brewpub is the largest in the state!

12 taps flow with craft beer all made on premises in our 10 barrel brewhouse. Styles vary from the classic, such as our flagship, Armstrong American Pale Ale, to current trends, such as our Mockingbird Black IPA, to the experimental, like our Sturdy Hippie IPA, fermented with a 14 year old sourdough strain belonging to our Executive Pastry Chef, Cody Johnson!
Speaking of Cody, he provides fresh baked bread in-house every day! From the sandwiches to the bread pudding and other amazing desserts, you can find his genius all over our menu and you can also find his bread for sale at Ozark Natural Foods for a taste of Apple Blossom at home! 
Our menu consists of affordable, amazing classics, such as the Cubano, Bahn Mi, or French Dip! We make all our soups, salad dressings, and all our prime rib is prepared in house! Our fries are cut fresh every day and fried to order! Try them topped with queso and some of the Mole chicken! And be sure to ask your server for the special of the day, as the kitchen is always encouraged to experiment and provide something new to pair with our beer.
And why not get a growler of your favorite beer to go? We offer both 64oz and 32oz!

Can't decide which beer is your favorite? Why not try a partial or full flight to get a sample of every brew we have to offer!
If beer's not your thing, we have a full bar and wine list, with special cocktails designed by our bartenders & owners! Cheers!
We have a private room that's available for meetings, parties, and weddings! Rent the whole place out and really show Fayetteville what a birthday party looks like!

Contact management@appleblossombrewing.com for details, questions, concerns, and complaints!

You can also find us on:
Twitter: @ABBCBeer
Instagram: @appleblossombrewing
Untappd: Apple Blossom Brewing Co. 

We've had the privilege of working with students from the UofA on a commercial! Check it out!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sHCrKs9EU3I
name: Apple Blossom Brewing Company

description:
We both grew up in California but after many years of living in the suburbs, fighting traffic and working in the corporate environment we yearned for a connection with the land.  Moving our family to Oregon was a natural choice.  We found the most beautiful apple orchard in the Applegate and absolutely fell in love with it.  Knowing nothing about orcharding we had our work cut out for us.  We had to learn quickly and made plenty of mistakes along the way.

Five years later we brought a cider press and all the related equipment to the orchard and began producing our own sweet (non-alcoholic) cider.  We’re now taking things to the next level and launching our “Apple Outlaw” line of hard ciders.

-Blair Smith and Marcey Kelley
name: Apple Outlaw

description:
From the self-performed renovation to the custom-fabricated brew train, Appleton Beer Factory was built to immerse patrons in beer culture & display the brewing process. We’re proud of our beer & want you to witness its journey from tun to tongue.

We have an obvious and delicious priority – beer. Our goal is to put top-notch brew in your glass while putting you in a friendly and fun atmosphere. Appleton Beer Factory beers are crafted to deliver what is so often missing from many beers on the market today – balance. This balance was struck from passionate experimentation by knowledgeable brewers who have focused on respecting the ingredients they use and the people they serve.
name: Appleton Beer Factory

description: Appleton Brewing is under new management as of October 2004. On January 1, 2005, the new owners, Steve and Tom Lonsway, changed the brewpub's name to Stone Cellar Brewpub & Restaurant.
name: Appleton Brewing

description: Enjoy wine tasting at a real farm winery in New York's Hudson Valley. Discover New York wines at Applewood. Our wines are made from our own vineyards, orchards and from across the state. We make Chardonnay's, Cabernet Franc, barrel fermented reds, in addition to that we have delicious fruit wines including Hard Apple Cider. Every wine is produced in a "limited edition" with almost every bottle spoken for as soon as its made. So you'll only find our wine at the tasting room and here in our online store
name: Applewood Winery

description:
Aquanaut Brewing Company is the creation of brewer and graphic artist, Eric McNeil. In 2006, Eric McNeil moved to Chicago where he brewed his first beer in his apartment on Addison Street. Eight years later, with the help and partnership of Philip Tadros of Doejo, LLC, Aquanaut Brewing Co. was formed and found its home in the Bomanville/Edgewater neighborhood.

We are dedicated to the entire package, inside and out. We produce fresh, locally brewed beers that have a seasonal flair; beers that are engaging to the palate while complimenting a wide range of foods. In embracing the entire craft, we have gained attention by concocting distinctive beer styles wrapped in original label art. We are passionate about producing well-balanced beers that are an exclusive example of that style
name: Aquanaut Brewing Company

description: Dale and Robert started home brewing and honed their skills together many years ago. They decided that they should join forces, start up their dream and open up their own brewery.  Aqueduct Brewing is a place where you can come,taste some different beers, find what you like, and you can take a growler or order a keg.
name: Aqueduct Brewing

description:
We've been brewing our beers in the fine city of Bristol since 2007. All of our beers are brewed with the intention of creating something we'll enjoy drinking ourselves and, more importantly, something we're proud to put our name to. In a world of endless possibilities, we try to explore as many of them as possible, which is why to date we've brewed in excess of two hundred different beers: some of them regulars, the odd few occasionals, and far too many one-offs to remember let alone try to name!
You should be able to find our beers on offer nationwide in the kind of pubs and bars that have the freedom and willingness to stock good beer. While most of it goes into cask, you'll also find it in keg or bottle if you look in the right places.
name: Arbor Ales

description: Our love affair with beer began in 1991 with our first batch of homebrew. Eventually the brewing operation took over the kitchen and basement and we decided it was time to look for larger digs. So with the help of family and friends, we opened the ABC Brewpub a brewery and restaurant in Ann Arbor, Michigan in 1995.
name: Arbor Brewing Company

description:
Arcade Brewery is a prospective production brewery. We want to create a deeper connection between our customers and their beer. Our goal is to create amazingly delicious craft beer with the help of our customers. With design challenges posted on our website, our customers will create and choose most aspects of beer creation from packaging/label design to even the ingredients that go into some of our seasonal beers. We want our customers to have greater control over the beer that they drink. Plus, we like to have fun and want to deliver you an amazing experience through your beer.

Arcade Brewery is also collaborating with amazing comic book artists and writers to bring label and packaging design to a whole new level of awesomeness. We are currently working with the talented Tony Moore (The Walking Dead), Eisner-nominated writer Jason Aaron (Scalped, Wolverine, PunisherMAX), and graphic artist Seibei.
Arcade Brewery is fun. We don’t believe in pretentious brews, but we do believe in great beers that satisfy our customers educated palette. 

Arcade Brewery is only limited to your imagination. Make the next beer your beer.
name: Arcade Brewery

description:
Arcadia Ales was established in 1996 as a microbrewery specializing in handcrafted British-style ales. All of our beers are produced in small batches, and our 25 Barrel Peter Austin Brewery and methods originated in England, which allows this style of beer to reflect over 250 years of world class brewing heritage.

In addition to brewing on authentic British equipment, Arcadia uses only the finest malted barley from England, and when combined with the freshest hops from the Pacific Northwest of our United States, and our legendary Ringwood yeast, the result is some of the best and freshest handcrafted ales available, on any continent.
name: Arcadia Ales

description:
Craft brewery definitely in the microbrewery or nano scale at 3.5 bbl per batch, our brewing facility and tasting room are located in the Carlsbad Gateway Center business park between El Camino Real and Palmer Way.
Open four days a week, you can come in and enjoy various sized tastings of all of our current beers, get growler fills to-go, and relax and enjoy the atmosphere with friends and fellow beer fans.
We're a 21+ facility, but can make limited exceptions for designated drivers and certain other cases (on Thursday & Sunday) if you check with us ahead of time.
Drink well and do good work!
name: Arcana Brewing Company

description: Micro brewery on the Southern Oregon Coast with a 15 barrel brewhouse and 30 barrel fermenters.
name: Arch Rock Brewing Company

description: The two microbreweries restaurant Archibald have become essential in Quebec! They are more than ever THE appointment of people connected to a drunken evening with friends or a delicious dinner head to head. On the beautiful terrace of one of the two microbreweries, there is no reason not to take the opportunity to come and offer an excellent meal while sipping a beer brewed on site. In addition, Microbrewery Archibald welcomes evening groups and singers who give the final touches to a friendly atmosphere among the most in Quebec!
name: Archibald Microbrasserie

description: A purveyor of fine hand crafted ales.
name: Arclight Brewing

description: We are a craft brewery located in Richmond, Virginia. Beginning in June of 2014, our beer will be available in our taproom and beer garden, as well as on draft at local restaurants.
name: Ardent Craft Ales

description: Area 51 Craft Brewery was founded by Mike Hawkins of Rialto, California.  His vision of becoming a unique brewer in a competitive business is a success story in the creation of "Alien Head Beer", which is now known worldwide.  He started very small, but is now growing at an unbelieveable pace, thanks to a lot of hard work finally paying off and a lot of prayers being answered.   Says Mike: "Initially, I decided to make everything from scratch because I couldn't afford to buy whatI needed.  Once I made a 1932 yellow deuce coupe in my garage and it became a beautiful running hot rod.  A buddy of mine told me "If I could do that, then I could make a brewery come true!"  That really stuck with me.  Little Area 51 Craft Brewery takes a chance in a worldwide market and it was a good choice according to an ever growing popularity.  Why Alien Head Beer? Earthly beers are brewed somewhat similar ways and have a common process.  Alien Head Beer is actually brewed in a special process that is unlike other breweries and delivers a taste that is out of this world!  "We're already thinking ahead and out of the box of what may come next.  Maybe one day soon, we'll think of something crazier!" says Mike.
name: Area 51 Craft Brewery

description:
We first opened our doors in Prices Corner in 1978, later settling in Pike Creek for over 20 years. After Homebrewing for several years, we've decided to expand to our new location (2667 Kirkwood Highway - Newark, DE) and install a 1.5 barrel brewery, making us the smallest brewery in the state of Delaware. We brew beers to please all kinds, including an Amber Ale, Rye Stout and an IPA that recently won a ribbon at the Delaware State Fair Battle of the Brews.

Since we're so small, we'll be sure to experiment with several different styles of beer, so there will always be something new to check out.  Along with the beer, we'll have the same great pizzas we've been serving up for over 33 years. We'll also have soups, salads, pub sandwiches and select entrees. Also be on the lookout for our occasional beer dinners and pizza beer dinners.   We're just as passionate about our food as we are about our beer.
name: Argilla Brewing Co. @ Pietro's Pizza

description:
Argyle Brewing Company is a small brewery operating under a New York Farm Brewery license, meaning a certain amount of our ingredients come from right here in New York State! With a combined 30 years of brewing experience between them, founders Matt Stewart and Chris Castrio are passionate about beer and dedicated to supporting our local farmers. Local hops and malts will combine with water and the finest yeasts to create several regular offerings and a variety of seasonal brews. 

Matt and Chris both hail from the farming community of Argyle, New York, but since Argyle is a dry town, our brewery is located in the fine Village of Greenwich.
name: Argyle Brewing Company

description:
For years we've dreamed of bringing together our two loves: The beautiful and diverse state of Arizona together with hand crafted, artisanal ales. While backpacking the wondrous depths of Arizona we forged ideas that would one day become Arizona Wilderness Brewing Co. Well, here we are! We will continue our endeavor into the remote beauties of both the Arizona Wilderness and Craft Beer.

Our belief is that beer is more than a beverage to guzzle on Sundays, just another beverage at the party, or cheap yellow fizzy stuff dad drank while wearing his dirty flannel shirts. Beer is culture and we have a true PASSION for this amazing beverage! Check out our food menu, as it was created to pair quite nicely with our fine ales. C’mon in and see what we are up to next!
name: Arizona Wilderness Brewing Company

description:
Arkell’s Brewery is one of the few family breweries left in the UK.

Established as Brunel was building the Great Western Railway, Arkell’s is still brewing beer long after the railway works closed down.
name: Arkell's Brewery

description: We are a microbrewery in Palmer, Alaska offering fresh, locally-brewed beer in our tasting room “The Growler Cache.” Enjoy a flight of tasters or a pint while we fill your growler. Logo pint glasses, logo taster glasses, and U.S. made apparel in 100% organic cotton and recycled environmentally-friendly fabrics also available.
name: Arkose Brewery

description:
For more than 9,000 years, the fermentation of honey has helped define culture and shape history. Early Slavic trading, Norse Mythology, Vedic Hymns of India, Old English Epics, 19th century Russian Literature, all of these acts or works, not to mention the contemplations of many a great mind of ancient Greece, have taken part in documenting and contributing to the continuing history of what we commonly refer to as Honey Wine or Mead making.

Arktos Meadery is now one more step in this evolutionary process. Nature has so graciously provided us with all the ingredients necessary for the production of this Nectar of the Gods. Now it is our responsibility to take these fruits, spices, and yeasts and combine them with those two wonderfully simple ingredients of honey and water for the purpose of continuing the hallowed tradition of making mead.

It is our hope and intention to provide each and every one of our mead drinkers with the finest, simplest and most natural mead possible. Oh, that sweet, sweet nectar…
name: Arktos Meadery

description: Our mission is to give Denton, TX fresh, handcrafted beers that are as unique as it is. We believe that bigger is not necessarily better, and good things come in small packages: like babies, puppies, and kittens. We believe our beer should be no different. By staying small, we’ll be able to devote the time, care, and love to each beer.
name: Armadillo Ale Works

description:
Armstrong Ales is a two barrel microbrewery located in Phoenixville, Pennsylvania. We pride ourselves in brewing some of the best tasting craft beer in the Southeast Pennsylvania area. Founded by Steven Armstrong in May of 2012, Armstrong Ales has been brewing and offering quality ales and lagers via local pubs and restaurants as well as operating a tasting room on premise at the brewery since August of 2013.

We handcraft our beers in small two barrel batches under close personal attention of head brewer and owner Steven Armstrong. These small batches provide us unique flexibility to craft ales and lagers that satisfy a variety of customer preferences.
name: Armstrong Ales

description: There's never been a more exciting time in craft beer. So come join us and let's see what's Around the Bend!
name: Around the Bend Beer Co.

description: Micro Brewery and Tasting room located in San Clemente, CA
name: Artifex Brewing Company

description:
At Artisan's Brewery, "Beer is Art".
Our Brewmaster Dave Hoffman hand selects hops and malted barley from only quality suppliers.

All of our beers are handcrafted in the on premise Brewery, made from our Brewmaster’s own recipes.

We proudly brew a variety of traditional beer styles and more distinctive specialty ales and lagers.
name: Artisan's Brewery & Italian Grill

description:
Arvada Beer Company is located in Olde Town Arvada, CO. Arvada Beer Company is the first Micro Brewery in the city of Arvada.

Arvada Beer Company is considered a “micro-brewery”, which produces beer that is wholesaled to pubs, taverns and restaurants in the city of Arvada, throughout Jefferson County, and  to the broader regional market.

Our tasting room allows you to view the operation of the brewery, purchase beer by the glass, growlers and kegs of beer to go, and retail items such as T-shirts and glassware with our logo.

Arvada Beer Company is different than most microbreweries due to our large tasting room. We have approximately 150 seats.

We have 14 taps that allow us to have specialty beers as well as our flagship beers on tap at all times.

Arvada Beer Company produces beer with a 7-barrel, stainless steel brewing plant.
name: Arvada Beer Company

description:
At Asher Brewing Company our mission is operate a successful brewery that produces world-class certified organic ales, while utilizing environmentally sustainable and socially responsible business practices. Our brewery is run on 100% wind power!

Chris Asher decided that the Boulder market deserved to have locally brewed organic beers. After nearly a year of planning, research, and hard work building a brewery, Asher Brewing Company opened the doors for business on November 20th, 2009.  

On February 25th, 2010 organic certification was issued for all beers at Asher Brewing Company; making it the first all organic brewery in the state of Colorado. Organic ingredients are better for the consumer, better for the environment, and better for the beer. (Studies have shown that pesticides are detrimental to the shelf-life of beer.)

USDA Organic Brewery
name: Asher Brewing Company

description:
A gem to the Asheville micro-brewing scene, Asheville Brewing creates it's own unique draw for the locals and visitors alike!! Along with our well known craft brews... SHIVA IPA, HOUDINI ESP, NINJA PORTER, ROCKET GIRL ALE, SCOTTISH BROWN, ROLANDS E.S.B, as well as limited addition Ales.... we also offer a full liqour bar at our Coxe Ave location, with daily drink specials!! 

We offer a full, fantastic food menu, including our "famous" pizza buffet during the week 11-3.

Our Coxe Ave location offers a "Beer Infuser Creation" every Thursday at 5:30!!
name: Asheville Brewing Company

description: We are a new Ottawa Brewery with 35 years plus Publican experience. Family run, Friend enjoyed. The Ashton Brewing Company.
name: Ashton Brewing Company

description:
Ashtown was conceptualized on a cold morning around a homebrewing setup in Longview Washington by two cousins who found themselves on a map in between two craft beer meccas and knew something needed to change to bring good beer to a vacant area.

In September of 2013 Ashtown opened their doors bringing local hand crafted ales to Southwest Washington. Ashtown believes in its community and the change it can make on a local level.
name: Ashtown Brewing Company

description: Ashuelot Brewing Company, LLC was founded in the fall of 2014. We are a small family owned brewery dedicated to brewing fine craft beer.
name: Ashuelot Brewing Company

description: Aslan Brewing Company is a local microbrewery committed to pushing the boundaries of craft beer while preserving the purity of brewing tradition. We only use the finest certified organic ingredients the Pacific Northwest has to offer, creating some of the cleanest and most unique brews in the market today. Truly dank brew; Pride of the Organic Northwest.
name: Aslan Brewing Company

description: Since the inception of Aslin Beer Company, Andrew, Kai, & Richard wanted to create a company that they all would want to work for. They have strived to create a culture that celebrates beer with a passion and depth of knowledge that can’t help but be contagious to our customers. We realize that our beer is not the only product we provide, but a long lasting relationship between our company, employees, and customers. Aslin Beer Company doesn’t take itself too seriously. Any why should we? Beer is fun. It’s for kicking back: vacations, parties, hangouts. Along with the fun and humorous atmosphere, our founders’ have a passion and dedication to create a good product and have a commitment to provide the best beer to all passionate beer drinkers alike. Our company will craft only the highest quality ales, lagers, and ciders that will help redefine American beer culture, re-educate the consumer palate and revive people’s passion, and using the highest quality ingredients from around the world.
name: Aslin Beer Co.

description:
spen’s beer history dates back to 1885 and the original Aspen Brewery which was located only a few hundred yards from the new Aspen Brewery.  Founded by Christian Sanders, the Aspen Brewery operated successfully in Aspen until being purchased by P.H. Zang Company of Denver in 1902.  We believe that they produced one beer, presumable a Lager, to quench the thirst of Aspen’s mining population.

In 1990, Flying Dog brew-pub was opened by George Stranahan and Richard McIntyre in the Cooper Street pedestrian mall.  Locals and visitors flocked to the brew pub for the beer, food and bohemian atmosphere.  Flying Dog operated in downtown Aspen for three years until moving to Denver.
name: Aspen Brewing Company

description:
We are a small handcrafted Brewing Company that specialize in unique flavors. We use only the best ingredients, and use organic whenever it is available.

We believe in making a product that is NOT based off of a profit model, but uses the best local organic ingredients (when available).
                             
We also believe it is important to know what is in the beer you drink and that it is made in an environmentally responsible way.  Ass Clown Brewing strives to be  a "green" brewing company that uses alternative energy and finds uses for brewing waste. For example, our warehouse will have recycled items, lights, furniture and equipment. 

Local ingredients will also be a focus for Ass Clown Brewing Company. We grow our own hops.  As our production expands we will be looking for North Carolina hop growing farms, malting farms, spices and fruits.
name: Ass Clown Brewing Company

description:
Ass Kisser Beverage Company is based in Fort Worth, Texas. We are a family owned company from South Australia. It is operated by Rocland Wine Imports. The Ales are brewed at our brewery in San Jose, CA. 

The Line includes a Double IPA, Smoked Porter, Vanilla Pale Ale, Hefewiezen and a Strawberry Wit. 

Ass Kisser Ales is a state of mind. Just as you contemplate the flavors and aromas of this fine ale, you can comtemplate sharing it with your friend or your boss. Maybe they are one in the same or maybe not! We are Just Sayin!
name: Ass Kisser Ales

description: Assawoman Bay (local /ˈæsəwʊmən/), once called Assawoman Sound, is a lagoon that is located between Ocean City, Maryland and mainland Delmarva. The name comes from the Algonquian Indians who originally lived here.
name: Assawoman Bay Brewing Company

description:
Athenian Brewery SA is one of the leading companies producing and marketing beer in Greece . Founded in 1963 by a group of Greek entrepreneurs and a member of the Group Heineken NV Works based in Athens .

The first factory was Athenian Brewery in Athens in 1965 and produced beer Amstel. In 1975 was inaugurated the second factory in Thessaloniki and in 1985 purchased the third , in the industrial area Patras . From the 1993 operates in Lamia the bottling plant of Natural Mineral Water Iole .

Today , we produce and pack them in some of Greece 's most famous beer : Amstel, Amstel Premium Pils, Amstel Bock, Heineken, ALFA , Fischer, Buckler, BIOS 5. At the same time , we import beers Amstel Light, McFarland, Erdinger, SOL, Murphy's, Duvel, Chimay, Kirin, Moretti, Desperados, Krusovice and others.

The 25 products we produce and distribute , available in 11 countries , with the help of an extensive network of distribution and sales . We continue to strategically plan our growth , seeking the strength of our products in existing markets and our expansion into new .
name: Athenian Brewery

description: The Atlantic Brewing Company began brewing in 1991, on the eve of the microbrewing revolution. We have steadily grown over the years by having a strong commitment to tradition, quality and service. As a result, we have become the number one beer of the Bar Harbor region. Our new facility was built on the site of an old farm a few miles from downtown Bar Harbor. It was designed to create a more visitor-friendly environment similar to country wineries and breweries found throughout Europe. Our beers are now available in select areas throughout the eastern US.
name: Atlantic Brewing Company

description: A packaging craft brewery in the District of Columbia. Atlas Brew Works focuses on providing D.C. with fresh, craft ales and lagers.
name: Atlas Brew Works

description: Atlas Brewing Company is a state of the art small batch brewery. From Atlas Golden Ale to the Andromeda Milk Stout, or the Sweet Oblivion Strong Dark Ale, aged with oak and tawny port, Brewers Ben and John Saller have developed an impressive range of craft beer.
name: Atlas Brewing Company

description:
ATLAS Cider Co from Bend, Oregon is here! Explore a taste of the Northwest in our premium ciders fermented from 100% fresh pressed Oregon fruit.

Delve into our site to learn more about us and our craft. In addition if you have a social media account you can: join the conversation, win free gear in contests, and get a glimpse behind the scenes. Simply Like/Follow/Support us. Thx!
name: Atlas Cider Company

description: Founded by Aaron Burks in 1997, Atomic Ale Brewpub & Eatery is the Tri-Cities’ first brewpub. We feature a distinctive menu cooked in the Tri-Cities’ original wood-fired oven to complement our fresh, full-flavored handcrafted ales. Set in an atmosphere that reflects the rich history of the Mid-Columbia basin and the Hanford Site, we work hard to provide an exceptional dining experience.
name: Atomic Ale Brewpub and Eatery

description: Atwater Block Brewery, founded in 1997, is housed in a 1916 factory warehouse located in Detroit's historic Rivertown district. Brewing relentlessly on our imported Kaspar Schultz system, we've ridden the wave of aggressive ales while holding true to our German roots through our traditional Lagers. With drinkability and tradition at heart, it's easy for us to "Drink Our Share and Sell the Rest"!
name: Atwater Brewery

description:
A recent addition to Old Town Auburn, the Auburn Alehouse Brewery and Restaurant is located in the historic American Block Building at 289 Washington Street in Old Town Auburn, California. You may better remember the building as the former home of the Shanghai Restaurant and bar, where scenes from the movie, Phenomenon were filmed.

The ambiance of the Auburn Alehouse combines the charm and character of this historic brick and mortar building with the bold industrial elements of a gleaming 10-barrel microbrewery.

Guests and friends can enjoy lunch, dinner, and libation while watching the freshly crafted beer they are drinking being produced just a few feet away.

There is also an outdoor patio with a great view of the historic Auburn courthouse. There are always at least 6-8 beers on tap and Hard Cider and select "guest" craft beers are also available on draught. Interestingly, the Auburn Alehouse is located just 1/10th of a mile from the original Auburn Brewery, which brewed for thirsty Auburnites from 1855 until 1908. You may stop by for the ale, but you’ll find the food is a star attraction as well. Whether you’re in the mood for pub fare or a sit down dinner, there is something for every one at the Alehouse.
name: Auburn Alehouse

description: Denton's hometown brewery.
name: Audacity Brew House

description: The August Schell Brewing Company is a brewing company in New Ulm, Minnesota. It was founded by German immigrants August Schell and Jacob Bernhardt in 1860 and passed into the possession of the Schell family in 1866. It is the second oldest family-owned brewery in America and became the oldest and largest brewery in Minnesota when the company bought the Grain Belt rights in 2002.
name: August Schell Brewing Company

description: The Augusta Brewing Company & Beer Garden is located on the KATY Trail in Augusta, Missouri.  With Augusta's strong German heritage, there always been a love of great beers. Our hope is to revive this tradition by serving our own Beer in this unique setting.
name: Augusta Brewing Co.

description: Since 1328 on Augustiner beer had been brewed within the monastery of the Augustinian Brotherhood near the cathedral of Munich. After nearly 500 years of tradition, the secularization in 1803 and the following privatisation led to a privately owned company: Augustiner Bräu. In 1817 it moved to the Neuhauser Straße, the very same place where the renowned "Stammhaus" still stands today. In 1829 the Wagner family took over the company and eventually moved it to the "Kellerareal" at the Landsberger Straße in 1885.
name: Augustiner-Bräu München

description: Austin Beerworks is an owner-operated Texas brewery hell-bent on excellence. Our beers are canned for quality. We brew for two reasons: to make consistently exceptional craft beer, and to build community in the town we love.
name: Austin Beerworks

description: Producers of Fine Cider for the Fine Folks of Austin!
name: Austin Eastciders

description:
Established in July 2010, the Australian Brewery has become an iconic venue in the community providing locals and tourists with a family friendly food, entertainment and sporting precinct second to none. Hand crafted beer; fresh pure Australian produce, a warm atmosphere, state-of-the-art sporting facilities and uniquely designed true blue decor make this hotel a destination in itself.
The Australian Brewery caters for everyone especially the little ones. A dedicated glass enclosed kid’s dining room catering for up to 80 along with an all-weather adventure playground, kid’s activities, parents change facilities and tasty kiddies corner menu are just some of the reasons why families from all over Sydney are drawn to the hotel daily. If that’s not enough to attract families, this family friendly hub also offers free face painting on Sundays with a family bistro featuring indoor and alfresco dining.
From the Comfy leather armchairs in the TAB to the Dragon tree in the Beer Garden, the hotel makes you feel right at home as soon as you step in the front door. We look forward to seeing you in the Hotel soon and enjoying The Australian Hotel and Brewery experience.
Home of live sports in the Hill's.
name: Australian Brewery

description: Automatic Brewing Co is anything but automatic.
name: Automatic Brewing Co.

description: Avenge Brewing Co. plans to open in 2016, bringing true English flagships to Charlotte and serving quintessential American flavors in small-batch brews.
name: Avenge Brewing Co.

description: New Restaurant & Small Batch Brewery In The Avenues of Salt Lake City, Utah.
name: Avenues Proper Restaurant and Publick House

description: Since 1993 our brewery has been committed to producing eccentric ales and lagers that defy styles or categories. Our products are thoroughly American at heart: blending Old World tradition and expertise with ingenuity, creativity and boldness.
name: Avery Brewing Company

description:
Aviator Brewing Company was started to provide fine ales and lagers in North Carolina.

We also got sick of driving to the store all the time to buy beer so we thought...what the heck....lets brew lots of beer and drink most of it ourselves.
name: Aviator Brewing Company

description:
Combine the charm of a historic town, the passions of several good friends, a rooted respect for the craft of brewing and you have unearthed the beginning of what Avondale Brewing Company is all about. A byproduct of the collaboration between Coby Lake, Hunter Lake and Craig Shaw, ABC is a locally owned and operated brewery in the heart of the Deep South with an unmistakable affection for hand-crafted brews.

As you'll discover throughout our website and branding, Avondale Brewing Company is rooted in layers of rich history. We are a young brewery built on years of knowledge, experience, and family bonds. We brew from the heart and pour from the hip. We are confident that you will fall in love with the beer we brew and the stories we tell! Cheers to good beer!
name: Avondale Brewing Company

description: ABC. Aztec Brewing Company - rediscovered by John Webster in 2008. Aztec Brewery specializes in California Ales and Mexican-style lagers. Come in and learn more about the Aztec Story and the cervezas especiales. aztecbrewery.com blog.californiabeerco.com
name: Aztec Brewing Company

description:
