Known for the most amazing and creative alcoholic beverages made from honey. B. Nektar is a world-wide sensation.

To boldly go where no meadery has gone before. To prove to you that the horrible mead your best friend made one time in college is NOT what a good mead should taste like. To show you that mead doesn't HAVE to be sweet. To educate you on the different styles of mead. To bring mead into the mainstream, but still maintain our integrity. To everyday thank my mom and tell her that I love her (shouldn't we all?).
name: B. Nektar Meadery

description: B.O.B.'s Brewery is heading in a fresh direction with a new Brewmaster and attitude. Brewmaster, John Svaboda, has brought a wealth of experience and talent with him to The B.O.B. The result has been the highest quality microbrews the brewery has ever produced. Along with technical know how, John has introduced an air of fun, ingenuity and tempered insanity with some of the most unique and delicious special batch brews ever available at The B.O.B. The Mango Chipotle and Papaya Peach Ginger ales come to mind most immediately. For the more traditional beer connoisseur we have our standard brews - Afterglow Amber, Nautical Dawn Pale and Platinum Blonde. John also rotates classic brews such as Stouts, Porters and Wheats.
name: B.O.B.'s House Of Brews

description:
BOMBrewery stands for Belgian Original Malt Bakery and Brewery. In the days of old, each brewery had its own malt bakery, also called the malting house. Starting from this tradition, we bake, as first malt bakery in the world, all our own malts ourselves. It concerns here new kinds of malt that we develop especially for each beer individually. They are unique and baked according to traditional methods.

We create our own beer recipes that we brew according to the principle of the gipsy-brewery. This means that we hire the wort boilers of a brewery to brew our own beer. We are convinced that not the kettles determine the taste of the beer, but on the contrary the malt baker and the brewing master.

The Triporteur beers are our point of departure and our basic beers. Besides those, we also launch a special beer line with once-off products. The beers are brewed using once-off kinds of malts or grains and will be put on the market under the collective name Special Roast Series.
name: B.O.M. Brewery

description: Coachella Valley's Oldest Craft Micro-Brewery with 27 medals including a Silver Medal at the 2014 Great American Beer Festival for Babe's Belgian Vanilla Blonde Ale.
name: Babe's Bar-B-Que and Brewhouse

description:
Located in Brisbane's Bayside at Capalaba, we offer bespoke brewing services, creating individually tailored beers for the trade & public. Come & try our amazing range of beers on tap (23+ taps) with many available to purchase in handy 5L party kegs. Want that special beer for your party or commercial bar? Look no further, we guarantee you wont be dissappointed.

We are also Australia's premier Homebrew Store (www.CraftBrewer.com.au) for the best value & range of quality equipment & fresh ingredients.
name: Bacchus Brewing Company

description: At Bacchus Brewing Company, we start each day with a singular focus. We love what we do and want to provide you with only the highest quality beer. Every beer we produce is made with premium ingredients and attention to detail. The quality of our beer reflects who we are and what we care about. We encourage you to sit back, relax, and enjoy an exceptional taste of the Finger Lakes. Visit us in person or at www.bacchusbrewing.com.
name: Bacchus Brewing Company

description: Back Alley Brewery was established in 2012 as a privately owned brewery and sports bar. It offers several hand crafted beers and ales. Come join us for great brew and watch your favorite sporting events.
name: Back Alley Brewery

description: Back Bay Brewing Co was founded in 2011 by a group of Virginia Beach friends. With deep roots in Virginia Beach’s Back Bay, Charlie Burroughs and Josh Canada were in a duck blind discussing their dream of brewing their own beer when they decided to make that dream a reality. They brought on three life-long friends and Virginia Beach natives, George Powell, Will Yearick, and Josh Malbon who all share their passion for beer and the outdoors. A year later, with each partner bringing a unique skill set, Back Bay Brewing Co. is proud to announce the release of their locally brewed False Cape Ale.
name: Back Bay Brewing

description: Back East is an award-winning Craft brewery in Bloomfield, CT.  Back East was formed by Edward Fabrycki, Jr. and Tony Karlowicz, two cousins with a passion for great-tasting, high-quality beer. Back East brews many different styles of high-quality beers, distributed on draft and in cans throughout Connecticut.
name: Back East Brewing Company

description:
Back Forty is a micro brewery based out of Gadsden, Alabama. With 2 offerings currently distributed throughout the state, Back Forty is the only Alabama based brewery that can be found anywhere from Muscle Shoals to Mobile.

The name Back Forty Beer Company is basically a reference to the back 40 acres of the farm. Tradionally the "Back 40" of a farm is the most challenging to maintain, but also produces some of the best yields due to the rich content of the earth. Likewise, Alabama was one of the last States in The Union to update it's outdated beer laws (MS is the only one left), and now it's time to reap those yields.

The craft beer market in Alabama has a lot of room to grow, and we plan on doing everything we can to make that happen. Our main goal is to focus on the local community and support other small business owners while offering up our tasty flavors for the people of Alabama. 

The company is founded in Alabama, and just about every aspect of this business is supported by Alabama based suppliers. We've worked with a Design firm out of Athens, AL on our label and logos, our attorney is in Birmingham, our accountant is in Dothan, AL, our shirts are printed in Huntsville and our Brewmaster is out of Montgomery, AL. 

We've been working with Jamie Ray (A nationally recognized Brewmaster who has won several medals at the Great American Beer Festival in Denver, CO), for over a year on our first offering, "Naked Pig Pale Ale". And we have several ideas in the works for additional year round offerings in the coming months. We're looking forward to producing some great beers that Alabamian's have never tasted before. Once things get up and running, we'll start releasing some seasonal offerings, one-time offerings, limited edition batches, etc. That's what we're really excited about.

The only aspect of this operation that isn't planted firmly in Alabama soil, is the production and packaging. We had to go to another craft brewery in a neighboring state for our first production batches. This is partially due to the enormous start-up costs associated with building a complete brewery operation from scratch. But it's also given us the opportunity to support another regional micro-brewery while we get up and running.
name: Back Forty Beer Company

description:
"We put LaPorte on the beer Map"

"Small brewery big beers"
name: Back Road Brewery

description:
Our neighborhood brewpubs bring together Lamppost Pizza's award winning pizza with the freshest handcrafted ales and lagers.

Our brewmasters use traditional brewing methods along with the finest imported ingredients available. We brew our beers in small batches to ensure freshness and quality. Although our methods are more expensive, we believe this process creates the best tasting beer.

As a brewpub, we allow our brewmasters more freedom to brew a variety of styles, and we have a constantly rotating variety of beers on tap. Our brewmasters create four to seven variety beers, while keeping four favorite, constant brews always on tap.
name: Back Street Brewery

description:
Frisco’s Backcountry Brewery and Restaurant was established in 1996 by a group of Frisco and Summit County residents with a desire to bring great brews and food to their community for the enjoyment of locals and visitors alike.
Backcountry is the second oldest brewpub in summit county. The property (site) Acquired in 1994 by the Mount Royal Brewing Company joined forces with our founding brewmaster and managing partner Anthony Carestia and construction of the Mount Royal Plaza quickly ensued.
The Brewery and Restaurant opened on September16, 1996. Over our 14 year history the Backcountry has established itself as a sanctuary for Summit County visitors and locals longing for great brews, great food and great views. We take great pride in offering diverse ales, lagers and American pub fare. Enjoy!
name: Backcountry Brewery

description:
It’s time to stand up against the predictable, old beer establishment and craft beers the way they were intended: flavorful, gimmick free and not produced in ridiculous quantities. We’re a Boston company with a Boston attitude, here to reclaim beer by recruiting people to fuel the craft beer movement.

Join the Backlash.
name: Backlash Beer Company

description: Backpocket Beer is German-inspired and hand-crafted right here in Iowa. We strive to provide Iowans with a simple, enjoyable world-class beer.
name: Backpocket Brewing

description:
Backroom Brewery is a boutique farm brewery nestled in the heart of the Shenandoah River Valley.  We began as a herb farm, growing culinary and medicinal herbs for the garden center trade. 
 
Our herb farm, Sunflower Cottage, grows 120,000 potted herb plants each spring from seeds and cuttings to sell to other garden centers and to our own customers. 
 
In the fall of 2012, we built our hops field.  After all, hops are the herbs that flavor beer.  Hops provide the bitter balance to the sweet malt that feeds yeast, which ferments beer.
 
In 2013 we began the process of creating an ordinance in Warren County to accomodate farm breweries.  By late spring, the process was complete and Backroom Brewery became the first farm brewery in the Northern Shenandoah Valley.
 
Our first hop harvest in August of 2013 was bountiful.  We were brewing in small batches and planning our brewery construction.  In the spring of 2014 we began construction and finished our brewery building plus equipment installation by July of 2014. 
 
Life is good and we are living the dream. 
 
We now have nearly 20 beer recipes approved by the State of VA. 
 
Our tasting room bustles and our scratch kitchen cranks out delicious dishes prepared with our own fresh herbs and farm grown produce in season.
 
In the spring , summer and fall, gardens abound, families enjoy the farm, the scenery, the corn hole, the labyrinth and chalk boards. Pets are welcome.
 
We host 3 annual events, The Virginia Herb Festival (June), BRB Hop Harvest Party (August) and BRB Holiday Market (November). 
 
You are cordially invited to come and drink our beer, eat, play and spend some time.
name: Backroom Brewery

description: There's something about the beach that feeds your soul, keeps you young, and demands your return. Of the millions who visit, a few are distracted by romantic visions of life at the beach and are left behind, never to return to the "real world." It's an existence unaffected by time or authority. Days and nights blend together, signaled by sunrises over the ocean and sunsets in the bay. Their hearts become gorged with rebellion and pride, inherent in all Americans but enjoyed by few. It is with the same celebration of freedom and togetherness that we have conceived this beer. We brew our beer in the salty air with our toes in the sand and the sun on our faces. Lucky for you, we can't finish it all. Please have as much fun drinking Backshore Beer as we have making it. We've spent serious time creating it. Have a ridiculous time enjoying it.
name: Backshore Brewing Company

description: Our first beer was brewed in a barn at the backside of a small community in rural western Oregon. Although our facility and equipment has been upgraded, our idea remains simple, Make. Great. Beer. So tip one back and have some fun.
name: Backside Brewing Co.

description: Backwoods Brewing was founded in 2012 and is located in Carson, WA, just an hour from Portland, OR. It is family owned and operated, with the goal to provide great beer and jobs to our small local community. The brewery has grown in size, starting from a single barrel brew pub, to now a 20 barrel system, with an estimated output of 6000 barrels in 2015. Backwoods specializes in NW style ales, sourcing as many local ingredients as possible. The beer can be found in draft at local bars and restaurants, as well in package format at many local grocery chains and independent stores.
name: Backwoods Brewing Company

description:
I like to drink beer, and I decided I never wanted 
to run out! So what's a feller supposed to do? I 
built a brewery of course! I've incorporated my 
ingenuity and resourceful habits to create the 
smallest producing stand alone micro brewery in 
Nova Scotia.

I managed to snag some epic assistance from pro 
brewer Greg Nash to help ensure the best brewing 
practices are in place and with his guidance I have 
been able to produce some beers I am proud of!
Along with many other successful neighbors we 
are helping to put Somerset on the map.
                                                               Jeff
name: Bad Apple Brewing

description: My name is Matt I have been home brewing for 23 plus years.  A friend of mine Allen O’Brien introduced me to “real” beer when I tried to offer him a Keystone.  I’ve been hooked on making and drinking real beer ever since.  My wife enrolled me in a home brewing class in Durango Colorado.  Over the past 23 years I have only made three bad beers out of thousands of batches.  I ended 26 years of the construction trades February of 2010 to fulfill my dream of opening a micro brewery.  Welcome to BAB short for Bad Ass Brewery.  My beers are hand crafted personal recipes sometimes extreme gravity.  I invite you to come on out and sample some of my latest creations.  No less than 20 beers on tap from Girly Pale, fruited beers to award winning stouts and over the top barley wines.
name: Bad Ass Brewery

description: Bad Attitude is a Swift Craft beer brewed in Stabio since 2010.
name: Bad Attitude Craft Beer

description: Bad Bear Brewery - Makers of Natural, Unfiltered, hand crafted Bad Bear beers and ciders that are created in small batches from local ingredients. Truly a brew that reflects our Great Lakes, we use regional grains, and hops from the world famous land of Sleeping Bear. We are committed to giving you quality libations that represent a sense of place and purpose. Bad never tasted so good!
name: Bad Bear Brewery

description: Bad Beat Brewing was created on the premise that quality should be above all else. It's not about how much you brew, or how much you sell. It's about the beer; how satisfying it is and how much it makes people crave more. It's about taking what's good and making it better, while leaving what doesn't work behind you. Making it in the beer world isn't a gamble, it's a game of skill. At Bad Beat Brewing we play to drink, and drink to win.
name: Bad Beat Brewing

description: BAD Brewing Company is a small Microbrewery locatedin downtown Mason, MI that opened in the Summer of 2012. We will offer a wide selection of hand crafted beers. We will have at least five house beers on tap, with several more on a rotating basis. All of the beers are hand crafted on site by the owner, and new recipes are always in the works! BAD Brewing looks forward to serving Mason and the Greater Lansing area the finest hand crafted beers possible. Have a BAD day!
name: BAD Brewing Co

description: In todays world to have great taste in beer you have to go to your craft brewers were beer is actually studied and time is taken to insure the quality and taste is always the same. Supporting your local breweries is a great way to keep wonderful, full flavor ale's and lagers available. Ballard, Wa. will soon be the home to Bad Jimmy's with a tap room for everyone to enjoy the full flavor ale's that we have to offer. Watch for us in your local bars and please let us know what you think of our tasty liquid joy.
name: Bad Jimmy's Brewery

description:
At Bad Martha, we believe in three things: great beer, getting bad and doing good. Every sip of our premium craft beer is a reminder that there’s a paradise out there where you can kick off your boat shoes, let your hair down and leave it all behind. That paradise is Martha’s Vineyard. Don’t hold back. Don’t bring your off-island worries. Don’t be too good. Drink it all in.

And while there’s a bit of bad in every drop of beer we brew, there’s also a whole lot of good that comes with every bottle we sell. That’s because Bad Martha is built on a simple idea – community first. We bring this idea to life by donating the first portion of profits to a local hunger relief charity. What’s left goes back into brewing more delicious Bad Martha.

We’re proud of our beer. We’re even prouder of the island that inspired it. We hope you enjoy both as much as we do.
name: Bad Martha Beer

description:
On June 28, 1895, after confessing to the murder of six people, “Bad Tom” Smith uttered his final words before meeting a hangman’s noose in Breathitt County, Ky.: “Bad women and bad whiskey have brought me where I am. I give you this warning: Don’t drink bad whiskey and don’t do as I have done.”

While he doesn’t think highly of his great-great uncle, Sean Smith, Bad Tom co-owner, has turned his relative’s evil deeds into a namesake for a local brewery. “My penance is to make good beer for all the bad whiskey he drank,” Smith quips.

After talking and sharing his great-great uncle’s story with Charles Boucher, co-owner and master brewer, they decided to change the name to Bad Tom Smith Brewing.

Boucher’s beer list includes the flagship Bad Tom Smith, a reddish brown ale. Other favorites are Brother Clement, a white Belgian ale brewed with more than a 100 pounds of clementines, and Old Abe American Ale, an American-style ale based on English beers with a dark amber color.
name: Bad Tom Smith Brewing

description:
From the beginning, it was our desire to culture a company that fit between the lines. Bad Water Brewing set forth with a beverage brand that could stand out with a unique cosmopolitan energy, yet supply a rich refreshing craft brewed experience.

Bad Water represents a progressive lifestyle in many ways. Our company decisions are all based on merit, essentially we believe the best idea wins and it doesn’t matter who it comes from. This is how we continue to stay the most progressive brand in the market.

We come from humble places as our first beer launched in 2012 and continue to let old brewing traditions meet our southwestern style. As we further press the envelope we hope you enjoy being a part of the growing Bad Water heritage!
name: Bad Water Brewing

description: Bad Weather knows the beer-lover's calendar is one that changes with seasons. BWBC offers unique beers with Midwestern Edge to them. These beers complement and celebrate the shifting summer sun and frigid winter winds.
name: Bad Weather Brewery

description: Are you a Badass? Badass Hard Cider was born and raised in New York, with a New York attitude. Only New York apples and pears are used in making our Cider.
name: Badass Hard Ciders

description: Chicago's Original Craft Beer
name: Baderbräu

description:
A family united by a hankering for travel and craft beer. In our blood: A melting pot of European heritage. Our passion: The singular love of beer. Our mission: Sharing what topped our taste-o-meters. We do hope you like them—and our promise is that we’ll keep coming up with new recipes while staying true to the brew. Mostly.

Wondering about our name? Badger Hill is a rough translation of the two brothers’ names in Old English and speaks to the influence of their European heritage. Plus, they liked how it sounded.
name: Badger Hill Brewing

description: We are Wenatchee's largest craft brewery. We have 12 taps that pour our beer, guest beer, and cider. Together with Country Boys BBQ you can't go wrong.
name: Badger Mountain Brewing

description: Badger State Brewing Company is a craft brewery located in the shadows of Lambeau Field. Opening officially in 2013 and excited to be a part of the Green Bay Area and great state of Wisconsin. Looking forward to sharing a beer with you!
name: Badger State Brewing Company

description: Come and try all Badlands Beers on tap. Enjoy fantastic homecooked breakfasts, lunches and cakes using fresh local produce where possible and browse the store stocking a wide range of interesting and tasty local produce including one of Orange's best selection of local wines.
name: Badlands Brewery

description:
BadWolf Brewing Company is a family-owned and operated nanobrewery in Manassas, VA founded on June 28, 2012. The Co-Founders, Jeremy and Sarah Meyers, are local residents who grew up in the NOVA area and have always dreamed of having a brewery. Jeremy has been brewing beer over 10 years inspired by his trip to Germany. Sarah has a background in business so it's a perfect match. The couple is passionate about craft beer and believes in sharing it with YOU! 

The brewing setup is a 1 barrel brewing system so BadWolf can pump out a variety of beers in the taproom. Free popcorn will be offered to cleanse the palate! We don't serve food but you can bring your own or order delivery. BadWolf will offer pints and samples on site and offer growlers to go.
name: BadWolf Brewing Company

description:
Baeltane Brewing is a small production brewery and tasting room located in Novato, CA (Marin County).

Our Marin brewery proudly produces artisanal ales for the discerning consumer. The beers we produce feature the artistry of our Head Brewer, Alan Atha, specializing in Belgian, French and West Coast Ale styles.

We might be small but our impression is huge.
name: Baeltane Brewing

description: An industrial farmhouse in the Historic Baker District of Denver.
name: Baere Brewing Company

description:
Literally translating to ‘of barley’ in old english, bærlic reiterates the fundamental idea that all things, no matter how complex or involved, can always be traced backward to single, simple core or point of view.

Our point of view comes from a belief that we are all in this together and that our actions shape our world – by being honest, we are approachable; by being consistent, we are trusted; by being considerate, we can sleep at night; and by choosing to keep it simple, we are able to do this really well.
name: Baerlic Brewing

description:
Joseph Dowd and Evan Feringa began brewing together in their college apartment at Michigan State University in 2009. (Go Green!) We have come a long way as brewers, worked hard and studied with the best, and now we are ready to bring our passion and brews to St. Clair Shores and South-Eastern Michigan!

Our mission is to provide our customers and community with the very best craft brewery in which to call their own; inspiring a sense of pride with each taste from the glass.
name: Baffin Brewing Company

description: Bagby Beer Company is the dream-turned-reality for long term brewer Jeff Bagby, and his wife, Dande. Located in Oceanside, California - just three blocks from the beach - Bagby Beer is a former mid-century BMW dealership transformed into a two-story, indoor/outdoor brewpub. We strive to always brew and pour world-class beer, serve simple food done well, and to welcome guests with genuine and inviting hospitality.
name: Bagby Beer Company

description:
Making a great beer requires a combination of art and science.  Science, in knowing what the gear and the ingredients can do.  Art, in imagining what beer can be.  Whether it's excellent versions of classic styles, or boundary pushing experimental brews, we strive to blend the art and science of beer.

But beer is also a social beverage.  The pub is part of our culture, and here in the Northwest that means locally brewed craft beer.  The local brewery is part of the fabric of the community, giving it character, individuality, and indeed, an air of hometown pride.  Bainbridge Island is certainly a great place to live, but it's been lacking one thing: our own craft microbrewery.  Well, no longer!  Bainbridge Island Brewing is the island's brewery, and the island is as much a part of us as we are of it.
name: Bainbridge Island Brewing Company

description:
Baird Brewing is a joint partnership company founded in 2000 in Numazu, Japan by the husband & wife team of Bryan and Sayuri Baird. We are a family company born of a deep passion for beer and a great reverence for brewing history, tradition and culture. Our motto is Celebrating Beer. This, to us, means the comprehensive enjoyment of beer in a way that enhances the overall experience of life.

The basic formula for our entire lineup of hand-crafted Baird Beer is the same: Balance + Complexity = Character. We are dedicated to the crafting of beer that bursts with flavor and character. We will not brew vapid beer and we are not afraid of not appealing to everyone. We brew to our own exacting standards and it is our daily mission to not disappoint ourselves.

In addition to crafting Baird Beer, we also own and directly operate a growing stable of beer pubs which we call our Taprooms (Numazu Fishmarket Taproom, Nakameguro Taproom, etc.). Baird Beer also is sold through a steadily expanding family of outside pubs, restaurants and liquor stores in Japan as well as being exported to select international markets. Consumer purchases of Baird Beer direct from the brewery are possible through our online estore (delivery only within Japan).
name: Baird Brewing Company

description:
Baldy Beard is the founder and creator of the brewery which bares his name. He is rarely seen, but heard from often. Drink With Friends.

Baldy Beard Brewing Company is a nanobrewery with a 1.5 barrel system.
Our brewery is currently under construction, but there will be plenty of time soon to #DrinkWithFriends.
name: Baldy Beard Brewing Company

description:
Bale Breaker Brewing Company is a new brewery in Moxee, WA, but our story starts back in 1932, when our great-grandparents planted our family’s first five-acre hop field in the Yakima Valley. Now, 80 years later, our love of hops and passion for craft beer has led us to where we are today – in the midst of building a craft brewery surrounded by our family’s hop fields, just minutes from where we were born and raised.

Bale Breaker Brewing Company will focus on handcrafted ales that showcase Yakima Valley hops and will celebrate Yakima’s status as one of the leading hop growing regions in the world. We’re optimistic that we will be pouring pints at our on-site tasting room and distributing kegs and cans to local bars, restaurants, and grocery stores this winter. Visit our website (www.balebreaker.com) or like us on Facebook to follow our progress. Cheers!
name: Bale Breaker Brewing Company

description: Ballast Point Brewing Company is one of San Diego's Premiere Breweries. We started out modestly as Home Brew Mart in 1992. Our goal was to teach others how to brew quality handcrafted beer at home. In 1996 the brewery was installed by New World Brewing Systems in the space behind our retail store and production began in September. In May of 2005 we open our second brewery in Scripps Ranch.  We currently distribute five of our favorite beers, Yellowtail Pale Ale,  Calico Amber Ale , Big Eye I.P.A., Black Marlin Porter and Wahoo Wheat Beer to a thirsty San Diego.  Come to our brewery and we will gladly give you a tour and allow you to sample our newest selection of beers. Currently our beer is available in twelve ounce bottles to 15.5 gallon kegs. We also offer half gallon and gallon glass jugs to go. Kegs are available for rent to the public with a minimum deposit.  The name for our brewery comes from the point where Juan Rodriguez Cabrillo first set foot in California. Located on the Point Loma Peninsula, Ballast Point is considered the gateway to San Diego Harbor. Stones from this area were used as ballast in the cargo holds of sailing ships returning to the eastern seaboard. Many New England streets are still lined with the cobblestones brought back from San Diego.
name: Ballast Point Brewing Company

description: The Ballyhoo Brewing Company is a new craft brewery located on the Texas Gulf Coast. We are currently working to finish up the conceptual design of our brewery. This blog will be a place for us to document what the team is working on as we start our brewery and will eventually transition into a place for us to interact with our fans and customers with photos of the brewery’s progress, notes on exciting and upcoming brews, and news about the most exciting Gulf Coast Brewery – Ballyhoo Brewing Company.
name: Ballyhoo Brewing Company

description:
The Balmain Brewing Company was launched in 2010 in honour of tradition, mates and pub culture. The Company is owned by a group of passionate mates, locals to Balmain, with the following vision:
• Becoming Sydney’s own iconic local beer company, representing tradition, mates and pub culture
• Brewing hand-crafted quality beer
• Having the majority of pubs in Sydney pouring a Balmain Brewing Company beer
• Re-opening the old Balmain Brewery of the 1980’s as a Microbrewery/Restaurant.

The mates dreamed up the plan while drinking over the years in each of Balmain’s 17 pubs, and hearing about the Balmain Brewery of last century and the 55 pubs of the 1800’s! Over the last couple of years several beers have been launched – Balmain Pale Ale, Balmain Pilsner and Balmain Bock, as well as the recent launch of the Balmain Apple Cider. 2012 will see the introduction of a wider range of bottled beer and the planned opening of the Balmain Microbrewery/Restaurant.
name: Balmain Brewing Company

description: Baltika Brewery is the largest brewing company in Russia, leader of the Russian beer market with over 38% market share. Its full name is Limited liability company Baltika Breweries. Company headquarters is located in St Petersburg, Russia
name: Baltika Brewery

description: Our beer was first conceived in Luxembourg between founders Stephen Demczuk and Wolfgang Stark.  Stephen was in Europe doing research in molecular biology and experienced its beer culture that lead to his mid-career crisis.  He started writing about beer, and then tried to open a brewery in Arlon, Belgium but that faltered.  He then formed the first beer-of-the-month club in Europe, Beer Around the World.  Importing beer into Luxembourg, boxing it up and shipping it within the EU.  One supplier of his beers was Wolfgang Stark of Haus de 131 Biere.  Wolfgang imported beer from all over the world. He supplied Ngoma from Togo, Flame from New Zealand, and Lapin Kulta from Finland.   One day Wolfgang asked Stephen if he would like to make a beer in Germany and using an American marketing theme.  It took Stephen just a second to say yes and a day to come up with The Raven.  The new company was registered in Baltimore and the new beer was eventually produced in Nagold, Germany and called in honor of Baltimore's Edgar Allan Poe The Raven Special Lager.
name: Baltimore-Washington Beer Works

description: Bandit Brewery is a nano-brewery and the smallest brewery in Montana with a quaint tasting room in Darby, Montana just off of Hwy 93.
name: Bandit Brewery

description: The Bandwagon Brew Pub of Ithaca, NY features delicious beers brewed in small batches paired with locally and seasonally influenced dishes.
name: Bandwagon Brew Pub

description:
Our founding principle at the Banff Ave Brewing Company is to create the absolute highest quality beer possible. This guiding philosophy encompasses everything that we do. We use only the best: premium hops and malts combined with our own cultured yeast strains. Our fourth and final ingredient is the pure, natural mountain water sourced from the great Canadian Rockies. Unlike most commercial breweries, we do nothing to our water but remove the chlorine added to it. Our fresh beer is made with real glacial water and all the minerals that come with it!

The premium beers that we brew have grown from roots grounded deeply in tradition. Our dedicated Brewmaster uses time-tested recipes and brewing methods in our traditional, English-style brewery. Our hops and malts are sourced from around the world as to provide true styles with the unique twist of glacial water. This combination yields beers that are absolutely the best that they can be.

Our beers are for everyone. They are fresh, modern, and innovatively looking to the future. They are true and honest, drawing on experience from the past. We truly believe there is an occasion for every beer and a beer for every occasion.
name: Banff Ave Brewing Compay

description: Goodness is brewing…
name: Bang Brewing

description: We are a microbrewery located on Fremont Street in Downtown Las Vegas.  We feature a tap tasting room with free tours, growler fills, and beer flights
name: Banger Brewing Company

description: Brewing out of Pompano Beach, FL, created by Matt Giani and Adam Feingold. Opening in Summer 2015.
name: Bangin' Banjo Brewing Company

description: With the construction of our very own brewery in Hendricks, the sun is rising on new opportunities. Located in rural Western Minnesota, our focus will be two-fold. Our taproom that is located in an old bank building on Main Street will be full of faithful local patrons but we are also a destination brewery for the region. The new brewery brings new beer to our lineup. Ales will dominate and hops will be used to extreme proportions. This new lineup of beer will appeal to the craft beer lovers who are seeking out big, flavorful beer but of course we will have a some that appeal to the masses as well. Our brewery operations are housed in a beautiful historic creamery building and the taproom is in an old bank. Our second effort is on distribution through kegs at pubs and liquor stores in the area.
name: Bank Brewing Company

description:
Banks Breweries Ltd. is a Caribbean brewery founded in 1961 in St. Michael, Barbados. The company's main brand, the Banks Beer brand is also the flagship product of the wider Banks Holdings Limited. ("BHL Group") which owns the Banks (Barbados) Breweries Ltd. company.

The beers are available on the island of Barbados and in many other countries in the Caribbean. The brand is also sold in the United Kingdom.

Banks has recently announced an agreement with the LCBO of Canada to start exporting beers to the country as of June 1, 2009.

Shipments to the US are surpassed by more popular brands such as Budweiser and Heineken.
name: Banks Breweries Ltd

description:
Mr. Thomas Banks, a true West Midlands family man, first established Banks & Co. as a firm of maltsters in 1840, before in 1874 venturing into brewing with his son Henry and two other employees. In 1875 the company founded the now famous Park Brewery on the site of an artesian well in Wolverhampton. This site is still the home of Banks's today, with many of the buildings remaining intact, including the old chimney that can be seen on the city skyline.

Our proud history and heritage isn't confined to our buildings either, even the live strain of yeast in all Banks's cask ales has been in use for over 100 years!
name: Banks's

description: Welcome to Banner Beer Company, where big flavor and low ABV come together in American craft beer. All of our beer is under 5% ABV so you can lengthen the session and enjoy the frequency.
name: Banner Beer Company

description: Modern American Cider. We are committed to making creative and distinctive crafted cider using fresh pressed apples and high-quality, all-natural ingredients.
name: Bantam Cider

description:
New Haven's best brick oven pizza team and sexiest crew of bartenders and waitresses around.  Come for our micro-brew beers, brick oven pizza, free pool, live music, best DJs in town, and the game on the big screen. 

BAR began brewing beer in 1996
name: BAR

description: Bar Harbor Brewing Company is Bar Harbor's first microbrewery. For nearly twenty years, we've produced several gold and even platinum winning brews, all while producing only 260 barrels of bottle-conditioned beer a year. This is not just beer to drink. This is beer to be celebrated. Try any Bar Harbor brew and see what a champ tastes like. Please drink responsibly.
name: Bar Harbor Brewing Company

description:
Baranof Island Brewing Co. is owned, operated, sampled and sold by Sitkan beer lovers, Rick and Suzan. When they opened the brewery in 2010, enthusiastic townspeople drank up the supply so quickly, they immediately had to ramp up the capacity of their operations.
Now that they can keep the thirsty locals satisfied (look for BIBCo. on tap at local restaurants), they are ready to share with you their passion for really good hand-crafted beer.

Brew nerds will appreciate that every unfiltered 55-gallon batch is a combination of pure, glacier-fed Alaskan water and a blend of gourmet malts and hops, lovingly selected by master brewer, Sam.
name: Baranof Island Brewing Company

description: Bard's Beer is not only the world's first craft-brewed gluten-free beer, it's also the only beer that's brewed with 100% malted gluten-free sorghum.
name: Bards Tale Beer Company

description: Bare Bones Brewery is located on the beautiful north side of Oshkosh, just off the scenic Wiouwash Trail. With his many years of experience, the brewmaster will be brewing up delicious hand-crafted beers throughout the year. Local flavor abounds at the brewery, as the guest taps and spirits are all made in Wisconsin. Visitors can enjoy tours, tastings and monthly beer tasting bike rides (weather permitting, of course) at Bare Bones Brewery. If you are hungry, the brewery offers food, such as pizzas and pretzels, or, if you choose, you can carry-in or have something delivered.
name: Bare Bones Brewery

description: Our story is simple: we are passionate about great beer and we want to share it with others. Handcrafted in small batches with the highest quality ingredients, you can (currently) only get this beer right here in the pub. Welcome, enjoy, and please come back soon.
name: Bare Hands Brewery

description:
Over the course of five years of entering and judging beer competitions, we noticed a simple, but largely unrecognized insight: the best, most innovative beers in America are being brewed by homebrewers. In almost every competition we judged, the award-winning homebrewed beers were more inventive and daring than the majority of commercially available beers on the market. That insight, along with an enduring passion for the craft of beer making, led us to create the Barebottle, a San Francisco crowd-inspired craft brewery.

Our philosophy and process is pretty simple:
1) Use the things that inspire us every day from the SF/Bay Area as the foundation for each new beer we make.

2) Inspire our merry band of super-talented homebrewing experts (which includes our head brewer, the founders, and some of the bay area’s best homebrewers) to create new beers.

3) Just like in regular competitions, we pilot-brew a select group of the best finalist beers and ask visitors to the brewery to cast their vote for their favorite beer. May the best beer always win.

We believe that this approach will lead to some incredible beers, and we hope you are eager to help us try some of them.- Ben, Lester, and Mike
name: Barebottle Brewing Company

description: A small craft brewery located in Thurgau, Switzerland
name: Barfuss Brauerei

description: Barhop Brewing: Like many native Californians, Tom struggled with the all the rain in the northwest until he figured out what to do with it: start fermenting it! And so Barhop Brewing was born. On brew days, you can hear Tom brewing to the tunes of Pearl Jam, Bob Marley, The Grateful Dead, Led Zepplin, and so on. Tom’s California beer-drinking youth provided him with a strong affinity for the pioneers of micro-brewing, back when Sierra Nevada, Pete’s Wicked, and Mendocino Brewing were small craft brewers. Decades of drinking beer – and specifically micro-brews – have contributed to Tom’s brewing pedigree. (Or so he says.) Currently he is a big fan of Elysian and Russian River Brewing, and these companies have influenced his brewing style which he calls “aggressive California-style ales, with a Northwest twist, using fresh Northwest ingredients”.
name: Barhop Brewing

description: BarkEater Craft Brewery, LLC is located near the Adirondack Mountains and is a nano farm brewery offering small batch, hand-crafted ales brewed on location and served in our relaxing taproom. Taproom is open every Wednesday - Saturday from 3-9PM. Live acoustic music every Thursday 6-9PM
name: BarkEater Craft Brewery

description: Stake your claim.
name: Barkerville Brewing

description:
When the same old thing just won’t do, head to Barley & Hops! You’ll find great beer brewed the old-fashioned way, award-winning  food, and a friendly atmosphere you don’t get in those cookie-cutter restaurants. Conveniently located in Frederick, Maryland at the interchange of I-70 and I-270, Barley and Hops is just a short Drive from Baltimore, Washington, and the surrounding tri-state area.

Whether you are shopping at the mall or antiquing in our historic downtown, Barley and Hops provides the perfect break for lunch, entertaining guests, or an unforgettable evening dinner. Also a great place to take in the game, learn about the art of brewing, or meet new friends. From the large screen TV to the glass enclosed working brewery, there is always something to do or see. 

Open Sunday, 11:00 a.m. ’til 10:00 p.m; Monday through Thursday, 11:00 a.m. ’til 11:00 p.m.; and Friday and Saturday, 11:00 a.m. ’til midnight. Call ahead of your visit at 301-668-5555 to check on seating availability.
name: Barley and Hops Grill & Microbrewery

description:
Since 2003, family and friends have come to know that initials on the bottle caps along with names of classic cars designate beers from the Barley and Vine Brewery.   Barley and Vine is becoming known for great quality ales, and at times going to extremes to provide the very best in beer.

From the first batch of beer, Rambler Red, brewing was destined for the garage or outdoors because of the huge mess and bad smell made in the kitchen. So, for the first four years Barley and Vine was making 5-gallon extract batches.  Barley and Vine began sharing the beers with friends and family looking for input and making corrections and changes when needed.  As time went by the brewing skill level and quality of the beer continued to improve.   Changing from 5-gallon extract batched to 10 gallon all-grain batches made a huge difference in the quality of the final product.

Barley and Vine is a nano brewery in the planning.  As we continue to build our business plan, determine a location, and perfect our recipes and processes we will do our best to keep people up to speed through this website, Facebook, and our blog.  The ultimate dream is to have a brewery and a brewpub.
name: Barley and Vine Brewery

description:
Barley Brothers restaurant and brewery is an upscale-casual eatery known for its extensive menu, great music, and award winning draft beer. From classic lagers to more obscure ales and stouts there's a draft beer flavor for everyone. Our American cuisine menu includes an impressive selection of appetizers, salads, pastas, sandwiches, wood fired pizzas, ribs and rotisserie chicken. Barley Brothers plays America’s favorite - classic rock and an abundance of flat screens showcase the day's sports and special events.

Barley Brothers is part of the Shugrues Restaurant and Brewery Group. Restaurants are located Lake Havasu City, and Sedona Arizona.

There is something for everyone at the Barley Brothers.
name: Barley Brothers Restaurant & Brewery

description: Small batch hand-crafted beer, good food, good company, good times...
name: Barley Brown's

description: Located in Tannersville, right off route 80's exit 299 in between the Crossings Outlet Stores and Camelback Ski area (Camelbeach Water Park, Barley Creek is the Pocono Mountains' Original Brewpub and Restaurant, where you can always find great food, freshly brewed beer, a comfortable atmosphere, friendly people, and a unique place to kick back, relax and have a great time. Bring your friends, bring your family, bring your friends' families. We are open every day at 11:01am, and serve dinner till about 10pm. On Friday and Saturday we are serving dinner till about 11:00pm. The bar stays open a little longer (so you can finish your fun if you ordered food just before the kitchen closed) Cheers!
name: Barley Creek Brewing Company

description: Known for its tasty, popular, and satisfying brews, Barley Days Brewery’s focus is quite simple: to craft excellent beers without compromise. Barley Days Brewery’s balanced and interesting product line represents classic brewing styles that use only the finest malts and hops, brewed in small batch sizes to insure quality.
name: Barley Days Brewery

description: Barley Forge Brewing creates robust, unique, and tasty beers inspired by the cultural melting pot of southern California.
name: Barley Forge Brewing Co.

description: Barley Island’s national award winning handcrafted ales produced on-premise with only the finest malts and hops. Being independently owned and operated has its advantages. We can quickly implement new food trends or even beer flavors to suit our local clientele.
name: Barley Island Brewing Company

description:
The BMBC is a nanobrewery and tavern in downtown Largo, FL. For all the non-Floridians out there, Largo is located in Pinellas County just north of St Petersburg. We have a 2 BBL system, which means we're able to produce about 4 kegs at a time. We started out with 3-80 gallon fermenters and have already added a 4th, 3 BBL fermenter!
Our tavern has 14 constantly rotating taps. We try to keep a many of our own beers on tap at all times, when we can't fill them, the rest are reserved for only American brews, most of which are Florida born. We also have an awesome wine list.
name: Barley Mow Brewing Company

description:
Welcome to the Barley Station Brew Pub...come enjoy our fine food and some of the best beer found anywhere.

Our head brewer uses recipes created exclusively for us using the finest ingredients available. We start with water that has been purified by our in-house reverse osmosis system and then add the right amount of minerals specific to each style beer. This water is combined with the finest malted grain from Europe and North America.

The addition of hops chosen for their aroma and bitterness and the best yeast for each style of beer all mean that you can now enjoy a variety of tastes in beers that will tempt you to try them all. During the year we will introduce some very special limited edition beers that will be on tap for a short time only. Be sure to ask your server for these seasonal beers when available.

All of our beers are made in house using the best ingredients available. We don't filter or add any preservatives to our beer. By drinking our beers you are greatly reducing the impact on the environment. Our beer only has to travel 50 ft. to get to your table, so feel good about doing your part to save the world one beer at a time. Relax and Enjoy Our Beer!
name: Barley Station Brewpub

description: The oldest brewpub in the area, opening in 1992. Award-winning craft ales alongside hearty, satisfying pub cuisine. Ale! Ale! The Gang's All Here!
name: Barley's Brewing Company

description: "Barnaul Brewery" - a modern and powerful enterprise producing the market only natural products: more than 25 varieties of beer, brew drinks and iced tea, which are presented in Siberia, the Urals and Central region.
name: Barnaul Brewery

description: Barnett & Son Brewing Co. is a small craft brewery in Parker, Colorado. We make fine handcrafted ales, serving pints in the tasting room and filling growlers to go.
name: Barnett & Son Brewing Co.

description:
We are a small brewery that focuses on making great beer for our local community.  We make every effort to use locally grown ingredients from our home grown hops to fruit and honey from our local farmers. 

Barnhouse Brewery opened in October 2012 and operated for two years steadily growing a loyal following of folks that enjoyed our easy drinking beers. We use fresh ingredients  (locally sourced when available) and traditional processes to bring you truly hand crafted beers.

Last year we moved the operation to an 18 acre property and are currently working to reopen the brewery by the end of the year.  We will be starting back up on our original 2 barrel system while our new 7 barrel system is being manufactured.  We expect delivery of the new system by early spring.
The new location will give us the opportunity to grow ingredients on site for use in the brewery and to provide our customers with that “rural“ atmosphere that keeps our customers coming back time and again.

Come by when we are open for a tasting, a pint or two, or a growler fill!
www.barnhousebrewery.com
name: Barnhouse Brewery

description: We are Barrie's only brew pub producing great local craft beer with all natural ingredients. Our menu includes a mix of artisan pizzas, salads, pastas, wings, and hot sandwiches. Stop in today for a pint!
name: Barnstormer Brewing & Pizzeria

description: Mike Baker and Jeff Smiley founded Baron Brewing in the beginning of 2003. A brewery has been in the works for sometime. Lots of discussions on what if we had a brewery were had, over lots of good German beer. The opportunity came for us to travel to Germany to really get involved with the German brewing process and ideology - as well as sample the best beer on earth. After that trip, the direction of the brewery was set. German beer had to be re-discovered by the population. After many discussions on opening a brewery and a trip to Germany, the dream became reality. We found an existing brewery to purchase - Lunar Brewing. After purchasing Lunar and getting approved for all the necessary licensing, Baron is ready to go. On June 14th, the world of Seattle will have the chance to finally taste and purchase Baron Beer. The first style of many to be released is our flagship beer - Munich Lager.That is all for the history. We are growing on a daily basis and plan to be around for quite some time.
name: Baron Brewing Company

description:
Barrage Brewing Company is a 1 BBL capacity Brewery, but soon to become a 3 BBL Brewery. The Brewery was Started in 2010 with it's roots in Nassau County. Distribution will only be through out the Long Island and Manhattan areas. 

Quality Brewed Craft Beers for the common person as well as the Beer Connoisseur.
name: Barrage Brewing Company

description: We at Barrel Harbor Brewing are passionate about brewing craft beers that are simply exceptional. We draw inspiration from our home brewing roots and the vibrant Vista, California brew culture. Using only the finest ingredients available, our Brewmaster draws from a decade of experience to deliver a variety of hand crafted beers. Barrel Harbor represents old world antiquity and celebrates centuries of quality brewing, so sail in and enjoy complex, flavorful beers that are sure to satisfy.
name: Barrel Harbor Brewing

description: Established as a brewpub in 1995 in the historic Over-The-Rhine neighborhood of Cincinnati, The BarrelHouse Brewing Company has since transitioned into a regionally distributed microbrewery offering an impressive selection of both innovative styles of ales and traditional lagers. Brewed and bottled in small batches with only honest ingredients, BarrelHouse beers are extremely fresh and exceptionally flavorful. Thank you for embracing our fiercely independent vision of a hand-crafted future for all! Operating as a brewpub from August 1995 until February 2005, The BarrelHouse Brewing Company recently relocated to our current location in the West End of downtown Cincinnati. We officially reopened with a completed expansion plan in April 2005. Our expansion included almost doubling our fermentation capacity as well as the addition of a brand new bottling line. Our first order of bottled beer hit Ohio area stores in June 2006 and we have subsequently begun to enter markets that were previously unavailable. The BarrelHouse Brewing Company brews on a 15 BBL brewhouse manufactured by Century. One BBL equals 31 gallons therefore; our beers are hand-crafted in 465 gallon batches. Our ales are ready after approximately fourteen days while our lagers are conditioned for upwards of six weeks. By brewing in small batches, our brewers are able to achieve an optimal level of quality control while creating a consistently flavorful product. While our brewing process is quite labor intensive, we believe that hand-crafting our beers sets us apart from the majority of breweries in the U.S. today. Our dedication is unparalleled and quite evident in the final packaged product.
name: Barrel House Brewing Company

description:
We love Belgian beer! We proudly brew Belgian inspired ales to bring the taste of the old world a little closer to home at our production brewery in Boca Raton, FL.

We use the finest equipment and ingredients and combine that with a deep understanding and love of Belgian ales to create finely crafted ales that pay homage to the great beers made in Belgium.

Our beers are created for those who are willing to take the time to truly appreciate the look, aroma, taste, and overall experience of a fine ale. We will not compromise the quality of our products by taking shortcuts or using inferior ingredients in the effort to make money, and we believe that quality of the beer is the number one goal
name: Barrel of Monks Brewing

description:
Barrel Trolley Beer harkens back to the days of secret handshakes and a flourishing underground world. During the days of prohibition when revelers crowded into hidden saloons, getting a beer was a clandestine process — the result of sharing a discreet password or speaking softly to avoid detection. Bootleggers flourished as they stealthily transported the prized cargo to thirsty revelers!
 
Using a seamless network of tracks, the covert trolley system of the 1920s was a bootleggers dream. This transport system was the ticket to an American revolution and the revolt against Prohibition. As the trolley’s connected underground speakeasies, mobsters teamed with bootleggers to distribute barrels of their precious brew. In a tribute to those brave soldiers of salvation, we bring you Barrel Trolley Pale Ale, Amber Ale, IPA, Nut Brown Ale and Belgian White Ale.
name: Barrel Trolley Brewing

description:
Barrelhouse Brewing Co. is nestled in the rolling hills of San Luis Obispo County on the edge of Paso Robles and in the heart of wine country…what will our neighbors think?

As you turn off Ramada Drive and onto Marquita Way, you will meander around a majestic oak tree.  This majestic white oak stands in the middle of where the road would have gone, if not for this tree’s historical significance.  If you look closely at the trunk of this old oak, you will notice the mark of an equal armed cross carved into its bark. The cross was carved sometime between 1775 and 1776 when Spanish Lt. Colonel Juan Batista de Anza led more than 240 men, women and children on an overland journey from the frontier New Spain to settle in Alta California. During that 1,200 mile journey, the very thirsty Colonel carved the cross to signify the perfect location for a brewery…well, that’s our story at Barrelhouse and we can’t exactly prove it, but we’re sticking to it!  Historians believe that Juan Batista de Anza or someone on his team carved the cross to indicate a safe place to camp.  We think it makes a sweet logo, too!

After you pass the old oak, make a left on Limestone Way and look for the dragon fly…you can’t miss it. 

Stop by, grab a brew or two and relax.  Enjoy our glorious beer gardens with friends while you listen to the waterfall and experience the central coast the way it was meant to be enjoyed…outside.  You can also pull up to the bar inside the brewery where you’ll feel like you’re part of the brewing action. Along with our amazing line-up of beers, we will also feature our very own custom crafted rootbeers.  If you ask nicely, we can even float a scoop of ice cream in your favorite sarsaparilla or stout.
name: BarrelHouse Brewing Company

description:
Barrels and Bottles is a nanobrewery that offers craft beer, wines and tapas in Golden, CO.

22 beers on tap
24 wines on tap
Colorado's 1st Fusion Tower
Wine Slushies
Delicious fresh food
name: Barrels & Bottles Brewery

description: A brewpub in Lafayette Hill, PA with 30 drafts featuring on average of 10 house beers along with a selection of the best craft & imported beers
name: Barren Hill Tavern & Brewery

description:
Barrier Brewing Co. is a 1bbl brewery operated by Evan Klein and Craig Frymark located in Oceanside, NY. The focus is small scale production of a breadth of styles and flavors brewed for the local market. The first batches were released to the public in June 2010.

"Brewing For Quality Not Quantity"
name: Barrier Brewing Company

description:
Welcome to the homepage of the Barrington Brewery & Restaurant. Our casual dining atmosphere is located at 420 Stockbridge Road (Route 7) in the Jenifer House Commons, Great Barrington, Massachusetts. We offer the freshest, handcrafted food and beer made right here.

Since 1995 the Barrington Brewery has been serving our own Barn Brewed Beer and food made from scratch and we were the first brewery on the east coast to install a solar panel system that supplies solar-heated hot water for brewing and restaurant use.
name: Barrington Brewery and Restaurant

description: We are proudly located at the corner of Toole and 16th St. Come on down and try any or all of our fresh microbrews, we have up to 12 on tap for all of your drinking pleasure. Combine the beer with our food, and you’ll have the recipe for a great night.
name: Barrio Brewing Company

description:
Our brewery, produced by DME Engineering from Prince Edward Island, Canada, consists of a 15 barrel system (465 gallons per brew) and has a fermentation capacity of 135 barrels.

Ice-cold beer is served from ten 15 barrel serving vessels located behind our main bar.

You can also buy our brew to enjoy at home!  Purchase party pigs(2.25 gallons), growlers (64 oz.) or 1/4 and 1/2 barrels for your next party or event.
name: Barts Tap Room & Brewery

description: Base Camp Brewing Company is the result of brewmaster Justin Fay’s determined vision and years of hard work.  His and brewer Paul Thurston’s combined decades of professional brewing experience are evident in each of Base Camp’s recipes.  Each of our beers have been crafted with an eye toward innovation and creativity as well as consistency and balance, making for awesome brewskies that are at once approachable for any beer drinker and satisfying for the most adventure-minded palate.
name: Base Camp Brewing Company

description: Basket Case Brewing Company is a nanobrewery in Jasper, IN. We are located in The Mill House Restaurant where we make and sell our beer.
name: Basket Case Brewing Company

description: The Bass Brewery was founded as a brewery in 1777 by William Bass in Burton upon Trent, England. The main brand was Bass Pale Ale. The company became one of the main breweries in the UK, and Bass Pale Ale was exported throughout the British Empire, the distinctive red triangle becoming the UK's first registered trademark.
name: Bass Brewery

description: Bastone first opened its doors in May of 2004. It is named and styled after the famous Belgian city (though the spelling has been simplified). This unique restaurant and brewery is housed in a 1930’s era building, the exterior of which has been restored to it’s original art deco look in association with the State of Michigan Historical Society. Inside, the high arched ceiling, wood floors and white subway wall tiles create the comfortable yet sophisticated atmosphere of a European brasserie.
name: Bastone Brewery

description: Bastrop's First Brewpub!
name: Bastrop Brewhouse

description:
Bat Creek Brewery is a small craft brewery committed to quality beer and exceptional experiences. If you haven’t sampled our beer, we urge you to give them a try. Check out the events page to see where we will be next.

We hope to see you around. Check back soon to see when our tasting room will be open at the brewery. “Good Beer, Good Times.”
name: Bat Creek Brewery

description: Small batch, handcrafted beer in Detroit. Also to feature brew-on-premise, guest brewers, and events that bring some of the city's creative minds together celebrating art, music, and beer.
name: Batch Brewing Company

description:
Batch Brewing Company brews beer the traditional way, hand crafted and batch by batch. We brew for you Sydney.

Hi there, we're Chris and Andrew and if you're reading this, you're probably a friend, a friend of a friend, or family. We aim to deliver to you small batches of hand crafted beer with a unique flavour, specially brewed for you.
name: Batch Brewing Company

description:
Bath Ales is an independent brewery, established all the way back in 1995. OK, that doesn’t sound like such a long time, but so much has happened in the 20 years since we started.

Our founders all come from a brewing background and share a passion for craft ale. Never a company to stand still, we've grown steadily and our brewery is now complemented by a bottling plant, a brewery shop, and a thriving estate of pubs in the West of England.

Our brewery is conveniently situated between Bath and Bristol in Warmley. Here, cutting edge technology – including our highly efficient steam-driven brewing plant – blends with our brewers' skill and patience, and the use of time-honoured brewing techniques.
name: Bath Ales

description: Battenkill, or the Battenkill River, is a 50-mile river rising in Vermont that flows into New York and is a tributary of the Hudson River. The “Battenkill” barn that houses our brewery in Poulsbo, Washington is reminiscent of the Yankee Style barns that have been built throughout the Battenkill Valley and is the perfect size for either a small craft brewery or dairy milking house. We chose the brewery!
name: Battenkill Brewing Company

description: Little Brewery, Big Beer
name: Battered Boar Brewing Company

description:
Let’s face it. Most beer is pretty damn good.

Sure, we’ll argue about which one we think is best.  But in the grand scheme of things, how much better can you make something that should only have about four ingredients?

That’s the way we see it anyway.

People who only want the best beer will always be looking for it.  We’d rather just sell good beer to people who believe what we believe.

Battle Born personifies those beliefs.

So while everyone else tries to invent the next pumpkin nut brown ale, we figure we’d keep it simple and build a great brand.

After all, it’s just beer.
name: Battle Born Beer Company

description: We strive to make Ales, Porter and Beer of the highest quality for our Commonwealth of Massachusetts, our home and place of business. Our primary criteria for our beer is that we apply our combined 36 years of Professional Brewing Expertise, painstakingly select the Finest Ingredients, and Insure that they arrive in your glass in Prime Condition.
name: Battle Road Brewing Company

description: Brewpub located in historic Gettysburg, PA. Housed in a barn/former field hospital from the Civil War.
name: Battlefield Brew Works

description: Fredericksburg’s first Brewpub - The Pub Restaurant Pub logo has been serving the area’s best food and drinks for 15 years. We offer some of the best food in Fredericksburg at prices that can’t be matched. Our ½ lb. burgers are the best in town and our secret spiced shrimp is enticing! With over 100 items on our menu you can’t go wrong. Kids menu and carry out available. We have a full service bar serving premium liquors and wine. We also have 16 beers on tap including 5 from our own microbrewery.
name: Battlefield Brewing Co

description: We are a grassroots beer company in the Atlanta area who is dedicated to delivering quality ales to the southeast region.  Our mission is simple – bring you great beer that you can enjoy after all your day’s battles as a reward to yourself and your friends.
name: BattleGreen Beer Co.

description: Awarded brewpub with 3.000 hl production, many differend beer styles ranging from traditional german beer styles to belgian and british ales as well as barrel aged beers.
name: Batzen Bräu

description: Bauhaus Brew Labs is a family of musicians, scientists, artists and above all, beer lovers, aiming to reinvigorate the spirit of the family brewery. At Bauhaus, we take a unique look at classic German-inspired beer styles, skewed slightly by a sense of play and adventure. Our flavor-forward, sessionable beers are crafted to surprise and delight without taxing the palate.
name: Bauhaus Brew Labs

description: Fundada en abril de 1889 CervecerÃ?Â­a Ã?Âguila tiene una capacidad de producciÃ?Â³n de 3.234.000 hectolitros de cerveza al aÃ?Â±o, con los cuales atiende los departamentos del Sucre, Magdalena, AtlÃ?Â¡ntico, BolÃ?Â­var, Guajira, Cesar y la Isla de San AndrÃ?Â©s. Produce y distribuye las marcas Ã?Âguila, Club Colombia, CosteÃ?Â±ita, ademÃ?Â¡s de cerveza en barril; Agua Brisa en diferentes presentaciones y Pony Malta. Esta planta tiene su origen en la CervecerÃ?Â­a Barranquilla que empieza operaciones el 10 de abril de 1913 y aÃ?Â±os mÃ?Â¡s tarde, en 1933, se une a la CervecerÃ?Â­a BolÃ?Â­var, convirtiÃ?Â©ndose en la CervecerÃ?Â­a Barranquilla y BolÃ?Â­var S.A. El 3 de marzo de 1967 la compaÃ?Â±Ã?Â­a tomÃ?Â³ el nombre de CervecerÃ?Â­a Ã?Âguila S.A. En diciembre de 2002 se fusionÃ?Â³ con Bavaria S.A. convirtiÃ?Â©ndose en una planta estratÃ?Â©gica para el proceso de exportaciones de la compaÃ?Â±Ã?Â­a. Desde octubre de 2005, Bavaria es parte de SABMiller, segunda cervecera mundial en volumen, con operaciones en cuatro continentes y una producciÃ?Â³n que supera los 170 millones de hectolitros de cerveza anuales en mÃ?Â¡s de 170 marcas.
name: Bavaria

description: Bavarian Barbarian Brewing Company is Williamsport's first production brewery since the 1950's. The brewery, which occupies 9,000 square feet at 429 W. 3rd St in Williamsport, Pennsylvania, was founded by Mike Hiller in July 2007.  Though a native of South Williamsport, Barbarian Chief, Mike Hiller, first entered the craft brewing industry in 1997 as an Account Services Associate for Legendary Distributors, Ltd., of Richmond, Virginia. After nearly a year of distributing beer, an opportunity arose for Mike to work as a brewer for Legend Brewing Company. Mike worked with five other brewers to perform duties at all levels of production including brewing, cellar work, cleaning and maintenance.  After nearly four years of service at Legend Brewing Company, Mike moved to Boston, MA, so his wife, Kira, could attend grad school. Tired of listening to him whine about how much he missed brewing, Kira gave him a home brewing kit as an anniversary gift. Mike began brewing whenever he could find the time. He developed the recipes for Hammerin' Ale, Headbangerz Brown Ale, Square Feet Wheat, Weldspatter I.P.A. and several other beers in five-gallon batches on his apartment's balcony.  Mike was also commissioned by friends and co-workers to brew beer for special occasions.  In fact, Square Feet Wheat was actually first brewed for an art gallery opening featuring works by the Barbarian's logo and label designer, Erick Thomas.  After reading Brewing Up a Business: Adventures in Entrepreneurship by Sam Calagione of Dogfish Head Brewery fame, Mike was inspired to start his own brewery. He spent eight months researching and writing a business plan. Another year was spent gathering support and revising his business plans. Thanks to the support of family, friends and other area businessmen who believed in Mike's dream, Bavarian Barbarian Brewing Company is now a reality.
name: Bavarian Barbarian Brewing Company

description:
Baxter Brewing Company is the first craft brewery in New England to can its entire line of beers. Located in the historic Bates Mill in Lewiston, Maine, Baxter beers are currently distributed throughout the state of Maine.

Founded by company President & CEO Luke Livingston (who is joined by Director of Brewing Operations/Head Brewer Michael LaCharite), Baxter Brewing Co., LLC is the first craft brewery in New England to can its entire line of beers. Located in the historic Bates Mill in Lewiston, Maine, Baxter beers are currently distributed throughout the state of Maine and are expected across the rest of northern New England in the summer of 2011. For more information, please visit www.baxterbrewing.com.
name: Baxter Brewing Company

description: Chula Vista's First Micro Brewery since 2007
name: Bay Bridge Brewing

description: Three guys with over 70 years of brewing knowledge getting together to make Beer better. Chip, Conor and Shawn are gearing up to start full production of Bay State Beer Co. We currently are brewing small runs in a Massachusetts basement brewery in Sturleicesterville, MA and plan to have product available in keg and 6 pk this coming April. We will keep you updated as we go! Great Beer should be interesting, inviting and refreshing - both distinctive and drinkable. Our mission is to make Great Beer!
name: Bay State Brewing

description: The Bavarian State Brewery Weihenstephan, founded in 1040, is the oldest existing brewery in the world. As directed by operation of Bavaria it is run as a modern company, which brews beers of the highest quality and successfully sells worldwide in over 40 countries. The unique combination of tradition and science gives the brewer the quality standard "premium bavaricum" and national and international awards for their "Weihenstephan beers."
name: Bayerische Staatsbrauerei Weihenstephan

description: Bayern Brewing began in Missoula, Montana, in 1987. We are proud to be the only German brewery in the Rocky Mountains. Owner and Brewmaster, Jürgen Knöller, is a German Diploma Master Brewer. He began brewing in 1978 at age 16. The education that he received in Germany was a rigorous and lengthy one. It took eight years to advance from apprentice to journeyman to Master brewer. He focuses on quality and is truly dedicated to his profession. Combine his education, experience and personal dedication and you have amazing beer.
name: Bayern Brewing

description: Bayhawk Ales, Orange County's largest microbrewery, began operation in late 1994 with our first beer being poured in February '95. We are a public corporation with over 1000 local and out of state stockholders. Bayhawk specializes in brewing House Beers for many fine restaurants and taverns throughout California, Arizona, Nevada, Oregon, and Washington. We just might be the Greatest Beer You Never Knew You Drank!
name: Bayhawk Ales

description:
Baying Hound Aleworks is a small independent nano-brewery in Rockville, Maryland. The brewery produces small batch beers and uses only the highest quality ingredients.

Our beers are unpasteurized and contain no additives or preservatives. Instead of forcing carbonation, Baying Hound ales undergo a secondary fermentation and are conditioned under a controlled environment.
name: Baying Hound Aleworks

description: Bayne Brewing Company is a local family owned beer brewery serving the Lake Norman area. We specialize in high quality craft beer using fresh, high quality ingredients. We will brew on a 2 BBL brew system, taking hand crafted beers to the next level. Cheers!
name: Bayne Brewing Company, LLC

description: Bayou Teche Brewing was founded on this simple dream – to craft beers that compliment the cuisine and lifestyle of Cajuns and Creoles.
name: Bayou Teche Brewery

description:
Welcome to Bays Brewery and its wide range of quality Beers, Ciders and Real Tasty Drinks (RTD’s). In landing on this page you have proved to have a passion for true hand crafted beverages and we thank you. Bays has a long history of making quality products dating back to 1993. Located in the Sunshine Capital of New Zealand, Bays make some of finest beer around. Step into Bays Brewery and experience a piece of Nelson, New Zealand. If it is fun you seek, you have found it here. Kia Ora.

Cheers from the Crew at Bays Brewery!
name: Bays Brewery

description: Bluegrass Brewing Co is proud to be the largest microbrewery located in the state of Kentucky. Reaching back over one hundred years, the city of Louisville has a rich and complex brewing history; a history that has provided BBC with a strong foundation on which to build and grow. It is a challenge we enthusiastically look forward to everyday. Led by our fearless brew master David Pierce who has been brewing award winning BBC beers for over fourteen years, our brewing philosophy is an audacious style that allows us to work diligently with the entire palette of malts and hops. This diligence and discipline is carefully brought to every batch that is brewed at Bluegrass Brewing Co. To truly enjoy life you have to love what you doÃ¯Â¿Â½and we love brewing. Our sole focus relies on consistency and producing the best beer available. We hope that you will taste that bold style in every BBC beer that you drink. Enjoy great craft beer wherever you live and remember this most important piece of advice: Don't Buy Beer From Strangers . . . Support Your Local Brewery!
name: BBC Brewing Co., LLC

description:
A Beancurdturtle Brewing LLC project. 
Making beer - nothing fancy, something special. BCT Brewing Project is a conduit with the right elements, knobs, dials, fidgets, and widgets to meet the legal and regulatory requirements to deliver beer architected and brewed by Daniel Fernandez of Beancurdturtle Brewing LLC to folks who enjoy good beer.
name: BCT Brewing Project

description:
The Beach Chalet Brewery & Restaurant is located above the Golden Gate Park Visitor's Center which features the amazing and historic WPA frescoes created by Lucien Labaudt in the 1930's. The artwork captures the flavor of San Francisco in that era in a style of the Arts and Crafts movement – a must see for fans of the style and for anyone who wants a taste of the strange and incredible period in which the WPA allowed art projects like this to exist during such hard times.

Upstairs you will find the Beach Chalet Brewery & Restaurant. It was developed by Gar and Lara Truppelli and Timon Malloy in 1997 after the Chalet had sat vacant for 17 years. To remodel and restore this historic building to its former glory so it could be a landmark to be enjoyed by future generations as well as to create a space for their restaurateurs’ dreams, they brought Heller Manus Architects onboard to help make their dreams a reality.

Today thousands of guests enjoy the Modern American Cuisine menu and hand crafted ales. The Beach Chalet offers a full bar, abundant free parking and a breathtaking ocean view. Bay Area residents and visitors find the Beach Chalet to be a wonderful San Francisco experience while visiting Golden Gate Park and Ocean Beach. Join us and find out why the Beach Chalet is your kind of place.
name: Beach Chalet Brewery and Restaurant

description: The Beach City Brewery team is  proud to be located in Orange County.  Our flagship beers were created with the characteristics of Surf City in mind and seasonal offerings will reflect and represent all of OC.  Being immediately accepted and brought into the Craft Beer community by its brewers was both humbling and a privilege.  Come and enjoy a beer with our team at the Tasting Room soon!
name: Beach City Brewery

description:
Established in 2007, Belmar, New Jersey based Beach Haus Brewery was founded by passionate individuals with a belief that the great American traditions of creativity, diversity, and accessibility apply equally to building a great beer company. 

Originally founded out of the co-founders garage, Beach Haus beers are now proudly brewed out of Belmar, NJ since December 2014.
name: Beach Haus Brewery

description:
At Beachwood BBQ & Brewing we take craft beer very seriously. As downtown Long Beach’s only independent craft brewery, we strive to make sure our passion for craft beer shines through with every sip.

Our award-winning Brewmaster, Julian Shrago, spends countless hours perfecting each recipe, researching new ones, and pushing the boundaries of craft beer brewing today. Our general philosophy on brewing is to always think of flavor first. No matter how creative you want to be, beer, much like food, must taste good (or hopefully outstanding).

We brew a wide variety of American styles, as well as some traditional British, German, and Belgian-style beers. Having a large variety of beers keeps customers excited and creates a sense of adventure associated with the brand. It also allows us to have unlimited creative freedom, and that always keeps things fresh. Cheers!
name: Beachwood BBQ & Brewing

description: Beachy Head beers are made with simple, traditional ingredients to guarantee the rich, nuanced flavours of real ale. Our dedication to quality and tradition has already earned our young brewery a number of awards.
name: Beachy Head Brewery

description: 1911 Hard Ciders are made from apples grown on our land in Upstate New York and fermented on the same property. Their delicious taste comes from our famous apple cider. Scroll down to learn more about each of our 5 delicious flavors.
name: Beak & Skiff Apple Orchards

description:
Bear Creek Brews has been a dream for over 30 years. Ever since the beginnings of the American Beer Renaissance, I have wanted to brew my own great tasting beer and make it available to the beer drinking public and help people learn about and appreciate beer. Coming from Oshkosh, Wisconsin, beer brewing is in my veins.

Twelve years ago my wonderful wife bought me the "everything but the kitchen sink" homebrew kit and it all started. After a few extract brew sessions, I built a 15 gallon brew sculpture and graduated to all-grain brewing, and things really got serious. Now after over 200 brews, BCB is in business!

The brewery is small, we call it a Nano-Brewery, we are hidden in the middle of 38 acres of woods in the heart of North Carolina. Most everything is recycled or made in-house. The Brew-House is an old 20' steel cargo container, the Beer-Garden brew patio is recycled flagstone and granite, nestled under spreading oaks and pines, our cooling water is stored rain water from a cistern, the chickens just love the spent mash. All the ingredients are as fresh as possible, some are even home grown. American malts, hops, and yeast are the mainstay of our beers. The water is from our 450' well and is just as pure and clean as can be. Our small batch brewing lets us assure you that each keg or bottle of beer will be as fresh and wonderful as though we were brewing it for ourselves to drink.
name: Bear Creek Brews
