description: We came together with a passion to create the beers we want to drink, to maximize the pleasure of a good beer buzz. That warm feeling that comes from a well-deserved beer in good company; we liken this to having a hug.
name: Bear Hug Brewing

description: Boise's Biggest Little Brewery!  Veteran Owned and Local Family Run, we make our brews UNfiltered, UNconventional and UNmatched.  Cheers!
name: Bear Island Brewing Company

description: Bear Republic's brews are hand-crafted using traditional brewing methods. We hand select only the choicest ingredients for each batch. The specialty grains and hops used by Bear Republic have been chosen for their unique characteristics. The recipes and their final formulations were developed over a period of several years. Those wonderful homebrewing sessions and the lessons learned from trial and error have established the solid foundations for each recipe's commercial equivalents. It's our goal to continually develop new recipes using our time tested home brewing methods. "I feel home brewing is the laboratory where true advancement of beer styles is coming from. "Richard G. Norgrove, Brewmaster
name: Bear Republic Brewing Company

description:
What we love: Ireland. New England. Beer.
 
Beara Irish Brewing Co. is an Irish brewery located in Portsmouth, NH. We are producing fine craft brews with genuine imported Irish Barley Malt for the discerning public. Other ingredients are locally sourced as much as possible: Water, grains, hops and yeast - no junk.
 
We cannot accept current offerings of watered-down mass-produced beer, so we intend to do something about it.
 
Join us at our new location for a flight or pint. Growlers, 22oz. bottles, and gift cards available.
name: Beara Irish Brewing Co.

description: Beard and Brau Farmhouse Brewery produces fine quality beers with no artificial additions. We are passionate about making eco friendly sustainable beer.
name: Beard & Brau

description: Bearded Iris Brewing, named not only for the state flower of Tennessee but also in tribute to the melding of art & science that has produced thousands of wholly unique cultivars of iris, focuses on blending old world brewing styles and techniques with artistic imagination and innovation. Employing poly-strain fermentation techniques, featuring a robust barrel-aging program and a taproom reminiscent of a Prohibition-era speakeasy, Bearded Iris Brewing distinguishes itself from other local breweries by inspiring  and rallying its city—a city where the energy of craftsmanship  and entrepreneurism is electric—toward a new, revolutionary movement in Nashville beer.
name: Bearded Iris Brewing

description: At Beards Brewery, we are devoted to making great beer. Stop by to watch us brew and enjoy a pint or two.
name: Beards Brewery

description: Drew Cluley, an award-winning master brewer, brings 20 years of extensive craft brewing experience to Beardslee Public House. Drew began his brewing career in Seattle at Pyramid Brewing Company when it opened in 1995. Following a stint as a brewery consultant in Nagano, Japan, Drew returned to the states and worked at Pyramid Alehouse and Big Time Brewery. He eventually became Pike Brewing Company’s assistant head brewer in 2000 when his first commercially produced recipe was released, and became Pike’s head brewer and production manager in 2006. In 2011, Drew returned to Big Time Brewery as head brewer before joining Chef John Howie in June 2014 to design and develop the Beardslee Public House beer program.
name: Beardslee Public House

description:
The Bearpaw River Brewing Company makes real hand-crafted Alaska beer for real Alaska adventures. No shortcuts. No substitutes. No sellouts. Just pure Alaska beer.

The brewery is run by four brothers from the valley: Jake, Jed, Jack, and James, all working together to bring you fresh, exciting, and original beer!
name: Bearpaw River Brewing Company

description: BearWaters Brewing Company is located in Waynesville North Carolina in the beautiful Smoky Mountains of Western North Carolina. BearWaters was named in honor of the region's pristine source of mountain water. BearWaters captures the spirit, traditions and majesty of the Great Smoky Mountains. Come enjoy what happens when fearless creativity, maticulous brewing meets natures greatest natural resource.
name: BearWaters Brewing Company

description: Beast Brewing offers a unique line of craft beer focusing on robust flavors for the adventurous palate. We are conveniently located on Highway 92 in the San Jose section of Bisbee, just five minutes from downtown. Our facility offers Stunning views of the Mule Mountains in the USA to the north & the San Jose Mountains in Mexico to the south, indoor & outdoor seating, ample parking and entertainment. We are minutes from internationally renowned birding spot – the San Pedro Riparian, as well as many of Arizona’s beautiful state and national parks, including Coronado National Memorial & Forest for hiking, biking, caving, picnicking, and the like. In addition to Beast Brewing’s adventurous beer offerings, we are Proudly continuing a Bisbee tradition, we brew Electric Beer.  Electric Brewing dates back to 1988, making it Arizona’s first microbrewery.  Electric Beer provides a high-quality approachable line of products. Beast Brewing Company strives to reduce our carbon footprint by incorporating locally sourced ingredients into our products when possible, utilizing refurbished equipment, capturing gray water and donating spent grain to farmers. Stop in to Arizona’s first & wildest craft brewery for a cold, refreshing beverage after an active and sunny day in Arizona. Cheers! - See more at: http://beastbrewingcompany.com/#sthash.NabirAAL.dpuf
name: Beast Brewing Company

description:
Beaus is located inside an old tannery in an industrial park, and makes some of the best craft brews in Canada, showing ingenuity in their craft, but also in marketing and distribution. From their website:

We’re fiercely independent. Our beer and our brewery is a labour of love from start to finish. There were no deep pockets behind us when we launched and there aren’t any now either. Our success is derived from hard work, unbridled passion and the support from customers who appreciate these qualities and a well made beer.

While we take great care in making the best beer possible, we don’t take ourselves too seriously. We go out of our way to take any pretense out of our beer. We believe in rustic, natural quality over fancy-pants snobbery. Our marketing and branding efforts try to reinforce this and we choose to market by talking to folks instead of blaring messages through mass-market advertising.
name: Beaus All Natural Brewing Company

description: We aren’t a microbrewery…we are an artisan NANO-brewery.   Beaver Brewing Company has a 1.5 Barrel system that ensures that every beer is LITERALLY hand crafted.  Every batch is tested before it is bottled to make sure you are getting the freshest and best tasting beer money can buy.
name: Beaver Brewing Company

description:
Beaver Creek Brewery has become known as a microbrew oasis on the vast plains of eastern Montana. We’re just two minutes off Interstate 94, we always have several hand-made beers on tap, and a song can break out at any time.

Come out and see us in Wibaux, and find out for yourself: Our Beaver Tastes Better!
name: Beaver Creek Brewery

description: At one time, St. Cloud was the home of six local breweries, but with the closing of the last one in 1939, local brewing became a thing of the past. Until now. Nick Barth and Matt Studer, two avid homebrewers and passionate entrepreneurs, have teamed up with local professional brewmaster Chris Laumb to launch Beaver Island Brewing Company—a venture that will revive the rich tradition of brewing in St. Cloud.
name: Beaver Island Brewery

description: You can watch the chefs create your meal in our open kitchen or view the brewer creating our handcrafted ales and lagers behind the bar.
name: Beaver Street Brewery

description: Each Beaver View Brew is small-batch handcrafted within a stone's throw of the mighty Beaver Creek. We're really just a couple guys who like to make (and drink) good beer. We use an all-grain method, hand-grinding select grains fresh for each brew.
name: Beaver View Brew Co

description:
Beavers Bend Brewery has been the longtime dream of Steve Bartholomew, Brad Reesing and Greg Campbell. We are committed to bringing top quality craft brewing to Southeastern Oklahoma.
Bartholomew and Reesing have more than 35 years of experience brewing beer, honing their craft in a wide range of styles. Our brews are available now at Grateful Head & Abendigo's, both in Hochatown, with more locations coming soon. BBB features both year-round and seasonal brews; Hoppin' Howlapeno Ale, Red Slough Amber, Our blonde ale, Fleucy Creek Pale Ale, Front Porch Peach Ale and our fall pumpkin seasonal ale. 
We hope you enjoy our craft beer as much as we enjoy creating it.
Cheers Ya'll!
name: Beaver's Bend Brewery

description:
Beaverhead Brewing Company is owned and operated by Brett Maki.

Brett was born and raised in Dillon.  His brewing career started in Seattle in 2001 with a homebrew kit his wife purchased for him for his birthday, three short months later he found himself working for Pyramid Brewery in Seattle, making soda, driving forklift, and washing tanks.  There he learned the trade of cellar work and brewing beer.

When Pyramid closed its doors in Seattle, Brett moved on to work for a small brewery in south Seattle.  He soon became head brewer and was put in charge of training new employees and developing new beers.

In 2011 he and his family moved back to Dillon, there the town needed a brewer and Brett needed a brewery.

The name for Beaverhead Brewing Company comes from the original brewery in Dillon which operated in the late 1800’s and early 1900’s.  Little is known about the original Beaverhead Brewery (Dillon Brewery) but newspaper clipping mention it was regarded as making the “Finest Beer.”  Owned and operated at one time by Henry Burfiend and his brother, the Brewery closed in 1919 at the start of Prohibition.  The Brewery was located on the south side of Dillon near where the medical clinic is located today.
name: Beaverhead Brewing Company

description:
Beavertown was set up in December 2011 by Logan Plant in the kitchen of Duke's Brew and Que, in De Beauvoir, Hackney, London. The brew house, situated opposite the two Smokers of the BBQ restaurant, runs at 4BBL per brew (650 litres - 1150 pints). 

In March of 2013 we moved out of our home at Duke's Brew & Que and into our new brew site at Unit 4 Stour Road, Fish Island, London E3 2NT. Now with a little bit more space we can push the boundaries of brewing and get more beer out to the thirsty masses. 

In May 2014 we moved to our new 11,000sqft space in Tottenham Hale. We upgraded to a 30BBL (50HL) brew house. We also sat our 'heartbeat' 4BBL kit next to Big Beaver to constantly push our Alpha's, experiments and minds!
name: Beavertown Brewery

description:
Beck's Brewery (Brauerei Beck & Co) is a brewery in the north German city of Bremen. Owned by local families until February 2002, it was then sold to Interbrew  for 1.8 billion euros. The brewery was formed under the name Kaiserbrauerei Beck & May o.H.G. on 27 June 1873, by Lüder Rutenberg (8 February 1816 ? 14 June 1890), Heinrich Beck, and Thomas May. On 1 October 1875, Thomas May left the brewery which then became known as Kaiserbrauerei Beck & Co.

Beck's ranks number 5 among Germany's best selling breweries.
name: Beck's Brewery

description:
Bee Creek Brewery is a family business that nestles comfortably in an old growth forest of immense Maples, bush tangles, and surrounding thickets in Clay County, Indiana.

Established on May 7th 2007 by Dr. Frank  Forster, wife Julie, and Julie's big brother, Mark Snelling, the brewery was christened Bee Creek for the stream cutting through the center of the property.

The Forster's are dynamic owners.  Not satisfied to manage from the front office, Julie and Dr. Frank are hands-on, day-to-day problem solvers.

Then there is Bee Creek's signature ales; a product of Brewmaster Mark Snelling's accomplished recipes of hops, honey, wheat, yeast and magical elements.  A navy veteran, he commands over 25 years brewing experience.
name: Bee Creek Brewery

description:
The newest craft brewery in Western North Carolina has opened in the Alpine Village at Beech Mountain Resort. Beech Mountain Brewing Co. has the capacity to brew up to 100 gallons per day and will be open year round to serve skiers, snowboarders, mountain bikers and other resort visitors.
The brewery features three distinct ales created on-site, with consulting from award-winning brewer Will Young of Blind Squirrel in nearby Plumtree. Heading the list of beers is the 5506 Pale Ale, followed by the Liberty and Yard Sale Ales. Patrons may purchase these high-quality craft beers by the pint or the growler. Flight tastings are also available, along with brewery tours, which include a pint and a keepsake glass.

"The brewery is yet another amenity added to the resort as part of our effort to become a year-round destination,” said Ryan Costin, general manager. “With the growing popularity of craft beer in North Carolina, we believe our customers will enjoy the experience."
name: Beech Mountain Brewing Co.

description:
Beehive Basin Brewery is a new microbrewery located in the Town Center of Big Sky MT, right next to Roxy’s Market. We operate a 7 barrel brewing system that has been created specifically for us by our friends at Portland Kettle Works in Portland, Oregon. We also run a small tap room where we invite you to come and taste some of our hand crafted brews. At this time we do not have any food service, but you are welcome to order in from one of Big Sky’s many restaurants. We also on occasion will have a food truck parked in front of our tap room. 

Our small brewing system allows our brewmaster Andy Liedberg to constantly change up the beers we have on tap. Andy has been refining his skill at several different breweries across the country for over a decade. We are excited to finally let Andy realize his dream and start brewing the recipes he has been designing over the years. 

Stop by the brewery after a day of fun in Big Sky and grab a pint or fill up a growler. Enjoy the mountain views from our tasting room or watch the brewmaster at work through our brewery viewing window. Hope to see you soon. 

Cheers. 


245 Towncenter Ave
Big Sky, MT 59716
United States

Mon - Sun 12PM - 8pm(Growlers filled till 9pm)
Phone (406) 995 7444
Email casey.folley@beehivebasinbrewery.com
name: Beehive Basin Brewery

description: Smoth
name: beer

description: The Beer Army Combat Brewery is a micro brewery located in Trenton, North Carolina. The brewery opened on April 19th, 2013 in the small town of 287 people.  The brewery maintains a tap room called the "Bunker" where patrons can come sit and drink inside the brewery.  Head Brewer Jeff Brungard retired from the Marine Corps in late 2012.  Owner Dustin Canestorp is currently enlisted as a Major.
name: Beer Army Combat Brewery

description:
Beer By Design (BBD) Brewery is the first craft brewery in Northglenn, CO. We are a production micro-brewery, producing high-quality beer designed to be enjoyed. We are an independent, traditional style brewer bringing innovation to craft beer design.

At Beer By Design, we believe that fresh quality beer produced locally, using the finest ingredients and without chemicals in processing or for preservation is the key to success among beer drinking enthusiasts.
name: Beer By Design Brewery

description: We're passionate about brewing great beer and enjoying new beers. Feel free to stop in and try one of our own brews or one of our many guest drafts. No bottles, No watered down brews, No comparsion.
name: Beer Engine

description: We are Alabama's newest Craft Beer Company. We are dedicated to making the South's finest high gravity beers. We are experimental. We are new. We are better by design.
name: Beer Engineers

description:
A nanobrewery located in downtown Culpeper, Virginia, Beer Hound Brewery strives to keep beer local by brewing and serving our beer direct to customers at the brewery.  Founder, Kenny Thacker, originally got into brewing beer as a business opportunity with a full-service homebrewing store, the Fermentation Trap.  Since that time, he has fallen in love with beer and brewing and felt compelled to do it professionally, and in 2012, Kenny opened Beer Hound Brewery.

Not long after Beer Hound opened, friends & beer entrepreneurs Frank Becker & Rick Cash saw the potential in the great-tasting brews that were part of the Beer Hound lineup. They joined forces with Beer Hound Brewery and decided to bring the great tasting microbrews to the Town of Culpeper, Virginia.  In October of 2014, Beer Hound Brewery opened its doors as the first-ever brewery in Culpeper. Local and visiting beer enthusiasts descended upon the new establishment immediately and now the Beer Hound brand is a mainstay of the arts district in Downtown Culpeper.

All of the Beer Hound beers are named after famous hounds in movies and history, with an attempt to link the beer style to the hound. Beer Hound Brewery serves a variety of beer styles fresh daily, so stop by and enjoy a pint!
name: Beer Hound Brewery

description: Beer Valley Brewing Company is an award winning microbrewery located in Eastern Oregon. Founded in 2005 by brewer Pete Ricks, the brewery started production in Ontario, Oregon in the summer of 2007. Specializing in the production of strong ales, the brewery currently produces 6 brands year round, plus occasional seasonals. Beer Valley Brewing beers are available in the states of Oregon, Washington, Idaho, California, Nevada, and Arizona.
name: Beer Valley Brewing Company

description:
Beerded Brothers Brewing Company is started by two step-brothers, Gabriel Pedersen and Max Scudder.

Beerded Brothers Brewing is a 1BBL nanobrewery located in a newly built shop in East Vancouver. Utilizing a mire 540 sq. ft., Beerded Brothers might compete for the smallest nanobrewery in Vancouver, and maybe the country!
name: Beerded Brothers Brewing

description: Beggars is a small production brewery and taproom located in the Chums Corners area of Traverse City, MI. Expect beer Fall of 2012.
name: Beggars Brewery

description:
Begyle Brewing is a Community Supported Brewery, located in the Ravenswood Industrial Corridor, Chicago, IL.

Using a CSA (community supported agriculture) model, we will supply beer to our members via monthly subscriptions (referred to as a CSB or Beer-CSA!). In addition to the growler subscriptions we will offer growler fills to walk up customers through our retail space, as well as kegs and bottle for sale. We source many of our hops locally, you can expect the majority of our beers to include locally grown hops from Wisconsin and Michigan. We have lots of other things up our sleeves, too, like using spent grain for dog treats and sharing our space with local artists.
name: Begyle Brewing

description:
Yanjing Beer has been the largest selling beer in China for ten consecutive years now. It currently maintains 85% market share in Beijing and was one of the major sponsors of the 2008 Beijing Olympics.

Yanjing Beer is brewed with pure mineral water collected 300 meters beneath the Yanshang Mountain and is certified “Green Food”. The Green Food logo is a quality certificate trademark registered by China Green Food Development Center, and embodies the concept of the pollution free, quality and safety characters of Green Food using sustainable agricultural processes.
name: Beijing Yanjing

description: Micro Brewery in Vista, CA - North San Diego County
name: Belching Beaver Brewery

description:
Our mission is for EVERYONE to try Belfast Bay Lobster Ale and McGovern's Oatmeal Stout from Belfast Bay Brewing Co. in Belfast, Maine

We are a family owned Micro Brewery in Belfast, Maine.  We currently distribute two beers, Lobster Ale and McGovern's Oatmeal Stout, in 12oz bottles, 1/6 barrels and kegs in 13 states and 4 countries!
name: Belfast Bay Brewing

description: A one-barrel nano-brewery at Campbell's Junction in the Belford section of Middletown, NJ. Open on Fridays and Saturdays with a well-rounded selection of beers.
name: Belford Brewing Company

description: The Belgian Mare Brewery is a small wood-fired brewery in rural Alstead, NH, specializing in bottle conditioned traditional ales.
name: Belgian Mare Brewery

description: Bell's Brewery, Inc. began in 1985 with a quest for better beer and a 15 gallon soup kettle. Since then, we've grown into a regional craft brewery that employs more than 200 people over an 20 state area, in addition to Puerto Rico and Washington DC. The dedication to brewing flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers that started in 1985 is still with us today. We currently brew over 20 beers for distribution as well as many other small batch beers that are served at our pub in Kalamazoo, the Eccentric Cafe. Our ongoing goal is to brew thoughtfully, creatively and artistically. We strive to bring an authentic and pleasant experience to all of our customers through our unique ales and beers.
name: Bell's Brewery, Inc.

description: Bella Casa di Vino is a winery and micro-brewery located in St. Clair Michigan, serving our own wine and craft beer since 2009.
name: Bella Casa di Vino

description: The Belle Isle Restaurant & Brewery, located in the heart of Northwest Oklahoma City, is a favorite for lunch, dinner and entertainment. Enjoy a menu of pastas, burgers, pizzas, and more. Then there's the Beer! We at the Belle Isle Brewery are proud to create the finest handcrafted beer available, using the best ingredients and strict German Brewing rules. We've developed an excellent selection of beers now available for take out. Our pub features a daily happy hour and live music.
name: Belle Isle Restaurant and Brewing Co

description: We are a new microbrewery, brewing American style beers right here in London. The brewery is up and running and we are brewing the eleven beers shown below.
name: belleville brewing

description:
Bellevue's first production brewery specializing in small-batch, handcrafted ales and lagers! We will be utilizing a 20BBL brewhouse with 160BBLs of fermentation capacity.

Although we don't intend to be an organic brewery, we will use organic ingredients whenever possible and, once food service begins, our menu items will feature organic ingredients as well. A children's menu will also be offered.

Our goal is to showcase the wonderful flavors of Washington with local food and brewing ingredients...keeping it local is good business!

We'll also feature a new Washington State wine each month and provide two guest taps for our craft brewing colleagues to showcase their beers.
name: Bellevue Brewing Company

description:
Situated on the mid north coast near Coffs  Harbour  the  Bellingen Brewing Company has been in operation since 2005 and specializes in producing a small range of hand crafted ales using only the finest quality malted barley and hops.

No additives or preservatives –this is real beer as it should be!
name: Bellingen Brewing Company

description: Bellows moved from Waunakee to Watertown in December 2001. Their new location sports a ten-barrel brewhouse in the front window, and a pool table in the back. I'm told their building will allow them to triple their ground-level floor space, and there's also a huge banquet-type room on the second floor, and a ballroom on the third, so watch for some major expansion here in the future.
name: Bellows Brew Crew

description:
Bellwether Hard Cider is owned and operated by Cheryl and Bill Barton.  We started the business in 1999, inspired by travels through the cider regions of France and after years of “research and development” as home cidermakers.  We started our business with the simple goals of making fine artisanal ciders and to lead the revival of a great American tradition.

We started operations in an old Babcock chicken hatchery building on Route 96 in Ithaca, New York.   In 2003 we built a new building on Route 89 in Trumansburg, New York, and planted an orchard of European cider varieties. We have been an active member of the Cayuga Lake Wine Trail for over 5 years.
At present, we produce around 10 varieties of hard ciders, ranging from very dry to semi-sweet, some with carbonation and some still.
name: Bellwether Hard Cider Company

description:
Bellwoods Brewery is a new Toronto microbrewery, retail store & café coming to Ossington and Argyle early in 2012

We intend to produce a diverse range of craft ales and fermented elixirs for both wholesale and retail customers.

Bellwoods Brewery will also operate a small indoor picnic-style cafe in collaboration with local chefs for lovers of craft beer.
name: Bellwoods Brewery

description:
Why Belly Love?

Well... it's hard to put into words the thoughts that led to the name, because so much of it is simply the feeling you have when you consume a carefully, dare I say lovingly, crafted beer. Complex and simple at the same time. Satiating but refreshing. Nourishment for your senses. Quite plainly; beer is liquid soul food.

We feel that beer makes bellies happy and shows them love. So... raise a glass, love your belly; Belly Love!
name: Belly Love Brewing Company

description: The Belmont Brewing Company opened in 1990 and is Southern California's oldest operating brewpub. Come by for a taster set of award-winning ales crafted by Head Brewer Blackwell. We serve classic American fare with international flair and the warmest customer service around.
name: Belmont Brewing Co

description: In 1992 Dean Wise made his first batch of beer. Things went well--at least nothing blew up. . . and the beer was, um, beer--but he wanted something more. Dean went from using a brew kit to creating his own recipes with shocking amounts of the best malts and hops. Some questioned his sanity, but the result was exceptional beer everyone loved. Having dedicated part of his basement to a brewery, when it came time to name his burgeoning business, Below Grade Brewing was a natural fit.
name: Below Grade Brewing

description:
Below the Radar is Huntsville’s first Micro-Brewhouse situated in the Historic Huntsville Times Building in the recently stablished “downtown entertainment district”. Below the Radar opened its doors on August 2012 and has been expanding its lunch and dinner menu of goodness as well as its micro-brews & drinks ever since.Below the Radar is a great place to have lunch or meet after work for socializing with friends and co-workers. BTR is known for its one of a kind variety of micro-brews, extensive wine list and liquor drinks or its wonder array of food by its own in-house Chef Bill Harden. BTR menu items include like roast beef sliders topped with cilantro-horseradish sauce. And how about some Lazy Magnolia Southern Pecan Ice Cream for dessert!
Enjoy live music every Tesday night to make it a night to remember.

BTR is open 7 days a week for lunch & dinner (including a very special “Chef Bill Brunch” on Sundays). Be sure to check out the Chef Dish Pick of the Week.

BTR has thirty-two beers on tap including 7 craft brews made in-house, more than 27 bottled beers.

BTR has a Full bar and a great selection of fine wines. Be sure to check our Wine Pick of the Week.

An upscale, yet relaxed, and nonsmoking atmosphere.
name: Below the Radar Brewing Company

description:
We are a start-up brewery and beer cafe located in Novato, CA (Marin County).  We are not open yet, however!  Planned opening date is on Bastille Day, July 14, 2012.  Please click on the Brewers Blog or contact us and stay in touch with our progress towards opening.

We proudly produce artisinal small-batch ales for the discerning consumer.  The cafe  will also offer chartucerie, cheese plates, pannini and snacks, sourced from local producers.
name: Beltane Brewing

description: Beltway Brewing Company is a brewery in Sterling, Virginia (Loudoun County, a Washington D.C. suburb) built exclusively as a host for partner brewing, contract brewing and production of private label beers. The mission of Beltway Brewing Company is to professionally produce high quality craft beer for those who cannot build or expand their own breweries.
name: Beltway Brewing Company

description: Belvoir Brewery brews eight regular beers, including the founding beer Beaver Bitter, and various specials, and also brews Shipstone's Original Ale and Shipstone's Gold Star Blonde Ale.  They supply over 275 pubs in a 50 mile radius and local shops with their Melton Red.
name: Belvoir Brewery

description: Bemidji Brewing Company LLC is a small craft brewery based out of the beautiful city of Bemidji, MN. Craft beer is our passion, and we hope to provide the freshest, most high quality craft beer to Bemidji and the northwoods.
name: Bemidji Brewing Company

description: Think of Bench Creek Brewing as a beacon for craft beer in Alberta, exploring the untouched wilds in search of new flavours before anyone else. We take what we find in those uncharted territories, refine it, distill it and perfect a beer that’s crafted to be shared with the world.
name: Bench Creek Brewing

description: Benchmark Brewing is all about delicious beer, beer that we want to take home and drink. We want consistently awesome beer that you can rely on to be the gold standard of the style.  Our year round beers are low in alcohol and high in flavor; we often find that it is nice to be able to enjoy a beer or two and keep your wits about you.  We also know that there are times when a ten percent beer is just what you need to keep you warm at night; to that end we will celebrate the seasons, months, weeks, or whatever we feel needs celebration with specialty releases that will vary wildly in alcohol content and style.  No matter the style or strength all Benchmark Beer will set the standard for its kind.
name: Benchmark Brewing Company

description:
Bend Brewing Company overlooks the Deschutes River at Mirror Pond in Bend, Oregon. Locally owned and operated, this exceptional brewpub opened its doors in February of 1995 and quickly became a favorite for locals and visitors alike. The people of the B.B.C. take pride in creative, award-winning handcrafted brews, fresh and flavorful menu selections, a casual and friendly atmosphere and superb service.

Bend Brewing Co. is a great place to have lunch, dinner or just some hot nachos and cold handcrafted beer after a day skiing or hiking in Central Oregon's recreational paradise.  In the summer, B.B.C.'s patio is the best place in town to dine outside. In the winter, come in and warm up with a malty seasonal ale.   Come and see for yourself why we're the locals' favorite!
name: Bend Brewing Company

description: Providing great quality hand crafted ales and lagers to the surrounding area.
name: Benny Brewing Co.

description:
Benoit Casper Brewing is a microbrewery located in Richmond, California. 

Marc Benoit and Chad Casper own and operate their 3.5bbl Microbrewery, specializing in small batches of delicious beer.
name: Benoit-Casper Brewing Company

description:
Cradled in the heart of Benson on Omaha’s north side - you will find Benson Brewery, a cozy neighborhood brew-pub welcoming all who look for friendly company, good conversation, house made beers and solid drinks. We believe a bar is what its patrons and community make it, which is why we serve true, locally sourced foods when possible, well-crafted brews, and drinks to please all.

The Benson Brewery is a pub for all times. From its reclaimed wooden flooring, to its warm interiors, modern brewery, and exposed brick walls – Benson Brewery is a place without pretense. Our food, our drinks, our service and our space are inspired by old and new American traditions. We welcome all to come and feel at home in our brewery, a Benson Local
name: Benson Brewery

description: Craft brewery and small batch distillery located in the great state of Minnesota. We've got great ideas for unique, beer-centric whiskeys and bourbons.
name: Bent Brewstillery

description:
Bent Paddle Brewing Co.® is a 30-barrel production craft brewery and public taproom located in Duluth, Minnesota. We use the amazing water of Lake Superior along with the talent of our brewers to make some of the freshest and most dependable craft beer possible. Our flagship beers, as well as specialty seasonal offerings, are available in varied keg sizes as well as 12 oz. cans to the retail market. Our beer is also available via growler fill and by the glass in our taproom, the Bent Tap. Look for us at bars, liquor stores, event facilities, and restaurants throughout Minnesota and beyond – and come visit us in Duluth for a tour and a taste!

It is our mission at Bent Paddle Brewing Co.® to brew craft beer with a concentration on sustainability for our business, employees, the environment and the greater community - all while “Bending the Traditions” that we encounter, for a more unique and interesting craft beer experience.

Bending Tradition® in Duluth, Minnesota since 2013
name: Bent Paddle Brewing Co.

description: Bent Rail Brewery is the brain child of restaurateurs Craig Baker and Derek Means and spearheaded by head brewer Bradley Zimmerman. Our core selection of beers will focus on flavorful yet sessionable styles with a mixture of creative and modern seasonals and specialties.
name: Bent Rail Brewery

description: Unique neighborhood brewery restaurant in "old" downtown historic district. We offer the midwest's best award- winning craft beers, a great selection of pub grub and one of the coolest beer gardens in the Quad Cities.
name: Bent River Brewing

description:
Thank you for your interest in Bentley Brewing and the Dark Horse Tavern. This is a family owned pub and brew house located at 12 Crane Street in Southbridge, Ma. Our goal is to offer a warm and inviting atmosphere where you can savor our array of freshly brewed beer on tap. We also offer a fully stocked bar for those wishing a more exotic cocktail. To accompany these libations we have a delectable selection of pub fare for your enjoyment.

As we gear up for the Dark Horse Tavern's grand opening in mid-June, Bentley Brewing, along with the help of our expert brew master, Tim Daley, will begin production of our four signature beers on tap. In subsequent weeks, we will be expanding our offerings to include four additional beers, as well as two cask ales, which will complete our on-site brewing selection.

Located just off Main Street in Southbridge, we are within easy access to major routes I-84 and the Mass Pike. Parking for over 150 cars and handicapped accessible, we offer outside dining on our spacious patio overlooking the scenic Quinebaug River, multiple large flat screen televisions broadcasting the latest sporting events throughout the bar, gaming options that include championship dartboards and a pool table, and live entertainment on Saturday evenings. You can also look into our brewing area where all the magic happens and Tim would be happy to answer any and all questions and we welcome your suggestions for future offerings. We accept reservations to accommodate parties of 30-70 guests in our conference room that includes a private bar and optional catering.

We are confident that after experiencing our locally grown and freshly prepared food, our fantastic brew and the exceptional service of our dedicated staff, you will make Bentley Brewing and the Dark Horse Tavern your favorite destination spot. We look forward to welcoming you and your guests in person at our riverside location at 12 Crane Street.
name: Bentley Brewing Company

description:
Berghoff’s history as a beer brand goes back over 120 years, and in that time it has developed a reputation of high quality and consistency. The first batch of Berghoff beer was brewed in Fort Wayne, Indiana in 1887 by Herman Berghoff and his three brothers. Herman’s desire to expand the market for the family’s beer led him to sell the product at the Chicago World’s Fair where it received high acclaim. Since then, Berghoff has continued its success and relevance in the Chicago market and beyond.           

   As the craft beer market has evolved, the brand has received fresh, exciting updates. Berghoff changed its brewing location and is now proudly brewed at Point Brewery in Stevens Point, Wisconsin. Berghoff has also refreshed itself with updated recipes and packaging. With consulting from brewing experts Randy Mosher and John Hannafan, Berghoff’s new, top-notch beers are ready to satisfy consumer demand. As the brewery looks to the future, Berghoff beer will continue to evolve as trends change, but will always maintain its roots as an authentic German-style brew whose history and tradition will never be forgotten.
name: Berghoff Brewery, Inc

description: We are Berkley Beer Company. Founded in 2012, our three-barrel nano brewery is located in the small farming community of Berkley, Massachusetts. We may be small, but our passion for creating an honest brew is great. All of our beers are crafted, brewed and bottled by hand for guaranteed quality and unparalleled taste. Because we care about the environment just as much as our craft, we utilize a wood gasification boiler, to heat all our hot water for the brewing process using recycled, reclaimed, and cord wood. So enjoy one of our hand-crafted beers and we hope you'll waste not, want another.
name: Berkley Beer Company

description: Berkshire Brewing Company Inc. is a regional brewery located in South Deerfield, MA, established in 1994 by Christopher T. Lalli and Gary A. Bogoff, a pair of homebrewers with the vision of being Massachusetts’ local brewery. Our goal is to produce clean, fresh, well-balanced ales & lagers in small batches. At the present time we are capable of producing 580 barrels (17,980 gallons) of fresh beer each week. All of our beer is unfiltered, unpasteurized and contains no chemical additives or preservatives. As craft brewers, we are now producing nine styles of beer year round and seven seasonals.
name: Berkshire Brewing Company

description:
Berryessa Brewing Co. is a 20 barrel craft brewery located just outside historic Winters, California. We take pride in producing fresh quality beer available for wholesale or to enjoy at our taproom.

The tap room is located at the brewery, a relaxed atmosphere in a country setting. There we have indoor seating, scenic outdoor seating, games, occasional entertainment, good company and most importantly, excellent fresh beer. We offer full pints, half pints, and sample trays. More often than not, you will find cask conditioned and barrel aged beers drawn off a cask engine exclusively at the tap room. You can also purchase 64 oz. growlers to go of any of our six rotating taps filled with a counter pressure growler filler.
name: Berryessa Brewing Company

description: Berthoud Brewing Co. is a locally owned craft brewery in Berthoud, Colorado. Our brewery is dedicated to produce authentic beers that represent the unique experiences of our friends, family, and community.
name: Berthoud Brewing Company

description:
Bertram’s Salmon Valley Brewery, like the town from which it derives its name, is situated in the heart of the beautiful northwestern Rocky Mountains on the River-of-No-Return. Salmon is the portal to the largest wilderness area in the contiguous United States, the Frank Church Wilderness. 

Once the center of an active mining, logging and ranching community Salmon has probably been the West’s best-kept secret. However, following the centennial of the Lewis and Clark expedition, this haven for recreationists is fast becoming a popular tourist destination.
name: Bertrams Salmon Valley Brewery

description: Berwick Brewing is dedicated to providing the highest quality, full-flavored, drinkable, Ales & Lagers with only the highest quality ingredients. Our commitment to freshness and character reflects in each glass. With over 50 years combined experience, we understand what our customers seek in quality brewing and world class products.
name: Berwick Brewing

description: Beryl's Beer Co. is dedicated to delivering high quality barrel aged beers to the local community.
name: Beryl's Beer Co.

description: Bessemer City Brewing is located just 25 miles west of Charlotte on I85 near the base of Crowders Mountain in historic Bessemer City. The beer is currently brewed and served in the Whisky Mill Bar & Grill known locally for its excellent eats, rubs & sauces. BCB’s focus is to brew high quality craft beer in the style of beers from the United Kingdom & Ireland. We celebrate the pride of our city’s culture and history by naming our beers after original city founders, industries & landmarks.
name: Bessemer City Brewing

description: At the Best Damn Brewing Co. we're on a mission to bring you the best damn thing you've had all day. We'll do whatever it takes to bring you great tasting, easy-to-drink, well-crafted brews that we hope you love as much as we do!
name: Best Damn Brewing Co.

description: Established in 2008 by founder, owner, and brewer, K. Kasner as a one man, one barrel operation. We intend to launch our beer in local markets this year (2012) and hope you'll hop on board.
name: Beta Brewing

description: Bettler Brewing Company, LLC is a brewpub in planning. We are currently looking for a permanent location in the Lake Norman area of North Carolina just north of Charlotte.
name: Bettler Brewing Company

description:
Bevog microbrewery is the fruit of inquisitiveness and aspiration towards discovering new beer-drinking experiences; it is the result of enthusiasm, love and zeal. We brew beers with character and soul. Our goal is to transcend the limits of the known and ordinary.

We have had enough of a monotonous beer offer and the belittling of beer. Beer can be and is much more than that. Bevog brewery is dedicated primarily to beers of top fermentation, more commonly known as ales. The ales we brew basically originate from England. In the last few decades this highly diverse type of beer has been given greater breadth, a wider range of flavors, has been shifting the boundaries of individual styles and becoming more and more popular around the world. It is gaining popularity not only with beer lovers and beer drinkers, but in general with gourmets, top chefs and people who are always willing to explore new flavors and experiences and who care about what they ingest.
name: Bevog

description:
Beyond the Pale was started as a small neighbourhood brewery by three local guys who grew up, went to school, and currently reside in the neighbourhood. Equipped with an old 400L brew system and a belief that there was room in the market for somebody wanting to make a variety of full flavour, unique beers, we embarked on our journey in early 2012. The concept was simple: make a variety of beers that WE wanted to drink and create a tasting opportunity for our customers to come into the brewery to decide what they liked, and buy to go.

During our first year of operation we released over 20 different beers, underwent one expansion, and our MO remains the same as it was in the beginning. In addition to the retail store our beers can also be found in over 30 local bars and restaurants.

You can be sure when you pick up a glass or bottle of our beer that you’re drinking a fresh local product. We work that little old brew house like a pack mule to crank out as much beer as possible. Nearly all of our beer is sold to customers within a week of leaving our brite tanks. That’s freshness that’s hard to find elsewhere.
name: Beyond The Pale Brewing Company

description: The Bier Brewery and Taproom is excited to be one of the newest breweries in Indiana.  We are committed to the highest quality and best tasting bier in Indianapolis.  Our small size allows BIER to have the utmost control over the many different variables that go into brewing a batch of beer.
name: Bier Brewery & Taproom
Bierbrauerei "Zum Lamm" Karl Ege GmbH & Co.

description: The abbey opened a brewery inside the monastery in 1884 in order to finance the monastery and contribute to charitable causes. Despite this goal, the brewery was run as a commercial enterprise. The abbey owned several bars in the area and produced lager under its own "Trappist" brand as well as contract brewing for several private labels. In 1969, the abbey licensed the brewing operations to the Artois Brewery (now InBev). In 1980 the deal with Artois ended, and the monks went back to brewing themselves, this time a top fermented beer which had only been made in limited quantities since the 1950s. Over time the brewery introduced more varieties, first with Dubbel and Tripel in 1987, then in 1992 they introduced Blond. Between 1993 and 2000, the brewery also marketed a brand called Enkel. The brewery also produces the world's only Trappist witbier. The brewery also used to produce the Jopen beer.
name: Bierbrouwerij De Koningshoeven

description: Beerbrewery St. Christoffel is a relatively young brewery, founded in 1986. Our brewery is situated in the former coalmining-town Roermond in Dutch Limburg and named after the patronsaint of Roermond: Saint Christoffel. The brewery started very small and was at first situated behind a house. In 1995 the brewery moved to her present facility. With moving there, the brewingcapacity greatly enhanced due to new brewing-, fermenting- and lagerfacilities. Christoffel brews according to the German Reinheitsgebot von 1516: which means the brewingprocess takes place in a completely natural way. Around the year 1990, Christoffel Blond was awarded 3 years in a row with the Dutch title: Best Beer from the Netherlands.
name: Bierbrouwerij St.Christoffel

description: Seasonal varieties of artisan sausage, bratwurst, hot dogs, jerky, bacon, pickled items, nano brews and more hand made fresh in-house.
name: Biercamp

description:
The Chimay Brewery is a Belgian brewery founded inside Scourmont Abbey, in the Belgian municipality of Chimay in 1862. The brewery produces three widely distributed ales and a patersbier exclusively for the monks; they are known as Trappist beers because they are made in a Trappist monastery. The brewing plant was updated in 1988, and as of 2005 produced 120,000 hectolitres annually.

Since 1876 the monastery has also made cheese, and currently offers four cheeses.
name: Bières de Chimay

description: New brewery in progress in Denver, CO.
name: Bierstadt Lagerhaus

description:
Bierwerk is situated in the Western Cape at the very tip of Africa, we strive to produce ales with a distinct African profile using local ingredients and getting inspiration from the culture and tradition of the great continent.

Southern Africa has an environment and climate which bring about a wide range of exceptional flavors. The intricate cultural and culinary traditions provide us with great inspiration for our innovative ales.

There are thousands of indigenous plants which will only grow in the countries in southern Africa. We utilize this great and diverse resource to produce beers with unique flavors. South Africa is also home to a thriving hops industry and vast areas of farm land producing a plethora of grains.

Many of our ales are fermented with a special blend of yeast (including wine yeast, ale yeast, and naturally occurring microbes) which provides complexity and a rustic character. Being unpasteurized, unfiltered and bottle conditioned with live yeast our ales has delicious mouth feel and great often ageing potential.
name: Bierwerk Afrikan Ales

description: German Style Brewpub with a great outdoor patio.  Always the place to stop on the way back from a day of skiing.
name: BierWerks Brewery

description:
To share the passion for brewing and the love of beer that we celebrated as home brewers.

We're proud to offer six year-round beers; a traditional irish red, a chocolatey smoked porter, a session pale ale, dry-hopped IPA, an amber just to pair with pizza and an ESB created to celebrate the passion of our very own Emerald City Supporters.
name: Big Al Brewing

description: In late 2012, Big Alice will arrive in Long Island City as one of its first breweries since Prohibition offering small batch, handcrafted, high quality beers to the neighborhood utilizing local and organic ingredients whenever possible. We look forward to turning pounds of grain into gallons of beer.
name: Big Alice Brewing Company

description: Big Axe is a Brewery and Bed and Breakfast in a small town, Nackawic, New Brunswick.
name: Big Axe Brewery

description:
At Big Bay Brewing we believe that life on the water is a little sweeter. And that sweet life is infused in every beverage we create. To us, life on the water means creating and savoring memories and moments that are cherished for a lifetime. And what better way to enhance those memories and moments than with the right beverage to sip and savor. 

The founders of Big Bay have a strong fundamental belief that craft brewed beverages and life on the water go hand in hand. Alone, what we drink is just sustenance, but paired with the right sights, sounds and settings, it becomes part of a much larger experience. And we are dedicated to bringing the “experience” back to brewing. After all, our personal life experiences have played a leading role in developing Big Bay Brewing. And as we grow, we invite you to be a part of Big Bay by sharing your experiences with us. In other words, we want you to be a part of the sweet life with us.
name: Big Bay Brewing Company

description: The Big Bear Mountain Brewery and Restaurant building on Red Ant Hill is one of the oldest commercial buildings in Big Bear. It was built in 1925 by a renowned pioneer of Big Bear named Bill Knickerbocker. The big pale yellow building was the original home of the Masonic Temple, but now the historic landmark building has a hand-crafted wooden bar and rustic ambience.
name: Big Bear Mountain Brewery

description: We are committed to brewing the best beer possible following the Germany purity law which states only water, malted barley, hops, and yeast can be used to make beer. To ensure maximum flavor, our beers are never filtered or pasturized.
name: Big Beaver Brewing Company

description:
To give West Texas a brand of beer that embodies the qualities of liberty and persistence that make the people of Big Bend exceptional.

A Microbrewery Coming to Alpine Texas with Head Brewer Steve Anderson from Live Oak in Austin
name: Big Bend Brewing Company

description: We are a small nano-brewery located in Sammamish Washington. We are dedicated to building high quality, hand craft beers. Building a better beer because we can. Our brewery was established in 2012 and we currently brew on a small one barrel brew house that produces 15 to 20 barrels of fresh brew every month, our key focus of course is making a beer that does not suck.
name: Big Block Brewery

description: Big Boss Brewing Company was started in 2006 and shipped its first beer in the 2nd quarter of 2007 in the triangle area of North Carolina. It was formed as collaboration between Geoff Lamb, a UNC graduate, who returned to North Carolina in 2006 to join forces with Brewmaster, Brad Wynn, who has 12+ years of brewing experience including several years with Victory, Wild Goose and Native Brewing Company.
name: Big Boss Brewing Company

description: The large dining room provides ample seating with a separate full bar.  From choice cuts of aged beef, including a 20-ounce Porterhouse, or a 9-ounce Filet Mignon, menu selections range from fine steaks, chicken, pork and seafood entrees, to a tempting selection of appetizers. Our chef's daily dessert specials complete your dining experience.  Join our master brewer for a tour of the operating brewery and taste test our newest brew, or visit our Northwoods inspired gift shop for a selection of unusual gifts. Featuring our glass walled, 15,000 barrel capacity brewery, Big Buck offers 8 signature beers along with seasonal specialty brews sure to please the most discriminating palate.   Enjoy dinner or drinks on our deck during the season.  Watch your favorite team or make a presentation on one of our many large screen televisions.  Our child and adult game rooms are available for your pre or post dining entertainment. With advance notice, special hours and special menus, including breakfast menus, may be arranged!
name: Big Buck Brewery

description: Big Choice Brewing is a microbrewery owned by Nathaniel Miller, his wife Andrea and Tyler Ruse, all Colorado natives that want to make great beer for their local communities. Come by the tasting room and see what the Big Choice is all about.
name: Big Choice Brewing

description: We here at Big Daddy's have been pouring our beer since September of 2008, we are fairly new and fresh. The variety of beers we brew here are all unfiltered leaving in all the good stuff most breweries take out, so that means are beers are better for you (HA,HA). Big Daddy's boasts of having a 250 member exclusive mug club so if you want to join you better sign up way in advance. We also have a variety of entertainment at Big Daddy's on the weekends and some weekdays you just need to check the calendar for who's playing and when. We do offer tours of the brewery if you call ahead we can usually fit you in. You can find our beers at the other Awful Arthur's locations. We hope to be in a bar near you in the future and remember to support your local brewery.
name: Big Daddy's Brewing Co.

description: Big Ditch Brewing is Buffalo's next local brewhouse. Join us in our journey, for the longest roads traveled are the most rewarding.
name: Big Ditch Brewing Company

description: Las Vegas' Original Brewpub... From our days at the Holy Cow in '92 to the present days at Big Dog's Brewing Co., we've been producing and enjoying award winning brews for over 19 years!
name: Big Dog's Brewing Company

description: Our unique, cozy and family-friendly brewpub is tucked away in a small industrial park in Lynnwood, WA. We have been at this location producing our handcrafted ales since 2005. We take pride in serving our patrons more than just a quick beer or a bite to eat; we want to build friendships that go beyond the bar. Beer to us is something that bonds and brings people together from all walks of life. We specialize in transforming your events and parties either at our brewery or your home into an impressive beer experience. Our dispensing systems are not only innovative and efficient, they will enhance your party and will impress your guests…they will be talking about the amazing beer and the cool “party pig” long after your party. Over the past 5 years we have grown from a small production brewery with a tasting room into a neighborhood hangout. Come in and enjoy one of our handcrafted beverages in our cedar lined pub or out in our beer garden, oh and don’t forget to order our Big “E” Signature Reuben. Next time you are faced with a “Beer Emergency” either personal or with your friends come down to the Big “E” and we will help bail you out.
name: Big E Ales

description: Big Elm Brewing is a production brewery in Sheffield, MA. Bill and Christine Heaton, former owners/brewers for Pittsfield Brew Works are canning and kegging their beers which are available all over Berkshire County.
name: Big Elm Brewing Company

description: We are a local craft brewery crafting the finest craft beers. Our brewery is in start up mode. We will be on tap in local establishments around Milwaukee in early 2013.
name: Big Head Brewing Company

description:
Loved by locals & visitors alike, Big Island Brewhaus is a family-friendly, community gathering place serving local handcrafted food and beer. Farm-to-table cuisine,
including fresh line-caught fish, local beef, vegetarian, vegan and glutenfree items complement their impressive lineup of craft beers – all brewed on-site. Award-winning Big Island Brewhaus is one of only two breweries in
the U.S. whose medal count in 2014 U.S. Open Beer Championships placed them on the Top Ten US Brewery list for the past two consecutive years! The Brewhaus has seating indoors and out in their bamboo beer-garden. Beers are available to-go in jars, growlers and in 22oz bottles, which can be found in fine establishments statewide!
name: Big Island Brewhaus

description: Specializing in handcrafted beer and wine.
name: Big Lake Brewing

description:
All over the United States, craft breweries are continuing an American tradition which experienced an almost 50 year drought after the repeal of prohibition. Big Muddy Brewing in Murphysboro, Illinois is much like many of these new “microbreweries” all over the country, reinvigorating an industry and continuing a heritage that has skipped several generations.
Until 1940, Murphysboro was the home of a thriving brewery and until prohibition; it was one of the cornerstones of the town’s industry. In 1910, the Stecher Brewing Company produced more than 40,000 barrels of beer a year. However, passage of the Volstead Act in 1919, which ushered in the era of prohibition, began a slow decline to the brewery’s demise.
Big Muddy Brewing’s founder Chuck Stuhrenberg attended Southern Illinois University Carbondale in the 1980s. After graduation, he opened a franchise of Chicago’s Rosati’s Pizza in Carbondale and in 1990, began another venture, Spray Shield Industries.
It was while Stuhrenberg was in college at SIU that he began making his own beer.
Stuhrenberg and his college buddies would homebrew, and as the years went on, he began to take his hobby more seriously.
Stuhrenberg always had professional brewing in the back of his mind, but it stayed a hobby until 2009. In July, 2009, Big Muddy Brewing finally began production, the first brewery in Murphysboro in over 50 years.
The first beer offered by Big Muddy Brewing is Kinkaid Wheat. It was a recipe popular with Stuhrenberg’s family and friends. It was also something he felt would be a good “craft beer transition brew” for those used to the conventional corporate brew (BMC).
Kinkaid Wheat is currently offered on tap and by bottle in bars, restaurants and liquor stores across Southern Illinois alongside of Big Muddy Brewing’s second selection, “Saluki Dunkel Dog”, a dark, amber/dunkel style beer.
The third and newest addition to Big Muddy Brewing’s lineup is an ale called “Big Muddy Pale Ale”, and future varieties include “Logan’s Lager”.
name: Big Muddy Brewing Co

description: Shuckin' good beer since 2015. Brewed with pride in Rehoboth Beach, Delaware
name: Big Oyster Brewery

description:
The Mark James Group is British Columbia's premiere collection of craft brewery restaurants. Established in 1976, MJG now has five popular brewery restaurants and a restaurant, along with three lounges and bars and one industry-leading clothing store. Over the years, MJG restaurants and pubs have proven themselves with an award-winning combination of great food, friendly service and unpretentious welcoming surroundings.

Our brewmasters have decades of experience and take great pride in making some of the finest beers around, while our chefs are constantly at work improving our menus which balance sophisticated flavours with solid, well-made pub favourites.
name: Big Ridge Brewing Company

description:
Our beers are hand crafted in small batches using the finest ingredients, traditional brewing methods and passion to bring you the best possible beer we can…

Beer is like food… the better the ingredients the better the beer. We take pride in sourcing the best possible ingredients from around the world and from our own back yard. Malts from Canada, England and Germany have been hand pick to produce a strong base in our brews. Hops, like grapes, are influenced by the territory, so if a beer style calls for hops from Germany we get hops from Germany. We love our ingredients so much we are planting our very own Hop yard at the Phillips Farm in Manotick, there we will grow specialty hops exclusively for our local brews. Our heritage yeast is housed in a special yeast laboratory to ensure the consistency and freshness of our brews. Our water is double filtered and boiled to give us a “clean slate”, and to finish it off we adjust the natural flavor compounds in the water to suit our various beer styles.

Good ingredients are the start of a great brew…

We use time honored and perfected brewing traditions that have been passed down from brewmaster to brewmaster for centuries. These methods are steeped in artisan spirit and have the precision of science. Using these methods, with our state of the art brewing system allows us to produce hand crafted beers that are pure, free of added chemicals and preservatives, full of flavor and rich in character. 
Generations of brewers have combined their knowledge to bring you this pint
Passion for the craft of beer is in every batch we make. Our brewmaster makes beer because he loves beer. The satisfaction of a job well done is confirmed with the good times, new friendships and community that is formed around sharing a great pint.

For the Love of Beer
name: Big Rig Brewery

description: The Big Rip was founded by two friends who caught the beer and wine making bug years ago and decided to throw in together to start this brewery. We don’t have goals of taking over the world or creating beer that only appeals to a select few. Instead, we want to create unique beers that appeal to both beer-nerds and beer-curious people.
name: Big Rip Brewing Company

description: Hand crafted and brewed to perfection, Big River goes to great lengths in serving each guest the freshest beer possible. This commitment to serving nothing but the finest and freshest beer possible has led to numerous awards.
name: Big River Grille & Brewing Works

description:
djoining the restaurant is a 1,950-square-foot brew house, with custom-designed, state-of-the-art equipment. Award-winning Brewmaster Dan Rogers has created four signature beers to complement the restaurant’s distinctive American fare: Norm’s Raggedy Ass Ale, Raymondo El Rojo, Flying Buffalo Stout and Weizenheimer Hefe Weizen. In addition to the four regular beers, Rogers adds a seasonal and specialty brew, which he changes frequently. A testament to their focus on quality, Big Rock Chophouse has been the proud recipient of Gold and Bronze medals at the annual World Beer Championships.   

All beer is available to go by purchasing one of our growlers. Tours of the brew house are also available by request.
name: Big Rock Chop House & Brewery

description: A new addition to Vancouver’s thriving craft beer scene, located in the heart of the Brewery Creek/Mount Pleasant district. Our full scale brewery offers brewery tours and tastings, a beer store with growler fill bar, and also features a full service restaurant & lounge serving beer-inspired dishes with live & local music many nights a week.
name: Big Rock Urban Brewery

description:
It started with a love of beer and a homebrewing kit.

Big Shoulders isn't a big beer company (yet). Hopefully soon we will win a ton of awards, but for right now, we strive to make good beer that everyone can enjoy, no matter where they fall on the beer lover's spectrum.

Our first releases will be Crosstown Wheat and Hopapalooza. Crosstown Wheat is a perfect summer wheat ale brewed with lemongrass and coriander. Hopapalooza is an IPA with nicely balanced aromatic and bittering hops.Both will be available in bottles and kegs in April 2012.
name: Big Shoulders Beer Company

description: Brewing Great Beer in the Northern Rockies Since 1995. We brew beers that we like to drink, and we hope you will enjoy them as well.
name: Big Sky Brewing

description: Big Storm Brewing Co. was founded in 2011 by longtime friends Clay Yarn and Mike Bishop. Using their backgrounds in different areas of business to fuel their passion for beer, they built Big Storm from the ground up together. Now proudly serving the Tampa Bay area with good craft beer, Big Storm Brewing Co brings new meaning to the phrase "hand crafted".
name: Big Storm Brewing Co.

description: We are a production microbrewery with an onsite taproom room located in beautiful Elkins, West Virginia.  We offer our own beers and house made sodas, along with a small selection of snacks in our taproom.
name: Big Timber Brewing

description:
Big Time's brewery is a 14 barrel JV Northwest system consisting of a gas fired brew kettle, an infusion mash tun with mixer, a hot liquor back, a wort cooler, (5) 14 barrel fermenters, (1) bright beer tank, and (20) 7 bbl serving tanks.  

We sell 85% of our beer at the pub but do wholesale a limited number of kegs to a dozen or so Seattle area taverns. We currently brew approximately 1,300 barrels of beer per year
name: Big Time Brewing Company

description:
Big Top Brewing Company is a Sarasota based production brewery. Proudly distributed by Coastal Beverage, Gold Coast Eagle Distributing, Great Bay Distributing, and Pepin Distributing Company.

Having lived here all our lives we know the history behind our beautiful town. Typically seen as a tourist destination for beaches, weather and art, Big Top plans to add world renown beer manufacture to those well deserved titles. We look forward to crafting the best beer, in the best town and showcasing it with the best artwork designed by Ringling School of Art and Design graduates.
name: Big Top Brewing Company

description: Big Ugly Brewing Company is the first microbrewery in Chesapeake, VA. Founded by local craft beer enthusiasts
name: Big Ugly Brewing Company

description: Brewing quality aged beers, one barrel at a time.
name: Big Water Brewery

description: Brewed in Vadnais Heights, MN, Big Wood Brewery is a licensed production brewery that produces distinctive craft brews for distribution throughout MN. Touting its edgy yet playful brand image and unforgettable name among its most distinguishing factors, Big Wood Brewery recognizes that, to stand out in Minnesota, consumers need to be torn away from normalcy. Ambiguity runs rampant among dozens of area breweries, yielding an opportunity for a bold new player to gain notoriety for its brand and its brews.
name: Big Wood Brewery

description: Bigelow Brewing Company is a small family owned startup located in central Maine. In keeping with our new motto, "Out with the horses, in with the brew," our equine facility has recently been renovated into a 3bbl brewery which offers a tasting room for sampling and growler fills. Our current features are two superbly hand crafted ales, Lying Bastard Pale Ale and Dementia Dog Double IPA with additional brews in the works.
name: Bigelow Brewing Company

description:
Bike Dog Brewing Company is co-founded by four Sacramentans with a love for bikes, dogs and craft beer. The brewers fell in love with the endless flavor profiles available through brewing and the delicate hop profiles only available in incredibly fresh beer and want to share that love with beer drinkers from all over the Sacramento area.

Bike Dog is West Sacramento’s first brewery and the only one in town with a tasting room. We operate a 3 barrel brewhouse (industry speak for really small) on site. Brewing small batches means the beer will always be amazingly fresh and allows for the flexibility to mix it up a little with new recipes getting brewed on a regular basis. Because it will be brewed in such small batches, much of the beer will be available only for purchase in the Bike Dog tasting room — allowing customers to see the beer go from grain to glass and hobnob with the brewers and allowing the brewers to personally nurture the local craft beer community.
name: Bike Dog Brewing Company

description: Bike Rack Brewing Co., Bentonville’s first brewery, hand-crafts extraordinary ales using quality ingredients and local inspiration.
name: Bike Rack Brewing Co.

description:
When something is truly exceptional it earns your loyalty. That’s why we named our beer after George Vanderbilt’s beloved St. Bernard, Cedric. Family photographs capture moments of Cedric enjoying sunshine on the Loggia and sneaking in quiet naps in the library. Wherever George was, Cedric was sure to follow. That’s the kind of loyalty that inspires us to craft a quality beer—a beer worth your loyalty.

In fact, we’d been thinking of creating a line of Biltmore beers bearing Cedric’s name for many years. Then, when the decision was made to open a tavern on the estate, aptly named Cedric’s Tavern, as part of the new Antler Hill Village, the opportunity presented itself to turn the idea of producing a line of beer into reality. That’s how Biltmore Brewing Company was established.

Each beer in Cedric’s line is crafted to the exacting standards that George Vanderbilt appreciated and is made in the traditional English style. Craft beer enthusiast and newly appointed manager of Cedric’s Tavern, Bryan McIntosh has led the style selection of these new brews.
name: Biltmore Brewing Company

description:
Bindlesticks are the iconic symbols of early 20th century America and what the hobos used to carry their belongings when they traveled from town to town looking for work. What they carried in those bags are tastes and experiences from each of the locations they visited.

A time when each town had a different beer that highlighted local ingredients. We wish to resurrect some of these fine brews from old as well as new creations celebrating the variety and flavor.

We will highlight local ingredients that show how beautiful this great state of Texas is!
name: Bindlestick Brewery

description:
Binghamton Brewing Co. was founded in 2011 with the idea to bring craft beer back to Binghamton. We pride ourselves on interesting brews and creating an atmosphere where customers receive the utmost level of service and have an amazing amount of fun while doing so.

Lead by Kristen Lyons & Jason Gardner the vision of Binghamton Brewing Co. is to create a place that is unique and fun. The vision is to use a systemic design to enhance the customer experience and to use technology in a whole new way.
name: Binghamton Brewing Company

description:
Birbeck's Brewing Company will redefine Australian beer by offering full flavoured craft beers moving Australian beer away from the ordinary to the extraordinary.

Birbeck's beers are well crafted beers designed for the Australian climate and palate. By taking traditional beer styles and an innovative approach, Birbeck’s Brewing beers will offer high quality approachable beers for all occasions.

The name Birbeck originates from a hamlet in North West England and in old Norse means birch wood by the stream. Drawing on this family history Birbeck's beers will focus on innovative new styles of beers perfect for the Australian climate as well as some traditional English styles. Approachable, easy drinking and hoppy.

The first beer released by Birbeck's Brewing is Four Brothers, a well balanced and hoppy Australian interpretation of the IPA style.

The second beer to be released by Birbeck's Brewing is The Captain, a refreshing beer full of complex malt flavours and strong hop presence. An Australian Mild Ale, The Captain is a beer for any occasion.
name: Birbeck's Brewing Company

description: Bird Brain Brewing Co was founded in 2013 with the goal of producing the highest quality and best tasting beer available and bringing it to the masses.
name: Bird Brain Brewing Co.

description:
Birdboy Brewing company is a locally owned and operated Fort Wayne brewery committed to offering the city's finest craft beer.  We hope to be open and have beer on tap around town july 2015. Stay tuned to our facebook and twitter for the most up to date info!
​
Around 1910, a 16 year old kid in Fort Wayne decided he wanted to be a pilot.  He designed a plane and built it with $1800 fom his parents after they had mortgaged their home.  Anxious to try his new design, he promptly flew and crashed the plane, demolishing it.  He redesigned and successfully flew his plane, possibly making him the first person in Fort Wayne to fly on his own.  This earned him the name Birdboy.  After making a name for himself locally, Birdboy travelled the country and the world, all the while updating and refining his design.  He became a huge influence on aviation throughout the world, and Smith Field here in Fort Wayne is named after him. 
 
Through Birdboy Brewing, we hope to embrace Birdboy's adventurous spirit by offering new and exciting choices in the local beer scene.
name: Birdboy Brewing Company

description: Genuinely handcrafted ales and lagers brewed in Columbiana, Ohio.
name: Birdfish Brewing Co.

description: Belgian ales, Farmhouse Flavors. Open fermentation in the upstate - Progressively Old School
name: Birds Fly South

description:
Birdsong Brewing is Charlotte’s newest microbrewery.  Birdsong was founded in 2011 with a quest for better beer and a 5 gallon soup kettle. Our vision is similar to many of our favorite craft brewing mentors who have inspired us to open our own brewery: We strive to brew flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers for distribution in the Charlotte, NC area.  
 
We are located in NoDa at 26th & North Davidson and we started retail distribution and tap room sales in December 2011.  Our goal is to create outstanding beer, to have a low impact on the environment, and to create personal relationships and ties to the local community. 
 
We have 7 owners and an extremely talented brewer - Conor Robinson. 
 
Our inspiration comes from the popular and innovative styles of the West Coast brewers and is fueled by Conor's Passion and ability to construct unique yet sessionable recipes.  We're excited to add to the growing craft beer movement in Charlotte and the Carolinas.
name: Birdsong Brewing Co.

description:
Birdsview Brewing Company started in July 2006.  It is a small family run craft brewery located in the beatuiful North Cascades in NW Washington State.

Kids & families are always welcome inside.  The outdoor beer garden is 21 and over
name: Birdsview Brewing Company

description: Almond '22 beers are produced by hand and fermented in the bottle with Champagne method. In order to preserve the organoleptic qualities, they are not subjected to filtration and pasteurization.  All processing steps are performed manualme
name: Birra Almond '22

description:
Passion, tradition and high quality are the beer Amarcord

Italy, Rimini: a great city told by a great film director Federico Fellini with his film Amarcord (Oscar winner in 1975). Amarcord, it becomes beer carrying the values of traditional Italian and delicious flavors of the Mediterranean. With the best malts, with the finest hops and pure water beers are born of excellence.

Created with passion by our brewers, craft beers Amarcord soon become the most famous and sold in Italy.
name: Birra Amarcord

description:
Craft brewery which seeks to enhance its production through the clear waters of the ancient volcano (Mount Amiata) and typical local products such as chestnuts (recognized PGI), saffron and honey thorn Maremma

Birra Amiata uses the finest ingredients of real beer, not pasteurized, making the public to rediscover the flavor of an old product
name: Birra Amiata

description: Curiosa cerveza oriental
name: Birra Bizarra

description: In accordance with the best quality standards, Birra Flea uses a very pure water and a high quality malt. malts used in the brewing process are obtained from 100% italian barleys, grown in our own lands, in order to guarantee a short distribution chain. we don’t use unmalted grains. our beers are both unfiltered and unpasteurized, and refermented in the bottle in order to preserve their original organoleptic properties, without the addition of chemical additives.
name: Birra Flea

description: Just outside Merano, on the way to the Val Venosta, a complex of buildings perfectly in keeping with their surroundings catches the eye. They are decorated in a graceful, highly tasteful manner and almost blend in with the flourishing local vegetation. Anyone who is curious enough to ask the name of this “village” – because that is what it looks like at first sight – will simply receive the answer “That’s FORST”. It is not called the “beer factory” or the “brewery”, but “FORST”. The name is inherently linked with the local area. It stands for tradition and love for nature, but also striving to ensure that the quality of its products remains consistently high. Traditional and modern values go hand in hand, making positive contributions to each other: this is the guiding concept of FORST.
name: Birra Forst

description:
Beer is an art and Drive Beer knows it well. Starting from this assumption, in 1999 The Tarricone Family takes over a factory, built in the '80es upon instruction of HM the Prince of Windisgraetz of the Austrian Family of Furstenberg who then bought the Prinz Brau Group. Later, in the '90es, this latter was acquired together with the Birra Moretti Group, by the Labatt Group.
In the next years, the Moretti-Prinz Brau Group was acquired by Interbrau and eventually by Heineken.
The entire know-how and the workers themselves have been kept by Drive Beer, thus assuring a continuity in the excellence of the brands produced. 
The art of manufacturing fermented products and yeasts management is in the DNA of the Tarricone Family. Precisely, in the first years of 1900, the ancestor Giuseppe Tarricone owned several vineyards and produced an excellent wine. He was producing and selling his wine all across the inland of Lucania transporting it on his picturesque chariots drawn by horses. 
He then moved the company office to Atella (PZ), and then to Bella (PZ), and eventually, bewitched by the beautiful landscape and the extraordinary nature of the surroundings of Muro Lucano (PZ), he settled down, together with his entire family of Corato origins, he married a Muro Lucano girl, whose name was Concetta Bianchini.
Therefore, when in 1999 the Tarricone Family was suggested by Gerardo, one of the sons of the ancestor Giuseppe Tarricone, to take over the Brewery, belonging to the Heineken Group, it was almost physiological to the five brothers, Giuseppe, Vito, Carlo, Federico e Fabrizio, who at that time were expanding their businesses linked somehow to the food and beverages sectors, to accept this "challenge", which represented for the Tarricone Family a "return to the origins".
The Drive Beer, an industry of the national market, has managed to impose itself as a beer pole, entirely Italian, competing with the most famous multinational companies.
Finally, the Company, based on the remarkable approvals made by operators, has then invested time and resources by recurring to the skills of expert advisors for realising an distributing the products.
name: Birra Morena

description: Beer Toccalmatto began producing Fidenza in October 2008 with a facility to be cooked to 550 Liters. This is the culmination of a dream of founder Bruno personnel Carillo, who after several managerial experience in the food and beer in particular, has the idea to start producing craft beer.
