The passion for beer lives of British and Belgian tradition from a project with three other friends, and the beginning of this new adventure.
name: Birra Toccalmatto

description: Now open in Red Bank, New Jersey. Birravino is located at 183 Riverside Avenue in Red Bank in an open, Industrial-era inspired space. Birravino is a new restaurant concept created by Vic Rallo, host of Eat! Drink! Italy! on Create TV. Over the past 10 years, Vic has been fortunate enough to travel to Italy more than 20 times, discovering the delicious food, wine and culture of the Italian people. During his journeys, Vic has cooked and eaten in both obscure and off-the-beaten path Italian kitchens, as well as restaurants run by famous Michelin starred chefs. These experiences have encouraged Vic to share his passion.
name: Birravino

description: Birreria is a rooftop restaurant and brewery that offers the highest quality beer and food under the stars and skyline. In collaboration with Sam Calagione of Dogfish Head, Teo Musso of Baladin and Leonardo Di Vincenzo of Birra Del Borgo, Eataly's Head Brewer is brewing unfiltered, unpasteurized and naturally carbonated Cask Ales just 30 feet from where you sit, eat and drink. Each is served through traditional hand pumps, at the perfect temperature, so you can enjoy our beers in the most natural and traditional way. The menu conjures the family style feasts of an Italy influenced by Austria and Germany. The focus on hearty fare feels convivial and comforting (deeply flavorful mushroom entrees, beer braised pork shoulder, housemade sausages and grilled meats). Don't worry about the weather,  our retractable roof and heaters keeps us open in all seasons; rain, shine or snow!
name: Birreria

description: It is the place where it all started. There would be much to say and tell it to start back over the key dates. In 1986, Teo decides, with his partner then Michelle, a pretty young French dancer, to open in Piozzo, a small town unknown to the door of the Langhe where he was born, a "creperie"! He rents a former "tavern" with an attached mini apartment on the top floor and a gravel courtyard on the back and opens its doors. At first, his passion for beer, and a little 'light his aversion for wine led him to fill the menu with more than two hundred references international beers, as well as dainties to enjoy to work alongside the crepes. Gradually, the goodness of the choices made ​​good name and port customers to small local baptized "Le Baladin" by his friend François of CIRQUE BIDON in homage to the nature of Teo same. Years went by and the room expands, you change, you will see a big circus tent to cover the courtyard paved with gravel now tables and chairs in style "Oktoberfest" and hand in hand also changes his mentor: Nora is now its new companion and muse together and decide a new course of the local : transform the creperie in a brewpub! After months of study and travel with Nora to discover Belgian brewers have our hero returns with huge bins loaded onto a van Volkswagen Westfalia and places them in the garage of the ousted former owner of the house, adjacent to the restaurant, now transformed into a microbrewery. So begins the adventure productive BEER BALADIN that sees just two beers "taxes" to the regulars who frequent the pub goers somewhat perplexed and embarrassed to taste these first, honestly a bit 'adventurous productions Teo. Over time, the production will be moved to other places for sizing issues and logistics, but still the aura of magic that permeated the early days of the brewery remains unchanged. Today, large kitchen has taken the place of the production and in the pub beers are on tap now classic carnet baladiniano as well as all production in the bottle. Occasionally a few small tweaks gives customers reason of surprise and veiled "Amarcord" in which one of them remembers the beginnings of this place, now a destination for "pilgrimage" by many fans of the beer world. It is always a place where good food is accompanied not only by our beers but by good music and by the sympathy of the staff who always has a smile for everyone and where it is customary to a friendly "welcome", a hello and a good day to all those who pass through it if only for a small beer refreshing.
name: Birrificia Le Baladin

description: The Adventure of the Fort Brewery was founded in 2010 as "obligatory" stop of a journey undertaken several years ago. The strong passion for craft beer has made known, wowed us and filled our lives more and more, up to actively involve us as organizers of major events and competitions at local and national level. Over the years, our experience and knowledge of the field is increased up to us to develop the skills necessary to give life to our project: a craft brewer in Versilia.
name: Birrificio del Forte

description: Grado Plato Brewery was founded in 2003 in Chieri in the province of Turin, and based upon an idea by Sergio and Gabriele Ormea to open a venue that could brew beer independently. Grado Plato Brewpub started off with two  recipes - Sveva, a blond beer and Spoon River, a red beer. Besides producing its own beer, the pub was characterised by its cuisine, with recipes based on the world of beer but also on snails - a true delicacy for aficionados.
name: Birrificio Grado Plato

description: In 1996 when the first beer was drawn in Lambrate Brewery there were 3 business partners. They produced 2 beers using the brewing system of 150 l and the pub was open every other day. Today there are 5 business partners and dozens of people working here, 18 beers brewed and the equipments with the output capacity of 2000 l per batch. Everyone of our top staff members: Alessandra, Fabio, Paolo, Davide and Giampaolo has their own mission to accomplish in the Brewpub – in the office, in the kitchen, in the pub and in the brewery. Lambrate Brewery is recognised as a national reference point: the quality of beers is impeccable, the high level cuisine goes way beyond a standard pub, the way clients are served makes everyone come back here and wait for a perfect draft beer. The success of the brewery, apart from the Pub, lies in the fact that the most part of the produced beer is bottled and sold to other pubs, in both, bottles and kegs. The passion and eagerness of this group will take you to a new and unforgettable experience.
name: Birrificio Lambrate

description:
Il Birrificio Rurale nasce nel 2009 dall'idea di cinque appassionati birrofili che hanno voluto ritrovare le origini agricole della birra in un territorio a forte vocazione rurale.
​Per questa ragione il Birrificio vede la luce ospite di una realtà agricola, valorizzando quella struttura che un tempo immagazzinava il raccolto annuale: il silos.
name: Birrificio Rurale

description: Born to provide the thriving community that surrounds Biscayne Bay with a great bright beer to match the words used by Ponce de Leon to describe it as "a bright, nameless great bay" upon its discovery 500 years ago. Chequescha, as it was called then by the Tequesta Indians, was a natural estuary with "fresh springs in the rocks" according to Don Ponce in 1513. Then, like today, it is the lifeblood of a community that depends on its nourishment to survive. We will live up to this legacy by making a product that nourishes and brings great joy, while honoring the earliest settlers and pioneers who built the foundation of the thriving city we stand in today.
name: Biscayne Bay Brewing Company

description:
Bison is committed to brewing quality organic craft beer that not only tastes great but helps to reduce your carbon footprint by offering carbon offsets to customers.

A Certified B Corporation
name: Bison Brewing Company

description:
Bissell Brothers was born out of a desire to make something from our deepest interests and passions that would become a separate entity; greater than the individual sums of its creators.
We believe that great beer comes from a commitment to be constantly challenging the perceptions of what different styles of beers can actually become. The second we settle, the second we say that a beer has been taken as far as it can go, we start losing. The proverbial mountaintop exists only in our minds. Always be climbing, always be pushing forward.

The next, and equally important commitment, is to the process. There is serenity to be found in even the most menial, repetitive task. There are always ways to improve yourself and your methods, hiding just below the surface.

The parties, jokes, and fun we seem to be having? We have created our own world in which to reside, and we love sharing it with all those that want to partake. I promise you, there is no greater joy, professionally.

The painfully fleeting span of the human life is much too short and precious to spend it being anything less than the best you can possibly be in your chosen vocation. We love the work we do, for its own sake. We spend every day trying to get better, and we treat the opportunity to give this beer to the people of Maine every week as the gift that it is.

Thank you for drinking.
name: Bissell Brothers

description: New Mexican products from grass-fed beef to fresh craft beers!
name: Bistronomy B2B

description: Bitburger is one of the leading breweries in Germany. Since 1817 the beer is brewed to the highest standards and of course according to the German Purity Law. Our products are Bitburger Premium Pils, Bitburger Radler, Bitburger Cola, Bitburger Alcohol-free, alcohol-free and Bitburger Radler Bitburge r Light. We support many sports, however, a special passion is football. We are since 1992, an official partner of the DFB and the German national soccer team. In addition, we promote different football clubs from the regional to the Bundesliga.
name: Bitburger Brauerei

description: We are a Small Artisan Nano-Brewery!  We specialize in English inspired American Ales and Belgian-style Farmhouse Ales.  We use only the finest barley, grown and malted all over the world.  We use hops that are grown all over the world as well.  If you are noticing a theme our beers are unique to each time we brew therefore we need to tap the expert farmers and craftsman worldwide to get these wonderful and unique ingredients.  We have six ales on draft at any one time and our Dry stout and Brown Ale are the only reoccurring beers.  We brew farmhouse ales that are different every batch we brew.
name: Bitter Ester's Brewhouse

description:
Bitter Old Fecker Rustic Ales, based in Chelsea, Michigan, is a small batch brewery started by Nathan Hukill, an entrepreneur with an ideal lineage for brewing craft beer. His great grandparents were bootleggers in Detroit, running booze from Canada, who also ran a blind pig speakeasy out of their basement. Detroit police (including the Chief) were their main clientele. His great grandmother also made beer in her kitchen for the guys at the brickyard where she worked.

Nathan's grandfather Cecil -- rail worker, 17-year Ford employee turned weird angry recluse -- left Detroit for Hillsdale, MI to start farming. Cecil started brewing in the early 80's, naming beers after the things that inspired the recipes and included ingredients he grew or foraged. 

After some frustration with trying to break into brewing, Nathan started Bitter Old Fecker, working under Cecil as an apprentice. During the start up process, Nathan took a job as an assistant brewer at Grizzly Peak, leaving after 18 months to focus efforts on Bitter Old Fecker exclusively. 

Nathan and Cecil produce high gravity, bold beers brewed in a "rustic" style. No automatic equipment. Kettles, mash tuns, etc., stirred by hand in a brewery that can literally produce beer without the use of electricity. All beers are barrel-aged and include non traditional, foraged and locally sourced ingredients. All malt and hops are 100% US grown. His first brew, introduced in the Summer of 2013, is called Strutter, named after a nasty old rooster on Cecil's farm. Darlin', Kaplan, and Jet are brews that are soon to follow.
name: Bitter Old Fecker Rustic Ales

description: Production brewery located in Addison, TX.
name: Bitter Sisters Brewing Company

description:
To brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

At BJ's we recognize that brewing is both an art and a science.

We also respect the vast variety of beer styles that the world has to offer - from the delicate balance of German Kolsch to the robust intensity of Russian Imperial Stout.

Our Passionate and talented team of brewers strives toward one simple goal: to brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.
name: BJ's Restaurant and Brewery

description:
Black Acre Brewing Co. is a new small batch brewery located in Irvington, Indiana. The idea for Black Acre initially was conceived in 2010 due to our love of brewing, great beer, and the beer community at large. We created Black Acre with the goal of contributing delicious and unique beers to the community in which we live.

Black Acre hand crafts its ales using a custom fabricated 3 barrel electric brewing system. The brewery will produce four house beers along with an ever rotating selection of seasonal and specialty beers. Distribution will be primarily though in house tap room sales although there will be limited outside distribution. Our beers are not ready quite yet, but stop by for a glass of one of our delicious guest taps and meet the staff.
name: Black Acre Brewing Company

description: Black Bear Brewery is Orono’s family owned and operated microbrewery. We pride ourselves in our hand-crafted small-batch beers made using only the highest quality ingredients and the greatest care to bring you the finest quality products. We hope you enjoy them as much as we do.
name: Black Bear Microbrew

description:
Black Bottle Brewery is a fancy Beer Bar that brews beer on site and has guest taps. The delicious beers are complimented with great small plates/Tapas.

The mission at Black Bottle Brewery is to create world-class and unique handcrafted ales and lagers. Going against the grain of the traditional craft brewing industry, BBB prides itself on the use of radical ingredients, brewing styles, and techniques.

BBB is devoted to providing a unique and innovative drinking environment, enhanced by great food. We are committed to sourcing food and ingredients locally, thus giving back to our community. BBB's staff will focus on customer education and great service, and the Company will employ only those who share our passion for high-quality beer and food
name: Black Bottle Brewery

description: The owners Greg Bentley and Jim Waller have fulfilled their dream of opening a brewpub. Passionate about beer and people, Greg and Jim are sharing their love for brewing with the community. We have four regular beers on tap and four rotating taps. We offer beers that appeal a broad range of tastes and experience levels. Our menu includes panini sandwiches, soup, cheese boards, cheese dip and desserts. We also have Allegro wine. Free tours every Saturday at 4pm.
name: Black Cap Brewing Company

description: The concept for Black Couch Brewery was developed in late 2008 by three close friends, William Cook, Travis Morgan, and Dave Svec. After sampling one of the earliest batches of our flagship product, American Homecoming Pale Ale, we realized very quickly that it tasted better than even the most popular beer brands available in the regional marketplace. We were sure that others would enjoy our beer, and the positive responses from tasters everywhere have reinforced our belief in the quality and taste. We are committed to developing unique and flavorful beers, using the finest ingredients available. We are currently in the planning stages of the brewery and hope to have it up and running in the Washington D.C. area in late 2010 or early 2011.
name: Black Couch Brewery

description:
Black Creek Historic Brewery recreates the techniques, tools and recipes used by brewers in 1860s Ontario. Our Brewmasters do everything by hand on a small scale. It's a great place to learn about beer because, unlike a modern commercial brewery, you can see every step in the process for yourself. And, no one else has a Brewmaster ready to welcome visitors in period costume.

In the 1860s there were 155 registered breweries in Ontario, and countless smaller operations. Black Creek Historic Brewery is the first in this province to replicate the brewing processes of that era, when there was no electricity or refrigeration, no stainless steel tanks or bottling plants.

The equipment at Black Creek Historic Brewery is made mainly of wood and copper, and the beer ferments the way it was done in the old days, with wooden barrels to age the beer. Malted barley is shoveled by hand into the wort tun where it is boiled into a mash. After filtering the solids through a linen cloth, the sugary liquid is boiled and hops are added, both for flavouring and as a natural preservative. Once the boiling is complete, the beer is put in barrels where the yeast is added. A short time later, the beer is ready!

Visitors can sample the beer at cellar temperature, the way it was enjoyed in the past, or drink a chilled pint in the pub, the way many people prefer it today. Either way, you’ll be tasting the authentic flavours of ales and porters made by hand, using only natural ingredients and genuine period recipes.

Visit the Black Creek Historic Brewery. It’s interesting. It’s fun. And the beer is great!
name: Black Creek Historic Brewery

description: Unwind after a day on the slopes or, more likely, a day in the office, with a hand-crafted Black Diamond brew at our Concord brewing facility. Your taste buds will immediately appreciate the finest of ingredients that go into making our exceptionally refreshing and flavorful beers, and you will feel right at home in our welcoming Tap Room. Sample some of our famous ales and enjoy a tour of our brewery - you will quickly realize why our seasoned Brewmaster is a multiple award-winning brewer. You have worked hard. Give yourself a break. Let Black Diamond Brewing help you and your friends dial down from a day of 'shredding' on the slopes or at the office.
name: Black Diamond Brewing Company

description: Black Dog Brewery was launched in late November 2011.  We are a craft brewery located at Taminick Cellars winery near Glenrowan in North East Victoria.  Our beers are hand crafted from premium malted barley, hops and yeast strains with pure Warby Range water.  Hand crafted, small batch brews made using traditional techniques and no preservatives, ensures each beer is of the highest quality, the way beers are meant to be.
name: Black Dog Brewery

description: Deep in the heart of rural Roscommon, in the village of Ballinlough, a brewery grows. Brewing without boundaries, Black Donkey Brewing, a concept that has come of age, has finally found a place to call home. Traditionally cautious animals, this Donkey is not one to shy away from turbid mashes, spontaneous fermentation, wood ageing, smoked malts, coolships, or anything else we can come up with, to bring you the best, and most diverse, beers we can make. Production began in mid 2014, bringing Irish, European, American and historical brewing influences together under one roof, and onto the rapidly growing and increasingly exciting Irish craft-brewing scene.
name: Black Donkey Brewing

description:
If you love beer as much as we do, your dreams have come true at Black Dragon Brewery! From award-winning beers conjured up and brewed right here at Black Dragon Brewery to local beers from our fellow Sacramento area brewers, our ever-changing tap selection will quench even the mightiest of thirsts. 

And for the dragon slayer who likes to go it alone, Woodland Homebrew Supply has all the brewing ingredients, brewing supplies, and brewing classes needed to make a beer of your very own that's worthy of knighthood!
name: Black Dragon Brewery

description:
Based in Port Macquarie, the Black Duck Brewery offers a friendly, relaxed venue to try the range of locally brewed beers while you catch up with friends and family or just enjoy your break.
 With the full range beers on tap, local food platters, local produce, and much more to come, the Black Duck Brewery is a must visit destination on the Mid North Coast.
Spend some time, meet the brewer, do the tour and experience the Black Duck Brewery.

To ensure satisfaction, all the Black Duck Brewery beers are 
brewed and packaged on site. We do occasionally carry another small brewery's beer on tap to both support them and give you another beer experience.

Non beer drinkers can enjoy some Apple Cider, a glass of local wine, some local soft drink or even a deliciously well crafted locally roasted coffee.

The Ploughman’s platters are popular with a generous serve of 
local beer bread, ham, olives, relish and a few other tasty goodies.
The brewery hours are 10am to 6pm Thursday and Friday, 10am to 4pm Saturday and Sunday. 

You can find us at 6B Acacia Avenue, Port Macquarie.
You can give the brewer a call on 0407 874 474 if you want to know more. 
Give us a call if you have a group and want some nibbles to ensure we have plenty.
name: Black Duck Brewery

description:
The Black Forest Brew Haus is the end result of two great countries combining their greatest attributes. Germany’s rich history and excellence in beer brewing -and consumption- combined with America’s ongoing pursuit for perfection have made us an award winning brewery with a menu to please all palates.

Black Forest’s mother company, Privatbrauerei Hoepfner of Karlsrue, Germany has been brewing since 1798 and shares its knowledge & tradition with the Black Forest Brew Haus including materials, recipes and equipment. All Black Forest beer is fresh brewed on our premises using only the finest imported yeast, hops, malt and the purest filtered water. 

Our brew master uses modern technology and respect for German tradition to produce award winning beer for our customers, and creates new recipes that will excite even the most jaded of beer connoisseurs. This is what sets the Black Forest Brew Haus apart from all other brew pubs.
name: Black Forest Brew Haus

description:
It starts with a man and his three sons on a march up a twenty degree slope that would last about ten miles… filled with thousands of escapades. Searching for and finally stumbling upon our perfect campsite… gathering firewood before the darkness of night descends, pitching tents, and settling in for the quiet of the mountain. Finally relaxing our weary feet next to a crackling fire, dreams of opening a brewery were discussed. The forty-two mile trail seemed to be never ending, never easy, and sure as hell never flat, but we never let it beat us. Now after years of planning and formulating, we can say “cheers” to the Black Forest Trail and honor the magical nights spent hiking its dark forest floors by opening our doors to the Black Forest Brewery. The trail has shown us that no matter the ascents and descents we travel, life is worth the vistas we see along the way.

As we open our Lancaster Brewery, we reminisce with friends and family about our commitment to making this journey a reality. With the support of many, we have turned the corner and proudly introduce you to the True Tavern Ales of the Black Forest Brewery each of them a labor of love (and lots of laughter)! Our goal is to make your experience at our Lancaster Brewery one that you will not soon forget. Our brewery and tasting room offer a warm, inviting atmosphere that begs you to “belly up” and share a laugh and a story. Our beer names are tied to local history and our favorite backpacking trail, and we look forward to sharing our stories of the past and how it ties to our future as a Lancaster Brewery and our new hometown of Ephrata.
name: Black Forest Brewery

description: Each of our Black Fox Meadery recipes uses only the finest Honey, Fruit and Spices to combine for a great tasting Mead. Ingredients are all sourced locally in Florida, as close to Palm Harbor as we can get. Our batches are carefully crafted by caring hands, 5 gallons a time ! Experience our quality for yourself.
name: Black Fox Meadery

description:
We are Black Heart Brewery; we are a home brewery located in Binghamton, New York, and we are in the process of becoming a nanobrewery. Coincidentally, these web pages are in the process of becoming our website. We are overhauling the whole thing, adding much more content, as well as many more new sections. 

Black Heart Brewery was founded many batches of home brew ago between two high school friends, Brett Martin and Jay Maslar. See what happens when you seat people in alphabetical order? We currently brew 10 gallon all grain batches on our custom, hand made heat exchange recirculating mash system; it is named HERMES. It is capable of fully automated brewing and extremely accurate data display and recording with our cutting edge Brewtroller 4.0.
name: Black Heart Brewery

description: Black Heart Brewery are producers of exceptional hand-crafed beers. From our signature Weizen with it's polarising taste, to our Dunkelweizen with it's light and dark complexity, these aren't your average beers.
name: Black Heart Brewery

description:
Black Hog Brewing started with the story of food, family, and a love for craft beer. Brothers Jason and Tom Sobocinski come from a Polish/Italian family where food and drink is always the focus of every gathering. From Jason’s wedding to his son’s birthdays, roasting a pig has become the favorite way to celebrate any special occasion. Tyler Jones, an old family friend and former brewer of The Portsmouth Brewery in New Hampshire, contacted Jason and Tom with a plan to move to New Haven so his wife and son could be closer to their family. With a plan in the works to form a brewery that would celebrate family and food, they needed to encompass all that they were passionate about. When they celebrate, they roast a hog and the Berkshire hog is the breed of choice, thus Black Hog brewing was born! 

Black Hog Brewing (BHB) will have a strong tie to local agriculture with a focus on unique craft brews that are pleasant to drink and pair well with foods of all types. Black Hog Brewing will craft year round and seasonal brews with a seasonal Farm Land Series dedicating a percentage of proceeds to support CT Farm Land. 3-4 pig roasts per year, using CT raised Berkshire pigs fed our spent brewing grains will celebrate the release of our seasonal brews. We hope you’ll enjoy Black Hog Brewing Company at one of our pig roasts soon or whatever occasion brings you together for great beer and food with friends and family.
name: Black Hog Brewing Company

description:
Our Taproom features a modern yet casual atmosphere where can enjoy a rotating selection of fine craft beer, wine, homemade sangria, whiskey, as well as some light fare. We will be offering special events and live music. Our beautiful outdoor area will feature a covered 12 foot farm table, covered standing bar area, bocce ball court, darts, gas and wood burning fire pits, and a relaxing garden.
 
We are so excited to announce the arrival of Harley Guy as our new Gastropub chef at the Blackhole taproom. The new menu is focused on seasonal homemade food with a unique point of view. Stay tuned for updated menu items.
name: Black Hole Beer Company

description: Making the world a better place one beer at a time, and to promote the joys of jodeling. Hoping to one day have a reality show called "Jodeling with the Stars."
name: Black Husky Brewing LLC

description:
Welcome to Black Isle Brewery. We are the UK's premier organic brewery making world class beers from the finest organic malt and hops grown on farms without chemicals, as nature intended.

We have our own organic farm where we grow malting barley for brewing. We even have our own brewery house cow, called Molly, who eats the malt from the brewery mash tun and gives us 20 pints of fresh creamy milk every day.

Based near Inverness, the capital of the Highlands of Scotland, it is our beautiful, unspoilt, unpolluted, wild, and not a little bit wet highland home - and we love it!
name: Black Isle Brewing Company

description: We strive to provide a solid beer by using as many organic and locally sourced ingredients as possible. We believe that knowing what goes in to each pint of beer, and more importantly, what doesn’t, is of the upmost importance. At BLBC we take the craft of brewing beer to the next level by producing as many ingredients in our beers as possible. We farm our own hops, honey, corn, raspberries, blackberries, and other ingredients. We are not certified organic, but we do farm using the same practices without the use of harmful herbicides and pesticides. We strive to perfect every pint of beer from the seed all the way to your pint glass!
name: Black Label Brewing Company

description:
Mark Harper, Michael Allan and his wife Jodi Allan (Mark’s sister) founded Black Lotus Brewing Company in 2006.  Their family business formed when Mark (a school psychologist and musician) and Mike (a financial planner and banker) both longed for more creative and spiritual control over their careers.  Disheartened by massive corporate entities serving up inferior products, Mark and Mike, together with Jodi (a high school educator) created the philosophy: “Think Global, Drink Local. “

Under this philosophy Black Lotus is committed to providing quality-handcrafted products to each and every one of its customers.  Furthermore, these products are to be served to the customer with timeliness, friendliness and individualized care.   In addition, Black Lotus is committed to the notion that this care should be extended to the community at large and the world when possible.  This is accomplished by supporting charitable contributions and activities that bring the world more creation, more compassion, more art, more tastefulness, and more peace.
name: Black Lotus Brewing Company

description:
Black Market produces high-quality, handcrafted beer.

HUMBLE BEGINNINGS. ALWAYS GREAT BEER.
A small budget, tight resources, and big goals are what Our first brews were made out of at a small warehouse that was, more realistically, a large garage. On that small 1 bbl brewing system we pinned our dreams and created the much-loved Hefeweizen.

FINEST QUALITY INGREDIENTS, FRESHEST QUALITY RESULTS
With big dreams for a mircobrewery, Black Market opened to put Temecula, California on the map with a commitment to use only the best malt, hops and yeast­, all selected by hand to ensure quality.  The results were award-winning products with a reputation for craft excellence.

GREAT BEER FROM WINE COUNTRY
As one of Temecula’s first craft breweries, Black Market introduced locally brewed beers to the community. Now found far beyond Temecula, Black Market beers are on shelves and in establishments throughout Southern California, Arizona and Washington.

LEADING A MOVEMENT
Like many craft breweries before us, we have followed stories of those who came before us. We’re proud to have launched the movement in Temecula, to keep inspiring the next waves of great beer with our success, and to continue to lead through our quality process, experimental hop releases, and innovative beers.
name: Black Market Brewing Company

description: An Oklahoma City Brewery, striving to create world class beers. Thank you for supporting Craft Beer and making the choice to drink local!
name: Black Mesa Brewing Co.

description: For Crazy Ed Chilleen, beer was too important to be trusted to outsiders, so, in 1989, he started brewing his own. The beer was good, that the yuppies started driving in from all over to try it. Something had to be done! So, whenever one of them whined for a wedge of lime, Ed put a hot serrano chili pepper into the beer instead. Amazingly, many of them actually liked the stuff.
name: Black Mountain Brewing Company

description: Established in 1999, Black Oak makes great tasting, slow brewed, all malt, authentic hand crafted beer that's true to style. Both our delicious Pale Ale and Nut Brown Ale are gold medal winners in the national Great Canadian Brewing Awards. All our beers focus on Quality, Character and Consistency.
name: Black Oak Brewing Company

description:
We (Mike and Cory) started brewing in January 2010 because we both love beer. It didn't take long before the act, the ideas, and the processes of brewing began to take over our lives. Shortly thereafter we dubbed ourselves Black Pond Brews, after a pond where we had some fun and memorable times in Woodstock, CT. Within no time we were entering our beers into homebrew competitions and they were met with immediate success. Spurred by this success and by the constant clamoring of our friends and family to make more beer, we really began to ask ourselves: how do we turn this passion for producing beer into a commercial reality?
 
Our project is not only valuable to us, but to the community in which we will operate.  Our beautiful, quiet town of Danielson, CT will become a destination for anyone who loves beer, be they local or travellers.  Who doesn't love beer?  Further, who doesn't love MORE beer to try?!
 
What inspires us?
The ability to write or create something unique, something revolutionary. Clara Barton once said “I defy the tyranny of precedent. I go for anything new that might improve the past". Such a philosophy is inherent in the way we approach brewing. Breweries often spend much of their time and effort looking back to past recipes- often times as far back as the inception of brewing itself- but what of the future? What new ideas and flavors can we explore? We are always pushing the envelope against the grain- but our guiding star will always be uncompromising flavor of the highest quality.
name: Black Pond Brews

description: The Black Raven is a true neighborhood brewery with a small retail taproom. We are the Eastside’s home to world-class, small-batch brewed ales & lagers. We also feature a continually changing hand-picked selection of other notable Washington State beers. And most importantly, home to local beer lovers who want to be a part of a community that enjoys great beer and great friends.
name: Black Raven Brewing Company

description: Since 1992 Black Sheep Brewery has been brewing fantastic beers in the heart of the Yorkshire Dales.
name: Black Sheep Brewery

description: An artisanal brewing company that combines classic and timeless technique coupled with progressive innovation and unwavering commitment to quality to create the very pinnacle of beer. Our hand-crafted, hand-bottled beer will be available in fine restaurants and select retail establishments soon.
name: Black Shirt Brewing Company

description: Beer.Pizza.Metal. Black Sky has 23 taps featuring in-house and guest brews, and serves a distinct New Haven Style Pizza. Daily lunch specials and happy hours!
name: Black Sky Brewery

description: The idea and the name were first thought of back in 2007 and incorporated in 2010. Dominating Beer and Coffee Since Yesterday!
name: Black Squirrel Brewing Company, LLC

description:
With a special focus on local producers, the basic mission of the Black Star Co-op is to foster an environment in which member-owners, as well as the general public, may realize the principles of co-operative ownership, worker self-management, education and community action through the responsible enjoyment great beer and food.

As the first enterprise of this type, we seek to realize an alternative business model for brewpubs and to help expand the co-operative movement into new and innovative areas — both in Austin and around the world.
name: Black Star Co-op Pub & Brewery

description: At Black Star Farms we are always busy with wine and culinary events. Whether you are looking for a special dinner on the farm, a wine trail event,  or a wine festival.
name: Black Star Farms

description:
From the start, Black Swan Brewpub has been driven to provide its customers with a unique culinary experience, delicious beers and warm hospitality.

Our chef, Nick Carter, has taken the dishes we know and love and incorporated freshness, originality and homemade goodness that cannot be found today in Southwest Indianapolis.

Soon, Black Swan Brewpub will have our brewery in place. In the meantime, while construction is underway, we will be serving a spectacular draught selection of craft beers, many of which are made right here in Indiana.
name: Black Swan Brewpub

description:
Sheridan's award winning brewery in the heart of downtown. Black Tooth Brewing Co has many different beers on tap that are brewed on premise.

Award Winners like
Deer Abbey - Bronze Medal 2011 NABA Awards
Wagon Box Wheat - Silver Medal 2011 NABA Awards

and of course our other favorites...
Bomber Mountain Amber
Indian Paintbrush Ale (IPA)
name: Black Tooth Brewing Company

description: We’re proud of our craft, integrity and quality. But we’re not afraid to break the rules to produce something that breaks the mould. Here’s to good, honest, beer. Beer worth howling for...
name: Black Wolf Brewery

description: Tucked away on Blackberry Farm's 4200 acre estate in the foothills of the Great Smoky Mountains, Blackberry Farm Brewery produces classic Old World - style beers - each one artisan-crafted and bottle-conditioned.
name: Blackberry Farm Brewery

description:
Blackfoot River Brewing Company was founded in 1998, and began producing their line of handcrafted beers in January of 1999. The Brewery is located in the heart of historic Downtown Helena and near the headwaters of both the Big and Little Blackfoot Rivers.

The founding partners established the brewery to produce the finest, handcrafted, traditional beers to be found in Montana. All Blackfoot River beers are brewed with the highest quality traditional 2-row malts, hops, and yeasts, individually selected to produce each particular style of beer. Each of our specialty beers are carefully handcrafted 14 barrels at a time. Blackfoot River's beers are never pasteurized, normally unfiltered and are available exclusively on draught.

Blackfoot River Brewing was founded and is operated by three partners:

Brian Smith -Head Brewer and General Manager
Greg Wermers - Off-Premise Sales
Brad Simshaw - Brewer and Regulatory/Tax Manager

Fourteen barrel, three-vessel, steam-fired brewhouse
(3) Fourteen barrel fermentation vessels
(5) Fourteen barrel conditioning/bright tanks
(3) Seven barrel conditioning/bright tanks
Packaging: draft
Capacity:1,850 barrels (annual)
name: Blackfoot River Brewing Company

description: Opened in 2004, award winning Blackfriars Brewery brought brewing back to Great Yarmouth, Norfolk 36 years after the closure of the famous Lacons brewery
name: Blackfriars Brewery

description: Neighborhood Pub and small production brewery.
name: Blackhorse Pub and Brewery

description:
HAND CRAFTED BEER OF THE FINEST QUALITY

Blackjack is a local craft brewery focused on making excellent small batch beers and serving them in a relaxed, communal environment.
It was started by Ed Wenda, a Raleigh native and former dentist, who one day realized he enjoys brewing beer more than drilling on teeth.  Ed also brought in Brooks Hamaker to brew beer.  Brooks has 29 years brewing experience, starting with more than a decade of being the head brewer at Abita Brewing Co.  Brooks has also brewed for Fullsteam and Big Boss breweries.  Also behind the scenes is Tim Sullivan, formerly of Big Boss Brewing.  Tim is Mr. “Fix It” who does everything from cellar work at the brewery to fixing our old skeeball machine.
name: Blackjack Brewing Company

description:
Break the Big Beer Model! Beer brewed with quality, creativity and culture in mind. See our 2013 beer offerings, to the right, and look for our upcoming Kickstarter Campaign for details.

Blacklist is a year long project that meshes local artisans with beer and the brewing process to create fun and unique collaborations. Featuring a different artist and brew each month, we bring you a drinking experience worth sharing and talking about. Available in VERY limited quantities for pick-up in MN only. Look for further details on our upcoming kickstarter.com campaign. Til then, Skal, and stay thirsty for new beers.
name: Blacklist Artisan Ales

description:
At Blackrocks Brewery our mission is to have fun and brew great beer that challenges conventional norms. We offer you a wide variety of beers and rotate them regularly. The Blackrocks experience is: local, unique, and diverse.

Some say we are limited by our small size. We look at it a little differently, located in an old four square house, the brewery and tasting room compliment the small nature of our operation. The setting lends a neighborhood feel and harkens back to a traditional public house where people can meet and play chess or debate politics.
name: Blackrocks Brewery

description: Blacksburg Brewing Co. (BBC) is an independent specialty brewer of premium beer.  As mandated by the Reinheitsgebot (German Purity Law), our beer is brewed with only 4 ingredients: water, barley malt, hops, and yeast.  The best beer requires the best ingredients, so we purchase them regardless of the cost.  We pay a premium to import the Cadillac of barley malt from Bamberg, and our hops from The Hallertau are the best that money can buy, period.
name: Blacksburg Brewing Company

description:
The building that houses Blacksmith Brewing Company was built in 1908.
It began as a steam laundry and later became a Blacksmith shop. With every brand the blacksmith made he would then burn it into the wall to make sure it was perfect. It took a great vision to see what it could become, and a lot of hard work. For seven months we labored, and opened on Oct. 25, 2008. The brands still stand to show testament of all who passed this way.
name: Blacksmith Brewing

description: Blackstone Restaurant & Brewery was established in 1994 and was the first brewpub in Nashville. In 2011 we expanded as Blackstone Brewing Company when we opened a brand new state of the art brewery in Nashville.
name: Blackstone Brewing Company

description:
The year was 1972 and a crack team of West Country master cider makers were tasked with making a new West Country cider to beat all others. 

After months of blending and many a late night tasting session, Blackthorn cider was born. The West Country know their cider, and The West Country liked it. 

Word quickly spread and Blackthorn rapidly grew to become one of Britain’s most popular ciders and one that remains true to its West County roots. 

Shepton Mallet, in the heart of the West Country, is the home of the Blackthorn cider mill. It’s here that we’ve been making cider for over 50 years. The team that oversee the process have over 100 years
of cider making experience (this is between them, they’re not really that old). 

We are also the biggest employer in Shepton Mallet and over 90% of our fruit comes from within 50
miles from here. We have long term relationships with 68 local growers from Somerset, Devon, Dorset and Herefordshire where all the finest cider apples come from.
name: Blackthorn Cider

description: The Blackwater Brewing Company is a family owned company. The company was formed in 1998 as a natural growth of a sole proprietorship, beginning with approximately four employees. Today we employ 13 local residents and continue to provide a family friendly environment for our patrons. The original owners, Terry Lee and Rosalinde Benson, continue to manage the daily operations here at Blackwater Brewing Company. Blackwater Brewing Company is currently divided into two divisions: food & beverage operations, and malt beverage brewing operations.
name: Blackwater Brewing Company

description: We're busy turning hard work into hard cider. Born and Brewed in Armada, Michigan.
name: Blake's Hard Cider Co.

description:
Blank Slate is one of the many new small craft breweries in the Cincinnati Ohio area. Launched in 2012 they are part of the growing renaissance of craft brewing in Cincinnati.

Blank Slate unlike many breweries, produce primarily seasonal brands. This means that many of the brands will be rotated several times throughout the year. This philosophy to forego the "flagship model" of beer branding and embrace the seasonal approach to beer brewing (and drinking) is a big part of the Blank Slate mantra.
name: Blank Slate Brewing Company

description:
A Mill Avenue microbrewery, Blasted Barley Beer Co. offers an oasis for beer lovers of all types, from the craft beer connoisseur to those who could benefit from a little well-informed assistance.

With more than 30 craft beer varieties on tap (including some of our own signature suds) and a bold, elevated menu by Executive Chef John Culver that goes well beyond typical “bar food,” Blasted Barley Beer Co. is sure to be hotspot for any occasion, be it a pre-game libation, a big night out or a lazy Sunday brunch. With ample interior seating and an always-packed patio, there’s no better place to get a taste of Tempe’s brew scene.

Blasted Barley Beer Company brews it beer with laughter and love. We like to get crazy and fool around but we have some classic styles we can’t help running back to. Our Resident Head Brewer Cooper Sepulveda discovered his love for craft beer whilst traveling the world in the U.S. Navy. Cooper home brewed for a handful of years before working for breweries such as College Street and Barley Brothers. Cooper is a lovely man with a steady income and reliable transportation. Please ladies don’t distract him with your evil ways Cooper is busy and he has lots of great beer to brew
name: Blasted Barley Beer Company

description:
Blatant beers are exceptional. That much is clear from the taste alone. 
Here’s what makes us world class:

Blatant beers are forceful, but never forced. 
These beers are dynamic and creative. 
We work with the brew on its own terms, nurturing and developing its unique personality. 
Anybody can throw together an average brew. 
Only a true artisan can craft a flavorful and vibrant drinking experience. 
No shortcuts. We pay extra attention to what goes in. 
We smell, taste and study each of our choice ingredients. 
Our brews are born of passion. 
Obviously, a love of brewing is the first ingredient in a brew worth loving. 

Blatant is new. We aren’t. 
We have been in the brewing business for many years—this experience, time and energy spent has earned us a reputation as talented brewers and true artisans. 

Yes, our beers are handcrafted. 
Yes, we are brew artisans. 
And yes, we've got well over 20 years experience in every keg, bottle, and can. But let’s face it: In the end, all that matters is the taste. 

Be Blatant!
name: Blatant Brewery

description: A one-man, part-time, 3 barrel brewery. The brewery is young, the brewer ain't!
name: Blind Bat Brewery

description: The Vance Toe River Lodge was originally built in 1919 as the T. B. Vance General Store. After trading hands through the years and seeing its fair share of abuse it was renovated by the Young family and continues to evolve.  With that evolution came the expansion of our  “Lodge Family”.  When Aaron Maas moved to Plumtree, NC in 2009 as an avid home brewer, the dream to open a brewery slowly moved towards reality.  After 3 painstaking years, the brewery finally opened in July of 2012.  We are excited to be able to live in such a wonderful place and still have the ability to follow our passions.  Come out to Plumtree so we can prove to you that we’re nuts about beer!!
name: Blind Squirrel

description:
We opened the first brewery in Topeka since the Prohibition era. 
It is named after the Prohibition era custom of displaying stuffed tigers in establishments to alert patrons of the availability of bootleg alcohol. These speakeasies were referred to as “Blind Tigers.”   We keep at least six flagships and seven rotating seasonals on tap, to the tune of about 1300 barrels a year. Our brews have gathered 21 national and international awards over the past 15 years.  Our Brewpub is located at 37th & South Kansas Avenue.
name: Blind Tiger Brewery & Restaurant

description: Blindman brewing is based in the central Alberta town of Lacombe, in the heart of barley-country. Their founders have range of backgrounds including brewing, farming and engineering. They believe in creating innovative, quality, flavourful craft beer, using the best local ingredients, and supporting the place they live and the people that live there.
name: Blindman Brewing

description: We brew with the finest organic base malt, in combination with top quality imported specialty malts and Northwest grown hops. On tap you will find at least 12, sometimes up to 14 of our own brews representing a fine spectrum of beer styles. On average we have a new beer on tap every 1-2 weeks, recreating classic styles and developing our own unique brews as well.
name: Block 15 Brewing Company

description:
Block Brewing Company’s focus is on Michigan Craft Beer, with at least 10 Block Brewery beers on tap including IPAs, Pale Ale, Ales, Porters, blond and specialty beers. 

Many other Michigan Craft Beers, Fruits & Ciders will be available along with a full cocktail bar, and after the hard work of Sampling the brews and trying our craft beer Flights you can take back home a growler of your favorite Block Brewing Company beer to enjoy later.

The restaurant’s menu will focus our own in-house smoked Block BBQ meats including smoked turkey, chicken, beef and pork. 
Brick Oven Pizza with smokehouse meats, beer braised baby backs, stout chilli, cheddar ale soup, lighter fish dishes, sandwiches and salads round out the food menu.
name: Block Brewing Company

description:
GREAT THINGS COME IN SMALL BATCHES…

At least that is what we believe here at Block Three Brewing Company. Brewed in-house, our small batch brews give us the ability to create new recipes while maintaining the classics.

As locals, we have pride in our community and have learned that a great product starts with the right ingredients. As a result, not only do we brew an all-natural product, we keep our ingredients as local and fresh as possible. Nothing is more important to our team than providing our community with quality craft beers.

Brewed right in St. Jacobs, we put the same artisan craftsmanship into each and every bottle we package and we look forward to seeing you soon!
name: Block Three Brewing

description:
Bloom Brew is co-owned by Jeff Bloom and Steve Denk. Jeff and Steve have a combined 8 years of home-brewing experience which is now being embodied by Bloom Brew's exquisite repertoire of craft beers! 
What started out as a hobby quickly grew into an obsession...                              
 The founder's story - Jeff Bloom
  Steve & I met through work and our common interest in brewing was immediately apparent. Everything we initially brewed together came out of my home kitchen. Soon enough, we were asked to participate in some non-profit beer shows, starting with our first invitation from Barks & Brews of the Beaver County Humane Society -  we were immediately hooked! People loved our beer and kept asking us where they could buy it. At first we explained we were just home brewers and couldn't sell it, but could only give it away at non-profit events. Finally, in February 2013, we had a change of heart, took the leap and decided to open our own brewery - thus, Bloom Brew was born.
  With a lot of hard work and a ton of sweat equity, Bloom Brew now has a place to call our own. Our brewery is located at 100 Riverside Dr, in West Newton, Pennsylvania (USA). We share space with the West Newton Volunteer Fire Department and are proud to say we have developed a beer exclusively to benefit this fire-hall, which we call 82 Hot Head Red, and 10% of all sales of this beer will benefit them!
  All of our beers are handcrafted in small batches using as many local ingredients as possible. We have a two-acre fruit orchard, raise our own bees and grow some of our own hops - so the ingredients in our beer are also home-grown! Further, we process 90% of the fruit we use by hand!  We're serious about our beer and our brewing and have 24 beers on draft at all times.  When those kick, we are always ready to have an additional 24 to put on tap! That's makes a total of 48 different beers you can experience at our brewery. 
  We may be small but our beer will speak for itself. This is a dream come true for Steve and I . 
We love our craft and you will love our beer!
name: Bloom Brew

description:
Philosophy—
Life without labor is guilt. 
Labor without art is brutality—John Rusgan

There is a nearly infinite variety of ways to make good beer. At the Bloomington Brewing Company, we make beers that we like to drink. That’s the first rule. Great ingredients and attention to detail is the second. Our intention is not to grow a large brewery operation, our intention is to make great beer that we like to drink and to take care of our community.

We make only ales and they are available only on draft in Bloomington, Indianapolis and the surrounding communities. We do not bottle our beers. We’re not against bottling, and we will assuredly reach a point in the future where we will package our beer, but no matter how good a beer is in the bottle, it can never be better than the beer coming from a well managed tap. Often it will be not nearly as good. Why? Draft beer is fresher; that’s a big one. Packaging beer is a complicated process with lots of potential for bad things to happen. Once packaged, the beer is exposed to its two mortal enemies; Sunlight and time.
name: Bloomington Brewing Company

description:
The Blowing Rock Brewery and Ale House Restaurant is located in downtown Blowing Rock. A state-of-the-art brewing system consists of a 5 barrel Mash Tun, Brew Kettle and 10 barrel Fermenters & Brights . The brewery offers an impressive variety of craft beers brewed by master brewer, Ray Hodge. The Blowing Rock Ale House restaurant offers a freshly prepared, seasonally changing menu using local & organic ingredients when available. 64 ounce “growler” fills of freshly brewed beer are offered daily, with brewery tours 1:00-5:30pm Saturdays. We hope you will join us for lunch & dinner, 11am-9pm.

152 Sunset Drive
Blowing Rock, NC 28605-1236
Telephone: 828-414-9600 
http://blowingrockbrewing.com/
name: Blowing Rock Brewery

description: The Blue & Gray Brewing Co. opened in Fredericksburg on March 17, 2002.  Before that, Fred Red Ale and the Blue & Gray Classic Lager were brewed at other  microbreweries in Virginia. We listened to customer input and perfected our recipes  before we started brewing in Fredericksburg. Blue & Gray Brewing Co. now offers Falmouth American  Pale Ale and Stonewall Stout for a total of four flavors year round. We also offer Spiced  Winter Ale for Thanksgiving through January, Chocolate Raspberry Stout for January-February and  Virginia Hefeweizen Memorial Day through Labor Day.
name: Blue and Gray Brewing Co

description:
Originating from Lock Road at Gillman Village The Villa Bali has bought in its joglos, lesehans and other Balinese paraphernalia. Affectionately known as Little Bali, we left behind our iconic Majapahid Gate, a legacy of the tragic bombing of Bali on 12 October 2002. 
Our Mission – Providing a dining and entertainment experience that allows people to commune with nature, relax, de-stress and be happy. By bringing nature and the Bali culture of service into the living or dining space our guests can experience the ultimate environment to chill-out, dine and entertain their friends and family.
name: Blue Bali

description:
Virginia’s first and only urban cidery, Blue Bee Cider is located in the heart of downtown Richmond’s Old Manchester district at the fall line of the James River. The name for Blue Bee Cider is derived from a common name for one of Virginia’s native bees, osmia lignaria, or the blue orchard bee. These hardworking bees are solitary and wild, emerging early in the cool spring just in time to pollinate apple blossoms.

At Blue Bee Cider, we aim to create balanced ciders true to their Virginia roots from a culinary perspective and true to the fruit from a cidermaking one. Each apple variety ferments differently, creating its own flavors which vary year to year depending on weather conditions. Blue Bee Ciders are never chapitalized (it’s so sunny in the South, who needs to add sugar?) and never watered down. We use raw juice and ferment it straight off the press.
name: Blue Bee Cider

description: Blue Blaze Brewing offers fresh, full-flavored beer brewed locally in small, artisan handcrafted batches using the freshest quality ingredients.
name: Blue Blaze Brewing

description:
Our community is everything to us. We protected it as cops. We celebrate it as brewers.

Inspired by our roots in law enforcement and the homebrewing scene, our beer is meant to bring people together. It's crafted using the finest ingredients. It's scrutinized for strict adherence to our standards. It's brewed to be savored among the best of friends.

Because you have a right to know where your beer comes from. A right to great taste-and great memories. A right to have a little fun. 

We swear to uphold those rights.

Blue Blood Brewing Company. Justice. Served.
name: Blue Blood Brewing Company

description: Blue Corn Brewery is a mid sized brewpub in Santa Fe New Mexico. All the beer at Blue Corn is brewed on a one manned 7 barrel brew house. There are four 7 barrel fermenters and one 15 barrel fermenter. The 15 barrel is used exclusively for the Road Runner IPA, our most popular beer. Our Head Brewer, John Bullard uses the finest ingredients from around the world to make a wide variety of ales and lagers. Blue Corn Brewery has 6 house beers and 4 rotating specialty beers. Blue Corn Brewery also specializes in Northern New Mexican cuisine.
name: Blue Corn Brewery

description: Premium Handcrafted Beer by Blue Diamond Brewing Company of Minnesota use only the highest quality hops, grain and yeast to brew its craft beer - because of these high quality ingredients, we can guarantee you a premium hand crafted product with a consistent taste that you deserve and respect.
name: Blue Diamond Brewing Company

description:
The oldest beverage on earth just got a facelift. No longer are viking wannabes and medieval enthusiasts the only people who get to knock back a glass of the original liquid sin. Now it’s your turn.

Mead has been around longer than any other drink on the planet, so we’ve had plenty of time to perfect the recipe. Blue Dog Mead is concocted with honey instead of grapes, making it a sweet, refreshing alternative to wine. Not to toot our own horn, but we think with one sip you’ll be hooked.

Our newly designed bottles are made to move, and we don’t just mean off
the shelves. We mean to the beach,in a backpack or while watching a game. You’re mobile and active, so why shouldn’t your drink be? No gimmicks here. Blue Dog just wants to go with you as you grab the 
leash and take life for a good long walk.

So leave history to the vikings and the books, grab yourself some Blue Dog Mead and let’s explore the future of this brand spankin’ old drink together.
name: Blue Dog Mead

description: Delaware's 7th microbrewery located in The Historic Town of Smyrna. Brewing extra special beer offerings! Crafting beers that are brewed for the soul. Now open! Cheers!
name: Blue Earl Brewing Co.

description: Blue Frog is committed to producing traditional ales and lagers with a non-traditional twist. We use only the best ingredients to hand craft our balanced food friendly beers. Brewmaster Nick Campbell constantly tastes each batch to ensure its consistency and quality, leaning no beer released before its time. That’s commitment to quality.
name: Blue Frog Grog and Grill

description:
Blue Heron BrewPub, located in the historic Parkin Place, offers the best in pub dining and finely hand crafted, locally brewed beers. Open for lunch and dinner daily*, the BrewPub offers a delightful selection of appetizers, sandwiches, salads, and hearty entrees. If you can't stay, you can arrange to "take out" your order. **

Our beers are brewed by Corey Nebbeling. Corey, who brews exclusively for Blue Heron BrewPub, hails from Michigan. While in college, Corey started brewing for his own pleasure, experimenting with different beer styles and recipes. He was an assistant brewer at the Lander Brewing Company in Lander, Wyoming for a year and then joined Short's Brewing Company in Michigan. Under Corey's direction, we are proud to continue our signature beers, Honey Blonde, Tiger's Eye, and Loch Ness Scotch Ale. Additional beers, such as RYEzome Red, Hub City Lager, Witz End Wheat, and Oktoberfest will continue to rotate through our 10 taps. In addition to these, Corey will be offering a wide variety of newly crafted beers for your tasting pleasure.
name: Blue Heron Brew Pub

description: From Pale Ale to Stout and from Porter to Pilsner, brewing beer  is our passion and as a family we're dedicated to bringing  New Mexico the finest brews.
name: Blue Heron Brewing Company

description:
Beer is our life! Blue Hills Brewery makes great tasting beers inspired by the elements and nature around us; embracing the rich history of the Blue Hills and the South Shore. We do this not only for ourselves but, for our friends, neighbors and visitors to the Boston and South Shore areas. 

We want to grow together with the South Shore community and businesses, by being a good neighbor, demonstrating civic responsibility and producing the finest, freshest beers around. 

Our brew house has a capacity of brewing 20 barrels at a time, that's about 620 gallons per batch. The beer spends the first 7-9 days in a primary fermenting vessel after which it is transferred to a secondary fermenter. There it is chilled to around 40 degrees for another 7-10 days. At this time it is ready to be filtered carbonated and kegged.
name: Blue Hills Brewery

description: Blue Lab Brewing is a small micro-brewery that produces fresh small batch ales for purchase in 1L and 2L growlers.
name: Blue Lab Brewing Co

description: Nestled in the "All American City" in the heart of the Adirondacks you'll find the Blue Line Brewery. We are a micro brewery offering casual pub food.
name: Blue Line Brewery

description:
Blue Lobster Brewing Company will be coming to Hampton, New Hampshire in 2012! Featuring fine craft beers from Michael and Roberta Benoit, Blue Lobster will become a common sight in your favorite local restaurants and bars.

Michael and Roberta have been crafting beer for 30 years (okay, so Michael crafts it, but Roberta helps design and drink it). After many years of wandering the country in exotic places like Texas, California, and for the last 12 years Oregon, they are looking forward to bringing their unique, locally-inspired brews to New Hampshire. Blue Lobster will feature small batch specialty brews, as well as more traditional beers - all served in our own tasting room AT the brewery. 

Freshly brewed beers will be available for sale in our tasting room and retail shop in swingtop amber 750ml growlers. swingtop amber 2L growlers, and 1/6th keg sales. Specialty bottle releases available in corked 750ml champagne bottles.
name: Blue Lobster Brewing Company

description: At Blue Moon Brewing Company®, we believe brewing is an art. And it’s been that way since our head brewmaster and founder, Keith Villa, first created Blue Moon® Belgian White Belgian-Style Wheat Ale back in 1995 in downtown Denver, Colorado.
name: Blue Moon Brewing Company

description: Blue Mountain Barrel House was founded in 2011 by the Smack family as a sister brewery to the original Blue Mountain Brewery, in Afton (Nelson County). The original Blue Mountain Brewery was created in 2007 by Taylor and Mandi Smack, Matt Nucci and a group of fearless shareholders. Blue Mountain introduced the concept of the rural brewery to our corner of the world and set the standard for great beer in Virginia. As the first production arm of the Blue Mountain family, the Barrel House focuses on the higher-end beers from Blue Mountain that require special processes, special ingredients, and a whole lot of patience.
name: Blue Mountain Barrel House

description:
Blue Mountain Brewery sits in the shadow of Appalachia's Blue Ridge Mountains in Afton, Virginia. We are a farm brewery, growing our own hops, and proudly craft real American beer inspired by thousands of years of tradition but not limited by convention.

Brewer Taylor Smack, previously head brewer for the Goose Island Brewing of Chicago brewpubs and South Street Brewery of Charlottesville, is now crafting his brews for the central Virginia area at the unique Blue Mountain Farm Brewery.
name: Blue Mountain Brewery

description: Blue Mountain Pizza restaurant is a true treasure in the quaint town of Weaversville, NC just about 5 miles north of Asheville. Very friendly staff, and a great menu to choose from. We were absolutely delighted with our baked pasta dishes, pizza, and quesadilla. The salads were scrumptious as were the garlic rolls. We shared the cheesecake and cannolis for dessert and thoroughly enjoyed a very entertaining singer/ guitarist. The locals seemed very comfortable in this restaurant which is always a clear sign for travelers.
name: Blue Mountain Pizza & Brewpub

description: Blue Nose is a new Chicago craft brewery specializing in unique handmade brews. We put a lot of time and love into each one of our beers and we hope you enjoy drinking them as much as we do making them.
name: Blue Nose Brewery

description: We aren’t a microbrewery…we are an artisan NANO-brewery.   Blue Note Brewing Company has a 6 Barrel system that ensures that every beer is LITERALLY hand crafted.  Every batch is tested before it is kegged to make sure you are getting the freshest and best tasting beer money can buy.
name: Blue Note Brewing Company

description: 7BBL Microbrewery based in San Carlos, Ca.
name: Blue Oak Brewing Company

description:
Blue Pants Brewery was born out of a love of craft beer and craft beer culture. This first brewery is meant to be a gateway to the second and an inspiration to other small brewers that it can be done on this scale with a healthy amount of hard work. We’ve already had phone calls and emails from other brewers who are planning to follow in our footsteps, and we provide any help that we can. 

The Brewery will consist of a 1.5 Barrel (or about 45 gallon) brewing system. Initially, distribution will be in 1/4 Barrel kegs to bars around the area, draft only. All the beer will be keg conditioned prior to distribution to ensure that it is at its maximum freshness, finishing the fermentation the moment it is loaded on a refridgerated truck out of the brewery.
name: Blue Pants Brewery

description:
Starting out in 1998 as two guys with a dog, a van, and a dream, Blue Point Brewing Company quickly became one of the nation’s premier microbreweries. After first launching our lightly toasted, complex, full-flavored Toasted Lager, we rapidly gained the respect of beer lovers far and wide. Soon after, we introduced several other brews and were being compared to breweries from noted craft-brewing capitals like Denver, Boston, Portland, and Seattle.

Brewing isn’t just our business, it’s our passion. We’re beer people. We started Blue Point Brewing Company because we wanted to make beer we would drink. To quench that desire, we select only top-quality ingredients and brew all-natural, unpasteurized beer. It’s this approach that put us on the world beer map. From the World Beer Cup to the Great American Beer Festival and the Australian International Beer Awards – we’re becoming noticed the world over. But we believe you should be the judge. Let us know what you think.
name: Blue Point Brewing

description:
Blue Republic Brewing Company is a production brewery located in Shelby County, Indiana.

The brewery is currently in 'start-up' mode, but hopes to be operational in the near future. You can follow our progress here as we take the long journey to that first drop of pure deliciousness. And you know it will be something hoppy!!!
name: Blue Republic Brewing

description:
Blue Ridge Brewing Co. is an established restaurant and brewery, offering 15 years of experience brewing only the finest of home brews and cooking an extraordinary array of unique dishes. Please, stop on by!

Born in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, Greenville's Brew-Pub continues to pay homage to one simple creed, to provide our customers the very best we can! We're as proud of Chef Rich's House-Made Menu as we are of Jay's Freshly Crafted Brews!
name: Blue Ridge Brewing Company

description:
Hello and Welcome to Blue Sky Brewery

Thank you for taking the time to view our product and read a little into why our beer brand is unique.

I am proud of what we have accomplished as a team and most importantly how we have taken a regional, obscure brand and thrust it into the upper pantheon of International contemporary beers.Pride, passion, integrity and professionalism are all current corporate buzz words, however I believe in those words and they are why we are an on-going success.

It’s really about a team of people with a common goal. Our team is unique in that they, not only like each other, they actually like working together. Ego is based on the quality of product that they collectively create and deliver on a daily basis. This is why I am proud and why we are attracting so much kudos. People creating a product that is designed for people.

Yes it’s true that our part of the world has some of the cleanest table waters. Yes it is true that our part of the world also has the purest environment for us to deliver a beer that is free of preservatives and additives. Our product is from Cairns and I am proud to say after 20 years of living in Cairns I can give something back to Cairns.

I hope you can spend a few minutes and view our product range.

Thank you.
Benjamin Newman – Chairman
name: Blue Sky Brewery

description:
Blue Skye Brewery and Eats is a new microbrewery and restaurant built around our cozy wood-fired pizza oven. We serve six varieties of in-house crafted beer along with a complete bar of bottled beer, wine and alcohol. In addition to pizza our menu includes quality sandwiches, salads and pub fare - all made in-house with fresh ingredients. 
We are located on Santa Fe Avenue in downtown Salina, Kansas and are dedicated to the development of this historic district. We think you'll find our offerings and atmosphere a unique addition to the current mix of local dining choices. We hope you'll join us for quality food, fresh brew, and the gathering of good friends.
name: Blue Skye Brewery and Eats

description:
Brewer, Rick Kane has been brewing beer since the early 90's. After brewing so long he decided to go to school and get a degree in Beer Engineering, which fit perfectly with his science teaching credential. His plan is to have 8-12 beers on tap, along with a couple of local guest taps. 
The restaurant will feature taco shop mexican food. There will be appetizers that pair perfectly with beer, along with some sandwich and salad options. 
We know that Highlands Ranch and Centennial have been waiting for a local brewery to call their own. Hold on tight, here we come!
name: Blue Spruce Brewing

description: Blue Stallion Brewing Co. is the newest craft brewery in Lexington, Kentucky. We make the finest German lagers and British Ales focusing on traditional brewing techniques and ingredients. We want to bring Lexington an experience in beer not available anywhere else.
name: Blue Stallion Brewing Company

description: Owned and operated by Joey and Maggie Villarreal of Joey's on N. St. Mary's Street, the BSBC has been open since June 25, 1996. We offer medal-winning beers, an exceptional wine list, and delicious food. The brew pub is located in the Blue Star Arts Complex at 1414 S. Alamo, on the San Antonio river across the street from the Pioneer flour mill. The stainless steel vats and brewing facility are right at home in what was once an old beer storage warehouse. Friendly staff and warm wood decor make for a comfortable, casual atmosphere.
name: Blue Star Brewing Company

description: Small craft brewery in Round Rock, TX owned and operated by a husband and wife team focused on brewing high-quality classic beer styles with a Texas twist.
name: Bluebonnet Beer Company

description: The original Bluegrass Brewing Company opened in 1993 at this location, 3929 Shelbyville Road, near Westport Rd., & Chenoweth, & Breckenridge Lanes. It is the city's oldest remaining brewpub and was the first to make a significant mark on the national brewpub and microbrewery scene. Louisville's best beer is made at this location, and large glass windows in the back dining room allow you to witness the brewing operation. The headbrewer is Jerry Gnagy, assisted by Sam Cruz and Cody Mingus.
name: Bluegrass Brewing Company

description: Brewery and Tavern in SE Washington, DC.
name: Bluejacket

description: Bluenose Gopher Brewery is a co-operative brewpub currently in the process of creating it's brews and organization. We predict to open our doors in late 2015 or early 2016 and will open with craft beer, local food and entertainment in a prohibition theme location in downtown Granite Falls, home of Andrew Volstead.
name: Bluenose Gopher Brewery

description: We are Maryville's first brewery and Tennessee's first brewery cooperative ready to pour this spring, 2014.
name: Bluetick Brewery

description: Craft Brewery and Small Batch Distillery
name: BNS Brewing & Distilling Co.

description: We believe that one beer does not fit all food or all times of year. We will produce beers that will challenge your taste buds and expand your knowledge of pairing beer and food.
name: Boaks Beverage

description: Boatrocker Brewery are a small, family owned and run microbrewery in Melbourne's south-east. We make world class, international award winning beers, without compromising on the quality of the ingredients. Hopefully you can join us on the journey that is craft beer.
name: Boatrocker Brewery

description:
Boatyard Brewing Company is on a journey to create superb craft beers through the exploration of artistic fermentations

We are focused on creating the best possible craft beers while keeping with tradition and adding our own artistic flair. Boatyard Brewing Company is also committed to making a positive impact on our community.
name: Boatyard Brewing Company

description:
Located at the heart of the Green Mountains, we have the unique pleasure of serving handcrafted beers along side homemade food that is fresh and creative. Our brewmaster, Mark Magiera, uses high quality grains, hops and yeast strains to create up to a dozen true to style beers. With his unending expertise, Mark is passionate and innovative without losing the tradition behind each style. In the kitchen, we work hard to bring consistency and quality to the table. We focus on local ingredients to enhance our creative comfort food.

The Bobcat Cafe and Brewery opened ten years ago as a community supported business. Today, we strive to support and enhance the community by hosting benefit dinners and by providing a comfortable spot where local people can meet and socialize. Our 100 member Mug Club is a testament to the dedication of our regulars.
name: Bobcat Cafe & Brewery

description:
We are a microbrewery nestled in the Texas Hill Country. We are small and intend to stay that way. We are from Boerne. We will be brewing in Boerne. Our beer is for the people that live in, work in, and visit Boerne.
We are painfully/cheerfully close to completing construction. We will continue to post updates and pictures as things go along.
name: Boerne Brewery

description: The Bohemian Brewery is a Microbrew Brewpub Craft Brewery in the Salt Lake valley brewing traditional European Style Lagers (Czech & German/Bavarian) with a great European style restaurant, patio and tavern serving traditional European dishes. We have a packaging facility onsite where we specialize in quality craft canned lagers.
name: Bohemian Brewery

description: Idaho's only community owned brewery located in downtown Boise.
name: Boise Brewing

description: We are a small craft brewery with a mission to provide bold flavored hand-made beer to all our customers.  From our small home brew system in a garage to our current 3BBL brew house we treat our beers with the same amount of love. We provide great beer in cunjunction with Rosati's great food here at 2737 W Thunderbird next to the Best Buy. We look forward to seeing you there. CHEERS!
name: Bold Barley Brewing

description: Bold City Brewery is locally owned and operated by Brian and Susan Miller (no relation to the Miller Brewing Company, although the money would be nice). They are supported by the rest of the Miller family who all have a hand in the operations whether it be marketing, distributing, ordering supplies, cleaning tanks or doing what's most important, brewing beer. Brian, the Brewmaster started with home brewing in 2002. He was a member of the Local Home Brewers club here in Jacksonville prior to opening the brewery. His mother, Susan, left her job in management at Blue Cross Blue Shield of Florida to join the beer biz. She is primarily responsible for managing the on-site Tavern.
name: Bold City Brewery

description: A southern guy from Virginia had a farm in the Blue Ridge Mountains and met a top cider maker in the world from New Zealand.  It doesn’t get much more southern than that!  Now the two of them are making hard cider and history.
name: Bold Rock Hard Cider

description: We are one of NJ's latest upstart craft breweries. In order to get "No BS...Just Ragin' Good Beer" into your glasses sooner rather than later, we will be contract brewing our beers to start with a full production site planned to open in late 2013.
name: Bolero Snort Brewery

description:
Introducing Bomb Lager from the Bomb Beer Company, New York, NY. Our lager is an easy drinking Bavarian style Helles Lager that is light-bodied, somewhat bready with a restrained bitterness in its finish. We can our beer to ensure the best quality for our product while providing a canvas for our signature artwork. 

Better beer deserves a better can.
name: Bomb Beer Company

description: I suppose you could say it's a truly Canadian story - hockey, friendship and beer. From the ice rink to the brewery, Bomber Brewing is the shared dream of three friends with a passion for playing hockey and savouring good beer.   We drafted a team, combined our skills, and in February of 2014, we launched one of the newest micro-breweries to hit the Vancouver scene.
name: Bomber Brewing

description:
Bombshell Beer Company’s 5,840 sq. ft building is conveniently located in the heart of Holly Springs within the Omni business park located off N.Main St. The building will house the production brewery, lab and a 1400 sq. ft. tasting room.
Our brewery features a custom designed 15 BBL steam fired brewhouse manufactured by SMT Food and Beverage Systems of Stokesdale NC.
