Cervejaria Backer is a family-run business, the initiative of brothers Halim and Munir Lebbos, in order to meet the large demand for specialty beers in Brazil.
name: Cervejaria Backer

description: Microbrewery with a productive capacity of 3.000 litres in each development. Through the system of English traditional elaboration (with maceration by the method of simple infusion), the production process is virtually manual. Because of these unique features of elaboration, HANDCRAFTED BEERS are produced.
name: Cervesa del Montseny

description:
Caleya is a Pale ale, bitter citrus notes, with a nice hoppy aroma. yy literally "because Asturies needed a good pale ale
asturias,spain
Thus, Caleya intended to accompany the beer culture in Asturias cider.
Caleya es una Pale ale, amarga con notas cítricas, lupulada y con un buen aroma. y  y literalmente “porque Asturies necesitaba una buena pale ale 

De esta forma, Caleya pretende que la cultura cervecera acompañe a la sidrera en Asturies.
name: Cerveza Caleya

description: 4bbl brewery located in Mexico, in the city of Mexicali, Baja California. Known for their award winning Cross Over IPA and Hoppy Blonde Ale, both great beers. If your ever in Mexicali, be sure to find them and have a few pints.
name: Cerveza Urbana

description: La Cibeles no es solo elaborar cerveza. Desarrollamos diferentes actividades alrededor del mundo de la cerveza artesana; Cursos, Catas, Visitas a la fabrica, Reuniones de empresa, etc.
name: Cervezas La Cibeles S.L.

description:
Chafunkta Brewing Company is a Mandeville, LA based Nanobrewery and was formed by Josh & Jamie Erickson in June of 2011. The word 'Chafunkta', aka 'Tchefuncte', was an early Indian settlement located in what is now the city of Mandeville, LA.

As a family run, Mandeville, LA based brewery, we believe that passion and personal attention is the key to providing you with a fresh, complex, full of flavor taste that you deserve as a craft beer consumer. By focusing on small batch brewing, we’re able to put our love and attention into each and every batch, giving you the quality and consistency that we demand and expect from EVERY CBC brew. Louisiana owned, Louisiana brewed, Louisiana loved, YOUR Chafunkta Brewing Company is raising the bar, one brew at a time.
name: Chafunkta Brewing Company

description: With every action there is a reaction. For us a strong foundation of dedication to trades such as mechanics, ironwork and carpentry was laid early in life. With the love of these trades the need to create was always a must and that is what brings us to this point of wanting to share our beers with the public. We never focus on pleasing just one style since we love just about all of them and while not every beer we brew will be the perfect student in its category it will be one that will get the craft beer loving palate craving more with each sip.
name: Chain Reaction Brewing Company

description: You have to be a little bit crazy if you come home one day and tell your wife you want to quit your job in healthcare and open a craft brewery.  She’d have to be a little more crazy to support the idea.  Fast forward two years and one professional brewing school later and here we are!  Chainline Brewing Company was founded on the idea that if it’s worth doing, it’s worth over doing.  No matter where our passions take us, whether it be the top of a remote peak or conjuring up the next batch of beer, we pledge to bring our A-game and give you everything we’ve got!
name: Chainline Brewing Company

description: A multiple GABF medal winning brewpub considered one of Albuquerque's longest standing pioneers of great craft beer in New Mexico.
name: Chama River Brewing Company

description:
With the start of a new decade, beer lovers are demanding something new. Not another new flavor of a mass-produced, foreign-owned beer, but something local that is new and exciting. That is why Chameleon Brewing is here.

Chameleon was founded by Randy Sprecher of Sprecher Brewing, a local company that Milwaukeeans have grown to know and love for 25 years. Just like Sprecher, Chameleon Brewing supports the local economy and recognizes that innovative American brewing styles are now setting the bar in the international beer world. Chameleon is a company focused on taking brewing to the next level by producing beers that are guaranteed to impress the savviest critic, yet also appealing to a widely diverse group of beer drinkers. Our brews are light bodied and refreshing, complimented by a fine balance of complex flavors and aromas.

Staying true to this principle, Chameleon would like to introduce its flagship beer – Hop On Top extra-pale ale. This aromatic non-bitter brew features a complex bouquet of dried flowers and hops. Easy to drink, Hop on Top has a toasty pale malt finish.
name: Chameleon Brewing

description: Charlottesville's fastest-growing production  brewery and beer-drinking Tap Room located at the foot of the Belmont Bridge.
name: Champion Brewing Company

description:
Chandeleur ("shan-duh-leer") Brewing Company was started by Cammack Roberds and Cain Roberds. Their love of beer began in the 90’s, which eventually lead to homebrewing, and an endless pursuit of finding the best craft beers the World had to offer.

They chose the name "Chandeleur" in honor of one of their favorite places, the Chandeleur Islands off the coast of Mississippi. The uninhabited island chain is approximately 50 miles long and is home to some of the best redfish and speckled trout fishing on the planet.

Cam and Cain were born and raised in Gulfport, MS. Being raised on the coast instilled in them a true love for the water. When they’re not brewing beer, you’re almost guaranteed to find them fishing or cruising in a boat with family.

As they gained a real passion for craft beer and continued to hone their homebrewing skills, they began to dream about opening their own microbrewery. Several years later, in July of 2012, Senate Bill 2878 became law, raising the permissible alcohol content in Mississippi beer from 5% by weight (6.25%ABV) to 8% by weight (10.1% ABV). The fellas knew that it was high time to start making their dream into a reality. And, they knew that Mississippi was the place to do it.

In December of 2013, they purchased a historic building in downtown Gulfport and broke ground for what is now Chandeleur Brewing Company. Their vision is to handcraft some of the most excellent ales on the Gulf Coast using only the finest, freshest malted barley, hops, and local ingredients.
name: Chandeleur Brewing Company

description: Chaos Mountain Brewing opened it's doors April 2014.  We are dedicated to producing the finest beer possible with the best available ingredients.  Chaos Mountain has a 30BBL brewhouse and a 7BBL pilot system that allow us to produce six production beers, seasonal beers and a constantly changing variety of limited release products.  Visit us in Callaway, Va. at the base of Cahas Mountain in the Blue Ridge Mountains.
name: Chaos Mountain Brewing

description: Chapman's Brewing Company is here because you care about what you drink. Everything we do, from working with orchards in Michigan and Washington to the selection of cans instead of bottles is completely focused on making the highest quality beers and ciders in the Midwest. Please come see us at the brewery in Angola – any Chapman’s employee you meet will also be an owner of the company and wants to hear what you think of our craft.
name: Chapman's Brewing Company

description: Chappell Brewery is a small one man operation created with the help of some friends. For now I only sell tasters and bottles out of the Tasting Room Shop in downtown Mariposa, CA.
name: Chappell Brewery

description: Charleston, West Virginia's first and only brewpub, CBC is bringing craft beer brewing to the state's capital. Located in the heart of Charleston's downtown Village District, CBC is a fusion of English and American sensibilities
name: Charleston Brewing Company

description: Our handcrafted microbeers are brewed on site at Charleville Vineyards. We proudly offer an assortment of ales, lagers and seasonal beers, some of which have already won critical acclaim! Our IPA and Half-Wit Wheat placed first and third in the ale category at the Lift For Life Microbrew Festival at Forest Park in St. Louis in the spring of 2005.
name: Charleville Brewery
Charlie and Jake's Brewery and BBQ

description: Located in Curtis Bay, Charm City Meadworks is Baltimore's first meadery. We're going to give your tastebuds something to be excited about!
name: Charm City Meadworks

description:
In an era of extreme everything, the Charter Oak Tree quietly stands apart as a patriotic symbol of strength and truth. That’s why we chose Connecticut’s beloved tree to be the symbol of our dedication to brewing the most honest, freshest and un-hyped beer possible.
Our ales are handcrafted from 100% natural ingredients: select malted barley, choice hops, special yeast, and using only the purest water for a unique and delicious taste. We never use any adjuncts or preservatives. 
Each varietal is carefully brewed to be the ideal balance 
of flavors for that style beer.
But also our beer is entertaining and enriching. For the enjoyment of our beer lovers, we have extensively portrayed the true events of the Charter Oak legend. Each variety and seasonal ale will share different parts and characters of this enduring story.
We hope you enjoy our beers as much as we enjoyed brewing it.
name: Charter Oak Brewing Company
Chateau de Pique Pardieck Winery & Brewery

description:
Our beer is imported, from Main Street, that is.

We were tired of the generic taste of mass-market beers. So we decided to brew our own. At least three times a week. Except when we're on a fishing trip. 

Our brewery in in Chatham, NY. You will find us right on Main Street.
name: Chatham Brewing

description: Welcome to the biggest little Brewpub site in Southeast Alabama. We are a small nano sized brewpub sitting on the banks of the Chattahoochee River in Phenix City, AL
name: Chattahoochee Brewing Company

description: Chattanooga Brewing Company opened in 1890 and lasted until 1915 and was the choice of beer drinkers in Chattanooga, selling beer in most of the local taverns and in cases of bottles. Among their brands of the day were Imperial Pilsner and Magnolia. Returning to the local beer scene in 2010, they have brought back Imperial Pilsner and many other tasty brews. Many German, English, and American styles are featured throughout the year.
name: Chattanooga Brewing Company

description: Friends Creating Belgian Goodness for the Love of Beer.
name: Chatty Monks Brewing Co.

description:
Back in 1985, a Dragon and an Angel visited me in a dream. The Dragon was swirling around the Angel, protecting Her, and blowing fire, turning white clouds into pink and red ones. The Angel then instructed: "Tuan, your destiny is to become a great brewer." The Dragon symbolizes the Emperor and the Angel symbolizes the Queen. It was such a powerful dream that I awoke and scripted the image on a napkin on my desk and it embraces my beer logo. To fulfill that vision, I began my journey in search of the finest brewers in the land. I found Sierra Nevada Brewery in Chico, California, and there... there, America's first Asian beer, Cháu Tiên® Pale Ale was born and brewed until the end of 1987.

From 1988 to 1998 Cháu Tiên® was brewed in Modesto, California and Dubuque, Iowa. Since 1999, Cháu Tiên® has been brewed at Santa Clara County and Mendocino County regional California breweries.

Tuan is seeking upwards of $50 million to build/acquire his own brewery and distribute his beer worldwide.
name: Chau Tien USA

description: Cheaha Brewing Company is a brewpub in the 1885 L&N freight house. We currently serve hand crafted beer produced in Alabama and nearby. Soon, we will begin brewing our own beers and have them on tap. Our beer is paired with uniquely prepared dishes incorporating as much locally produced and all natural food as possible.
name: Cheaha Brewing Company

description:
Back in 2009 a few of us craft beer enthusiasts and history buffs from Cheboygan shared an idea. We dreamed of reestablishing a proud local brewery, one out of production since the wave of prohibition captured northern Michigan like it did the rest of the country. We imagined brewing fabulous beers that respected the heritage of the original recipes and brought time honored brewing techniques and a few brewmaster secrets to the table. We focused on the water. We went after taste.

Now, after 100 years of waiting, Cheboygan Brewing Company is back!
name: Cheboygan Brewing Company

description: A new craft brewery located in the seaside town of Southport NC.  We have a large selection of handcrafted beers sure to please very beer lover!
name: Check Six Brewing Company

description: Born and brewed in Margaret River, Cheeky Monkey is producing Western Australia’s freshest line up of craft beers and ciders. But it’s not all about the beer, we’re blessed with an idyllic location half way between Margaret River and Dunsborough on Caves Road. It’s a location that affords the kind of space that lets kids play free whilst you relax, kick back and enjoy a long lunch. Check out our Cheeky Beer Blog for the latest news and events at Cheeky Monkey Brewey & Cidery.
name: Cheeky Monkey Brewery & Cidery

description:
Located in Chelsea’s historic Clocktower Complex, the Chelsea Alehouse Brewery opened its doors in December 2012.  Featuring American and English style Ales, we aim to provide a wide variety of choices for the beer connoisseur and occasional beer drinker as well.

In our pub, enjoy a view of our American-made tanks at the bar, get cozy in a booth or enjoy a pint outside in our beer garden.  Our deli-style kitchen features delicious grilled sandwiches, wraps, housemade hummus and salsa, or try our meat cheese plate featuring local cheeses.

We’re family friendly with menu options for kids and have changing tables in both our restrooms.
name: Chelsea Alehouse

description: Chelsea Brewing Company, rated the best brewery in New York, is a first class waterfront restaurant and the only micro-brewery in Manhattan located at pier 59.With over 15 years of experience, and 8 National Awards, we are proud to serve up to 27 natural hand-crafted ales and specialty beers using only the finest malts and hops from around the world. We offer beer tastings, brewery tours and group packages.
name: Chelsea Brewing Company

description:
Cherry Street started out as a little garage operation in the foothills of the Rockies and quickly spread and built up great community support. Initially being known as a cooperative, we established our identity as applying cooperative ideals to everyday life. These ideals focus on education, community, and sustainability. We are here for the community just as the community is here for us.

We are a crazy group of people who love to brew lots of beer and share our passion for brewing. Cherry Street always has something fresh and exciting to enjoy. We continue to come up with crazy off the wall recipes and experiment with unusual ingredients and wild yeast.

Based in Vickery Village of Cumming, we are in partnership with Rick Tanner’s Grille & Bar. Join us for a pint, or swing by the brewery for a tour.
name: Cherry Street Brewing Cooperative

description: Formerly Rock Creek Brewing. Opened in 2001 by Scott Whitham and Brooke Baldridge, this brewery also carried some of the Rock Creek beers. The brewery and taproom closed in 2003.
name: Chesapeake Bay Brewing Company

description: Location Opened In 2000 by Charlie Sturdavant, Geoffry Bruce and other investors. Closed In 2008.  Was a Brewpub with food and beer in the English-style.  Was sold to the Yak and Yeti Brewpub which continues to use the location and brewing equipment.
name: Cheshire Cat Brewery

description: The Chester River Brewing Company hopes to be Kent County, Maryland's first modern micro-brewery -- well, OK, nano-brewery -- serving small-batch artisan ales to thirsty townsfolk and tourists.
name: Chester River Brewing Company

description: Chestnut Brew Works, LLC is a small beer brewery nestled in the woods of southern Monongalia county, about 10 miles south of Morgantown, WV. We utilize a 1 barrel (1 barrel=31 gallons) system to produce about 200 barrels per year.  This level of production is extremely small, even compared to “micro-breweries” such as Tröeg’s or Flying Dog.  Our small size allows us to experiment with different ingredients and processes, which highlights the artistic and creative sides of brewing.
name: Chestnut Brew Works

description:
Small Town Brewing, World Class Beer.  This Award winning nano-brewery on the Southern Oregon Coast brews an amazing array of finely crafted Ales.  From their Unite Pink Pale Session Ale to their Silver Medal* winning Block & Tackle American Imperial Stout, Chetco brews every batch with great affection and respect for the craft. 

*2014 World Beer Cup Silver Award winner, Block & Tackle American Style, Imperial Stout
name: Chetco Brewing Company

description: Chicago Beer Company is in persistent pursuit of producing the finest quality craft beers that will be deemed worthy of their Chicago namesake. Such was the destiny that led to the creation of Chicago Beer Company’s flagship release, Chi-Town Windy City Wheat! On draft and in bottles!
name: Chicago Beer Company

description: Award winning brewpub featuring a selection of appetizers, pizzas, sandwiches and entrees along with a fully stocked gaming bar. Beer is brewed on premise and has won numerous awards at the Great American Beer Festival and The World Beer Cup.
name: Chicago Brewing Company

description:
Chick Beer is America's beer for women!

Chick Beer is a premium craft-brewed light lager that tastes like a full-bodied lager, yet has just 97 calories and 3.5 carbs per bottle, about the same as half of a carrot.
name: Chick Brewing Co.

description: An urban brewpub with super food infused with great music, located in Downtown Indianapolis.
name: Chilly Water Brewing Co.

description: We make beer.  That is what we are passionate about.  We are also passionate about our traditional Italian pizza using dough and sauce made in house.  And unicorns.  We love unicorns.
name: Chimera Brewing Company

description:
Our atmost goal is become well respected brand in the Asiapacific region.

In 1998, “Chinggis beer “LLC was the landmark in the history of Mongolian Beer market supplying high quality beer brewed according to the quality control stature or famous “ Reinheitsgebot” , Beer Purity law of Germany.
name: Chinggis Beer Brewery

description: A local nano-brewery making craft beer in small batches! We are now open to the public. We have 5 house beers and usually have at least 4 of them on tap. Stop in for a visit and some fresh craft beer!
name: Chino Valley Brewery

description:
Meet Oklahoma's oldest handcrafted beer.

In Italian immigrant Pete Prichard's effort to support his family, he came up with the idea of using an Indian Territory recipe to brew a beverage for the coal miners.

Pete's idea led to trouble during Prohibition. He was convicted, not once but twice, for breaking the federal Prohibition Act.

Prohibition was repealed in the late 1950s, but home brewed beverages were still illegal because they didn't bear the proper liquor stamps. Nevertheless, homemade Choc and wine continued to be available to regular customers at Pete's, a restaurant owned by Prichard in Krebs, Okla.

Those customers happen to include JFK and high-powered Oklahoma politicians.

Finally, in 1995, through tireless efforts on the part of Joe Prichard, the grandson of the founder, Pete's Place reintroduced Choc beer as part of the restaurant's tradition and a "legal" brew for customers.
name: Choc Beer Company

description: Two friends and avid homebrewers, Ben Matz and Jay Irizarry, had an idea to bring their love of hand crafted micro-brewed beer to the masses via a small scale manufacturing and production facility. No small task when you consider this “dream” was taking form during the latter part of 2008, when the financial markets were set to implode, credit markets were freezing, and good economic news, especially for entrepreneurs and business start-ups, was hard to come by. The two pressed ahead and, with the financial assistance of Brian Flanagan as a third partner and business development specialist Don Parker, launched Chocolate City Beer in November of 2009.
name: Chocolate City Beer

description:
The Chocolay River Brewery, located inside The Bayou Restaurant at 200 West Main Street in Harvey, makes beer. Good beer. Not only does our beer taste good but it also makes your meal better.
 
We believe that our flavorful beers enrich the life, tradition and the culture of our community. While striving to brew the best beer possible (and make time for our families), The Chocolay River Brewery promotes the proliferation of good beer and good food whenever it can.
name: Chocolay River Brewery

description: The Christian Moerlein Brewing Company was founded in Cincinnati, Ohio's Over-the-Rhine Brewery District in 1853 by its German immigrant namesake Mr. Christian Moerlein. By the end of the 19th-Century the brewery would be one of the largest in the United States. The brewery closed its doors when Prohibition began in 1919. The brand was revived in 1981 as one of the pioneer craft beers of todays craft beer movement, with the introduction of a series of Christian Moerlein beers by the Hudepohl Brewing Company. In 1984, Christian Moerlein Lager was the first American beer ever certified by the German government to pass the German Beer Purity Law (Reinheitsgebot). After a series of sales that took the business and brewing out of the region, the company was relocated once again to Cincinnati in 2004 by Gregory Hardman, its current local owner. With the goal of returning Cincinnati's grand brewing traditions, Hardman led the effort to build a world-class Moerlein Lager House brewery/gastropub on the banks of the Ohio River which opened in 2012 in Cincinnati's Smale Riverfront Park next to Great American Ballpark, home of the Cincinnati Reds. A spectacular craft brewing facility and Malt House Taproom opened in 2013 in the historic Over-the-Rhine brewery district, just blocks from its original 19th century home. The brewery offers tours and has a taproom in an original 1860's malt house complete with historic underground lagering cellars. The brewery is the first American craft brewer to rescue a City's heritage beer brands and owns Hudepohl-Schoenling Brewing Co. including the brands of Hudepohl, Hudy Delight, Hudy 14-K, Burger and Little Kings Cream Ale brands.
name: Christian Moerlein Brewing Company

description: Inspired by our grandfathers, Chuck and Alek, we draw on their legacy and the legacy of those who came before them, striving to brew creative, artistic, and uncommonly good beers. ChuckAlek Independent Brewers is pulling some of the past into the present by recovering, reviving, and recreating heritage craft brews.
name: ChuckAlek Independent Brewers

description: Enjoy world class European style, award winning lagers & ales and a local-centric menu of fresh American cuisine including woodstone pizzas, burgers, seafood, salads and more! All ages are welcome everyday starting at lunch and into the night.
name: Chuckanut Brewery & Kitchen

description:
The Church Street Brewing Company is bringing lagers and ales from around the world to Chicagoland. Using the finest malted barley and hops from North America, the UK, and Germany, there's something for every beer lover. Using traditional German brewing methods, Church Street will break new ground with beer-lovers by making an expansive range of both new and old beers and ales, pleasing all palates!

While we currently have several year-round beers, our tap rotation will continue to evolve, with special releases and seasonal brews. We love hearing from customers, so let us know what your favorite styles are — we might just try a batch!
name: Church Street Brewing Company

description:
Founded in 2000, Church-Key Brewing is located in an 1878 Methodist Church on the outskirts of the town of Campbellford, Ontario.

The only microbrewery in picturesque Northumberland County, Church-Key features a variety of award-winning hand-crafted ales including our flagship Northumberland Ale and the multi award-winning Holy Smoke Scotch Ale. All of our ales are made in small batches from four ingredients: malted barley, hops, water, and yeast. Within these traditions, each Church-Key product has distinct properties of color, richness, and aroma that make it unique.

Open daily from 10am until dark, visitors are always welcome to learn all about the brewing process on a guided tour. Afterwards, sample our excellent ales in the tasting room. All of our ales are available in our gift shop in six-packs and Growlers along with local honey and bison products, and Church-Key clothing and glassware.
name: Church-Key Brewing

description:
A limited production artisanal nano brewery located in Carson, Iowa. Opened December 21, 2011.

To produce full flavored, real beer with the highest quality from local ingredients and sell that beer to our friends and family.

CIB is a small batch, production only nano brewery with an emphasis on flavor, evironmental responsibility, local artwork, ingredients, and distribution.
name: CIB Brewery

description:
From early morning through late afternoon, we bring a winemaker’s approach to producing small batches of handcrafted hard apple ciders. It starts with cold fermenting small lots of fresh apple juice to capture the delicate flavors and complex balance that makes this Mother Nature’s most refreshing adult beverage. The result is our refreshing, lightly carbonated artisan cider, produced at our Lodi winery.

Starting around sunset, we bring a cider lover’s approach, along with a bottle opener and a couple of chilled glasses, and enjoy the fruits of our daytime jobs. Join us tonight on our journey to great taste and enjoy America’s first adult beverage.
name: Cider Brothers

description:
Cider Riot! is dedicated to producing high quality ciders from Cascadian grown apples. With tradition as our guide and 
our roots firmly planted in the rich soils of our bioregion, our urban cidery produces refreshing, flavorful ciders.
name: Cider Riot!

description:
Two very refreshing guys. One idea.
Create unique hard ciders blending unexpected fresh fruit flavors with the crisp taste of apple.
name: Ciderboys Cider Co.

description: Cigar City Brewing was founded with two goals in mind. The first to make the world's best beer and the second to share with people near and far the fascinating culture and heritage of the Cigar City of Tampa. From its past as the world's largest cigar producer to its Latin roots and the many other diverse peoples that call it home, Tampa draws on many sources to develop its unique culture. At CCB we are fascinated by Tampa's history and suspect you will be too.
name: Cigar City Brewing

description:
When we brewed our first batch of beer we never imagined where it would take us. The passion that was created for brewing these unique full flavored beers became intoxicating to all of us. This dream has been 3 years in the making and took a bit of luck and a lot of hard work.

It’s hard to believe we started small at our homes and have now grown into our 15bbl facility with a full taproom and barrel aging program. We haven’t forgotten our roots as we continue to focus on unique full flavored beers with plenty of character and a whole lot of attitude. We strive to share a truly unique experience in every glass of Cinder Block Beer.
name: Cinder Block Brewery

description: At Circle, all of our brews embody the concept of purity through simplicity of design.  You won’t find chemicals, stabilizing or clarifying agents, cheap additives or adjuncts, or even gimmicky fruits or spices in any of our brews.  At Circle, we embrace the German Purity standards of 1516 and continually brew better beer with that in mind.  To us, the circle is a symbol of perfection in its most basic form.  We share that perfection with you in every pint of Circle.
name: Circle Brewing Company

description:
Cismontane Brewing Co. was started by two native southern Californians, Ross Stewart and Evan Weinberg. They chose the name Cismontane because the geographical area it represents, coastal Southern California from Santa Barbara to San Diego. As a brewery we are dedicated to creating the finest beers to represent the unique culture and diverse natural aspects of this region. Each beer is named after a local feature that is unique to the area.

The Brewery is located on the side of the largest mountain in Orange County in the city of Rancho Santa Margarita. The great views from Santiago peak and the trails through the canyons provide some of the natural inspiration for the beers and the company.

The brewery is small and accessible to all with a warm and comfortable tasting area. So don’t hesitate to come by when in the area.

(cis-mon-tane)

“This side of the mountains”, in reference to coastal Southern California. This was a common term used for Southern California while it was forming its identity during the gold rush and before prohibition.
name: Cismontane Brewing

description: Justin Heilenbach, Bryan Holmes and Kris Nelson founded Citizen Cider in 2010 on a hunch and some good old-fashioned hard work. Kris was working as a wine salesmen, Bryan as a chemist and Justin as a small farmer. All discontent for one reason or another, they started pressing sweet cider in Kris’s barn and fermenting test batches of hard cider in Bryan’s basement. As it happens, they discovered that their ideas about hard cider translated into some pretty unique and interesting finished products.
name: Citizen Cider

description: City Brewing Company is one of the premier contract beverage producers in the country. Our two production facilities located in La Crosse, Wisconsin and Latrobe, Pennsylvania have the capacity to package over 60 million cases annually. Both facilities have the capability to produce beer, flavored malt beverages, teas and energy drinks in a variety of bottle and can sizes and configurations. We pride ourselves in quality and reliability for our customers which include some of the largest beverage companies in the country. Our facilities coupled with the experience and dedication of our skilled employees enables our customers to meet the demands of an ever changing marketplace.
name: City Brewing Company, LLC

description:
Founded in 2011, the City Island Beer Company produces hand-crafted beer inspired by a local ship building tradition of craftsmanship and quality that produced seven America's Cup winning yachts. 

Our mission is to bring you the best beer made with the finest ingredients.
name: City Island Beer Company

description: Small batch ales hand crafted in the heart of downtown Berthoud, Colorado. Taproom open daily.
name: City Star Brewing Company

description: Have a blast with our laughs and drafts!
name: City Steam Brewery

description:
We hold these truths to be self-evident: that all men are created equal, with certain unalienable Rights, that among these are Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of fine crafted ales. 

We are a local craft brewery situated in the great Tower Grove South neighborhood. We currently have 8 beers on draft a British Bitter, English Best, American Brown, German Wheat, Scottish Ale, Vienna Lager, Black Lager, Munich Dunkel Lager. We built a very traditional pub inside of an old warehouse. Best yet, our beers can be found around town. Head to our web-site at www.thecivillife.com for a listing. Hope you can enjoy a pint sometime soon and check us out. Cheers!
name: Civil Life Brewing Company

description: At CJ's, we're all about the beer. Enjoy our great brews and ales along with a delicious meal.  Watch the brewmaster as he prepares some of the six fresh brews we have on tap daily in the brewing room.  In season, slip out the back door and enjoy your beer and dine on our open air patio. Our menu offers a wide variety of delicious and creative beer- friendly dishes made with the freshest ingredients.
name: CJ's Brewing Company

description:
We are a 3 1/2 barrel small-batch craft brewery located in Eugene, Oregon. Our beers are European influenced styles made in the Northwest tradition with the best Northwest ingredients. We focus on quality, flavor, and community. 

We love beer, and we love food. And we love what happens when friends get together and enjoy great beer alongside fantastic local food. Our beers will be available at restaurants and bars in the Eugene area that share our philosophy on quality, local ingredients, and community.
name: Claim 52 Brewing

description: 10 bbl brew house
name: Claimstake Brewing Company

description: New Brewpub, Restaurant, and Handcrafted Beer Company in Cadillac, Michigan!
name: Clam Lake Beer Company

description: We are passionate about brewing and united in our quest to produce beer of the highest quality.
name: Clandestine Brewing

description: Located in eastern Los Angeles County in a picturesque college town, Claremont Craft Ales is dedicated to bringing premium hand-crafted ales to the local community.  With a focus on freshness and variety, CCA has quickly become a favorite watering hole for a clientele that places a strong value on locally-made authentic products.  As CCA grows into the future, we are excited to bring this beer philosophy to a wider audience.
name: Claremont Craft Ales

description: We are a small craft brewery located in historic downtown Buffalo, WY at the foot of the Bighorn Mountains.
name: Clear Creek Brewing Company

description: Craft brewery in San Leandro, CA.
name: Cleophus Quealy Beer Company

description: Climax Brewing began as the dream of two home brewers who felt it was time for some good beer. Most of the recipes we use to brew our beer today started out as Dave's own home brewing recipes and all are developed from the style guidelines and are 100% representations of their given style.
name: Climax Brewing Company

description: Climbing Bines Craft Ale Company is one of New York State's first farm breweries! We specialize in small batch, hand-crafted ales brewed on site with the freshest, estate-grown hops and barley harvested just a few miles down the road.
name: Climbing Bines Craft Ale Co.

description:
Clouds Brewing was built in the summer of 2014 with the idea of being a technologically advanced bar that caters to the crowds of downtown Raleigh.  As businesses continue to evolve and change in Raleigh, we wanted to bring that feeling to the local restaurant scene by offering items that no one else does.  The self-serve beer wall, The Downpour, allow patrons to sample, select, and pour their own beer.  We are importing beers from both Europe and across America to supplement our soon to be released beer line.  A collaborative effort of Matt MacNeil and Adam Hoffman, the goals of the company are simple: Great Beer, Great Food, and Great Service.

Located in the Historic CP&L Garage, the space has been renovated to bring back the industrial feel that the Powerhouse Square District deserves.  With garage doors that connect the patio to the restaurant, exposed columns, and I-beams, as well as a custom concrete bar with reclaimed wood accents, we’ve blended the modern with the historic.  The industrial atmosphere has been infused with technology wherever possible. Wi-Fi tablets for tableside service, LED lighting, and of course The Downpour (our self-serve beer wall), all come together to create a space that feels both raw and unfinished, yet modern and  functional.  Come enjoy a drink with friends, cheer your favorite team to victory, or host a company event.

A bar and restaurant focused on craft beer, Clouds Brewing is home to The Downpour; using RFID technology you can start a tab and pour your own beer. And the best part is you pay by the ounce, not by the pint! Feel free to try a small taste of each beer, or a pint of your favorite—the choice is yours. With 10 rotating taps there is always something new to try, and with no need to buy whole pints, you can try them all! So seriously, come on down, grab a glass, and “Experience the Downpour!”

Our bar features 40 beers on draft with 10 of those located on The Downpour.  We also offer a large selection of canned and bottled beer, ciders and mead, along with wine and liquor.
name: Clouds Brewing

description:
Founded in December 2009 by beer lovers trying to make work fun again, Clown Shoes has been redefining what craft beer should be. We strive to add our own little creative twists on under-represented styles and styles in need of change.

Our mission now is to produce beer without pretension while being free and a little crazy.
name: Clown Shoes Beer

description: Carmel Indiana's downtown brewpub.
name: CMG Brewery

description:
CO Brew is Denver's only homebrew supply store, small-scale brewery, and brew on premises experience. Denver metro homebrewers looking for a full selection of grains, hops, yeast and equipment will appreciate our convenient location at 11th & Broadway in Central Denver.

Brew on premises is a unique opportunity to learn to brew or to improve your brewing skills using professional-grade equipment. If you live in a small space and do not have room to brew or store brewing equipment, want to learn how to brew, or simply enjoy having fun and want to brew with friends, brew on premises is perfect for you. In addition, we will handle all of the set-up and messy clean-up.
name: CO-Brew

description: Located in Historic Downtown Norman, The Brewhouse was first established in 1993 to provide beer for the Coach's Restaurant concepts. Over time it has evolved into its own entity which features many different facets. Of course it is a fully functional self-sustaining brewery first and foremost. Oklahoma's largest brewery at 30 barrels (that's 900 gallons at a time), we've been doing it longer than anyone. The big beautiful stainless-steel brewery is enclosed by glass so that visitors can see it at all times. But that's not the only reason to visit. We've also got 9 full sized pool tables, and are one of Norman's premier live music venues. We've had Grammy winners, Blues Hall-of-Famers, local acts, regional acts, VH-1's Save the Music Tour, and later this year we'll host Color Me Badd's first live performance in 10 years.
name: Coach's Brewing Co

description: The Coachella Valley Brewing Co is liquid perfection.
name: Coachella Valley Brewing Co.

description: Coal Creek turned 21, so naturally, we opened a nano-brewery! Visit us at 108 Grand Ave. located right next door to the downtown Coal Creek Coffee shop. Currently, we have 13 different brews on tap, ensuring that everyone will find something to love. Every beer is hand-crafted on site by owner and brew-master, John Guerin, a long-time business owner and Laramie entrepreneur. At Coal Creek TAP we encourage you to break out of your beer comfort zone and experience something new. And, if you're not ready to commit to a pint, we offer 5oz. and 10oz. pours as well as flights of our beers. We've got something for everyone's palate: a light, fruity and refreshing pilsner; a rich and creamy smoked porter, a variety of pale ales and IPA's, and big, bright and spicy Belgians!
name: Coal Creek TAP

description:
Coalition Brewing was born out of a serendipitous chance encounter between owners Kiley Hoyt and Elan Walsky. Both began as home brewers and received formal brewing education through the Siebel Institute in Chicago.

Their love of beer and the brewing process is the impetus for the Coalator Program, which encourages local home brewers to brew their recipes in the brewery and serve them at the pub.

Coalition Brewing prides itself on highly balanced, drinkable beers.
name: Coalition Brewing Company

description: COAST Brewing Company is a family owned craft brewery, on an old Navy base. We make beer we like to drink, simple and done well. We believe in choice organic and local ingredients. But it's not just about being organic, it's a certain mind set of considering the environment in everything we do. In fact, we're not certified organic and have no plans to be-we do it because we believe it's the right thing. All of our ingredients are listed including which are organic. Welcome and thanks for your continued support!
name: COAST Brewing Company

description: Artisan ales and lagers.
name: Coastal Empire Beer Company

description:
The Coastal Extreme Brewing Company was started in 1999 by four graduates of Colby College. During his college days the head brewer, Derek Luke, reaquired a homebrewing kit he had given his sister and quickly went to work brewing and passing his knowledge along to the company's president, Brent Ryan. As Graduation grew near and the cold reality of post-collegiate life set in Luke and Ryan knew that they could turn their affinity for beer and their new found ability to make it into a viable alternative to unemployment or sitting at a desk answering to "The Man". Of course, they couldn't do it by themselves, so after very little convincing, they got roommate and friends, Mark Sinclair and Will Rafferty to join them.

On Father's Day in 1999, after almost two years of planning and preperation, the first batch of Hurricane Amber Ale was brewed. By July 2nd the first kegs had been shipped to three Newport Restaurants and were quickly tapped and emptied. A little over a month after the release of the first kegs, 6-packs of Hurricane Amber Ale began to hit the shelves. Since then we have expanded our product line and our distribution territory but continue to brew up a storm in our Middletown Brewery.
name: Coastal Extreme Brewing Company

description: Owned by Molson Coors
name: Cobra Beer

description: We know how satisfying it is to enjoy a nice hand crafted beer, that is why at Cobra Brewing Company we brew with only top quality ingredients. All of our crafted beer is brewed locally in Flower Mound, TX.
name: Cobra Brewing Company

description:
Cocoa Beach Brewing Company is a family owned and operated brewery and pub.  We are located in historic downtown Cocoa Beach on Atlantic Avenue (northbound Highway A1A) between 1st Street North and 2nd Street North.  We are proud to be located in one of the oldest buildings in world famous Cocoa Beach.  Built in the 1930s, our building was originally Navy housing for the Banana River Naval Air Station.  It has since been home to a number of commercial enterprises.

Our brewery consists of a custom designed and built 1.5 bbl Brewhouse and three 1.5 bbl stainless steel conical fermentation tanks.
name: Cocoa Beach Brewing Company

description: CODA Brewing pairs beer with music, art and food.
name: Coda Brewing Co.

description:
Cody Brewing Company is located in Historic Amesbury, Massachusetts on the Powow River. We make hand crafted beer that combines traditional styles with rule breaking ideas to make the best beer possible. We brew on a 7 barrel system, which is just over 200 gallons, to make 1200 barrels each year.

Hand crafted beer that combines traditional styles with rule breaking ideas to make the best beer possible that our customers enjoy. Always.
name: Cody Brewing Company

description: Representing Japan’s globally appealing craft beer, COEDO makes premium craft beers in Japan, whose brewing and high quality has received accolades from the world.
name: Coedo Brewery

description: We are a brewery in development in the city of Norfolk, Virginia. We are building out our space in an historic Warehouse in the Ghent neighborhood of the city.
name: Coelacanth Brewing

description:
Cognition Brewing Company is the newest addition to the growing craft beer scene here in Michigan’s Upper Peninsula. We are located right in the heart of the U.P. where the winters are long but enjoyed. We are proud to be located in an area that has such strong appreciation for community and locally made products. It only makes sense that the people that live here have strong work ethics and aren’t afraid to help one another out because that is what it takes to get by up here.

It has been a long journey for us at Cognition Brewing Company and we are really excited to be bringing you a product that we have worked hard to produce. Whether you come visit us at the tap room or find our beer on tap somewhere else, we truly hope that you enjoy it to the fullest. Our beers are brewed in small batches in our humble 7 barrel brewery that is located in the historic Mather Inn.

We want our beer to be more than just a beverage. We hope that when you sit down to a pint, you do so in great company and experience the beer to every degree.
name: Cognition Brewing Company

description:
This historical brewery founded in 1874 has a storied tradition and heritage. It all began in the 1500”s. French Canadian trappers traveling west along the famous Red River Trail discovered this natural spring, which had the most refreshing water. Word of this spring spread and became a regular stop for all settlers going west on the Red River Trail. In 1857 Swiss born naturalist Armond DuPont wrote, “it is a water like no other, unique in its ability to refresh.” He noted, “Though seemingly impossible, a year-round frost forms at the base of this amazing spring.”

The brewery was built at the site of the spring and its water became the basis of all the award winning brews for over 125 years. In addition, the brewery has become the #1 energy drink and specialty drink producer in the country. We personally invite you to explore and enjoy our great water, drinks and brews.
name: Cold Spring Brewing Company

description: ColdFire Brewing is an emerging production brewery opening in Eugene, Oregon. In late 2015, we will begin sharing our quality ales at local establishments and from our own tasting room. Connect with us on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter. Cheers!
name: ColdFire Brewing

description: At the gateway to the Yarra Valley, Coldstream Brewery is a destination for those who have an appreciation for fine flavours and great beer and cider.
name: Coldstream Brewery

description: Enumclaw's first craft brewery
name: Cole Street Brewery

description:
Collective Arts is a grassroots beer company built on the creativity inherent in both the craft beer and the arts communities. By fusing distinctly crafted beer with inspired art and artists we aspire to raise the creative consciousness through the sociability of beer. 

Collective Arts is made up with a team of creative junkies all brought together through our common love of well crafted beer. Our beers will be developed and continually re-imagined in collaboration with emerging brewmasters, artists, filmmakers, musicians and visionaries. 

Collective Arts first brew, Rhyme & Reason Extra Pale Ale launches in Toronto and throughout the Province of Ontario on September 9, 2013.
name: Collective Arts Brewing

description: Just a quick drive to the north side of town, you'll find yourself at Havasu's hippest new brewhouse and pub. Here we focus on creating one-of-a-kind handcrafted beers. Revelers will appreciate sipping a smooth, flavorful craft brew while enjoying our rustic cuisine. Our casual atmosphere, outdoor dining, large bar and views of Lake Havasu are sure to become your favorite place to come and unwind.
name: College Street Brewhouse & Pub

description: It's a brewery. We make beer.
name: Colockum Craft Brewing

description:
Colorado Boy is owned and operated by Tom & Sandy Hennessy (Pictured at right) who have been in the brewing business since 1993, starting with IL Vicino in Albuquerque, Colorado Springs, and Salida, Colorado, and the Palisade Brewery in Palisade, Colorado.

Since 1993, Tom has been pushing the idea of Frankenbrew and publishd a video on how to build inexpensive brewing systems in 1995. Colorado Boy is the culmination of years of owning and operating different breweries. Stop by and see how small and efficient Frankenbrew works.
name: Colorado Boy Pub & Brewery

description: Founded in 1995, Colorado Brewery prides itself on keeping alive while renewing the ancient tradition of brewing beer in the city of Ribeirão Preto.
name: Colorado Brewery

description: New Brewhouse/Micro-Brewery in downtown Boulder, CO. What was the Redfish Brewhouse location, the Colorado Brewing Company/Boulder Draft House opened its doors February 20, 2009. We are a Boulder brewhouse serving amazing comfort food that is regionally and globally inspired along with perfectly balanced handcrafted beers for the everyday beer drinker and the micro-brew enthusiast, all served in a friendly and comfortable setting that is enhanced by quality live music several days a week
name: Colorado Brewing Company

description: The Colorado Cider Company was founded to produce a fresh hard cider for the discerning Colorado drinker. With a well-developed craft beer market and an educated populace Hard Cider has been a missing choice in the cacophony of craft drinks in local pubs and liquor stores. We hope to remedy that. We're getting out in the market, check out our "Find us" page!
name: Colorado Cider Company

description: The 1st brew pub in the history of Wheat Ridge, CO. Brewery Tap House and Restaurant.
name: Colorado Plus
Columbia Bay Brewery Restaurant and Pub

description: Purchased by Labatt in 1974, and therefore now part of AnheuserBusch-InBev.
name: Columbia Brewery

description:
We are Rod Smith and Bill Collister. We have been working together for 13 years at Farason Corporation. www.farason.com We became friends quickly due partly for our love of engineering and automation, as well as, our love and passion for craft beers. Our favorite past time has been traveling around visiting craft breweries, brewpubs and taprooms together, along with our wives, for 10 years now. Rod took up home brewing 5 years ago and has become quite proficient at brewing delicious beers to the delight and enjoyment of his colleagues, friends, and family. Rod's talent for brewing and Bill's business experience seemed like a good match for a brewpub that would allow us to continue enjoying Rod's hobby to its fullest extent and share it with many more fellow craft brew enthusiasts. We expect the creation, operation, and continuing evolution of the brewpub to provide us another outlet for our passions by providing a quality product and environment in which to enjoy it, along with meeting and enjoying the company of many people with the same love and passion for high quality craft beer.

Originally we looked all over for a good location starting within a few miles of our homes and extending out as far as Columbia hoping for a place within reasonable driving distance from our homes. We believed the market would, to some extent, come to us. Over several months we looked at numerous potential sites and due to one reason or another couldn't find an acceptable location. We ran into floor restrictions, ceiling height issues, limited parking, zoning issues and unaffordable rent. When we eventually met and talked with David Doolittle, Doolittle Investments LLC, he showed us two potential sites in Columbia. David seemed very interested in bringing our type of business into Columbia and offered us reasonable lease pricing and an honest willingness to work with us to bring our dream of a microbrewery to reality. The drive is 35 minutes from our homes, but after considering the location as fairly equally distant between Lancaster and York (both of which have more than one brewery), and the fact we would be first in Columbia and nearby Marietta and Wrightsville, plus the proximity to Route 30, we were sold on the location. We have since discovered that Columbia Borough is quite willing to help us establish our business in their wonderful town. We are thankful and grateful for their assistance and cooperation and look forward to being a part of the community.

Our brewing equipment consists of a 5bbl brew kettle, a 5bbl mash tun, and a 5bbl hlt. We will have three 5bbl or larger fermenters. We are ale people so we will have blondes, pale ales, IPAs, Porters/Stoudts, bitters, and a variety of Belgian versions as well. We will open with 4 taps and gradually expand to 8.
We expect to open this winter, Nov/Dec., but that is dependent on receipt of the brewing equipment and completion of the site as tentatively scheduled. We will open quitely and plan for a more elaborate grand opening at a later date. This venture is a new experience for us and the people assisting us so we need to start out slowly. Our initial hours will be 5pm to 9pm Thursday and Friday and 12pm to 9pm on Saturday. We are planning a lite menu using seasonal local ingredients whenever possible.
name: Columbia Kettle Works

description: Columbus Brewing Company is located in the capital city's historic Brewery District. The Columbus Brewing Company was originally founded in 1830. In 1988, the name was once again chosen to resurrect the proud brewing heritage of its namesake. It's our goal to produce unique world class beers. So, we use only the finest ingredients, many locally harvested, to bring you the best in hand-crafted brews. Look for our award winning beers at your local grocery store and be sure to try our other seasonal selections on draft at fine restaurants and pubs throughout Ohio.
name: Columbus Brewing Company

description: Comanche Creek Brewing Company is a small family owned microbrewery nestled in the Sangre de Cristo mountains of Northern New Mexico and located just out side Eagle Nest, New Mexico. Comanche Creek Brewing Company offers its take on several tradition beer styles including Alt and Kölsch styles. We utilize the pristine mountain waters of the Sangre de Cristo mountains to bring our customers great tasting beer. We hope you enjoy our hand-crafted beers the next time you are in Northern New Mexico!
name: Comanche Creek Brewing Co

description: Hand crafted brews and great food at a fair price.
name: Commando Brewing Company

description: Local family owned, full production brewery housed inside a fully renovated, former fire and rescue station in Virginia Beach.
name: Commonwealth Brewing Co.

description:
BEER FOR THE GREATER GOOD.....

Community Beer Company represents many meanings --
all centered on what we feel a great Community represents.

FIRST: Beer is Communal. For ages, it’s been a central part of get-togethers among friends, family, and co-workers to celebrate old acquaintances ... or make new ones. 

SECOND: As a brewery, we are passionate about providing quality craft beer to the people within our Community: Dallas, Texas and the surrounding Metroplex. 

THIRD: We want to be stewards of our Community by adhering to environmentally sustainable business practices, production, and distribution. 

And FINALLY: We plan to become an integral part of our Community by giving back to it through charitable activities and supporting our local artists. 

Truly, Beer for the Greater Good!
name: Community Beer Company

description: Brewing up beers North Raleigh in 2015. Trust Your Compass!
name: Compass Rose Brewing

description: Welkome to the Party.  That's the motto for Comrade Brewing Company in southeast Denver.  Comrade features "back-to-basics" beers and a tongue-in-cheek nod to Communism.  But the name actually celebrates the camaraderie the craft brewing industry has become known for.
name: Comrade Brewing Company

description: Brewery / tap room
name: Conclave Brewing

description: Concrete Beach Brewery is located in the heart of the Wynwood Arts District, and will begin brewing craft beer in early 2014.
name: Concrete Beach Brewery

description: Confluence Brewing Company will be the only commerical micro-brewery in the area offering a wide variety of traditional handcrafted ales and lagers packaged in kegs and 16 oz. cans.
name: Confluence Brewing Company

description: The first production brewery in Columbia, SC established after prohibition.
name: Conquest Brewing Company

description:
Conshohocken Brewing Company is founded on the same American industrial spirit as the borough for which our brewery is named.

Conshohocken was an industrial national hub in the late 1800s – a time of bowler hats, small local breweries and velocipede bicycles. We are carrying that same spirit forward through our hand crafted beers and our personal commitment to each and every beer we brew.

Brewing in small batches, each of our beers is uniquely crafted, allowing us to share innovative, fresh, high quality beers with the good people of our communities. In addition to making beer we love, we have big plans to give back to the community and create a socially responsible brewery.

We look forward to raising our glasses with all of our neighbors and friends, both near and far.
name: Conshohocken Brewing Company

description:
After a terrific couple years of construction and planning, Constantine now has a Brewery/Winery. 

We will feature a daily BBQ plate, with rotating appetizers. Sunday features Hot Wings and Pizza! Everything is made here, the beer, the wine and all food from scratch featuring local ingredients wherever possible. 
We have 6 handles, with a variety of ales on tap. "Laughing Leaves" Wines are by Char, and made with grapes from our vineyard, and a vineyard in Allegan. Also, fruit wines made with fruit from local suppliers, including Hunts raspberries.

Most weekends will feature Live music by local solo acts, and duos.
name: Constantine Brewing Company

description:
Having reached our tenth anniversary milestoe we continue to produce cask & bottled ales of the highest quality with probably the best range of ales in North Wales. We are proud of our Welsh roots with all beers brewed and bottled at our brewery in Llysfaen, Conwy, North Wales. We have innovated with our Infusion ale winning the first ever Beer Academy Welsh Pale Ale award in 2012. At our new premises in Llysfaen we have installed a brewery designed by Brendan Dobbin the brewing engineer behind the Firkin brewpubs.

We have a new brand West Coast Brewing to showcase modern beer styles with California & Riptide so far and more planned in the future.
name: Conwy Brewery

description: Currently a local microbrewery with a tap room now open Wednesdays and Fridays.
name: Conyngham Brewing Company

description:
Cool Beer Brewing Company was founded in 1997 by Bobby Crecouzos. His ambition was simple: to brew only the highest quality beer, made with the best ingredients, using absolutely no preservatives, additives or chemicals.

From the beginning, Cool didn’t focus on marketing and promotions. The Company concentrated on the product and the brewing process. Headquartered in Brampton, Ontario, the once-tiny Brewery grew steadily as its Cool Beer brand became increasingly successful. So much so, Cool had to expand its operations a number of times.

But the commitment to quality never changed.

By 2003, Cool was sufficiently well-established for the Brewery to launch another high-quality beer, new Millennium Buzz Beer. Buzz is a refreshing red lager which has also proved to be a resounding success.

Both Cool and Buzz will always be made with the finest ingredients, contain no additives whatsoever, and be put through the Brewery’s advanced cold-filtration system that makes them two of the most refreshing and thirst-quenching beers available. Judging by their success, a commitment to quality still pays off!
name: Cool Beer Brewing Company

description: Brewpub with a focus on innovation and unique brewing styles. We utilize multiple yeast strains and techniques to develop traditional sours, and Belgian style beer. We also love the hops, and most of CSB's pales represents a PNW hop characteristic.
name: Cool Springs Brewery

description:
COOP Ale Works began with a humble home brewer and a simple dream. The idea spread as friends tasted the unique beers, and the popularity of those early batches encouraged a dedicated team of three partners to begin working to make the dream of a local brewery a reality. Mark Seibold, JD Merryweather and Daniel Mercer spent the next two years traveling throughout the United States, Europe and Central America visiting breweries and sampling local flavors. The insight gained from entrepreneurs, brewers, biologists, operations personnel and consumers provided an invaluable basis for a serious endeavor into quality commercial brewing. By integrating this knowledge with the local, regional and national brewing trends, as well as local feedback, the trio planned the birth and growth of the yet unnamed COOP. After nearly 3 years of research, comprising thousands of man hours and dozens of test batches, COOP fashioned its identity as a steadfast professional team that holds closely a passion for bringing quality, local beer to taps and homes in Oklahoma City and beyond.

 

With the help of close friends and fellow craft-beer fans, COOP was capitalized on July 15th, 2008. In less than 6 months, the COOP team; navigated the multi-layered regulatory process, secured a building lease, completed the remodel, purchased and installed a commercial brewery, obtained brewing licenses from the State of Oklahoma and the Federal Tax and Trade Bureau, created and branded original recipe beers and brewed the first full scale batches for distribution.

The outpouring of support that has come from friends of the COOP team has been overwhelming. Our sincere hope is that you – the fan of COOP Ale Works – will take pride in the beers, as if they were your own. Thank you for your unwavering support and encouragement!
name: COOP Ale Works

description:
We'd been brewing up beer in the kitchen at home for a few years. In 1995, we were informed that Ed's corporate employer of eleven years was leaving the area (NAFTA). Not wanting to move, and having had enough of the corporate world, we decided to do some research and see what was out there. At that time there were no breweries, brew pubs or microbreweries in our area. A two week vacation to Nova Scotia was inspirational.

It was the comradery of the brewers, owners and staff members that really sold us on the idea of opening our own establishment.The Micro Brewery people we've met have been generous beyond our wildest expectations, with information, how-to, where to find it, etc.
name: Cooper's Cave Ale Company

description:
Cooperage Brewing Company will produce Cellar beers: small batch, artisan, barrel aged sour ales meant for aging as well as more traditional beer styles.

Cooperage Brewing Company will be a production craft brewery and retail Tap Room in Sonoma County, CA. Cooperage Brewing Company will focus on producing two lines of beer: Cellar beers: premium, small batch, artisanal, barrel aged sour ales meant for aging and Cultivate: more traditional and everyday drinking ales and lagers.

Our goal is to provide our customers with a beer that makes them think. A beer that causes them to stop for a moment to inhale the complex aromas, to allow it to linger just a bit longer in their mouth, to taste the depth of flavor and really want to know what is in there and how its made. We will start small and grow organically at a manageable pace to ensure quality. 

Cooperage Brewing Company will produce world-class beers and provide a safe and comfortable drinking environment in which one can truly enjoy their beer. We value a properly trained staff, correct glassware, correct serving temperatures, glass/growler rinse, spot on carbonation levels, and a high level of cleanliness.
name: Cooperage Brewing Company

description: Coopers Brewery produce a range of Ales,Stouts and Lagers.   Our ale range is brewed by a method of top fermentation, originating in the Middle Ages.  Coopers uses only natural ingredients including malt, hops, sugar, water and a special yeast strain that's over 90 years old.  Coopers do not use preservatives or chemicals in their ale range.   Coopers also produce Stout and Lager beers.  The Lager beers are bottom fermented in cooler conditions, matured for a short period and pasteurised.
name: Coopers Brewery

description:
Tucked into the heart of Old Town Fort Collins, CooperSmith's offers a distinct alternative in eating & drinking establishments. We invite you to enjoy both our poolside and pubside.

For a fun, interactive look at all of the beers that they've brewed over the years, check out their Beer Finder at http://www.coopersmithspub.com/beer.
name: CooperSmith's Pub & Brewing

description:
The Cooperstown area had a significant impact on American Brewing. It started with the introduction of hop farming which flourished here until the end of the 19th century. Back then, Otsego and the surrounding counties produced most of the hops grown in the United States.

Traveling through the upper Susquehanna Valley towards Cooperstown in July 1898, a visitor would have enjoyed the view of hop farms with those beautiful hop vines reaching toward the midsummer sky. Grandfather Eckler ws a hop farmer and he used to say, "The hop was King in those days!" His hop farm was in Westville, NY only three miles up the Cherry Valley from where our Brewery is now located. When it came time for the hops to be harvested, Grandma Eckler would "put up" a dozen people from "the City' and they would pick the hops for their room and board and a "vacation" in the country. My mother, Cynthia Eckler Hall, said she always loved it when the hop pickers came to the farm. Everyone had a lot of fun during the harvest. When the blight devastated his crop in the early 1900's, grandfather turned to dairy farming.
Settled by Englishmen in the early 1800's, Cooperstown once had two English-style breweries in town. Following that tradition, the Cooperstown Brewing Company was founded in 1994. We brew premium ales, porters, and stouts using the finest two-row English barley malts, West Coast hops and the English Ringwood Yeast.

Grandpa would be pleased if he could see the Brewery. We have hops growing here that survived the devastating blight to New York hop farming and those hops grown here are used to finish our Back Yard India Pale Ale.
name: Cooperstown Brewing Company

description: In 1873, as the United States approached its centennial year, its people were busy building a new kind of nation. It was thirsty work. And that's where Coors Brewing Company came in. When we began in that same year, we were a small, family-owned brewery, located at the foot of the Rocky Mountains. We were busy creating the same kind of crisp, refreshing beer we're known for today. While hundreds of such family-owned breweries have come and gone in the years since, we believe the reasons for our success are simple. We've never compromised on quality in producing our award-winning brews and we've never lost sight of our rich Rocky Mountain heritage. Just as important, we've always believed in doing well by doing good. We treat our employees with respect, we support the local communities where we do business, and we strive to protect the environment. That's just how we do business.
name: Coors Brewing Company

description:
Relax.  You shouted. We heard you.  Copp Winery of Crystal River Florida is now Copp Winery and Brewery. 

We are proud to be the first and ONLY winery to also hold a brewpub license in the State of Florida!

With that distinction comes a responsibility that we have not taken lightly.  In addition to continuing to offer you the best selection of hand-crafted wines produced on premises from the finest domestic and imported varietals and blends of grapes and juices, our craft microbrewery now produces and offers the highest quality selection of hand crafted beers made on premises from the finest domestic and imported ingredients, like quality English barley malt and the freshest dried hops. 

Because our beers are produced in smaller quantities, we can offer not only the highest quality but diversity in our craft beers.  Like our extremely popular True Grit pale ale with corn grits, our brown ale Center Field or our English style porter Inaugabrew. 

While some of our craft beers will always be on tap, others will be limited production.  Don't miss out - visit often and enjoy!
name: Copp Brewery

description: Lake Havasu City, Arizona's first Nano Brewery. Specializing in Handcrafted Ales and Lagers.
name: Copper Canyon Brewing Co.

description: Copper Club Brewing Company is a new local brewing company in Fruita Colorado serving high quality beers in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere. Food can be brought in or have it delivered.
name: Copper Club Brewing Company

description: (No longer brewing)
name: Copper Dragon Brewing

description: Copper Kettle Brewery is an up and coming brewery owned by Harold Kerlin and Russ Eisenhuth. We have been independently brewing beer for the past 6 years. In 2006 we won First place in the Sam Adams Longshot contest for the northeast region of the U.S. with our Potbelly Porter. After that we decided to start our own brewery. The Brewery is located in just outside of Laurelton PA. We are a small production brewery using a one barrel brewing system. We hope to produce around 50 barrels a year. At present we are making 4 different styles of beer. A Wheat beer, Porter, Grand Cru, and Belgian Dubbel. All of our beer is unfiltered, and bottle conditioned. Our beers are now available at the Bull Run Inn, Market St., Lewisburg, The Beer Barn, Lewisburg and Wehr's Beverages, Mifflinburg.
name: Copper Kettle Brewery

description: Copper Kettle Brewing Company is a locally owned Mom and Pop brewery, established in 2011. Built on the foundation of craft beer, quality ingredients and the idea of re-creating the local neighborhood pub feel that America seems to have lost. Come on in and enjoy a pint or two and take a growler home with you to share with your friends and family
name: Copper Kettle Brewing Company

description: We found the perfect location in Boynton Beach, Florida for our production Brewery. We are open!
name: Copperpoint Brewing Company

description: Coppertail Brewing Co is a production brewery and taproom in progress scheduled to open in Tampa in late 2013. It was started by local home brewers and craft beer enthusiasts, Kent Bailey and Robb Larson. Brewmaster is Casey Hughes.
name: Coppertail Brewing Co.

description:
Corcoran Brewing Company was founded in 2011 on the beautiful foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains in Waterford Virginia. This was the second business venture for Corcoran whom had been making award winning wines since 2004. Corcoran which is family owned and operated decided in 2011 to branch out into the hand crafted beer industry. Initially started in a barn on old farmland near Corcoran Vineyards, this combination became Virginia’s first vineyard / brewery combo in the state. After several years of growing business it was realized that there was not enough room to stay as demand for the beer grew. In early 2014 the brewery was moved to Purcellville Virginia which is about 6 miles from where it started.

Corcoran Brewing Company has produced over thirty three distinct beers since opening day. We strive to create both traditional beer types as well as creating unique experiences with experimental beers. On any given day we have twelve beers on tap ranging from Kolch style, American Pale Ales, IPA’s, Imperial IPA’s, Stouts, Bourbon barrel aged, port barrel aged and more. This daily broad selection of quality hand-made craft beers has been a primary reason for our success. Customers can always find a beer that meets their drinking style.
name: Corcoran Brewing Company

description: Every great community needs a local flavor and Core Brewing & Distilling Company is out to be Arkansas’ hometown beer. Our brews are big and innovative rooted in tradition. We brew with passion and pride. From grain to glass, we brew beer for this great community to love and share.
name: Core Brewing & Distilling Co.

description: Beaumont's first Mirco Brewery, located in Bevil Oaks. Look for our tasty brews in a restaurant or store near you!
name: Cornel's Brewing Company

description:
When we opened the doors to our beach town brew pub on Coronado Island in
1996, we wanted it to be the kind of place where friends count enjoy great
beer, a good meal and a laid-back atmosphere.
Now, years later, our brewery’s a lot bigger and we’ve gotten a number of
awards. But we’re still following that same dream: brewing exceptionallly
balanced beer that’s authentically inspired by our West Coast roots. And
offering that experience to an ever-growing family that seeks an undeniable
coastal vibe, and shares our passion for great beer.
Welcome to Coronado Brewing Company. A Coastal Calling.
name: Coronado Brewing Company

description: Welcome to the Cortland Beer Company, the start of something new in Cortland, NY. We are located at 16 Court Street, in the heart of Downtown Cortland, NY. Our tasting room is open and we are selling growlers and kegs at this time. You may also call ahead and pre-order your growler to go. We will do our best to have it packaged and ready to pick-up when you stop in. Keep your eyes open in the next few months for Cortland Beer Company beers at your favorite local pub’s and restaurants, and ask them to put it on tap.
name: Cortland Beer Company

description:
Brewing a truly cosmic beer.
We are committed to brewing true flavors of beer that satisfy every taste bud.
name: Cosmic Ales

description:
Nanobrewery in Buffalo NY currently in the licensing phase of start up. We look forward to serving handcrafted ales that we feel are both creative and a solid contribution to the craft beer renaissance. 

To enhance the culture of craft beer and quality of life of our community and customers by providing handcrafted, artisan ales created with thought, passion and attention to detail provided in an atmosphere that aspires to create mutual engagement.
name: Cosmic Frog Handcrafted Ales

description: CoStar Brewing is Pittsburgh's newest nano-brewery. Our brews can be found in some of your favorite eating and drinking establishments in the East End.
name: CoStar Brewing

description:
An LLC started by Brett Cotton and Krista Cotton in January 2011. The microbrewery license was issued to Cotton Brewing Company in August 2012. Build out of the brewery has been completed, inspections are finished, and we have begun building our tap room on Oak St. in Adrian.

Cotton Brewing currently has a production facility that is not open to the general public. Beer may be purchased directly from the production facility by appointment only.
name: Cotton Brewing Co.

description:
Cottrell Brewing Company is a Connecticut-based micro brewery, manufacturing delicious craft beers a fine New England tradition.

Our flagship brew is Old Yankee Ale, which is a medium bodied, American Amber Ale, that has a great up-front malt taste with a refreshing hop finish.

More recently, we launched Mystic Bridge, which is a great example of a year ‘round New England IPA.  A mild earthy IPA with hints of citrus, this beer is great for paring with foods or for session drinking.

We believe in drinking local and thinking global!
name: Cottrell Brewing Company

description:
Council Brewing Company, established in 2013 and opened in 2014, is a small batch brewery, located in the Kearny Mesa area of San Diego. 

Our tasting room has been deliberately crafted to create a destination for people from all walks of life to come together, converse, and fellowship over truly fine craft beer. The name "Council" was chosen because it conveys this sense of community; a place where peers come together to deliberate, debate, and make decisions. The tasting room has a warm, inviting feeling, with green, tan, and rustic red toned walls, soft brown flooring and rich Mahogany bar tops. Careful thought was placed into the low music sound levels and decision to not install televisions in order to promote conversations. 

We place a tremendous emphasis on creating exemplary beer, crafted to the highest standards. We brew beers that are unique and extremely flavorful, focusing on Ales hailing from American, Belgian, and English origins. No matter what the style, we focus on creating intense aromas and flavors that are very well balanced and drinkable. Click over to "Our Beer" to find out more about our beer offerings.

Council Brewing Company is owned and operated by Curtis & Liz Chism and you can usually find them at the tasting room serving up freshly crafted beer.
name: Council Brewing Company

description: Handcrafted Beer & Hearty Food
name: Council Rock Brewery

description: The core of the Counterbalance players, Frank Lawrence and Jeff Howell, met in their previous careers with Seattle specialty coffee mainstay Caffe Ladro. In their respective roles as Project Manager and Operations Manager, Frank and Jeff developed a great working relationship, a mutual desire to enjoy life, and a shared love of great beer.
name: Counterbalance Brewing Company

description: Country Boy Brewing was founded in late 2011 by three country boys who like beer and had a similar goal of making and drinking good beer.
name: Country Boy Brewing

description:
The County Cider Company & Estate Winery is a family-operated estate winery specializing in mouth-watering hard ciders. (In North America hard cider is an alcoholic drink made from fermented apple juice.) Carefully crafted from the best apples grown on our family farm and nearby orchards, our ciders are made with 100% pure apple juice.

Located on the picturesque island of Prince Edward County in Southeastern Ontario, our tasting room and retail store welcomes visitors from May to November. Come visit us or look for County Cider Co. products at restaurants, bars and LCBO stores

The County Cider Company is located on Ontario’s island of Prince Edward County. Most famous for the giant sand dunes and golden beaches of Sandbanks Provincial Park, the County also enjoys a dramatic history.

Following the American Revolution of 1776 the Township of Marysburgh—home to the County Cider Co.—was one of many established for the settlement of United Empire Loyalists. Named in honour of Princess Mary, a daughter of King George III, it became home to a small group of disbanded German mercenaries under former Lieutenant Baron von Reitzenstein. This party, numbering about 40 persons, was one of the earliest German-speaking groups to settle in Ontario. By October 1784 they had begun to clear and cultivate the land. Henry David and his wife Elizabeth were among these early settlers and it was in 1830, that their son Conrad David, was given title to the lot, which the County Cider Co. now calls home.

conradhouseToday, the 1832 Conrad David House is an area landmark. Set on the brow of the Waupoos escarpment, the stone house is an excellent example of Regency Cottage architecture. It features dramatic French doors, over-sized windows and veranda as well as a hipped roof. Next door, the property’s picturesque 1832 stone barn houses the County Cider Co.’s tasting room and retail store. Visitors are invited to take advantage of the million-dollar view of Lake Ontario from our patio and enjoy a cold, refreshing cider and a light lunch.
