name: County Cider Company & Estate Winery

description: This Pickering brewery offers two unique ales. Their County Durham Signature Ale achieves a wonderful balance of malt and hop flavours creating a smooth, refreshing, golden ale. C'est What Homegrown Hemp Ale uses Ontario grown hemp seed to create a nutty cream style brew.
name: County Durham Brewing Company

description: Small batch nano brewery in New Orleans, Louisiana. Hoppy ales, barrel aged beers, and other fun stuff.
name: Courtyard Brewery

description:
Handcrafted seasonal and specialty beers. Please check facebook postings when open.
 We are not a brewpub. (no food / sit down only growler sales)

15 Campbell Rd
Catawissa, Pennsylvania
(570) 672-1283
name: Covered Bridge Brewhaus

description: Covington Brewhouse introduced a new craft brewing tradition to Louisiana in 2010 with the goal of showcasing local flavors and stories. Tours and tastings available to the general public weekly.
name: Covington Brewhouse

description:
Crabbie’s Original Alcoholic Ginger Beer is part of Scotland’s famous Crabbie clan, founded in 1801 in the ancient Scottish port of Leith.

Made from a secret recipe, Crabbie’s Original Alcoholic Ginger Beer has 4 top secret ingredients. We combine these with steeped ginger, which we still ship all the way from the Far East, just as the first Scots Merchant Adventurers did all those years ago. That explains the Elephant Trademark old chap!At Crabbie’s, we do things by the book – no shortcuts for us old chap! The ginger in Crabbie’s Original Alcoholic Ginger Beer is steeped for up to 8 weeks to produce its deep, deliciously spicy flavour. Top marks!With centuries of experience behind us and using only the finest products, all we can say is that the uniquely refreshing sparkle of Crabbie’s Original Alcoholic Ginger Beer speaks for itself.
name: Crabbie's

description:
In 1990 Larry came up with the idea to sell produce from the corner of Rt. 463 and Lower State Road. He took Dani and the three kids to meet the owner of the property, Al Walters. Mr. Walters took an immediate liking to the Jones family and allowed Dani and Larry to sell produce from his corner. Being a farmer, he even started growing corn and other vegetables for them. One day, Larry's father showed up with a bushel of live crabs and left them with Dani to sell. The crabs sold so fast that they picked up more crabs, shrimp, and other types of seafood too. In 1994, Mr. Walters passed away and Dani and Larry had to move on to bigger and better things. They rented a space in the Chalfont Village Shopping Center and opened a restaurant and fresh fish market. Dani and Larry did all the cooking. Larry would go to the fish market daily to ensure the freshest seafood. And with the help of loyal family and friends, Jones Family Seafood became a popular seafood restaurant in the area.
    Early in 2001, Larry received a mailing, the kind we all ignore, advertising "Brew your own beer". He was immediately hooked. After convincing Dani that this was a good idea, they met up with a "brew master", ordered the equipment, and they were on their way.
name: Crabby Larry's Brewpub Steak & Crab House

description:
The Crabtree Brewing Company is dedicated to serving the environment, the community, our customers, and our valued employees.  Requiring the best ingredients to support unique premium beers.  Keeping a dynamic business mind while remaining modestly profitable.   Employing technology, embracing ethics, growing to meet the needs of our customers and employees, and having fun doing what we love - Making Great Beer.

The Crabtree Brewing Company, ltd. is a Colorado based company providing premium ale, wheat, stout, and lager style beers. Established in 2006, this is the first micro-brewery located within Greeley, Colorado.
name: Crabtree Brewing Company

description:
Craft Brew Alliance was formed with the merger of leading Pacific Northwest craft brewers – Widmer Brothers Brewing and Redhook Ale Brewery – in 2008. With an eye toward preserving and growing one-of-a-kind craft beers and brands, CBA was joined by Kona Brewing Company in 2010.
When Kurt & Rob Widmer founded Widmer Brothers Brewing in 1984, they didn’t confine their brewing exploration to strict style guidelines. To this day, Widmer Brothers continues to create handcrafted beers with a unique and unconventional twist on traditional styles that are award winning and please a wide range of craft beer lovers.

Redhook began in a Seattle transmission shop in 1981, and those colorful roots are reflected in the brand’s personality to this day. As one of the country’s first craft breweries, Redhook continues to offer sessionable craft beers to consumers across the country.

Kona Brewing was founded in 1994 by the father and son team of Cameron Healy and Spoon Khalsa, who dreamed of crafting fresh, local island brews with spirit, passion and quality. As the largest craft brewery in Hawaii, Kona personifies the laid-back, passionate lifestyle and environmental respect of the people and culture of Hawaii.
name: Craft Brew Alliance, Inc.

description: The Craft Brewing Company is a partnership of four home brewers who wish to generate more interest in crafted beers. Come by to take a taste of our brew on tap and then grab a growler to take some home.
name: Craft Brewing Company

description: Located in rural Northeast Ohio Crafted Artisan Meadery specializes in award-winning handcrafted Mead.  Through the labors of the honeybees and flora around us we transform their work into one of the oldest fermented beverages in the world. We use the finest locally sourced ingredients and pride ourselves on providing the highest quality Mead to our customers.  Taste something Crafted!
name: Crafted Artisan Meadery

description: Our production brewery and taproom are located 12 minutes from the Las Vegas Strip. CraftHaus Brewery's foundation is built on quality beer and a commitment to community. Enjoy and share: it's time well spent.
name: CraftHaus Brewery

description: We interpret classic international beer types in new and modern ways according to the German Purity Laws.
name: Craftwerk Brewing

description: Nano-Brewery in the Finger Lakes
name: Crafty Ales and Lagers

description: Our craft beers are individually created by our brewers in Crafty Dan, our 20-barrel innovative micro-brewery and they are based on some of their favourite recipes, to bring you a repertoire of ales that suits every season and occasion. We love experimenting and creating in Crafty Dan and we’d love to hear what you think.
name: Crafty Dan

description: Our passion is to locally produce quality craft beers and to foster community involvement with commitment and integrity.
name: Craggie Brewing Company

description:
Welcome to the Craig Street Brew Pub!

We are a locally owned and operated business and we offer fresh hand-crafted brews, local house-made food and top-notch customer service.

We love the environment!
We recycle all paper, tin, glass and plastics.
We use biodegradable garbage bags.
We compost daily.
We have reduced our waste by 75,000 kg so far.
Our fryer oil is recycled into Biodiesel.
We offer a complimentary shuttle on weekends.
We offer a variety of celiac-friendly food!
Our mash from each brew feeds the local pigs!
We sponsor tons of community organizations.
We use energy efficient products.
We use biodegradable cleaners.
We buy from local businesses.
We buy with environmental consciousness.
name: Craig Street Brewing Co.

description: We are brewers & beer loving professionals brought together by our passions and expertise to provide authentically inspired Belgian farmhouse ales.
name: Crane Brewing

description: Crane’s Pie Pantry Restaurant & Winery is dedicated to providing you with exceptional food and drink in a unique atmosphere that is unlike any other. Crane’s handmade fruit pies are still made the old fashioned way from family recipes passed down through the generations. Using fresh fruit straight off of the farm, only the highest quality ingredients, and the bounty of local food sources in our beautiful township, we are continuing the tradition of high standards that was first set on the Crane family farm in 1916.
name: Cranes Pie Pantry Restaurant & Winery

description: Welcome to Crank Arm Brewing! We are a craft brewery with tasting room located in the heart of the warehouse district in downtown Raleigh, North Carolina. Our mission is to provide fresh artisan beer while utilizing green transportation methods.
name: Crank Arm Brewing Company

description:
We make carefully crafted, fully flavoured, massively drinkable beers. We do it because we love it, and we never cut corners. The taste of the beer is the only thing that matters to us. Well, not the ONLY thing – breakfast is fairly important, as is coffee…

In 2013 we expanded our little brewery by taking over an industrial warehouse in Queens Yard, just a stone’s throw away from our original bar and brewery. With this newer ten-barrel kit we’ve been able to increase the number of people we supply to, and have dedicated our smaller kit for our own experimentation and innovation, pushing the boundaries of our beer.
Being a small brewery we’re able to work very closely with our customers, and are more than happy to give advice or a helping hand if we can.
name: Crate Brewery

description: Crazy Mountain Brewing Company was founded in January 2010 by Kevin and Marisa Selvy in the heart of the Rocky Mountains.  After a chance meeting in the Anchor Brewing Tasting Room, Kevin and Marisa decided to follow their crazy dreams and move to Colorado, Kevin's home state, and brew.  With a combined passion for craft beer, Kevin and Marisa founded the Vail Valley’s first production brewery.  Crazy Mountain was built with love from the ground up in a gutted warehouse, shipping in tanks and equipment from around the globe. Their first beer was poured at a beer festival in Vail in January 2010.  Using the highest quality ingredients, Crazy Mountain handcrafts each brew for beer enthusiasts across the United States, Japan, Hong Kong, and Sweden.  We say crazy is as crazy does, so drink up and live the life you want!
name: Crazy Mountain Brewing

description: Brewery, Brew pub and Tap Room.
name: Creede Brewing Company

description: Creek Bottom Brewing was started by a group of folks with a passion for good beer. We thought the Southwest Virginia area needed a good brew, so here we go!
name: Creek Bottom Brewing

description: Hand-crafted ales, pub-style comfort food, scenic patio dining, local wines, full bar, banquet room and catering available
name: Creekside Brewing Co

description:
At Creemore Springs, we’re renowned for being different – in part because we remain 100 years behind the times, in deed and in thought. We make our beer in small batches, in an open flame copper kettle, using the same painstaking methods as the European brew masters of the 1800’s. We take no shortcuts; we make no compromises. Our unofficial motto is: if something is worth doing – it’s worth doing well. Some might question such old-fashioned thinking but it results in consistently superb beer, and that has won us the loyalty of a legion of fans.
Will we ever do things the same as everyone else? Ask us again in another 100 years.
name: Creemore Spring Brewery

description: CREW Republic stands for honest, craft-brewed beers of extraordinary flavor. We are constantly on the lookout for the best hop varieties in the world and creating new recipes. A refuge for all those who aren't satisfied with the "standardized beers".
name: CREW Republic

description: We believe that New Jersey is starting to learn what the rest of the country already knows; that local microbrews are some of the best beers in the world! Finally, curious beer drinkers are stepping out from under the mind-numbing barrage of large brewery advertising and deciding for themselves what they like. Our beers are designed for those curious drinkers. The large breweries use fillers in their beer; Corn or Rice are the most frequently used. Most good beer should be all Barley, in the same way that good hamburgers are all beef. Barley is expensive and the more fillers that are used, the better the profits! Cricket Hill Beers are 100% Barley as are most great beers. Please take the time to taste different local beers. I am certain that those who decide not to let television dictate what they drink are ready for a wonderful adventure into the world of Beer!
name: Cricket Hill Brewing Company

description: Crime + Punishment Brewing Company is located in the Brewerytown neighborhood of Philadelphia. Our beer and comfort food unite our local history and community with the themes and characters of Russian literature. The result is a warm and friendly brewpub experience that invites people to mingle in the name of good beer and great stories.
name: Crime and Punishment Brewing Company

description:
Classically refined, but not styled as a traditional "sweet beer" beer alternative, Crispin ciders are crisp and clean, not sweet and sticky and never sacrifice superior quality refreshment satisfaction for overbearing complexity.

Always true to the apple, Crispin Hard Ciders naturally fermented in the USA use fresh pressed apple-juice, not from apple juice concentrate, from a premium blend of US West Coast apples, with no added malt, grape wine or spirit alcohol. Crispin’s unique USA produced ciders are smoothed with pure apple juice or from natural sugar sources like organic honey or organic maple syrup, and contain no added colorants, sorbate or benzoate preservatives.

Crispin ciders have 7 different varietals - Original, Light and Brut; classic European styled crisp clean ciders, Browns Lane; an imported classic English dry cider, and our line of Artisanal Reserves; Honey Crisp, The Saint and Lansdowne - unfiltered "cloudy" ciders, ground-breaking "craft beer" uniquely American ciders.

Crispin ciders are all Gluten Free for the wheat-intolerant person.
name: Crispin Cider

description:
The Cromarty Brewing Co is a family run business consisting of Craig, Chap and Jenni Middleton. Craig, our fanatical brewer studied the science of brewing at Heriot Watt University and the art of beer making in the student accommodation and flat basements. After finishing the course with a 1st class degree he went on to do some work in breweries such as Odell's in Colorado and Cairngorm in Aviemore. It was during this time that he decided he wanted to get his own beers to market. He applied for grants, got some scary bank loans and managed to get his folks Chap and Jenni in on the deal.

In the spring of 2011 construction started on the shed works and some awesome stainless steel was ordered from Bavarian Brewery Technologies. Hectic times and long hours later led to the first of the casks rolling out on the 19th December 2011 – just in time for the festivities.
Chap is the brewery engineer with a passion for making anything and everything and proves very handy in the day to day running of the brewery. Jenni is on accounts and keeps us in check with the paperwork to our delight.
name: Cromarty Brewing Co.

description:
The name Croocked Moon is inspired by a graffiti drawing, I once saw a grinning moon. Its expression captured in many ways the philosophy I want to resist. This is also underlined by the name of the election. I want to create a brand with an attitude that is not afraid to push the limits and the current perception of what the actual individual beers represent. English ologists will notice the spelling error in the word "Croocked". This misspelling is because originally, that I was given webdomænet and because of a typo there had sneaked an extra "c" in. I wondered whether I should buy another domain name, but then decided that it actually fell very much in line with my philosophy about challenging the conventional way of perceiving the beers on: I want to signal a more aggressive and provocative attitude towards the conventional way put together on the beer.

The slogan "Ergo Bibendum", which loosely translated means "why we drink" is the old character and is used increasingly often by medical students when they are toast. The idea behind this slogan is simple. As a philosophy describes, I want to create beers that challenge and provoke, but simultaneously has a flavor that gives people reason to choose just one Croocked Moon when they want a beer, there is something beyond the usual. 
Croocked Moon must in itself be an excellent reason to drink a beer (or two).
name: Croocked Moon

description: Built upon the founders’ passion for craft beer, Crooked Can Brewing Company is an upstart craft brewery built inside the Plant St. Market located in Historical Downtown Winter Garden, Florida.  The brewery represents a unique image and creates a cultural following for a way of life.  The brand represents a free spirit, laid-back approach, but with a purpose!  We produce quality craft beer consistently, with excellent taste and unique quality.  The brewing process is monitored under the close personal attention of an award winning experienced brewmaster to ensure the vision is reached batch after batch using traditional brewing methods.  The Brewery has an onsite tap and tasting room featuring 4 flagship brands in addition to many other limited edition, seasonal, and specialty batches.
name: Crooked Can Brewing

description: We are passionate about brewing great local craft beer.  Philadelphia, Bucks, and Montgomery counties in particular are becoming well known for producing unique local beers and we are excited to be part of that tradition.  Our beers aren't intended to slap you in the face with outlandish concoctions.  You will find yourself coming back to them time and time again.  We are family owned and operated and extremely proud of that.
name: Crooked Eye Brewery

description: Craft brewery located in Garden City, Idaho (Boise). 15 BBL brewhouse with a tasting room and gift shop. Makers of Rusty Nail Pale, 3 Picket Porter, Derby Oatmeal IPA, Hole Wheat American Wheat, Sins of Our Fathers Imperial Stout and the Grim Reaper Black IPA.
name: Crooked Fence Brewing

description: Crooked Hammock Brewery - Restaurant - Backyard Beer Garden delivers the Beach Life- Easy Going – Flavorful - Lively – backyard cookout craft brews
name: Crooked Hammock Brewery

description: Crooked Run is a nano-brewery brewery located in historic Market Station in Leesburg.  Crooked Run offers unique and well-crafted American and Belgian style ales, many made with locally-grown ingredients.  Beers can be purchased by the glass at the brewery bar or growler fills to go with bottles coming soon.
name: Crooked Run Brewing

description: Crooked Stave is a progressive, artisan brewery that strives to blend brewing science and art, through creativity and following our passion. We are based in Denver, Colorado while the unique beers we produce draw inspiration from worldly adventures. All our beers are produced from the highest quality ingredients, using contemporary and historic brewing techniques aimed at evolving ones perception of what beer is and focused on delivering the best possible drinking experience.
name: Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project

description: Crooked Tongue Brewing was started in 2008 as a father/son project. We focus on high quality custom Ales!
name: Crooked Tongue Brewing

description:
Crop believes in simplicity…..

We believe food is at its most flavorful, its most creative, its most passionate, when it’s at its freshest.

We believe food is at its best when it highlights the care and craftsmanship of those who bring it from the field to your plate.

We believe food is community, a series of connections between farmers and chefs and guests.

Seasonal, local flavors, hand-crafted ales and inventive libations, lovingly prepared and cheerfully served…Come and share the bounty of Crop.
name: Crop Bistro & Brewery

description: Perched on the edge of the North Yorkshire Moors National Park, Cropton Brewery has been producing award-winning real ales since 1984.
name: Cropton Brewery

description:
If you could be doing whatever you want right now, what would you be doing? For Ken Landin and Janine Bennett the answer to that question would always be "listening to live music and drinking craft beer." Fueled by their outrage over the political and corporate disaster that unfolded on the nightly news, and frustrated by the thought that their lifestyle may contribute to the problem, they were at a crossroads. And so began the plan for Crossroads Brewing Company.
 
There was many years of discussion, research, paperwork, rejection, and searching for the perfect property.  After having deals fall through and the economy taking a turn for the worse, their hopes were fading. Then, in December of 2008, the Brooks Opera House in Historic Athens was discovered by accident. After leaving a restaurant just 2 miles from home they noticed a for sale sign on the deteriorating building and it's just like the old saying goes............when you know, you know.
 
It was quickly realized that when a community believes in what you are doing and puts it's support behind you, great things can happen. So they were off and running from the first turn of the key. Restoring a Historic Opera House from 1893 was not part of the original plan but with hard work and their secret weapon, Janine's brother Jimmy, things are coming together. Ken, Janine, Jimmy and Janine's Dad, Jim, have had their hands on just about every square inch of this 15,000 square foot building. Little by little, this grand and unique property will be restored to it's former glory.
  
Everyday seems to bring a new challenge but the ultimate goal remains clear. This building was once the hub of this sleepy riverside village and Ken and Janine intend to return it to the community. The second floor, where the Opera House once was, will get a new stage for plays and musical performances of all kinds. Athens is surrounded by hard working farmers so looking any further for meats and produce just doesn't make sense.  From organic menu items to earth friendly building materials the environment is a factor in every decision that is made along the way. They hope to eventually have the brewery running "off the grid" as well.
 
Ken, Janine, Brewer Hutch Kugeman and Chef Paul Parillo invite you to come visit the pub in Athens, NY.  There's 10 craft beers on tap and a menu that showcases the small farms of the Hudson Valley.   Cheers!
name: Crossroads Brewing Company

description:
Crow Brewing is a Southern California based brewing company pioneering locally produced 100% organic high quality craft beer. We focus on West Coast style ales and lagers using the highest quality organic malts and hops. We are headquartered in San Diego County and our beer is currently being produced in Orange County. We are back to looking for a brewery site.

CROW BREWING~ Great beer that happens to be organic.
name: Crow Brewing Company

description: The main brewing philosophy of Crow Hop is to create well-balanced recipes that highlight each of beer's classic ingredients. Our seven core beers represent this philosophy, whereas our rotating selections give our brewers' creativity a chance to shine, in particular our Monthly Micro-fest. Each month, we release three to six pilot batches brewed around a common theme, from fruit beers to IPAs to a high gravity series - nothing is off limits. We strive to have products on hand that will excite and satisfy all kinds of beer lovers because for us at Crow Hop Brewing, it's about the beer.
name: Crow Hop Brewing Co

description:
Crow Peak Brewing Company began on March 9, 2007. The brewery is located in Spearfish, South Dakota at the foot of the beautiful Black Hills.

We began in a small tap room with a 5 barrel system. Word got out about Crow Peaks great beers starting a dedicated fan base. With the popularity of the beer growing, so did the brewery.

In December of 2009 we opened the doors to our new building and 30 barrel brewhouse.

Crow Peak beers can be found on tap and in cans throughout South Dakota, North Dakota, Omaha, NE, and Eastern Wyoming. We are proud to distribute  11th Hour IPA,  Pile of Dirt Porter and Canyon Cream Ale, as well as a number of seasonal offerings.
name: Crow Peak Brewing Company

description:
When the Crown Brewing Company opened its doors in 2008 we had one goal in mind, "Craft the Best Beer Period!" In 2010 our Industrial Porter won a Bronze Medal in the World Beer Cup, Brown Porter category.

We offer a selection of six to eight of our hand-crafted beers, fresh and on tap year round. In addition to our foundation beers, we brew special seasonal beers throughout the year. So, stop on in and see what's new!
name: Crown Brewing

description: Crown Valley Brewing & Distilling features handcrafted brews made exclusively at the Coffman location by Brewmaster, Jeremy Gilbert. All beers are produced in the state-of-the-art 15-barrel microbrewery.  We strive to produce small batches of great beer.
name: Crown Valley Brewing & Distilling Company

description:
Crux brewmaster Larry Sidor is always in pursuit of the next great beer—beer that defies taste profiles with its complexity and creativity. We’ve designed our brewery to allow for non-traditional brewing methods like decoction mashing, open fermentation, oak barrel aging, wild yeast strains and experimental hops.

Initially, we’ll only have a few thousand hectoliters of capacity. With added fermenters and bright beer tanks, we could push that to 11,000 hectoliters (or around 9,000 barrels). But we kinda like being small. It makes us nimble and free to experiment in ways that just aren’t possible with larger batch sizes.

Housed in a former transmission shop and mill supply store, Crux Fermentation Project was built by a community of beer lovers. To everyone who contributed ideas, materials, sweat and support, thank you. And cheers.
name: Crux Fermentation Project

description:
Crystal Ball Brewing Company is a microbrewery located at 1612 West King Street in West York, Pennsylvania. After years of planning and months of construction, this production facility is now open. 

Using the finest and freshest ingredients possible, combined with traditional brewing techniques and the latest technology, our intent will be to produce world-class beer. Our brewers love good beer and know its social potential for creating and sustaining a tasteful social experience. Every batch will be carefully crafted with passion, vision, and fun. Our brews range from traditional offerings to the more experimental, for adventurous drinkers. With a great product, and community engagement, we see in our future the potential to become the largest production brewer of hand-crafted beer in the region. And while we cannot predict everything, we can make one guarantee. CBBC will make the best possible beer, with offerings that will appeal to all who Seek the Finest.
name: Crystal Ball Brewing Company

description:
We love craft beer, and Crystal Lake Brewing is all about the beer. We love drinking great beers, we love making them, and we can't wait to share them with you. Our goal is simple, to produce world-­class beers right here in Crystal Lake.

Starting this summer, you'll be able to enjoy Crystal Lake Brewing Co. beer at restaurants and bars throughout Illinois, but we'd also like you to come visit us in person in our on-­premises tap room. Here, you can sample our beers in an open, relaxed space, then sit back and enjoy a pint or two of your favorite, all while admiring the brewhouse.

The Crystal Lake Brewing Co. is a production brewery, and we're totally focused on producing top-­notch beers. We won’t be serving any food in the tap room, but you'll be welcome to bring it in with you or order delivery from one of the nearby eateries. From time to time, expect to see a food truck parked just outside the front door, where you can grab a casual bite.

The tap room will always be pouring our best known beers, but you'll always find "pilot" brews, too. These unique beers will be brewed in smaller quantities and will be available only here at the brewery. Something new will always be on tap.

Of course, brewery tours will be offered, too.

Look for "CLB" beer at your favorite tavern or restaurant this summer, or at a local summertime festival. Don’t forget to come on in and visit us in the tap room. We’ll have a pint waiting for you. Cheers!
name: Crystal Lake Brewing

description: We make good beer, plain and simple. If you are looking for unique, small batch beers painstakingly created under the watchful eyes and hands of our brew master, look no further. You have found something unique to pour into your favorite glass. Our brewery is named after the original Crystal Springs Brewing and Ice Company, founded in 1875 in Boulder, Colorado. We brew craft beer you must try. Each of our beers begin with a simple theme: to create memorable beers - ones that our customers will savor and want to share with close friends. Drinking great beer is our aspiration, making great beer is our passion.
name: Crystal Springs Brewing Co

description: Craft beer, just across the border.
name: Cucapa Brewing Company

description: Cugino Brewing Company closed operations in 2004
name: Cugino Brewing Company

description:
We can all agree, it’s a great time to be a beer lover. There are more quality beers to enjoy than ever. More new flavors and interpretations of styles. And more people dedicating their lives to the craft of brewing. Culture Brewing Co began with their own long-time passion for beer. Culture’s three owners, John Niedernhofer (Owner), Steve Ragan (Owner/Brew Master) and Dennis Williams (Owner) began brewing together long ago. From their earliest brainstorms about taking things to the next level, the goal was always to create more than just great beer. Bringing their approachable style to the already rich community of the craft beer industry, they opened their brewery in February 2013.

Our modern and rustic microbrewery is the ideal showcase for our beer. The brewery is our tasting room, with everything you need and nothing you don’t. The tasting room features an inviting beer service counter, ample indoor and outdoor space for visitors with an ocean breeze. The tasting room’s 12-tap serving system (including Nitro) allows us to deliver a large variety of our crafted beers. The on-site Brewhouse is equipped with a 10 barrel Premier Stainless System including a boil kettle, mash tun, 5 fermenters and 3 brite/serving tanks. With our beers gaining fans every day, we couldn’t be more excited about what we’ll brew next, and who we’ll get to share it with.
name: Culture Brewing Co.

description: Giving new meaning to the term microbrewery, Cumberland Brews may be one of the smallest eateries in town, with a half-dozen four-top tables and a short bar with nine stools making tight quarters of what used to be the White Mountain Creamery. (Techically, it's not a microbrewery but a brewpub - a restaurant that makes its own beer on the premises - but I'm not one to quibble in the face of a good pun.) It's usually packed, too, earning its crowds the old-fashioned way by providing very good food, friendly service, and the sine qua non for a brewpub: extremely high-quality hand-crafted artisan beers. Hand-crafted offerings are produced by Head Brewer Cameron Finnis.
name: Cumberland Brewery

description:
For millennia brewers have taken hops, grain, yeast and water and turned them into flavours unique to their own place in time. Each beer – some rough and some refined – captured the essence of a moment. And right now is a special moment for Cumberland.

Cumberland has always been a community on the fringes, a place where independent thinkers could come for a fresh start and to build something of their own. Today it's tree planters and oil patch workers, activists, creatives, and tireless trail builders. At the end of the day these disparate folks eat, drink and come together. Building a life with bare hands is thirsty work.

Cumberland deserves good beer that’s a reward for the daily toil of building a community. 
Real beer. Brewed right here.
name: Cumberland Brewing Company

description:
Old Hall Brewery lies on the shores of Esthwaite Water at the southern edge of Hawkshead village in the English Lake District.

Our beers are all produced with care and pride using the wonderful Lake District Fell water and the best of English malts, together with quality hops from around the world.

In 2011 the stunning Loweswater Gold was judged Champion Golden Ale of Britain but our range also includes the famous Croglin Vampire. Click on our beers to find out more.
name: Cumbrian Legendary Ales

description:
Custom BrewCrafters introduced to the market in 1997 an innovative micro-brewing concept in which they have partnered with dozens of local restaurant and tavern owners in offering unique signature craft-brews custom designed for each establishment.

In addition to adding this new dimension to the Western New York beer market, Custom BrewCrafters opened a tasting room and gift shop at the brewery in Honeoye Falls, where we introduce the public to the many unique custom brews as well as educate them on craft beer and microbrewing.
name: Custom Brewcrafters, Inc.

description: Cutters Brewing Company is a start-up, small scale nanobrewery operated by Emma Inman, Chris Inman, Monte Speicher, & Amanda Speicher.
name: Cutters Brewing Company

description: The beer-making innovations of Doug Dozark at Peg's Cantina have inspired a new venture - Cycle Brewing. Doug, with the assistance of brew team Eric Trinosky and Kristina Kirk, have plans to take the brews he made famous at Peg's to St Pete and beyond.
name: Cycle Brewing
Cypress Street Station / Abilene Brewing Co

description: Czann’s Brewing Company has a catalog of several ale recipes that will be available year round and seasonally. The Brew Masters overall approach to designing each beer is to strike a balance between solid malt flavor and hop bitterness. Base and most of the specialty malts are supplied by Franco-Belges, one of the largest malteries in Europe. Rather than just adding bitterness, German and American hop varieties are selected to add to the overall flavor of each beer. And finally a clean yeast strain allows the flavor contribution from each ingredient to stand out in every glass.
name: Czann's Brewing

description: The D.L. Geary Brewing Company was incorporated in October, 1983 by David and Karen Geary who shared the vision of producing world class products on a small scale for local and regional consumption. At that time, there were only 13 so-called microbreweries in the United States, almost all of them in California and the Pacific Northwest. In the winter of 1984, David Geary began a period of training and research in Scotland and England. With the help of Peter Maxwell Stuart, a Scottish nobleman and brewer who arranged introductions and itineraries, he worked in a half-dozen small commercial breweries from the highlands of Scotland to the south coast of England.
name: D.L. Geary Brewing Company

description: A craft microbrewery with the purpose of brewing and sharing outstanding beer that unites people. First envisioned in July 2009 over a pot of boiling wort, our founders believed every person – and beer – has a story and decided to start a brewery where both could be shared. At the D9 Brewing Company, we seek to inspire the community and promote the art of Craft Beer.
name: D9 Brewing Company

description: Daas beers are organically brewed Belgium beer produced in Hainaut the famous Belgian province known for its fine hand crafted beers.
name: Daas

description: We are a small pizzaria/brewpub making fresh batches fresh food and ales each and every day
name: Dad & Dude's Breweria
Dahlonega Brewing Co. / Carusos Italian Restaurant

description: Dale Bros is a craft brewery and tap room in Upland, CA. We brew the kind of beer we like to drink. Beer that’s smooth, balanced and that pairs up well with food. Turns out other people like to drink it, too. Sometimes, they even like it enough to give it a gold medal (or two.) We’re not brewing beer to put trophies on our mantels, but it’s nice to be appreciated.
name: Dale Bros. Brewery

description: The Damascus Brewery is focused on providing high-quality beer and customer satisfaction - we will do everything we can to meet and exceed your expectations. With a variety of beer to choose from, we're sure you'll find a style and flavor that compliments your meal or activity.
name: Damascus Brewery

description: Dangerous Man Brewing Company’s mission is to be a destination tap house brewery in Minneapolis, focusing on high-quality small-batch production beers. With ever-changing taps, we will be the hub for lovers of beer and those seeking everything from the traditional to the extreme in their glass.
name: Dangerous Man Brewing Company

description: Danny Boy Beer Works is a family friendly brewery and pub located in the heart of the Village of West Clay, located just 15 miles from Indianapolis’ Circle Center. We are proud to feature 10 taps dedicated to Danny Boy Beers and 30 guest taps.
name: Danny Boy Beer Works

description: Danish mead A / S is a mead brewery with a focus on craft traditions. The products currently includes many variants within mead, additionally we also manufacture a range of delicious senneper.
name: Dansk Mjød

description:
Daredevil Brewing Co. is an independent, Indianapolis based craft brewery that was founded by two award winning craft brewers, Bill Ballinger and Michael Pearson, and a talented craft beer enthusiast, Shane Pearson. We know from experience that brewing eclectic, aggressively fun beers is not for the timid. Fortunately, the only thing we like better than a challenge is drinking the end result.

Daredevil Brewing Co operates a state of the art production craft brewery built in the heart of the Indianapolis metro area. The brewery is located on a 2.0-acre site at 1151 Main Street in Speedway just five blocks from the Indianapolis Motor Speedway while also being just minutes from downtown and easily accessible from anywhere in the metro area by car, public transit and bicycles. The taproom at Daredevil Brewing Co provides a welcoming atmosphere for guests to visit, take a brewery tour, enjoy a pint or pick up Daredevil beers to go.
name: Daredevil Brewing Co.

description:
Humble beginnings gave way to lessons learned of brewing in the shadows of the residence hall; steering clear of the landlord and having your ass handed to you by the almighty dollar are now consumed by the glory bells of success and the daily grind - a dichotomy of sorts… Should a young madman have to bend and be Ned Beatty’d to sell and serve to please the public eye’s nerve endings from the very beginning? Not this time around.
 
A brewer slowly climbed from the lowest points of business life with a sore ass, as he ascended to a new level. Hark! The horse of the dark nature holds the scales where the wheat and barley feedeth, not taketh from the mouths of man. A non-filtered view of hard work, careful perseverance of expansion, sticking to what is believed to be the right way and the only way to stay true to high quality, and also, the vague understandings of possible humor; blurring his family’s, employees’ and customers’ drinking experience and vision between a no-bullshit approach to brewing big, outstanding beers and selling nonsensical imagery and haberdashery…Proven to the masses as a Darkhorse trademark for the man behind the reigns.
 
Can true patrons of quality, time and devotion deal with the inner workings of a mad-man’s psyche as he speaks of visions of smacking Umpa Lumpas with snow shovels, or allows the obscure drawings of lawn jarts and tinker toys to be hung on the walls of his establishment? They seem to…A madman’s passion for brewing comes out in strange ways indeed; where his employees and fellow brew house boys may know not how to deal with his tongue twisted ramblings and contortions of the face at first; where the same can definitely scare away newcomers.
 
True patrons know how to accept the obscure humor. Some have lent a hand in some way or another. They know what “pour to the line” means; they have been to every annual crawfish boil and some find the passion within themselves to put the Darkhorse name to skin…still they barely understand the immature drawings created in the brewery… True patrons know the hard work the brewers put in to create and keep the Darkhorse name in the lead.
 
Some things in life are easily read and some things keep you guessing. Should we take turns consuming garage sale items and vomiting them on the walls or should we follow the square, straight and narrow? Slip into the pub and look around. Go out and buy a six-pack, and read the holder the beer comes in. Read the back of your growler. When you’re done, you’ll either get it or you won’t. No matter, as you’re drinking some of the best fuckin’ beer made in the great state of Michigan. Period!
name: Dark Horse Brewing Company

description:
The Dark Star Brewing Company was born in 1994 in the cellar of The Evening Star Pub, in Brighton.   With a brew plant only marginally bigger than an enthusiastic home-brew kit the characteristic style of hoppy beers was developed and tried out on the willing guinea pigs at the bar.

Within a few hard working years it was obvious that the brewery could not keep up with the growing thirst of the Evening Star’s drinkers, yet alone the demand for its beers from other local pubs and beer festivals.

In 2001, the team emptied their piggy banks, cashed in any ISA’s, sold TV’s and dug around behind the sofa for loose change, to relocate the brewery to a new purpose-built, 15 brewers barrel brewery in Ansty, near Haywards Heath – some would argue this was the point the hobby started to become a proper business…some would anyway. A few years on, and once again the brewery was on the move, this time to a bigger site in Partridge Green, just south west of Horsham, West Sussex.

No one really wanted to leave the cellar of the pub, but apparently more and more people liked drinking the same beers as us, so we needed to brew more…
name: Dark Star Brewing Company

description: Come in and try some our great beer brewed in-house. A instant hit, we have many seasonal flavors to choose from.
name: Darkside Fermentation

description:
During a 9 month road trip through Africa, owners Kevin and Philippa stumbled across the idea of micro breweries and instantly knew that Darling would be the perfect home for one.

'Slow Quarter' is the Darling Brew taproom located in Darling. Here we aim to marry our beers with a selection of light tapas styled meals.
name: Darling Brew

description:
Darwin Brewing Co. is a production brewery with a beer tasting room.
Co-owner and Brewmaster Jorge Rosabal is in charge of the brewing operation.
name: Darwin Brewing Co.

description: Das Bierhaus tap beer is brewed on premise in strict accordance with the Bavarian Reinheitsgebot of 1516 by our award winning Bavarian Braumeister.
name: Das Bierhaus

description:
Located in Downtown Norman, Das Boot Camp is a place where people sit together and engage in conversation, meet friends and family, enjoy traditional German food and of course, some great German beer. We invite you to join us for true German hospitality as well as our great selection of German specialties created by proprietor and Certified Master Chef Andy Gmeiner. We are pleased to offer a selection of Handcrafted beers brewed by Royal Bavaria, as well as a full bar. All of our beers are brewed to German Purity Laws dating back to 1516 and are offered in mugs as well as das boot. We hope you will join us for some true German tradition and great German hospitality!

Das Boot Camp is a product of
Royal Bavaria
name: Das Boot Camp

description: JP DasBrew is a small, commercial brewery owned and operated by Jan Schutze and his wife Priscilla, and is located in Fremont, California
name: DasBrew, Inc.

description:
"We’re not real fancy, we believe in great food, exceptional beer and having a good time. Honestly, it’s why we went into business. We’d never owned a restaurant and had no idea how to brew beer, but we were experienced beer tasters and knew plenty about going out to eat.
Granted, this isn’t the salesiest pitch, but we let the food, beer and atmosphere speak for themselves. We stick to the beer guarantee and greeting our guests."
name: Davidson Brothers Restaurant & Brewery

description: Small brewery near Bath with five pubs in Bristol, producing innovative beers.
name: Dawkins Ales

description: Day Block Brewing is a brewery-restaurant located in Downtown Minneapolis, Minnesota.  Their local beers are brewed in house using 100 percent locally sourced hops.  From IPAs to lagers and more, Day Block has a variety of unique brews to satisfy many tastes.
name: Day Block Brewing

description: For 3000 Years the Aztecs honored the unique character of the deceased individuals in annual celebration.  Now Day of the Dead Craft beer is produced to celebrate those traditions with extreme care given to its individual flavors and packaging.  Day of the Dead artwork has gained a large following so artists well known in this arena hand painted the original works of art  used for the labels and packaging of the brand.  The liquid was developed by the brewery management team and fine-tuned by the head brewmaster at Cerveceria Mexicana, the brewery that owns and produces this quality beer.
name: Day of the Dead

description: Brewing Craft Beer at the World's Most Famous Beach.
name: Daytona Beach Brewing Company

description: The fact that D.C. has become a world-class beer town is undeniable. The choices available to the local beer nerdery are staggering and ever expanding. The neighborhood corner stores continue to add microbrews to their stock and it seems that a dynamite draft selection is essential to any new bar that opens. Restaurants regularly hold beer dinners featuring multi-course food and beer pairings and for seven days in the spring, during DC Beer Week, the number of beer-themed events can make the head spin. At a handful of downtown brewpubs the beer enthusiast can sample a variety of house made brews. What D.C. has not had in over 60 years, however, is a brewery whose product is available in local stores and on tap outside of its site of production.
name: DC Brau Brewing Company

description: We are a small rural brewery specializing in many diverse styles of ales, but with a focus on spontaneous fermentations inspired by the European farmhouse traditions.
name: De Garde Brewing

description: De Garve Brewery is the first micro-brewery established in Vanderbijlpark in the Vaal Triangle. This brewery is a family owned business where Patrick does the brewing and sales and his wife Goedele does the bottling and packaging, purchases and finances. The brew house has been built on the property behind the residence, creating a perfect situation for continuous attention. The love for beer started long ago with Patrick making his home brews and culminated in the establishment of a micro-brewery during 2007 and the realization of his life-long dream. In this brewery all beers are handcrafted according to traditional brewing methods and are "brewed with passion"
name: De Garve Brewery
De La Vega's Pecan Grill and Brewery

description: Owned by Heineken
name: De Ridder Brewery

description: De Steeg Brewing - A micro brewery in the Highlands providing quality craft beers to the Metro Denver beer enthusiasts.
name: De Steeg Brewing

description:
De Struise Brouwers (DSB) is a small beer company currently located in Oostvleteren, Belgium. In its brief commercial life to date, it has garnered respect and admiration from the beer enthusiast community and won several awards.

Owners of a nearby ostrich-raising farm in Lo-Reninge with accommodations for vacationers, Urbain Coutteau and Philippe Driessens developed an interest in making distinctive regional beers to serve to their guests. In 2001 they began doing so with help from local wine maker Carlo Grootaert, and this project eventually developed into its own independent commercial concern.

Upon its inception in 2003, Struise produced beers at the Caulier brewery in northern Hainaut. Since 2006, they have been made at the Deca brewing facility in Woesten-Vleteren in West Flanders. The firm has reported that their own microbrewery and tasting room in a renovated school building in Oostvleteren, is currently open & operational.

The company takes its name from the historic Flemish word for ostrich, which also is a contemporary slang term meaning "tough". They render the name into English as "The Sturdy Brewers", and many of their labels feature ostriches, a trait they share with Dutch microbrewery Brouwerij 't IJ.

Following current industry trends made popular by American craft brewers, DSB has recently ventured into stronger, more flavorful beers and also barrel-aging. While often drawing upon various traditional styles, they have won acclaim by creating unique products which reflect their own personal vision.

They have also collaborated with other recent arrivals on the European artisan beer scene such as Denmark's Mikkeller, fellow Belgians Picobrouwerij Alvinne and Brouwerij De Molen of the Netherlands, as well as American brewers.
name: De Struise

description: Artisanaal bier van hoge goesting met smaakevolutie, ambachtelijk gebrouwen.
name: De Vrolijke Brassers

description: At Dead Armadillo Craft Brewing we are committed to crafting fine beers that meet the highest standards of the industry. Our three flagship beers are an India Pale Ale (IPA), an Amber Ale, and a Wheat Beer. Our brewery was established in the Spring of 2012, the culmination of years of dreaming, drinking, hoping and planning. After all, what could be better than brewing beer for a living? It is an opportunity to spread the good cheer that comes with quality ales.
name: Dead Armadillo Brewery

description:
Feeling thirsty? Dead Bear Brewing Co. has a full bar with 21 beers on tap!!!

Formerly Mainstream Steak & Ribs: 
Same great people & food!
name: Dead Bear Brewing

description: A Canadian Craft Brewery located in Aldergrove BC and home of the finest beer in the universe! Do It Froggy Style!!!
name: Dead Frog Brewery

description: Dearborn Brewing is a small micro-brewery located in downtown west Dearborn, Michigan. We’re going to be brewing hand crafted beers with an on-site taproom and growler sales
name: Dearborn Brewing

description: Deciduous is a constantly striving, boutique brewery in Newmarket, NH. Employee and Brewer owned. Owners are Frank and MaryAnn Zagami and David Sakolsky.
name: Deciduous Brewing Company

description: Dedicated to constantly challenging what is possible in craft beer, Declaration Brewing Company will strive to write its own chapter in the celebrated history that humanity and beer share.  Through continual evolution of the status quo, Declaration Brewing Company aims to expand upon established craft beer culture, practices, and expectations.
name: Declaration Brewing Company

description: Explorer, risk-taker, brewer and purveyor of fine ales! Join the adventure as we build the first great craft brewery in Tallahassee since the last one!
name: Deep Brewing Company

description: A business is brewing in Deep Ellum, Texas... Dedicated to making extraordinary beers and supporting all things local. Drink the Deep!
name: Deep Ellum Brewing Company

description: Deep River Brewing Co. is committed to using local Grains and Hops, and ingredients in our beers whenever possible. "beer geeks making beer for fellow beer geeks" is our mantra.
name: Deep River Brewing Company

description:
Deep Water Brewing Co. is our very own three barrel microbrewery.  While the actual brewery is currently off site in Brooklin, it will soon be located behind the Arborvine.

At Deep Water we personally handcraft each and every beer from the best ingredients available. Right now, we serve our beers exclusively at the Arborvine and the Vinery.

Being small allows us to experiment. We brew a number of styles and try to keep them rotating throughout the summer.

Primarily, we brew ales, namely: Pale Ale, Double IPA, Amber Ale, Porter, Oatmeal Stout (coming soon), and British mild.

For special occasions, though, we have been known to break out a keg of lager or two.  In the past we've served: Bohemian Pilsner and Octoberfest (Marzen).  Sometime this summer we will debut our Vienna Lager.
name: Deepwater Brewing Company

description: Craft production brewery called Deer Creek Brewery with a tap room. Industrial space connected to retail at Cumberland & Cherry Street.
name: Deer Creek Brewery

description: Defiance Brewing Company is a soon to be up and running production craft brewery (not a restaurant/brewpub) located in Hays, KS. The brewery will offer a wide variety of new and fresh beer that we have all been craving.
name: Defiance Brewing Company

description: Features a good range of beers, from the hoppy Muddy Creek to the malty Chocolate Porter.  Defiant also offers delicious bbq wings made on-site.
name: Defiant Brewing Company

description:
Deja Brew is a Brew-on-Premise (BOP) that offers you the opportunity to brew your own beer or wine in a retail environment. We provide the recipes, ingredients, brewing kettles, and knowledge you’ll need for a rewarding brewing experience.
Best of all….. We clean up the mess!!
No matter if you have a beginners interest or are an experienced home brewer, Deja Brew has something for you. We offer over 65 beer and 12 wine recipes. If you already have a favorite recipe, we may be able to duplicate it. We use the finest ingredients so you’ll craft a high quality, chemical free beer or wine.
Read about our brewing process, look at our beer and wine offerings, then grab the directions, and we’ll see you soon!
name: Deja Brew
Del Mar Stuft Pizza and Brewing

description: Del Norte is the only U.S. brewer specializing in authentic Mexican-style beers. Brewed locally in small batches with traditional ingredients, our beers capture the styles and flavor of the oldest brewing heritage in the Western Hemisphere.
name: Del Norte Brewing Company

description: The Delafield Brewhaus features in-house brewed craft beers and original menu selections. We can accommodate up to 200 guests in our Banquet Facility. We are conveniently located between Milwaukee and Madison.
name: Delafield Brewhaus

description:
Deluxe Brewing Company is a production brewery located along the Willamette River in Albany, Ore. Deluxe Brewing produces fine German-style lagers. Its lineup includes a Pre-Prohibition pilsner, Amber Lager and Schwarzbier and seasonals. 
Come in and sample! Deluxe Brewing’s Tasting Room hours are Fridays 4 to 8 p.m. and Saturdays 12 to 6 p.m.
Deluxe Brewing is located in the Borden Building, 635 NE Water Ave. For more information on Deluxe Brewing visit www.deluxebrewing.com.
name: Deluxe Brewing Company

description:
In celebration of the ballpark’s 20th Anniversary season, Delaware North Companies Sportservice, the food, beverage and retail partner of the Baltimore Orioles, has partnered with beloved former Oriole Rick Dempsey to create Dempsey's Brew Pub & Restaurant. 
The longtime catcher, a member of the Orioles Hall of Fame and 1983 World Series MVP, is also a member of the Orioles broadcast team and will make frequent appearances at Dempsey’s. 
The full-service brew pub, with a décor featuring plenty of Rick Dempsey and Orioles memorabilia, accommodates 150 in the dining area, 100 at the bar, 
and another 80 in outdoor seating on its Eutaw Street patio. We serve lunch and dinner seven days a week, year-round, featuring broad menus that are sure to hit every taste. 
And then there’s the beer! Dempsey’s features more than 20 bottled beers, including 10 local and regional craft brews, as well as four distinct draft beers brewed onsite, all featuring baseball-themed names.
Please stop in and see us for lunch, dinner or to host a special celebration.
name: Dempsey's Brew Pub and Restaurant

description:
Cead Mile Failte! Dempseys Brewery Restaurant & Pub

 We are a local family owned restaurant, with an on-site micro-brewery (2nd oldest in the state!) and we have been in business for over 15 years! 

We specialize in european/american style food, with about 85% of all of our items made from scratch. Executive Chef Se'an Dempsey is also the only Certified Pizzioloia in South Dakota, as a recent graduate of the Scullo Italiana Pizzaioli in San Francisco.

We also feature the ONLY Brick Oven in Watertown!
name: Dempsey's Brewpub

description:
Denali Brewing Company is Talkeetna, Alaska's local craft brewery. In addition to serving the community of Talkeetna through our tasting room and sister establishment, Twister Creek Restaurant, our beers are on tap at an increasing number of killer bars and restaurants in and around the Mat-Su Valley and Anchorage, Alaska.

At Denali Brewing Company we use only the finest ingredients to handcraft the kinds of honest beers you like to drink.
name: Denali Brewing Company

description: Denison's is now a part of Side Launch Brewing Company. The Denison’s beers, Weissbier and Dunkel will remain exactly the same in terms of ingredients.  The water is coming from another lake, Huron that is, but the same “Great” family.
name: Denison’s Brewing Company

description: Denizens Brewing Co. is a craft brewery serving European-style lagers, American-style ales, Belgian-inspired beers, sour beers, and barrel-aged beers to both the craft beer aficionado and those new to high quality brews. The brewery, along with our 200-seat beer garden and 2-level taproom, are located steps from the Metro in downtown Silver Spring.
name: Denizens Brewing Co

description: Dennis Beer Co. is the beery brainchild of three mates who've long shared a passion for craft beer and big flavours. We've loved watching the local craft beer scene explode in recent times and wanted in! In mid '12, our little (...well nano to be precise) craft beer company was born. Since then we've been rolling out our 'curiously quaffable' hand crafted brews to a growing band of merry drinkers, and loved every second of the ride. Welcome to our website and hope to see you getting your science on sometime soon. Cheers!
name: Dennis Beer Co

description:
Denver Beer Co. was born in our garages with a few batches of homebrew and a love for the craft of brewing. Serving only premium artisan ales and lagers, we utilize fresh ingredients and embrace both innovative and old world styles of beer. Similar to a farmer’s table, our beer selections change with the seasons. By brewing in small batches, we can ensure that a few old favorites are always on tap, but new goodies greet visitors each month.

Our brewery is founded on passion for high quality, flavorfully crafted beer and the belief that the best pints are those shared with good company. Drawing inspiration from beer gardens of Bavaria, we designed Denver Beer Co. to be a place where new and old friends can share a table and pint out of doors.
name: Denver Beer Company

description: Based in Jersey City, New Jersey, Departed Soles Brewing Company is a brewery and tasting room opened in 2015.  The brewery has 8 rotating draft lines in its tasting room and distributes out a variety of beers, both in kegs and cans, including regaled Gluten Free options.
name: Departed Soles Brewing Company

description: Inspired by the everyday family cooking that we grew up with, you’ll feel at home while savoring a great meal in our casual and relaxed dining room in a restored Railroad Depot.  Experience our attentive service, Micro Brewed Beer, and friendly unique atmosphere; come see what makes us one of the most popular restaurants not only in Shenandoah, Iowa but also regionally.  Your headquarters for The Wabash Trace Nature Trail, Everly Brothers Memorabilia, local history and great food.  Established in 1983.
name: Depot Deli and Lounge

description: Woman Owned. Woman Run. Woman Brewed.
name: Der Blokken Brewery

description: Founded in 1988, Deschutes Brewery began as a brew pub in downtown Bend, Oregon and is known for such brands as Black Butte Porter, the nation’s number one selling craft porter, and the popular Mirror Pond Pale Ale. In addition to its original Bend pub, this family and employee-owned brewery opened a second pub in Portland’s Pearl District in 2008. The company’s main brewing facility is located on the banks of the Deschutes River and is the nation's 7th largest craft brewery, distributing in 28 states, Washington D.C., and two Canadian provinces. Deschutes Brewery was named one of America’s Best Places to Work in 2013 & 2014 by Outside Magazine.
name: Deschutes Brewery

description:
Desert Eagle Brewing Company, the brainchild of brewmaster and co-owner Joe Campbell, was founded not only upon his passion for home brewing while in college, but also upon his German heritage and inherent knowledge of quality beer.
 
After perfecting the process of creating a great craft brew, this dream finally became a reality in 2011. Partnering with co-owner Jeff Bryant, the team became committed to creating great Craft Beers. Vowing to maintain the integrity of their product by using the best ingredients possible, they include whole cone hops in every step of the brewing process. Seizing the opportunity to participate in the downtown revival, which is slotted for light-rail expansion, Desert Eagle Brewing Company saw the opening of its taproom in October 2012 in Downtown Mesa – an important location of focus for the two Mesa residents.
 
Desert Eagle’s commitment to both quality, and its patrons, is a true testament of the team’s mission and dedication to serving great beer in an even greater community.
name: Desert Eagle Brewing Company

description: The Scene – Whether you call it Desert Edge or the Pub, you only have to visit once to call it home away from home. In the last few years, it's become more family-friendly--kids are welcome--but college students and professionals are the main patrons. – – The Food – Known for its daily pasta salads and lunch menu that gets better after 2pm, the kitchen serves the usual pub sandwiches with fruit, pasta and salad sides as well as other traditional pub dishes. Customer favorites include the Szechwan chicken pasta salad (served on Tuesdays), nachos and the French onion…
name: Desert Edge Pub and Brewery

description: Desert Mountain Brewing Company is a small-batch craft brewery in Columbia Falls, Montana. It is the closest brewery to Glacier National Park.
name: Desert Mountain Brewing & Draughthaus

description:
Founded by Greg and Kristie Camp, Deslogetown Brewery started in 2009 as a simple homebrewing hobby in a basement on the west side of Desloge, Missouri.  Back in the area's formative years as a lead mining boomtown, Deslogetown referred to the company town that formed around the Desloge Consolidated Lead Mining Company.  While the lead mines are just a part of our area's history, the spirit of creating something with your own hands and hard work lives on.

So what happens when a couple of homebrewers get together with an accomplished vineyard and winery? The Ale House at St. Francois Winery! Thanks to Edward "Skip" Daugherty, owner/operator of St. Francois Winery, the dream of not just bringing local, handcrafted wines to the public, but local, handcrafted beer as well is a reality.

Today, the Deslogetown Brewery seeks to provide approachable craft brews without all the fuss - instead we hope to expand your beer palate with a beer that you will find delicious and refreshing.

​Open FRIDAY 4pm-7pm
SATURDAY 1pm-7pm
SUNDAY 1pm-5pm
1669 Pine Ridge Trail, off Highway 32, between Park Hills and Bismarck
name: Deslogetown Brewery

description: DESTIHL opened its first gastrobrewpub (DESTIHL Restaurant & Brew Works) in Normal, IL in November 2007 and added its second gastrobrewpub in downtown Champaign in April 2011, where the company focuses on both artisan food and beers.  DESTIHL’s 20,000sf production brewery project in Bloomington, IL commenced in September 2012 with brewing starting in May 2013 and includes a 25-barrel brewhouse, several large fermenters and 100,000 cubic feet of barrel-aging space. It has taken countless hours to develop the unique concept that is now DESTIHL, where the brewery team utilizes both global brewing traditions and new American craft brewing ingenuity and artisanship to make uncommon beers uncommonly well.
name: DESTIHL Brewery

description:
Opened in September 2003, the Detroit Beer Co. occupies the first two floors of the recently restored Hartz Building on Broadway in Downtown Detroit just steps from Comerica Park and Ford field making it the best spot for pre & post event. The historic setting, combined with state-of-the-art brewing technology and 21st century finishes provides a unique dining experience. Seating is available on both floors and can be reserved for special events.



The menu features a broad selection of eclectic American cuisine, all prepared with the freshest ingredients. From delectable appetizers, fresh salads, pizzas and pastas to delicious entrees and unique sandwiches, the menu has something for everyone and a kids menu is available
name: Detroit Beer Company

description: We (Mike and Greg) worked for the same company and were relocated from the Cincinnati area to Indy in 1995.  Soon after, we were introduced to our first Belgian style beers (Chimay, LaChouffe) and have been hooked on good beer ever since.  It progressed to the inevitable challenge of making our own home brew versions of the shared beers we loved and with the donation of our first brewing equipment from a friend, we started our beer making journey about 18 years ago.  From the beginning, we both found common ground having similar tastes in beer styles which progressed to a shared obsession of trying to figure out how our favorites were made.  We both shared in the fun of sharing our results with friends and watching their reactions, which kept us motivated to make more.  Now, I think we play to each others strengths.  Mike is excited about the technical part of brewing and Greg enjoys determining flavor combinations and fun new things to try.  Our joint passion to make fun, creative craft beer coupled with our individual strengths makes a good brewing team that works well together.
name: Deviate Brewing

description: Device Brewing Company is a small microbrewery in Sacramento, California specializing in premium ales, stouts, lagers and barleywines.
name: Device Brewing Company

description:
Devil’s Canyon Brewing Company, located in the heart of the San Francisco bay area peninsula, produces award-winning, sustainably handcrafted beer and root beer centered on the most premium ingredients.

Prior to the 1780’s the canyon portion of Belmont and San Carlos was known as “la Canada del Diablo” or Devil’s Canyon.

Since opening our doors in 2001, Devil’s Canyon Brewing Co. has won over 35 awards for our craft beers. San Francisco Bay Area A-List readers voted Devil’s Canyon “Favorite Bay Area Brewery” in 2013 and “Best Bay Area Beer Bar” in 2014. San Francisco Business Journal readers voted Devil’s Canyon “Best Beer” in 2014. Also in 2014, the brewery was awarded “Business of the Year” by the City of San Carlos and the San Carlos Chamber of Commerce.
name: Devil's Canyon Brewing Company

description: Brewed at the Devil's Peak Brewing Company's full production facility at the foot of Devil’s Peak in Cape Town, this South African craft brewery produces world class examples of American, Belgian and English  style ales. From bold, American IPAs to light and easy drinking session ales, they have something for everyone. Their motto is 'Truth to Material', which reflects in each of their top quality beers.
name: Devil's Peak Brewing Company

description:
Devil's Purse Brewing Co. is a small craft brewery located on Cape Cod in South Dennis dedicated to the pursuit of making exceptional handcrafted beers.
Many of our beers are American styles heavily influenced by their older European cousins. While our beers reflect the elegance of simplicity we enjoy the creativity and experimentation that can occur in the brewhouse. 
Above all is our commitment to using only the highest quality ingredients and great care in making our beer.
name: Devil's Purse Brewing Company

description: 2012 GREAT AMERICAN BEER FESTIVAL SMALL BREWPUB and SMALL BREWPUB BREWER OF THE YEAR & 2010 WORLD BEER CUP CHAMPION BREWERY & SMALL BREWPUB, the award winning Basecamp Brewpub is situated in the majestic valley of the Blue Ridge Mountains with a lodge style atmosphere. We brew authentic craft beer in our brewhouse with a traditional German style brewing system and pour fresh brews daily from 16 taps in the pub area. Our menu specializes in oak wood -fired smoked dishes and local fare. We offer children their own special menu too!  Basecamp is open daily: 11:30pm serving lunch & dinner.
name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company

description: Christopher DeWalt started DeWalt Brewing Company as a way to share his passion and create a business that could provide opportunities for his family and community.  After working many years in the construction and Telecommunication industries, he decided to create a business to achieve these goals. The DeWalt Brewing Company is built on the foundation of faith, and Christopher's chief belief is that all things can be achieved through faith.
name: Dewalt Brewing

description:
Diamond Bear Brewing Company is Little Rock's first production brewery in over 15 years. Diamond Bear started brewing on September 21, 2000, and started distribution on October 17, 2000 with the Flying Saucer (Downtown River Market District) being the first establishment to carry our product. We currently distribute our beer throughout Arkansas and Mississippi. Our styles of beer are produced in the old time honored traditional methods of European brewers, using only two-row malted barley, hops, yeast and great Arkansas water. Being brewed locally gives the beer a great advantage in "freshness" while still capturing some of the worlds most famous styles of beer without the use of adjuncts or preservatives!

You may be wondering where our name came from. Diamond Bear is brewed in Arkansas which is the only state to have a diamond mine. This is where the first part of our name came from. As for the bear portion of Diamond Bear, Arkansas was once home to a large population of bears. In fact, during the pioneer days Arkansas was known as the "Bear State." Therefore, we combined the two to create a name that is distinctly Arkansan, Diamond Bear!
name: Diamond Bear Brewing Company

description:
Diamond Knot Brewing has been handcrafting great NW ales since 1994! 
 
With four convenient locations in Mukilteo, WA & Camano, WA we offer a unique dining experience along with our handcrafted beers.  Our original brewery & alehouse is located on the beautiful Puget Sound, and if you are looking to relax with the family, check out Diamond Knot Lincoln Ave for our family friendly calzone & pizza house.  At Lincoln Ave, you can enjoy a craft beer as your children can construct their own pizza right at the table.  If you are out exploring the islands, check out Diamond Knot Camano Lodge.  Or if you want to experience all the magic of craft beer, check out our Production Facility & Taproom. 

Explore the Diamond Knot and experience all we have to offer.
name: Diamond Knot Brewery & Alehouse

description: Diamondback Brewing Co. is a craft beer company based out of Baltimore, Maryland.  Diamondback was founded in Fall of 2014 by Maryland natives Tom Foster, Colin Marshall and Francis Smith. Keep an eye out for the Diamondback Golden Ale, 3:30 Amber Ale and the new Oktoberfest in local bars and retail locations.  These sessionable beers are sure to delight with smooth finishes and bold flavors. Check out our Facebook, Instagram or Twitter for locations!
name: Diamondback Beer

description:
Dick Young started brewing as a home brewer in 1984 and sold homebrew supplies at his business, Northwest Sausage & Deli.  When he wasn’t busy handcrafting smoked summer sausage and pepperoni at the deli he was handcrafting small batches of beer.  Dick built from scratch a three barrel brew house (which we still use today as our pilot system) to start designing and creating recipes in the back of the deli. The beer was so popular among Dick’s friends that he soon found himself exceeding the annual production limit for homebrewers.  In 1992 Dick decided to make his hobby a business and started the application and permit process to create Dick’s Brewing Company.  After two years and many batches brewed, and many beers drank, Dick’s Brewing Company became a reality.

Dick quickly realized he would need more space for his growing passion and built a 2,100 square foot building adjacent to the deli.  He started with the three barrel system and would brew once a week yielding 6 kegs.  Initially he focused solely on three beers: Pale, Porter and Dick Danger.  Dick Danger Ale, is still our best selling beer to date.  When asked why he started the brewery Dick always answered, and I quote, “I started brewing beer for one reason, I was thirsty”.   And we are all so grateful he was.

The brewery was located behind the Deli on Prather Road from 1995 to 2008.  Over those 13 years the brewery grew from 200 bbls in sales in one state to over 3000 bbls in 6 states.   New uni tanks and bright tanks were added along with a brand new bottling line to keep up with demand, and Dicks creative passion for brewing also grew, starting with three recipes in 1994 to over twenty different styles in 2009.  Life was good and  Dick’s Beers were flying out the door.
In 2006 Dick set his sights even higher, and he started construction on a new brewing facility. After two long years of work  we moved into the brand new 18000 square foot brewing facility on Galvin Road in Centralia.

Dick wore many hats and he was so many things to so many people.  In 2009 we lost a brewmaster, a friend, a dad, a partner, a son, a teacher, a rebel, an electrician, a plumber, a carpenter, a craftsman, a joker, a complete and unique leader.  He will always be remembered and by doing so his vision and his dream will forever live on in every bottle or keg that gets shipped from the warehouse to someone that is thirsty.

Today, the Dick’s Brew Crew is led by Dick’s daughter, Julie Young.  With the new brewing facility producing 23 different styles and with plenty of room for growth, we feel that the sky is the limit when it comes to Dick’s legacy.  All of us here at Dick’s are proud to continue the dream that our founder started, and we are proud to have you all along for the ride.
name: Dick's Brewing Company

description: Once, ours was a dark metropolis rife with corruption and urban decay; our soot-covered city needed to be restored. Fueled with inspiration, we look to what the future holds in our new city — our vision inevitably tainted by a layer of grime. Fuel your vision with Dieselpunk Engineered Ales.
name: Diesel Punk

description:
The Dillon Dam Brewery is the Largest Brewpub in the Colorado Rockies and one of the largest Brew-Pubs in the nation as well as one of the best family restaurants in Summit County, Colorado.

We serve signature, seasonal, session and big beers -- primarily ales and lagers -- and we brew over 1,700 barrels per year. WE have a 13-tap system. This makes us the 37th largest Brew-Pub in the nation (out of nearly 1,000). That's a lot of Dam Beer™.

We are an American-style restaurant serving lunch, dinner, and a kids menu. Our extensive menu has over 70 items to choose from. We serve the families of and visitors to Dillon, Silverthorne, Frisco, Keystone, Breckenridge and Copper Mountain.

We are also an easy stop-off for those traveling west to Vail, Steamboat Springs and Aspen or east to Denver. In fact we are a great stop for anyone traveling I-70.
name: Dillon Dam Brewery

description:
Awesome lager, naturally brewed! That’s what is in store for you when you sample Tom Crean’s lager at the Dingle Brewing Company. Take a tour of our brewery, which began operating as a creamery in1888. Learn the fascinating story of how we created this premium lager and how it’s brewed using only the finest ingredients.

At the end of your tour, enjoy a pint of Crean’s at the bar in a warm, relaxed atmosphere. Discover amazing stories about the legendary Antarctic explorer, Tom Crean, after whom our lager is named. Our friendly staff are available at all time to answer questions to ensure you get fantastic value for money and a treasure-trove of intriguing information.

Nestled at the base of the majestic Conor Pass, the Dingle Brewing Company is on Spa Road on the outskirts of Dingle, Co Kerry, on the Wild Atlantic Way. Start your Crean’s lager experience here, enjoy it in pubs throughout your visit to Ireland
name: Dingle Brewing Company

description: We are looking to open up a small, craft brewery in the Carrboro-Chapel Hill area. Our mission is simple - save the lives of companion animals, one beer at a time. We will be using our sales to fund grants to local animal rescue groups, and 'no-kill' shelters. Check back periodically for an update on our progress, and to see what we are brewing!
name: Dingo Dog Brewing Company

description: Dirtbag Ales was originally conceived amongst friends who had a love of great beer and a quest for fun.  We were brought together through our love of country, stayed together for the love of beer. Dirtbag Ales has tapped their curious imagination, combined blood oranges with a traditional kolsch recipe, and brought this crisp ale to new heights. For the refined tastes of the modern man.
name: Dirtbag Ales LLC

description:
Dirty Bucket Brewing Co. started over exactly that...a dirty bucket. Brewing in the garage and pondering the idea of creating a place where we can share our beers and passion for creating them. After we took that leap of faith towards brewing as a profession we needed a name. Holding true to our "Home Brewing" roots the name Dirty Bucket Brewing Co. was tossed up and the more we thought about it the more we realized there truly was no other name that better describes our passion.

By creating smaller batches we are able to maintain an intimate level of craftsmanship and rotate different styles of beers more frequently giving our customers a wider range of beers to choose from
name: Dirty Bucket Brewing Company

description: The road to the creation of Dirty Hands Brewing began during those halcyon days of college where Grant (UCLA) and Phil (University of Utah/University of Wyoming) started developing an appreciation for great beer. They first met during graduate school at the University of Minnesota where the fates would have it, they joined the same chemistry research group.
