The guys spent many a night proving the adage of their PhD (piled higher & deeper) advisor, “The true test of running a scientific instrument is being able to operate it after a few beers.”  After graduation, Grant and Phil pursued different career paths, Grant went the academic route, while Phil initially started out in the chemical industry, but then wised up and conned people into hiring him as a beer then wine chemist.  After a few years of chasing the academic and corporate dollar, the boys wised up and decided to strike out on their own.  They landed in Vancouver, WA (which was the first Vancouver, by the way) and started up Dirty Hands Brewing Company.  From the start, their goal was to brew full flavored beers that were both balanced and highly drinkable.  So, they set to work, getting their hands dirty renovating the space that was the old Columbian Newspaper building to a working brewery and taproom.  Speaking of the newspaper, that’s how the name came about.  Think of reading a hard copy paper and how your hands would look from getting newsprint all over them!  The brewery also strives to honor the working past of Vancouver and Washington state by using locally sourced ingredients in the beer and food that we serve.
name: Dirty Hands Brewing Company

description:
Dirty Oar Beer Company will be opening during the summer of 2016 directly at the entrance to Cocoa Village, Florida. 

Initially they will be serving some of the finest craft beer that Florida has to offer while they await their brewing permit from the federal government. Once they are granted permission to produce their own beer on site, they will transition most of the taps to their own beer but plan on keeping a few special guest brews in the rotation.

Once they open, you will find an informed member of the ownership team behind the bar to guide you to your next great brew. Once you have a beer in hand you will be able to chat about beer at the bar, explore the lounge area or retreat outside to the beer garden where you will be able to enjoy the fantastic Florida weather.
name: Dirty Oar Beer Company

description:
Discretion Brewing is a family-owned brewery in Soquel, CA dedicated to producing handcrafted organic beer of consistent high quality. 

Choose Goodness. Have Discretion.
name: Discretion Brewing

description: The goal of the Distant Whistle Brewhouse is to draw in and connect with home brewers and craft beer enthusiasts. From our consistently delicious flagship beers to our constantly changing craft selections, the Brewhouse promises to be a unique experience every time. We pride ourselves on our home brewing past, and will offer easy access to all the recipes for beers brewed for our customers. We plan on offering brewing demonstrations, classes, and competitions, as well as offering a venue for different entertainers, and fostering an excellent community atmosphere.
name: Distant Whistle Brewhouse

description: District 14 serves as a small scale neighborhood brewery. With 10 tap lines, half of the taps are constantly rotating.
name: District 14 Brewery & Pub

description: (No longer brewing)
name: Dixon's Downtown Grill

description: The Do Can Brewery in Lowell, MA was founded to provide great beer and an even better beer drinking experience. With so many great beers being brewed throughout the country it wasn't enough to make another clone of this scripted style or that trendy brew.
name: Do Can

description: One of the best cider makers in America today. Absolutely fabulous. From Doc's Draft Hard Apple Cider (great, semi-dry and effervescent refreshment) to the incredibly dry, delicate, and fragrant Doc's Draft Hard Pear Cider, to the tremendous Doc's Framboise, which is a dessert beverage that is on par with any dessert wine out there. The raspberry can be sipped on a long hot day...what a delicious enjoyment. The pear and raspberry are to die for and are absolutely unique! These two ciders rate with the great Belgian ale house, Lindemann's, whose fruit ales are among the best in the world.
name: Doc's Draft Hard Ciders

description: Founded in 1985, Dock Street Brewing Co. was the first microbrewery in Philadelphia and one of the first in the country.  Today, Dock Street is a small artisanal brewery that finds its home in a magnificent historic firehouse on the corner of 50th and Baltimore Ave., in a progressive, eclectic and counter-culture neighborhood that reflects Dock Street's philosophy.  Dock Street has a rich brewing history, a reputation for exceptional quality, innovation and brewing distinctive beers.  Dock Street continues to experiment and push the boundaries of the movement it helped build.
name: Dock Street Brewery

description:
From humble beginnings producing niche full flavoured ales via commercial collaborations in New South Wales, Doctor’s Orders Brewing is now producing seasonal beers for wider distribution in Australia. 

Doctor’s Orders Brewing is all about special thought provoking and inspirational beers released seasonally, with availability across Australia currently on draft only (including growler fills at specialty liquor stores). The ethos is simple, produce beers that are intriguing based on emerging, historical and/or rare styles often with a twist but always with balance that enables you to have more than one.
name: Doctor's Orders Brewing

description: Dodgeton Creek Brewing Co. is a new independent traditional mircobrewery located in Trinidad, CO. Ten ales are typically available in the taproom. Dodgeton Creek's initial offerings are available to the public through direct retail sales at the brewery's taproom in Trinidad. Additionally, Dodgeton Creek Brewing Company's kegged, draft products will be available to bars, taverns and restaurants in Southern Colorado through wholesale sales.
name: Dodgeton Creek Brewing Company

description: The Dodging Duck Brewhaus is located in Boerne, Texas, in the Texas Hill Country. We have an eclectic menu of international and local favorites, from Thai Lettuce Wraps to Chimichurri Grilled Beef Tenderloin to Bratwurst & Sauerkraut. Best of all, we brew great beer! We've already won three gold and three silver medals at the World Beer Championships!
name: Dodging Duck Brewhaus

description:
Our mission is to provide the highest quality crafted beers that deliver a message of gratitude for the selfless sacrifice of our nation’s military. Our fallen warriors are not just nameless and faceless statistics, but great Americans with stories of courage and inspiration. 

Dog Tag Brewing works with Gold Star families and details the stories of their fallen loved ones on each can. Better yet, a portion of our proceeds are donated to select organizations to individually honor each fallen warrior featured on our IPA and Lager brews. We invite you to learn more about each hero on our website, dogtagbrewing.com.

Dog Tag Brewing is combat-veteran owned. We are profoundly grateful to our nation's military families and will ensure that their loved ones are not forgotten through our unique can design, community outreach and charitable giving. Please remember these great Americans, salute their sacrifice and enjoy our beer.
name: Dog Tag Brewing

description: Dogfish Head Craft Brewery makes off-centered ales for off-centered people.  Since 1995, Dogfish has brewed with nonstandard ingredients such as raisins, chicory, maple syrup, and grapes, changing the way people think about beer.  Dogfish believes beer can have as much flavor, complexity, diversity, food-compatibility and ageability as the world's finest wines.  To discover your favorite off-centered ale, visit www.dogfish.com
name: Dogfish Head Craft Brewery

description: American-style craft beer in Lisbon, Portugal.
name: Dois Corvos

description: Dolores River Brewery was founded under the premise that everybody needs somebody, and every community should have a comfortable place to hang out with that somebody!  We strive everyday to create that place.  A place where you can meet old friends and new ones over a beer, and some good food.  A place where you can kick your shoes off and let your hair down, a place where you can experience joy and laughter to occasional live music, and a place where no one is the fool, because everyone is!
name: Dolores River Brewery

description: Domaine de Kervéguen is a family owned business started by my paternal grandfather.  In addition to working on his farm, I delivered barrels of cider to cafes during the 2nd World War.
name: Domaine de Kervéguen

description:
The Doodle Brewing Company was started by Nick Vaughn in 2008. Nick graduated from the University of Missouri-Columbia with a degree in Chemical Engineering. After graduation, Nick got a call from the Harpoon Brewery in Boston and they were willing to give him a shot. While he was working out east, he enjoyed the superb beer culture and variety of beers available in New England. But he knew that he would one day return to Missouri. Finally, after three years, probably too many beers, and the addition of his son, Nick finally got his chance to come back to Missouri. He worked at a small brewpub in Kansas City called The 75th Street Brewery where he was able to experiment with many different beer styles and brewing techniques. Again after a few years, Nick grew restless. While working at a brewpub was fun and enjoyable, it just had too many other distractions from his true passions... Brewing beer, drinking beer and spreading the word about craft beer.
So he started the Doodle Brewing Company with every intention of brewing beers and beer styles that explore the boundries of flavor. He's probably sitting in front of his brewhouse right now with a beer enjoying what he's doing because he's making beer for you.
name: Doodle Brewing Company

description:
Doolally is arguably the best among the handfull of Micro-breweries in India. It is based in the city of Pune, in the western Indian state of Maharastra. It was founded on March 20, 2006 and has been growing steadly since then.

At any given point in time they have 4 brews on tap, one of which usually is a cider. Doolally experiments a lot, both with local ingridents (like a jaggery based Ale[2]) with flavours to complement Indian cusine or with traditonal brews like a German wheat or a good English stout.
name: Doolally

description: Doomsday Brewing Company is a premiere small batch craft brewery located in Vancouver, WA. We want to bring the beer we love to everyone. We make small batches of quality beer with an emphasis on local ingredients. Malt from the oldest malting company in the western United States, Great Western Malting Co, in Vancouver, WA. Hops locally grown in Yakima, WA from Hopunion and yeast from Wyeast Laboratories Inc in Odell, OR.
name: Doomsday Brewing Company

description:
Door County Brewing Company is inspired by our surrounding; our friends, our families, our landscape. Our mission is to create beers that lead to a gathering of community and friends where ever you are. We promise to create only the best tasting, thought provoking, carefully sourced, eco conscience beers that are constantly pushing the edge of imagination and senses.

What you will find in our beers is music, food, friends, family, travel, trees, soils and flowers—not just ingredients.
name: Door County Brewing Co.

description: Dos Desperados Viven: We Will Live, We Will Enjoy Life
name: Dos Desperados Brewery

description: Dostal Alley - A Brewpub and Casino, serving the best Pizza in the county for over 18 years. Now open 24/7 Never closing!! A family owned and operated business located in the heart of Central City's Historic Main Street.
name: Dostal Alley Brewpub & Casino

description: Big, bold, hand-crafted beers in a unique setting featuring a 70+ seat tap room beer garden and kitchen.
name: Double Barley Brewing

description:
We started with a man and his dream. Our founder, Leigh loved sampling beers but felt that something was missing. After some encouragement from his friends, and a loving and understanding wife, he decided to start making his own. As it turned out, he was a natural Brewmaster. That was 3 years ago. 

Today, the brewery has grown from a single pot on a stove, to a three vessel BCS system and continues to expand. 

﻿At Double Dizzy we’re passionate about making beer and drinking beer!
name: Double Dizzy Brewery

description: Double Horn Brewing is a family-friendly restaurant serving lunch, dinner and a kid's menu. Double Horn is also the only brewery in Burnet County.
name: Double Horn Brewing Company

description:
Matt Swihart and Charlie Devereux founded Double Mountain in 2007 with a clear mission: make great beer for craft beer fans. Ours is a "brewers' brewery", with an uncompromising focus on beer quality.

 From the beginning, our goal was to make beers that we liked to drink. All of our beers are served up unfiltered and long-aged, to deliver maximum flavor and character. The beers can be very complex and assertive, but with the ultimate goal of proper balance. We aim to satisfy both the hardcore aficionados and the more casual craft beer fan, all in the same glass.

 In June of 2013, Matt purchased Charlie's shares of Double Mountain, vowing to continue the good work the two partners created.
name: Double Mountain Brewery

description: Double Shift started as a future dream by our brewer and founder Aaron Ogilvie. After realizing the craft beer market in Kansas City was ready for another brewery, that future dream turned into a current reality.  The Double Shift family is just that, comprised of family and lifelong friends we're committed to a great product and a relaxed atmosphere.
name: Double Shift Brewing

description:
Take a sip and do a Double Take!  This premium craft beer is sure to grab your attention and leave you wanting more.  Crafted with finesse and brought to you in style, Double Take beer flirts with balanced hops and malts to keep your palate aroused.

With just one taste, you'll know it's a head snapper!
name: Double Take Brewing Company

description:
An independent company, run solely by two friends taking a chance on doing what they love.

Claude and Nathan met at Trent University, ended working for the same small craft brewery together almost 15 years ago. From there both
Nathan and Claude have worked in the craft brew industry. They’ve always joked and talked about having their own beer. Something that
they could believe in, a sessionable, flavour packed beer that would not only inspire, but also wake the senses of the beer drinker. A
complex but fun beer. No compromises, adhering to the purist quality in brewing. This idea has been discussed over and over, always in the
back of their minds. Sometimes the timing just wasn’t right, but in 2012 all their bottles have aligned.

From being in the beer industry so many years, we decided to plan, we wanted to bring a small batch brewed craft beer that we would love, and one the average Canadian beer consumer would too.

We contacted an old friend and craft brewer with our thoughts. We talked obsessivly about the beer we needed to create. From the passion came the experiments, the tastings and the refinements, until we had something that we knew was special.

No investors, just what we managed to scrape together and fueled by a passion for craft beer. Taking a chance to do what you love and believe in is what Double trouble Brewing Co. is all about. This is how everything good starts. The first step is the biggest. We are not out to make a fortune, but to have people enjoy a delicious beer that tastes like love when it flows down your gullet.
name: Double Trouble Brewing Co.

description: Doubleheart evokes the love of all things that come in pairs in our life, Tara and I, our two dogs Jake and Shay and our love of both Chicago and Harbor Springs. Doubleheart’s beers are a reflection of these dualities.
name: Doubleheart Brewing

description: Downeast Cider House was founded by Ross Brockman and Tyler Mosher during their senior year of college. After a considerable amount of time spent on the family orchard, an affinity for farm-fresh apple products was born. Meanwhile, at school, the guys could always be found studying. Whether it was deep into a weekend night, Wed/Thurs specials at the local library, or perhaps a casual “Sunday fun-day study-day,” the fellas were relentlessly toiling away, focused primarily on the classic works of Professor Busch and his famous theories on the smooth-cold continuum, copper-top revision.
name: Down East Cider

description: There are few enemies on a porch swing, and there are no strangers in a bar. Slide up with a few friends because good beer goes Down Easy!
name: Down Easy Brewing

description: An up-and-coming Metro Boston beer crafter. We are committed to making top-quality beer and getting it to you at the peak of freshness. Get Thirsty!
name: Down the Road Beer Co.

description:
At Downdraft Brewing, making great beer is more than just a passion, it's a lifestyle! Located in beautiful Post Falls, Idaho, we invite you to come taste our beers and hang with us in the taproom.
 
Cheers,
The Downdraft Team
name: Downdraft Brewing Company

description:
Doylestown Brewing Company at first wanted to brew a specialty beer for a event which is held every year by the Doylestown Porch Society called Rib Feast. But soon we realized that the Doylestown bars, pubs and restaurants needed a local flavor and style they could call their own.

DBC opened its corporate office on Union St right here in downtown Doylestown and it soon became clear and obvious choice for the name of our Flagship IPA, Union St IPA. 

DBC is making the finest craft beers, and we plan on putting a brand and style that is a bit different than most. With flavors like Fountain House Light, R5 Lager and Union St you are sure to find a style and flavor that you will think has been specially brewed for you
name: Doylestown Brewing Co

description:
Dr. Jekyll's Craft Beer Company produces unique and delicious craft beers made with organic hops and malt and brewed with various complimentary common and exotic super foods to create a "Truly Odd, Yet Oddly Delicious" beer. Dr. Jekyll's beer is Non GMO and vegan friendly.  Each beer has an associated charity that it donates 1% of proceeds to. The story of Dr. Jekyll’s is that it was conceived in the heart of an old constable station turned brewery in Brattleboro, Vermont by three longtime friends united by their love of great beer and active, healthy lifestyles. After one of the friends suffered a serious health setback, they were inspired to craft beers that not only tasted great, but had something special about them, something with a greater purpose, - to be shared with the
world - and so was born Dr. Jekyll’s.
name: Dr. Jekyll's Craft Beer Company

description:
Traditionally, all goods were made or sold locally.  Butchers, bakers, farmers and even brewers, made their products for local consumption.

Founded in 2009, Draai Laag began as a way to introduce beer with creative flavors into the market, offering a bit of variety in a world of Pilsners, Pales Ales and Porters.

Here at Draai Laag we use old world methods, such as bottle conditioning by aging our ales on lees.  We brew in small batches and use several strains of yeast to produce our beers.   The drinker may notice slight nuances from batch to batch.  But, you will find that all our ales are aged and, just like a fine wine, can be laid down for extended periods.   This results in a unique drinking experience each time a bottle is opened.

Here at Draai Laag we like to cater to those that want something respectful of tradition, but ultimately different.  Those who are not satisfied drinking the norm.  Most importantly, we get our biggest enjoyment and fulfillment not from profit, but from your smile after the first sip.

This company was built on the dream of doing what we love and following our passion.  For those who understand us, we thank you and hope you enjoy what we have to contribute.
name: Draai Laag Brewing Company

description:
Draft Line Brewing Co. was founded by Scott Palmieri and Scott Wood. 

Sharing a passion for great beer, we began like most home-brewers several years ago brewing five gallon increments in the Palmieri family kitchen. Soon enough we realized that we needed to make a lot more beer. The home-brew setup morphed into 40 gallon increments...
 
Once the operation began to resemble a nano-brewey we decided to forge ahead with creating a microbrewery in the heart of North Carolina.
 
We like getting friends together and having a great time. Let us share our vision for what a great beer can be -- stop by our taproom in historic Fuquay-Varina, NC, now open!
name: Draft Line Brewing

description: We strive to offer 35-45 different styles of beer on tap in our pub, including nitrogen-dispensed beers and two cask ales. We source all of our ingredients for each beer style from the country of origin. Our draft and bottle distribution market includes the entire state of Michigan. Final Absolution (Belgian Style Trippel) is our flagship and our most award winning beer. Our brew house is a three barrel system from Heavy Duty Products in Ontario, Canada. Last year we produced 2,400 barrels of beer. We also serve a small selection of meads and wines in our pub.  In November of 2013 we installed a brand new 20 barrel brew house fabricated by Craftwerk located in Michigan.  This new system will help us meet the growing demand in our state.
name: Dragonmead Microbrewery

description:
Dragoon Brewing Company was founded with a simple goal in mind: to increase the quantity and quality of local beer in the Arizona market. To that end, we’ll stay true to the spirit which spawned this goal — the idea that in sharing a creative endeavor with another person, you can’t help but share a bit of yourself. For DBC, that creative endeavor is craft beer, and we’re proud of the passion, integrity, and soul that we pour into every pint.

It almost goes without saying: we’re about good beer first and foremost. But there’s more to it than that. Our vision for this brewery includes the community. We aren’t setting out to compete head to head with the biggest breweries around, we’re here to produce beer that Tucson can be proud of.
name: Dragoon Brewing Company

description: Drake’s Brewing Company is an urban craft brewery operating in San Leandro, California since 1989. Drake’s brewers have set the standard for West Coast Style ales with their unflinching dedication to brewing clean, high-quality, innovative, and often unapologetically hoppy beers.
name: Drake's Brewing Company

description:
Welcome to Draper Brewing. Draper started  in 2010 located in Tenmile, Oregon nestled between the wineries of the beautiful Umpqua Valley.

The original Draper brews were done on a one barrel system which has since been replaced by a 5 bbl system. All current brews are fermented in an open primary fermentor in old world tradition. All bottled beers are naturally carbonated by means of a secondary fermentation in the bottle. Every bottle is  sanitized, filled, capped and  packaged by hand.
name: Draper Brewing

description: Draught Horse Brewery will brew beer for businesses so that those establishments can sell their own branded craft beer, a high-quality signature house brew. This unique concept will be marketed by Draught Horse Brewery as “Brew-4-U”, a program that allows bars and restaurants --- that do not have the manufacturing Facility or brewmaster knowledge --- to brew their own unique beers. These establishments can now offer their own personal house brand tap. DHB will focus on its Brew-4-U Program with both In House and Distributor Keg sales. In addition, the manufacturing location will have a Taproom featuring both DHB craft beers as well as select DHB-brewed restaurant brands. Not only will DHB brew for businesses, owners will actually have the chance to try our product in our taproom!
name: Draught Horse Brewery

description:
We are an onsite brewpub that brews great ales and lagers.  If your looking for a fun, friendly casino with great award winning craft beer Dostal Alley is your place.

Ask about special parties. We have become famous for our birthday parties. We host many special holiday events. Watch our face book page to get the latest news.
name: Draught House Pub & Brewery

description: Draught Works Brewery is committed to creating worldclass, hand-crafted beers for the good people of Missoula.
name: Draught Works Brewery

description: Drekker Brewing Company is a craft brewery and taproom in Downtown Fargo which offers pints and flights in the taproom and growlers to go.
name: Drekker Brewing Company

description: Your Community Brewery! Locally Handcrafted Fine Ales and Lagers. Located in Soldiers Grove, WI.
name: Driftless Brewing Company

description: We love great beer, in fact we live it! We are a crew of seven, working hard to brew the beers we love. At Driftwood we're doing our best to expand the landscape of quality beer in British Columbia.
name: Driftwood Brewery

description:
We'll be producing a flagship beer that a lot of people will love to drink. We'll also be producing a range of beers that a few people will enjoy sipping.

We operate a tasting room for beer samples and growler fills. You can stand in one place and see the whole brewery but if the brewer is there the door is always open
name: Drop In Brewing

description:
Our beers are European-inspired and uniquely sessionable – designed to showcase deep flavors in an approachable package. Using unfiltered Snoqualmie Pass mountain water, imported German malts and Yakima Valley hops we craft beers that are distinctly Dru Bru.

We offer a warm welcome, a wealth of beer knowledge and wide variety styles brewed in our adjoining 15 barrel brewhouse. Our taproom is open year round so park your skis, boards, bikes, packs or cars and gather around something great.

All ages welcome.
name: Dru Bru

description:
Drunk Monkey Brew Werks is dedicated to making hand crafted artisan beers for the central Pennsylvania area.

We are a 'nano' brewery that is founded on the idea of bringing beers of all styles to the market as dictated by our customers.  We brew what our followers want and what we like. There is no style of beer we won't attempt, but we will always have our standards on hand. We take pride in being a local business and being eco-responsible. This is all about enjoying life and having fun.
name: Drunk Monkey Brew Werks

description: Life’s all about choices.  Given our Druthers, we (Chris, a lawyer; George, a bio-chemist; and Brian, a financial analyst) are choosing to brew choice beer for good-humored, freethinkers that would rather do it their own way....Rewarding those that put their life, work, and convictions to the test. Given your Druthers, what will you choose?
name: Druthers Brewing Company

description:
Dry City Brew Works is a 5bbl craft brewery accessible from the parking lot between Main and Hale (next to the back entrance to Wise Penny) in historic downtown Wheaton. 

Our size allows us to consistantly experiment with new beers and keep things fresh. We're always open to new ideas and challenges.

Stop by, grab a flight, chat with your neighbors, and meet new friends. We'll be here!
name: Dry City Brew Works

description: Hand tossed pizza and hand crafted beer. What could be finer?
name: Dry County Brewing Company

description:
Dry Dock Brewing Co. is a speakeasy that hasn’t stopped growing. The brewery was Aurora, Colorado’s first when owners Kevin DeLange and Michelle Reding opened with a 7 BBL brewhouse in a 900-square-foot space next their original business The Brew Hut, a homebrew supply shop, in 2005. They named the brewery as a nod to Kevin’s love of nautical history.

Dry Dock expanded in 2009, and again in 2011. Now the brewery runs a 7 BBL brewhouse including a tasting room with 180 seats and 16 taps at its original location at 15120 E. Hampden Avenue which is called South Dock.

In 2013, Dry Dock nearly quadrupled its production numbers, jumping from 3,200 barrels in 2012 to 12,000 barrels in one year. This increase came with the purchase of a 30,000-square-foot production facility, North Dock, at 2801 Tower Road. At North Dock, Dry Dock has the capacity to expand to brew more than 30,000 barrels a year, and cans its flagship line of beers, including the Amber Ale, Hop Abomination, Hefeweizen, and Apricot Blonde.

In September of 2014, Dry Dock opened the Canoe Room, a four-tap tasting room inside of its North Dock facility. The tasting room, which in addition to draft beer, serves Dry Dock’s canned offerings. The room was once the storage area for The Boy Scouts of America Aurora chapter’s canoes and the area gained the nickname “Canoe Room,” which stuck.

Dry Dock established itself early on by word-of-mouth, and put itself on the map when it won a gold 2006 World Beer Cup (only 6 months after the tiny brewery opened) for its HMS Victory ESB (now Dry Dock’s Amber Ale). Dry Dock has since been the recipient of 20 GABF® medals, the prestigious Brewers Association’s Small Brewery of the Year award, and five World Beer Cup® awards.
name: Dry Dock Brewing Company

description: Dry Ground Brewing Company is Paducah's first craft brewery. Our microbrewery and tap room is now open in The Coke Plant, a Paducah, Kentucky landmark.
name: Dry Ground Brewing Co.

description: Making delicious, cutting-edge beers, while pioneering the green brewing movement. The preservation of our planet and her resources are at the core of our philosophy.
name: Dry River Brewing

description: Drydock Brewery is a small brewery creating hoppy beers straight from the heart of Southsea.
name: Drydock Brewing Company

description:
Wondering about us? That’s very flattering.

DryHop Brewers is a brewery and kitchen. The craft beer we brew is only available here in Lakeview, Chicago. Yes, we do tend to focus on hop-centric ales. Everything that comes out of our kitchen is prepared from scratch and, when the seasons allow, is locally sourced.

Hanging out at DryHop is all about being in a brewery; feeling connected to the craft brewing and culinary worlds; and most importantly, feeling a personal connection to a community of craftsman. You’ll soon discover the absolute perfection of drinking a craft beer at the source.
name: DryHop

description:
Dubh Linn in Old Irish means ” The Dark Pool”. In ancient times the river Dodder made a pool before flowing into the Liffey. Here the Vikings decided to settle. The Dodder today is a memory and has long been confined as a subterranean river. The dark waters from this pool were the inspiration for Arthur Guinness’ “Perfect Pint.”

“Dublin” is an Anglicism of “Dubh Linn”. In the old script, ‘bh’ was written with a dot placed over the ‘b’ – thus appearing to be Dub Linn or Dublinn. The Norman-speaking English who arrived in Old Irish-speaking Ireland in 1169 omitted the “dot” (or sÃ©imhiÃº in Irish), and spelled the town’s name as ‘Dublin.’

Some have suggested that “Dublin” is of Scandinavian origin: “djÃºp lind” (“deep pond”). However, the name “Dubh Linn” pre-dates the arrival of the Vikings in Ireland, and the Old Norse name is simply the words “Dubh Linn” re-spelled as if they were Old Norse: Dyflinn (correctly pronounced “DUEV-linn’ ).

Therefore, we selected “Dubh Linn” as a way of tying two cultures together – the Scandinavian heritage of Northern Minnesota and the Irish traditions of fine spirits, good company, and a comfortable atmosphere you only find in a pub.
name: Dubh Linn Irish Brew Pub

description:
Jared and Jim Dubina are a father and son team that had the dream to start their own brewery after a trip to Prague, Czech Republic. Their family heritage is from the Czech Republic and immigrated to the United States in the early 1900's. Jim's family settled in Chicago, IL but moved to Phoenix, AZ in the 60's. Jim's grandfather owned five taverns in Chicago and his father owned one in Phoenix off Indian School rd. You could say that beer runs in our family blood.

Tradition is important to the Dubina's. While Jared has a fun and creative side, the Dubina Brewing team feel that staying traditional and incorporating the worlds beer history in their beer is just as important as creating new brews. We plan on bringing a year round lager to our list of beers on tap while also enjoying may other great beer like IPA's, stouts, ales and porters.
name: Dubina Brewing Co.

description:
Duluth is an old industrial city and a thriving tourist destination. A city that used to boast 3 major production breweries among its ore docks, wheat granaries, and timber barons is now home to at least 5 microbreweries and brewpubs. Maybe it’s the water – fresh, cold, and right outside our door.  
 
Dubrue is building on this rich and local brewing history with a 15 bbl system located in the heart of downtown Duluth. And we’re brewing in the established tradition: start with great ingredients – fresh water, barley, and hops – and end with a satisfying brew. Our Duluth roots, combined with west-coast training and 10 years of brewing and building recipes, help us focus on consistency in our flagship beers: an irresistibly drinkable Pub Ale, and a hoppy and inspired India Black Ale.
name: Dubrue

description: A new approach to beer consumption: great tasting specialty beers that just happen to be accessible for the gluten­ intolerant. Now Open!
name: Duck Foot Brewing Company

description: At DuClaw Brewing Company, we are very proud of our beers. Our beers have received their fair share of recognition over the years, but even though we put quality first, fun is never far behind ... just look at the names of our beers. How do we come up with them? All we have to say is that there is a whole lot of creativity in those vats of beer just dying to come out, and we never stop till we get it right.
name: DuClaw Brewing Company

description: Due South is a distributing brewery with beer in bars & restaurants from Orlando to Key West FL. The brewery taproom is a great place to watch the latest batch getting brewed, order a pint, or pick up a growler to go. We cannot serve food, but we do encourage people to bring in take out or order delivery to the taproom. We also have food trucks onsite sometimes too. We're located in the warehouse between Boynton Marble and Sherwin Williams. Park and enter in the back.
name: Due South Brewing Company

description:
Dugges Ale- & Porterbryggeri (Dugge's Ale & Porter Brewery) is a microbrewery situated in Mölndal outside Gothenburg, Sweden. The brewery was started in 2005 by Mikael Dugge Engström and is focused on top-fermented beers, influenced by US micro breweries. The ales are brewed with lots of hops, such as Chinook, that gives them a strong and pleasant aroma. The brewery is very active in inventing new types of beer and usually has many test batches for sale.

The brewery has won several medals in competitions. For instance gold medal at the Stockholm Beer & Whiskey Festival.

In 2007 the brewery purchased a bottling machine in addition to previously sold barrels. The beer is sold at several bars and restaurants in Sweden as well as at Systembolaget.
name: Dugges Ale- & Porterbryggeri AB

description: Dukbone Brewing was founded with a love for craft beer and a whole lot of ambition to bring more quality brews and excitement to the Charlotte, NC beer scene. This brewery has an "everything is game" approach and will brew anything and everything at least once. We aim to be experimental and push the limits of brewing. The brewery will feature an onsite taproom, brewery tours, and special events. Our goal is to produce high quality hand crafted ales, while giving the community a brewery they can be proud of. Currently, we are looking for space in the Plaza Midwood community. We hope to be able to open our doors to the world in late 2013 and we can hardly wait until then!
name: Dukbone Brewing Co.

description: At Dundee Ales & Lagers, we support all beer lovers on their adventure through the world of craft beers. We believe wholeheartedly in great craft beers that invite and reward you; craft beers that you'll want to reach for again and again. We brew a range of of styles in which all the ingredients are perfectly balanced and work together to offer a flavorful, complex brew that's true to the original style but never over-the-top or intimidating. That's the kind of beer we brew. Because that's the kind of beer we drink. Cheers!
name: Dundee Brewing Co.

description: As the oldest microbrewery in Florida, we are committed to two great challenges: satisfying our thirst for a well-crafted brew and fulfilling the need to contribute to a strong, vibrant community. Dunedin Brewery is founded on values that make these goals a reality; like yourself, we value the integrity to stand for a cause, the stability gained from working hard, and the experience of connecting with good people—our dedicated staff of beer enthusiasts or our loyal guests. There’s plenty of things to do in Florida- even plenty of things to do in Tampa Bay, but we strive to be more than just a place and more than just a beer; we strive to meet the challenge of creating an amazing city and an amazing craft brew. Sláinte!
name: Dunedin Brewery

description: (No longer brewing)
name: Duneland Brewhouse Pub and Restaurant

description:
Dungarvan Brewing Company was launched in April 2010 after a couple of years spent researching, planning and developing by the four founders.
The philosophy of the brewery is one of purity — we keep the beer in its purest form by bottle-conditioning it. It isn’t filtered, isn’t pasteurised and is naturally carbonated so there is minimum interference with it between raw ingredients and finished product. We always start with the best quality ingredients including; Maris Otter malt, full leaf hop cones and the limestone rich water of West Waterford.
Our brewer strives for quality and consistency across every stage of the brew, working hard to ensure that each bottle achieves the high standards he has set. All the beers are craft brewed in small batches and by its artisan nature this can lead to slight variations by batch.
The brewhouse is a 6bbl plant made by PBC Brewery Installations, the UK’s top micro brewery installer and is ideally suited to the bottle-conditioned traditional ales that we brew.
Bottling is currently done by hand with a four-head filler with plans to upgrade this to an automated system in the coming months.
name: Dungarvan Brewing

description: Dungeness Brewing is the start of a dream...
name: Dungeness Brewing

description:
Many people inspired us to not only brew, but to take something that makes us happy, find a way to share it with others and enjoy our work. We began brainstorming how to combine our love of beer and our family farms in Montana on a trip to Ireland and Italy in 2012. 

Our hope is that we make tasty beer that brings people together. We also hope that our work keeps us close to our family by growing barley at Adam's family farm in North Central Montana, growing our own hops, yeast and spices and brewing in Lauren's family's town in Western Montana. We believe that everything that goes in to our beer can be meaningful and improve the experience of drinking it.

We bought our half barrel system and worked more on recipes and licensing in 2013. We began construction at Lauren's family's farm in Spring 2014 and sold our first keg in October 2014.
name: Dunluce Brewing

description:
Micro Brewery, Restaurant, and Pub. Serving hand crafted ales and fine food using the freshest ingredients the kitchen is open from 11 am to 9pm but we keep serving until everyone has had dinner.

Come in and enjoy our delicious food and drinks.
name: Dunsmuir Brewery Works

description:
Durango Brewing Company is the third oldest microbrewery in Colorado. Brewing since 1990, our heritage dates to 1886 when Durango Beer and Ice Company became Durango Brewing Company. Our beers are hand crafted using the finest barley, hops, and yeast along with water born high in the San Juan Mountains of Southwest Colorado.

Presently our beers include Durango Amber Ale, Durango Dark Lager, Durango Wheat Beer, and Durango Golden Ale. We also brew Derail Ale, 2007 and 2008 Gold Medal Winner at the Great American Beer Festival (Other Strong Beer Category), and various seasonal beers. Seasonal selections include Blueberry Wheat, Durango Pale Ale, Durango Winter Ale, and 2009 GABF Gold Medal Winner - Colorfest, our fall seasonal.

In November 2007, we added our new Tap Room which has features inspired by the Narrow Gauge Railroad and the history of our town. The Tap Room is open seven days a week for all to relax and enjoy the Flavor of Durango. Stop by and try a sample or enjoy a fresh pint of any of our award winning beers. Our unique growlers are always available for carry out along with all our packaged products.
name: Durango Brewing Company

description: Old world brewing techniques blended with creativity and passion, Durty Bull Brewing Company will be a 15-barrel craft brewery and tasting room specializing in barrel aged and sour beers as well as other unconventional offerings brewed for the residents of The Bull City and beyond.
name: Durty Bull Brewing Company

description:
Welcome to Dust Bowl Brewing Company located in Turlock, Ca. We are a small brewing company in the Central Valley of California. Our size allows us to have a very personal and passionate connection to each of our beers. We are continuously testing new flavors and styles to develop our selection of beers. Our goal is to help create a thriving beer culture in the Central Valley.

Our company is a tribute to the strong-willed, gritty people of the Dust Bowl and Great Depression era. Inspired by the families who came west in search of a new start as well as those who stayed behind to weather the storm. This is great beer born of hard times. Storm’s comin’!
name: Dust Bowl Brewing Company

description: Dutch Girl Brewery or DGB, has been in the making for years.  Even Kelly's great, great grandmother worked at a local pub in the Netherlands! As homebrewers for 20+ years, it was time to take the plunge. After many visits to breweries, numerous tours, endless tastings and hundreds of gallons of homebrew, we figured we were crazy enough to create an amazing brewery on the lakeshore.
name: Dutch Girl Brewery

description:
Duvall Springs Brewing is Duvall, WA. first brewery! Deep in the woods of Duvall, a secret shed is producing some of the heartiest and unique beers, using local Washington State products.

Started by three friends with a passion for all things beer, we hope to be in a fine establishment near you as soon as possible.
name: Duvall Springs Brewing

description: Today, the Duvel Moortgat group, founded in 1871, is an independent producer of authentic speciality beers and premium brands. Around the world, the group is considered to be the leading producer of blond, bottle conditioned, high fermentation beers, a dominant position owed largely to the success of its best-selling product Duvel. A niche player, Duvel Moortgat occupies a leading position in the strategic segments of speciality beers and premium brands like Duvel, Maredsous, Bel Pils and Vedett. The group markets Steendonk white beer in a joint venture with the Palm brewery. Duvel Moortgat has also entered the market of natural fruit juices with a 70% participation in the quality juice producer Freya. Today, the group's beers are exported to over 40 countries. Duvel Moortgat has also taken a firm foothold in Central Europe, thanks to a 50% participation in the Czech Bernard brewery, renowned for its premium Pilsners. The group has launched itself into the market of artisan premium beers through the acquisition of the American Ommegang brewery. Duvel Moortgat has also been listed on the Brussels Euronext stock exchange since 1999.
name: Duvel Moortgat

description: DuVig Brewing Company opened May 17th. Onsite, we offer tastings and tours, sell growlers to the public, and supply our beer to CT restaurants and bars.
name: DuVig Brewing Company

description:
Founded in 1978 (Christchurch) and owned by the Sinke Family, the Dux de Lux has expanded throughout the years to provide the widest spectrum of hospitality available in one unique and historic setting, and recently now in two destinations - Christchurch and Queenstown.

Coming into it's sixth year, Queenstown Dux de Lux specialises in New Zealand produce from the land and sea, legendary salads, spectacular seafood, world renowned vegetarian fare alongside mouth watering Underground Coffee. Food is the fuel for the vehicle that is our body. Our aim is to fuel you with the food that offers the sustenance and nourishment our busy lives demand. Dux was the original vegetarian restaurant in Christchurch.

Our historic brew bar offers a relaxed environment to meet friends and unwind at the end of the day, watch your favourite sport, catch the band or just watch the world go by. An institution in the live music scene, the Dux de Lux is one of New Zealand's premier venues for showcasing emerging new talent. From rock to dub, jazz to hip hop and every genre in-between, many nights a week come and check out New Zealand’s next big act. Many of the country’s top artists and bands have grown up with the Dux de Lux - you may just see one tonight!
name: Dux de Lux

description:
At Dyckman Beer Co., we craft beers inspired by the flavors, the people, and the culture of Uptown and it’s surrounding neighborhoods.
We aim to elevate the beer standard Uptown to a level deserving of those that call it home. Our beers are created with respect for the brewing craft and an edge of rebellion against the weak and watered-down. We believe that beer is an experience. Each bottle is a moment to be savoured, a dose of courage, a relief from chaos, or a soul-bending indulgence. We take pride in our beer. We love our beer, and we hope you do too.
Born in Dominican Republic, moving to New York City at the age 5, and raised by a single mother, Juan J. Camilo started Dyckman Beer Co. in 2012 with a goal to create premium beers that will be a source of great pride for Uptown and its surrounding communities. Armed with recipes reflecting the taste and spirit of Uptown, subtly infused with Dominican flavors, Juan set out to give Uptown NYC a beer they could call their own. Dyckman Beer Co. was born.
name: Dyckman Beer Co.

description:
E.C. Dahls Brewery (E.C. Dahls Bryggeri) is a brewery and soft drink factory based in Trondheim, Norway.

E.C. Dahls Brewery was founded in 1856 by Erich Christian Dahl (1814–1882), a local businessman and consul-general from Trondheim. He was the son of Erich Dahl (1774-1821) Christine Lyche (1776-1861). His parents had been the owners of an import-export business and shipping company. In 1851, Erich Christian Dahl had bought the Sugarhouse (Sukkerhuset) in the Kalvskinnet area of Trondheim, where there had been a sugar refinery since 1754. Sukkerhuset was rebuilt for brewing. The brewery stayed in the building until 1984.

The first bottle of Bayerøl, a Munich-style dunkel, was sold in 1857. In 1910, the plant began to produce soft drinks at the brewery as well. Bayerøl was the most important type of beer until the early 20th century when Dahls Pils, a pilsener took over as the most popular beer.

In 1966, it was merged with Trondheim Akti Brewery (Trondhjems Aktiebryggeri), which was founded in 1899 and Trondheim Brewery (Trondhjems Bryggeri) which dated to 1919. E.C. Dahls Bryggeri is now owned by Ringnes, part of the Group Carlsberg AS.
name: E.C. Dahls Bryggeri

description:
EaDo (pronounced “EE-D'OH”) Beerworks is the brain-baby of a group of close friends and beer fans who dreamed of making brews in a way that would invite more people into the craft beer fold. 
At EaDo Beerworks, we make a wide range delicious ales so all types of folks can find their BOC (brew of choice), whether they’re a craft beer aficionado or neophyte, While craft beer has permeated cities across America, there are many more people to reach who could both enjoy better beer and whose input will push the industry in new exciting directions.  EaDo (or East Downtown, Houston, TX) is a rather new name for a culturally and historically rich area in Houston. As a business, we value a highly urban environment and we hope to grow and evolve with the neighborhood. We will feature a free-standing taproom that is open to the public 5 days a week. It will have space for tasting events, live music, and community gatherings.
All truly transformative changes start at the smallest scale - one beer at a time, or so we like to think. Let's work together to make craft beer truly represent our community and all of our tastes.
name: EaDo Beerworks

description:
Opened in August 2013 Eagle Creek Brewing Co is Statesboro GA's first craft brewery. Located in the heart of South Georgia we focus on producing delicious, interesting and highly drinkable beers using the very best ingredients available.
Stop by our taproom or find our beers at good beer bars and bottle shops all around Georgia.
name: Eagle Creek Brewing Company

description:
As the first brewery with operations based in Los Angeles in over 60 years, we're dedicated to the production of unique artisanal beers using the best ingredients to promote the ongoing development of the beer community in Los Angeles.

Our microbrewery is attached to our public tap-room, where fellow beer lovers can gather to relax, refresh, and enjoy our unique beers. As we do not serve food, we encourage patrons to bring your own food or make a visit to the local food trucks/vendors that we have outside. Guests visiting our taproom need to be *21 and over to enter - no exceptions.
name: Eagle Rock Brewery

description: EagleMonk Pub and Brewery features craft beer, wine, soda and pizza. We also make our own Pizzas, Paninis, and Salads!
name: EagleMonk Pub and Brewery

description: Earnest Brew Works is a brewery and taproom coming to Toledo in 2016.
name: Earnest Brew Works

description: Earth Bread + Brewery is an earth-friendly place that puts respect for the environment and the comfort of our guests above all else.  From the green-minded details of our build out, to our choice of vendors and the way we treat our colleagues, you will find Earth an enticing place to visit.  We support local agriculture, local breweries and small producers from around the world.
name: Earth Bread + Brewery

description:
Serving "Empyreal Ales & Wonder Gruits" at our tasting room in downtown Portsmouth. The qualities some Native Americans attribute to the "Earth Eagle" (common wild turkey) speak to our philosophy as brewers and business owners: ecological, charitable, resilient, and unconventional. "Brewings" is our nod to the first brewers who made small batches for their families crafted from local grains, herbs and yeasts. At Earth Eagle Brewings we embrace a Belgian-inspired, pre-Reformation spirit where hops are but one of the hundreds of ingredients to be used in the alchemy of brewing. 
Cheers to you, intrepid imbibers, for sharing our adventures in beer.
name: Earth Eagle Brewings

description:
We are Production Brewery and Taproom in Pittsburgh's East End. We've been in operation since 2005, and have two locations where you can stop in for a pint, a Growler, a six pack, or a Keg. 

Tours too, about every other Saturday! Check the website for more details. 

Come see us! Otherwise how will you...

BUY A GOOD FRIEND A GOOD BEER
name: East End Brewing Company

description:
Eastern Shore Brewing opened it's doors September of 2008 by owners Adrian and Lori Moritz.  Both had an entrepanerial passion, but never thought of a microbrewery as their business.  "The decision was made for us.  Make a business out of something you love to do and you will never work another day in your life" the couple states.  A lot of hard work and a love for good beer motivates the business. 
We decided to open Eastern Shore Brewing after talking with friends from St. Michael's Winery, and were told that the town was in need of a microbrewery.  After some discussion (less than you may think), we agreed and were on our way.  With some trials along the way in year one, year two proved to be the pinicle of change.  An increase in brewery size promoted an increase of staff.  Randall Marquis came on board as brewmaster in March of 2009 and has made his presence known.  An undergratudate of Franklin Marshall College, and a brewing certificate holder from UC Davis, Randy is a large portion of the success of Eastern Shore Brewing.  Three beers took home medals in the Maryland Govenor's cup competition (Bronze for Lighthause Golden Ale, Silver for the Duck Duck Goose Porter and a Silver for the St.ichael's Amber ALe) on October 9th.  And although happy with the medals, Eastern Shore Brewing's goals are to continue to grow the busines and improve their products.  Distribution ranges from Cambridge to Kent Island on the Eastern Shore of Maryland, and recently moved into Ellicott City, Maryland.  A new fermenter will be arriving shortly after the new year, which will increase capacity even further.
There is more to come....
name: Eastern Shore Brewing Co

description:
Eastlake brews both post-modern American and traditional European beers, served exclusively in the 75-seat taproom. We'll do our best to always have at least one malty, one light & refreshing, and one (or three) hoppy beer on tap. Prost!

Gluten-free? Non-drinker? Not quite 21 years old? We didn't forget about you – we also have two flavors of kombucha, in addition to locally made root beer and ginger ale, on tap.
name: Eastlake Craft Brewery

description:
Eastwood Brewing Company, formerly Double Barrel Brewing Company, is a family owned nano brewery located in the Eastwood neighborhood of Syracuse, New York. Using a one barrel brew system, owner Pete Kirkgasser is able to create a unique variety of specialized craft brews. Pete's beers are only available locally at the Eastwood Brewing Company location. Customers are able to visit our tasting room and purchase beer in growlers seven days a week.

With a $3 tasting fee, patrons will receive 8 samples of fresh, craft beer. Growler fill prices vary depending on style and growler size. 64 or 32 ounce growlers, pint glasses and other merchandise is available also.

Cheers, and thanks for the support!
name: Eastwood Brewing Company

description: EB Coffee & Pub is Michigan's first Traditional Coffee house and Brewpub.
name: EB Coffee & Pub

description: Echo Brewing Company is a small family run brewery nestled between the towns of Firestone and Frederick in the heart of Colorado’s Carbon Valley.  Founded by twin brothers who have a passion for brewing the best beer possible.  Homebrewers of eight plus years they keep their brewing concept at Echo similar to their homebrewing history: brew one fine beer followed by another while sharing them with the local community.
name: Echo Brewing Company

description:
Ecliptic opened October 2013. Owned by John Harris. John’s vision is a destination restaurant and brewery. His goal is to push the limits of creativity in the brewhouse, and create a sense of place in both the restaurant and the beer he builds. 

John’s background is one steeped in Oregon’s rich history in craft brewing. He spent his first two years, from 1986-1988, as a brewer at McMenamins’ breweries; his next four were at Deschutes, where he created the recipes for Mirror Pond, Black Butte Porter and Obsidian Stout; and John spent the next 20 years of his illustrious career as a brewmaster at Full Sail. He is now starting the next chapter with the creation of Ecliptic Brewing.
name: Ecliptic Brewing

description:
Eddyline Brewery has been brewing in the heart of Collegiate Peaks in Buena Vista, Colorado since 2009.

All beer are brewed with inspiration from our wild surroundings. Crank Yanker IPA is the best beer for cruising single track all over the valley. River Runners Pale Ale is the greatest all day suds sipper on the river and beyond. Come visit and have a great time in the Colorado Wilderness!
name: Eddyline Restaurant and Brewing Company

description:
Previously Chesapeake Bay Brewing.

Opened in 2003 by Brian Baker, who relocated to Raleigh from Edenton, NC rather than suffer the massive expense of moving ChesBay's brewing equipment to his building in Edenton, especially considering the local Raleigh customer base that was already in place after the demise of ChesBay.

In 2007, Baker sold the business to Geoff Lamb, who ultimately renamed the brewery after Edenton's most-popular label.
name: Edenton Brewing Company

description: Eder & HeylandS is a privately owned brewery in the north-western part of Bavaria (about 50 km east of Frankfurt). The brewery was founded in 1872 and is ever since managed by the Eder's family.
name: Eder & Heylands

description: Edge Brewing is an American craft brewery located in the industrious Poble Nou district of Barcelona. Join our email list at www.edgebrewing.com to be notified of upcoming parties, tasting sessions, collaboration brewing schedules, brewery tours and a host of other surprise events.
name: Edge Brewing

description:
Edge Brewing Company is a collaboration of several diverse individuals, each of whom have their own strengths and above all a passion for craft beer...

By blending this passion, knowledge and experience, we intend to produce an exciting and innovative range of beers to the treasure valley and beyond.
name: Edge Brewing Company

description:
Why Edmund's Oast?

The “Edmund” in the name comes from Edmund Egan, who began producing beer in Charleston after emigrating from England in the 1760s. "Oast” is a kiln used in the drying of hops. 

Edmund's Oast!
name: Edmund's Oast

description:
Once an old lumber mill, we brew in our  brewing facility in Scotia, California. 

Our tap room and grill in Fortuna, California offers all of our beers as well as an extensive menu featuring local and organic products. Check out the "Pub Specials" tab for information on daily specials at our pub.
name: Eel River Brewing

description: We are a family business for 30 years that have strived to connect with the community we serve, "The Neighborhood". We are part of a wave of pubs with good food - "Gastro Pubs"; informal, inexpensive fun, yet with high standards.
name: Egan and Sons

description:
Ei8ht Ball, named after the streets we got our
credit from, we are humble yet proud. Local but not
influenced. We might not move mountains, but we will
push the envelope. We will test theories and create
moments through our liquid in which tones and times
are our muse. We will brew and flow with poise and
confidence. We will rush for no one, yet hesitate for
nothing. We strive to please but make no apologies. No
billboards, neon lights and flashy text, it’s not our speed.
Make us part of your flight or enjoy us with a meal and
the mission is complete. For all of those in search of
something diverse, unique, improved and fresh, look
into, behind, under and around the Ei8ht Ball. What you
will find is what you never thought you were looking for.
This is Ei8ht Ball Brewing, the proof is the glass.
name: Ei8ht Ball Brewing

description:
We are family at Eight Bridges Brewing which is why we want you to bring yours! Bring your kids and your dog. Sip beer while playing games or just sit and enjoy some family time.

Our beers combine traditional ingredients to create unique flavors which roll through your mouth and cover all styles from hoppy ales to malty lagers. In any brew, our goal is to produce beers with interesting flavors that will tease your senses.

We’ll see you soon!
name: Eight Bridges Brewing

description: Eight Degrees beers are handcrafted in the beautiful Ballyhoura region of north Cork, by Scott Baigent and Cam Wallace, a Kiwi and an Aussie. Their mission is to make modern interpretations of traditional Irish ale and lager styles, providing distinctive malt and hop characteristics for what they call ‘naturally adventurous’ beers.  The results are a range of full flavoured, tasty ales made from natural ingredients.
name: Eight Degrees Brewing Company

description: It started with Bernard La Borie's search for the best water on the planet. He ultimately found it in the amazing country of Iceland, where abundant water is naturally filtered through ancient lava fields. In exploring ways to share this water with the rest of the world, we partnered with Vífilfell, a beverage bottler and distributor and one of the most respected companies in Iceland. They also happen to own the Viking Brewery in Akureyri - a fishing port located just 60 miles south of the... (read more)
name: Einstök Icelandic Craft Ale

description: Eisenbahn is a microbrewery located in Blumenau, Santa Catarina, Brazil. It produces beer and draft beer following the Reinheitsgebot, with a variety of flavours and fermentations. The name (which means railroad, in German) is an analogy to an old railroad station, that was close to the building now used by the company as a bar and beer production base. Eisenbahn is owned by Schincariol.
name: Eisenbahn
EJ Phair Brewing Company and Alehouse

description: A small craft brewing company based in Sydney’s Northern Beaches. We are a small microbrewery, producing quality, handcrafted beers since 2009.
name: Ekim Brewing Co

description:
El Segundo Brewing Company was created out of a love for beer. Well, hoppy beer at least. Rob Croxall, proprieter and brewer, was a longtime aerospace finance guy who left a cushy corporate job to risk it all on craft beer. He says all the time, “My worst day here, still beats my best day there.”
By our measure.. THAT is success.
name: El Segundo Brewing Company

description: Geno and Cindy Acevedo founded El Toro Brewing Company in the summer of 1992. After much planning, research and construction business was begun in March of 1994. The brewery is a small 17-barrel (527 gallon) batch system and operates on the Acevedo's rural residential property.  Within seven months of opening El Toro Brewing Company received its first national recognition at the 1994 Great American Beer Festival (GABF). One of its flagships El Toro Oro Golden Ale won a coveted Gold Medal for English Pale Ale. At the 1996 GABF Poppy Jasper Amber Ale, the brewery's other flagship beer, won a Silver Medal for English Brown Ale. It is a mild yet robust brown ale. The 1997 GABF saw El Toro garner another Gold Medal for the American styled wheat beer named after the brewer's father-in-law, William Jones Wheat Beer.  After 16 years of planning, Geno and Cindy Acevedo of Morgan Hill finally opened a brewpub on November 25 2006. El Toro Brewpub is a two floored building with patio. Inside is the world's only Poppy Jasper Bar. Featuring over 45 feet of gorgeously inlaid and polished Poppy Jasper rock into its surface. To the back of the large mirrored bar you will find over 25 beers and handcrafted sodas on tap. We also have a gleaming copper Pub Brewing system 3 BBL (100 gallon) brewery. Live music and dancing will also be a regular nighttime happening at the brewpub consisting of mostly local bands playing cover type and original Rock, Blues, Jazz and Reggae.
name: El Toro Brewing Company

description:
Arizona's first microbrewery.. 30 bbl home built gravity system, located on the edge of scenic Bisbee. We are generally closed to the public, however our beers are on tap and in bottles everywhere in Bisbee and some lesser locations in Phoenix and Tucson.

Brewery was Purchased by Beast Brewing.
name: Electric Brewing Co

description: Element Brewing produces unique hand crafted beer that just has to be tasted. We fuse styles and flavors together and break the style barrier.
name: Element Brewing Company‎

description: Élesztő ("Yeast” in Hungarian) was founded in spring 2013. It was the first - and the last up to this day – big craft-beer bar, which offers 21 taps of quality Hungarian craft-beer. Since Élesztő was opened by the organizers of Főzdefeszt – first Hungarian Craft-beer Festival, the festival that effectively established craft-beer in Hungary – it’s visitors have easy access to the ost exciting, most distinguished Hungarian brews. While we aim to showcase the best of Hungarian and increasingly international craft brewing, we always make sure, there are some nice session-beers on tap as well. Élesztő was never meant to be just a pub. Our real goal has been to found a cultural entertainment zone, a small-town sidestreet with its own rules, or an undergroud plaza, if you like.
name: Élesztő

description: Uniquely crafted beers and fresh local foods for the bay area.
name: Elevation 66 Brewing Co

description:
Four friends; Carlin, Christian, Sheila, and Xandy, started Elevation Beer Co. on a cool Colorado night over a few beers and a backyard BBQ.

We all had the same dream of starting a brewery that brewed the highest quality barrel aged and specialty beers we could imagine. At the same time we all dreamed of living in an area of Colorado that would allow us to sneak out of the brewhouse to catch a four-pound trout, hike a 14,000-foot peak, or slash through some of Colorado’s famous powder. In the winter of 2011 we made our dreams a reality and took the leap and started brewing in Poncha Springs, Colorado.
name: Elevation Beer Company

description: The Elevator Brewer and Draught Haus finds its home in the historic Columbia building, built in 1897 by the Bott family to house the Bott Brother’s Billiards and a gentleman’s saloon. The beautiful hand-carved, hand-split Philippine mahogany bar was created to serve the whiskey distilled on the second floor. The saloon enjoyed a brisk business from the turn of the century until the advent of prohibition in 1920. The building, rich in history, is on the national registry of historic landmarks and has been restored to much of its original grandeur. Among the original architectural elements that remain today are the beautiful bar, intricate mosaic tile floor, much of the stained glass and of course the decorative ceiling. The luxurious back-bar won the coveted blue ribbon for craftsmanship at the 1893 World Columbian Exposition in Chicago. Many myths and legends surround this historic building, including the presence of ghosts and spirits. Perhaps during your visit with us, you’ll encounter the unexpected.
name: Elevator Brewing Company

description:
Elgood’s Brewery is a family business established over 200 years ago and run by the Elgood family since 1878. You can find out more about our history here.
 
Today’s Chairman is Nigel Elgood, who ran the brewery as managing director from 1968 to 2002.
 
In that year he handed over the running of the business to the eldest of his three daughters Belinda, who continues as the managing director; while her two sisters Claire and Jennifer are directors. We are very proud of our family history and its association with Elgood’s Brewery.
name: Elgood's Brewery

description: Since 2003, the residence of Alyson and Richard Brewer-Hay has been known to family and friends as The Elizabeth Street Brewery. Located in the family-oriented San Francisco neighborhood of Noe Valley, the ESB is a pub for the people, by the people.
name: Elizabeth Street Brewery

description: Head Brewer Tim Yarrington makes beers that people want to drink.  With over 12 years brewing experience under his belt, founding the brewery operations at Long Valley Pub & Brewery in New Jersey and resurrecting Time Square Brewery in Manhatten, Brewer Tim brings a good sense of what beers people enjoy drinking to Elk Creek Aleworks.  Winning Gold and Bronze medals for his Porter and Bitter at the prestigous Great American Beer Festival attests to the fact that his peers also think he makes great beer. Drawing inspiration primarily from traditional English ale brewing, Tim makes balanced beers, giving both malt and hops prominence in every pint.  In addition to our rotating selection of seasonal brews, we offer six outstanding House Standards year 'round.  Without doubt, there's a pint for you!
name: Elk Creek Cafe and Aleworks

description: Elk Mountain Brewing, Inc., established in April of 2009, is owned and operated by Tom and Marcia Bell. Elk Mountain Brewing is a small scale microbrewery located in the industrial area of Parker, Co, serving truly unique handcrafted microbrews with award winning recipes. Tom Bell is the head brewer with nearly 20 years of experience. Although he brews a variety of beers, his specialty is German beers with a twist. For those non-drinkers we will have homemade Root Beer on tap.
name: Elk Mountain Brewing

description: Elk Street Brewery Offers Hand-crafted, Premium Micro Brews Using  Locally Grown Hops. Our Brews Are Designed For Maximum Flavor, Smoothness, & Drinkability
name: Elk Street Brewery & Tap Room

description: Just a simple home brewer who is inspired to turn his passion into a career.
name: Elk Valley Brewing Co.

description: Here at the Mills we have a very simple, yet demanding approach to producing Alpenhof beer. We use the very best ingredients available. We are efficient and precise in production method, yet we allow the product to age to its full maturity. Balance is the key to our beer.  Alpenhof beer is not created to challenge the senses. It is not created to be a complex beer. Well balanced for Alpenhof means smooth and easy-drinking. The way a beer should taste.  To achieve this well balanced taste, only the finest ingredients are used. We import our malt, hops, and yeast from Germany. (For true German style Lager beer, authentic ingredients are essential!) We might spend more for our ingredients, but it is well worth it. This is an expense you can actually taste!
name: Ellicott Mills Brewing

description:
To date, EBC is considered one of the finest craft brewers and has received no less than THREE International World Beer Championship Awards.

The Ellicottville Brewing Company is the result of the desire to open a family business. Inspiration struck during a ski trip to Vail, where other craft brewers began. There was the realization that Ellicottville, sometimes referred to as "the Aspen of the East", would be the perfect location for a craft brewery & grill.

After 10 years of building a successfull brewery & restaurant in Ellicottville, our team ventured to open a second location where we could build on our brewing & culinary talents. EBC West opened June 1st, 2005 in the fun-filled college town of Fredonia, home to SUNY Fredonia.
name: Ellicottville Brewing Company

description:
Elliott Bay Brewing Co. is a family owned company of high quality neighborhood brewpubs in communities throughout the Seattle area.  Owners Todd Carden and Brent Norton met in 1994 while working for the iconic Maritime Pacific Brewing Co. They forged a friendship and explored their common goal and dream of owning and operating their own brewpub. They also met Head Brewer Doug Hindman at Maritime Pacific.
Todd and Brent incorporated the company in November of 1996.   In March 1997 they signed their first lease and began construction of a brewpub in the historic “Junction” of West Seattle.  They opened for business on July 11, 1997.  Doug joined the ranks in September of 1997 and has been Head Brewer ever since.
Over the past thirteen years in West Seattle, Elliott Bay Brewery & Pub has been a leader in sustainability, philanthropic support, and instumental in creating an amazing sense of community in the neighborhoods which it serves.  Elliott Bay Brewhouse and Pub, the companyís second brewpub, opened in Burien in March of 2007.  The Burien Brewhouse, like its West Seattle sibling, supports a progressive company culture and socially responsible business practices.
- See more at: http://www.elliottbaybrewing.com/about/about-us/#sthash.v5ZoitjL.dpuf
name: Elliott Bay Brewery and Pub

description: Bringing to Lansing some of the highest quality craft beer and spirits Summer of 2015!
name: Ellison Brewery and Spirits

description: Freshness is paramount at Elm City. Our chefs and brewer use only the finest ingredients to produce the flavorful products we're known for. Our beer is brewed on premises by brewer Bill Dunn. Our breads, sauces and desserts are made fresh, using locally grown produce when available.
name: Elm City Brewing Company

description: The Elysian was founded in 1995 by principals Dick Cantwell (President/Head Brewer), Joe Bisacca (CFO/Head of Operations) and David Buhler (Sales & Marketing Director). Our first Seattle location, a 220-seat beer hall and our main brewery, opened in 1996 on Capitol Hill, Seattle’s most populous neighborhood. In 1997 Elysian was chosen to operate a pub and small brewery at Gameworks—a large entertainment complex owned by Universal Studios, Dreamworks & Sega. Elysian left this partnership in 2002 upon expiration of the five-year contract. A short year later Elysian opened TangleTown, an 80-seat neighborhood brewery/bistro. With a 3-bbl pilot brewery, Elysian-TangleTown acted as the brewers' test kitchen, fueling the creative fires and helping cement Elysian's reputation as Seattle’s top brewpub. The most recent addition to the Elysian empire, Elysian Fields, opened in August 2006. Perched next to Seattle’s two sports arenas, Fields seats 400 and packs the house at lunch and on gamedays. It is typical for us to offer over twenty different Elysian beers between the three locations.
name: Elysian Brewing Company

description: An American Lager Brewery located out of the Old Rainier Brewery in Seattle, WA.
name: Emerald City Beer Company

description: The Emerald Coast Beer Company was started in 2006 with the goal of building a brand of beers to satisfy the taste of the southern beer drinker. There are four beers under the brand.
name: Emerald Coast Beer Co

description: Established in 1999, Emmett's Brewing Company is comprised of three brewpubs in the Chicago suburbs. Tradition, craftsmanship, and the highest standards in beer and food are our passion. We believe in using only the finest ingredients in what we make, whether they are destined for your pint glass or your plate. Our original pub is in West Dundee and houses our copper-clad, seven barrel JV Northwest system. There, we produce about 600 barrels per year, including all of the company's barrel-aged and cask-conditioned ales. We opened Downers Grove in 2004 and brew on a 15 barrel Specific Mechanical system to make about 850 barrels per year. The 10 barrel DME system at Palatine is our newest brewery and is also the home of our bottle and draft packaging operations. Our beer can be found in chain and independent retail stores, bars, and restaurants throughout the Chicago-land area.
name: Emmett's Brewing Company

description:
Empire Brewing Company began as a contemporary Microbrewery & Restaurant in Syracuse, New York. Established in 1994, we have served our national & international award winning ales & lagers exclusively to the craft beer pallets of Central New York.
In 2010, we expanded our proprietary brewing practice to Brooklyn, NY. We are excited to offer you the fruits of our labor in a pint glass. Thank you for your patronage & please enjoy responsibly.

Cheers!
empire brewing company
name: Empire Brewing Company

description: Empirical Brewery is a startup brewery in Chicago Illinois.  Our mission is to create high quality craft beers that exceed your expectations.  We are focused on innovation and exploration of unique flavor profiles.  Our customers come first and have a direct impact on brewery operations.  The advantage of a craft brewery is that it can respond to changing market tastes.  To that end, we will endeavor to gather feedback from you and incorporate it into our brewing.  For updates on the brewery, follow us on Twitter, Facebook or our blog. Look for our beer to be available early next year.
name: Empirical Brewery

description: It began with a dream that we could brew full-flavored beer in the great state of Nebraska. In late 1990 that dream became our state’s first brewpub, Lazlo’s Brewery & Grill. Since then demand for our beer has grown, so we expanded our pub and Empyrean Brewing Company was born. Today we still dream big even while we hand craft our beers in small flavor–filled batches. So enjoy an Empyrean beer, the taste of dreams come true.
name: Empyrean Brewing Company

description:
Engine 15 Brewing Co. was born of the need for great beer!  Way back in 1988, Luch Scremin was a Freshman in college and became interested in brewing his own beer.  Since the internet did not exist, Luch was forced to order a “beer kit” from an ad in the back of an issue of Popular Mechanics.  Suffice it to say that what resulted was indeed beer but was far from great.

Fast forward twenty years and the love of beer and the desire to brew it had matured over years of home brewing and an insatiable appetite for delicious brew.  Luch traveled the world with his job in the airline business and was treated to many delicious beer styles and beer culture.  In 2008 while planning to open a beer bar and brewpub,  Luch met his future business partners Andy and Sean.  The three were soon making the business a reality.

All that was left was a name.  They soon decided they would name the brewery for Luch’s 1962 Ford Fire Engine – after all, they just don’t make them like that anymore.  It represents all that Engine 15 Brewing Co. is about. Camaraderie, old school know how, determination and a simple but serious dedication to the cause.
As of 2011, Engine 15 Brewing Co. has enjoyed success and was even voted best Pub and Brewpub  in Jacksonville by the Folio Weekly readers poll.  At Engine 15 Brewing Co. you’ll find a friendly atmosphere where you can enjoy a dizzying array of beers, both brewed in house and imported from the far reaches of the globe, eat a tasty meal and even brew your own beer!

Engine 15 – Eat, Drink, Brew!
name: Engine 15 Brewing Company

description: Engrained Brewing Company is a locally owned micro-brewery and farm to table restaurant.  Brewed onsite, our beer lineup is crafted to bring friends together with a broad range of styles.  Our menu features fresh and affordable food from local family farms.  Our brewmaster and chef are always crafting fresh new brews and food to give you a unique experience with every visit.  Gather at Engrained for a drink with friends, a family dinner, or special event at your own local brewpub!
name: Engrained Brewing Company

description: ENKI Brewing is the 20+ year culmination of the friendship between two beer lovers. John Hayes and Dan Norton met working for NIKE in the early-80s. Training and competing in track and road running events brought them together. They soon found another shared interest--experiencing the world of beer. The two made many friends spending spare evenings in New England pubs offering European beers, which, before the emergence of American craft beers, were the best beers available. The two often discussed their dream of opening their own brewery over the years. In August of 2012, John and Dan decided to take the keg into their own hands, and ENKI Brewing Company was born. Just a few months later, their dreams came to fruition at 7929 Victoria Drive.
