ENKI’s mission is to “Make the World a Friendlier Place – Two Beers at a Time” just as John and Dan have been enjoying and sharing beers with old and new friends, alike.
name: ENKI Brewing

description: We are a nano-sized artisan brewery specializing in the bière de champagne style. Look for “Enlightenment Brut” on shelves in the Spring of 2012!
name: Enlightenment Ales

description: The beers of Ensenada Brewing Company are hand-crafted in Baja California in the heart of Ensenada, where dedicated artisans mix passion and innovation to deliver unique blends sure to please any beer enthusiast.
name: Ensenada Brewing Co.

description: Welcome to Eola Beer Company! We are located in the mountains of North Carolina in the beautiful and artistic city of Lenoir. Eola Beer Company features handcrafted artisanal beers made with local ingredients of the highest quality using malted barley, fresh whole cone hops, Appalachian Mountain waters and fresh cultured yeast. All Natural, Organic Beer with No additives, No extracts, and no shortcuts to provide you with the finest, freshest beer . We are also a Gastropub , Chef Stephen Loe uses local and seasonal ingredients to create an ever-changing menu of exciting , flavorful dishes from around the world. Influenced by many chefs, and culinary styles Loe focuses on Southern American, French, Cajun -Creole, and Indian. Stephen Loe has won many awards for his cooking and beers and is a graduate of the prestigious Culinary Institute of America in Hyde Park NY. He has worked at many fine restaurants in New York , Emerils, Sonoma California Bistro, Barringtons, and Artisanal before starting his own. Eola is a great mountain destination with great food, great beer, souvenirs,gifts,live music and a fun , friendly atmosphere with outdoor seating in the historic downtown area. Please come make Eola your North Carolina Mountain tradition! Cheers
name: Eola Beer Company
Eola School Restaurant, Brewery and Lodge

description: Epic Ales is Seattle brewery founded in early 2009. Master Brewer, Cody Morris, started the brewery with the hope of providing the Seattle area with a slew of strange and wonderful brews.
name: Epic Ales

description:
EPIC Brewing Company opened in May 2010 with six fermentation tanks, but an increase in space and brewing capacity has given brewers the flexibility to create beers that have yet to be imagined. Epic has doubled is capacity twice in the past three years and in the summer of 2013 opened an additional brewery in Denver, CO.  

In only a few short months after opening, Epic began earning medals for its beers domestically and internationally. Now brewing over 35 distinctly different beers we believe there is an Epic brew for your tastes, at the right place and the right time. At Epic, everyone is here to help you make the perfect beer match.
name: EPIC Brewing Company

description:
Well there are a few reasons why Epic was chosen for the name of the company and beers.

Epic Flavour - It reflected the way I like to brew beer. I like to have big aromas, flavours and taste in the beers.

Epic Challenge - To start a new beer brand in this day and age, in a mature market, dominated by multinationals with huge resources, and the public perception that beer is a low value commodity, is a big challenge.

Epic Journey - everyone that lives in New Zealand, or travelled here for a holiday, they at some point in their or their ancestors lives had to make an Epic Journey. Whether it be by canoe or commercial airliner they traveled a great distance to the end of the world to be in this beautiful country of New Zealand
name: Epic Brewing Company

description:
The most common question we get is, why Equinox Brewing? The equinox, and the intrigue of equal night and day, has deep roots in history and ritual. But, at the same time, the equinox marks the changing of the season, and forces us to look toward the future. We find it interesting that the two days out of the year that have perfect light and dark balance also show the balance between the past and the future, tradition and innovation. Beer contains similar elements. Sure, there’s the balance of flavors in a beer; sweet and bitter, rich and simple…

We find another aspect of beer’s balancing act fascinating. Historically, beer styles have developed because of limitations in local ingredients and the necessity to make do with what you have. However, due to global trade and modern shipping methods, limitations on ingredients have been removed. We can get any ingredients we want. While most modern brewers recognize the importance of beer styles and learn from the brewers who made them, they certainly don’t limit themselves to making beers that fit into traditional definitions.

On one level our beers fit into some traditional styles, but we put our own twist on them. We want our beers to capture elements from the past and incorporate new ideas, ingredients and techniques into them. We’re not afraid to try new things.

As a brewer, its playtime and work, balanced.
name: Equinox Brewing Company

description: Erie's first community-funded brewery, we brew beer we like to drink.
name: Erie Ale Works

description: Erie Brewing Co. is a microbrewery that offers award winning craft beers to the Erie community and along the East Coast. You can stop in for a tasting and tour or find one of our 10 beers at your local bar, 6 pack shop, or beer distributor.
name: Erie Brewing Company

description:
Canastota, NY brewery. http://www.eriecanalbrewingcompany.com/contact-us.html
https://m.facebook.com/eriecanalbrewingcompany
name: Erie Canal Brewing Company

description:
Escape Brewing Company founded by brother-in-laws John McGregor and Matt Thompson. A passion for craft beer and creativity drove their desire to share Escape Brewing Company hand crafted ales with the Tampa Bay community. 

We are a nano-brewery located in Trinity, FL brewing on a 3 BBL system. We will have an onsite tasting room and limited distribution. 

Launching in May/June.

Cheers!
name: Escape Brewing Company

description: We are Escape Craft Brewery. We are a micro brewery based in beautiful Redlands, California. Using the freshest local ingredients, we take pride in our work and everything we create is executed with precision and love.
name: Escape Craft Brewery

description: Winchester, Virginia's first production brewery, Escutcheon Brewing Co. is a maritime themed company that excels in traditional brewing methods.
name: Escutcheon Brewing Co.

description: As Winchester, Virginia's first production brewery, Escutcheon Brewing Co. excels in traditional brewing methods to create extremely enjoyable brews.
name: Escutcheon Brewing Co.

description: Arriving in Madison, Wisconsin on May 11, 1852 from a village in Germany called Ichendorf, George Esser possessed little more than the clothing on his back, a talent for masonry, and a taste for good, traditional German beer. Esser started producing lager in a small brewery he bought in Monroe for $1,500. In 1863, he purchased 2 1/2 acres of land in Cross Plains. The original building had two cellars below and several rooms above to house Esser's family. The beer, known as Esser's Best, was first brewed in October, 1863. He was joined in this enterprise in 1881 by his son Jacob. At that time, the brewery had a capacity of 2,000 barrels. A barrel of beer cost $7, and a case containing 36 pint bottles was priced at $1.75. Jacob and his sons, primarily Werner (W.B.) and Peter (Spundt) began delivering beer to the surrounding communities, often starting out as early as 3 a.m. Werner acted as Brew master from 1907 to 1910. It was increased competition from the larger breweries that forced him to become a distributor. The first beer that he handled as a distributor was Hausmann's originally brewed in Madison in 1920, Werner became the distributor for Blatz Near Beer. Following Prohibition in 1933, the company again to distribute beer. It should be noted that during prohibition, Werner and his brothers were kept very busy taking care of the beer needs in the area, mostly doing business at night. In 1937, Werner's eldest son, Roman, became a partner. At this point, the company began to handle Old Style products out of La Crosse, Wisconsin. The family tradition continued when Del Esser, Werner's youngest son, joined the firm in 1948. In 1988, Roman's son, Wayne, took over the business. In 1990, Wayne was joined in the business by his son, Larry, which made six generations of Essers in the bee business. It should also be noted that the Essers were distributors of Blatz and Old Style products until they sold the distributorship in January 1998 to Frank Beer in Middleton, Wisconsin. Frank beer is currently the distributor of Esser's Best in the area.
name: Esser's Cross Plains Brewery

description: Seasonal, food-inspired, small batch beers coming to NYC taps Spring 2013 from the team behind Brooklyn Brew Shop
name: EST Brewing Company

description: The original Brewing equipment which consisted of a 4 1/4  Barrel Brewhouse was moved to Estes. For the first summer the Event Center kept the main floor as a stage and dance floor. For the first summer we offered four beers:  Estes Park Porter, Estes Park Renegade, Longs Peak Raspberry Wheat and Estes Park Pale Ale.  In the fall of 1994, Gordon Knight decided to sell his half of the business. When Gordon left, Eric Bratrud took over as the head Brewer. The Brewery also expanded to a 14 BBL Brewhouse and moved out onto the main floor where is now located. In 1995 we started packaging our beers in 12 oz bottles, which expanded our market. By this time we had added a number of beers including Trail Ridge Red, Estes Park Gold, Stinger Wild Honey Wheat and Samson Stout. 1995 was also the first year of the Best of the West Brewfest held in the Brewery parking lot. Since '95 we've continued to evolve both in our restaurant and with our brewing operations. In 2003 Tyler Lemirande and Eric Bratrud took over as owners.
name: Estes Park Brewery

description: A microbrewery in the works. We will brew craft beer in Howell, Michigan. :-)
name: Eternity Brewing Company

description:
Located on the Old Pepper Distillery Campus, Andrew, Brandon and John started Ethereal Brewing as a way to follow their passion for craft beer.

HAND-CRAFTED MICRO BREWS DESIGNED FOR TASTE, SMOOTHNESS, AND QUALITY. 

Each of our beer recipes uses only the finest hops, wheat, barley, and other ingredients to combine for a fine tasting brew. The smoothness of each swallow is unsurpassed. Experience our quality for yourself. Come in and grab a pint.
 
We offer beer brewing classes and tasting parties by appointment only,
name: Ethereal Brewing

description:
Eudora Brewing Co. is Dayton's first and only brew-on-premises facility and nano-brewpub.

At Eudora, YOU are the brewmaster. Once our doors open, you'll have the opportunity to come in and brew your very own batch of beer in our brew-on-premise facility. You'll be able to schedule a brewing appointment or simply stop by to see if a kettle is available for brewing. A variety of recipes will be available to brew, and we plan on offering more styles as we grow. Whether you've brewed before or you have no idea what you're doing, we're here to guide you through every step of the process and make it as easy and as fun as possible. 

Eudora will also serve as a taproom, where we'll brew our own ales and lagers and serve them on draft. The pub will be open to brew-on-premise customers as well as the general public. We offer a variety of award-winning house-brewed beers as well as non-alcoholic beverages and a small selection of snacks.

Eudora will also donate a portion of EVERY sale toward funding a water project for those in need of clean water. We're teaming up with a group called Charity: Water whose mission is to end the water crisis happening all over the world. With each purchase you make at Eudora, you're helping Charity: Water build wells and water purification systems in villages, schools and clinics in areas where water is difficult to obtain. We use a TON of water in the brewing process. It's the least we can do to give back and do our part to fight the water crisis. With your help, we can change lives and help make the world a better place!
name: Eudora Brewing Company

description:
Belgian local brewery. Eutropius makes blond and dark beers. They also have special beers like 'Winterse heerlijkheid' during winter.

Wouter Vermeersch is creating new beers every so often.
name: Eutropius

description:
Evans Brewing Company is a full scale brewing company located in Irvine, California. 

As Orange County’s oldest craft brewery and one of the largest, Evans Brewing Co. brews all of the Bayhawk Ales brands and is in the process of re-branding these beers under the Evans Brewing Company name.
After a 2 year hiatus, the Silver Medal World Beer Cup award winning Evans Lagers will also be making a return to the market. These beers will be brewed at the Irvine brewery by Summer 2015. 

Follow EBC on Instagram @evansbrewingco
name: Evans Brewing Company

description:
Eventide is a start-up brewery in Atlanta, GA. It was founded on the idea that great beer doesn’t have to be complicated and good beer should be enjoyable. We are also focused on bringing sessionable craft beer to everyone. The biggest trend, and subsequent impediment, in craft/micro brewing is the almost obsessive need to make the biggest, hoppiest, strangest beer possible, which is great for advancing the boundaries of what can be done with beer but does not satisfy a daily thirst. We pride ourselves on making great beer, with all the flavor one could want, that people will actually want to drink whenever and with whatever. Again, great doesn’t have to be complicated.

Another of our fundamental ideas is that brewing is free, and should be open. So, with this in mind, we will share as many of our “secrets” as possible with everyone so that they too can make great beer at home. If you ever have questions please reach out, we are more than happy to share what we know! (Seriously, we will talk about brewing and all of it’s components for hours…love this stuff.)
name: Eventide Brewing

description:
Evil Czech has been operating since 2011 and opened it's doors to a new 20 barrel facility in 2014.

... sometimes for beer to be good, it has to get evil.
name: Evil Czech Brewery

description:
In 2008, our founders Luke Bowen and Trevor Hayward met in an accounting class at Villanova University. Realizing that their job prospects were grim due to the recession, they decided to follow their passion and start their own brewery. 

Their journey took them first to South Bend, Indiana, then to Cooperstown, New York, and finally to Hartford, Connecticut. This exhaustive search landed them a partner who cared as much about craft beer as Luke and Trevor. Today the amazing team at Thomas Hooker Brewing Company works with our founders to craft the highest quality beers possible. 

The next step for Evil Genius is to build their own brewery. Right now, Luke and Trevor are searching for locations around Philadelphia. As Evil Genius turns 4 in September, we have you, our customers to thank for helping make this dream a reality
name: Evil Genius Beer Company

description:
We Have all good intentions to disturb, disorder and enlighten you with unforgettable beer after beer.

Because We are so much in love with good taste, all the beers from Evil Twin are prepared in 10 of the best breweries around the world. Exclusively hand picked to please you with delicate, funky, extreme and by all means rare flavors. Maybe not the easiest way, but certainly the most fun!!!

One More Thing, A clever man once said: 'Stay thirsty... stay foolish.' That sounds like our vision, just with a tad less attitude.
name: Evil Twin Brewing

description: Our mission is to produce the finest local ales in the Mid Atlantic Region. We are a Craft Brewing company focused on producing well balanced handcrafted ales.
name: Evolution Craft Brewing Company

description: Brewing great beer blends art and science. We exist to blend fine craft beer with positive social change. Ex Novo translates as "from scratch”, and we’ve been hard at work building a 10-barrel non-profit brewery from the ground up. That's right, we said non-profit. Don't get us wrong, we aren't opposed to making money. On the contrary, we want to make as much as we can, so we can give it away. We are committed to donating 100% of our net profits to organizations that are working to affect positive social change both in Portland and around the world.
name: Ex Novo Brewing Company

description:
Excel Brewing Company runs a 20 BBL brewhouse. The brewery is a division of Excel Bottling Company. Once up and running, we will offer co-packing for the St. Louis regional craft beers.

Excel Bottling Company was founded in 1936 by the Meier Family. The company bottles more than 10 flavors of old-fashioned sodas including “Ski” soda. Each soda flavor is manufactured using pure cane sugar and most often packaged in eco-friendly, returnable glass bottles. In 2012, Excel Bottling Company embarked on a new bottling venture in the craft beer business serving Illinois and Missouri. Excel Bottling Company is headquartered in Breese, Ill. Visit www.excelbrewing.com for more information.
name: Excel Brewing Company

description:
Our mission is to celebrate the rich history of Lake Minnetonka and historic Excelsior by delivering superior brews hand-crafted in their image. We are a locally-based employee-owned brewery committed to stewardship of the Lake and dedicated to serving her surrounding communities. Our brew was created to honor lake life, and ultimately, to complement it.

A Lake Minnetonka inspired microbrewery, right in the heart of Excelsior. The brewery is a full production brewery offering several unique brews. The brewery offers tours, growler sales and trucker caps. Stop by and let’s get to know each other, neighbor.
name: Excelsior Brewing Company

description: Inspired by the countless immigrants who have made our country what it is today, Exile Brewing Co. is a hand-crafted brewery fueled by the passion of a burn-bright lifestyle, and driven by a unique sense of gratitude for the customer, community and future of our land.
name: Exile Brewing Company

description: We offer 70 different craft beers and 5 made right here in house. We are non smoking and do not have a kitchen. However, if you’re hungry, bring food with you or we have a bunch of menus of places that will deliver right here to the bar!
name: Exit 6 Brewery

description:
A very small craft brewery based around Melbourne

Just a couple of mates who lived for 10 or so years in the UK and Europe, united over a love of beer inspired by the Belgians, Brits, Scandinavians, Italians, other random European nations, the US, Kiwis oh and some Australians too, who after a few years home brewing, finally got sick of their real jobs and decided that this brewing adventure was worth pursuing. Come join us on our journey. 

I'm sure we'll make lots of mistakes along the way but we'll certainly be making friends and trying to make some really interesting and tasty beers for all you lovely people out there
name: Exit Brewing

description: Exit Strategy Brewing Company is a startup brewery focused on creating, brewing and serving excellent craft beers.
name: Exit Strategy Brewing Company

description:
Wiveliscombe, a Somerset town on the edge of Exmoor has been the heart of West Country brewing for two centuries. The famous Hancocks brewery dominated it and regional economy. Formed in 1807, its vast array of buildings crests the hilltop, known as Golden Hill, and forms the skyline of the town visible for miles around.

At one time the Hancock’s employed half the town’s workforce, and owned the best of the 36 town pubs! After the War, Hancock’s, as many other regional breweries, fell to the consolidation of the many by the few. Eventually in 1959 the site was abandoned.

Exmoor Ales "Golden Hill Brewery" occupied a modest part of the Hancock site in 1980, where it has remained since acquiring more land and buildings as it has grown, continuing something of the history of Wiveliscombe Brew Town, along with a neighbouring local brewery, Cotleigh, situated close by on the local industrial estate.
name: Exmoor Ales

description: Founded in 1997, F&M is a rennaissance brewer of premium ales and lagers. Brewed under the brand name Stonehammer, after our flagship pilsner lager we offer three main brands, two seasonal beers, and contract brew the Maclean's Pale Ale.
name: F&M Brewery

description:
FOK Brewing Co es una micro cervezera artesanal localizada en Caguas, Puerto Rico. 

FOK Brewing Co is a craft micro brewery located in Caguas, Puerto Rico
name: F.O.K. Brewing Co. LLC

description: F.X. Matt Brewing Company is an American family-owned brewery at the foothills of the Adirondack Mountains in Utica, New York. It is the fourth oldest family-owned brewery in the United States after D. G. Yuengling & Son (1829), August Schell Brewing Company (1860), and Straub Brewery Inc. (1872). Its most popular product is the Saranac line of beers, although soft drinks such at Root Beer and Ginger Beer are also produced by the company.
name: F.X. Matt Brewing Company

description:
Mission Statement: Factotum Brewhouse assists homebrewers in creating a highly-drinkable product by providing professional brewing equipment, guidance and education, and a beer-loving community defined by mutual support, unbiased opinion, and a philosophy that anybody can brew.

Who we are: We are a sibling-owned brewhouse in the Sunnyside neighborhood of Denver. Our German-American upbringing has instilled in us a passion for beer and our background as professional educators compels us to impart our brewing knowledge to the community.

The brewhouse: Factotum Brewhouse is a brewery for the people, by the people. The drinks you enjoy in our taproom were conceived and created by homebrewers and other beer lovers under the tutelage of our head brewer in an effort to guide and teach our customers in the art of making great beer. Drink a beer, make a beer—at Factotum Brewhouse, the choice is yours.
name: Factotum Brewhouse

description: The mission of the Fainting Goat Brewing Company is to consistently provide our customers with a variety of high quality, full flavored, drinkable, hand-crafted beers in a casual setting. We are driven to share our passion for brewing and to promote the craft beer industry with enthusiasts and novices alike.
name: Fainting Goat Brewing Company

description: Fair State Brewing Cooperative is Minnesota's first and only cooperatively-owned brewery, where you can truly drink like you own the place. We concentrate on brewing high quality hoppy, German, and sour beers that bring a unique collective perspective to Minnesota's craft beer world, creating beer of the people, for the people.
name: Fair State Brewing Cooperative

description: The Fairhope Brewing Company will serve the craft beer needs of Lower Alabama by operating a taproom in the brewery and selling our beer throughout Baldwin and Mobile counties.
name: Fairhope Brewing Company

description:
We're a small brewery providing hand-crafted beer in small batches. We sell our variety of beer in growlers from our brewery in Fairport, NY.

We're located in the business park at 1000 Turk Hill Road, right on the historic Erie Canal. After you enter the business park, drive past the buildings and park in the lot in the back. Walk back between the buildings, and look for Building 8 on the right. Use the “Classroom Entrance” and take the stairs or elevator on your left. You’ll find us on the second floor down the hall and to the right.
name: Fairport Brewing Company

description: A giraffe falls down a few escalators and an idea is hatched; let’s start a brewery!  Fall is a culmination of hungry humans starving for something they can commit to 110% and believe in…without having to answer to anyone.  “We wanted to create a place where we wanted to hang out, drink the beers we wanted to make, and not stuff anyone’s pockets that weren’t deserving of it.  So that’s what we did.” says company mascot and tasting room legend Eggmund. The rest as they say “is history” (in the making).
name: Fall Brewing Company

description: At Fall River Brewing Company, we create handcrafted ales and lagers. We brew our beer on a small 1/2 barrel system which allows us to put our personal touch into every pint. We hope you enjoy our beer as much as we enjoy brewing it for you. Cheers!
name: Fall River Brewing Company

description:
Fallbrook Brewing Company is a small craft brewery in the ‘Friendly Village’ of Fallbrook. FBC prides ourselves on brewing, serving and living the craft beer movement. Our nano brewery includes a tasting room to serve those who are looking for a delicious and local handcrafted beer. FBC caters to the craft beer enthusiast as well as the novice converts. Our small four barrel brewing system allows us to be creative and offer our customers an amazing array of staple beers and variety of specialty offerings.

FBC will strive to utilize local ingredients whenever possible and is looking forward to having a positive impact on our local community.

Cheers!
name: Fallbrook Brewing Company Inc

description: Producing small batches of high quality craft beer using the best ingredients we can find. We love hops and promise to use lots of them. We love the countryside and promise to be as environmentally friendly as possible. We also love brewing great beer for you guys to enjoy. If there's a beer you'd like us to brew, let us know.
name: Fallen Brewing Company

description: With an emphasis on the origin of the “Farmhouse Ale,” Falling Branch Brewery has formulated several beers hearkening back to rural Belgium, while incorporating ingredients and brewing techniques that are uniquely American. With a myriad of cheese and beer choices, everyone will find a pairing to love from Falling Branch Brewery.
name: Falling Branch Brewery

description:
Falling Down Beer Company (FDBC) is the newest craft brewery in the state of Michigan. Continuing the tradition of Michigan and Craft brewers before us, we will create unique hand crafted Ales and Lagers, that will challenge expectations and ideas of what great beer really is. With a focus on premium quality, handmade Ales and Lagers, FDBC will present a new unique product to the Detroit area.

Made in Michigan and the U.S.A.

One of the missions of FDBC is to create jobs and spur the economy in Michigan and the U.S. in general. At opening we plan to have 18 positions available with that number doubling year to year. Our long term goal is a bottling factory and additional restaurants that will employee hundreds of local workers.

Keeping with our philosophy of locally sourced goods and services, we will purchase from local companies whenever possible. On the food side this includes local fish markets, meat markets and bakeries; and on the brewery side designing beers that will be made using Michigan grown hops and malt. And it doesn’t stop there! We are actively negotiating and designing the brew house, promotional materials, general construction and website operations with Michigan companies.

Where it is not possible to source a product or service locally or in the State of Michigan, we will be looking first to keep our business in the Mid-West and then United States. We call this an inside-out sourcing philosophy. First source at the city level and slowly work out by county, state, region and country. We feel this benefits everyone in this endeavor where we support the community that is supporting us. A Win-Win for everyone!

It’s All About the Beer!

We are going to be creating quality; handcrafted beers that we believe will be some of the best beer you have ever tried. We are also going to push the envelope and make beers with unique and far-out ingredients that will invite you to be different and maybe live a little on the edge. We already have over 20 recipes waiting for people to try and enjoy.
name: Falling Down Beer Company

description: After nearly a decade of providing exceptional service and products for home brewers and winemakers, Valley Vintner & Brewer, 30 E 13th Ave, in downtown Eugene has changed it’s name to Falling Sky Brewing and expanded to bring Eugene a new Brew House, featuring handcrafted brews and locally sourced eats.
name: Falling Sky

description: Falls City Beer is back! An old Louisville favorite has returned with a whole new recipe. Falls City Original Pale Ale is now available at dozens of local bars and restaurants. The new brew is made in the style of Falls City Pale Ale from the 1930’s. Falls City began as a craft beer in 1905, made in small batches with only the finest ingredients. As we start again, 105 years later, we are once again a craft beer with a commitment to quality and taste.
name: Falls City Brewing Company

description: Fannin Brewing is a hometown brewery in a real place - beautiful Blue Ridge, GA. We combine our love for German beer, our experience making wine and our passion for the mountains to create world-class beer with a local focus. Local isn't just a word - we use local ingredients,name our beers for the beauty around us, and support our local community.
name: Fannin Brewing Company

description:
Fantasy Brewmasters develops real beers inspired by the magical worlds of dwarves, wizards, and dragons. Our talented and growing team of artists, writers, and brewers are truly passionate about the genre; we strive for excellence in every aspect of the process.

Our brews are brought to life through detailed stories, rich artwork, and authentic recipes. We often look to history and mythology for inspiration, and round it out with a modern touch and professional presentation.
name: Fantasy Brewmasters, LLC

description: Bend, Oregon's newest cidery, producing traditions styles using Pacific Northwest apples.
name: Far Afield Cider

description: (No longer brewing)
name: Far West Ireland Brewing

description:
Fargo Brewing Company is a microbrewery starting up in Fargo, North Dakota. The four founders are Fargo natives who care about bringing hand crafted, artisan beer to the heartland.

Opening in 2011, the brewery will be devoted to crafting a premium product from bushel to bottle.

Join Fargo Brewing Company at their local events for free beer tastings and more information.
name: Fargo Brewing Company

description:
FarmHouse Brewery wil be located in Newark Valley, NY, where we will operate as a Farm Brewery, growing and processing our own hops and grains grown here in Tioga County, NY. Come tour our on-site malthouse and learn how local handcrafted beer is engineered from ground to glass.

A NYS "Farm Brewery" with a Tap Room location in Owego, NY and a malthouse/brewery location in Newark Valley, NY. In our Tap Room we offer craft ales, hard cider, old-fashioned sodas and revolving taps for other NYS "Farm Brewery" libations.
name: FarmHouse Brewery

description:
Farmington Brewing Company is the brainchild of two innovated scientists.   Jason Hendricks and Jason Schlaff met in the fall of  2009.  They didn’t know then that their friendship would bloom, but when it did, a brewery would be the flower.

The Jasons started humbly with a five gallon pot, a homebrew starter kit, and an idea of what good should be.  The first brew was just ok, an American Ale extract kit that did not allow for any artistry.  They quickly realized they needed to switch things up in order to attain the flavors they wanted.  So, the two amateurs ventured into the world of all-grain brewing.  The first mash tun, a cooler, the first brew, a porter.  Jason and Jason had their first failure.  

Poor taste and terrible color ruined their tongues but not their spirit.  They could do much much better.   Schlaff, an avid reader and researcher, dove head first into every book he could find.  Hendricks scoured the internet and talked to every expert he could find.  Armed with brains full of knowledge the two gents embarked on the brewing adventure again.  

The second beer, a blonde ale, crafted with the newfound comprehension they acquired.  After a two weeks of eager anticipation, success!  The Jasons now had the knowledge, the drive, and the skill.  Each ale after that was instant hit among their friends and family.  Gary Schlaff, Jason’s distinguished father, joined the endeavor in 2013.  Gary, a marketing genius, is nearing retirement and has decided to throw his business knowledge into the mix.

The brewery itself will not serve or prepare food.  Patrons will be allowed to bring in outside food, as well as have food delivered to them at the brewery.

We strive to be as sustainable and as local as possible.  The brewhouse and fermenters will be purchased for Psycho Brew LLC of Greenville, MI.  Our hops will be purchased from the many growers in Michigan.  Our spent grain will be sold to local farmers instead of going to waste in a landfill.  As a side project, we will also used the spent grain to made organic dog treats.
name: Farmington Brewing Company

description: Farnam House Brewing Company is an exciting new brewpub located in Midtown Omaha at 3562 Farnam St. Farnam House specializes in farmhouse ales and barrel aged beers and offers a diverse food menu made with locally-sourced ingredients and beer-infused creations.
name: Farnam House Brewing Company

description: Farnham Ale & Lager is a microbrewery in Farnham,  Québec with four primary beers identified by their bitterness level.
name: Farnham Ale & Lager

description:
Farnum Hill Ciders fulfill the true meaning of the word “cider” -- alcoholic beverages fermented from apples, exactly as wines are fermented from grapes. But not just any apples: in our orchards grow more inedible tannic weird genuine cider apple varieties than anywhere else in the States. Many originated in the gentler climates of France or England. In our tough conditions, these varieties produce intense, concentrated flavors and aromas not typical in their home regions.
Our own ciders, at 6.5-7.5% alcohol, tend toward the dry, sharp, fruity and bountifully aromatic. We intend them to gladden the moment and to freshen the flavors of companionable foods. We are proud of Farnum Hill Ciders, and we are authoritatively told that, for now at least, they are the best-made ciders in America.
Let's hope many more Eastern apple-growers will learn the craft and horticulture of cidermaking, and that distinctive American orchard-based ciders, now too rare, will return to their pre-Prohibition glory and variety. Johnny Appleseed planted the frontier for cider, after all -- “Mom and apple pie” came later, blotting out certain enjoyable truths from the national memory. But now cider -- real cider -- is back.
name: Farnum Hill Ciders

description:
Fat Bottom’s full-flavored brews are bigger and more exciting than other beers in town. Our signature brews represent a sophisticated array of styles perfected over many years, with a few unique twists. Ben has refined each recipe and sourced the highest quality ingredients for every batch of specially crafted Fat Bottom beer.

Our beer is unfiltered, so you can savor the unique cloudy appearance and subtle flavors that truly bring craft beer to life. We like the bolder hops flavors, distinct body of aromas, and the beautiful color compounds that come from the natural grains. Unfiltered beers also have more nutrients from yeast and barley malt, including B vitamins which have been shown to reduce the effects of hangovers… a little added benefit for those of us who seriously love beer.
name: Fat Bottom Brewing

description: Fat Head's was founded in 1992 as a premiere craft beer tap house and restaurant in Pittsburgh, PA. In 2009 we expanded to Ohio and teamed up with our award-winning Head Brewmaster. With the explosion in popularity came the necessity to open a full-scale production brewery in 2012. Fat Head's Brewery produces original ales and lagers for distribution throughout Ohio and Western Pennsylvania.
name: Fat Head's Brewery

description: Up and coming brewery in the Charleston area. Currently sharing space with Tradesman Brewing, looking for own space.
name: Fat Pig Brewing Company

description: Fat Point Brewing is Southwest Florida's craft brewery, producing fresh, local, hand-crafted beers. You can find Fat Point beers, like our Big Boca Ale and our Ryeght Angle IPA, at Southwest Florida's best bars and restaurants.
name: Fat Point Brewing

description: We do things a bit differently at Fate. Our beers are brewed in small batches, which means you'll find steadily rotating traditional favorites, experimentals, seasonals and cask conditioned ales on tap exclusively at the brewpub. At Fate you'll be offered a nifty opportunity to develop and expand your taste profile with our ever changing distinctive beers and wood-fired pizzas. Join us for a pint and a pie at Scottsdale's very own micro brewpub and put Fate in your hands!
name: Fate Brewing Company

description: FATE Brewing Company is Boulder’s first brew-bistro and your new place to enjoy chef-inspired, gourmet creations with unique, handcrafted microbrews. Local ingredients are featured on the lunch, brunch, and dinner menus and the full bar with 30 taps feature house drafts and rotating guest beer. Stop by for a pint and a bite at 1600 38th Street and Arapahoe Road (one block west of Foothills Parkway) in Boulder, Colorado.
name: FATE Brewing Company

description:
Heavenly. Devilish Est.2013.... 
Here at Father John's we are more than just a restaurant and microbrewery. Visit us at our home in the restored and remodeled 1895 historic Methodist church located just off the the town square in beautiful Bryan, OH.  

We are committed to the highest standards of quality and sustainability in everything we  put on the plate as well as what we put in our brew kettles. 

With just over eight acres of growing space and working with Wild Winds Bison preserve, our commitment to this ideal is continued. We use only Non-GMO seeds, grow chemical free, and raise cruelty free, grass fed bison. All of this in order to produce food that tastes the way nature intended. So, when you and your loved ones sample our honest, handcrafted fare and selection of artisan microbrewed beers you will taste the difference... honest to goodness!

From artfully prepared tapas to delightful share plates, sumptuous sandwiches to mouthwatering favorites such as our slow smoked 12" bison rib, Father John's is the premier destination for satisfying your cravings. 

Make and bottle your favorite brew, spend a day with us and feel the special harmony of our blend of old and new.
name: Father John's Brewery

description: Fathom & League Hop Yard Brewery is dedicated to the first brewers in the Pacific Northwest.  On May 5, 1792, the intrepid crew of the HMS Discovery rowed ashore about 5 miles from our brewery.  They brewed a spruce tip beer and enjoyed a day off from their exploration of the Strait of Juan de Fuca and Salish Sea.  We are proud to carry on the tradition of brewing beer in this remarkable corner of the world. Cheers!
name: Fathom & League Hop Yard Brewery

description: (No longer brewing)
name: Faultline Brewing #2

description: FBC opened its doors in December of 1994 and has been supplying the Silicon Valley with spectacular hand-crafted beers and delicious cuisine ever since.
name: Faultline Brewing Company

description: The Faust Brewing Company features an array of house brews, including Faust Golden Ale, Altered States German Altbier and Mike Crowe IPA and Walter's Ghostly Pale Ale, as well as a variety of seasonal favorites. Leading the production is Ray Mitteldorf, a professional brew master with 17 years experience. For a complete experience, the pub features a tapas-style menu, created by Chef Chris Kilisz....See More
name: Faust Brewing Company

description:
Faustino Microcervejeira is a production and trading company of Craft Beer. It produces several beers under various brand names that come to you with the utmost care and quality that we can.

As we only use particular beer ingredients, barley, hops, yeast and water, we obtain an end product which distinguishes itself from the soda flavor, the aroma, the gas and until the foam.

We also do not filter out our beer as it removes the same properties and with sterilization eliminates any living yeast. Did you know that in ancient times beer was the safest way to drink water? This is because beers have a long duration without spoiling due to microorganisms responsible for fermentation yeasts. These can overlap with agents that invade their surroundings, beer, killing them. Due to the lower alcohol content does not lead to dehydration as much as other alcoholic beverages. Thus one Brew is valid for drinking from about 1 year. The most interesting is that adequately conditioned beers, depending on the style, last up to five or even more years in the most extreme cases. Our all beers last more than 1 year but because the properties change with time, to better almost always guarantee only that period to enjoy what described on the label.

How do fermentation in the bottle always guarantee that the beer will live yeast to the consumer, which on the one hand clears the beer and the other creates gas in it. Because of this fermentation in the bottle our beers have always deposit. These beers should have deposit, because besides any indication of handmade process demonstrates that there has been fermentation in the bottle.
name: Faustino - Microcervejeira, Lda.

description:
In December 2010, Mooretown Rancheria unveiled this elegant addition to the area’s original gaming facility.  The décor features rich woods, plush fabrics and copper accents throughout the airy dining room.   

Visitors are taken with the view of gleaming brew tanks behind the bar, and the frequent sight of Brewmaster Roland Allen measuring ingredients and testing batches.  With seven craft beers and a rotating menu of seasonals, beer connoisseurs can always find a new taste on tap.

The 350-seat full service restaurant’s $1 million kitchen includes the only fresh sushi bar in the area.  Hand-crafted pizza with beer-infused crust is also available.  Diners enjoy an outdoor seating area with a custom shade lattice.  Food service extends to the balcony level, which boasts large leather chairs and a private bar.  Three luxury VIP suites are available to rent for group functions or private parties.

Entertainment is a major focus of the brewery, as well.   With a host of video poker machines and big-screen TVs, guests find plenty of activity to accompany the excellent food and drinks.  The dining room turns into a showroom at night, complete with live music on an elevated stage.  The state-of-the-art sound and light system enhance the concert experience.

Feather Falls Casino Brewing Company serves food and beverages 7 days a week, so make a point to visit the next time you’re in Northern California!
name: Feather Falls Casino Brewing Co

description:
Brewed and bottled in the rugged foothills of the Sierra Nevada Mountains of Northern California by Masterbrewer Roger Preecs.

We use our own brewing style which produces a smooth, clean, less-bitter beer than the English Style ales produced by most California micro-breweries. We feel our beer, made with fresh ingredients and mountain waters, appeals to more consumers who enjoy this surprisingly smooth, yet rich, full bodied ale.
name: Feather River Brewing Co

description: Serving the finest ales in pints at the tasting room, as well as in growlers and grumblers to go.
name: Federal Brewing

description:
Often referred to as the most picturesque pub on the waterfront, Federal Jack's Restaurant and Brew Pub is well-known for its spectacular views, creative pub fare, and award-winning hand-crafted ales. 

Jack's, as it's known by the locals, offers a brew with a view overlooking the Kennebunk River. This award-winning restaurant and brewery was built on the site where, in their heyday, Kennebunk's historic 19th century shipyards built schooners known throughout the world for their grace and speed. Federal Jack's was named for one of the most famous ships built on this site in 1908 - the Federal Jack.
name: Federal Jack's

description:
At one of the most difficult times in the history of the City of Bethlehem, the Fegley family entered the brewing and restaurant business. The Bethlehem Steel plant had been shutting down slowly for years – a dying industrial giant of a bygone day – and the region was suffering the loss hard. The downtown had also been bled by the malls and box stores that promised savings to the consumer in exchange for genuine local culture and community. Yet on April 15th, 1998, the same day the the historic Hotel Bethlehem declared bankruptcy and closed, the Bethlehem Brew Works optimistically opened its doors to the public at the corner of Main and Broad Streets. The one other restaurant in the neighborhood closed the following week.

Bethlehem Brew Works chose to ignore the public exodus, and instead celebrated the history of ‘Steel’ and paid tribute to the region’s working class culture in it’s decor and menu. The Fegley’s believed a transformation was already well underway, and would grow with the city as it came to life. Over the course of a dozen years, the family became more involved in the community, and worked with the downtown shop owners to strengthen the downtown. One by one, new restaurants began open, and stores began to keep longer hours to accommodate the growing crowds. Historic Bethlehem now is home to a burgeoning restaurant row and retail shops of all kinds.
2002

Most importantly, the restaurant and brewery grew as well. The Steelgaarden lounge was added, and quickly became a Valley hotspot, and a few years later, the lounge exanded again, annexing another two shop spaces for more nightlife and event space. The kitchen also tripled in size with new space, and the brewery added additional tanks to keep up with the demand for the brews.
2005

With an eye still on things to come, the family looked west into Allentown. Opportunity was difficult to see in a city who’s retail heyday had ended some years before with the departure of Hess’s department store. But the optimistic Fegleys became smitten with the history of the “Queen city” – from it’s role in the War of Independence, to the great silk industry that supplied the world’s fashions, and the great retail era the followed. “The All-American City” as it was known, seemed to be frosted over – and the Fegleys believed it was about to thaw.
2007

In June 2007, years in the making, the Allentown Brew Works opened on Hamilton Street, housed inside the historic Harold’s Furniture Building. Proud to be part of another resurging downtown, the 400 seat restaurant is a testament to the vibrant heartbeat that thrives in the city. Offering two and a half levels of dining, plus state-of-the-art banquet facilities in The Hamilton Room, and multiple bars offering different atmospheres, as well as an outdoor casual patio, Der Biergarten and a new seductive lower level lounge, Silk. The 15-barrel brewery in the Allentown location boasts seven fermentation tanks and eight serving tanks – built with capacity to add a bottling line and begin outside sales of Fegley’s Brew Works in earnest.
2008

In 2008, the Philadelphia Phillies AAA team, the Iron Pigs, opened the new Coca-Cola Park stadium, and added Fegley’s Brew Works to its lineup. With that account in place, and a new sales team behind the brewery sales, Fegley’s Brew Works can now be found at almost 200 locations in the region from Harrisburg to central New Jersey, north to Scranton, and south to Philadelphia where it is very popular.
2010

One of the nation’s leading beer writers and co-founder of Philly Beer Week, Don Russell (aka Joe Sixpack), named Hop’Solutely the Beer of the Year.

Becoming supportive and active in the Allentown community, during their first few years the Brew Works saw eateries come and go. In 2010, the tide seemed to change with major restaurants adding to the draw of the city. For some time, the Fegleys had been constantly thinking up good ideas that they would love to see happen in the neighborhood, when it finally struck them that they should just do it themselves. In an effort to continue to move the Fegley brand toward healthy, sustainable “green” practices, they chose concepts that would fit that ideal.
2011 to Present

In 2011, Fegley’s brewery continues to be recognized as their Arctic Alchemy wins it’s first bronze medal at the Great American Beer Festival and Blueberry Belch wins “Best Summer Beer” at the Philadelphia Summer Ale Festival at the Philadelphia Zoo . Arctic Alchemy goes on to win a gold medal at GABF in 2014 and the pubs continue to win Reader’s Choice Awards and Best of the Valley Awards. View our complete awards list.

With the addition of a bottling line, and the growing success of outside accounts the brewery is closing in on it’s capacity, and soon Fegley’s will begin to nose their way to new opportunities. Perhaps there’s another fragrant wallflower ready to dance.
name: Fegley's Brew Works

description: The Fenton Winery & Brewery is located on a beautiful, 5 acre property in Fenton Township. At over 1 acre, the beer garden is one (if not the) largest in the state. The taproom is located right alongside the brewery and is around the corner from the winery - all in full view of patrons. FWB specializes in crafting balanced wines and beers that maximize flavor and originality. Food is available - from tasty specialty meat & cheese plates, to delicious sandwiches and specialty pizzas. Definitely worth a stop (or three). Cheers!
name: Fenton Winery & Brewery

description: Located in Hungary, at Móricz Zsigmond street. 21, Zsombo. They produce two types of beer. The owner is Fenyves Sörház Ltd.
name: Fenyves Sörház

description:
The Feral Brewing Company is a proudly family owned and operated hand-crafted microbrewery situated in the heart of Perth’s premier food and wine tourism precinct – the Swan Valley, just 20km from the Perth CBD.

Current titleholders of the Australian International Beer Awards Best Medium Australian Brewery, we handcraft a world class range of awarded beers expanding from the usual to the deliciously unusual.
name: Feral Brewing Company

description:
Belgian farm brewery, one of, if not the first in Canada. The owner, Patrice Schoune, is from a long line of Belgian farmers and second generation established in Canada. 

Their beer recipes naturally use in their vast majority products directly issued from his farm (barley, wheat, oat and hop).Patrice reestablished the ancient technique of floormatting to create his malt out of his own barely production. In 2002, he reintroduced the Fuggle hop which had disappeared since the 40’s in Canada and is now integrated in his recipes. These elements are part of the uniqueness of the Farm Brewery Schoune.

Today still very attached to the flavours and tastes excellence and the love of the product from its conception up to its production and finally distribution of his artisanal beers, the 300 hectares Farm Brewery Schoune is a regional as well world reference for the quality and originality of its products. 

Farm Brewery Schoune exports under the name of O’Canada.
name: Ferme brasserie Schoune

description: FERMÆNTRA is a 7bbl brewery that produces bold, artful, inspired craft beer. We are located in the University area at 1715 East Evans Avenue, in Denver, Colorado. Our brews are rooted in traditional style, yet amplified to embody the evolution of American craft beer.
name: FERMÆNTRA

description:
Although one of the smaller micro-breweries, we’re about as passionate and thirsty for making great beer as you can get.

Located just off Hwy 3 east of Fernie BC, our Brewery features a Tap Room and Store, alongside our ever-expanding on-site production facility. It is also home to Fernie’s finest beer aficionados and creative beer-fuelled minds.

But we don’t want to give the game away. Jesse, our bowtie wearing infamous tour guide is waiting to fill you in on the rest. At present, our Brewery Store is currently open 7 Days a Week 10AM-6PM, to stop by, try and say hi. Tours are generally Friday at 3PM, but if you’re a larger group, we can set up a Private Tour on request. Reserve your spot below.

And if you’re sadly unable to join us for a tour, then we’ll share a little piece of the FBC family magic with you. Check out this promo video for some good beer and cheer.
name: Fernie Brewing Co

description: Downtown Whitehall, Michigan's premier craft brewery!
name: Fetch Brewing

description: Ryan and Christa Kilpatrick plan to combine their love of good books and good beer at Fiction Beer Company, which they'll open on the first floor of the Phoenix on the Fax apartment building in east Denver, a part of town that is desperately lacking in craft breweries.  Fiction will include a seven-barrel brewing system, six beers on tap and a patio out back.  The beer styles will be categorized into genres based on the couple's favorite works of fiction, including classics, like an IPA; mystery and adventure; and fantasy/sci-fi.  Opening July, 2014
name: Fiction Beer Company

description:
Fiddlehead Brewing Company is located on Route 7 in beautiful Shelburne, Vermont. Our mission is to produce high quality beer, use as many local ingredients as we can, and create recipes with the true beer connoisseur in mind.

We use a 15 barrel brewery and will distribute in the regional market.
name: Fiddlehead Brewing Company

description: Fieldhouse Brewing company is located in downtown Colorado Springs. We offer a variety of delicious beers, including a gluten-free lineup. We also offer free wifi, and food from local food trucks on a regular basis.
name: Fieldhouse Brewing Company

description: Brewpub with a variety of seasonal house beer blends, plus savory pies, in an industrial setting.
name: Fieldwork Brewing Co.

description: The 5th Quadrant is the latest addition to the Lompoc Family. The most northerly of all of the Lompocs, the 5th Quadrant (or 5Q as it is commonly known) is also surprisingly the warmest of all the Lompocs, a benefit not lost on the bald-headed patrons who frequent the establishment.
name: Fifth Quadrant

description:
Thank you for your interest in Fifty West Brewing Company. Here is a little rundown about what Fifty West is all about:

All the beers brewed at Fifty West Brewing Company have been hand made in small batches with a focus on craftsmanship, tradition, innovation, and patience.

There are several reasons why we selected the name ‘Fifty West’; the most obvious being the fact that our brewery is located on Route 50, which extends from Coast to Coast- it spans more than 3,000 miles starting in Maryland and stretching all the way to California. 

The brewery is located in a building that has a vast and varied transient history (http://www.cincinnati.com/dining/heritage/history.html); from the settlers heading west through the Ohio River valley, to the days of Prohibition when our building was a favorite of George Remus and the bootleggers running whiskey from Cincinnati to Chicago, to where we are today—amidst a renaissance of the craft beer movement.

To us, it’s not about the destination, but instead making sure we are enjoying the journey, appreciating the moment, and brewing beers that are enjoyed by anyone who is willing to let us become a part of their journey.
name: Fifty West Brewing Company

description: Founded by Andy and Alicia Barr, FiftyFifty is located in Truckee at 11197 Brockway Road, between Hwy 267 and downtown Truckee. Open seven days a week from 11:30 a.m. to 2 a.m., FiftyFifty serves both lunch and dinner to complement their variety of beers brewed on the premise. FiftyFifty also features a full bar, seasonal outdoor seating on the patio and live music and entertainment.
name: FiftyFifty Brewing Company

description: Figueroa Mountain Brewing Co. was founded by father and son team, Jim and Jaime Dietenhofer, in 2010.  With a passion for craft beer, they set out to pay homage to the beautiful Santa Ynez Valley with handcrafted beer and hand-drawn artwork depicting the local landscape on their labels.  There are currently five taprooms along California’s Central Coast and one taproom set to open in Westlake Village late summer 2015.  Figueroa Mountain Brewing Co. beer can be found in their taprooms or at select retailers and restaurants throughout California.  Learn more about @FigMtnBrew or where to find their beer at www.FigMtnBrew.com.
name: Figueroa Mountain Brewing

description:
Figure Eight Brewing is a small craft brewery located just an hour southeast of Chicago in Valparaiso, Indiana. We believe in making great beer and enjoying life to its fullest.

Our mission is to make great beer and share it. Utilizing the best ingredients while synthesizing classic and innovative brewing styles and techniques, riding on the edge of where beer has gone and where beer is going.
name: Figure Eight Brewing

description: “I HAVE AN IDEA!”  That is how it all started.  Two years ago at our annual Brews on the Beach Beer Festival, Hooper’s was approached by a local gentleman named Vince Wright.  He had recently won first place with his “garage brewed” Pumpkin Ale at the infamous Pumpkin Chunkin.  With the growing trend and demand for hand crafted beers, and the fact nothing tastes better to wash down great crabs and old bay, we not only jumped, but dove head first into the world of craft brewing.  We created the brewing equipment, devised a system and here we are today.  With the help and guidance of a few experts along the way Hooper’s brings to you Fin City Brewing, Ocean City’s Oldest Brewery.
name: Fin City Brewing Co.

description: Creatively micro-brewed beer pairs with delicious, simple food in a relaxed environment.
name: Final Gravity Brewing Co.

description: Our goal is to make great beer following our passion for richness and complexity from quality ingredients and small batch artisanal brewing. We focus on pushing American styles and brewing flavorful, unique beers to drink. We like it hoppy and complex to roasty and smokey, strong and sippable to session and gulpable. Most importantly we like it happy and enjoyable. Something to drink with friends, in the backyard, at the beach and at the bar. We make beer because we like to drink and we like to smile.
name: Finback Brewery

description: Finch's Beer Co. is in the business of brewing great, craft beers locally in Chicago, Illinois. We use the best ingredients and take special care to make sure every batch is the best we can brew. While following in the footsteps of other local brewing companies, we intend on adding another brand of beer to Chicago's already growing selection and contributing to a new generation of microbreweries, taking a foothold in Chicago.
name: Finch's Beer Company

description: We are a Nano Brewery in Findlay Ohio, and feature a variety of rotating beers. There are several locations you can find on tap us in the Findlay community to enjoy our beer, and you can also come to our taproom. We will be open every Friday from 5 pm to 10 pm. Our taproom is where you will be able to try several different beers that you won’t find anywhere else. So stop on by and let us know what you think!
name: Findlay Brewing Company

description:
Finger Lakes Beer Company was established in the fall of 2009 by Partners, Wayne Peworchik & Mark Goodwin. Both Wayne and Mark were avid homebrewers for many years. Mark continued on with his brewing education by completing the Web-based Concise Course in Brewing Technology at the Siebel Institute of Technology World Brewing Acadamy from which he obtained his Certificate.   We selected our location nestled in the heart of the beautiful Finger Lakes Region of upstate New York for its close proximity to Keuka Lake and the availability for lake water for brewing. Our building offered a spacious workable layout, ample parking and room for future expansion. We began our building renovations and equipment installation in early 2010,  received our license in the fall of 2010, and on November 11th, 2010 opened our doors for tours, tastings, and growler fills. 

Our Brew Room features a matched Ripley 7 Barrel Stainless Steel Brewing system. The Brew House includes a Boil Kettle, Mash Tun and Hot Liquor Tank. The Brew Room also features 3 double wall digital temperature controlled fermentation tanks, grain mill, filter, and other assorted brewing equipment. Adjacent to the brew room is a walk-in cooler containing 8 - 7 Barrel Stainless Steel Serving Tanks and assorted keg filling and dispensing equipment. 

The entrance way and tasting room offer large windows for great views of the Brew Room  as well as a large comfortable area for you and your friends to relax and visit while enjoying your favorite brews offered fresh daily. We offer tastings and growler fills of fine crafted ales and root beer all brewed on premises as well as guided tours on non-brewing days. Have your own growlers, we fill your clean growlers. Don't own one yet, no worries we have 1 and 2 liter in several styles with our logo on them.
name: Finger Lakes Beer Company

description: Brewing high quality craft beer in Boulder, CO. Check back for info on our opening date. You can also follow us on Instagram, @finkelandgarf.
name: Finkel & Garf Brewing Co.

description:
MAKING THE WORLD A BETTER PLACE ONE PINT AT A TIME.
In the same spirit that buys a pint for a lad down on his luck, we believe in helping those in need. That's why we donate every single penny of our profits to the Finnegans Community Fund. What better reason to raise a pint or two? Or twelve

Finnegans is available in more than 500 restaurants and bars and 570 liquor stores throughout Minnesota, North Dakota, South Dakota and Wisconsin. If your favorite place doesn't carry Finnegans, ask them to order it. 

Finnegans and the Finnegans Community Fund does not accept any government or foundation grants of any kind – we are out there doing it for ourselves and so we invite you to join us! Do you have ideas that can help us do more? Bring it on – we would love to hear from you!
name: Finnegans

description: The Finnriver crew farms and ferments on an 80 acre family farm and orchard in Chimacum, along a restored salmon stream on the north Olympic Peninsula of Washington.  While our farm is remote, we're honored to be on the forefront of the Pacific Northwest hard cider revival and we are committed to producing both traditional and innovative hard ciders using premium, organic ingredients while maintaining an authentically farmcrafted and land-based operation.  We source organic apples from across Washington state and grow our own organic orchard of over 3000 trees, with 20 varieties of heirloom and traditional cider apple varieties.  We aspire to serve the land with cider,  by caring for our soils, watershed and community while crafting award-winning premium ciders. Our ciders are a tribute to old hard cider traditions but also offer an approachable, fresh perspective on the possibilities of the fermented apple.
name: Finnriver Farm & Cidery

description: Fire Island Beer Company has emerged from the handiwork of two brothers and a cousin who developed their taste for craft beer and home brewing during the summers they spent on Fire Island, the naturally beautiful barrier island just off Long Island's south shore. The relaxed island has attracted families, artists, partiers, weekend beach-goers and outdoor sports lovers for generations, yet it refuses to allow cars, pretention and the frantic pace common to NY-metro area culture. This led us to coin it “The Other New York”, a concept we find very refreshing.
name: Fire Island Beer Company

description:
In the fabled summer of 2003, Jordan Busch and Sara Sawicki told their friends and families they were going to open a wing joint together. Sara had just finished her fifth season of guiding whitewater rafting trips and Jordan had recently passed the Colorado Bar exam. People scoffed. However, for Sara and Jordan the next logical step was to open up a cool wing joint where people could drink cold beer, eat spicy wings, listen to some good music and kick it with their homies. They wanted to open their wing joint in a town that needed great wings and that suited their outdoorsy lifestyles.
After some research it became clear that Portland was the ideal place. After moving to Oregon in the fall of 2003, Sara and Jordan scoped out the town, worked hard in local restaurants, and developed their menu for their new restaurant. Neither of them had ever managed a restaurant, let alone owned one. They attended small business meetings, talked to accountants, restaurant owners and local wing connoisseurs. People asked them if Portland was ready for a wing joint. Others suggested they should have stuck with their previous occupations. The naysayers fueled Sara and Jordan's passion for opening their restaurant even more.
On the first day of 2005, the first customers walked through the doors of Fire on the Mountain Buffalo Wings. In the early days, there were just a couple cooks and Sara and Jordan were the only front of house staff. Fast forward to 2011 where Fire on the Mountain Buffalo Wings has become a Portland institution with three restaurants and close to 100 employees. FOTM still possesses the same passion to provide customers with a fun, easygoing restaurant to enjoy our delicious food and great service.
name: Fire on the Mountain

description: At Firefly Brewing, our mission is to express our collective pursuit of happiness through our shared passion for beer. We are a conglomerate of creative minds who believe we can make the world a better place by providing an atmosphere and a product conducive to creative expression. It is our sincerest hope that the beer we create helps you further your own creative journey and propels you down your own road to happiness. Our slogan, “Get Lit” is a testament to spreading our inspiration, because it takes more than one firefly to enlighten the world.
name: Firefly Hollow Brewing

description: Founded in 1996 by Adam Firestone (aka the Bear) & David Walker (aka the Lion), Firestone Walker Brewing Company began as a small brewery with roots in wine country on California’s Central Coast. Now a regional brewery, our singular purpose remains – to craft ever better beer.  Passionately in pursuit of the perfect beer…and never satisfied.
name: Firestone Walker Brewing Company

description: Firetrucker beers are loaded with flavor and maintain a clean finish. Our Steam, Ginger and IPAs stand out, but the house line up of dark beers goes over the top. Many of our porters and stouts have a smoky companion, compliments of our in-house smoked and milled grains. Each month, our seasonal beers push the boundaries while complimenting the time of year. Craft beer is art! Enjoy!
name: Firetrucker Brewery

description: FireWheel Brewing Co. (FWBC) is run by locals, born and raised in the North Dallas area. We brewed our inaugural homebrew in January of 2010. Originally starting as away to have great tasting beer to share with family and friends, the demand quickly outstripped the supply. We expanded our equipment to over double, then triple, and continued to keep all the fermenters full and active.
name: FireWheel Brewery Co.

description: In March 2012, four friends came together with the concept of opening a brewery in our hometown of Gainesville. We all had great jobs and young kids, so the idea of changing our lives and opening a brewery was truly a leap of faith. As we discussed our reasons for going into the beer business, we realized that each of us offers different perspective and unique experience but that we all want the same thing: make excellent beer, have a great space for people to come and enjoy a pint, be an exceptional place to work, and be a big part of our local community. These ideas are what we bring to the table (and taps) at First Magnitude. This is the reason why we’re here – we hope you’ll join us in our vision and passion for great beer and great community.
name: First Magnitude Brewing Company

description: From our home in beautiful Olympia, Washington, Fish Brewing Company has been hand-crafting ales of Northwest proportions since 1993. Then, using a system cobbled from brewing and dairy equipment, we brewed for our neighbors up and down Puget Sound. Growing steadily since, Fish is now an award-winning craft brewer with distribution throughout the Pacific Northwest and beyond.
name: Fish Brewing Company

description:
Fitger's Brewhouse is located in the ancient Fitger's Brewery, in Duluth. We serve our own award winning hand-crafted ales and lagers brewed on premise by Fitger's Brewhouse Master Brewers. North Shore style ales and lagers, brewed with fresh Lake Superior water.

Fitger’s Brewhouse opened in 1995, after its founders took a western-states ski trip and came back inspired by that region’s brewing scene. Combining the relaxed ambience of a high-mountain brewery with uncompromising dedication to quality, Fitger’s Brewhouse established a tradition of handcrafted beer, fantastic food and excellent entertainment on Lake Superior’s North Shore.

In 2012 Fitger's Brewhouse won a bronze at the Great American Beer Festival for their Fitger’s Framboise. In 2013 they have received multiple honors including “Best Reason to Save the Growler” by the Minneapolis Star Tribune, “Best of the Lake” by Lake Superior Magazine, and “Best Brew” by Duluth Superior Magazine.

This year Fitger's Brewhouse will produce more than 80 styles and nearly 3000 barrels of handcrafted beer. Our stage hosts eclectic local and touring entertainers six nights a week.
name: Fitger's Brewhouse

description:
Flagstaff Brewing Company was opened in July, 1994 with the mission to provide craft-brewed beer to a thirsty mountain town, and to break the mold that has typified the atmosphere, structure and goal of brewpubs for all too long.

Beer lovers, dancing deadheads, and outdoor enthusiasts congregate to share their latest adventures while enjoying the brewery's latest creation. So sit back, pull up a pint, and take pleasure in the casual pub atmosphere of FBC.
name: Flagstaff Brewing

description: From great seasonal beers like an imperial stout, pumkin ale, or maibock to all-year ales, lagers, and stouts, this micro-brewery has it all!
name: Flat Branch Pub & Brewing

description: After years of careful planning  and mortgaging everything  the Flat Earth Brewing Company was brought to life in 2007 by head brewer Jeff Williamson and his wife Cathie. In search of a calmer life and an even better beer, Jeff turned his passion for brewing into a career. After a temporary stint at Northern Brewer and a job as an assistant brewer at Minneapolis Town Hall Brewery, Flat Earth opened in Saint Paul and set out to create beers not normally found in the upper Midwest. Flat Earth's distinctive brews are often inspired by the couple's travels and time spent in conversation with family and friends. The company's brewing on the edge philosophy is reflected in its stylish interpretation of traditional brewing assumptions. Today, Flat Earth Brewing produces a variety of artisan ales and lagers every month. As the beers roll out of the brewery, you're sure to see a theme develop around their names  a hint of conspiracy, perhaps. The names are meant to get people thinking and talking. Whether you enjoy Flat Earth beers at home or out with friends, there are no secrets when it comes to good beer.
name: Flat Earth Brewing Company

description:
We are very proud of what the Flat Rock Brew Cafe stands for, and with our dedicated and friendly staff, look forward to seeing all our friends, locals and appreciators of beer, wine and cider!
 
Beer is certainly our focus and our aim is for customers to walk out of the cafe more enlightened about this great beverage, than when they came in.  The Flat Rock Brew Cafe is home to a working 'nano-brewery' and a member of the Craft Beer Industry Association. The brewhouse itself consists of a Braumeister system, one very familiar to home brewers. German made, it provides efficiency in the brewing process and was selected for its compact design. For those who want to really explore the world of beer, we offer unique beer tasting events and brewery tours.
 
Something that is important to us is supporting the local community and since opening, we have been involved in many fund raising events for a number of local schools and businesses. We have also become the venue of choice for community meetings from sporting clubs to pre-schools.
 
Our great range of wines and ciders are mostly Australian as we aim to support local producers.
 
Our food is highly regarded and compliments our range of beverages. From share plates to weekly curry specials, there's always something for everyone including vegetarian and gluten-free options.
 
We truly appreciate the support you have all given us since opening and we look forward to seeing you here at Flat Rock Brew Cafe in the near future.
name: Flat Rock Brew Cafe

description: Started in 2010 in Corvallis, OR, home of the Oregon State Beavers, Flat Tail Brewing started with a small 6 barrel system. 4 years later Brewer/Owner Dave Marliave is creating some of the best beers in Oregon.  From his flagship Tailgater Kölsch, an authentic German Style Ale, to his creative and eclectic barrel aged brews, this 25 year old wiz kid is taking Oregon by storm.  In Aug 2013, Flat Tail installed a brand new 15 barrel system and will be available all over Oregon and many more locations very soon.  Try some Dam Good Beer today!
name: Flat Tail Brewing Co

description: Flat Top Brewing Company is one of the highest breweries on the east coast in Banner Elk, NC at over 3000 ft. above sea level. Specializing in fine craft beer. Our beer is refreshingly elevated.
name: Flat Top Brewing Company

description:
Flat12 Bierwerks is a production craft brewery based in downtown Indianapolis, USA. Flat12 brews beers for quality, consistency and tradition - with a twist. Our classic line-up includes the Upside Down Blonde, Half Cycle IPA, Pogue's Run Porter and Flat12 Amber Ale. Specialties and seasonals will feature herbs, spices and other experimentations, always geared toward flavor, taste and well-orchestrated subtlety. 

Inspiration: The Flathead 12-cylinder engine - a nod to the automotive and craft brewing heritage of our neighborhood and the early 1900s era when both thrived.
name: Flat12 Bierwerks

description: Flathead Lake Brewing Co. was established in 2004 on the east shore of Flathead Lake in Woods Bay, Montana and is home to handcrafted award winning beers, excellent food and spectacular views. Stop by our world class tasting room for one of our beers and sit back and enjoy the incredible mountain and lake views. It is a Montana experience to remember. Flathead Lake Brewing Co. was established in 2004 with a kitchen added in  March of 2010. FLBC endeavors to provide the highest quality product (all natural, unfiltered, and full of flavor) and customer satisfaction while supporting a responsible beer culture... “Quality Montana Lifestyle, crafted and brewed in the Flathead Valley”. The Brewery features ten premier award winning quality crafted brews as well as seasonal offerings. In addition to our focus on product quality, FLBC creates a positive experience for our customers by offering more than a great brewpub where people can come to relax and converse over great food and beer. It offers a place where people can come to learn more about the beer and the brewing process.
name: Flathead Lake Brewing Company

description: Not very many people know about the pre-prohibition brewing traditions of Northwest Ohio. Many communities had their very own brewery selling quality beers to thirsty local customers. Flatrock Brewing Cmopany would like to continue this tradition by offering local high quality micro brewed beers. Flatrock Brewing Company produces beers using fresh grain and locally sourced ingredients including honey and seasonal fruits. With the brewery expansions we also plan on hiring local brewery employees and sales people.
name: Flatrock Brewing Company

description: Nano, meaning extremely small. Where we may be small in production, we are huge on flavor and personality. Brewing has begun!
name: Flesk Brewing Company

description: Flix Brewhouse America’s Cinema Brewery - the only first run movie theatre in the world to incorporate a fully functioning microbrewery. By combining these concepts, Flix delivers to your theatre seat three of America’s great loves - craft beer, great food and the latest movies! All six of our stadium seating “dining rooms” are outfitted with the latest high-definition digital projection and sound technologies, wall-to-wall curved screens and feature our revolutionary Easy Glider moveable table top. We brew six beers of our own and offer 42 other draft beers for guests to enjoy. The Flix Mix lobby bar and cafe is open seven days a week to public, no ticket required, so you can come in and grab a bite to eat or have a locally brewed beer anytime!
name: Flix Brewhouse

description:
The Florence pub is a major South London landmark and home to the Florence Brewery, which is home both to beers produced under the Florence name and the A Head In A Hat range. The Florence Brewery is looking forward to building a name for itself as part of the vibrant life of South London and let’s face it, what we do is . . .

Too good for North London!
name: Florence Brewery

description:
Brews that can be enjoyed rain or shine...from hot summer months to mild winters on the beach....
During hurricane season we bring the party...no matter what walk of life or Noreaster that brought you to the Sunshine State...once it hits your lips all you can think is: "Gotta Have A Florida Ave"©
name: Florida Avenue Ales

description: Headquartered in beautiful Cape Canaveral, FL. Florida Beer Company is Florida's state of the art brewery. With 17 years of brewing tradition, Florida Beer Company produces some of Florida's finest craft beer from its new 60,000 sq.ft. facility. Locals and visitor's to Florida's East Coast can enjoy handcrafted favorites like Swamp Ape DIPA, Florida Lager, Devil's Triangle IPA and Sunshine State PILS.
name: Florida Beer Company

description:
Is it a family restaurant, or a world-renowned brewery? Flossmoor Station has no identity crisis — it carries both titles with panache! Named “Best Brewery in Chicago” by Chicago Magazine (August 2002), Flossmoor Station features a gleaming glass-enclosed brewery where guests can watch how its fine handcrafted beers are made. (Tours are available upon request). The brewery has won dozens of local, national and international brewing industry honors in only ten years – a distinction not lost on micro-brew aficionados. 

Some of its more notable awards include being named Best Small Brewpub and Best Small Brewpub Brewer in America at the 2006 Great American Beer FestivalTM and winning gold, silver and bronze medals.
