Homer is known as "The Cosmic Hamlet by the Sea," and once you’ve been here, you’ll understand why. We are also known as the halibut capital of the world and that, too, is proven when you see a 300 pound fish hanging by its tail.

Our home is often referred to as the crown jewel of the state, and its beauty is defined by the land and seascape of the area.

If you need another reason to visit Homer, beer could be what brings you. Open since 1996, Homer Brewing Company has been welcoming both locals and visitors to the brewery every day of the year, with the exception of Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Years and Mardi Gras day.
name: Homer Brewing Company

description: Homestead Beer Company, headquartered in Granville, Ohio was founded in 2011 by Adam Rhodes and Kevin Atkinson. It's the first large-scale microbrewery dedicated to craft beer in Licking County with the brewing facility located in nearby Heath, Ohio.
name: Homestead Beer Co.

description:
Hometown Beverages’ mission is to create traditional American lagers with flavors that are unique to the palate of beer drinkers in their respective area. Try new Hometown Light, Pennsylvania Lager, New Jersey Lager and New York Lager!

Hometown Beverages is America’s best new brewer of what they call "specialty" session beers. You know the kind you can drink one after another - after another - and not get filled up. 

Hometown currently brews four different beers, namely - Hometown Light, Hometown Pennsylvania Lager, Hometown New Jersey Lager and Hometown New York Lager. 

Chris Curylo and Bob Selsky, aka The “Hometown Boys,” are the owners of Hometown. They brew their beers in beautiful Wilkes-Barre, PA.
name: Hometown Beverages

description: Hometown Cellars, located in the heart of Michigan's lower peninsula, offers a variety of quality wines and beers for you to sample and choose from. We are a full service winery & brewery offering over 30 varieties of wine and 8 craft brewed beers.
name: Hometown Cellars Winery & Brewery

description: Our mission is to bring the Oahu community together. We hope to accomplish this by offering craft beer that everyone can enjoy. Continuing with our artsy neighborhood, we used our surroundings as inspiration for our interior design. Our large warehouse offers a rustic feel for our up and coming Kaka’ako Community. The recycled wooden wall, benches, and cabinets provide the perfect ambiance to let loose and drink a few of our local brews. Here at Beerwork's we encourage new friendships by providing community style seating. Aloha, is the way of the island's and the way everyone should drink. So don't be shy and cheers your bench neighbor.
name: Honolulu Beerworks

description: Made with pride. Served with respect. Shared in tribute.
name: Honor Brewing Company

description:
Hood Canal Brewery opened its doors in September 1996 in an 800 sq. Ft. pole building at the home of Don Wyatt, owner and brewer, just north of Poulsbo, Washington. Don had five years experience in home-brewing and worked at the Thomas Kemper Brewery before its closing. When Kemper's closed its doors, he decided to follow his passion and strike out on his own.
 
Distribution of Hood Canal Beers started in Kitsap County. He later expanded his sales to the Seattle area via Odom Distributing Corporation, and now he personally distributes to bars, pubs, and grocery stores in Kitsap and surrounding counties.
 
Our Tasting Room is on Bond Road between Kingston and Poulsbo. It's about the ten minute drive from the Kingston ferry terminal or from Poulsbo.
name: Hood Canal Brewery

description: HooDoo Brewing Company makes world class ales, right here in the heart of Alaska. Come by for a glass of beer, and take a growler to enjoy at home! Prost!
name: HooDoo Brewing Company

description: Crafting beers with all the subtlety of David Lee Roth in bunless chaps.
name: Hoof Hearted Brewing

description: At Hook & Ladder Brewing we believe in great beer in the company of good friends, so we bring you three great beers for your drinking pleasure (please drink responsibly). Each of our beers is carefully crafted with the finest quality ingredients for a distinctive taste we know you will enjoy. Try one tonight, you just might get hooked. Through our own experiences in the fire and rescue service we have chosen the Hook & Ladder as a symbol of pride and honor to pay tribute to the brave men and women who serve and protect our communities.
name: Hook & Ladder Brewing Company

description: A regional brewery with the finest in craft beer made with the best ingredients. We are the proud manufactures of redFLYER Irish Ale, & other brews!
name: Hoosier Brewing Company

description: Let it be known that the HOOTS BEER CO. is a mysterious brotherhood which concocts blue collar brews of unmatched character. Combining beer’s old world elements with fair dosages of dark secrets, imagination, and old fashioned rock and roll, H.B.C. are boundless in ambition and highly attuned to Winston-Salem’s industrious spirit and local community. The faceless and nameless conjurers of HOOTS are hellbent on fulfilling one age-old prophecy: You will enjoy the beer you were born to imbibe.
name: Hoots Roller Bar & Beer Company

description: Georgia's newest Brew Pub. Providing Alpharetta, Ga and surrounding communities with excellent beer, brewed in-house, served right off the tank, along with pouring beers, brought in from world renowned breweries. All while serving fresh, delicious, food provided by local farmers.
name: Hop Alley Brew Pub

description:
For too long beer has been removed from its true craft roots.

Think about the first guys who sat down in some basement to craft the first batch of beer. There were no rules, no reverence, no sales projections to meet. Just ingenuity, passion, and the chutzpah to create something completely different. That was a craft beer, not the $150 million ad campaigns.

At Hop City, we brew beer because we love it. And in doing so we have created a really really really good recipe we dare you to try. Made with the only the best ingredients, this beer will make squirrels bark and grown men cry.

It's time to make some noise.

It's time for craft beer with attitude.
name: Hop City Brewing Co.

description: Hop Dogma Brewing Company is proud to bring you creative hand-crafted ales and lagers made from the highest quality ingredients. We specialize in small batches and adventurous brews! Come on by and taste the difference!
name: Hop Dogma Brewing Company

description:
Hop Farm Brewing Company is dedicated to the responsible use of our natural resources, from production to packaging and everywhere in between. We grow our own hops, by hand, organically and add them to every batch we brew. 

The inspiration for Hop Farm Brewing Company began over a decade ago. A green thumb naturally led to growing some of our own hops. The passions of growing hops and making beer came together when Hop Farm Brewing Company opened its doors in September of 2013 at 5601 Butler Street in Pittsburgh's Lawrenceville neighborhood. 

The tap list is ever changing and growing based on seasons so stop by soon and see what beers our staff have crafted for you!
name: Hop Farm Brewing Company

description:
Hop Haus Brewing Company handcrafts exceptional, inspired and unique beers by combining equal parts science and artistry.  Sparked by a belief that every community deserves a place to gather and come together as neighbors to enjoy a pint of beer and worthwhile conversation.

Hop Haus Brewing Company will create an ever-changing beer menu, occasionally offering experimental beers that can be appreciated by all. Our goal is to bring people together over a handcrafted beer. Beer that is equally as enjoyable to create, as it is to drink.

We strive to foster involvement and engagement of the Verona community by creating a welcoming and open tasting room in which to sample our handcrafted ales, spark new friendships, and participate in the evolution of our products through feedback, education and customer input.
name: Hop Haus Brewing Co.

description: Hop Nuts Brewing will be bringing craft beer to The Downtown Las Vegas Arts District in February, 2015. We are the first Microbrewery in the Arts District and are proud to say it! Our goal is to provide locals and tourists alike with a unique craft beer experience in a relaxed atmosphere. Whether you want to sit at our one of a kind bar or out on our patio and enjoy the weather while you enjoy your beer, we’ll leave that to you!
name: Hop Nuts

description:
Founded in February, 2009, Hop Valley is the first craft brewery in Springfield, OR.  With a 15 barrel system and a restaurant that compliments the fine hand crafted beer, Hop Valley has grown into one of Springfield's largest businesses.  Distributing beer throughout the Western States.
Based on that success, and significant pent up demand for their beer, Hop Valley opened a new facility at 990 W.1st Ave in Eugene at which they have built a new, much larger, 60 barrel production brewery.  This facility will be capable of producing up to 100,000 barrels per year, in stark contrast to the system in Springfield, that is maxed out at about 4000 barrels produced in 2012.
Our state of the art equipment and the facility are all built with every opportunity toward a green foot print, including the most efficient lighting, boiler, solar heating, etc.. available today.
The new facility has a large tasting room and outdoor patio and also has limited food service, to allow customers to enjoy all of our craft brews in a very comfortable setting, and with enough parking and outdoor area to support large parties!
name: Hop Valley Brewing Co.

description: HopCat was envisioned, designed, stocked and staffed with one mission in mind: to bring you great beer.
name: Hopcat

description:
HopDog BeerWorks is a beer tasting, cellar door sales attraction. HopDog brews hop-centric beers and artisanal ales, with a focus on quality ingredients and attention to detail. 

HopDog BeerWorks is a 200 litre nano-brewery. The beers are uncompromised, unfiltered, unadulterated and bottle conditioned, bringing you an unparalleled experience in a glass.
name: HopDog BeerWorks

description:
The purpose of the microbrewery Hopfenstark is to make quality beer and tasty, made from carefully selected ingredients. Make a mix of original taste of beer from different regions of the world and the current, open and eager to discover.

Without falling into caricature tastes, we want to make the nobility to the beer, for some time, is a left-nots in Quebec. Because, in reality, a beer should not taste the water ...

Hopfenstark therefore offers cask ales are available at various locations in Montreal and Lanaudière, and the tasting room.
name: Hopfenstark

description: We’re relentlessly focused on making great craft beer that delivers a flavorful, approachable, balanced drinking experience for geeks and non-geeks alike.
name: Hopothesis Beer Company

description:
Hopped Up Brewing is located on E. Sprague Avenue in Spokane Valley. The brewery includes a tasting room with seating, open Wednesday thru Saturday 2 pm to 9 pm.  Ask us to Hop Up your private events.
Steve Ewan, the owner/brewer at Hopped Up Brewing, is a fan of hot rods. The name Hopped Up is a reference to his love for beer as well as his appreciation of hopped-up cars. And then there’s the building. Hopped Up Brewing is located in a former International House of Pancakes (IHOP).  It’s all Hopped Up!!!
Steve has brewed up several different beers. Quality Cream Ale, High Performance Porter, and Raspberry Champale to name a few. We started out by pouring beer at the tasting room exclusively but but now distribute to local  establishments as well.
name: Hopped Up Brewing Company

description:
Hoppers opened its doors in Midvale, UT December 16th, 1996 becoming the first brew pub in the south end of the Salt lake Valley. Since its inception, Hoppers has offered both tradition and non-traditional bar food from our famous beer battered fish and chips, and homemade soups and burgers to our complimentary sticky buns served with weekend brunch. We also craft our award winning beer in our onsite brewery. 

While Hoppers is just one location, we compete with the best nationally. To date Hoppers has won 34 Medals for our hand crafted brews at the North American Brewers Association and the Great American Beer Festival. While modern beer styles have limited brewers by putting everything into categories, our Brewmaster, Donovan, finds inspiration in history and takes beer back to its roots and then gives it a twist without taking away the quality of a good beer. 

You can see innovation, passion and devotion in everything we do. That is why we are where locals go to “chill” in south end of the Salt Lake Valley. 

Hoppers Grill and Brewing Company – Your Local Chill
name: Hoppers Grill & Brewing Company

description:
Hoppin’ Frog is a small, hands-on brewery making very flavorful beers in the most flavorful beer styles. We brew high quality beers with an uncompromising focus on detail, from the ingredient selection to the brewing process. A specially designed JV Northwest brewing system creates more flavorful beers by allowing more barley to be used in the brewing process.  We also use a special bottling machine that keeps the beer fresher, and extends storage times compared to other conventional microbrewery bottling machines. This is very beneficial to retain all the character of these flavorful styles of beer.

Hoppin’ Frog is the concept of owner and established brewmaster Fred Karm, who has designed and produced more award-winning beers than any other professional brewer in Ohio since 2000. All of these awards were won at the 2 most prestigious contests in the world, including the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Cup. Mr. Karm has been a brewer of specialty beers since 1994, a life-long Akron, Ohio resident, and is a graduate of the University Of Akron.
name: Hoppin' Frog Brewery

description: We are a brewpub in Sacramento, CA that bottles a bit too. This year we celebrate 20 years of great food, awesome beer, and cool people. You can find our products in many of Sacramento's finest establishments as well as other notable locations throughout northern California.
name: Hoppy Brewing Company

description: Hops and Grain is a local Austin brewery that produces hand-crafted ales and handmade dog treats. We are very passionate about our craft and strive to create sustainability in everything that we do
name: Hops & Grain Brewery

description: We have been growing hops for 6 years and are very excited about hops farming coming back to New York. Our craft ales will feature NY hops and other agricultural products in a variety of beer styles. The Hopshire brewery building is a recreation of a 19th century NY hop house built with modern techniques for a high performance building.
name: Hopshire Farm and Brewery

description:
A beer is only as good as its ingredients, and at Hopsters we provide the best. We’ve partnered with the Wood Family Farm in Dudley, MA to source organic ingredients for our beers as well as meat and cheese for our charcuterie boards.

Just as we’re committed to showing the full-circle process of beer brewing beer at Hopsters, we’re also committed to full-circle local farming. We send the used grains (byproducts of the brewing process) back to Woods Farm to feed the pigs raised there. You could say we’re a “farm-to-table-and-back-to-farm” kind of place!
name: Hopster's

description: Hopvine Brewing Company is an original, locally owned and operated restaurant and brewery in Aurora, IL. Guests immerse themselves in the craft brewing process while looking through windows into the brewery, the fermentation room and ultimately the storage cooler. Hopvine Brewing Company offers a selection of craft beer, fine wines, specialty drinks and an extensive, constantly evolving selection of fresh seasonal menu items.
name: Hopvine Brewing Company

description: HUB is Portland's first Eco-Brewpub to offer all organic handcrafted beers, fresh local ingredients, and a sustainable building with a relaxed and casual atmosphere. Brewmaster Christian Ettinger has spent the past year and half constructing his dream brewpub.  HUB incorporates all aspects of sustainability.  From composting to rain barrels, and from pervious pavers to hand dryers, we have made every effort to protect our future with a thoughtful alternative.  Hopworks has four distinct areas including a family friendly restaurant with play area, a vibrant bicycle bar, banquet mezzanine, and outdoor beer-garden.  Our 20 barrel brewery produces 3000 barrels a year and provides our restaurant with ten different HUB organic beers on tap and two cask ales at all times. We have parking for seventy cars, eight motorcycles and up to fifty bikes.  Our world-class beer, New York style pizza, and wonderful staff are some of the best you will find anywhere.
name: Hopworks Urban Brewery

description: We’re often questioned about the origin of our name. Our story has it that “Spanish Fly Brewing” sounded too clumsy. Another says it was a bet at a card game. A third we’ve been advised by our lawyers not to discuss. While each rendition may have some truth to it, what it really boils down to is quite simple: Beer is fun. Brewing is fun. Drinking beer with your buddies is fun. So, why not a name that’s fun? After all, we’re in the business of helping people enjoy life. And we take our business very seriously. Our beers are craft-brewed for Old World taste and new world refreshment. Savored, slammed or sipped,these beers are also brewed to be sold and we plan on selling a lot of them. Aggressive marketing campaigns are in place to make sure Horny Goat Beers are on the radar of beer purchasers in select markets. Radio commercials, point-of-sale, guerilla tactics, swag, social media, you name it ‘cause we plan on growing, and growing large quickly. Kind of like a horny goat. So prepare yourself, the world is about to become a much hornier place.
name: Horny Goat Brewing Company

description: Work & family, hops & malt, Horse & Dragon. We craft high quality, great tasting beers sustainably and build community in the heart of Northern Colorado, the Napa Valley of Beer.
name: Horse & Dragon Brewing Company

description: Our beers are well balanced and finish smooth. During the brewing process, we utilize meticulous attention to detail while creating a balance between select malts, hops, and yeast. From the standard favorites to our new brews, Horse Heaven strives to create hand crafted beers that fit our friends flavor profiles. The hardest decision to make  is which beer to taste first!
name: Horse Heaven Hills Brewery

description:
Horsefly Brewing Company decided they wanted the name to represent something “local”.  They couldn’t spell Uncompahgre so they settled on Horsefly, which is a peak 10,000 feet high on the Uncompahgre Plateau west of Montrose.

In April of ’09 Horsefly Brewing Company started brewing recipes and fine tuning them.  In May ’09 construction began on the current location.  After lots of sweat and tears, (from watching the bar top drip on the floor) and with the help of a lot of friends and family, the doors finally opened September 9th, 2009.   09-09-09 was supposed to be lucky someone said.

In September of ’10 the doors opened at our new & current location. This was a 4 month adventure into remodeling the building to suit as brewery.
name: Horsefly Brewing Co

description: Horseheads Brewing broke ground on June 2006 and opened it's doors for business on July 3rd, 2007. The Master Brewer, after "home-brewing" for 8 years, received his education and certificate of concise brewing technology from the Siebel Institute in Chicago.
name: Horseheads Brewing

description:
Horseshoe Bend Brewing Co., is a micro-brewery located on "the Bend", of Lake of the Ozarks, a 7-mile long peninsula. It's named after its horseshoe like shape, as the lake follows it's natural shoreline. 

Chris and Carrie Case transformed a Firehouse from the 70's into a 7-barrel brewhouse.  Carrie had some roots in the Ozarks, but both moved from Colorado with a passion for craft beer. Chris worked previously as a Chef for over 20 years and Carrie with many years of Marketing and Graphic Design experience.  They figured that should be a good start for owning their own brewery.  Come to find out, Chris was really good at developing flavors and Carrie was really good at finding out what people liked...and several years of practice in the garage helped too!  

They focus on traditional brewing methods along with new techniques to produce distinct full-flavored beers!
name: Horseshoe Bend Brewing Co.

description: Hosanna Brewing Co’s Brewpub is the greatest place to enjoy beer, wine and coffee with friends. It’s the best escape from normal life in the Triangle. If you’re looking for a great night out you’ll be glad you spend it at Hosanna Brewing Co.
name: Hosanna Brewing Company

description:
House of Pendragon Brewing Co. focuses on handcrafted artisan made ales and lager.

Nothing is off limits at House of Pendragon Brewing Company. Here, we embrace the flavor. We use modern brewing techniques and the latest ingredients. With no restrictions holding us back, we’re not just thinking outside the box, we’re breaking it down and recycling it!

What does Pendragon mean? 
Pendragon is the last name of the famed Arthur Pendragon, otherwise known as King Arthur and The Knight’s of the Round Table. The translation of the name Pendragon literally means "head dragon" or "chief dragon".
name: House of Pendragon Brewing Company

description:
The Houston Brewing Company is a brewery in the village of Houston in Renfrewshire, Scotland. It is attached to, and operated in common with, the Fox & Hounds public house.

It produces a constant range of seven cask condition ales, alongside a range of seasonal and bottled beers
name: Houston Brewing Company

description:
Howard Brewing Company is a brand new craft brewery opening in Lenoir, North Carolina at the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains.

We will be opening in a great old building downtown on West Avenue alongside the Carolina Distillery and a new pub-style restaurant. We are working on some great ideas at the building including rain water recapture, solar power, and renovating the building so the dining experience literally overlooks the brewery and distillery operations. We are excited to bring our beer to you as soon as we can and are acquiring our brewhouse and swinging the hammers as you read this...
name: Howard Brewing Company

description: Howe Sound Brewing is proud to provide premium quality, all natural, micro-brewed beers to British Columbia's Sea To Sky Corridor, from Vancouver to Whistler BC. All of our ales and lagers are handcrafted with no preservatives to deliver pure satisfaction.
name: Howe Sound Brewing Company

description: Welcome to Howling Henry’s Brewery, LLC – an independent, family owned brewery that crafts classic beer styles, with each style’s recipe being brewed to be unique and different.  Sound interesting?  Although, our brewery has no retail space, I am able to deliver to your address.  The brewery’s home is located at 119 N Duke St., Hummlestown, Pennsylvania, but Howling Henry’s is unable to conduct retail sales here.  We are actively seeking establishments ready to give Howling Henry’s kegs and/or cases a try.
name: Howling Henry's Brewery, LLC

description:
Ed Taylor started off brewing at home making cider and meade before graduating to craft beer. He started brewing professionally at Redemption Brewing Company in Tottenham, before moving to the basement of The Cock Tavern on Mare Street to start his own operation, where most of the Howling Hops beer is sold. The Cock Tavern is a well stocked craft beer pub where the barmen make time to talk you through their excellent selection. Also, try their pork pies, served with piccalilli.

Which beer to try
The Howling Hops Smoked Porter is a dark coloured beer with a delicious smokey, malt driven flavour with tones of dark chocolate in the finish. 5.2%
name: Howling Hops

description: Hoyne Brewing Co. is located in Victoria, British Columbia. And while existing among a very saturated brewing industry in the area, Hoyne stands out as one of the best.
name: Hoyne Brewing Co.

description: Set in the heart of the Midwest, the Hub City Brewing Company is located five miles east of the historic town of Oelwein, Iowa. Founded in 1872 on a plot of land nestled amongst the fields, the city served as a hub for three major branches of the Chicago Great Western Railway, earning it the nickname of "Hub City" during the heyday of the railroad. Our beers pay homage to this historic Iowa town and the romantic era of the iron horse.
name: Hub City Brewing Co
Hub City Tap House: Home of Ciclops Cidery and Brewery

description:
Located in Austin County, Texas, we’re committed to crafting our beer to complement our history, customs, and lifestyles. We always brew with a respectful nod toward tradition before looking forward to produce beer with a worthy amount of creativity, adventure, and independence. The result is our idea of a good beer: one we enjoy.
 
We hope you agree. Here’s to sharing a beer with you soon — Cheers!
name: Huff Brewing Company

description:
We’re small, but who knew when we took on the tagline of Competing for the title of Portland’s Smallest Brewery that we’d actually also qualify as Oregon’s Smallest Brewery. (At least for 2011, based on sales volume.)

But our size isn’t quite the whole story. For now, it will suffice to say that we’re passionate about creating tasty beers that surprise you with their simplicity. Beers that we hope people LOVE to drink. Brewed in small batches.

Thank you for your interest! We hope you get the chance to try one of our beers and appreciate your support.
name: Humble Brewing

description:
In 1987 a new direction in craft beer took flight from the redwoods of Northern California, helping set the pace for the craft brew revolution. 
Founded in Humboldt County as one of California’s pioneering microbreweries, Humboldt Brewing Co. has been making waves for decades with our innovative brewing techniques and award-winning flock of delicious brews. 

We have experienced quite a journey in our 26 years. Today, we are independently owned by Total Beverage Solution and brewed on California’s Central Coast by Firestone Walker. We continue to craft the finest all-natural brews from the California Coast, giving you a taste of the Humboldt spirit in every sip.
name: Humboldt Brewing Company

description:
Humboldt Brewing Company was founded in Arcata, California in 1987. They brewed the famous Red Nectar and Hemp Ale until 2000 when they moved the brewing process to Firestone Walker Brewing Company in Paso Robles, California. In 2003, the Humboldt Brewing Company stopped all operations and closed it’s doors.
At that time, the majority of the employees formed Humboldt Brews LLC and opened for business in March 2004 as employee owned. In 2007 we had a major remodel to our building and at that time revamped our menu as well.

In 2009, with the old Humboldt Brewing space still vacant, we added our HUMBREWS Next Door music venue and banquet room. On November 12, 2009, The Mother Hips played to a full room. Since then we have hosted many entertainers and have held countless of events establishing ourselves as one of the premier live music venues in the North Coast.
Humboldt Brews is looking forward to celebrating 10 years of business in March 2014!
name: Humboldt Brews

description: Our Mission is to raise awareness about the importance of re-localization and building a healthy community.  We aim to serve as yet another example of a small local business directly supporting our local food-economy.  By growing our own ingredients, distributing directly to community members, and having an educational focus pertaining to craft brewing and sustainable agricultural practices we hope to help build a more resilient community.
name: Humboldt Regeneration Brewhouse

description:
The first Humperdink's opened on Greenville Avenue at Southwestern in 1976 as the Original Dallas Sports Restaurant & Sports Bar. We soon opened in Addison followed by Las Colinas (now relocated at West NW Hwy in Dallas) then Richardson in 1991 and Arlington at Six Flags. We began Brewing our own Beer in 1995 when the Arlington Restaurant opened and now offer our award winning beers at all locations. Humperdink's has the local flavor Texans love in a casual yet upscale atmosphere.

Fun, sports-oriented lounges are perfect for gatherings & celebrations.

Locally owned & "humpin' to please" since 1976!! Large parties welcome, gift cards available.

Our Mission is simple and dedicated:

We are a casual and fun Restaurant group emphasizing quality food, drink and service with positive attitudes providing for satisfied guests.
name: Humperdink's Restaurant And Brewery

description:
What we do here at HBC is make beer, great beer, great beer that we enjoy drinking. We also have the opportunity to share our love of beer with visitors who drop by to watch us work, sample our wares or just have a chat. We make a large range of beers with a huge range of colours, aromas & flavours & we firmly believe there is a beer in there for everyone – and the only real way to find out is by visiting us and tasting the beer!
 
Our brewery is very small, one of the smallest in the country. We strive to create a beer experience for our customers. Visit the brewery, chat to a brewer, watch us at work - the person who made the beer will be pouring the beer for you to enjoy!
 
Most of our beer is sold on-site, but if you are unable to visit us our beer is available in other locations (several restaurants, pubs and bottleshops) or you can order on-line .
name: Hunter Beer Co

description:
Hunter's Brewing is a nanobrewery located in Chesterton, IN. Brewed by hand on our one-barrel system, Hunter's Brewing beers focus on flavor and range from the traditional to the creative.

Owner-brewers Justin Reisetter and Amy Gentry take a thoughtful approach to brewing and are delighted to bring high-quality, small-batch boutique brews to the Duneland region.  

We offer 32 oz half-growlers to go.
name: Hunter's Brewing

description: This is a new brew pub in Mount Pleasant that creates cutting edge micro brews. We are attached to Hunter's Ale House! Come check us out!
name: Hunter's Handmade Brewery

description:
Fayetteville North Carolina's only downtown brewery with live entertainment!  Enjoy first-class Custom Brewed beer in a casual, sophisticated atmosphere!

Huske Hardware is proudly brewing 6 unique Custom Craft Beers - never filtered and always using the highest quality import and domestic malts and hops.
name: Huske Hardware House Restaurant and Brewery

description:
We are a Quality Lager and Aleworks Brewery with focus on American Craft Beer.  We are located in the now defunct Rio Salado Brewery in South Tempe.  We have a Tap Room with 20 revolving handles of the beers made on site along with the best beers available in Arizona.

Two people with a lot of passion for Craft Beer.  Owned and operated by husband and wife team Jeff and Leah Huss.  Together they have 20 years experience in the Craft Beer Industry.  Jeff “Ginger” Huss graduated from the Siebel Institute of Brewing Technology and was the Head Brewer for BJ’s Brewery in Chandler Arizona for over Seven years.  Leah Huss graduated from Scottsdale Culinary Institute with a degree in Culinary Arts and has been the Managing Partner at the Papago Brewing Co. in Scottsdale since 2001.  Both share a love and passion for American Craft beer and it’s culture, and look forward to sharing their knowledge and experience with you!
name: Huss Brewing Company

description: We are a 7bbl brewery and tap room located in the heart of Chattanooga.
name: Hutton & Smith Brewing Co.

description: Hyde Park Brewing Company
name: Hyde Park Brewing Company

description: Our brewery is in central Wisconsin just outside of Madison, which is thankfully vibrant with craft breweries, and now even distilleries. (the Napa valley of micro beer? love it) Our goal as a small business is first to provide high quality food, beverage, and service to all; and second to support our community.
name: Hydro Street Brewing Company

description:
We are a very small brewery located in Chino, CA. We are starting out as basically just homebrewers with an outlet to share our beers with others. We brew in very small batches and currently the only place to get our beer is directly from our brewery. This allows us a great deal of freedom in variety of style and recipe selection.
 
One of the main reasons we started I & I was because it was hard to find good fresh beer around. Although there are many great breweries in the surrounding counties, San Bernardino County had very few so we decided to open our own.
name: I & I Brewing

description: From Melbourne, Australia, comes a boutique liquor importer/distributor with a passion for handcrafted premium beers, spirits and ciders. Because we are spirits and beer enthusiasts, we carefully select all our products from Europe and South America to impress even the most demanding palates. Our aim is to give your price-conscious yet discerning customer the ultimate drinking experience, by offering an innovative product selection ranging from Brazilian Beers to Mexican tequila.
name: IBEV

description: Established in 1997, Ice Harbor Brewing Company is dedicated to producing award-winning beers for people who love beer.
name: Ice Harbor Brewing Co

description:
We are a Production Brewery and Tasting Room located in Leavenworth, Washington. We produce fresh, delicious craft brews!

Our tasting room overlooks our craft brewery where our head brewer, Dean Priebe has masterfully combined the pristine waters of the Icicle River with only the freshest ingredients to craft fresh and flavorful ales and lagers for your enjoyment.
name: Icicle Brewing Company

description: Based in Everett, Massachusetts, Idle Hands Craft Ales is the Boston area’s only nanobrewery.  We hand craft our beer with a nod towards belgian styles mixed with new world ideas. Founded in 2010, we recently received our federal license only days before the new year and are currently planning to produce our first commercial beers by late Winter/early Spring 2011.
name: Idle Hands Craft Ales

description: Idyll Hounds is a small craft brewery located in northwest florida. The white sand beaches forever blue sky and warm waters of florida give inspiration to the carefully crafted fresh tasty brews. Whether it's the tropical crispness of the Divide N Conch'r DIPA, the refreshing beachablility of our Man O' Wheat or the unique flavors of our seasonal line you can know our beer is responsibly brewed with the freshest and finest ingredients. At Idyll Hounds we brew for the beer enthusiasts and the novice beer drinkers alike. With a local first mind set concoctions are brewed with poetic attention to detail and memories that easily inspire lines of prose.
name: Idyll Hounds Brewing Company

description: Local microbrewery/pub. Brew house on premise with a 70 seat pub. 10 rotating taps and 2 handpulls. Simple and delicious menu includes fresh made pizza, oven-baked sandwiches and snacks made in house! Get some Great Local Beer!!!!
name: Iechyd Da Brewing Company

description:
A NEW KIND OF BREWERY 

COMING TO POWELL FALL 2015
name: Ill Mannered Brewing Company

description: Illawarra Brewing Company supplies 7 ongoing handcrafted beers and 2 rotating seasonal beers to bars, restaurants and cafes in Wollongong and the surrounding regions, and The Illawarra Brewery Bar on South Beach in Wollongong showcases all 9 brands. Illawarra Brewing Company also brews a number of beers on contract for some of the best craft breweries in NSW.
name: Illawarra Brewing Company

description: Imagine Nation Brewing Co. uses a 7-barrel brewing system to produce smaller, artisan batches of beer. With this system, we produce 2 house beers, 4-5 seasonal  taps, and occasional higher gravity brewer’s reserve specials. We focus on selling our beer almost entirely out of the taproom in 12oz. specialty glasses and half gallon growlers. Beer has played an important role in the evolution of humanity for 12,000 years.  Imagine Nation Brewing Co. strives to continue this evolution by earning its place in the American microbrewing renaissance through the production of brews that push boundaries and by focusing its efforts on positive change. We have specifically chosen a brewery as the vehicle to help people become better agents of change because microbreweries are an acceptable meeting place for people from all walks in society and because we are more apt to do good things if we feel good in the process. As polarization threatens to rip apart the social fabric of society, Imagine Nation Brewing Co. works to play a unifying role by supporting people to find common objectives towards the goal of positive social change for all people.
name: Imagine Nation Brewing

description: Imperial Oak Brewing is a Micro brewery focused on brewing high gravity beers with many barrel and wood aged offerings. We'll have some incredible session-able beer in there somewhere too.
name: Imperial Oak Brewing

description: We are a small brewery on the outskirts of Gig Harbor fueled by impulse. When the urge strikes, be sure to "Satisfy Your Impulse".
name: Impulse Brewing Company

description: In a few words InBev is the world's leading brewer, realizing 14.4 billion euro in 2007. The company has a strong, balanced portfolio, holding the number one or number two position in over 20 key markets  more than any other brewer. It has a key presence in both developed and developing markets. Headquartered in Leuven, Belgium, InBev employs almost 89 000 people worldwide. With sales in over 130 countries, the company works through six operational zones: North America, Western Europe, Central and Eastern Europe, Asia Pacific, Latin America North, and Latin America South.
name: InBev

description:
Indeed Brewing Company has a penchant for adventure, both in the beers we brew and the way we go about brewing them. 

We offer two flagship beers: Day Tripper Pale Ale & Midnight Ryder American Black Ale. We also brew seasonal offerings like Shenanigans Summer Ale, and Stir Crazy Winter Ale. 

Visit our taproom to to buy 10, 16, or 20-oz. beers, or take home 750 mL bottles of beer. Our tours are available on Saturday's, to sign up, visit our website at IndeedBrewing.com.

Indeed Brewing was founding in Feb. 2011, and began production in July 2012, and opened taproom in August 2012.

We distribute kegs, 12-oz. cans, and specialty beers in 750 mL bottles.
name: Indeed Brewing Company

description:
Rob and Amy Cartwright embarked on their dream to brew flavorful, delicious beers for the people of Austin in October 2004. Armed with their love of beer, years of brewing experience, an intrepid spirit, and their trusty dog Jasper, they founded Independence Brewing Company.

Located in southeast Austin, amongst tech companies and warehouse park entrepreneurs, Independence Brewing is a true reflection of the creative energy and pioneering spirit that makes Austin great.

What started with a married couple and their dog, has blossomed into a crew of nineteen and a community of beer drinkers who enjoy drinking fresh, handcrafted beer.
name: Independence Brewing Company

description: Independent Brewing Company is a small batch craft brewery located at the Ma and Pa Trail in Downtown Bel Air, Maryland.
name: Independent Brewing Co.

description: Brewing fine ales and lagers in Oakland, California's historic Jack London District.
name: Independent Brewing Company

description: A small brewery in Plymouth, Massachusetts specializing in Belgian-style beers using locally sourced ingredients.
name: Independent Fermentations Brewing

description: Welcome to Indian Joe Brewing. We are a taste experience pushing the boundaries of flavor and limitations on our beer. We brew a variety of handcrafted beverages such as Ales, Witbiers, Stouts and Hefeweizens. We are continuously changing our line up. So, stop on by and check us out!
name: Indian Joe Brewing, Inc.

description: Proudly producing fine ales & lagers since 1995. One of California's favorite microbreweries!
name: Indian Wells Brewing Company

description: It’s our mission to brew innovative beers for craft beer lovers in Indy. And that is that. We’re focused on Indy. We’re doing all we can to add to the beer culture right here. We’re filling growlers at our taproom near downtown, and we’re on tap at select craft beer bars in Indy.
name: Indiana City Brewing Co.

description: The Indigo Imp Brewery is an independent, family-owned and operated microbrewery hand-crafting small batches of the highest quality Real Ales. All beers are produced in open fermentors. These beers are various classic styles as well as some new creations.
name: Indigo Imp Brewery

description:
Here at the first Weissbier brewery in Denmark, we focus on innovation with respect for tradition. In developing the best beers and brewing techniques. With roots going back to 1897 Indslev Bryggeri on Funen reopened as a modern brewery in April 2006.

The equipment and the raw materials we use are selected to achieve the very best quality. Weissbeer from Indslev Bryggeri has great taste. Every week shops, cafes and restaurants across the country get freshly tapped beer from Indslev - so you can enjoy the best beer in your glass.

Weissbeer is classic Belgian and German beer tradition dating back to ancient times. And the right person to introduce the German weissbier tradition of Indslev Bryggeri is Brewmaster Stefan Peter Stadler. He has 30 years of experience with Weissbier and the art of brewing beer for the senses. Stefan Peter Stadler was born and raised in Munich, where he is graduated master brewer at Hofbrauhaus in Munich. He has experience in both German and Danish breweries.

Discover our interpretation of Danish Weissbier that is hand-brewed by Bavarian tradition. We believe that hand-brewed beer tastes better. The entire brewing process is controlled by hand, and we treat for all the details and the best ingredients. There is no additives - only malt, hops, yeast, water and a few spices.
name: Indslev Bryggeri

description:
The team at IBC hails from a diverse background spanning multiple industries who have settled in ATX from other parts of Texas and from both the East and West Coasts. 
We have been home brewing for quite some time and now we are taking that passion to the next level by offering our creations to as many people as possible.
We are currently in the initial stages of development and hope to begin production by year end. Given the strict licensing process, it will probably be sometime in early 2013 before we can share our beers with the rest of Austin, but we are working hard to make that happen as soon as legally possible.
Much more information will be coming on our planned initial beer selection. In the meantime, continue to check back for updates and continue to spread the word!
name: Infamous Brewing Company

description:
Infinite Ale Works is a haven to anyone interested in expanding their horizons and knowledge into the wonderful world of craft beer. Infinite’s tasting room features 40 different taps of excellent, adventurous craft beer that will suit any discerning palate.

Once brewing commences (in the near future) Infinite Ale Works will feature Belgian inspired ales in a comfortable and friendly atmosphere and will strive to make Ocala a ‘beer destination’ for the beer lover. Stop in and become a part of the Infinite family!
name: Infinite Ale Works

description: 7 barrel brew operation.  Hours of operation for tasting room and retail outlet are currently Thursdays and Fridays from 4pm until 8pm and Saturdays from noon until 6pm.  Summer Sunday hours are noon until 4pm for tastings.
name: Infinity Brewing

description: Located in the heart of the "Benson Beer District" in Omaha, Nebraska, and built in the historic former home of Olson's Meat Market , Infusion Brewing Company brews up great hand crafted beers with a locally sourced twist! Our beers are available through our on-site tap room and in the Omaha and Lincoln areas on draft only.
name: Infusion Brewing Company

description: Small brewery dedicated to production and distribution of craft beer.
name: Ingeniero Microbrewery

description:
As Inishowen’s 1st independent brewery, we are dedicated to making beers that really reflect Inishowen people: well travelled, creative, lively and individual. 

Combining state of the art brewing technology with  traditional brewing methods  and using only natural ingredients with no artificial colours or fillers, our beers provide a refreshing alternative full of the best flavours from around the world.  All of our beer is brewed entirely on site here in Inishowen ensuring maximum freshness for you.
name: Inishowen Brewery

description:
Inland Empire Brewing Company was formed in 2007 by three long time friends.  We had all been home brewers for approximately five years prior to stumbling upon a really good deal on some used 7 BBL brewing equipment. We all three decided that we had what it takes to go big, and sell our beer to the public!

After about two years of work with Government agencies, permitting and construction, we opened our doors to the public on February 20th, 2009!  While we are now down to two owners, we continue to grow at a comfortable pace.

We’ve recently (early 2012) added four 15 BBL State of the art conical fermenters, which has improved fermentation times, consistency and quality.  We are also working on other new projects, yet to be announced.
name: Inland Empire Brewing Company

description:
Innis & Gunn is a specialist independent brewing company based in Edinburgh, Scotland. Established in 2003, its beer has gone on to be the most popular British bottled beer sold in Canada, and second most popular in Sweden. It was part of the nominated drinks list for the G8 Summit 2005 at Gleneagles Hotel.

The business is, since 2008, family owned following a management buy-out from its original part-owners, William Grant and Sons.

Their Innis & Gunn Original beer is brewed in Dunbar, East Lothian before being matured in American white oak Bourbon barrels for 30 days and is then a further 47 days in a marrying tun, and so it is matured for 77 days in total. It is 6.6% alcohol by volume. At first only available as a bottled beer it is now marketed both in bottles and as draught.

According to Innis and Gunn's website, the process was discovered in an ironic accident: the intent was to create a scotch whisky with ale flavours. To do this, a special beer was created which would then be stored in the whisky barrels. After the beer had conditioned the barrels, it was to be discarded and replaced with the whisky. The brewers noted that the process had an agreeable effect on the beer, and thus aging the beer became an end in itself.

A "blonde" version of Innis & Gunn is also widely available, and a limited edition matured in rum barrels was produced.
name: Innis & Gunn

description: Innovation Brew Works is a 3.5 BBL Brew Pub that serves its own craft beers and craft pizzas at the Cal Poly Pomona campus. Cal Poly grown grains and other ingredients are used in each brew.
name: Innovation Brew Works

description: Innovation Brewing is changing the way you think about beer. While we will be supplying our neighborhood patrons with plenty of traditional styles of ales and ol’ standbys, we are constantly evolving and crafting new and unique styles of beer. Experimentation with a variety of fun and fresh ingredients will always be available to stimulate the palate and the senses when you stop by Innovation Brewing for a pint. And of course an IPA or three will be available for your drinking pleasure at all times.
name: Innovation Brewing

description:
The inspiration to start Insight Brewing Company happened in Denmark in 2007 when I tasted the world’s best beer on ratebeer.com. It was a Westvleteren 12, a beer brewed by Belgian Monks. I had no idea that beer could have such complex flavors. The experience instantly changed my life and set me off on an adventure around the world in pursuit of deeper insight into global brewing cultures and techniques.

In 2010 and 2011, I worked with breweries in England, Japan and Denmark, picked hops in West Kent, and befriended brewers from around the globe. The experiences and trade secrets I picked up inspired me to start a brewery where I could bring new and innovative beers back home to the U.S. Together with my partners Brian Berge, Kevin Hilliard, and Eric Schmidt, we’ve made that dream come true with Insight Brewing Company.
name: Insight Brewing

description: We are a family owned and operated micro-brewery dedicated to crafting uncompromised and unfiltered American style ales. We are committed to producing and serving world class beer to our local community. Our Camarillo based brewery has an on-site tasting room and our beer is available at select local bars/restaurants.
name: Institution Ale Company

description:
Brewer of eclectic, rustic and wild ales based in South Central Pennsylvania.
Intangible Ales is a new project combining Terry Hawbaker's passion for brewing and Kristen Mullen's passion for photography (Watch for Kristen’s cool label art!)  Most releases will be in bottles, however there will be some occasional draft as well. 

Style is subjective. Art is an ale.
name: Intangible Ales

description:
"May your spirit be light and may you always enjoy Intercourse."

Affectionately named for the town in Lancaster County, PA Intercourse Brewing Company began production in June 2008.
name: Intercourse Brewing Company

description: We are a San Diego Based Pilot Brewery, currently operating on a Nano-Scale brewing system.
name: Intergalactic Brewing Co

description: We are a small microbrewery, focused on bringing an ever-rotating cycle of quality beers to Brevard County.
name: Intracoastal Brewing Company

description: Iowa River Brewing Company is a craft brewery specializing in small batch beers. The brewery feature a tasting room and sells beer for take out in growlers or for consumption in the brewery. Beer is available for sale in kegs to restaurants, bars and for special events. Iowa River Brewing is also planning to offer private label brewing.
name: Iowa River Brewing Company

description:
Always Fresh and Local Since 1991

Makers of Ipswich Ale, Stone Cat Ales & Lagers, and Mercury Soda Pop. Located in historic Ipswich, Massachusetts, one of America's oldest towns. Proudly brewed since 1991.

What sets our Ales apart is our brewing process. We produce styles which are totally unfiltered and unpasteurized. Through this natural brewing style the result is ale which maintains a greater level of freshness, mouth feel, and full flavor.
name: Ipswich Ale Brewery

description:
Formerly Astigarraga was a Santiago district and part of Asteasu village, but since January 26th 1660 it was erected as a independent village.
It has been always considered the cider town. The antiquity  of the apple in this province goes back to documents from the 1014 year; and the most antique places that existed in the oldest country houses demonstrate that the cider fabrication is of a very remote time.

Since the end of the 19th century, Astigarraga saw Irigoien cider house be born as a country house mainly destined to natual cider elaboration.
Since then 3 generations of a family have been taking relief,  being me myself, IÒaki Irigoien its actual owner.
name: Irigoien Sagardoa

description: After spending years pretending we knew beer, and dreaming of working for ourselves, drinking beer and living the American dream, we decided to take the plunge in Ireland.  With our new favorite Irish friend, we set out to create a brewery that captures the spirit of Ireland's rich brewing history, the flavor of the Irish countryside and our American spirit and hustle.
name: Irish Yankee

description: Relax in our alfresco beer garden and enjoy our handcrafted beers, ciders, Aussie Food and woodfired pizza's and local wines!
name: Iron Bark Brewery

description:
Specializing in cask ale, everyone is welcome to enjoy our refreshing craft beer. Come sample different cask ale and their hard carbonated equivalents on tap every day. 

We're a couple of small town guys with a passion for beer and keeping it real. Everything is brewed on location and we'd love to have you join us for a round of flavorful session-style beer!
name: Iron Bird Brewing Co.

description: Iron Fist Brewing Company is a family owned brewery located in Vista, California, smack-dab in the middle of the exciting San Diego craft beer scene. Our passion for the best hand crafted beer prompted us to make a lot of it. However, we quickly realized we were making a bit more than we could drink ourselves, so we decided to sell whatever we don't drink to you. So do yourself a favor; start a little revolution. It's ok. We won't tell on you. Put the 500 pack of light lager back with all its buddies and rule your taste with an Iron Fist!
name: Iron Fist Brewing Company

description:
Iron Flamingo Brewery, IF, was established in December of 2013.
Iron Flamingo is the first micro brewery to produce and distribute beer  in Corning, New York. IF is the product of a long standing friendship between two families the McClellans and the Mauers.
 
Over the past 5 years flamingo wars have been fought between the two families. The flamingo battles resulted in flamingos unexpectedly appearing in odd places in the gardens and homes of the two families.Flamingos have even appeared in The local brew pub on Market Street,( see if you can spot a flamingo on you're next visit there).
 
Passion for good beer and entrepreneurial  adventures resulted in the creation of this micro brewery. The families agreed that  the flamingo was a good symbol of their long standing  jovial friendship and iron represented  the strength of that friendship.

With 17 years brewing experience at Market Street Brewing Company, Pelham McClellan is creating new and exciting beers for Iron Flamingo Brewery.
 
Iron Flamingo is located at 196 Baker Street in a historic fruit market
building. This building also served as a auto repair shop  over the years. The charm of this building has been retained in its conversion into a brewery. The original fruit coolers have been converted into beer coolers,  air  pressure lines remain on the ceiling and the expansive 20 pane glass service doors provide a street view to the classic stainless  brewing  tanks.
name: Iron Flamingo Brewery

description: Iron Goat brews are now being served in some of Spokane's best bars and restaurants. Taproom will be open the first week of June.
name: Iron Goat Brewing

description:
Welcome to Iron Hill Brewery & Restaurant, where you'll find fine handcrafted beers, creative yet informal cuisine, and friendly, attentive service in a casual, upscale atmosphere.

We're passionate about producing distinctive, full-flavored handcrafted beers, accompanied by fresh–from–scratch New American cuisine in a comfortable, casual atmosphere. Our goal has always been to provide food and beer that is inspired, consistently crafted and presented by a knowledgeable and courteous service staff.

Our commitment to support the communities in which we do business goes to the heart of what differentiates Iron Hill from other restaurants. But it is because of you, our guests, that we have been able to make this all happen.
name: Iron Hill Brewery

description:
The Iron Horse Brewery that opened its doors in December of 2004 was a bit different than today. It had a very mom and pop feel, and featured a look that was as traditional as it gets. Those who knew of it visited regularly, but the regulars were few. For many, the brewery was a thing shrouded in mystery... college students-which comprise a fair percentage of Ellensburg's population for most of the year-would occasionally see a bottle on a store shelf and ask where it came from. The likely response:

"Yeah, I think some dude makes that in his basement or something..."

The word just wasn't getting out, and things didn't look good for the tiny brewery that made exceptionally tasty ales. 
Well, a couple of hoodlums in their late-twenties jumped on the opportunity to own and operate their own brewery, and what resulted is the Iron Horse Brewery you know and love today. They tweaked some recipes, changed some names, threw some ridiculous theme parties to encourage locals to actually see the brewery with their own eyes, and good things started to happen. Locals started to dig what the guys were doing. A few bars took a chance and put Iron Horse back on tap, and the beer started flowing. 

The word started getting out.
name: Iron Horse Brewery

description: Iron Spike Brewing Company is a craft brewery and restaurant located in downtown Galesburg, IL at the historic Central Fire Station. This 10 barrel brewhouse and restaurant is truly unique to the downtown community, both inside and out. A 20 foot long, 12 foot high glass wall separates the brewery from the dining area, with the last of three functional fire poles located behind the bar. Iron Spike Brewpub operates with one simple philosophy of crafting traditional, unique and specialty styles that will entice every beer drinker, whether a craft-beer virgin, blog enthusiast, or malty connoisseur, and to rescue the standard that craft beer was founded upon. Iron Spike pushes the envelope of traditional styles including pilsner, porter, Indian Pale, Belgian, wheat and many others. We design recipes that stretch the character, basis and strength of each style. Our kitchen and chef compliment our craft beers with simple methods of building “from scratch” homefolk, hearty, and mouth-watering dishes that will entice and pair perfectly with our brews. Iron Spike not only brings craft beer and food to the area, but brings live music and local bands to fill up the atmosphere. Altogether, Iron Spike prides itself on original beer, great food, and local entertainment while supporting the Galesburg community.
name: Iron Spike Brewing Company

description: Brewpub in the heart of Marin County.
name: Iron Springs Pub & Brewery

description:
Beer is the beautiful marriage of grain, hops, yeast, and most importantly

WATER

Iron Triangle Brewing Company is named after the three men who came together to build the LA  Aqueduct, William Mulholland, Fredrick Eaton, and Joseph Lippincott, Upon completion of the LA Aqueduct William Mulholland stood atop the flood gate over a massive crowd of Angelenos as the water gushed forth and famously decreed,

“THERE IT IS. TAKE IT”

Located in the Los Angeles Arts District and housed in a pre-prohibition era warehouse. Iron Triangle takes inspiration from these men, and vintage 1920’s Los Angeles.
name: Iron Triangle Brewery

description: Ironfire Brewing Company was founded in 2011 by John Maino and Gregory Webb. The two spent many years working/brewing together at Ballast Point in San Diego before venturing off on their own. They plan on a Spring 2012 opening.
name: Ironfire Brewing Company

description: Pool, pinball, darts, sports, bar food, and delicious craft beer.
name: Ironworks Brewery and Pub

description:
Have you ever heard of a little island in the Florida Keys called Islamorada?  Islamorada has been called many things. It’s referred to as the sport fishing capital of the world, and has the longstanding reputation of a drinking town with a fishing problem.  Most people who visit call it paradise, but at Islamorada Beer Company we simply call it home.

It's here on this small island in the Florida Keys that Islamorada Beer was founded, with a goal to make quality local craft beer with the drinkability that complements our lifestyle. Brewing Florida Keys craft beer is our passion and is shown by the quality in our beer. 

If you’ve ever been to Islamorada then you know about our legendary “Sandbar.”  And if you have yet to experience a day wading in the water with a cold drink in your hand we invite you to join the Islamorada Beer group on any Sandbar Sunday for the time of your life. #MySandbar
name: Islamorada Beer Company

description: Island Brewing Company has been brewing in Carpinteria, CA since July, 2000 and has steadily gained a following of enthusiasts along the Santa Barbara coast. Owner and brewer Paul Wright began his brewing adventures after receiving a homebrew kit for Christmas in 1991 in Novato, CA. He joined the local brew club and started winning awards for his beers. Soon he found himself president and heading up the Marin County State Fair competitions, and after burning out all the burners on the stove, he was banished to brewing outdoors. A certified beer judge, he worked at Marin Brewing Company before starting off on his own, moving south to Carpinteria. Now a family run brewery, Island Brewing Company has won awards on both the state and national level. We serve local bars, restaurants, and retail outlets and have five and fifteen-gallon kegs and 22-ounce bottles available for weddings, caterers, as well as for thirsty individuals that happen to come our way. We’ve now opened a new brewery in beautiful downtown Carpinteria and hope you’ll stop by to visit soon.
name: Island Brewing Company

description:
Our Island Hoppin' crew consists of Becca Gray, Jim Parker and our brew master Nate Schons. 

Everyone of us brings something else to the brewery. We truly believe that to make an excellent brew you need to put a lot of heart and soul into your work. 
We love brewing and it shows in every pint poured.
name: Island Hoppin' Brewery

description:
Island Orchard Cider began on our farm on Washington Island, just across Death’s Door passage from mainland Door County. Located on a hill overlooking Lake Michigan, the property had a few craggy apple trees remaining in the fields.
During family trips to visit Yannique’s French father in Brittany, we always enjoyed going to Creperie restaurants to eat savory galettes and sweet crepes, accompanied by a bottle of cidre brut. Over time, as Bob became more interested in cider, we started traveling to the Pays D’Auge region of Normandy, where we tasted many varieties of this traditional beverage that is typically served with meals, and is the perfect complement to the wonderful cuisine of the area.
As we experienced the cider culture of northern France, we realized that nothing like these dry, complex ciders existed in the U.S., and we became excited about the prospect of introducing a French-style cider to the American palate. Back at our orchard, we began planting cider cultivars from France, England and America, while testing the types that would work best with the Island’s climate and rocky limestone soil. Our Washington Island orchard has expanded with our passion for cider, and we now produce several varieties of gluten-free cider in our Cider House in the small town of Ellison Bay, WI, located at the tip of the Door Peninsula.
name: Island Orchard Cider

description: Situated just off the West coast of Scotland the Isle of Arran is arguably one of the most beautiful and dramatic islands in Europe. The splendor and diversity of the landscape has led it to be considered by many as Scotland in miniature. Nestled between the islands largest mountain, Goatfell and the imposing Brodick Castle lies Arran Brewery which has been brewing award winning craft beer for over a decade.
name: Isle of Arran Brewery

description:
Established in 2003, the award winning Isle of Purbeck Brewery started brewing at the gateway to Dorsets world heritage Jurassic coast, nestled in the Purbeck Hills overlooking the clear blue sea of Studland Bay.
Building on the success of our renowned Fossil Fuel under the expert guidance of master brewer Dan Thomasson, Jack, Pippa and the IOPB team have grown the range to 5 core beers, encompassing a delicious spectrum of styles and tastes.
Our approach to making the beer has always been straightforward. First of all we make it all by hand in the traditional way, that way we make sure each part of the brew is perfect. Secondly we dont cut any corners on ingredients.
We use the best that England can provide. And last but not least, we aim to provide exceptional personal service in the finest traditions of a family run brewery.
name: Isle of Purbeck Brewery

description: Isley Brewing Company is a new microbrewery coming to Scott's Addition area of Richmond VA. Our large tasting room will be great for relaxing with friends and family while enjoying an ever changing variety of artisanal beers. We will update this page with our progress.
name: Isley Brewing Company

description: A small 2 BBL. production brewery located in Manhattan IL. Believed to be the first brewery the town has ever had.
name: ISOB Brewing Company

description:
Founded in 1997 by two businessmen at the Christening of their Godson Dugald Rhodes. The Godfathers, pleased with their honorary responsibility, thought carefully for the future of little Dugald.

Several pints of mediocre ale later the idea for forming a brewery and making their own beer began to take hold. A toast was made and within weeks a site (wholly inadequate) was found and the equipment (too big for the site) was bought.

The first brew, Godfathers, won the Bronze Award for best ale in Britain the following year at the Great British Beer Festival.

16 years, 30 million pints and a brewery relocation later IVB continues to thrive. Situated in the heart of Hampshire we produce an unrivalled range of award winning real ales with pure Hampshire water, yeast and barley along with the finest hops around the country and world.

Godson Dugald is as yet too young to enjoy his beer birthright, but we’re sure he will.
name: Itchen Valley Brewery

description:
Ithaca Beer Co.,established in 1998, has a mission to brew delicious beers for the purpose of making life more enjoyable. We strive to make this company better and build our brand name and good reputation among our customers.

Over the last decade we have worked hard doing just that, and we have had lots of fun in the process!  From our friendly staff to the award-winning beer to our community outreach, Ithaca Beer continues to brew beers for the purpose of making your simple moments worthwhile.  Take a moment to look around our brand new site and learn about more about Ithaca Beer as a company, the beers we brew, and our involvement in Ithaca, NY.
name: Ithaca Beer Company

description:
The Ivory Tower Brewery - where it's all academic!

We are proud to be partnered with Academic Affairs and be the home of the brewing class here at Appalachian State University. Headed up by Dr. Brett Taubman and Dr. Shea Tuberty this class provides a rigorous coverage of the chemical, biological, and physical processes that go into brewing malted beverages, including coverage of the hops, malt, and yeast varieties and how they are combined to produce specific styles and flavors of beers. The class also covers the history of fermented beverages as well as the business side of beer and brewing. Students enjoy a "hands on-minds on" approach to brewing basic styles of beer during class at the Ivory Tower Educational Brewery in the Broyhill Events Center.
name: Ivory Tower Brewery

description:
Long time Home brewer using the best ingredients from all over the world to bring the finest brews to you.

4 legged friends always welcome, can book for private events on hours or days I am usually not open, growlers available and food is allowed to be brought in. I do have peanuts available.
name: J Wells Brewery
J. Fargo`s Family Dining / Coyote J Brewing Co

description: Creating craft brews that dont follow the norm. Brewing our libations in the great city of Miami.
name: J. Wakefield Brewing

description:
Established in 1997, J.J. Bitting Brewing Company was the first brewery to operate in Woodbridge Township, New Jersey, since the repeal of prohibition in 1933. Our spacious 3 story restaurant resides in a beautifully restored 100 year old brick building that once housed The J.J. Bitting Coal and Feed Depot.  

During your visit, indulge in the finest American Grill Cuisine and Handcrafted Beer and Ales offered by our chef and master brewer while soaking in the vibrant and rustic environment the restaurant that has awarded us the distinction of “#2 Brew Pub In America” by BeerAdvocate.com and "Best Hot Wings" by besthotwings.com
name: J.J. Bitting Brewing Company

description:
Most homebrewers, at some point, begin to dream of starting their own brewery.  I had always liked my beer, but I realized that there tends to be a brewer’s bias towards their own beer.  A great deal of time and effort goes into making a batch of beer, so the brewer is bound to speak highly of their own goods.  It turns out, I’m my own worst critic.  I’m constantly searching for ways to improve the beer.  Whenever I shared brews with others, they always liked it as well, but who doesn’t like free beer?  For me, the seed was planted quite a few years ago when I started winning homebrewing awards statewide.  It was then I began to realize that I was making more than just pretty good homebrew.  I was making some damn good beer!  I began volunteering to judge at homebrew competitions and making an effort to get out and sample more of the beers not available in northern Minnesota.  I quickly realized that there was much more to explore in the world of beer than I realized.  I studied and tasted everything I could find regarding brewing science and beer styles.  In the midst of all of the studying and research, I took the Beer Judge Certification Program test and obtained a National rank in the BJCP.  I now had some credentials to back up my knowledge of good beer and brewing.  It was clear that this was starting to become more than just a hobby, so I began to put a bit more time and effort into the dream of starting a brewery.

So, after all this research and planning, what’s the plan?  Start small.

Jack Pine Brewery is starting very small.  Nanobrewery small.  Brewing forty gallons at a time small.  Did I mention the brewer is small?

This little brewery serves as a pilot system for the eventual build-out of a full scale production brewery.  It provides the opportunity to test the waters before sinking a boatload of cash into a warehouse full of stainless equipment.  Best of all, it gives YOU a chance to TRY THE BEER!  I’ve been my own worst critic for the past 12 years of homebrewing.  Now it’s your turn.  With your help, we can build a brewery to provide our friends and neighbors with delicious locally-brewed beer.

So, stop in and give it a try!
name: Jack Pine Brewery
Jack Taylor's Brewery and Public House

description: Jack's Abby Brewing was formally founded in January of 2011 by three brothers, Jack, Eric and Sam Hendler, who grew up in a family business. The ideas behind it, however, date back over ten years to when Jack was still in college experimenting with home brews. After graduating, Jack became the head brewer of one of the largest brewpubs in the eastern US. He earned joint diplomas in Brewing Technology from Siebel Institute of Chicago and Doemans Academy of Munich. Currently he is a member of the Master Brewers Association.
name: Jack's Abby Brewing

description:
Founded in 1999, Jack's Brewing Company opened its first full service microbrewery and restaurant at 39176 Argonaut Way, Fremont, California, on the west side of the Fremont Hub shopping center. Jack's is proud to announce the opening of our second location at 2410 San Ramon Valley Blvd., San Ramon, California in August 2009.

Jack's Brewing Company brews on premise every week to allow serving the finest and freshest quality beers in the area. We are known for fantastic California Pub Cuisine, ranging from incredible 1/2 pound gourmet burgers, Certified Angus steak platters, fresh salmon fillets sliced from fresh whole fish to delicious entrée salads and delightful desserts.

A sports themed restaurant with over 20 HD TV's and one 10-foot monster screen, Jack's offers the best sports viewing around at both locations. Our Fremont location offers a banquet facility available to suit corporate or large party needs; San Ramon can accommodate large parties within their dining room. Both locations are pleased to accept reservations for parties of six or greater.

Visit Jack's Brewing Company and enjoy Great Beer, Great Food, and Great Fun!
name: Jack's Brewing

description:
Jack’s Hard Cider is produced and canned by Hauser Estate Winery just 8 miles west of Historic Gettysburg, Pa. Our cider is produced from apples native to our home, Adams County Pennsylvania.  Featuring our farm fresh flavor, never from concentrate, Jack’s Hard Cider is part of the growing craft cider revolution.

The partially solar-powered, completely under-ground, naturally cool (55 degree) winery & cidery, churns out thousands of gallons of Jack’s Hard Cider per year. Each batch starts as apples skillfully grown and tended to by our farm manager Lee Wagner. Their juice is then carefully crafted by our Cider-maker and is filtered slowly to maintain flavor and a high level of smoothness for which our product has been noted. Jack’s Hard Cider awaits maturity in state of the art stainless steel tanks, and finally is canned on-site.
name: Jack's Hard Cider

description: Jackalope Brewing Company is owned by Bailey Spaulding and Robyn Virball, two young ingénues with an affection for beer. They met in September 2002 in the tiny Scottish village of St. Andrews, Scotland. Bailey was a Harvard student doing a semester abroad and Robyn was beginning undergrad at St. Andrews. They bonded over being put into the worst dorm for overseas orientation and teaching Danish people how to play beer pong. Though after three months Bailey went back to Cambridge, you can't break the bonds that are made when teaching Europeans drinking games and a true friendship was born. During the next eight years, they both graduated, Bailey went off to Vanderbilt Law School, and Robyn entered the working world, but both thought they were meant for much bigger and more alcoholic things.
name: Jackalope Brewing Company

description: Jackie O's Pub and Brewery prides itself in creating neo-traditional handcrafted artisan ales. Inside each pint, a fusion of American craft brewing creativity and historically sound techniques await your palate. A marriage of exploration and tradition guaranteed to cure whatever ales you!
name: Jackie O's Pub and Brewery

description: Jackrabbit Brewing Company was started in 2011 by four avid homebrewers who share a passion for full-flavored, yet balanced beers.   Taking inspiration from Belgian, English and German brews, our goal is to craft beer that is founded in tradition, but defies convention with California-style inventiveness.   We have a DIY ethic when it comes to our beer, our brewery and our business - in other words, we prefer to do things our own way (often, the hard way).  All of our beers' recipes were designed and perfected by us, and even our 5-barrel brewing system was custom built by the Jackrabbit crew.  If you come across our beer on tap, or in bottles at your local retailer, rest assured that we poured our passion for beer into every ounce.
name: Jackrabbit Brewing Company

description: Small batch micro-brewery in the Jackson Hole area of Wyoming.
name: Jackson Hole Brewing Comapny

description: Tasting room and brewery using fresh, home-grown ingredients.
name: Jackson Street Brewing

description:
Leinenkugel’s. The brand born in Wisconsin’s Northwoods 143 years ago, shares a powerful story of adventure, family and brewing heritage. A story of fifth generation craft brewers. And a portfolio of 11 distinctive, flavorful beers. No other brewer more passionately shares its family history or connects with its fans like Leinie’s. 

The Jacob Leinenkugel Brewing Company produced its first beer in 1867 for the thirsty lumberjacks inhabiting Wisconsin’s Northwoods. Based in Chippewa Falls, Wisconsin, the brand has continued in the rich European tradition of brewing crisp, refreshing, and delicious craft beers.
name: Jacob Leinenkugel Brewing Company

description: All new micro brewery open at Cascade Winery
name: Jaden James Brewery

description: Jagged Mountain Craft Brewery is a unique, innovative, and distinctive brewery based out of Denver, Colorado.
name: Jagged Mountain Brewery

description: We are a production craft brewery located in Laurel Maryland. In addition to serving our beers to hundreds of restaurants, bars and retailers across the state, we also operate a tap room with a capacity of 150ppl. We offer 8-12 different styles of beer for purchase by the pint, sample flight and growlers to go. Food trucks are present onsite during normal business hours.
name: Jailbreak Brewing Company

description: Some often tell me that the old Hampton Jailhouse was the overnight home to many a drunken guest through the years. It seems only fitting that beer is being brewed in this quaint little two-story brick structure built in the 1920's. It's had its history as the jail, fire station, courthouse, mason lodge, and last but not least a sandwich shop that made those little sandwiches you can buy in gas stations. You know the triangle packaged ones that have mystery meat in them? Don't lie, you've had one. Today it is home to JailHouse Brewing Company and we are brewing hand-crafted beer not punching out license plates.
name: Jailhouse Brewing Company

description: We are a two barrel (64 gallon) brewery located within the restaurant. All of the brewing process takes place right here! Our beers are created to compliment the cuisine. The beer we serve is fresh because it is made with all natural ingredients. Malted barley is added to water and boiled for nearly an hour. Fresh hops are added throughout the boil to add both flavor and aroma. This un-fermented beer is called wort and is pumped from the boil room to one of the three fomenters we have in the restaurant.
name: Jaipur Restaurant and Brewpub

description: Aggressive Beer for Aggressive Beer Drinkers.
name: JAKs Brewing

description: James River Brewery is housed in a historic 19th century tobacco warehouse on the main street of Scottsville, VA (a river town along the James River).  Come enjoy a beer in our rustic taproom or in the beer garden alongside Mink Creek.
name: James River Brewery

description: The James Street Brewery is a six barrel micro brewery which is fully on show in the Bath Brew House. As you walk into through the front door you will see our mash tun, liquor tank and copper, and then upstairs from our Tank Room you will see our three fermenting vessels. We brew a delicious range of cask conditioned ales that are sold in The Bath Brew House as well as our sister pub in Bath, The Cork.
name: James Street Brewery

description:
