Jamesport Center is a late Victorian six storefront complex. The earliest section was completed in 1890 and was occupied by the Red Andrews Saloon and the Central House Hotel. It was built by August Tiedemann, a noted local builder and architect, for two Swedish brothers, "Red" Andrew Johnson and Axel Johnson. It largely served sailors of the Great Lakes during the booming days of logging in Western Michigan.
In 1892 a second structure with decorative cast iron columns was added.(Now, entrance to Sunset Bay Antiques.) It served as the lobby of the Central House Hotel and provided a dining room, upstairs parlor rooms and additional bedrooms.
In 1905 the final four storefronts were added to provide apartments for the employees of the recently completed Star Watch Case Co., then located on nearby Rath Street. The ground level store-fronts of the buildings have been used for a wide variety of trades over the past 120 plus years, including a butcher shop, a millinery, a theatorium, a dry cleaners, a hardware store, a clothing shop, various furniture stores, the State Liquor Control Commission store, a bicycle shop, the local headquarters for the National Maritime Union, and currently, Sunset Bay Antiques and Jamesport Brewing Company
name: Jamesport Brewing Company

description: Jamul's Local Brewery is now serving our community's restaurants and pubs!! Stay up to date on where you can find the Jamul Brewing Co.® Brews!
name: Jamul Brewing Co.

description: In 1993, this Vermont brewery tradition was revived at the Norwich Inn when Jasper Murdock's Alehouse began producing traditional English-style ales in 5-gallon glass jugs. By 1995, an historic livery building was renovated and outfitted with a new four-barrel brew house, enabling 125-gallon batches. Though the vessels are now larger, we remain one of the smallest breweries in America.
name: Jasper Murdock's Alehouse / The Norwich Inn

description: Established in 1996, the Jasper Ridge Brewery produces  beer made from all natural ingredients such as malts, hops, yeast, and water and creates beer that is bursting with individual flavor, color, and aroma. We provide it to you fresh from our 10-barrel all-grain brewing system on our property. We've rediscovered the rich, enjoyable flavor of fresh brewed beer.
name: Jasper Ridge Brewery

description: Established in 1973, Jaxon's Restaurants & Brewing Co. has been providing the very best Southwestern food for over 30 years. Jaxon’s specialties include signature homemade Potato Green Chili and Tortilla soups, Santa Barbara Beef, a specially seasoned grilled sirloin served sliced with Jaxon’s own barbeque sauce; unique appetizers, fresh salads, gourmet hamburgers, hand-cut steaks, and much more! Jaxon’s “King” Margaritas and signature cocktails are acclaimed as the best in the region. Jaxon’s Brewery, the fourth oldest brew pub in the state of Texas, pours a variety of award-winning handcrafted ales and lagers. In addition, Jaxon’s offers FREE wireless Internet access and a wide range of multimedia services for business meetings and special events.
name: Jaxons Restaurant and Brewing Co

description: JDub's Brewing Company, located in sunny Sarasota, FL, is dedicated to Quality, Innovation and Culture. We celebrate our beer, our community, and life.
name: JDub's Brewing Company

description: Produce the highest quality beer with passion. Bring people together. Give back to special causes. Exercise corporate responsibility. Have fun!
name: Jekyll Brewing

description: Located in the beautiful Texas Hill Country, Jester King Craft Brewery is an authentic farmhouse brewery committed to brewing artisan ales of great depth and character. At times drawing influences from the world beyond traditional brewers’ yeast, Jester King’s beer is not rushed to market but allowed to mature – often in oak barrels – to create the most enjoyable, interesting and exciting beer we can make. An additional layer of complexity is added to Jester King’s bottled beers by allowing a second fermentation to take place in the bottle. As part of its commitment to sustainability, the slow food movement and Texas, Jester King beer uses as many organic and local ingredients as possible and will soon be brewed with harvested rainwater.
name: Jester King Craft Brewery

description:
The John A Huber Brewing Company is a family owned and operated business. Here, brewing is family

"The concept for John A. Huber Brewing Company was set in motion in 1984 with the dreams of Missouri farmboy John Huber as he tasted his first home-brewed beer. In 2003, John received a home-brew kit for Christmas from his wife and sons. It was at that moment the Huber Brew or "Hubrew", the Company's flagship beer, was born. In 2009, he opened up Homebrew Supply of Southeast Missouri, LLC in Jackson, Missouri. In 2011, the John A. Huber Brewing Company took root in Fruitland, Missouri. The Company is a family owned and operated business. John's sons, Matthew and Chad, assist their father in the Company's operation. John and his family have lived in Southeast Missouri all their lives. They want to share their passion for brewing, their sense of community and their comradery. Come join them."

Hubrew is a packaging brewery. We do not currently have any onsite sales or tours.
name: John A. Huber Brewing Company

description:
John Harvard’s boasts and extensive list of brews, ranging from the tried and true All Amrican Light Lager to the rich, roasted Dry Irish Stout. In addition, we carry a full-line of seasonal brews, so you’re sure to find the perfect beer any time of year.

When you come to John Harvard’s, please check with your server to find out what specialty beers are available, as well. Our award winning brewers offer a range of beer styles from around the world.
name: John Harvard's Brew House

description: Founded in 1758 and originally known as the Backhouse & Hartley Brewery, John Smith's Brewery traces it's roots back to Tadcaster, Yorkshire, England. The company is famous for it's Bitter and Extra Smooth Ales, which have been amongst Britain's best selling ales since the 1990s.
name: John Smith's Brewery

description: A craft microbrewery located in Historic Downtown Johnson City, TN
name: Johnson City Brewing Co

description: Welcome to a land of open fermentation, oak barrel aging, and bottle conditioning. At Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales we are dedicated to more than the traditions of old world craftsmanship. Everything we do is designed to create ales of outstanding art and flavor. Focusing on traditional rustic country style beers brought to life through labor and love, we strive to create beers to lighten the spirit, and soothe the soul. Sharing our joy to the betterment of mankind is the most that we could hope for.
name: Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales

description:
Jonas Bronck's paradise was 500 acres between the Harlem and Aquehung rivers. Several centuries later the area came to be known as The Bronx. Jonas was a farmer by trade but like many of the early pilgrims Jonas brewed his own Ale on his farm and it is established that he was the first brewer outside New York City limits

Today The Bronck's Beer Company continues Jonas' tradition by bringing you quality Crafted Ales & Lagers brewed rich in flavor while celebrating the history of this fine Borough.

Represent The Bronx by drinking Bronck's Beer. Owned and operated by 6th generation Bronx residents.
Be Proud of your Borough, Be Proud of your Beer.
name: Jonas Bronck's Beer Company

description: Jopen beers are the traditional beers from Haarlem Holland (NL). Haarlem was an important brewing town during the Middle-ages. Jopen brews a number of historic recipes and "new classics". The brewery is open in a church, thats open from 10am to 1am.
name: Jopen

description: Southern Nevada Craft Brewery Specializing in Craft Beer and Gluten Free Ales
name: Joseph James Brewing Co. Inc.

description: Brewed by Gordon Biersch Brewing Company and is also know as Trader Joe's Brewing Company.
name: Josephbrau Brewing Company

description: (No longer brewing)
name: Joshua Huddy's Brew Pub and Grill

description: A craft brewery across the street from the banks of Sloan's Lake in Edgewater, Colorado. Hop On!
name: Joyride Brewing Company

description: JT Walker’s prides itself on its’ complex and ever-changing beer list that features more than 75 bottled beers and 18 beers on tap.
name: JT Walker's Restaurant & Brewery

description: Jubeck New World Brewing is a small (nano) brewery located in downtown Dubuque, Iowa. Our mission is to create interesting and delicious craft beer for the Dubuque community.
name: Jubeck New World Brewing

description:
Jubilee Craft Beer Company, LLC was founded in 2010 by Nashville native Mark Dunkerley.  A Vanderbilt graduate, Mark spent eight years working in sports marketing and development before jumping into the beer world.  He’s a tall guy.  “Circus freak” tall, according to an old lady at the Phoenix airport.  He loves barbecue.  Actually it’s kind of an issue for him.

Mark got into craft beer on a family trip to Oregon in 2004.  The Oregon Brewers Festival opened his eyes to a whole new world of beer and he’s been hooked ever since.

Shortly after moving back to Nashville in 2009, Mark got involved with the Oasis Center through his high school friend Anderson Williams.  After a couple of beers and some brainstorming on how to get the word out about Oasis, the idea for Jubilee came up.  In March of 2010, the first batch of Jubilee Nut Brown Ale hit the shelves in Middle Tennessee, thanks to the good folks at Bluegrass Brewing Company.  In January of 2013, Jubilee brought production closer to home, partnering with Mayday Brewery in Murfreesboro TN to release Randy’s IPA.

Who’s Randy? Well…”Randy” first appeared at Mark’s mom’s 60th birthday party.  When his own mom didn’t recognize him for 15 minutes (including taking pictures with him), he knew he had a good thing going.  After all, who doesn’t love a mullet-toting, jort-wearing 6’6″ craft beer aficionado?  OK, other than Mark’s wife, who doesn’t?
name: Jubilee Craft Beer Company

description: Junction Craft Brewing is committed to brewing highest-quality, hand-crafted beers. We brew only with the natural ingredients of Water, Yeast, Barley and the world's finest Hops.
name: Junction Craft Brewing

description:
Jungle Beer was conceived by a group of friends with a passion for premium craft beer and all the other finer things in life. It is absurd to us that in tropical Asia the food have the most sophisticated flavours yet all that is usually expected from the beer is “refreshing,” “crisp,” and “cool.” That is what water is for – beer can be so much more! 

We therefore set out to create beers that embody the spirit of Singapore and the tropics - rich, vibrant, adventurous and full of character; beers that are as diverse and exciting as our cuisine; beers that don't just quench your thirst and wash down food but enrich the experience make you relish the moment. 

Unplug from the boring and ordinary – Welcome to the Jungle!
name: Jungle Beer

description: Junkyard Brewing Company was conceived as I brewed my first batch of homebrew in college. I still remember that batch; it was a five-gallon recipe with eight pounds of dark malt extract powder and eight ounces of chinook hops for the boil with a packet of dry yeast to ferment it. I "bottled" this first batch in pint-sized canning jars and judged when the natural carbonation had taken place by the "plink, plink" noises of the lids buckling upward under pressure. Friends suggested names for my first brew, and a couple stand out in my mind: "Junk's Trunk" and "Junkyard" beer. It was  nicknames like these that helped guide me toward choosing the name "Junkyard" for our brewing company when the time came to  attach a name to my idea.
name: Junkyard Brewing Company

description: Jupiter is the East Bay's most popular beerhouse, locally owned & operated, serving its own handcrafted beers & ales along with wood-fired pizzas. Housed in an old livery stable from the 1890's, Jupiter exudes a European atmosphere found in the heart of Berkeley, California. (The design was inspired by the oldest bar in Berlin.)
name: Jupiter Brewing

description: Jurnee Brewing Company (JBC) is a craft brewing partnership founded in 2010. Jurnee Brews has locations in Centreville, Virginia and Ewing, New Jersey.  This microbrewery is a collaboration of two men who themselves are on an exceptional journey to bring what was once an idea to your local watering hole. Jurnee is more than what is in the bottle, it's about how it came together...the journey. Just like in life, we have experiences throughout time that form who we are as people, it just so happens our journey culminates in a bottle.
name: Jurnee Brews

description: Brewer of american grown beer.
name: Just Beer Brewing Co.

description:
Established as Justice Brewing, LLC in 2009 I set out to open a small scale craft brewery. Having spent a few years as a homebrewer and always wanting to work for myself I attended Craft Brewing classes at Chemeketa Community College in Salem, OR and read as many books as I could on brewing. I searched for a long time trying to find a suitable place to open up and could be licensed as a Microbrewery. I finally found the location in 2011 and started the move. Then finally in 2012 went through all the legal red tape of opening Everett’s first Belgian Style brewery.

Due to current regulations in the City of Everett we are not open for retail sales. You can make an appointment if you would like a tour or make arrangements for a delivery.

Among other things we now brew AWARD WINNING BEER! Thats right our recipes are now the recipients of not only numerous Blue & Red Ribbons at the 2012 Evergreen State Fair but our “White & Nerdy” Belgian Wit won Best of Show.
name: Justice Brewing

description:
This is a nano-brewery 
​​Producing 500 barrels yearly 
With 6-to-8 beers on tap

We shipped in German Made equipment to set ourselves apart in the local industry allowing us to specialize in lighter style lager beers while keeping the favorites such as Porter's, ESB's, IPA's and other classic Ales.  
​​
​O​ur reverse osmosis water purifier allows us to control the quality of water during each and every brew. ​​​
​
​Mike Waddy, our brew master, has over years of experience creating beer recipes and hand crafting beers consumed by many New Mexican beer enthusiasts.
name: Kaktus Brewing Company

description:
Glacier National Park, Flathead Lake, Bob Marshall Wilderness Complex, snowcapped peaks, miles of hiking trails, raging whitewater rivers, deep fresh powder: Kalispell Brewing Company is proud to call the Flathead Valley home.  When we aren’t out exploring new trails or skiing fresh powder, we’re proudly brewing handcrafted lagers and ales in Montana’s Glacier country.  And after a full day of adventure who doesn’t want a Montana-made beer?

Kalispell Brewing Company has a 10 barrel brewhouse with an additional third vessel which allows us to do decoction mashes. Decoction mashing is an old process which harkens back to continental Europe that allowed brewers to extract sugars from under-modified malts more effectively.  It is no longer necessary to efficiently extract the sugars but with our malt forward lagers, decoction mashing produces a melanoidin-laden wort, which our yeast turns into in a truly complex and well-balanced Montana-made beer.  Sure, we could try to compensate with specialty grains, but it just wouldn't taste the same. With our lager beers, we’re after superior taste. Decoction mashes may take more time and be more labor intensive but we believe, like all good things, it’s worth the wait.
name: Kalispell Brewing Company

description:
Kalnapilis is a Lithuanian brewery, established by Albert Foight in Panev?žys in 1902. A landowner of German origin, Foight named the brewery "Bergschlösschen", meaning a small castle on the hill. In 1918, the name was changed to a Lithuanian equivalent of Bergschlösschen, Kalnapilis.

Kalnapilis was taken over by Baltic Beverages Holding (established by Pripps of Sweden and Hartwall of Finland) in 1994. Ownership passed to Royal Unibrew in 2001, which merged the Kalnapilis with Tauras brewery in Vilnius into AB Kalnapilio-Tauro Grup?.

In April 1996, new fermentation and storage equipment enabled significantly different processing, the result being the introduction of three new brands. The brewery has an annual maximum capacity of 600,000 hectolitres.

Kalnapilis won 2 gold awards at the 2004 World Beer Cup, the Olympics of beer competitions; one in the German Style Heller Bock or Maibock category, for 'Kalnapilis 7.3', and one in the Muenchener style Helles category, for 'Kalnapilis Original'.

The brand has a significant presence in sports advertising, and promotes a sporty image.
name: Kalnapilis Brewery

description:
We, at Kalona Brewing Company, are passionate for quality, are uniquely offbeat-but substantial, creative, warm and inclusive. 

We believe you will find that reflected in both the products we brew and in the restaurant atmosphere we create for your dining and drinking enjoyment. 
One of our goals is to be Kalona’s living room – a place where people can come to relax, relate, and have some recreation playing scrabble or dominos by the fireplace in the sofa area of the restaurant. Plus we have a fantastic beer garden to enjoy during the warmer weather.

Kalona Brewing Company and Eatery is strategically located in beautiful downtown Kalona at 405 B Avenue, a half hour drive south from Iowa City.

The brewery is home to a fifteen barrel brewing system from Newlands Systems Inc., which includes a three vessel brew house, four 15bbl fermenters, two 30bbl fermenters and two 15bbl bright tanks.
name: Kalona Brewing Company

description:
We’ve been retailing here since 1986, the Topiwala family with mom and pop and three brothers as well as the help of a handful of invaluable staff members. Pop started in the recession years of Reaganomics, thru the boom of Clintonia and still strong despite George II & the current class wars. Starting as a convenience store & gas station, we’ve been evolving from pretty much day one, trying to offer quality and service like our friendly Travis Heights neighbors and fellow Austinites deserve.

We are committed to sustainable, local, and organic & natural produce and groceries with our offerings on the shelf as well as our kitchen menu (No high fructose corn syrup or MSG!!!) With 72 taps of beer available, we are quite picky on what we present with only quality brews that go with our food.

We also enjoy giving back to the community with nonprofit fundraisers and support for grassroots organizations.

We serve our very own authentic and unique Gujarati-style Indian food, mom approved.

Beer by the pint & wine by the glass make it that much more of a yummy pairing.

Our own brews are specifically designed for our menu items!

Also enjoy live music in our unique intimate and awesome music room, or at least our staff selections of eclectic tunes.
name: Kamala Brewing at the Whip In

description: Kane Brewing Company is a new craft brewery located on the coast of New Jersey. Our focus will be on American style and Belgian influenced ales. All of our handcrafted beers will be unfiltered and brewed locally in our custom built two-vessel brew house located in Ocean in Monmouth County. Our beers will be self-distributed and available on draft at restaurants and bars in coastal and northern New Jersey. We plan to launch in the spring of 2011.
name: Kane Brewing

description:
West of the Rockies there is an ancient volcano known as the Grand Mesa, the largest geographic feature in the world of its kind. From this mountain runs a creek called Kannah that flows into the high desert of the Grand Valley of Colorado and offers some of the purest water in the United States.  At the foot of the Mesa, we stand, Kannah Creek Brewing Company, where we turn this pure, untouched snowmelt into award winning classic American craft ale.

Since 2005 Kannah Creek has been turning the finest ingredients and a privileged water source into amazing craft ale with a focus on quality and tradition.  With several awards to our name and a town full of friends we found demand soaring, and our 7 barrel system couldn't keep up. We have expanded into a 12,000 sq. ft., state of the art 30 barrel production facility, Edgewater, in South Downtown, Grand Junction, Colorado.
name: Kannah Creek Brewing Company

description: Authentic German-style lagers and ales available in local taverns, restaurants, and the brewery tasting room.
name: Kansas City Bier Company

description:
We like beer. A lot. 

Our background is in the beer biz. Everything from distribution and importing to German training and brewery operations. A few years ago we had an opportunity that would allow us to open up our own brewery. We jumped on it.

We’re extremely excited about this project, and we think it shows in everything we do. This is just plain fun for us. The day it starts to feel like a job is the day when lightning shall strike us dead. Cause, hey, at the end of the day we're making beer. And beer is fun.

Join us, it should be a kick ass ride with some cool stops along the way!
name: Karbach Brewing Company

description: Karl Strauss Brewing Company has pioneered the San Diego beer scene since 1989 with innovative beer releases like Mosaic Session Ale, Big Barrel IIPA, and Wreck Alley Imperial Stout. The brewery has won 67 medals over the past five years and its Red Trolley Ale is one of the most award-winning beers in the world. The company is currently ranked #45 on the list of the country’s top craft breweries with sole distribution in California. For more information visit www.karlstrauss.com or call the brewery at (858) 273-2739. Share it. Cheers.
name: Karl Strauss Brewing Company

description:
We're a small Micro Brewery nestled right into downtown Red Bud, Illinois. The name comes from a local river located just a few miles away and is a popular summer boating destination for the local area. The brewery was also named after the first state capitol of Illinois which was Kaskaskia, Illinois.

The brewery is located in a 150 year old building in the Heart of Red Bud and the brewhouse is capable of pumping out about 4 Barrels of beer per batch. We're a small brewery but the small size allows us to stay creative and keep a variety of different beers on throughout the year. Stop on in and try a flight, have a pint, or take a growler to go. We're beer enthusiasts and look forward to your visit!
name: Kaskaskia Brewing Company

description:
Kassik's Kenai Brew Stop is housed in a small warehouse, nestled in a clearing in the woods, adjacent to the Kassik’s home in Nikiski.   Frank's passion for brewing began when his wife Debara, bought him a home brew kit for Christmas. Frank was hooked and soon became a proficient home brewer.  They built a 36 X 50 shop in hopes to someday have a brewery.  In May of 2005 Kassik's purchased a used seven barrel system, and then remodeled their building to accommodate the equipment with the help of family and friends.  The brewery opened Memorial Weekend 2006 with their first brew Beaver Tail Blonde, their Moose Point Porter was on tap a few weeks later.

Kassik’s has 8 brews on tap.  We are open 6 days a week during the winter, and daily during the summer (May - August).
name: Kassik's Brewery

description: Katabatic Brewing Company is ready to take craft beer in Montana to the next level. Katabatic was founded by Montanans that are passionate about crafting full-bodied beer and building a local beer culture based on Montana traditions. Our beers embody Montana's individualistic pride, majestic scenery and tough past. Our tagline, "Rugged, Yet Refined," captures the rugged mountains that surround Livingston and the refined quality of our beer.
name: Katabatic Brewing Company

description:
The Kauai Beer Company will be a neighborhood microbrewery producing small quantities of high-quality beer for sale to individuals and local restaurants. Our beer will be available in our tasting room, as well as for sale to-go in durable, refillable growlers (large stainless-steel bottles with resealable tops). 

Hopefully starting in mid January we will be open for lunch and have food every day we are open.  

Please visit our website www.kauaibeer.com 
Or follow us on http://instagram.com/kauaibeer and https://twitter.com/KauaiBeer
name: Kauai Beer Company

description:
Located in downtown Port Allen, “The Worlds Westernmost Brewery” and Kauai’s only brewpub, Kauai Island Brewery & Grill is open for business and eager to serve the Island of Kauai’s craft beer drinkers!

Kauai Island Brewing Company (KIBC) has its origins in Waimea Brewing Company, which had been located on the historic Waimea Plantations. When the lease was up, owners Bret and Janice Larson, along with their brewmaster Dave Curry and his wife Christina, decided to come together and become co-owners of their newly created Kauai Island Brewing Company, moving locations to Port Allen where they would have more space to brew the delicious beers they were known for. 

After eight months of renovation, Kauai Island Brewing Company has its home in the industrial building complex of Port Allen Center, with an industrial theme to go along with both its surroundings and purpose of crafting quality beers. Its 35-foot high corrugated metal ceilings and walls give it an open and spacious feel. The retro atmosphere with chandelier lights hanging from the ceiling, a catwalk leading to the second story mezzanine over the entrance, and picture perfect views of the sunset over Port Allen bay from the second story window makes it hard to say goodbye to this beautiful place.

We offer up to 10 of our own handcrafted in-house beers as well as several guest microbrewed beers, all on draft. If you can't stay for a pint, that's okay! We sell 64-ounce growlers that you can fill and take with you, as well as kegs available for customer pickup.
name: Kauai Island Brewery & Grill

description: Kaweah brewing Co. is a small scale hand crafted brewery! Every batch is made with finest ingredients available!
name: Kaweah Brewing Co.

description:
A fine and successful Ontario microbrewery, Kawartha Lakes has been producing tasty beers for almost four years. Beginning in 1996 with their now-famous Raspberry Wheat Ale and Pale Ale as draught-only selections in Ontario pubs, the brewery developed a strong following with beer connoisseurs.

The brewery added Nut Brown Ale and Cream Ale to their slate, and offered their ales in oversize 473mL bottles for sale at only at the brewery. This led to many beer pilgrimages by this writer to Peterborough to satisfy my thirst.

Luckily, Kawartha Lakes now distributes their Raspberry Wheat and Cream Ale in 12-packs in a growing number of Beer Stores. Due to the immense popularity of KLB beers, their Nut Brown Ale will also be available in Beer Stores beginning in September. Drinkers who desire their fine Pale Ale must still trek up to Central Ontario, but hopefully this brew will follow sometime in the future and round out their slate.

Kawartha Lakes was recently written up in the National Post, with the headline on March 8 reading: "The last thing thriving Kawartha Lakes Brewing needs is more customers". It is great to see an Ontario microbrewery succeeding, which has been something of a rarity in this province's microbrewery industry over the last few years.
name: Kawrtha Lakes Brewing Company

description:
We are a destination brewery in Central Massachusetts with a focus on creating the highest quality German and American style ales and lagers. We brew many classic styles and seasonal varieties using imported malt and ingredients from local farms.

After a year of serving our beer exclusively by the growler out of our brewery by Webster Lake, we have expanded our operations by moving to a larger space in downtown Webster. Our new brewery taproom and outdoor beer garden by the riverwalk is a generous space where our patrons can enjoy beer by the glass, local musicians, and friendly conversation.
name: KBC Brewery & Beer Garden

description:
Keegan Ales was founded in early 2003 when Tommy Keegan learned about an empty building in Kingston that nobody would buy because there was a defunct brewery stuck in it! (Although the building was built in the early 1800?s, the building was most recently home to the Woodstock Brewing Company.)

After months of cleaning and rebuilding, Keegan Ales brewed its first batch of beers on August 1, 2003(Tommy’s mom’s birthday) and set out hand-selling beer to local bars and restaurants early September. The first kegs of Old Capital, Hurricane Kitty and Mother’s Milk went to competition at Hunter Mountain that month. Mother’s Milk took home a gold medal and Old Capital was honored with People’s Choice: Best of Show.

After getting the brewery up and running selling draft beer, the crew at Keegan Ales turned their attention to the defunct bottling line. It had been left broken and literally in hundreds of pieces. It took months of pounding, tinkering and countless scratching of heads, but by the summer of 2004, Keegan Ales was available in 12 ounce bottles!
name: Keegan Ales

description: Brewery Craftbeer House Brewed Beers in 20oz Pints
name: Keg & Lantern

description:
Keg Creek Brewing Company is a microbrewery located in Glenwood, IA that produces small batch craft beer. 

We will have an on-site tasting room, serving pints and offering growler purchase and refill. Additional products offered for sale at our location will include 5 gallon kegs, 22 oz bottles, T-Shirts and Caps. Our beer will also be available at many bars and wineries in the local area. Opening planned for August 2011.
name: Keg Creek Brewing Company

description: (No longer brewing)
name: Keihan Uji Kotsu

description: Pubs (from "public houses") have a long and colorful history. Before the rise of large-scale beer manufacturers, people got their beers from local makers. A good beer was cherished and the brewmaster was well-respected for his skill. We liked the idea of having a pub with it's own beer on Kelleys Island. We thought the brews we made could be expressive of the Island's inherent magic. So we started down the road of learning the craft and conceptualizing our brews.
name: Kelleys Island Brewery
Kellys Caribbean Bar and Grill & Brewery

description: Kelsen Brewing company is a new nano brewery in Southern New Hampshire creating craft beers full of flavor and pushing the limits of style.  We have a 3BBL brewing system and we have an onsite tasting room where you can purchase bottles and growler fills.
name: Kelsen Brewing Company

description: Brewing extraordinary lagers which highlight the simple beauty of well crafted, local beers since 2006.
name: KelSo Beer Company

description: The Keltek Brewery is a multi award winning Brewery situated in Redruth, Cornwall.
name: Keltek Brewery

description:
Kenai River Brewing Company is a microbrewery specializing in handcrafted ales.  Compliment your adventure, whether fishing, hiking, snow machining, or just relaxing, with freshly brewed beer.

Support locally brewed beer by asking for Kenai River Brewing Company at your favorite bar or restaurant.
name: Kenai River Brewing Company

description:
The Kennebec River Pub & Brewery is located at Northern Outdoors Adventure Resort in the North Woods logging village of The Forks, Maine. Northern Outdoors is New England's most diverse and accessible adventure destination, offering an authentic outdoor experience and first class amenities in any season. The brewery began pouring pints for thirsty woodcutters, rafters, hikers, snowmobilers and tourists at the resort, in January 1997.

Kennebec River beers are unfiltered and all natural, with no preservatives, additives or stabilizers. We handcraft our beers with the utmost care, using the finest malted barley, premium domestic and imported hops, superior yeasts, and pure water. Good flavorful beer, brewed in small batches right here in the North Woods of Maine! Cheers!
name: Kennebec River Pub & Brewery

description: Kennett Brewing Company believes that everyone deserves extraordinary beer. This philosophy and attitude stems from our founders’ personal journey in craft brewing. Years of pursuing excellent traditional and inventive beers led to the discovery that enjoying the greatest beers was not easily achieved. Ours was a flavor odyssey, searching for representative and unique beer from around the world and bearing whatever cost necessary. Ultimately, the founders of KBC decided to make these great beers themselves. Together they dedicated over 13 years of research, practice, and achievement to develop their own beers to the category of extraordinary. Through a combination of replicating traditional styles and creating innovative interpretations, KBC provides a tasting experience like no other. Our customers have the opportunity to affordably enjoy the finest beers flavors from around the world at a single location. From traditional English styles to the groundbreaking innovations of America’s West Coast, customers explore flavors that may take a lifetime to enjoy. At Kennett Brewing Company, everyone drinks extraordinary beer.
name: Kennett Brewing Company

description: The Kensington Brewing Company is a small, independently owned and operated craft beer company located in the heart of Kensington Market, Toronto.
name: Kensington Brewing Company

description:
The Kern River Brewing Company (KRBC) brings people back to the magnificent simplicities that life has to offer.

From its beginnings, Kernville has been a wild-west town.  Established as a mining settlement in the mid 1800's and continuing as a ranching community through the 1900's, Kernville remains a town of adventure, offering a wide variety of outdoor activities.  On any given day, the outdoor enthusiast enjoys activities ranging from the excitement of whitewater rafting, kayaking, downhill skiing, cross-country skiing, snowmobiling, horseback riding, attending rodeos, windsurfing, water-skiing, mountain biking and climbing.  If a more relaxing day is preferred, people can enjoy fishing, hiking, camping, sailing, antiquing, and bird watching or simply kicking back and taking in the spectacular views of the Sierra Nevada mountain range.
name: Kern River Brewing Company

description:
It’s 1991. Tim O’Leary, a third generation Montanan was living in Colorado, finding his way working for NOAA, mountain biking and skiing… and feeling a little bit like a fish out of water. Colorado is a beautiful state, but Montana was home. One afternoon on his bike ride home, he spotted a new business that had cropped up in Boulder. It was a Brew on Premise (BOP) – a place where customers could come in and brew their own beer. Having dabbled in homebrewing for a few years, he tried it and thought, “This is my ticket back home.”

Fast forward to 1995. Tim and his wife, Suzy Rizza, open Missoula’s first BOP. Lots of people came to try it, and lots of people had a great time doing it. It wasn’t quite making the bills though, and for the next 13 years, through good times and worse times - Tim was the guiding force behind the transformation of the Kettlehouse into a small microbrewery and neighborhood taproom.
name: Kettlehouse Brewing Company

description:
Keuka Brewing Co., LLC opened its doors to the public in the fall of 2008 is overlooking beautiful Keuka Lake, the brewery’s namesake, in the heart of the Finger Lakes. It is the first Microbrewery on this breathtaking lake and the only microbrewery on the Keuka Lake wine trail. Surrounded by some of New York State’s best wineries, Keuka Brewing offers an alternate world-class epicurean experience for wary wine drinkers and beer connoisseurs alike. 

Keuka Brewing is owned and operated by Linda & Richard Musso. Bringing years of home brewing experience to the business, Keuka Brewing uses only premium ingredients of malted barley, wheat, and a variety of hops to produce a wide array of top grade hand crafted ales and delicious beers to this unique region.
name: Keuka Brewing Company

description: Keweenaw Brewing Company is the hops-induced vision of Dick Gray and Paul Boissevain. Dick, a Michigan Tech graduate was looking for a way to return to the Copper Country. Paul, meanwhile, was introduced to - and seduced by - the crystal clear waters of nearby Lake Superior, the beauty of the surrounding area, and the small-town charm of Houghton, Michigan. The two men, whose passion for beer runs as deep as Superior, are the driving force behind Keweenaw Brewing Company.
name: Keweenaw Brewing Company

description:
Kichesippi Beer is a family owned business, brewing in Ottawa, Ontario.

The question we get asked the most is; a Cool name, what does it mean?Kichesippi is a word meaning "The Great River". Prior to 1855, when the City of Ottawa was founded, the Ottawa River was known as the Kichesippi. The river has consistently been an integral part of the history of Ottawa and Eastern Ontario.

We have been involved with the beer industry since 1995 in many different capacities. Working with breweries in Halifax, Toronto and Guelph introduced us to array of beer from around the world. Everything from British Columbia craft beer, to brands from Belgium, Germany and Japan; have fueled our passion for great beer.
name: Kichesippi Beer Company

description:
Microbrewery now open in Commerce Township, MI.

Started by two homebrewing friends, this dream turned reality is bringing a variety of styles and flavors to the local beer enthusiasts.

15 BBL system.
name: Kickstand Brewing Company

description:
Kilowatt Brewing produces unique styled, hand-crafted beer located in the Kearny Mesa neighborhood. Creative and interactive lighting permeates throughout the brewery and taproom featuring rotating artwork created by local artists. Custom programmed LED lighting allows us to change the lighting color and mood in real-time while our customers enjoy Kilowatt’s unique beer styles in a one-of-a-kind taproom.

Kilowatt rotates in outside chefs and gourmet food trucks providing different styles of food and menus daily, while allowing you to experience select culinary items paired with complimentary styles of beer. For example an Asian style food truck will pair unique menu items with Kilowatt’s Green Tea Ale, Coconut Chai Porter, or Goji Berry Mountain Honey Ale.
name: Kilowatt Brewing

description:
Kilted Dragon’s New location will continue to provide a unique line-up of hand-crafted beers in Garden City and can be found at other pub and restaurant locations around the Boise region. Kilted Dragon joins the Boise craft beer revolution with a new spectrum of flavor.
Partnering with businesses in the Boise area and beyond, Kilted Dragon Brewing is a part of the hand-crafted beer community, the Boise Business community and regional art and music groups. In addition to excellent beer, you’ll find live music, art and food as a standard sustenance feature at the Tap House Tasting room in Garden City.
name: Kilted Dragon

description: The first offering from Kind Beers hit store shelves and restuarants in the Charlotte, North Carolina market in the summer of 2008. Since the introduction, our beers have made their way into establishments all over the Southeastern United States.
name: Kind Beer Distributing

description:
Kinetic Brewing Company is the premier microbrewery in Lancaster, CA, located just 50 miles north of Los Angeles in the heart of the historic and newly gentrified downtown, The BLVD.
Featuring international pub cuisine and fine American craft beer from Southern California and beyond.
name: Kinetic Brewing Company

description:
King Brewery is committed to brewing stylistically authentic, ultra premium beer, and offers an unprecedented combination: The craftsmanship and premium nature of Old World brewing, combined with the freshness of a local product. King Brewery is dedicated to using leading edge thinking and technology to produced beer that rivals the best imports in both taste and quality.

King Brewery is an award winning brewer of truly authentic world class lagers. We brew using only the finest imported European ingredients in a state of the art traditional German style brewery.

Toronto Star newspaper declared King Brewery Pilsner "Beer of the Year" and our Pilsner won the gold at the 2010 Canadain Beer Awards. Simply the best in class.

Drop by and sample our very saaz hoppy gold medal Czech style Pilsner and our authentic nutty-chocolate German style Dunkel Dark Lager or our true to style Vienna Lager.
name: King Brewery

description:
We brew classic styles with a California coastal twist by sourcing unique ingredients to emphasize flavor profiles and the drinking experience - hoppy pale ales that use subtle fruit additions to brighten hop character, an American style brown ale blended with a cold press coffee, and a Saison brewed with locally sourced lemon verbena and lemon peel.  

And when we are not brewing we can usually be found on the beach, at Dodgers or Kings game, or shooting birdies on the links.  For us, an awesome beer is part of an awesome experience.
name: King Harbor Brewing Company

description: Kingdom brewing is the Northern most Brewery in the state Of Vermont. Located withing Seconds of the Canadian Border . Half way between the equator and the North Pole.
name: Kingdom Brewing

description: Browar Kingpin is in the vanguard of the polish craft beer revolution. We brew uncompromising, bold beer using custom,  add-ons. Try our American Pale Ale, American India Pale Ale, Witbier, Foreign Extra Stout and many, many more.
name: Kingpin

description: Kinkaider Brewing Co. is a farm brewery located in Broken Bow the gateway to the beautiful sandhills of Nebraska.
name: Kinkaider

description:
Kinky Kabin Brewing Company LLC, Founded in October 2011, is a microbrewery that combines the love of craft brewing with the love of seduction and naughtiness. We promise that it "goes down good".

Our beer celebrates lowering inhibitions of people, so that they get into a frisky, naughty, seductive, flirty, sexy mood. Both men and women will love it. The taboo of keeping sensuality hush-hush is being overwritten. We encourage people to become lustful yet classy, and our marketing strategy will be seductive and classy as well.
name: Kinky Kabin Brewing Company

description: Kinnegar Brewing makes a  range of finely crafted, all natural farmhouse beers. The brewery is named after the nearby Kinnegar Beach  just north of Rathmullan in County Donegal.
name: Kinnegar Brewing

description: Kinney Creek Brewery started out as a love for beer, and a lack of quality brewed, right priced beer.  After making home brew for a small test group,  things got bigger and bigger.  Now we are making several varieties of beer to accommodate the need for great Midwest Brewed beer.  We source as many of our ingredients that we can from our local neighbors to bring you the very freshest and eco-friendly beer on the market.,   Currently we are expanding our facility, increasing our advertising, expanding our exposure to local bars & restaurants, and introducing our product to new customers.  So please watch for us in your neighborhood.
name: Kinney Creek Brewery

description: Contract brewed by Gordon Biersch, CA and The Matt Brewing Company, NY.
name: Kirkland Signature / Costco Wholesale Corporation

description: Kirkwood Station Restaurant and Brewing Co. is located just a block north of the historic train station in beautiful downtown Kirkwood Missouri, a southwest suburb of St. Louis. Established in 2009, we are building a tradition of taste, quality, service and charm. With our award winning craft beer, exceptional food, and fabulous live music, the focus is on our guests and great times! Sit back with friends and enjoy the wonderful food and craft beer as you play billiards, throw darts, watch the game, or dance the night away. Whether it’s a small gathering or a party of 275 guests, Kirkwood Station wants you to enjoy the ride.
name: Kirkwood Station Brewing Company

description: Located in Hungary, Búzavirág street 70. Dombóvár. They produce 5 types of bier and make spirits from bier as well.
name: Kissler Sörfőzde

description:
Kissmeyer Beer and Brewing was launched in 2010 after ten years at Nørrebro Bryghus. The company spans over three main areas of business:

Kissmeyer Beer: My personal beer brand offering my own and collaborative beers at home and abroad.

Kissmeyer Brewing:  My consultancy business offering services related mainly to the brewing industry.

Kissmeyer Beer & Brewing: I offer a wide range of communication services including beer tastings and presentations.
name: Kissmeyer Beer & Brewing

description:
The beginning The Kiuchi Brewery was established in 1823 by Kiuchi Gihei, the headman of Kounosu village. His family was collecting rice from farmers as land taxes for the Mito Tokugawa family. He began his brewery with the idea of using the remaining rice stocks in the warehouse. At this time in Japan a new political movement began to reform the Tokugawa regime. Fujita Toko, one of the movement's activists, advocated an ideology to build a new organizational government with a reverence of the emperor, and his thought led to the Meiji Restoration.

Fujita was a close friend of Kiuchi, who named one of his sakes "KIKUSAKARI" as a respect to the emperor. KIKU (chrysanthemum) is a crest of the imperial household, and SAKARI means 'property'.

1950's Mikio Kiuchi inherited the brewery legacy in 1950. It was the time when the sake industry flourished as the rapid growth of Japan's economy after the World War II. Although many sake breweries started mass producing low quality sake due to increased demand, Kiuchi Brewery maintained their policy of pursuing the best quality of sake with the optimum ingredients and craftsman-ship.

Hitachino Beer In autumn 1996, Kiuchi started beer brewing business, named the brand "HITACHINO NEST BEER" with unique owl character logo.
Over the years, Kiuchi Brewery has gained Japan and worldwide attention by winning awards at numerous world beer competitions.
In 2000, Brew on Premises facilities has opened to introduce the Lager is the main stream in the beer industries in Japan.

Shochu Kiuchi Kiuchi built a Distillation facility in March, 2003. to aid with recycling and reduction of waste, beginning with the production of "Shochu Kiuchi" Distilled liquor made from Sakekasu (Sake lees) which is the by-product of Sake Brewing.

The wine brewing project is the latest challenge of Kiuchi Brewery. Kiuchi bought 4000 square meters of land next to the brewery for the vineyard. The grape seedlings, Merlot and Chardoney were imported from France. The vineyard produced its first crop in 2000.

In 2004, 3 tonnes of grapes were harvested producing 2000 Litres of Wine. This wine is hoped to be able to offer on a market as another prestigious Kiuchi brand in the near future...
name: Kiuchi Brewery

description: Knee Deep Brewing Company is known for brewing big, hoppy West Coast style brews. We love hops and love finding ways to create excellent beers by blending our Humulus lupulus friends together.
name: Knee Deep Brewing Company

description: The newest craft brewery in Maui, equipped with a large tasting room and awesome vibe! We have six flagship beers as well as a number of specialty brews that will be rotated in and out.
name: Kohola Brewery

description: Koi Pond Brewing Company, LLC is soon-to-be Rocky Mount’s first brewery, an eastern NC craft brewery that we can all be proud of! We are in the process of establishing all the necessary relationships...permits...licenses...contacts...and friends to become a PREMIER craft brewery rooted in Rocky Mount! We look forward to sharing this journey with our friends and we welcome all of you to join in watching us grow!
name: Koi Pond Brewing Company

description: Kokopelli Beer Company is a small brewpub located in the Solaire Shoppes at 8931 Harlan Street in Westminster Colorado, just across from the future Westminster Mall renovation. We enjoy brewing quality handcrafted ales and meeting new folks, so we decided to put them together. As a brew pub, we offer a small menu to compliment our ales with items such as pizzas, sandwiches, salads and more.
name: Kokopelli Beer Company
Koliba a pivovar u tří králů

description:
Barry Nalebuff, co-founder of Honest Tea and a professor at the Yale School of Management, and Ariel Glazer, a natural foods entrepreneur and former Goldman Sachs analyst, met while trekking the Tiger Leaping Gorge in Southwest China.  According to legend, in order to escape a hunter, a tiger leaped across the vast gorge and made it to safety. Barry and Ariel's encounter was a bit less dramatic. They met at a guesthouse midway through the trek.
 
After completing the second day of the trek, on the long bus ride back to the nearest town, Ariel and Barry found themselves yapping and sharing their culinary endeavors with each other.  And soon realized that they shared the same entrepreneurial values and, of course, the love of making wholesome and delicious food and drink.
 
The idea of making kombucha that is low in calories, delicious, and slightly alcoholic had been brewing in Barry's mind for a while.  John Hillgen, one of Barry's students at Yale School of Management, a doctor and a co-owner of several wine stores, fell in love with this concept and suggested that they start a business together.
 
When Barry and John were ready to start an alcoholic kombucha business, they asked Ariel to join.  Kombrewcha was born.
name: Kombrewcha

description: Kona Brewing Company was started by father and son team Cameron Healy and Spoon Khalsa. The pair had a dream to create fresh, local island brews made with spirit, passion and quality. Their love of Hawaii, and a desire to protect the pristine environment here, brought them to the Big Island to fulfill their vision. Kona Brewing continues to be headquartered right where it began, in Kailua-Kona on Hawaii's Big Island.
name: Kona Brewing Company

description: The Royal Brewery of Krušovice is a Czech brewery, established in 1581 by Jiří Birka in the village of Krušovice. The brewery gained a contract to provide beer to Emperor Rudolf II in 1583, allowing them to use the Imperial Crown of Austria as part of the company's logo. The company was acquired by Heineken in July 2007.
name: Königliche Brauerei Krušovice

description: Royal Grolsch B.V. is one of the largest breweries in the Netherlands. It is best known for its 'beugel' bottle design.
name: Koninklijke Grolsch

description:
Kooinda, meaning ‘ Happy Place’, is an award winning boutique brewery producing handcrafted, quality Australian made ales.

Kooinda brewed ales are unfiltered and use only the finest available malted barley, hops, water and yeast.
name: Kooinda Boutique Brewery

description: Kootenai River Brewing Company is a local family owned restaurant and brewery with a strong sense of community and enthusiasm for its customers! Located in beautiful downtown Bonners Ferry, ID. we offer a lunch and dinner menu complete with homemade soups and desserts. The KRBC sits alongside the banks of the Kootenai River with spectacular views of the mountains from both inside the restaurant and outside on our deck (open seasonally). We offer a variety of wines in addition to our hand-crafted beer which is brewed on sight. The restaurant is family oriented and we love sports! Three flat screen televisions broadcast football, hockey, soccer, basketball, etc. depending on the season. Please join us daily at 11 a.m., 7 days a week for a terrific dining experience.
name: Kootenai River Brewing Company

description: Plevna was established in 1994, in the old Finlayson cotton mills, and it is the only genuine brewery pub in Tampere, producing a vast selection of beers made on the premises. Since its opening, Plevna has been one of the most popular meeting places for local people and visitors alike. Koskipanimo is the actual brewery housed in the same premises.
name: Koskipanimo / Plevna Brewery Pub & Restaurant

description: KrashBrewery was created to make the best beer in the World.
name: Krash Brewery

description: Kriemer's sits on the banks of the Great Miami River. Outside dining is available seasonally. River Bar opens the first weekend in May every year.
name: Kreimers Bier Haus

description: The area where Krogh's Restaurant & Brew Pub now stands was a beautiful meadow with a meandering stream until the early 1920's. By the end of the decade, the dream had been fulfilled, the dam was built and Lake Mohawk was formed.
name: Krogh's Restaurant and Brewpub

description:
The brewery was founded on 4 February 1803 by John Haas. His father, Johann Eberhard Haas chatted in Krombach an inn. As for a Regulation of 25 July 1618 serving of beer was only allowed if the restaurant also had its own brewery and a malt kiln, John Haas set up a brewery in the family business. 

The water for the brewery ("Hasbrauerei") they picked first in barrels from a spring at the foot of the Grumbergs in the west of the village by bullock carts to brewery. 1854 had a brewery owner Haas church annual 17 Gulden (Florin) pay rent that the water pipeline was conducted on church land to the village.
name: Krombacher Gruppe

description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.
name: Kuhnhenn Brewing

description:
We, the Kulmbacher Brewery, oblige ourselves day-in, day-out to ensure that we live up to the expectations of Kulmbach, the quintessential beer town.

We both challenged ourselves to be and promise to genuine beer lovers that we will continue to make Kulmbach the secret capital of beer. We are beholden to the lovers of our beers. For them we mobilise our whole competence, knowledge and centuries-long tradition and experience of our brewmasters, in order to brew a first-class beer.
name: Kulmbacher Brauerei AG

description: We are a new brewery on James street in Bellingham Washington. We have a lovely tap room you can come and visit, as well as a dart board and a nice sitting area. For us, it’s all about the beer. Come in and try some! Or you can visit one of the many establishments around town that are already carrying our brews.
name: Kulshan Brewing Company

description:
Based in Quebec, microbrewery La Barberie since 1997 excels in the art of brewing premium beers to delight your taste buds!

Open daily from 12:00 to 1:00 AM, the tasting room (along the terrace in summer) offers regular rotation in a selection of eight beers varying the days and seasons. A small area set can accommodate groups of less than 25 people.

To your health!
name: La Barberie

description:
This Belgian farmhouse brewery is located in the middle of Pipaix, in the Wallonian Hainut region (15 km from Tournai, 74 km from Brussels). This family-owned brewery is named after the steam engines which power the brewing process. Their saison (seasonal) beers reflect the Wallonian brewing tradition, as there are many spices in the beers, although all their beers are spiced. They hold public brewing sessions from 9-12 noon, the last Saturday of each month.  Call ahead to reserve a spot; tours are in French and English. They serve a grand lunch buffet along with their beers in their brasserie across the street (30 € per person). Check the website or call for more information. 
La Brasserie à Vapeur brews these beers: Saison de Pipaix (saison), Vapeur en Folie (lager), Vapeur Legere (lager), Vapeur Cochonne (amber-style).
name: La Brasserie à Vapeur

description:
Over the next few years, our headbrewer will develop both the business and brewing skills to establish a nanobrewery outside of Philadelphia. From Manayunk to West Chester, this swathe of land boasts some of the most well-informed, enthusiastic, and--frankly--fanatical beer fans. It would be our honor and pleasure to provide them fresh, small batch, artisanal beer with an emphasis on seasonality and occasionality.

La Cabra is a nanobrewery in the planning, a porfolio of beers over the last 7 years of homebrewing. Small-batch, labor intensive, and patient brewing produces ale and lager styles of distinct quality, integrity, and creativity.
name: La Cabra Brewing

description:
Cagole the creeks is a girl; It is the brainchild of two childhood friends at a cocktail in a shed Sormiou.

Both nostalgic old Marseille and beer lovers, the cronies have devised a beer the color of the Old Port of Pagnol. A golden beer with a Provencal accent, that Caesar and Marius could have gone to the terrace of the Bar of the Navy.

This adventure is also a way to honor the elders that were the glorious Phoenix beers, brewed Velten and Marx in Marseille
name: La Cagole

description:
La Cumbre Brewing Co. is what happens when two people take one thing altogether way too seriously. Beer is what we do. It’s all we do.
 
The best beer money can make; the best beer money can buy. Simple as that.
 
Sure, we could tell you about the quality ingredients, the state of the art equipment, the commitment to traditional brewing methods… But all you really need to know is that our brewer is the pickiest SOB on earth, especially when it comes to the beer he drinks.
 
Well, this is the beer he drinks.
 
And we guarantee that you won’t find better beer anywhere.
name: La Cumbre Brewing Company

description:
ROSITA, the main brand, is a honey-colored ale, that delivers elegance with a certain density in the glass, ivory tones with white foam, creamy and consistent with a wholesome persistence. Due to the presence of secondary fermentation yeast, the appearance is cloudy.

We recommend tasting it cold, not frozen (42 to 46ºF) in order to envelop its aromatic presence.

Ones olfactory will detect fruit such as banana and red apple notes along with molasses which is very subtle but also very complex.
name: La Gardenia

description: The beers are brewed by Korrigane traditional way and meet high quality standards. They are unfiltered, unpasteurized and contain no chemical preservatives or artificial flavors.
name: La Korrigane

description: Located in the Greater Palm Springs area, La Quinta Brewing Co. opened it's doors in 2013 and is served in over 150 bars/restaurants throughout the desert.
name: La Quinta Brewing Co.

description:
Inspirée des racines québécoises, La Souche ramène à l’essence, rappelle les cabanes à sucre, les camps de chasse où les hommes festoyaient à grandes goulées. Accoudés aux tables rondes découpées à même l’arbre, La Souche vous invite aux découvertes brassicoles dans une ambiance feutrée et chaleureuse.
﻿
Influencée par les produits locaux, notre cuisine s’inspire des pubs tout en intégrant la bière au menu. Dans une philosophie de développement local et durable, La Souche se veut un lieu culturel où les esprits assoiffés de qualité se rencontrent!
​
Nos bières artisanales sont inspirées des styles classiques anglais, écossais, belge, allemand et américain. Notre brasseur et ses acolytes travaillent avec des ingrédients du terroir afin de développer le style québécois.
name: La Souche

description: La Verne Brewing Company is a local brewery centrally located next to the Pomona Raceway and Brackett Field Airport. It all started with backyard brewing, the love of craft beer and has turned into a passion we want to share with the world.
name: La Verne Brewing Co.

description: La Voie Maltée, une micro-brasserie du Saguenay, totalement hors du commun. Venez prendre une bière chez-nous!
name: La Voie Maltée

description: Ladyface Ale Companie was established in late 2009 along with its restaurant Ladyface Alehouse & Brasserie. Named LA Weekly’s 2013 Best Brewery in LA, and an international RateBeer.com Best Brewpub, Ladyface is known for their award-winning Belgian, French and American style ales.  La Blonde, La Grisette, Blind Ambition Abbey Ale, Trois Filles Tripel, and seasonal ales such as La Trappistine® Belgian Dark Ale, Bluebelly Barleywine and Dérailleur® Bière-de-Garde are brewed onsite. Ladyface is one of Los Angeles County’s first modern day microbreweries, and the first brewpub in the Conejo Valley. Visit www.ladyfaceale.com for more information on Ladyface beers, tours and special events.
name: Ladyface Ale Companie

description: Lafitte Brewing is a new start-up micro-brewery based in New Orleans. Named after the legendary pirate, Jean Lafitte, The Lafitte Brewing Company is regional brewery with an initial production capacity of 3,000 barrels annually. The brewery is to be located a 4,700 square foot facility in the Gentilly area of New Orleans, a community that understands the urgent need for new jobs and manufacturing facilities.
name: Lafitte Brewing Co

description:
Established in 2004, Lagerheads has continued to reign supreme in finger-licking BBQ anywhere around! All of are meats are hickory smoked, and the finest BBQ sauce you'll ever have! All of which are hand-made on premises. Come join us in enjoying are famous ribs and wings, which were voted Best of the Best 2010 compliments of the Medina Gazette! 

New to 2010 is our brewery! Handcrafting lagers and ales, we have a taste to appease everyone. If you are really thirsty, we now offer growlers, 64oz of your favorite Lagerheads beer to take home, or to wherever the occasion brings you! We are brewing new beers often, so come in and enjoy us perfecting this art! (read less)
name: Lager Heads Brewing Company

description:
From our earliest days of striving to make consistently good beer, and instead making beer that ranged from vile, to barely drinkable, to wonderful, to elegant, to questionable-at-best. From being castigated by our West Marin neighbors to finally suffering an 'eviction' by our West Marin septic system. From landing in the welcoming arms of Petaluma, and actually getting our beer into bottles, onto the streets, and into the hands of sympathatic beer geeks, to steadily losing less money each month. From all this and more, Lagunitas Brewing Company is emerging as a battle-tested brewery capable of making great beer out of goat's milk, brambles, and asphalt on the surface of the Moon, if need be.

As the poet once said, 'Where, but for the grace of God and the kindness of strangers, go I'. Where go we indeed, whatever that means.
name: Lagunitas Brewing Company

description:
We couldn't have said it better ourselves. Laht Neppur Brewing Co., located in Waitsburg, WA, offers premium handcrafted ale by the glass or pitcher in our tap room. Sampler trays are highly recommended for first time visitors. We also have Mason Jars, Growlers, and Party Pigs to go.

After home brewing for more than 20 years, Chiefton Brewer Court Ruppenthal, came to the Walla Walla Valley to learn the art of wine making. He quickly realized that what the valley really needed was beer - good beer. After all, winemakers in the valley are often heard saying, "It takes a lot of beer to make good wine." So he decided to open his own brewery, and opened the doors to the public on June 3, 2006.

All Laht Neppur beer is produced on site and is available in our tap room. There are no macro-brews here! Families are welcome, and we offer an outdoor seating area.
name: Laht Neppur Brewing Company

description: We converted and old cafe into a 7 barrel brewery. We feature a variety of ales, cider, mead, and wine. Light snacks are available as well as Northwoods Soda Pop.
name: Lake Ann Brewing Company

description: We're a quaint craft brewery in the Chicago's North Shore suburbs. We strive to create the finest beer while minding the rich traditions of brewing.
name: Lake Bluff Brewing Company

description:
The Lake Charlevoix Brewing Co is a craft brewery located on the beautiful shores of Round Lake in downtown Charlevoix, MI.
Founded in May of 2015, The Lake Charlevoix Brewing Company is the second venture of the Round Lake Group LLC. 
The 5 barrel PsychoBrew system provides the Brewery the flexibility to produce our flagship beers, as well as a myriad of seasonal and experimental brews. The brewers also believe in supporting Michigan craft breweries and it is not uncommon for the brewery to have collaboration beers with different breweries spanning the entire state. 
The menu aims to provide guests with a quick, easy, high quality dining experience. 
For the convenience of our guests, we also offer a fantastic wine and spirits selection.
name: Lake Charlevoix Brewing Company

description:
Lake Chelan Brewery is a nano-brewery located in downtown Manson, Washington that was created for the love of beer! We brew delicious and diverse beers and welcome the beer community and beyond.

At LCB, we currently produce 4 house beers-- Manson Beach Blonde, Mackinaw Red Amber, Devil's Backbone IPA and Imperial Prize Fighter Irish Stout. These tasty brews are created in-house, using only the finest ingredients and Lake Chelan’s glacier fed water.

Make Lake Chelan Brewery your vacation destination. Relax and sample some of our beers, or grab a snack and growler to bring with you on the boat!
name: Lake Chelan Brewery

description: Lake Drum Brewing is a small batch brewery operated by Victor Pultinas and Jenna LaVita in the heart of downtown Geneva, NY.
name: Lake Drum Brewing

description: Our name, Lake Effect, is inspired by the weather phenomenon we experience on the Great Lakes, most famous for creating legendary snow storms. The lake effect also produces longer growing seasons that yield some of the highest-quality grains, fruits and vegetables in the world. Most importantly, our central ingredient – the water – is from our great lake.
name: Lake Effect Brewing Company

description:
Lake Louie Brewing started out as a mid-life crisis for owner Tom Porter.  He had spent 20+ years in the Engineering field and was looking to make a change in careers and a change in outlook.  Having been homebrewing for a couple of years, Tom wrote a ‘cartoon’ of a business plan that stated that a 3 barrel brewery could make a profit (in the first year, no less!).

Armed with said business plan and a cashed in 401k, Tom and his wife DeAnn proceeded to convert a metal storage shed on their property into a nascent brewery.

Lake Louie Brewing is located on 18.5 acres of land purchased from Tom’s uncle Louie Carpenter (hence the name ‘Lake Louie’) near the small town of Arena, Wisconsin (population: not too many, traffic lights: zero).  Lake Louie was the skinny dipping pond for area youth (including Tom in his day).

At the end of one full year’s brewing, Lake Louie has produced the astounding sum of 106 barrels of beer.  2001 year end totals:  276 barrels.  A 258% increase in one year (lookout Bud!).
name: Lake Louie Brewing

description: At Lake Monster Brewing we aim to make unique versions of classic beer styles, putting our own subtle twist on the flavors craft beer drinkers have come to love. Ranging from esoteric to approachable, subtle to over-the-top, our beers adhere to the philosophy that there is always more to be discovered.
name: Lake Monster Brewing

description:
Lake Norman Brewing Company is a family owned and operated microbrewery located in Mooresville, NC. We specifically chose the name “Lake Norman” due to the Lake’s prominence and the vitality it represents to the population that thrives around it. Whether you love Lake Norman as your home or get-away, for the boating, the sunsets, the watersports, the swimming or the fishing, we are excited to be part of phenomenon known to the locals as
 the “Lake Life”.
name: Lake Norman Brewing Company

description: The Lake of Bays Brewing Company is Northern Ontario's newest craft brewery. We busted our butts for more than a year getting ready to launch, and now our retail store and brewery in Baysville is open for business (woohoo!). Try our beer and see what Pure Northern Taste is all about. Cheers!
name: Lake of Bays Brewing Company

description:
It began, like many microbreweries, with a homebrew kit and a love of beer. Not just a love of drinking beer but a real respect for the craft, the history, the art, and the industry, as well as a love for the brewing process itself. Today, Lake Placid Pub & Brewery has been brewing award-winning ales for 14 years and has expanded rapidly due to its popularity and quality, earning the respect of the brewing community.

In 1996, Christopher Ericson and a college friend purchased P.J. O'Neill's, a pub in the small, Adirondack village of Lake Placid. They renovated the upstairs into a pub and restaurant, installed a seven barrel brewery, and began brewing. Chris' brewing experience included Federal Jack's / Shipyard Brewing in Kennebunkport, ME and The Shed Restaurant and Brewery in Stowe, VT.  The Lake Placid Pub & Brewery soon became a popular spot both for locals and visitors to the Lake Placid area.
name: Lake Placid Pub & Brewery

description: A multi-award winning micro-brewery located in Duluth, MN.
name: Lake Superior Brewing

description: Welcome to the Lake Superior Brewing Company, the place to be when you're in Grand Marais.  From our handcrafted beers to our delicious brewpub cuisine, we know you're going to want to come back again and again.  Nestled near the shore of Lake Superior we know that our unique atmosphere is unparalleled.  Steeped in the history of a harsh environment and life in Michigan's Upper Peninsula, the LSBC reflects bygone days while blending in its own contemporary identity.
name: Lake Superior Brewing Company

description: Milwaukee’s own Lakefront Brewery Inc. started in 1987.  The industrious and inventive microbrewery located on the Milwaukee River has become a Milwaukee landmark.  Its rich history includes partnerships with local taverns, preservation of local historical pieces, unique tours, family style dining options and most importantly, great beer.
name: Lakefront Brewery

description: Wherever anglers gather, you’re bound to hear great stories. One of the better known and sworn-to-be-true is the story of the Lakemaids. Long ago, these freshwater mermaids found their way inland from the oceans, down the St. Lawrence Seaway and up the Mississippi, to summer in the cool, pure waters of the North Country. Each year, on the night of the Summer Solstice, they reward anglers who have kept their lakes pure, with ice cold Lakemaid Beer, made fresh from the deepest, purest water they can find.
name: Lakemaid Beer

description:
From our origins home brewing out of a garage in the east Dallas neighborhood of Lakewood, to quickly becoming one of the fastest growing craft breweries in North Texas, we stay true to our vision of local beer for local folks. We're dedicated to using the highest quality ingredients to produce internationally inspired and locally crafted beers, perfect for whichever neighborhood you call home.
Pay us a visit in our taproom and beer garden. Brewery tours are offered on the weekends and free to the public. Schol!
name: Lakewood Brewing Company

description: We brew our beer in the heart of Lancaster County, Pennsylvania with great respect for the old traditions of brewing. Our master brewer, Christian Heim, has a strong commitment to quality and uses advanced brewing techniques to produce a consistent and high quality beer. Savor the hopped aromas as they come alive and accentuate the wholesome malt flavors in our ales and lagers.
name: Lancaster Brewing Company

description:
Established in 2014.

Land-Grant was born from a passion for painstakingly-crafted beer, powerful design, and a midwestern sports devotion. We all come from different backgrounds - Adam, business & brewing; Walt, design & photography; Q, pharmacist and homebrewing; Jamie, production brewing; Gus, basset hound--but we're brought together through our dedication and commitment to the craft of producing championship quality craft beer.

Alumni of Ohio State, Adam and Walt always dreamed of returning to Columbus to build something of their own. Before coming home to Ohio, the seed of what would become a 2,500BBL capacity brewing facility was planted in a tiny carriage-house apartment on the west-side of Chicago. To test the viability of what was then called Oval Brewing, we launched and successfully completed a Kickstarter Campaign in 2012, allowing us to tackle this thing right.  A long 899 days later, with a brief stopover in Grandview, Land-Grant brewed it's first batch 10/16/2014 & opened our doors 10/18/201
name: Land-Grant Brewing Company

description:
The beer brewing process began in Lander with the original Lander Brewing Company located just across the river from its present location. One hundred and ten years later, Lander Brewing Company is back, providing tasty locally brewed beer that we can call our own. 

The award-winning Lander Brewing Company is located in the newly remodeled Cowfish Restaurant. The brewery won four national awards in its first year of operation, and has continued to win awards each year. Our Rock Chuck Rye has won gold medals in both the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Cup. 

While sampling tasty brews in the stylish pub and inhaling the hoppy aroma of beer-brewing in progress, you can can enjoy tasty food from the Cowfish menu. In the summer our outdoor decks provide a beer garden like atmosphere under the shade of a hundred year old pine tree or this year’s crop of cascade hops. Looking for something more casual, order your beer next door at the historic Lander Bar while feasting on one of the Gannett Grill’s signature burgers or hand tossed New York style pizzas.

Our brewmaster Ted Briggs got his start at the Tun Tavern in Atlantic City, then moved west. Chris Erickson, former “brewmaster of the year” shared his knowledge and recipies with Ted and the results are amazing. If you spot Ted stirring his elixir in the copper tanks with his wooden paddle, checking his dials, ask him for a tour of the brewery. You will be sure to come away with a new appreciation for beverage with a thousand year history that gives this small town in Wyoming a world class taste.
name: Lander Brewing Co

description: We are a small producer of craft beers located in the Central New York city of Syracuse. We currently brew two year round beers, Landmark Vanilla Bean Brown Ale and the Landmark India Pale Ale.
name: Landmark Brewing Co

description: Good beer here!!
name: Lang Creek Brewery

description:
Langham is a traditional craft micro-brewery. We have a restored 10 barrel steam heated plant, updated with the latest control and measurement equipment to ensure consistent and flavoursome beers every brew.

What sets us apart?

First we only use the finest quality ingredients - water, floor malted barley and aroma hops, sourced as far as possible from local English suppliers.

And second, we cask conditions our beer. For every landlord this means a longer shelf life than beer from conditioning tanks. And for the real ale people it means better, fresher tasting beer.

Visitors are always welcome to the brewery shop for offsales - from two pints to a firkin for that special occasion, party or wedding. The brewery is open on Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday, but please ring in advance to avoid disapointment.
name: Langham Brewery

description:
Small craft brewer on the eastern side of Oahu, currently with two beers available in grocery stores (the 808 Imperial IPA and vanilla-scented Pillbox Porter) and a tasting room open on weekends with rotating test batches and growler fills.

Address:
175-C Hamakua Drive
Kailua, HI 96734

Tasting Room Hours:
Friday: 5 p.m. to 9 p.m.
Saturday: Noon to 5 p.m.
Sunday: Noon to 5 p.m.
name: Lanikai Brewing Company

description: New local brewery with good food.
name: Lansing Brewing Company

description:
Lantern Brewing is a very, very small brewery in the Greenwood-Phinney neighborhood of Seattle, Washington State, USA.

Our passion is beer, its enjoyment with food, and the history and culture that goes with it.

Our goal is to create beer that will enlighten the drinker; it will refresh and nourish, it will complement your food and bring to light new flavors, it will enliven the ambience and provide a delicious and memorable experience with each passing sip...

We will focus on highest-quality ingredients, sourced as locally as possible.  We will nurture the beer carefully through the brewing process, allowing it to change, mature, and to come into its prime; once it's ready, we'll make sure it finds its way to you!
name: Lantern Brewing

description:
The Lao Brewery Company Ltd. (L.B.C.) is a producer of beer and bottled drinking water in Laos headquartered in Vientiane.
The company produces and markets 3 types of beer under the Beerlao brand (Beerlao Lager, Beerlao Light and Beerlao Dark), and locally-brewed Carlsberg lager. It also produces and markets bottled drinking water under the Tiger Head brand.
Lao Brewery Co Ltd was established in 1973 and is now a joint venture company owned by the Carlsberg Group and the Lao government.
name: Lao Brewery Company

description: Lariat Lodge Brewing Company, just 2 minutes east of historic Downtown Evergreen overlooking Bear Creek, is the town’s first brewery/restaurant, with classic house-brewed beers, upscale comfort food, and a friendly neighborhood vibe. Come see what makes us an experience you won’t find anywhere else.
name: Lariat Lodge Brewing Co.
Las Cazuelas Mexican Grill and Brewery

description: Northeast California's only brewpub-- Lassen Ale Works--  Located in uptown Susanville, CA at the historic Pioneer Saloon.  21 and over only, ID required. On-site brewery.  Six house beers on draft, plus seasonal specialties and guest taps.  Full bar offers good selection of wine by the glass and craft cocktails, single malt scotch and premium liquors. Fine pub fare is prepared in house, from scratch. House specialties include beer battered fish with hand cut chips, lamb dip and fresh salads. Weekend lunch and dinner specials. Pool tables.
name: Lassen Ale Works

description: Nano brewing in Magnolia Warehouse District of Knoxville TN. The brewery is designed so that we have every advantage in creating unique small batch ales.   Brewing in small batches affords us the opportunity to constantly create new and exciting beers.  Our goal is that each time you visit or taproom, their is a beer available that you haven't tasted before.
name: Last Days of Autumn Brewing

description:
