We are Colorado natives, family owned, and pursue the happiness in life one fantastic beer at a time.
name: Mockery Brewing Co.

description: Modern Monks come from many different places. They share a deep, completely unearthly passion for characterful beer.
name: Modern Monks Brewery

description:
Modern Times is a 30bbl production brewery and tasting room in the Point Loma neighborhood of San Diego. Modern Times is named after a beautifully crazy utopian community founded in 1850, and (almost) all of our beers are named after real utopian experiments or mythological utopias.

The brewery was founded by the guy writing this (Jacob McKean), a beer geek, former Stone Brewing Co. employee and long-time homebrewer, along with crack team of consultants consisting of illustrious graphic designers, vicious attorneys, a slightly unhinged kombucha-obsessed real estate agent, one faraway brewing prodigy, a pricey architect, a gregarious general contractor, and (a bit later in the process) three outstanding brewers. 

Today, we're distributed throughout Southern California and have a fully awesome tasting room at our brewery, along with a super rad tasting room in North Park. You should totally come check it out.
name: Modern Times Beer

description: A Northern Beaches brewery located in Mona Vale! honest.local.fresh. That's our Modus Operandi.
name: Modus Operandi

description: When you see big barns dotting the countryside in the Land of the Cross-Tipped Churches, you'll know you're close. Moeller Brew Barn was built because we believe everyone should have a choice to enjoy Fresh Local Craft Beer.
name: Moeller Brew Barn

description: Overlooking an incredible wonderland of soaring mountains and magnificent pines, Moffat Station Restaurant and Brew Pub is truly a spectacular place to eat, drink and be merry. Moffat's fame has existed ever since explorers and settlers first came to exchange their animal pelts, gunpowder and maps for food and brew. Adorned with old west artifacts and memorabilia, the ambiance is inviting and inspiring—and so is the food. Join us to dine on buffalo meatloaf and other outstanding local dishes, and wash it all down with our authentic microbrews, lagers, stouts and ales.
name: Moffat Station

description: Mogollon Brewing Company, LLC, and High Spirits Distillery is a small, 20 bbl micro brewery and distillery. Our beers and spirits are hand crafted from the finest ingredients available and we use pure mountain water.  The artwork found on our labels is the embodiment of, and is inspired by, Northern Arizona wildlife.  Mogollon Brewing takes its name from the Mogollon Plateau which sits at 7000 feet above sea level.   We are now located at 4366 Huntington Drive in Flagstaff, AZ.  This is a brand new 4500 square foot building designed and built specifically for brewing beer and distilling spirits.
name: Mogollon Brewing Company

description: Mohawk Brewing Company was founded in 2010 by Stefan Gustavsson and Wicked Wine. The recipes created by our brewing owners Stefan Gustavsson, and the beer is distributed via AB Wicked Wine Sweden. Mohawk Brewing wants to develop the Swedish beer culture by bridging unusual beers that indicate the beer range and usefulness as a social drink well with food. We brew surprisingly flavorful beers in a modern style but just as often inspired by old tra
name: Mohawk Brewing Company

description: Momentum's goal is to provide you with a neighborhood brewhouse to call your own. Brian Hahn and his team will provide you with a comfortable tasting room and an interactive brewhouse experience. Momentum is for all ages and family friendly. As we get through the start-up stage, keep your eyes and ears open for exciting happenings.
name: Momentum Brewhouse

description: Monadnock Brewing Company is a NH based nano-brewery in the planning stage. Please stay tuned for updates. We will brew high quality German lagers as well as American ales.
name: Monadnock Brewing Company

description:
Monday Night Brewing is an Atlanta-based craft beer company. We currently offer two delicious styles of beer on draft in select Atlanta establishments.

Believe it or not, the idea for Monday Night Brewing grew out of a small Atlanta Bible study. We started brewing beer together on Monday nights as a way to get to know each other better. As we got more engrained in the industry and more people started showing up to brew with us, beer quickly became more than just a weeknight hobby.

We spent almost 5 years perfecting our Eye Patch Ale and Drafty Kilt Scotch Ale before bringing them to market. Years of minor tweaks, arguments over hop profiles, and experiments with different brands of base malts are poured into every glass that we brew.
name: Monday Night Brewing

description:
An award winning small batch boutique brewery and pub  located in the East Village section of Downtown San Diego.  

We're not monkeying around..
name: Monkey Paw Brewing

description: A small craft brewery in Los Angeles (Torrance), California creating artisanal beers inspired by Belgian-ish farmhouse and monastic brewing traditions and philosophy.
name: Monkish Brewing Co

description: At Monocacy Brewing Company we focus on crafting fresh, great tasting beer. The quality of our products is a direct result of our passion for the craft combined with our selection of choice and local ingredients resulting in beer that we are proud to brew and package in historic Frederick, Maryland. Join us for one of our regularly scheduled brewery tours and enjoy a taste of a flavorful and genuine Maryland beer.
name: Monocacy Brewing Co

description: In 1994 we combined the concepts of a small brewery, saloon and a restaurant to bring you a new and unique dining experience. Our diverse and "beer-friendly" menu offers great beer and food combinations for the most discriminating palette.
name: Montana Brewing Company

description: Montauk Brewing Company was incorporated in 2010. For two years, the men of MBC drew up a plan of action and attacked the miles of paperwork that came with opening a microbrewery. After hard work and determination, and several tasting parties, they are ready to launch Long Island's easternmost craft brewery.
name: Montauk Brewing Company

description: Brewing balanced low-gravity beers, strong ales and seasonal lagers with integrity, diligence and a passion for freshness!
name: Montavilla Brew Works

description: (No longer brewing)
name: Monte Carlo Casino and Brewpub

description: Monteith’s has been crafting its family of fine beers for nigh on 150 years, staying true to the authentic process and recipes of the classic beer styles we re-create. Renowned the world over, Monteith’s continues to produce beers that are made to exacting standards and capture the spirit of the world’s most famous beers and, in some cases, forgotten favourites, that are all but forgotten.
name: Monteith's Brewing Co

description:
Montgomery Brewing has a rare combination of hometown charm and historic cachet.

When you have access to a 130-year-old defunct brewery building, there’s only one thing to do—start brewing in it. That’s exactly what Charles Dorsey and AJ Newton did these past years when they drove from the Twin Cities to Montgomery, Minnesota, to homebrew inside the historic Montgomery Brewing Company building owned by Dorsey’s in-laws.
name: Montgomery Brewing

description:
Six thousand miles separated brothers Ken and Matt, good beer kept them close.
Matt and Ken on their annual hike!
Matt and Ken on their annual hike!

Ken was living in Baltimore while Matt was working overseas. Despite the distance they spoke almost daily about new beers they had either tried or brewed. After a year, Matt came to Baltimore and the two set off on their annual hike along the Appalachian Trail.  It was on that trip they began discussing a family brewery; one that would become part of the Baltimore community.  After their return they put pen to paper and Monument City Brewing was born.

Matt moved to Baltimore and the two immediately got to work building a pilot brewing system and started perfecting their recipes. Their focus was on producing honest craft beer using traditional American brewing methods.

Today, the beer that began as a conversation across two continents is ready for you to enjoy with your own family and friends. Here's to the things that matter most, and here's to great beer!
name: Monument City Brewing Company

description: The Moo Brew brewery was installed at MONA, then Moorilla Estate, in 2005. In June of that year the first keg was sold and went on tap at T42° on Hobart’s waterfront. In 2010 Moo Brew expanded and opened a second brewery site 10 minutes up the road in Bridgewater, Tasmania. Due to continued expansion all brewery operations are now carried out at this secondary site.
name: Moo Brew

description:
Our mission is also our slogan: Celebrating Beer Moo-Duck Style. 

Moo-Duck Style is HANDCRAFTING beer in small batches, allowing us to serve the freshest beer possible.

Moo-Duck Style is using the HIGHEST QUALITY ingredients possible.

Moo-Duck Style is respecting the traditional beer styles while embracing NON-TRADITIONAL brewing ingredients.

Moo-Duck Style is buying LOCAL ingredients whenever possible while supporting the local community through charity brews.

Moo-Duck Style is expressing our creativity throughout the brewing process to craft a beer that is INTERESTING and DELICIOUS.

Moo-Duck Style is promoting the RESPONSIBLE enjoyment of craft beer in a casual setting.

Moo-Duck Style is passionately wrapping our hands around our work to serve a beer we are PROUD of.
name: Moo-Duck Brewery

description: Moody Tongue Brewery was opened in 2014 under the direction of acclaimed brewmaster Jared Rouben. Moody Tongue, a nickname for a consumer with a discerning palate, features “culinary brewing”, Rouben’s original approach to brewing that combines the worlds of brewing and cooking through the application of a chef's mindset to the brewing process. Rouben, classically trained from the Culinary Institute of America in New York, worked in kitchens such as the Michelin star Martini House in Napa and Thomas Keller's three Michelin star Per Se in New York City before moving to Chicago and becoming Brewmaster at Goose Island Brewery. While at Goose Island, Rouben created the brewery's Farmers' Market Series and Chef Collaboration Series, brewing custom beers for renowned chefs such as Rick Bayless, Stephanie Izard and Paul Kahan.
name: Moody Tongue Brewing Company

description:
The Moon Dog brewery is as hand-crafted as the delicious beer it produces. A good chunk of the brewing gear was cobbled together from second-hand farming and dairy equipment.

The brewhouse is a four vessel 13hL electric system (hot liquor, mash/lauter kettle and whirlpool). The beautiful and shiny fermentation system is comprised of an ever-growing farm of cylindro-conical tanks.

There is a wall of barrels, a painting of "The Big Man" - John Candy, many many chandeliers, a pink elephant (actually, maybe a few..), and most of all a whole lota love.

It has been described by one observer as the “oddest brewery” he's ever seen. We like to call it home.
name: Moon Dog

description: The Moon River Brewing Company is founded on our obsession with creating the ideal restaurant and brewery experience. Striving for this ideal, we are committed to providing three basic services. We are dedicated, first and foremost, to providing you with a comfortable and relaxing environment with prompt and cheerful service. Secondly, we are committed to serving you a delicious variety of freshly prepared foods. Our kitchen is a boiling pot of diversity, offering a range of dishes from simple comfort food to eclectic gourmet cuisine. Finally, we are undeniably passionate about serving great beer.
name: Moon River Brewing Company

description:
The Moon is a true “beer bar”, which means a selection of only the finest brews, paired with food designed for every taste and even serving the beers in new glassware appropriate to the style of beer. 

The new Moon beers can be described as ‘German-fusion’ and are Brewmaster Clay’s West-coast interpretation of traditional German styles. All beers are 100% natural, unfiltered and naturally carbonated. Guest beers are handpicked to showcase some of the best Craft Beers in British Columbia and served alongside the house brewed beers.
name: Moon Under Water

description: Moonlight Brewery was started in rural Santa Rosa in 1992 by Brian Hunt. Small by most all comparisons, the brewery has capacity for about 1000 barrels per year. Whereas the original brewery was in a converted tractor barn, today it is in a building built in 2003 for this brewery. Currently all the beers are only sold in kegs and can be found in San Francisco, the East Bay and North Bay counties. Mendocino and Lake Counties have a few spots, and there are rare sightings in Santa Cruz, Seal Beach, and San Diego.
name: Moonlight Brewing Company

description:
It all started back in 1995, when Michael tried a cyser (apple and honey mead) for the first time.  Since that first sip Michael has developed a passion, and a masterful skill at making international award winning meads. Michael Fairbrother has started Moonlight Meadery™, with a mission to bring ultra premium meads to the market place.  It is more than a product and it is more than a process, it's our obsession.

"Mead to me is passion, it's about living and love, it's about enjoyment, family and friends, and sharing." says Michael Fairbrother, Founder and Mead Maker. 

Our meads will be unique, and unlike anything you have ever tried, you will find it incredible!   We are going to embrace the unique nature of natural honey as minimally processed as possible.
name: Moonlight Meadery

description:
Every Monday we donate 10% of our sales to programs in Salida we believe make this town amazing. We support anything from school groups to ski clubs to horse rescue to the mentors program because, well, they support us and honestly it’s the right thing to do.

Dough. We like dough. It fits well in wallets and tastes good under cheese. We like to think we’ve got some good dough. We make pizza crust, we make sandwich bread, and we make finely crafted dog sweaters. Alright, we don’t make the last one, but we COULD if we wanted to. We take pride in the freshness of our dough and veggies. Our dough was made today. It wasn’t made in Topeka, frozen, shipped here, and warmed up. Ask who made it and he or she is probably in the kitchen.

Why no Straws? We know you didn’t get one. You’ll use them for about seven minutes and then we have to throw them away. It’s nothing personal. If you absolutely need one we’re happy to oblige, but we’re trying to reduce our non-recyclables, keep our landfills at a minimum, and keep plastic out of our oceans. Find a kid and ask them about plastic. Plastic pollutes our oceans and air, so we serve our beverages in glass. If you want to bring a kid cup from home, we’ll fill it up!

What, no Coasters? You’d be amazed at how many coasters we pick up off the floor. If our tables were Peruvian mahogany, inlaid with reclaimed oak from an historic church in New Brunswick, we’d say “heck yeah, give that pizza patron a coaster!” Let’s conserve together.

Hopefully you’re now thinking, “Wow Henrietta, these are some globally concerned restaurateurs.” But, then again, maybe you’re wondering about the lack of ice in the sodas? Are we trying to conserve ice bergs? Nope. We don’t even know any icebergs. Our soda’s are handmade with the finest extracts available, fantastic water and cane sugar. They’re served at cellar temps just like our beers, so you get a full flavored beverage that doesn’t need to be watered down. There’s a saying in Colorado, Whiskey’s for drinking, water’s for fighting. (We also have Whiskey, no fighting). If you want ice, just ask. We’ll not think less of you. Becoming a soda pop connoisseur takes time.

From all of us at Moonlight Pizza: Kick back, order another beer, enjoy the sunset, and don’t forget your leftovers! Peace.
name: Moonlight Pizza & Brew Pub

description:
Moor Beer Company brings you something different – a company dedicated to quality products, service to the community and social responsibility. We are not publicly traded and leave our accountability to the people that matter – our customers, employees, suppliers and families.

We strive to produce strongly flavoured beers of exceptional character. All our beers are brewed using only natural ingredients. We put a lot into our beers by using the finest malt, hops, yeast and water – but don’t take anything out. All our beers are unfiltered so they retain the yeast that is so vital to producing exceptional flavour, as well as providing vitamins.
name: Moor Beer Company

description:
Founded in 1867 by Susannah Oland and still operated by the Oland family today, Moosehead Breweries Limited is Canada's oldest Independent Brewery. 

Sold throughout Canada, The United States, and in select countries around the world, our flagship Moosehead Lager beer is often regarded as Canada’s Premium Lager. 

With a taste as clean and refreshing as the Canadian outdoors, Moosehead Lager and it’s iconic Moose label have long been associated with the great outdoors.
name: Moosehead Brewery

description:
Moosejaw Pizza & Dells Brewing Co. proves that All Restaurants Are Not Created Equal!

We feature steaks, ribs, burgers, pastas, salads & sandwiches. The Dells only micro-brewery features ten hand-crafted brews. From our tanks straight to your glass…that’s fresh. Large arcade, pool table & premium sports viewing located on the 3rd floor. Large Groups Welcome! Family Friendly! Free Delivery! (608)254-1122
name: Moosejaw Pizza & Dells Brewing Company

description:
We’re a nano brewery that features a wide range of fruit beers (inspired by our family farm, Monadnock Berries), as well as traditional brews!

Stop by to taste some beer, tour the brewery, and even bring some growlers home for yourself!
name: Mooselick Brewery

description:
Nestled on cobblestone streets polished by more than 200 years of commerce along the Mississippi River, Morgan Street Brewery radiates the charm that only history can impart.  Morgan Street Brewery’s rich architecture and warm interiors are highlighted by burnished wood and exposed brick and feature cozy nooks and corners.  The main brewery building and adjacent Lodge, both more than 130 years old, are separated by a brick patio that is as perfect for café style dining as the popular outdoor dining patio along second street.

Morgan Street Brewery, founded in 1995, is one of the oldest buildings in historic Laclede’s Landing.  It’s where St. Louis- and thousands of visitors from other cities- go for great times, great food and fabulous beers made right on the premises in Morgan Street’s micro brewery.
name: Morgan Street Brewery

description: Morgan Territory Brewing is a new 15,000 ft2 brewery established in August 2015 in Tracy, CA. It started out as Schooner's Grille & Brewery and after many years the decision was made to share the beer with the rest of the world and pursue a production brewery. Same GABF award winning beer, brewer, and ownership. New bold name!
name: Morgan Territory Brewing

description: Morgantown's oldest and newest brewpub, located in the heart of downtown Morgantown West Virginia. This casual local pub offers a wide range of craft beers brewed on the premises, great food, a live music venue and full calendar of events.   Meet friends for lunch or dinner, or have a beer and watch the big game on TV.  A must visit for craft beer lovers.
name: Morgantown Brewing Company

description: This brewery has since been closed. Their brands are now brewed by Greene King in Suffolk.
name: Morland and Co.

description:
Our Symbol

Derived from a medieval alchemy sign for Aurum Potabile, drinkable gold. It was used as a rejuvenating medicine, an elixir of life. Paracelus, a famous alchemist once wrote: “…drinkable gold will cure all illnesses, it renews and restores”. While we know now that medieval medicine did get a few things wrong, the idea of drinking liquid gold is not a bad thought. Cheers!
name: Mornington Peninsula Brewery

description:
The Morpeth Brewery & Beer Co. is a micro-brewery situated at the Commercial Hotel Morpeth. The Brewery kicked off operations in April 2012.

At Morpeth Brewery & Beer Co we are passionate about brewing according to artisan principles, and aspire to produce all-natural beers from the finest quality ingredients, with no additives or preservatives.
name: Morpeth Brewery & Beer Co

description: Moscow Brewing Company entered the Russian beverage market with products of own production in September 2008. The company consists of the most modern brewery in Russia, as well as its own distribution and logistics centers located three kilometers from the Moscow Ring Road (in Mytischi) in an ecologically clean area. Partners of the project and Sberbank of Russia Investment Fund Detroit Investments, total investment amounted to over $ 300 million.
name: Moscow Brewing Company

description: Hand Crafted Brews with Most Wanted Ingredients
name: Most Wanted Brewery

description: At Mother Bunch Brewing we love great hand-crafted beer and food, and truly appreciate exceptional service. We are committed to using only the finest ingredients as inspiration for every pint and plate.
name: Mother Bunch Brewing Company

description:
In early 2010, Mother Earth launched a unique brewing supply store and tasting room at its new Vista, CA location. Just a half mile from the 78 freeway and just minutes from the I-5, Mother Earth Brew Co. is right in the middle of the "North County Beer Triangle" in North San Diego County. 

Our business caters to home brewers seeking the highest quality, freshest ingredients and to people who enjoy sampling great beers - many of which are exclusively available at our tasting bar! Come on by for a truly unique experience, and always remember...Love Your Mother!
name: Mother Earth Brew Company

description: Mother Earth Brewing Company is located on the corner of Heritage and North Street in Kinston NC. The facility includes the brewery itself, a bottling facility and Mother Earth’s corporate offices. In keeping with our company name, our rehabilitation of this old building is incorporating green technology, eco-friendly building materials and alternative energy sources wherever possible. Future plans include opening a tap room and offering tours of the brewery. Mother Earth’s four staple beers are a Munich Dunkel, an American IPA (organic), a Belgian Wit and a Kolsch, along with seasonal brews and oak aged beers. Mother Earth will distribute statewide in groceries, restaurants, and bars. Look for Mother Earth products soon..
name: Mother Earth Brewing Company

description:
Driving on a dark stretch of two lane road, founders Michael and Alissa
Marquess were pondering how to better live their creed of ‘finding joy in the adventure’. They came up with a plan that brought together their passions of craft beer, travel, Arizona and the enjoyment of life;they decided to create a brewery. We hand craft each of our beers along Route 66 in Flagstaff in a 1920s era building with a small staff. We found craft beer, where does your road lead?
name: Mother Road Brewing Company

description: Mother's is a growing family that's all about heady craft beers. So we started our own brewery, and we're producing as much love per barrel as we possibly can. In the short time that we've been open, we've made a helluva lot of different, fun, and innovative beers. Stop by and see what we brought with us. Cheers!
name: Mother's Brewing Company

description:
Since our beginning in 1994, MCBW has been committed to producing hand-crafted superior quality beer. Our beer is unfiltered, unpasteurized assuring maximum freshness & delicious flavor Naturally! 
We hope you enjoy our labors as we contribute to the genuinely original exports of Detroit’s Cultural Center. A century of art, literature, music & now Beer!


20 BBL Custom fabricated brewery made from salvaged equipment & scrap of Detroit’s great industrial era, by the hands of Detroit’s finest artists, fabricators & craftsman.
name: Motor City Brewing Works

description: Windsor, Ontario's most Nano of Breweries
name: Motor Craft Ales

description: 10 BBL brew house located on Historic Motor Row on the near South Side of Chicago. The breweries main focus are on lagers and Belgian style ales. It is a draft only brewery with distribution throughout the Chicagoland area. There is an on-site tasting and tap room open 5 days a week from Wednesday through Sunday.
name: Motor Row Brewing

description:
Motorcycle Wineries distributes local wine and cider in the SF Bay Area. I ride around the globe, searching for unique wines and goodies, and host exclusive events for Bay Area residents. We work with independent restaurants and stores who share our focus on authentic human connection, laughter, and adventure. Send us a note to see our current inventory and set up a tasting.  Sign up for our mailing list if you would like to hear about our underground dinners, gallery openings and music events, new wines, or simply to follow the adventure.
Philosophy

The integrity of the Motorcycle Wineries is my own integrity. There is not much that you need for a life that is a complete joy to lead. Love, freedom, beauty. And yet there are some physical things that can create magic. A bottle of wine with the one you love, a picnic in the rose garden with a baguette and olive oil, a sparklingly joyous cider to make a memorable night with friends unforgettable. Luxury is not born from spending a lot of money on stuff society expects you to buy. It is not comfort. It is not status. It is the scene of Meryl Streep getting her hair washed in the middle of the African savannah. That magic is the purpose. Everything that I offer has given me a glimpse into the incredible beauty and complexity of our world. That is what I hope to share with you.

Thank you for being a part of the Motorcycle Wineries.
name: Motorcycle Wineries

description: Distinctive Ales and Lagers
name: Mount Pleasant Brewing Co

description:
Mount St. Helena Brewing Company is a Northern California microbrewery founded in 1996 by Phil Box, Ken Davis and Jim Garrett. The Mount St. Helena brewery also features a full service restaurant, serving lunch and dinner. The Mount St Helena Brewing Company (named for nearby Mount St Helena )is located on Calistoga Street, the main road through the town of Middletown, California. 

Mount St. Helena Brewing Company pours six styles of beer, including the award winning Palisades Pale Ale, English Style Brown and Imperial Stout. These ales were awarded silver medals in the World Beer Championships. Their Honey Wheat Ale and Palisades Pale Ale won Gold Medals at the 1999 California State Fair.
name: Mount St Helena Brewing Co

description:
Dave and Cam learned to be persistent. Really persistent. They finally secured the required funds from friends, family and a business banker who wanted them out of his face.

Today the boys operate their very own microbrewery in Richmond (inner Melbourne). They craft the Hightail Ale, Organic Steam Ale plus seasonal beers in longnecks like the Surefoot Stout , IPA and Double Hightail.

“The plant is very labor intensive, but we can squeeze great beer out of it” says Dave. “And after hand filling, capping and labelling just on 2 million bottles you can well imagine we’re pretty happy about putting in a small, automated bottling line.”

Mountain Goat has collected a swag of awards over the years for their traditional, all natural ales and now has about 80 bars in Melbourne pouring their beers on tap plus bottled beer distributed nationally.

So why Mountain Goat? Well, a mountain goat’s a big hairy animal that’s never gonna fall over.
name: Mountain Goat

description:
In 2011, the current owners answered their calling for the mountains and relocated to Durango from Phoenix, Arizona. They soon bought this restaurant with the idea of creating a true neighborhood pub in the heart of the Animas Valley where none currently exist. A new pub that focuses on a simple but tasty menu with a high energy atmosphere where everyone is welcome and comfortable. Our specialty is handcrafted gourmet brick oven pizzas complimented with great apps, salads, and sandwiches, all washed down with quality craft brews. We have a full bar, free Wi-Fi, and several HDTV's for all your sports viewing pleasure.
 
At Mountain Madness we can best be described as passionate. We're passionate about people (and dogs), we're passionate about great craft beer and gourmet pizza, and we're insanely passionate about the mountains. Mountain Madness is the culmination of a life long dream of its founder to create an experience that combines these passions.
 
We will continue to remodel, tweak, and enhance Mountain Madness as we strive to perfect your neighborhood pub. We are simple, casual, and unique by design...and we love dogs! During the summer bring your furry friends with you and enjoy our fantastic deck with the best views in town!
 
We are your apres ski destination as the closest "in-town" location to Purgatory right on Hwy. 550. We are located 2 miles north of downtown directly across from the Iron Horse Inn with plenty of free on-site parking.
 
On behalf of our entire staff, we hope to see you soon at Mountain Madness Pizza & Pub. Our people make the difference!
name: Mountain Madness Brewing

description:
As Natives of West Virginia, it has long been our dream to bring quality hand-crafted beer back to our state.

Originally from Elkins and Helvetia, we were raised on easy drinking beers and homemade wine. Curiosity eventually got the best of us, and we combined the two - our first batch of homebrew was conceived in the early 90's with home brewing equipment, books, and some ingredients handed down from our parent's home brewing days in the 70's.

Since then we've learned a lot about brewing professionally. We developed easy drinking and well rounded beers with our own state of the art brewing equipment. We sold our first beer in October 2005 and now we're distributing throughout the Canaan Valley, Davis, Thomas, Elkins, Morgantown and Fayetteville.

That's our story so far. Thank you for all the great support we've received pursuing our dream.

- Brian & Willie
name: Mountain State Brewing Company

description: "Hippies, mountain bikers, and locals flock here for some of Boulder's best microbrews. The low-priced, healthy fare includes massive mixed-green salads, big burritos and even non-garden-variety burgers, like the Black and Blue burger, with blue cheese and blackened seasoning. The Junk burger is loaded with everything in the kitchen. Drink options include the coffee-alcohol Java Porter, or the XXX Pale Ale, a hoppy brew with flavor and bite."
name: Mountain Sun Brewery

description: Mountain Toad Brewing is a craft brewery in our beautiful town of Golden, Colo. We have a small taproom and large beer garden where our community can come and enjoy our freshly brewed beers.  Our beer line up includes four flagship beers and up to six seasonal or small batch beers on tap at any given time.
name: Mountain Toad Brewing

description:
Mountain Town Station proudly serves central Michigan the highest quality hand crafted brews made from specially selected hops and organic grains. With seven distinctive beers available including seasonal specialty draughts, the brewery is an essential stop on the road to Mount Pleasant. 

Stop in and try a sampler platter of six beers, one cool pint, or take one of our brews home in a half gallon growler or even a keg of your favorite flavor. Mountain Town Station, central Michigan's premiere brewery and steakhouse.
name: Mountain Town Station Brew Pub

description: Welcome to the Mountaineer Brewing Company, located in Martinsburg, West Virginia. We have been brewing quality beers for our local customers for several years, but now the secret is out and you will find our products growing in popularity throughout the region. Why? Because we know that good beer is about quality ingredients and exceptional taste. In a market dominated by global conglomerates, Mountaineer Brewing Company understands that success is really earned one customer at a time. We constantly strive to meet the changing demands of our consumers and deliver a wide range of high quality products that we can be proud of.
name: Mountaineer Brewing Company

description:
Born from Matthew and Lauri's passion for craft beer, Moustache Brewing Co. is a 2 BBL microbrewery located in Riverhead, New York. Moustache Brewing Co. provides Long Island and the New York City area with fresh, local and handcrafted beers.
 
The beers are based on brewing’s tradition with a nod to the trends and uniquely changing future of craft beer. the beers are constantly changing to keep our unique homebrew spirit and to highlight fresh locally grown ingredients. We are dedicated to creating, sharing and educating the masses about craft beer.
name: Moustache Brewing Co.

description: Moylan’s Brewery & Restaurant, Novato’s only brewpub, was $3.5 million project that has established a strong following among North Marin’s beer connoisseurs. Moylan’s features a 57 foot long bar, a dart room with a fireplace and a reading library featuring brewing books and magazines from Brendan’s personal collection. By constructing the brewpub in an empty lot from his own vision, Moylan was able to increase efficiency and productivity, while still leaving room for expansion as the establishment’s popularity grows. According to Moylan, the location at Rowland Plaza provides good freeway visibility and helps attract a greater number of customers from the nearby theatre and corporate offices. When Moylan co-founded Marin Brewing Company back in 1989 there were only about a 100 brewpubs across the country. Today, there are more than 2000.
name: Moylan's Brewing Company

description: Michael Mraz started brewing as a hobby.  Now after winning many awards with his innovative beers, he is bringing his style of amazing tasting beer to you.
name: Mraz Brewing Company

description: Welcome to Mt. Emily Alehouse! We are a brewpub, that is a brewery and restaurant, located in downtown La Grande, Oregon. We specialize in English style Ales. but brew a variety of beers from a blonde to a stout. As the only current brewery in La Grande, and in fact Union County, we are bringing back a tradition of small local breweries producing fresh brewed beer. Our kitchen specializes in gourmet pizza, but also offers a variety of appetizers, hot sandwiches, soups and salads, desserts, and weekly specials. If you are in La Grande please stop into our brewpub and enjoy a cold pint and some delicious food.
name: Mt Emily Ale House

description: Small craft brewery located in downtown Vancouver with it's roots in SE Portland.  Fall of 2015 we'll be opening back up in SE Portland
name: Mt Tabor Brewing Co

description:
Mt. Begbie Brewing was founded by Bart and Tracey Larson. Their love of beer and the quest for mountain living lured them to move to Revelstoke to create the brewery in 1996. Bart has a Phd in nuclear physics, but he prefers to make beer not war, right here in Revelstoke. And Bart hasn't let all that education stop him from making great beer. In fact, he's managed to combine his scientific background with an artistic, if somewhat bohemian, flair for beermaking to create what The Globe and Mail and Vancouver Province newspapers have called some of the best suds around. 

Bart's brewery skills are complemented by Tracey's tenacious management and marketing skills. Tracey has a degree in biology; but she too is immersed in the brewing business. She probably comes closest to using skills learned in courses such as zoology when calling on remote bars to demo cold Begbies to rowdy, and thirsty, patrons. 

The brewery has seen expansion since it's beginnings. Most significantly, the brewery moved to a larger location downtown, in an old car dealership, which now includes a tasting area and retail space.
name: Mt. Begbie Brewing Company

description:
Mt. Carmel Brewing Company is a local family owned and operated brewery. The brewery was founded in May of 2005 by Cincinnati natives Mike and Kathleen Dewey. 

Inspired with a passion for good beer, founders Mike and Kathleen Dewey work towards providing exceptional craft beers to the greater Cincinnati area. We look forward to serving our customers, as if each was our first and only. We look to grow at a comfortable pace not to jeopardize our focus on product quality, customer service, and a respectful business practice.
name: Mt. Carmel Brewing Company

description: We are a micro (Greek letter µ) brewery that is in the heart of the Aurora Cultural Arts District. We are very excited to be a part of this community. We are looking forward to doing several events in tandem with the fantastic Artists from all mediums in this area. So, whether you are looking for somewhere to cool off in the summer or warm up in the winter or going to any one of the shows around Downtown Aurora, please stop in and enjoy good beer and fantastic company.
name: Mu Brewery

description:
We craft a variety of exquisite and delicious beers. There is sure to be several brews that please most every palate.  For the kids of all ages, we also craft excellent soft drinks such as Teetotaler Sparkling Lemonade and Where's Your Mother Root-Beer.  For those seeking beverages other than beer, feel free to visit The Post Martini Bar just a few feet down the hall from us.

We provide free popcorn and you are welcome to bring in your own food or order-in food in from a variety of restaurants in the area.

We are located in the historic Post building in Uptown Butte on corner of Main and Galena.  This tastefully-remodeled historic space has been designed to facilitate a fantastic customer experience focusing on a rustic relaxed atmosphere, easy conversation, quality music, friendly & knowledgeable staff, great beer and good times!
name: Muddy Creek Brewery

description:
The brewery's building is a little over 100 years old and used to be a Wool & Skin Store run by the Poulton family for 80 years. After a few renovations, it's perfect for enjoying some ice cold beer, local Mudgee wine and of course, local produce. The brewery is also the home of live music in Mudgee. Other services include catering, weddings, events and tours. 

As a family run local business, our main goal is to promote Mudgee, local wine makers and farmers while increasing tourism in the Central West region. And, as always, serve fantastic beer and food.
name: Mudgee Brewing Co

description: Southern Maryland's first Production Craft Brewery! Find Patuxent Pale Ale, Marc Six Blonde, Jack Straw IPA, Carmelite Wheat and Shucker Stout at bars, liquor stores and restaurants throughout Southern MD and the Mid-Atlantic. Drink Local.
name: Mully's Brewery

description: Microbrewery and taproom located in Downtown Los Angeles, California.  We brew a wide variety of beers from American style IPAs to Belgian Strong Ales.
name: Mumford Brewing

description:
Hamilton, OH United States
Micro Brewery
name: Municipal Brew Works

description:
At Murray’s we are fanatical about the quality of our beers. We use only the best quality ingredients sourced from Australia and around the world and we give all of our beers extended conditioning times – no rushing.

Established in late 2006 by passionate craft beer enthusiast, Murray Howe, Murray’s Craft Brewing Co. has quickly gained a reputation as one of Aust best Craft Brewers. So much so that we were awarded ‘Best Brewer in Australia’ in October 2012. 

Crafted in Port Stephens on the beach on the NSW Hunter region our hugely sought-after range of unconventional, unique and sometimes just plain weird – full-flavoured beers are available across Australia.

We’re not a corporation and we’d NEVER lower our standards to sell more beer. Rest-assured our beers have won more awards than our ads. Murray’s is proudly 100% Australian-owned.

Murray’s… Made of the Right Stuff.
name: Murray's Craft Brewing Co

description: The Murree Brewery produces a wide variety of Beer's, Liquor's and non alcoholic products. Our Premium products include Murree's Millennium Beer, Murree's Classic Beer, Lite Export Pils, Eight and Twelve years old Single Malt Whiskies, Vintage with a blend of a Scotch Grain Whisky, Silver Top Gin, Bolskaya Vodka and Doctor's Brandy.
name: Murree Brewery

description:
Museum De Roos Hilvarenbeek is a unique authentic village brewery from the nineteenth century. You are experiencing the world of traditional beer. Volunteers have managed to completely renovate the old building and its inventory and even build a new brewery. The Rose has become a living museum where history, knowledge, Brabant geniality and hospitality go hand in hand. Only volunteers ensure that Museum De Roos is getting expanded.
You will find us at the St. Sebastian Street 4 Hilvarenbeek, on the corner of the plaza.
name: Museumbrouwerij de Roos
Museums- und Traditionsbrauerei Wippra - Gebr. Gehring

description:
Founded by Gary McMullen and Kirk Evans, Muskoka Cottage Brewery opened for business in 1996. The Brewery now employs a team of 18, all dedicated to providing you with the finest experience in hand-crafted beer.

Nestled in the heart of Muskoka, Muskoka Cottage Brewery is the Taste of Cottage Country! In keeping with our Muskoka home and surroundings, our goal is to lead our industry in craft beer excellence and innovation, environmentally sound and sustainable practices.

Our values at Muskoka Cottage Brewery are to have a respectful, authentic, open and honest relationship with all of our Muskoka customers and business partners.

In short, we have a passion for great craft beer and we hope you enjoy it!
name: Muskoka Cottage Brewery

description: Mustang Brewing Company was created to makes great, easy-drinking, craft beers. Headquartered in Oklahoma City, OK, our award-winning line-up includes Washita Wheat, Sixty-Six, Golden Ale, Thirty-Three, Harvest Lager, and more. For details, please visit www.mustangbrewing.com.
name: Mustang Brewing Company

description: At this family-run locale nestled in the breathtaking Wallowa Valley on the remote northeastern corner of Oregon’s craft frontier, Mutiny is brewing.  Fueling hikers, rafters, and outdoor enthusiasts 330 miles due east of Portland, Mutiny Brewing Company specializes in beer as it’s meant to be made and as it’s meant to be enjoyed.
name: Mutiny Brewing Company

description:
Our mission is to create a cornucopia of high-quality rustic ales for the discriminating consumer, to test the boundaries of creativity and style. In short, to make outstanding beer.

How do we plan to do it? It involves using fresh, high-quality ingredients and a steady hand at the kettle. But that’s just half of it. The other half of it is right here. The power of the internet, social media, and networking is here to see. Think of this as your own internet brewpub where you can sidle up next to the brewmaster and ask a question — because you can.

What’s so Mysterious?

It’s a bit of a throwback. “Mystery” in its original definition meant the “art and craft of a trade.”  Brewers were among the first organized trade groups; there is evidence of a guild of brewers as early as 12th Century London: “the Master, Keepers or Wardens and Commonalty of the Mistery or Art of Brewers of the City of London”. So, it’s a tribute, it’s recognition that there is just as much art to brewing as there is science, and it’s a gentle reminder that to move forward and create a truly excellent future, sometimes you have to look at the past.
name: Mystery Brewing Company

description: Mystic microbes abhorred the isolation of the industrial age. They became a microscopic cabal intent on flourishing. As mystic brewers we yield to their intent; we let them make the beer. Our job is to goad them unto self-realization.
name: Mystic Brewery

description: Nail Brewing Australia brews multiple award winning beers including Nail Ale and Nail Stout. Nail has recently added a special Russian Imperial Stout as an annaul beer - Clout Stout. Nail Brewing is a 100% Australian owned company. John Stallwood is presently head brewer.
name: Nail Brewing Australia

description:
Nail Creek Brewery is situated in the barn directly behind Nail Creek Pub. The origins and age of the barn are unfortunately unknown. About the only thing that I know is that the building is very old. The area of Utica where Nail Creek is located was once filled with breweries, malteries and all kinds of brewing industry. I am crossing my fingers and hoping that the barn was once involved in Utica’s brewing history.


The first year of the brewery’s operation will consist of true micro brewing. I’m talking about 20 gallon batches here… one keg at a time. Brewing will take place 2 to 3 times a week. The Primary focus of the first year will be to develop a few finalized, tweaked, end game recipes that I can set as a standard at the pub. I want to continually narrow down the recipes and processes until I have taken them to where I would be confident in sharing them with the worlds best brewers. The secondary focus is to experiment with different styles of beer and explore the art of brewing. Ideally, I would like to brew 3 times a week. The first two times would be to work on standardizing the two recipes and the third would simply be an experiment.
name: Nail Creek Pub & Brewery

description: A duo of guys who know that life is too short not to drink good beer. Our goal is to bring a variety of natural and exceptional craft brews to the masses, but since priests frown on that we've decided instead to bring them to you. Got Naked Lately?
name: Naked Brewing Company

description:
Once upon a time, there were two dudes named Donald and Don. One was an engineer toiling away on the super computers of a local university, and the other was a supervisor managing the complex operations of a local billionaire. Both of them loved their jobs, but more than their jobs they loved beer. Each Don had a recurring dream of a magical place without a name, a place where the great beers of the world flowed like the Salmon le Sac at flood stage, and the fine brewing tradition of the Pacific Northwest stood proudly beside the best concoctions from far-flung breweries in Asia and across Europe.

Don and Donald worked tirelessly in the wee hours on their home brew mixtures, searching for the best possible combination of hops, malt, barley, and love. For long years, the two Dons had their separate dreams, and never met. A local poet named Bryan had the pleasure of growing up with Donald, and worked for the same local billionaire as Don. After many months of hearing Don speak of his dream of the magical beer haven, Bryan knew it must be the very same place of which Donald had spoken too. He knew instinctively that it was his responsibility to bring the two Dons together. On a fateful summer afternoon at the Elysian Brewery on Capitol Hill, the two Dons met. The event later became known as THE HAPPY HOUR OF DESTINY.

Every patron in the pub knew something special was happening that day. The magical place both men dreamed of was one and the same. That very afternoon, the two Dons vowed to create a great beer haven right here on earth, and together they would name this magic place THE NAKED CITY. In THE NAKED CITY, it doesn't matter where you're going or where you've been, all that matters is great living and great beer. In THE NAKED CITY, the only problem is what great craft beer to try next. The two Dons spent a combined 25 years studying the world's great brewing traditions, and couldn't wait to begin experimenting together. Their very first batch of beer, an Oak-aged double IPA, took a ribbon in the Northwest regionals of the 2007 National Homebrew Competition. The rest, as they say, is history.

Two years after the two Dons combined their separate dreams, THE NAKED CITY opened its doors. Now Naked City boasts an award-winning brewery that produces a variety of small-batch beers available at the pub and friendly bars and restaurants in Seattle, Tacoma, Bellingham, and beyond. The 24 taps of THE NAKED CITY offer a constantly rotating variety of Washington's best beers, regional craft beers, and the best beers Donald and Don have found in two lifetimes of beer travels around the world.

Two and a half years after THE NAKED CITY was founded, the Dons convinced the local poet who brought them together to join them in the adventure. The Dons and Bryan together built a bigger brewery; a full-size kitchen; a dining room/movie theatre called The Screening Room that features free monthly events including film, comedy, poetry, community discusssion, and jazz; and now The Walrus Beer Garden, a patio that's home to murals by local artists, games, and summertime events.

So. Welcome to THE NAKED CITY, where great beer lovers flock like the salmon of Capistrano, and the only question is: WHAT TAP NEXT?
name: Naked City Brewery & Taphouse

description:
Naked Dove Brewing company was born through our passionate commitment to the art and science of brewing.

At Naked Dove we concentrate on doing one thing: utilizing the best ingredients that the world has to offer to brew world class beers locally. The beers have passed our strict quality standards to ensure that they will meet yours. We are located in Canandaigua, NY in the beautiful Finger Lakes region of New York.
name: Naked Dove Brewing Company

description: Nano Brew Cleveland is a friendly neighborhood brewpub with 24 beers on draft both at the inside bar and at the lively outdoor Beer Garden Bar. Enjoy a freshly brewed beer from our 1 barrel brewhouse or any of the other local craft breweries we feature on draft. Brewmaster Andy Tveekrem brings over two decade of award-winning brewing experience to this small but mighty brewhouse to turn out advent...See More
name: Nano Brew Cleveland

description: Nantahala Brewing Company is a microbrewery that was founded in Bryson City, Western North Carolina’s outdoor adventure capital, in the spring of 2009.  We officially started selling beer in May 2010.  If you are in the area, stop by and check out our progress.
name: Nantahala Brewing Company

description: Napa Point Brewing opened November 2013 at 388 Devlin Road, near the Napa County Airport, with the goal of bringing “ultra-premium” beer and food to the Napa Valley  A variety of staple beers, like the India Pale Lager, American Hefeweizen, Dry Irish Stout and Amber Ale, are on tap year-round, along with a number of seasonal brews.
name: Napa Point Brewing

description: We create our beers using proprietary recipes developed by our Master Brewer Don Barkley, with his 30+ years in the craft brewing industry. Only the finest domestic and European hops, two row barley, and malted wheat are used in the beer that we make
name: Napa Smith Brewery
Napa Valley Brewing Co/ Calistoga Inn

description:
Naparbier is committed to make beer with a high quality, using the best ingredients, naturals and fresh. It means that each Naparbier beer is make without preservatives, additives and other harmful chemicals.
We develop uncompromising beer. Beers bold and irreverent. Beer with passion and soul.
name: Naparbier

description: The Naples Beach Brewery is a family owned craft brewery founded with the sole purpose of helping beer drinkers who are disappointed with their current beer selection and are also frustrated with not being able to drink high quality local craft beer. We will make it a point to source local ingredients and products for use along the path from grain to glass. The brewery will begin brewing on modest sized equipment handcrafting small batch ales for the local community and surrounding areas.
name: Naples Beach Brewery

description:
Narragansett Beer is New England's oldest beer, founded in 1890. It was the #1 beer New England from 1919 through the 1970's and the official beer of the Red Sox for over 30 years. It's now one of the fastest growing beers in New England and was winner of the Bronze Medal at the 2008 World Beer Cup.

Narragansett has always been for New Englanders. That's why in these especially troubling times, we want to build a brand new brewery in the heart of New England. The brewery would provide a slew of new jobs and help stimulate New England's economy. We need to sell 7.5 million cases of beer a year to be able to make it all happen. And to do that, we need you! So Drink your part! You buy a case, we build a brewery.
name: Narragansett Brewing Company

description:
Our brewery was established in 2004 to provide a wide range of flavorful Ales and Lagers, brewed and packaged on site at our picturesque farm. Each beer is hand crafted in small batches, employing both traditional brewing methods and American craft-brewing creativity. We offer our fine micro-brewed beers on draft with your meal at J’s Restaurant and for sale at our Wine Shoppe.

We mill our grain on site and grow hops used in our operations. All beers are 100% brewed and packaged on site. There are no additives or preservatives in our beers.
name: Nashoba Valley Winery

description: Zimbabwe's National Brewery.
name: National Breweries

description: Natty Greene's Pub and Brewing Company is one of the most frequented restaurants in the downtown area and in Greensboro. Natty's offers a variety of menu items such as platters, appetizers, beverages and specialty housecrafted brew on tap along with a sports bar atmosphere and patio dining available. Great restaurant for all ages. Childrens menu available.
name: Natty Greene's Brewing Co.

description: Our passion is brewing quality handcrafted ales.
name: Navigation Brewing Company

description:
Nebraska Brewing Company was formed in November of 2007 and has established itself as a Midwest Innovator of quality Craft Beers and artisanal Barrel-Aged Products. Building on a reputation for quality, flavor, and creativity, Nebraska Brewing Company strives to be a stand-out in an ever growing field. Nebraska Brewing Company is proud to be locally owned and locally operated. Small, independent, and pushing the envelope.

Brewpub est. Nov'07
Production Facility Jan'14
name: Nebraska Brewing Company

description: Nectar Creek Honeywine was created by two brothers with a contagious energy to redefine the world's oldest fermented beverage as a new and artful libation. All of our mead is handcrafted in small batches using the best ingredients the Pacific Northwest has to offer, highlighting specific blends of Willamette Valley honey, water and yeast to produce a sensational pint
name: Nectar Creek

description:
Even if you paid attention in school, you probably still don’t know that there was a time, before Prohibition, when our region was the hop capital of the nation. And when more than 50 breweries operated in the area.

Nedloh Brewing Company is committed to restoring the tradition of hop growing and small breweries in our area. We’re dedicated to making beer the way it should be, with fanatical quality, and a glint in our eye when we get to experiment on a new small batch.
name: Nedloh Brewing Company

description:
Negev Brewery started in 2005 as one of the first home-breweries in Israel.
Already at this stage, the special beers have won recognition and appreciation throughout the country, earning numerous awards.
name: Negev Brewery

description:
Classic German Beers with an American Twist
Based In Exeter, NH, The Neighborhood Beer Co. is a craft brewery specializing in American interpretations of authentic German-style beers made from the finest and freshest ingredients on Earth.  Based on a shared passion for flavorful, easy-drinking beers and a commitment to high quality and innovation, Neighborhood beers are designed to help bring people together.
name: Neighborhood Beer Co.

description:
The Neil House Brewery was started by Patrick Kelleher, who was, at the time, an undergraduate student in Chemistry at The Ohio State University. What started as a hobby turned into a passion, and now the Neil House Brewery is open as a fully-functional Columbus-area microbrewery.

Also, the Neil House is a fully stocked retailer of homebrewing supplies. Whether you are into making beer, wine, mead, cider, soda, or cheese, please check the Homebrew Supply section of our website for prices, and stop into the store.
name: Neil House Brewery

description:
The brewery was first brought to the Historic Dockyard at Chatham as the Flagship Brewery in 1995 where it established a five barrel kit brewing up to 100 firkins a week. All the ales have nautical themed names to gel with the surroundings in which it is brewed


In 2003 the brewery was bought and renamed the Nelson Brewing Company to fall in line with the most famous naval hero of all time 'Admiral Horatio Nelson' and that his flagship 'The Victory' was built here in Chatham Dockyard.

In July 2006 the brewery was purchased by Piers Macdonald. Piers has over 20 years experience in the brewing industry and is passionate to keep the traditions of Kent brewing alive. Using the best ingredients and the finest Kent hops, combined with the expertise and dedication of his brewing staff, Piers plans to build on the brewery's already growing reputation as the provider of some of the tastiest ales on the market.

Now brewing from a seven and a half barrel kit and regularly having over a dozen ales of various strengths and taste available, the brewery is sure to have a beer to suit all!
name: Nelson Brewery

description:
Since its inception in 1991, the Nelson Brewing Company has been dedicated to producing all natural, traditional, full-flavoured ales. In 2006 we decided to let the brewery evolve to an even more natural state, and by October of that year we were granted Certified Organic status. In a sense, we were getting back to our roots. People have been brewing organically for over 6000 years; the current practice of large-scale industrial farming with synthetic fertilizers and pesticides is an aberration of traditional farming, and therefore brewing, practices. Choosing organic production is also in keeping with the spirit of our home town of Nelson, a laid-back, progressive community nestled in the heart of the Kootenays. With limitless backcountry skiing and hiking at our back door, as well as a host of other outdoor activities year-round, brewing an organic beer in Nelson just seems like the natural thing to do.

What does it mean to be organic? Organic certification is a guarantee that our beer and its ingredients were produced without the use of synthetic fertilizers, pesticides, or genetic engineering. Our processes, cleaning and sanitation regimes must also adhere to a strict set of organic principles and be approved by our organic certification body. Being organic also signifies a commitment to environmental sustainability. Our goal is to eventually source all of our ingredients as locally as possible. Most of our barley is already malted right here in BC, and we are working with local farmers toward the planting of certified organic hops. Our spent materials are recycled by local farmers as feed and compost.
name: Nelson Brewing Company

description: The Neon Groundhog Brewery was added to our brand in May 2015. We are excited to see this addition grow and prosper at Majestic Oak Winery.
name: Neon Groundhog Brewery

description: A small brewery and tap room in Livingston, Montana that focuses on great beer, food and service. Don't drink like a fish, Drink Like a God!
name: Neptunes Brewery

description:
Located in Lower Bucks County, Pennsylvania, Neshaminy Creek Brewing is one of the fastest growing craft breweries in the Philadelphia area.  Since opening in June of 2012 the brewery has built a solid reputation for solid lagers and hoppy ales.  Winner of the 2015 Philly Beer Scene magazine Brewery of the Year and 2014 and 2015 Brewer of the Year, Neshaminy Creek has also won a GABF Gold Medal in 2013 for their Vienna-style Churchville Lager.

To make great tasting beer that challenges not only beer drinkers, but ourselves as brewers as well.
name: Neshaminy Creek Brewing Company

description:
At Neuse River Brewing Co. we concentrate on Belgian style ales and IPAs. Our goal is to pay homage to the traditional styles of beer which have been perfected throughout time although we are also passionate about experimenting with contemporary concepts and bridging the gaps between the two. Neuse River Brewing Co. incorporates sustainable practices and buys local whenever possible in an effort to support our neighbors.

NRBC will be located just outside the Five Points area in Raleigh, North Carolina. The 68 year old building, originally built for restoring and building firetrucks, will house the 20bbl brewhouse and tasting room. Come early 2015, patrons will be able to enjoy one of our Belgian inspired ales while taking in a view of the downtown Raleigh city skyline or relaxing beside the herb garden.

NRBC provides a gathering place for friends, family and community to share stories and quality time with one another. And, if we’re lucky, our beers will help to inspire new stories and memories for many years to come.
 
Santé!
name: Neuse River Brewing Company

description: Neustadt Springs Brewery, a small family-run craft brewery, is dedicated to brewing only natural premium ales and beers, using the finest Canadian malts, New Zealand hops and European yeasts. Reputed to be Ontario's oldest original operating brewery building, the 1859 stone-built brewery rests over some of the purest spring water in Ontario.
name: Neustadt Springs Brewery

description:
Nevin's Brewing Company opened its doors in December 2012. Like all breweries, we use grain to make our beer. But unlike other breweries, we do not simply discard our used or "spent" grain. Instead, we deliver our spent grain to local farmers to use as feed for livestock and compost to enrich the soil for vegetables. We then, in turn, purchase this well-fed livestock and nutrient-rich vegetables to make our steaks, burgers, salads, side dishes and so many other items on our menu.

Our goal is not only to bring you the freshest, most flavorful food and beer possible, but also to aim as high as we can for true sustainability.
name: Nevin's Brewing Company

description: The Brewery was officially brewing in October 2002 and was incorporated in 1994 as the New Albanian Brewing Company in a room that branches off of Sportstime Pizza. The brewery established by Roger Baylor his wife Amy (O'Connell) Baylor and her sister Kate O'Connel. This is the first commercial brewery in New Albany since 1935. The first brewmaster was Michael Borchers which brought with him experience and used machines from the now defunct Silver Creek Brewing Corporation that was located in Sellersburg, Indiana. Jared Williamson and Jesse Williams are the current brewers working the brewery. In 2005, 14,000 gallons of beer was produced by the brewery, and with the new additions, the planned output for 2007 is double the 2005 amount.
name: New Albanian Brewing

description:
Our story starts in the kitchen of David Bryan circa 2006.  That's when the first batches of home-brewed beer began appearing and David's wife Lori began to realize that her husband was forming a lifetime passion.  David's passion would continue to grow and evolve.  He learned the tradition of brewing in America.  The history of small family owned breweries that we able to serve fresh handcrafted beer to their local communities.  The fact that the these small local breweries became points of pride in the community and that the businesses would stay in the family for generations.  
 
An idea began to grow.  The idea that despite the brewing world we live in now with mega breweries pumping out mass marketed bland beer, that a small locally owned brewery making fresh unique beer could again be a source of pride for a community.  David dreamed of recreating this American brewing tradition and so set out on his way to do just that.
 
David spent the next 7 years honing his craft.  Learning about beer styles and brewing techniques.  Winning contests with his beer and defining a unique style for quality and consistency.  In 2012 the wheels were set into motion for our brewery when David met Tyler Meusburger, a colleague with a passion for entrepreneurship and creativity.  Working together they began building a business plan and putting financing into place, and in Nov of 2013 David and Tyler brewed the first batch of beer at New American Brewing Co.
 
We look forward to continuing our story and living a "New Tradition" of American brewing.
 
Drink American!
name: New American Brewing Co.

description: We'll set the scene: 1989. Belgium. Boy on bike. (OK, make that a young man of 32). As our aspiring young homebrewer rides his mountain bike with fat tires through European villages famous for beer, New Belgium Brewing Company was but a glimmer in his eye. Or basement. For Jeff Lebesch would return to Fort Collins with a handful of ingredients and an imagination full of recipes. And then there was beer. Jeff's first two basement-brewed creations? A brown dubbel with earthy undertones named Abbey and a remarkably well-balanced amber he named Fat Tire. To say the rest was history would be to overlook his wife's involvement. Kim Jordan was New Belgium's first bottler, sales rep, distributor, marketer and financial planner. And now, she's our CEO.
name: New Belgium Brewing

description: New Bohemia Brewing Co. (NuBo) was stablished in the Pleasure Point neighborhood of Santa Cruz in 2015. We offer a wide variety of beer styles, but specialize in craft lagers--both traditional and experimental in nature. We have a limited but wonderful food menu, as well as a great space to sit and savor a perfect beer.
name: New Bohemia Brewing Co.

description: The New Boswell Brewing Company started business on St. Patrick's Day, 2010. The brewery, owned by Rodrick and Kiera Landess began as a project at the IU East Center for Entrepreneurship. While majoring in Fine Arts at IU East Rodrick took classes in the Business Department studying Entrepreneurship and participated in Students in Free Enterprise. After completing his degree, the project took on a life of its own, slowly inching its way towards becoming a reality. In 2010, with the help of a matching funds grant from the Eastern Indiana Regional Workforce Board and the GrowthStart Project, New Boswell Brewing Company was able to purchase the required equipment to begin operations and work towards becoming a functional brewery. After a couple of months of practice and creating procedures, New Boswell hosted their Grand Opening at the 4th Floor Blues Club.
name: New Boswell Brewing Company

description:
Founded in early 2011 by the Meyer family, we're inspired to brew our locally hand-crafted beer by old-word German recipes. What goes in our beer is as much local wheat, local water and local passion as we can get our hands on. 

Our beers go right up to the edge of the style and take one defiant step over it. We make beer that tastes great and refreshes the soul. we don't care whether or not it 'fits the style'. 

Order a glass of NBBCo and experience something different
name: New Braunfels Brewing Company

description:
Buffalo, New York welcomed in the 20th century with the Pan American Exposition.  It was a time of amazing progress.  Electricity was cutting-edge technology, and the possibilities seemed endless.  Hard times lay ahead for the country and for Buffalo though; The Great War would rage and The Great Depression would last for nearly a decade before the United States would emerge from the second World War as the leader of the Free World.

What does any of that have to do with a startup craft-brewery?  The New Buffalo Brewing Co. shares the same passion for progress.  Buffalo produced over half a million barrels of brew in 1896, but by the end of the 1970's, production halted to almost zero. The United States is emerging from that low point as the world leader in brewing. Home brewing is continually growing, and new nano-breweries are popping up everywhere. Once again, The United States is leading the way by taking brewing forward into the next golden age.

So raise your glass in a toast to progress; It’s time to bring brewing back to Buffalo!
name: New Buffalo Brewing Company

description:
As Muncie's local brewery, we hand-craft fresh beer for some of the most passionate, knowledgeable and discerning craft-beer drinkers anywhere. We are proud to be part of such a rich, local tradition, and our mission is to supply locally-brewed, unique beers to some of the best taverns and pubs in the state (or Midwest).

Just as enjoying great beers is done best in community, responsibly with friends, we also believe that brewing that beer should be done in relationship with you, our customer. Drop us a note to let us know what you think about New Corner beers, ask a question, arrange a brewery tour, or tell us what you'd like to see brewed next!

We're always happy to meet our customers, and if you come by the brewery, you can also purchase a 64oz growler!
name: New Corner Brewing Company

description:
New England Brewing Co was conceived in early 2012 and brews beer for the New England North West region of NSW.

We love country NSW, but there was an issue. No real beer. No regional beer. Just beer from the cities. So we’ve changed this.

We self-distribute our beers to the region’s best pubs, clubs and bottle shops (in a slow old truck). If our beers aren’t at your local, complain!
name: New England Brewing Co

description:
New England Brewing Co. is a microbrewery based in Woodbridge, CT that crafts a handful of savory brews including Atlantic Amber, Elm
City Lager, and Sea Hag IPA.

Owner and brewer Rob Leonard started making beer in his kitchen. Like many home brewers he eventually grew in knowledge and recipes and wanted to make more and different beers.

He landed that home brewers dream job at New Haven Brewing in 1992 cleaning kegs and packing cases. But his obvious passion for the brewing craft led him to the title assistant brewer and eventually head brewer in short three years. At that time he joined forces with former NHB colleague Blair Potts to run Quality Assured Brewing, a consulting service for microbreweries throughout the North East. 1996 saw Rob as the Brew Master for both the Manchester and Westport, CT locations in The John Harvard’s Brew House chain. While there, Rob won a gold medal at the Great American Beer Festival in the German Altbier category. Southern Connecticut, especially Norwalk, took a liking to Rob and that was where he became the brewmaster and operations manager for New England Brewing. He learned the sales end of beer and when the owners wanted to get out of the brewery business, Rob immediately took the opportunity to acquire the name of the company and re-locate the whole business just down the street from the kitchen where he first started making beer.
name: New England Brewing Company

description: New English Brewing Company - Traditional New English Style, Authentic West Coast Character
name: New English Brewing

description: Welcome to our quaint little brewery nestled on the outskirts of New Glarus, Wisconsin. The brewery is run by an enthusiastic couple, Daniel & Deb Carey, who have successfully combined business management and brewing professionalism. Our philosophy is based on individuality, cooperation and the employment of 100% natural ingredients to produce world -class, handcrafted beers for our friends in Wisconsin. Cheers!
name: New Glarus Brewing Company

description:
New Glory is a small brewery located in Sacramento, CA.   Our name was inspired by the American spirit which embodies ingenuity, hard work, passion, family, pride and a dream.

Our Ales reflect our rich heritage and are brewed with an American twist.  We Commit ourselves to quality, Integrity and Sustainability.
name: New Glory Craft Brewery

description:
The ghost of the old Buffalo Brewing Company lives here

Inspired by Sacramento's Buffalo Brewery, a new generation can once again enjoy Buffalo Beer.
name: New Helvetia Brewing Company

description:
New Holland Brewing Company’s deep roots in the craft industry go back to 1997. Our role as an integral member of the artisan approach is something we take seriously, yet engage lightheartedly.

We believe the art of craft lives in fostering rich experiences for our customers, through creating authentic beer, spirits and food while providing great service. Recognized for our creativity and artistry, our mission to improve the lives of craft consumers everywhere is seen in our diverse, balanced collection of beer and spirits.
name: New Holland Brewing Company

description: New Jersey Beer Co. is dedicated to crafting quality beer for all; from the occasional beer drinker to the beer aficionado. We believe that good products come from good people, and strive to do our very best for our community and our customers. We believe we can provide happiness through doing what we love, and that a good beer can make the good times great
name: New Jersey Beer Company

description: New Mexico Craft Brewing is committed to producing the highest quality, least processed Craft Beer possible. We use local ingredients when possible and we strive to quench your thirst for quality beer.
name: New Mexico Craft Brewing Company

description:
New Planet Beer specializes in great tasting craft ales, that are 100%gluten-free, offering a range of beer styles that can be enjoyed by any craft beer drinker, but especially by those that gluten-free is their only option. Unrivaled in flavor, quality, taste and care, New Planet is everything a craft beer should be.

The brand is grounded on what’s good for the earth and for the individual, and is about discovering something better. That’s why New Planet is dedicated to donating a portion of their proceeds to help make the planet better for all of us.
name: New Planet Beer Company

description: An Aggie owned & operated nanobrewery. Distributing to Bryan & College Station.
name: New Republic Brewing Company

description: Microbrewery located in downtown Salisbury NC
name: New Sarum Brewing

description: To provide citizens and guests of New Smyrna Beach unique handcrafted specialty ales brewed right here in the heart of New Smyrna Beach.
name: New Smyrna Beach Brewing Company

description:
We are a microbrewery in Myrtle Beach, S.C., producing 3000 BBLs a year.

Supplying fresh ales and lagers to people living in and visiting South Carolina.

We now have Draft pours on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Fridays at 4:30-7:00.  Free tours on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 3:00.
name: New South Brewing

description:
Newaygo Brewing Company, LLC is a brewery, winery, restaurant, and cultural center located in historic downtown Newaygo, Michigan. Founded in 2014 and opened in 2015 by the Looman family of Grand Rapids and Newaygo, it features a 16 seat bar, dining room, and event stage. Its professional staff serve a large variety of beer, wine, hard cider, mead, artisan pizza, and award winning desserts; all produced in their 115 year old building on the Muskegon River. 

Beer is produced on a 5 Barrel brewhouse which was custom made by PsychoBrew, LLC in Greenville, Michigan. The brewery specializes in producing English style cask ale served from traditional casks with the use of beer engines. They also offer many local favorites and creative takes on modern beer styles. 

Newaygo Brewing Company offers beer to-go in bottles, growlers, howlers, and crowlers and wholesales kegs of their offerings to local bars and restaurants. In 2016, Newaygo Brewing Co will begin distribution of canned beer to retail locations throughout Michigan.
name: Newaygo Brewing Co.

description:
Welcome to Newburgh Brewing Company, which is the Hudson Valley's newest Craft Brewery!

Founded by Chris Basso and Paul Halayko, both from Washingtonville, NY, and later joined by an accomplished Charlie Benedetti, Newburgh Brewing Company is proud to join the rich history of brewing in New York State. 

We began brewing in March 2012, launching our beers on April 19, 2012.
name: Newburgh Brewing Company

description: Founded in 2012, the Company is Massachusetts' only exclusive all-can and keg craft brewery. Co-founded by two local Newburyport entrepreneurs, musicians, and home brewers - Chris Webb and Bill Fisher - the company aims to capture the essence of Newburyport's quaint seaside character across a line of great tasting handcrafted ales. Newburyport Brewing Company uses premium quality natural ingredients in its Newburyport Pale Ale™, Plum Island Belgian White™, Green Head IPA™ and 1635 Series™ beers.
name: Newburyport Brewing Company

description: Lofty tasting room in a historic setting with Southern small plates, small-batch brews & live music.
name: Newgrass Brewing Co.

description: Great burgers and craft brews.
name: Newhall Refinery

description:
At the end of 1992, the idea of the second brewery in Orange County was born. After six months of searching for the perfect location we found the old Delaney's Seafood Market building in the historic Cannery Village on the Balboa Peninsula, which would become our home.

Two years later construction was complete and on April 1, 1995 the Newport Beach Brewing Company became the first and only Brewery to open in Newport Beach and the 2nd Brewery to open its doors to the public in Orange County. Under the same ownership since day one we strive to serve fresh high quality food, cocktails and hand crafted beer at intelligent prices.
name: Newport Beach Brewing Company

description: Newstead Brewing Co lives in a 1940s steel warehouse that was built by Skennars coaches. The warehouse was given a new lease when transformed into the Doggett Street Studio in the 1980s. A combination of bus and artistic flare gives the site a wonderfully tranquil, comfortable vibe with lashings of industrial robustness. We have done very little to spruce it up, keeping the original elements as much as possible, with some modern necessities (Big Ass Fans) and large shiny tanks.
name: Newstead Brewing Co

description:
Next Door Brewing Company is a brewery and restaurant for our community.  We serve the best beer and food we can provide while offering a convivial environment for our customers to enjoy a great conversation over a drink and snack or meal with family, friends and neighbors — old and new.

Our beer is handcrafted in small batches and served just a few yards from where it was brewed.  Expect to find 8 to 11 choices at any time, ranging from our standards, Wilbur!, WPA and Sevex to a wide variety of seasonal, creative and collaborative brews (including a new brand of brews every 10-14 days).  And, we proudly pour a full pint.
name: Next Door Brewing Company

description:
Nexus Brewery is dedicated on being the Albuquerque brewery that people can count on when it comes to providing amazing tasting beer and excellent food.
