We love good beer, and that makes our job just that much more fun. We sell delicious New Mexican soul food with a mix of southern comfort food. Come on down to Nexus Brewery and enjoy the beer we brew. We’d love to meet you and pour you a cold one.

You don't just drink a beer; you drink in the experience of life and all that goes with it.

Throw in the best beer in Albuquerque and it's an ExBeerience.
name: Nexus Brewery

description: Niagara College Teaching Brewery is the centre for beer education in the Niagara Peninsula and the only fully licensed teaching brewery in Canada. First Draft is our brand.
name: Niagara College Teaching Brewery

description: Niagara Falls Brewing Company has been bought by Moosehead, and moved to Brampton, Ontario in 2007. Now called Niagara Brewing Company.
name: Niagara Falls Brewing Company

description: Farm to glass beers. Tours, Tastings, & Special Events.
name: Niagara Oast House Brewers

description: Nickel Beer Company is now open Friday, Saturday and Sunday with beers brewed by longtime San Diego brewer and pub owner Tom Nickel.
name: Nickel Beer Company

description: A family-owned microbrewery, with 30 years of brewing history, committed to producing an outstanding local product with European character.
name: Nickel Brook Brewing Company

description: Nickelpoint Brewing Co. is a craft brewery located in the Five Points neighborhood of Raleigh, North Carolina, that will offer classic European style ales. A 20 bbl microbrewery with a tasting room is being up-fitted where customers will be able to enjoy the brewery's beers and learn about the process of brewing. Stay thirsty and stay tuned for a 2014 opening!
name: Nickelpoint Brewing Co.

description: Night Shift Brewing is three friends who turned a passion for nocturnal brewing into our profession. Started in a Somerville kitchen, we now brew at our Everett, MA nanobrewery. Fusing unique ingredients into an array of rich, complex flavors, we present and pour our small-batch creations throughout Greater Boston. Our mission: the innovation and sharing of memorable craft beer.
name: Night Shift Brewing

description: The concept for Nighthawk Brewery started on January 2, 2011 when Ethan Hall & Jay Mead did the first home brew at Ethan's home on Nighthawk Circle. Jokingly, "if we even open our own brewery, we HAVE to call it Nighthawk Brewery..."
name: Nighthawk Brewery

description:
We brew beer and produce good spirits

Our brewing there since mid-September 2006 Fruängskällan in Nyköping, about 10 mil south of Stockholm, and the distillery is nearby on Tärnö Manor where even mälteriet is located. We have been around since 1996. The Nils Oscar operates some of Europe's most qualified brewer. Our products are sold to bars and liquor stores throughout the country. Other companies in the same group , occupational group includes, in addition Brewery and Distillery also our own malt house and farm Tärnö Manor. Try our products and please let us know if you want to know more: info@nilsoscar.se You can also sign up to Nils Oscar Good Friends . Welcome!
name: Nils Oscar Bryggeri

description: Nimble Hill Brewing Company is a new 15 barrel, farm style microbrewery, located in rural . Northeast PA.
name: Nimble Hill Brewing Company

description: What began as a small, local brewery in the spring of 1996 has grown into the largest brewery based in Arizona with three 150-barrel fermenters that stand nearly 30 feet tall and holding nearly 5,000 gallons of beer each. The brewery opened up two locations statewide with bistros serving their craft beer and an extensive menu including burgers, brewpub food & wood-fired pizzas. Nimbus beer is renowned throughout the state for its collection of natural beers that derive from the local Tucson groundwater that resembles that of the water found on the Burton in the heart of England. It is that exceptional water that makes their flagship beer, Old Monkey Shine a favorite of true beer enthusiasts. This traditional English Strong Ale is a medium-bodied ale with a dark, roasted flavor derived from seven different malts and brown sugar. This dark beer starts with a touch of sweetness but finishes dry and crisp. Although this beer has an explosive flavor profile that could almost be considered a dessert beer, it packs quite a punch with an ABV content of 8.2%
name: Nimbus Brewing Company

description:
The malt-and-hop magic happens in our 5,400-square-foot brewhouse, with every step in the crafting process overseen by our award-winning brewmaster.

Visit our brewery and tour the facility or simply relax with friends inside our 1,500-square-foot tap room or on the large covered patio, where you can celebrate the sunset, your successes, or simply toast to the day just completed.
name: Nine Band Brewery

description: We are a New York craft cider company producing hard cider from 100% Capital District and Hudson Valley apples.
name: Nine Pin Cider Works

description:
Established in 2006 by Jamie Floyd and Nikos Ridge, Ninkasi Brewing Company continues to brew independent craft beer from its Pacific Northwest home base in Eugene, Oregon. Named after the Sumerian Goddess of fermentation, the brewery operates under the core purpose: Perpetuate Better Living. Known for beers like Total Domination IPA, Tricerahops Double IPA, Dawn of the Red IRA, and cult favorites like Sleigh'r and Maiden the Shade, Ninkasi proudly serves quality craft beers while focusing on community involvement, art and culture. 

Learn more at www.ninkasibrewing.com.
name: Ninkasi Brewing Company

description:
Our mission is to create exceptional hand-crafted Ales and Lagers that are unique to Katy and Texas.

We are a family owned and operated brewery in Katy, TX. Our roots are from Panama, Texas and Philly. Our family heritage is also very different. We have Germans, Czechs and Panamanians in the bunch. So to say all four owners are different is an understatement.
name: No Label Brewing Company

description:
If Spokane were a liquid it would most certainly be our beer. Born & Raised in Washington’s Inland Empire, we’re an internationally award-winning brewery, crafting Spokane-Style beers with No Boundaries: innovative beers made in Spokane, by Spokane residents, using ingredients sourced from within 300 miles of Spokane. We create beers that push ourselves & No-Li drinkers beyond the boundaries… taking a leap beyond the typical beer-drinking experience, and into a memorable adventure. No Boundaries, No-Li!

The pub features Inland Northwest-style pub food, with an emphasis on "keeping it local." Most of the dishes are created from scratch, and use as many locally sourced ingredients as possible. 

For more information about our beers, brewery & the pub, visit www.nolibrewhouse.com.
name: No-Li Brewhouse

description:
What is number six? It’s a tunnel in the mountains. But this is no ordinary tunnel. This mile of rail at 7000 Sierra Nevada feet connected east to west like no other. In 1867, Transcontinental Tunnel Number 6 finally broke through solid granite after 2 years of hand picks, dynamite, willpower and a startling disregard for safety. Number Six was the most deadly and ambitious railway tunnel ever built. What used to take 25 days to cross, now could be done in a matter of hours. People, materials, and cider now flowed freely.

Number 6 Hard Cider is a tribute to hard fought progress and the connections it creates. Come taste our flagship True Cider and crafted seasonal releases at our rail-side cidery and taproom. 100% Washington apples and a relentless toil for perfect taste is what we’re made of. Raise a cold, crisp pint to progress. Onward!
name: No. 6 Hard Cider

description:
Noble Ale Works is a microbrewery located in Anaheim, California at the Stadium Plaza Business Park in the Platinum Triangle. We are conveniently located between the Angels Stadium and the Honda Center.
 
Our goal is to create and maintain high quality full flavored craft brews for those who can handle it. "We are not here to convert light or non-beer drinkers; our beer is for people that already appreciate craft beer" We will never skimp on quality or freshness of ingredients, so that we can maintain the high profile flavor of brews that we at Noble care about.
name: Noble Ale Works

description:
Noble Rey Brewing Company is DFW's newest Craft Brewery. We aim to produce the highest quality hand crafted beers for our community.
Chris Rigoulot, owner and head brewer, brings with him the knowledge he gained at the American Brewers Guild and puts that into every beer he creates. We cannot wait to share his dream with you!
Be Noble. Drink Noble. is not just a slogan to us, it's a way of life. We are deeply committed to DFW and the people that live here and hope to be the best neighbors we can be. Whether we are volunteering at local relief agencies or at one the area great festivals, you'll definitely see and feel our presence.
name: Noble Rey Brewing Company

description:
NoDa Brewing Company opened its doors to the world on October 29, 2011 and is one of Charlotte’s newest home-grown microbrewery for beer lovers in the Carolinas! This unique production brewery in Charlotte’s NoDa neighborhood crafts small-batch premium beers, offering something for nearly every beer drinker. The North Davidson (NoDa) neighborhood is known as the creative center of Charlotte: as a natural extension of NoDa’s artistic spirit, there isn’t a better place for a microbrewery to call home.

NoDa Brewing is a 15 barrel brewery creating the highest quality beers for local restaurants and pubs, as well as our tap room.  Our beer styles will have a Northwestern feel, showcasing American Pale Ales, India Pale Ales, and Porters.  Our small size gives us the flexibility to introduce many unique and artistic recipes as well as our renditions of classic varieties such as Imperial Stouts, Wit beers, and Winter Warmers.  Our Head Brewer frequently traveled to Europe over the past couple years.  He has been fortunate to have experienced the wonderful beers that have historically defined many current craft beer styles.  As we pay homage to these great and historic beers, we’ll add an American Flair that will be embraced in the Carolinas and beyond.
name: NoDa Brewing Company

description: Philadelphia's most award winning brewery, located in the heart of Center City.
name: Nodding Head Brewery

description: NOLA Brewing – New Orleans Lager & Ale – represents the creation of refreshing high-quality beer in the heart of New Orleans. Located in the Irish Channel, we provide locally produced products and are sensitive to the taste, look, and feel of great beer. Founded in 2008 by Kirk Coco & Peter Caddoo, NOLA Brewing is providing quality lagers and ales for you to enjoy. Check out our current selections and locations proudly serving our fine ales and go enjoy one!
name: Nola Brewing Company

description: A new brewery experience on the Northern Beaches of NSW . The Nomads of craft brewing.
name: Nomad Brewing Co.

description:
There was a time when life was less hectic and things moved a bit slower.   many small towns used a town whistle to let people know it was mid-day and  time for a break. the whistle could be heard throughout the town. Today At Noon Whistle, we want you to take a break and enjoy yourself. 

Many towns still blow a Noon Whistle today. In fact, the Noon Whistle guys  grew up going on vacation to towns where that Noon Whistle sounds off. 

Marquette, Wisconsin is the town that  inspired the name for Paul, and the Noon Whistle  signifies tradition in his family. Not only does it symbolize  the annual trek his family takes to get away and spend time together, but It also sets the schedule  for the first  beer - no beer before the Noon Whistle. You  can hear two things happen at Noon: the Noon Whistle and the  opening of a fresh beer.
name: Noon Whistle Brewing

description:
The brew house built in Germany in the veranda of Norderneyer brewery has a rash of 500 liters. Both copper bowls are used for various multi-functional tasks and are on the cutting edge of brewing technology. In the basement are located next to the other technique, the two fermentation tanks and eight storage tanks, each with a volume of 1000 liters.
Since 500 liters are produced in the brewhouse per brewing process, there are always two consecutive brewing days for a fermentation tank can be filled with 1,000 liters. A full week has four brewing brewing days on which the two fermentation tanks are filled. On 5 Day the system is completely cleaned.
name: Norderneyer Brauhaus

description: English-style Brewpub.
name: Norris English Pub and Brewery

description:
North by Northwest came into existence from an idea that I had many years ago – that great craft brewed beer and fabulous food could come together in a fun and interesting atmosphere.

I chose the name North by Northwest because I wanted to convey the image of the Northwest where many brew pubs and micro-breweries got their start. Once settling on the name,the architecture and the image flowed naturally. Stone and wood are combined with the high vaulted ceiling to create the feel of those great lodges in our Northwest National parks.We have urbanized it a bit with the steel structure and industrial designed light fixtures. The Brewery Tower is a prominent feature along with the NXNW grain silos. The one directly in front of the Brewery Tower is a functioning silo full of 25,000 lbs. of barley – the major component ofthe beer making process. All the beers at NXNW are brewed right on site inside the Tower.
name: North by Northwest Restaurant and Brewery

description: North Center Brewing Co. is proud to be a part of the Michigan brewing family.  We strive to incorporate all things Michigan not only in our beer but in everything that went into making it and our brewery.
name: North Center Brewing Company

description:
A pioneer in the craft beer movement, opened in 1988 as a local brewpub in the historic town of Fort Bragg, located on California’s Mendocino Coast.

Under the leadership of brew master Mark Ruedrich, the brewery has developed a strong reputation for quality having won more than 70 awards in national and international competitions.

In addition to Red Seal Ale, Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout, Scrimshaw Pilsner, and other fine North Coast brands, the brewery has resurrected the old Acme label with a heritage dating back to the San Francisco of the 1860’s.

These exceptional beers are available in 47 states now and also are exported to Europe and the Pacific Rim.
name: North Coast Brewing Company

description: Nestled in the heart of downtown Slippery Rock, North Country Brewery typically features 10-15 beers that rotate seasonally.  While this unique restaurant and brewery inhabits a former funeral home, it is quite lively inside.  Featuring a great menu and fun events, North Country Brewery is a great stop for any beer lover.
name: North Country Brewing Co.

description: New Hampshire's 100% All Natural Craft Cider. Conveniently located on the right end of the Lower Mill Building of the Salmon Falls Mills in Rollinsford, NH (look for the sign and outside entrance). Stop in for free tastings of our four ciders currently on tap. We have growlers, bottles and kegs available as well as gift certificates and merchandise.
name: North Country Hard Cider Company

description:
Our approach to brewing is as much art as it is science. We strive to create beers that our local customers enjoy while staying true to the traditional flavors of each unique brew. Our brews are handcrafted on-site and made from all natural ingredients - absolutely no preservatives - with the finest barley malts, cereal grains, hops, yeast and spring water. 

We offer many styles of beer from Belgian ales to Czech pilsners and British porters to light American lagers. Please feel free to ask your server if you have questions about the specific brews you choose. We recommend trying them all by ordering a sampler of all of our microbrews (only $5).
name: North End Tavern & Brewery

description: North High Brewing is a microbrewery that offers a unique blend of experience, retail, and consumption for craft beer enthusiasts.
name: North High Brewing

description:
7 barrel system, great microbrews, brewery tours available
Brew Pub...located inside City Limits Pub and Grill  - Adjacent to Wallace RV Park
name: North Idaho Mountain Brew

description: We are a brewery and tap room in Seaview, Washington on Washington's Long Beach Peninsula.  We offer craft beer, gourmet sodas, lemonade, and light snacks.  We do not have a kitchen but you are welcome to bring in outside food.  People under 21 welcome with an adult until 6pm most nights.  We have live trivia as well as live music.
name: North Jetty Brewing

description:
Classic beer hall influence, full flavored unfiltered beer and beer food of the world inspired menu. Separate room for special events and meetings.

NMTBrew provides hand crafted, well balanced, brews and tasty food to the fine people living in or visiting Phoenix. Both the lunch and dinner menus feature beer/food pairings with a rotational element meant to highlight special events, the seasons and their flavors.
Sunday brunch till 2:00 P.M. Separate room available for special events and meetings.
name: North Mountain Brewing Company

description: The highest quality ingredients and passion of our head brewers Ron Jeffries and John Walsh help to insure every bottle of North Peak beer is brewed to perfection. Everything we do is designed to create ales of outstanding art and flavor. Every beer is brought to life through labor and love. We strive to create beers to lighten the spirit and soothe the soul.
name: North Peak Brewing Company

description: Like many small brewery owner's, Kurt Ahrens started as a homebrewer. He enjoyed brewing a variety of fresh, flavorful and unique beers and he loved sharing them with friends and family who liked the beer so much they encouraged Kurt to start his own brewery. Kurt had a day job in the insurance business but started to dream of someday opening his own commercial brewery. After years of resisting the temptation, he finally succumbed (with support from his wife, Lori) by buying a building in 2009. Previously owned brewing equipment was acquired in July 2009 in Anaconda, Montana and moved to the Mount Vernon location. Building permits were finally obtained and brewery construction began in October 2009. Federal and state brewery licenses applications were submitted March 1, 2010 and approved by July 2010.  Brewing operations commenced later that month and on August 27, 2010 the first kegs of North Sound Brewing Co. ales were sold to local pubs in Mount Vernon, WA. A week later on September 3, 2010 the tasting room at the brewery was opened and Kurt's dream had become a reality!
name: North Sound Brewing Co

description:
We opened our doors and served our first pint on August 10th, 1987. Now into our third decade, we remain a leader, well known for our wide variety of beers, original menu and popular outdoor, rooftop beer garden. With the addition of our fabulous sunroom, the Northampton Brewery continues to grow to accommodate our loyal fans.

Come on in for a delicious meal, snacks and a couple of beers, or just a couple of beers. Whether you're sitting by the warmth of our fireplace on a chilly winter evening, or under the stars on our rooftop beer garden, our comfortable friendly environment will keep you coming back again and again.
name: Northampton Brewery

description: Northbound Smokehouse & Brewpub is a full-service restaurant with an on-site craft brewery. We opened in 2012 with the hopes of being a cozy neighborhood bar. The people have responded! We won the City Pages Best Brewpub award in 2013, after only being open for 5 months. We smoke virtually everything on our menu, from turkey, beef, pork to cheese and eggs! Our beer has received great acclaim for being edgy, full-flavored and overall well executed. If you haven't visited us yet, it's probably time you give us a try!
name: Northbound Smokehouse & Brewpub

description: Focused on session ales from the classic British styles.  Small batch and fresh delivery.
name: NorthGate Brewing

description: Northport Brewing is Northport's oldest brewery. Located in the center of Northport, MI with an indoor lounge and bar, covered outdoor patio with stone fireplace. Our beers vary in style from classic to experimental with the intent of using as many local ingredients as possible from Leelanau County. Come visit us this summer and relax with a pint paired with a locally sourced appetizer, or fill a growler up to take on your boating adventures.
name: Northport Brewing Company

description:
Our company policy mandates that we have the radio on anytime we are working in the brewery. Company policy further states that attending our kids' games are more important than any board meeting. Not to mention our fishing poles are always in the trunk of our cars. 

We are not your traditional business, we're alot more fun than that. Top of the line premium grains, great hops and new school craftsmanship is how we create our beers. We don't conform to traditional recipes, we take it to the next level in all things we do. We keep it fun.


We focus on family, friends and making the best beer we can. We started brewing together 5 years ago as a hobby. Thanks to the encouragement of family and friends who loved our beer Northshire Brewery was born. Here at Northshire Brewery we're just trying to make a living doing what we love, brewing beer.
name: Northshire Brewery

description: Our year round tasting room opened in June 2012. We have wine, hard cider and beer tasting, wine, hard cider and beer by the glass, outdoor seating and live acoustic music. The Northville Winery originated across the parking lot in Parmenters Northville Cider Mill in 1982. Rob and Carina Nelson started making their own wine over 5 years ago and they have been expanding ever since, including adding a microbrewery this year. All of our grapes and apples are brought in from the West side of Michigan. We then do all the pressing in the cider mill and fermenting and bottling in the winery building. Every bottle is filled and labeled by hand. The winery produces several alcoholic wines, hard cider flavors and most recently BEER! We are also adding a small distillery soon!
name: Northville Winery & Brewing Co.

description: A taste of Northwest Brewing Company's beers is akin to a trip around the world. The brewery, formerly Trade Route Brewing Company, finds inspiration in the trade routes of old, which is why its brewmaster incorporate exotic ingredients such as ginger when crafting each batch with time-honored brewing methods. These eclectic flavors beget distinctive beers, such as the Mango Weizen, which stirs taste buds with Nugget hops and mango puree, and the Local Ink which has Aromatic, Dextrapils, Chocolate, Crystal, Munich, and Roasted Barley malts and is bittered with Magnum. Not content to keep their flavors in liquid form, Northwest Brewing Company also slings a menu of gastropub cuisine– including BBQ from Brank's, gourmet pizzas and cheese-slathered pasta dishes– backed by live music every Saturday night.
name: Northwest Brewing Company

description:
Northwoods Brewpub and Grill brought the fine tradition of craft brewing to Eau Claire. Now the first microbrewery in west central Wisconsin is the place to be!

It’s all woodsy and warm in our lodge-like bar. Hang out with friends, shoot pool for free or melt into the comfy chairs in the lounge. Whether you want to let loose, play trivia or have an intimate conversation there’s a spot waiting for you. Did we mention the 14 tap beers? Your thirst stops here.
name: Northwoods Brewpub and Grill

description: Nosdunk Brewing Company is a microbrewery located in Walla Walla, Washington. We pride ourselves in creating hand-crafted quality beer.
name: Nosdunk Brewing Company

description:
There is a myth born of the craft beer movement that flavorful beer is synonymous with high alcohol. The art of brewing great beer in the US without a debilitating ABV had seemed all but dead. Not anymore. Myths are simply myths, and beers of great flavor and quality have been brewed for hundreds of years in every great brewing nation except ours. Chris is not out to change the US craft beer world, but to simply brew the beers he loves to drink, and he thinks he is not alone.

Chris has been brewing professionally since 1993, first as an apprentice at Kennebunkport Brewing, then at the Tremont Brewery in Boston MA starting in 1994. Today, Chris is an independent brewer – he owns no facility – instead brewing and collaborating with other breweries. He currently brews his beers at two locations, the Ipswich Ale Brewery (Bottles & Draft) and Kennebunkport Brewery (Cask).
name: Notch Brewing

description: "Beer makes thirst beautiful"
name: Nova Paka Brewery

description: California brewery with a Brazilian soul, producing craft beer lifestyle with fun accents, aromas, colors, and unique flavors.
name: Novo Brazil Brewing Co.

description:
Nowhere Brewing Company is not quite an official brewery...yet. With 10 years of local brewing behind us, it's our goal to establish a nano brewery and taproom where the great people on the North Shore can enjoy local beer. Until then look for us at local beer events and remember, great beer comes out of Nowhere.

Nowhere Brewing Company is looking to build a great group of investors that are excited about our beer, and bring more small batch beer to the North Shore. Know of someone that is looking for an incredible investment opportunity? Send them my email, chris@nowherebrewingcompany.com. We are eager to share with our community and enthused about involving all of you in our journey.
name: Nowhere Brewing Company

description: The hobos have long used breweries as a safe haven. After years of leaderless exile, they have finally crowned their king.
name: Nowhere In Particular Brewing Company

description: NW Peaks Brewery is a "nano-brewery" located in Ballard. As a nano-brewery, we make less than one barrel of beer per batch and therefore cannot produce nearly the quantity as other breweries around. It also means that we can afford to brew many different styles of beer in smaller quantities with attention to traditional styles and creative "experiments". Instead of having a few flagship beers available at all times, we release two new beers each month. These are only around while they last and then will be supplanted by the next styles in line. You can think about it as brewing only *seasonals* such as a stout or a winter warmer in the winter, a nice malty brown in the fall, or a refreshing kolsch or hefeweizen in the summer. However, the best received ones will get duplicated (but not that often) and quite possibly may become flagship beers down the line.
name: NW Peaks Brewery

description: Nøgne ø is Norway's leading and largest supplier of bottle conditioned ale and the first and only producer of unfiltered sake in Europe. We make more than 20 different styles of ale & 5 different sake!
name: Nøgne Ø

description: O'Connor Brewing Company brews all of our handcrafted ales on a 4 vessel 30 barrel Brewhouse. Each beer is brewed into three 30 barrel, four 60 barrel, and four 90 barrel Fermenters where the yeast takes over and creates one of our delicious libations. From there, we filter to remove all loose sediment into one of our three 30, 60 or 90 barrel Brite Beer Tanks. This is where our beers are conditioned, carbonated, and ready to package. We currently only offer our products in draft and bottles.  We have an onsite Tasting Facility that allows you to enjoy our brands and take beer home in Growlers!
name: O'Connor Brewing Company

description: O’Dempsey’s *Beer To Die For* is the creation of Atlanta homebrewer  Randy Dempsey.  A passionate beer aficionado Randy began all-grain homebrewing in 1984.  He was always focused on adjusting and perfecting his craft and sharing his creations with friends. In 2009, after much persuading he made the decision to "go pro" and share his beers with the rest of the world. He'll continue perfecting his craft and sharing his new brews with his friends.  You know who they are.  Enjoy.
name: O'Dempsey's

description: At the O'Fallon Brewery we are passionate about making beer and we work hard to brew beers that look good, smell good and taste good! Ours is a small manufacturing brewery located in St. Charles County, just north and west of St. Louis, Missouri. Founded in January, 2000 by Fran and Tony Caradonna, the O'Fallon Brewery currently employs eight full-time. In 2009 we brewed around 4,100 barrels of beer...equivalent to about 57,000 cases.
name: O'Fallon Brewery

description: A unique fusion of craft brewery and restaurant featuring a 60 seat dining room complete with a stage, dance floor and lounge area. Have a seat by the fire and sip an Idle Irishman Stout, grab a table with friends, or just post-up at the bar! Be our guest for freshly brewed beer (made on site!) and a well appointed Pub Grub menu.
name: O'Meara Bros. Brewing Company

description: A small neighborhood micro brewery with from-scratch food and an excellent beer selection.
name: O'Possum's Pub

description:
The O'so Brewing Company, 1812 Post Road, Plover, is ready to offer local residents a taste of the unusual as they begin to brew their first batch of beer.

The company, founded by Marc Buttera and Bart Peterson, has one goal: brew beer differently. "I don't think anyone around here offers what I'm looking at ... we want to fill some voids,I don't want to make a regular brown ale, or pale ale. I want to do something that fits in between."

The dream for Buttera started when he was in college, and a friend turned him on to home brewing, which he has been doing now for about 13 years. Four years ago, his love of home brewing led him to open the Point Brew Supply, 1816 Post Road, Plover, with his wife, Katina.

"It (Point Brew Supply) has opened my eyes to all the different ingredients that I think a lot of brewers don't have exposure to," "I've played with every single strain of yeast and grain and hop in there.

O'so Brewing Co. is planning to have a varied lineup of beers, with interesting names and flavors. They will have a red ale, a West Coast Pale Ale showcasing American hops, as well as a Black Cocker Bock.

"I'm ready to show the world what I've learned, and I'm definitely not going to do things like other people are, but I think I'm on some sort of weird cutting edge.

The brewery has a capacity to brew about 280 gallons per batch, with plans to brew twice a week. A unique aspect of their marketing technique will be in the tapper. The design, a "Big O" will be the brewery's signature.
name: O'so Brewing

description:
Irish heritage and California creativity to create fine craft Ales & Lagers.

Five brothers thought it might be a good idea to pull the family together and make some tasty beer – Brewed right here in San Diego. We’re now off and running! We hope you enjoy our beer.
name: O'Sullivan Bros. Brewing Co.

description: Knightdale's first legal brewery since prohibition.
name: Oak City Brewing Company

description:
The Kraus family came to Sedona in 1993 with all their worldly goods and a dream, to brew great fresh beer the way Fred learned at the Gasthausbrauerei Hufeisen, or Horseshoe Brewery, in the picturesque village of Pottenstein, Germany. The dream became reality when they opened the doors of Oak Creek Brewing Co. in west Sedona.

Since February 1995 Sedona's only Microbrewery has been known to locals and tourists alike as the place to enjoy delicious handcrafted brews in a relaxed, unique setting.
name: Oak Creek Brewing Co.

description: We're a production craft brewery in Oak Hills, CA. We focus on creating solid adaptions of classic beer styles for both people new to craft beer, and for people who already know and love great beer! As we grow, we aim to experiment more, creating new, different, & crazier beers for everyone's fun and enjoyment. We have a tasting room up front where you can come in, try tasters & pints, and buy growlers (re-fillable jugs of beer).
name: Oak Hills Brewing Co.

description: British and Belgian style beers with a West Coast edge. Our full kitchen pairs our beers with local and seasonal ingredients. Cheers!
name: Oak Park Brewing Company

description: Outstanding Brewery located within 30 mins from Colby College in rural Maine. Phenomenal Nut Brown Ale, among others.
name: Oak Pond Brewing Co.

description: Oaken Barrel Brewing Co. has built its reputation on its award-winning beers. Head brewer Mark Havens and assistant brewer Andrew Castner brew a variety of fresh ales on-site in small batches. They use a fifteen barrel system to brew six standard house ales and a steady stream of specialty beers.
name: Oaken Barrel Brewing

description: Bringing Brewing Back to Oakland, One Brewery at a Time.
name: Oakland Brewing Company

description:
Oaks Bottom Public House is named for the Oaks Bottom Wildlife Refuge that runs just west of our location in the heart of Westmoreland. The 163-acre natural wetlands was Portland’s first urban wildlife refuge and is home to more than 125 species of birds, including the Great Blue Heron that is our symbol.

The term “Public House” was used in Old England to describe homes that innkeepers, or publicans, who were seeking a warm meal, a cold (but not too cold) pint and possibly a comfy bed. While we don’t offer lodging (and can’t let you snooze in our booths), it is our intent to offer neighbors from near and far good food and good drink in a friendly and relaxed atmosphere.

A good public house should be an example of what sociologist Ray Oldenburg calls a “third place”- a friendly, comfortable haven where guests can leave behind the cares of the “first place” (home) and “second place” (work) and enjoy the company of friends while someone else cooks the food and does the dishes.
name: Oaks Bottom Public House

description: The name Oakshire represents Strength, Independence, Community, values held by our owners and employees.   Begun in October 2006 by brothers Jeff and Chris Althouse, Oakshire Brewing operates as a production brewery in the Bethel neighborhood in Northwest Eugene.    We make three year round beers, available in 22oz bottles and 12 oz cans and on draft found throughout Oregon, Washington, Idaho, and Alaska.  Oakshire makes a rotating seasonal beer available in 22oz bottles and on draft as well.  And the brewers at Oakshire craft a range of beers in their Single Batch Beers Series only available on draft.
name: Oakshire Brewing Company

description: Producing iconic, rustic beers in the heart of the Texas Hill Country
name: Oasis Texas Brewing Company

description:
A small Micro-Brewery based just outside the coastal town of Aberystwyth in Mid Wales, producing cask conditioned and bottled real ale for Aberystwyth, the surrounding area and occasionally further afield.

We are currently Cuckoo Brewing while we save up funds to buy our own kit, but we are looking forward to doing that in the near future.

Oast House Brewery takes its name from the old maltings based in Trefechan. We liked the idea of resurrecting a little of Aberystwyth’s ale past, and so we named ourselves after them. The Old Oast House which can still be found in the harbour was used for drying and roasting barley in order to create malt. We use malt in our ale to give our ale both flavour and sugar. You get to taste the flavour in our ale, but the yeast eats most of the sugars and turns them in to alcohol. We did look into basing our brewery in the Oast House but unfortunately it is not for sale.
name: Oast House Brewery

description: It all about the freshest and best in local beer, great food and top service. This all happens at Obed and Isaac's Microbrewery & Eatery. Directly across the street from the President Lincoln's home and neighborhood.
name: Obed and Isaac's

description:
Oblivion Brewing is located in Bend, OR. We are a small production brewery producing high grade ale's. Golden, Pale, IPA, Porter, Stout, and seasonals!
At first we will be on draft only at local establishments and cans to follow!
name: Oblivion Brewing Co.

description:
The corporation’s history dates back to 1974 when the construction site of the future brewery was sand filled. The start-up of production was dedicated to the 1980 Olympic Games.

Czech experts were engaged in the project as world-renowned brewmasters. They were the ones who identified the construction site for the new brewery. The choice of construction site was determined by the main factor, namely the availability of huge reserves of soft, crystal-clear water. Today, the water from Jurassic bedrock (290 m) ensures the high quality of our products.

Soon afterwards, the enterprise gave the impetus to developing the largest corporation in Ukraine to produce beer, low alcohol and soft drinks, and mineral water.

The plant received its current name only in 1986, after the district of Kyiv with the same name. The word ‘Obolon’ comes from the times of Kievan Rus, when it denoted low riverside meadows.

Built according to a Czech design, the brewery produced beer that gained wide popularity. After Ukraine became independent, Obolon was the first corporation to export hopped beverages to Europe and the USA. Obolon trademark beer started being perceived as traditional Ukrainian beer in the whole world.

After a quarter of a century, Obolon has evolved into a world-renowned trademark. Today people on five continents associate Obolon with Ukrainian beer #1.
name: Obolon Joint Stock Company

description: Since Montana's statute of limitations on a minor possessing alcohol has long since run out, it's safe to say that Dan's been brewing beer since he was 17. After some early batches with extracts, it took less than a year to trade up to all-grain brewing in a friend's basement apartment. The youngest of six in a family of caterers, he may have it in his genes to provide others with food and drink, and the early experiments proved a hit at weekly parties on Missoula's University Avenue. Dan tried his hand at the homebrew standards--stouts, porters, English-style ales, etc.--but also made a mean hefeweizen (no lemon, please), alt, marzen, dunkel, and other Continental styles. Since moving to Portland in 2001, he's quenched the thirst of friends, neighbors and guests--not just college partygoers but beer geeks who live in Beervana for a reason. After a slight detour for law school and the cat-herding world of criminal defense, Dan swapped his back-porch setup for a bigger set of kettles and fermenters.
name: Occidental Brewing
Ocean Avenue Restaurant and Brewing Co

description: Ocean City Brewing Company is family owned and operated. It started as a dream of bringing a craft brewery to our hometown but then blossomed into a large scale brewery, bar, & restaurant. Someone once told us that there is nothing better than drinking a good craft beer, enjoying good food, and being surrounded by good people. That’s why we wanted to bring this experience to Ocean City.
name: Ocean City Brewing Company

description: Oceanside Ale Works crafts award-winning ales in the first microbrewery to find its home in beautiful Oceanside, California. Using the freshest hops and finest malted barley, our ales are hand-crafted to exacting standards ensuring a taste experience you are sure to remember. We are located along the North Coast of San Diego County, and right now you can taste our products at many locations in San Diego, Orange and Riverside counties.
name: Oceanside Ale Works

description:
Craft beer is a passion, an obsession and a journey. This journey has opened our eyes (and taste buds) to some of the finest examples of beer this planet has to offer. Our tastes and expectations have forever changed, and so have our methods of enjoyment. From beer trades, to home brewing, to attending release parties and festivals one thing became clear… We rarely drink the same beer over and over again, and we love to share.

Our IPAs will be constantly revolving depending on inspiration, hop variety, availability, and season. We will make everything from low gravity Sessions, to Regulars, Doubles, Triples and even a San Diego Pale Ale or two. We will make sure these styles are released, distributed, and tapped… FRESH!

We like big beers and we cannot lie! From the biggest Russian Imperial Stouts aged in spirit barrels to malty Double Reds, Smooth Porters, and velvety Wee Heavies, we just can’t get enough of these complex beauties. Thick mouthfeel, high gravity, and rich flavors suitable for aging to be shared with family and friends. Crack one open to celebrate a special occasion, or just because its a Tuesday.

Mouth puckering sour ales is another style which we adore. One which we hoard, savor, and curse for not being more readily available. Using wine barrels from local Virginia Wineries we will age some carefully crafted super tart ales, blending them when needed and using fruits for character. Once the bugs catch up to our pipeline, expect a new sour to be released every month.

At Ocelot, we love two things… Beer and Music!

We believe in inspiration. It can come in many forms and varies from person to person. For us, music has always been our inspiration. Music has been the soundtrack to our lives and has in one way or another crafted every decision we’ve made. We aim to create and dedicate our beers to the music that has inspired our journey through life.

Ocelot Brewing Company is a reflection of us, our styles, and our habits. From chasing freshies to cellaring whales and everything in between. We will craft many different beers in small batches. We brew beer we want to drink when we want to drink it. Come by and visit, listen to some tunes, grab a pint, fill a growler, and join us on this adventure.
name: Ocelot Brewing Company

description: Odd Man Rush (OMR) Brewing was founded by three local hockey guys who have deep roots in Eagle River.
name: Odd Man Rush Brewing

description: Odd Otter Brewing Company is a new, exciting nanobrewery in downtown Tacoma, WA.
name: Odd Otter Brewing Company

description: ​Welcome to Odd Side Ales, one of the fastest growing breweries in Michigan. Born in an old piano factory in downtown Grand Haven, Michigan, Odd Side Ales first opened its doors in March 2010. We've grown steadily since that first brew, but have never lost sight of our initial goal: to create a variety of complex beers, each with its own unique flavor. To that end, we strive to craft unusual beers that will make your taste buds dance. Whether you're looking for the perfect IPA or something ... just a little different, we've got the beer for you.
name: Odd Side Ales

description: Odd13 is a brewery located at 301 East Simpson Street in old-town Lafayette, Colorado. Our focus is flavorful American-style hoppy beers, Belgian styles, and sour beers.
name: Odd13 Brewing

description: Located in central New Hampshire. We are one of the Granite State's newest nano breweries. Bringing you unique, well crafted beers!
name: Oddball Brewing Co.

description:
We love beer. We talk about beer. We dream about beer. And we make incredible beer. We don't mess around with serving food, making music or cutting up limes to mask our beer's flavor. Our dreams lead us to create imaginative, big, bold and beautiful beers. Every ounce of our passion is poured directly into the next bottle you open. Our mission is simple; to make consistently great beer.

Handcrafted classics and small batch experimental beers that include Pale Ales, Stouts, Pilsners and Porters. Come visit us in our tap room for a taste of how we keep the craft in craft beer.
name: Odell Brewing Company

description:
Odin Brewing embraces the exploratory spirit of the ancient Vikings.  We set sail in December 2009, during the height of a global economic storm, and have quickly become one of the fastest growing breweries in Washington, with our beer is now sacking and pillaging cities throughout Washington and British Columbia. We have taken a different tack than many new brewers, and rather than going for a number of very big, single batch beers, we are focused on food-friendly beers in a smaller lineup that is readily available year round. We realized a long time ago that food-friendly by no means needs to be less flavorful, and we actually add ingredients to widen the palate of our beers above and beyond their original styles.

To better integrate with a meal and make our beers more ‘sessionable’ in general, we utilize highly attenuating yeasts to dry out our beers to make them less sweet and filling, then replace that desired sweetness with an addition outside the norm, such as Juniper, Ginger or even Angelica. These ingredients are always kept at a level to avoid building a ‘spice beer’, and always present themselves as a unique and complementary addition. We also focus on extremely clean finishes, and use the entire recipe to build bittering rather than just using the hops to reduce lingering starchiness.

In the end, the true beauty of any flavor is in the eye (and mouth) of the beholder. Read about our beers here, then taste them at your local restaurant or store and judge for yourself if we have truly crafted ‘Great Beer Designed With Great Food In Mind’. We believe we have.
name: Odin Brewing Company

description:
Back when the world was a much different place, filled with grunge music, loose fitting clothes, and Wayne’s World movies, two shady characters fell in together and started doing various sketch and wonderful things. One of these was brewing . . . beer. Not the tasty, modern, complex craft beers flowing in today’s market, but the goofy and “just OK” beers that home brewers in the 90’s seemed to know how to build. These guys (we’ll call them Chris and Josh for lack of anonymity’s sake) got better at brewing over the years, even as they moved apart.

Chris went down a corporate marketing path; Josh seemed to prefer engineering and operations; both still enjoyed beer and, with lots of practice, the homebrew got better and better. When Y2K sputtered out before it even came to life, the two had their first discussion about opening a brewery. More life happened. More of the guys’ improving craft beers were served at more home parties. When they got together again more recently, the topic resurfaced, but this time it wouldn’t go away. And gradually a brewery was born.

20 years since the start of their homebrew hobbies, Odyssey Beerwerks was formed to do the impossible: take an enjoyable hobby of creating fine craft beers and make it into a dreary job, with the benefit of bringing new and exciting hand crafted beers onto our vibrant planet.
name: Odyssey Beerwerks

description:
Ordinem Ecentrici Coctores = Order of the Eccentric Boilers.

We are an unusual brewery stemming from neither here nor there. We take influence from the great lost brewing traditions of the areas going from Northern Germany across to Belgium combining them with modern brewing techniques.

Our brewery is not the creation of a sole individual rather an Order of individuals. Ideals, techniques and ingredients come from places as near as the orchard to more than 1,900 leagues aways.

The goal of all being to create ales & concoctions of fantastic aromas & flavors.

For all of the ales are living, none are to be filtered or pasteurized. All shall undergo long maturation times while many others will spend time resting on wood.
name: OEC Brewing

description:
We make beer. Sometimes we do other things but not as well.

We've produced award winning, beers on the global stage. Now we just do it for ourselves applying our brewing knowledge, experience, and creativity to create a new breed of classically inspired American beer.
name: Off Color Brewing

description: "IT'S NOT JUST A BEER, IT'S A STATE OF MIND."
name: Off the Grid Brewing Company

description: Offbeat Brewing Company is a small collective of like-minded people who believe that well-crafted beer, untethered art, and the communities that support them are what make life worth living. We have a cute, little building in an industrial park as well as some beer that we'll sell you, but we think that's just the starting point for something much more vital, unique, and important, and we'd love it if you'd be part of that with us. Let's get together, drink some beer, and make some stuff!!
name: Offbeat Brewing Company

description: Quality hand crafted beer. Brewing the finest styles not found in commercial breweries, rather the same quality beers our forefathers brewed and enjoyed. Go for the best, go Shwide!
name: OffKilter Brewing Company

description: Offshore Ale Company is Martha's Vineyard's own brewery and restaurant, serving the island 7 days a week, year round since 1997. Located at 30 Kennebec Ave., Oak Bluffs, MA. 508-693-2626
name: Offshore Ale Company

description:
To handcraft innovative beers with unique and complex tastes; to make a positive impact in our community.  Ohana Brewing Company is an artisanal brewery in the heart of Los Angeles.

Our slogan is "A fresh face in beer!" Although our production is ultra-small we will pursue a number of strategies to stand out in the craft brewing industry. Our mission is to brew innovative beers with unique and complex tastes - not to just copy what the competition is doing. To that end we are committed to avoiding "repeatability" - i.e. we will not brew any beer more than once in our first full year of operation, i.e. no recipe will be duplicated.
name: Ohana Brewing Co

description:
Ohio Brewing Company is an award-winning microbrewery located in downtown Akron in the historic Selle building. Our brewery produces a wide array of styles, form German ales to Irish Red ales to Stouts and even Oktoberfest lagers.

The original Ohio Brewing Company was founded in 1997 in Niles, Ohio by current owner Chris Verich. Our current operation is a new venture by Chris in Akron, Ohio to produce these award-winning beers in a craft production brewery setting.
name: Ohio Brewing Company

description: A staple in BC households for the past 30 years, we strive to bring you the best tasting cider made from only the freshest fruits of the Okanagan.
name: Okanagan Cider Company

description: The mission of ol’ Republic Brewery is to provide everyone who enjoys a great beer with world-class, quality handcrafted ales and lagers. After all, the name ‘Republic’ is derived from the Greek ‘res publica’ which translates as ‘for the people’. Hence the catchy slogan; Beer for the People!
name: Ol' Republic Brewery

description:
Old 690 Brewing Company is one of the first farm breweries to open in the state of Virginia. Our mission is to brew and serve a unique yet balanced variety of fresh craft beers including several seasonal ales that utilize crops grown on the 10 acre property. Come out to beautiful Loudoun County to see our hops and enjoy our unique tasting room Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays where we serve tasting flights, pints and growlers to go. We have food trucks all weekend, but feel free to bring your own food. We are also family, kid and dog friendly. We also make and serve our own root beer!

If you are interested in hosting a special, private or corporate event please contact events@old690.com. Special event hours are available 7 days a week pending availability.

Looking forward to seeing you soon at Old 690!!
name: Old 690 Brewing Company

description: Old 99 Brewery will remind you why you drink craft beer.  We won't bore you by talking about ingredients or brewing methods, but simply tell you that we love to do this. One sip and that will be obvious.
name: Old 99 Brewing Co.

description: The Old Bakery Beer Company is a sustainable craft brewery located in downtown Alton, IL.  All of our beers are made with 100% American, USDA-certified Organic malts and hops.  Our restaurant and tasting room features a menu of seasonally-rotating sandwiches, salads, and soups, designed to pair well with beer and highlight the vast array of produce and artisan goods available in Southern Illinois & Eastern Missouri.
name: Old Bakery Beer Company

description:
Serving up seven premium craft beers in a comfortable atmosphere. By the pint or by the growler (to go), we have a beer for every palate!

Bring the kids! We serve natural artisan sodas, sure to please.

We are dog friendly, so bring your well-behaved, furry best friend along.
name: Old Bisbee Brewing Company

description:
Our decision to start brewing beer and sharing it with the public came from our desire to create a great beer that real people can not only enjoy, but also relate to. Some beer companies try to market their beer as being able to bring you a life of leisure; others may try to convince you that higher alcohol content automatically means better beer; others may simply try to sell you beer of poor quality and claim, "It's a craft beer." People know better than that, and our goal is to make great beer and sell it at a fair price without using silly marketing gimmicks.

Old Black Bear is not able to bring you a carefree life. If we could, we are undercharging for our product. However, what we can do is this: Provide you with a beverage that you can enjoy with your friends after a hardworking day, and assure you that every Old Black Bear Beer you drink will be of the highest quality and offer you drinkability and refreshment that is unmatched by any other small craft brewery ~ a real life beer you deserve.
name: Old Black Bear Brewing Company

description: Old Boys’ Brewhouse Restaurant was founded in 1997. With Melissa Brolick at the helm, Dave Bayes in the brewery, Dan Paquin in the kitchen along with our fantastic staff you can expect your experience to be spectacular and consistent.
name: Old Boys' Brew House

description: Locally brewed. Universally loved.
name: Old Bust Head Brewing Co.

description: At Old Credit Brewing our goal is to craft a quality Amber Ale & Pale Pilsner and Holiday Honey We brew small batches with no additives or preservatives to ensure quality freshness and taste. We use quality malts imported hops and specially selected yeast.Water is charcoal filtered to ensure purity.Direct firing in a copper kettle.Fully matured at 8 Weeks at 3.5 degrees below zero produces our Ice Aged Beer.
name: Old Credit Brewing Company Ltd.
Old European Brewery Co/Colonial Brewing Co

description:
The dream all began a few years ago while microbrewery hopping in Asheville, North Carolina. The Wife and I were sitting at dinner enjoying some fabulous craft beer and when she made the ultimate statement to me: "You know, for as much as you love craft beer, you should make it for a living."

Thus the mission of the Old Firehouse Brewery was found:  To passionately brew fresh, hand-crafted beer by using only the finest ingredients possible.

Our motto is great beer, great friends and great fun.
name: Old Firehouse Brewery

description:
We are devoted to the creation and continual improvement of our beers.  While we have several house beers they are the result of months of refinement and are constantly evaluated to insure quality and freshness.  Variety of style is also part of what we believe in and you will find lagers along with German, Belgian and English ales.  The range of beers we brew in-house is hard to find in a brewery of our size.

Bicycle and outdoor seating friendly, the brewpub welcomes all lovers of locally crafted beer and food, partaken in an atmosphere that celebrates the Old First Ward’s history, and its continued cultural milieu. Enjoy a pint outside in the historic Old First Ward.
name: Old First Ward Brewing Company

description:
Old Forge Brewing Company is a fun, casual, comfortable brewpub, specializing in healthy pub fare and fresh brewed beer.

Our country was built on the skills and labor of old-world artisanal craftsmen. Woodworkers, carpenters, stonemasons, ironworkers, blacksmiths, tileworkers, and many others came here and employed the knowledge and skills of their craft in building their farms, homes, and towns.

Nowadays, it is so easy and convenient to purchase generic products from big-box stores, that we sometimes neglect to appreciate the uniqueness and quality of a hand-crafted product.

At Old Forge Brewing Company, we strive to honor personal craftsmanship. Our hand-crafted beer is made in small batches to ensure quality and peak freshness, while the healthy and delicious menu has ingredients sourced from local farms and markets wherever possible. Take the time to notice our bar, furniture, and fixtures which were all handcrafted by local wood and metal worker Keith Kocher (Lightstreet Custom Woodworking). Check out our unique tap handles carved and forged by local artist/sculptor J. Mark Irwin (Irwin Sculpture Studio), and our plates, bowls, and beer mugs, all hand-made by local potter Mike Hart (M. Hart Pottery).
name: Old Forge Brewing Company

description:
Named for the venerable climbing vine outside in the patio. The vine was originally at home in Germantown, Pennsylvania, came west to Hilltop Farm near Forest Grove in 1848, on to Vancouver in the late nineteenth century, finally arriving here with the construction of the Patio Building in 1947.

We hope you enjoy the ambiance of the taproom, find the range of micro brews intriguing and the menu to your liking.

Enjoy!
name: Old Ivy Brewery

description:
Here at Old Mill Brewpub & Grill, we strive to provide quality food and drink in a relaxing atmosphere, using only the freshest quality ingredients in our products.We believe in sourcing locally and naturally whenever possible. Listed on the National Registry of Historic Places, the Historic Eesley Mill provides our patrons with a truly unique venue to enjoy the best beers, wines, spirits, and food, served to you by a passionate team of Old Mill Brewpub & Grill associates. We hope you enjoy your experience today and ask you to tell your friends about us. See you again soon!
Cheers!
name: Old Mill Brewpub & Grill

description: Small Batch Handcrafted Beer
name: Old Mill Craft Beer

description:
Old Nation Brewing is the culmination of years of hard work for brewer Travis Fritts. He spent time in Germany honing his craft under the best brewers in the world and returned to the states with master brewing credentials. He wanted to return to the place he grew up to spread his knowledge and love of great beer. And 
Williamston is the perfect fit.

And don't worry, the food will be taken just as seriously as the beer. Because a good pub should be a fusion of incredible beer, food, and people.
name: Old Nation Brewing Company

description: Old North State is the only winery in the state of North Carolina that is a licensed brewery. Our American Style Pale Ale uses Hops grown in Oregon with only natural products and whole grains in our production. Our hand crafted Ales are made in small batches and are available on tap at our tasting bar.
name: Old North State Winery & Brewery

description: Old Planters is a boutique nanobrewery that specializes in brewing hop forward ales in small batches. We take pride in our practice of classic brewing techniques while also utilizing innovative equipment and technology to make well balanced craft beer. We use the best ingredients we can get our hands on, while always keeping an eye on sustainability.
name: Old Planters Brewing Co.

description: Old Post Brewpub is a restaurant and bar set in a casual and intimate atmosphere with in house craft beer and a fresh, local menu. Opening Spring 2015.
name: Old Post Brewpub

description: Old Mandeville's 1st & only locally owned Brew Pub. Located across the street from the Mandeville Trail-head and adjacent to the St. Tammany Trace.
name: Old Rail Brewing Co.

description: Windsor's first Nanobrewery
name: Old Redwood Brewing Company

description:
Brew pub and family restaurant in west Las Vegas. 
Pizzas, sandwiches, entrees, full bar, gaming machines and fresh made beer from our 15 barrel brewery.  Tours welcome.
name: Old School Brewing Company

description: Family owned Craft Brewery, located in the heart of Fort Myers, Florida.
name: Old Soul Brewing

description: For us, making beer is all about community. Settled in the frame of Portland, Oregon, we support the importance of being hyper-local and only using the best possible ingredients. We cultivate the spirit of our neighborhood by embracing the idea that brewing a good beer is born of your surroundings. Inspired by our own back yard, we aim to create a beer that reflects not only our passion for the craft, but our love of the great Northwest.
name: Old Town Brewing Company

description: We are a local brewery in Phoenix at the old Capital Station Post office 334 N 25th Ave., selling fresh local craft beer to retail, bar, and resort accounts throughout Metro Phoenix and Az.
name: Old World Brewery

description:
In the heart of BC ‘s Fraser Valley surrounded by pristine mountains, rivers, lakes and agriculture you will find Chilliwack, BC – a recreational paradise and home of Old Yale Brewing Co.  

The story of our name, Old Yale, originates from the Old Yale Wagon Road.  Built in 1875, it was the Fraser Valley’s first road link connecting all the communities from New Westminster to Yale.  All of us at Old Yale Brewing  believe that it’s the connections between  people and communities that bring us together much like the road itself. 

Whether it’s our Classic Old Yale Pale Ale, Seargeant’s IPA or nationally acclaimed Sasquatch Stout, we invite you to taste one of BC’s finest craft-brewed beers.
name: Old Yale Brewing Company

description: The Olde Burnside Brewing Co.is a spinoff of our family-owned ice manufacturing business, The Burnside Ice Co., which was founded in 1911 (more history). While our brews may enjoy universal appeal, our marketing theme is clearly Scottish in flavor. In keeping with our roots, we add a bit of Celtic color in all we do, including our sponsorship of a local bagpipe band, Manchester Regional Police & Fire Pipe Band, as well as our local rugby team, The Hartford Wanderers. Come fall, join us at “Pipes in the Valley,” Connecticut’s premier Celtic music festival, showcasing the finest local and world renowned Celtic talents.
name: Olde Burnside Brewing Company

description:
Great beer is the result of meticulous attention to detail throughout the brewing process. Our beers begin their life as fresh water that flows from the granite slopes of the Blue Ridge and culminate in small batches less than 800 gallons each.

Our beers are and have always been, brewed using select grains, robust hops and cultured yeast, with no additives or preservatives.  These basic ingredients are added with time, passion and the undying thirst for knowledge to produce our variety of quality brews that we're sure you'll enjoy!
name: Olde Hickory Brewery

description: At Olde Main Brewing Co. we believe, it's not about the next beer, it's about enjoying the one in your hand. That's why head brewer Jeff "Puff" Irvin and brewer "Big John" Rundall blend traditional brewing practices and modern techniques to craft fresh, full-flavored beers. Taste the true deliciosity at bars, restaurant, and retail stores across Iowa or at the Ames brewery and restaurant.
name: Olde Main Brewing Co.

description:
Olde Mother Brewing is Frederick's newest craft brewery! We are very excited to be opening our doors in summer 2015. Nick and Keith have been brewing for a number of years and are finally ready to share their homegrown craft beer.

On a much smaller scale than anything Frederick offers, we will be brewing on a custom built 55 gallon brewing system. You can expect many typical craft beers that will suit your palette, but be prepared for a few twists and unique flavor profiles.

We could not have come this far without the support and positivity of our friends and family! Thank you all so much. Follow us here to get the latest and greatest on our progress!! 

Cheers from Olde Mother!
name: Olde Mother Brewing Co.

description:
Olde Peninsula is a micro brewery and a full service pub and restaurant.      ? ?
Kalamazoo’s first brewpub, opened to the public on St. Patrick’s Day in 1996. Previously known as the “Bib Corner”, this location has an interesting historical past. Originally designed for the Peninsula restaurant, this three story structure was built by Nicholas Bauman in 1874.

This elegant restaurant gave way to the Franklin and Folz clothing store from 1884 to 1924. Through the years, the building housed a succession of businesses, including the Kalamazoo Stove company, a book bindery and a hotel.

It became the headquarters for W.R. Biggs/Gilmore Agency in 1973. Severely damaged by the 1980 tornado, the building was completely rehabilitated in 1980-81.

The current owners, Marie and Stephen Blinn, wish to bring back a piece of history for all of Kalamazoo to enjoy. We are proud to offer to you the freshest beer available, brewed on-site in our 7-barrel brew house.
name: Olde Peninsula Brewpub and Restaurant

description:
Located in historical Saratoga Springs, New York, the Olde Saratoga Brewing Co. has been a well-kept secret in the city.

Established in 1997, it is the fourth largest brewery in New York State and produces the highest quality and freshest craft brewed ales and lagers in the area.

The company is owned by the Mendocino Brewing Company, which is based in California. The Olde Saratoga Brewery brews about 30 different kinds of beer throughout the year - over 20,000 barrels last year. A third of their business is through contract brewing for a variety of breweries throughout the Northeast . Contract beers allow the brewery to make a variety of unique beers from light beer to a white Belgian to dark Stout beer and also gives the public a chance to taste of variety of great beers throughout the year.
name: Olde Saratoga Brewing Company

description:
The Olds College Teaching Brewery was established in 2013 and is attached the the Olds Pomeroy Inn & Suites. The Brewery is an essential facility and will be where students can learn to become Brewmasters. The Olds College Brewery will produce four commercially branded beers: Aggie Ale, Old Skhool, Hay City and Prairie Gold.

The revenue generated from the sale of these beers will be used to support the program and reflects the entrepreneurial spirit of Olds College. The Brewery’s retail outlet will carry the four flagship beers, as well as samples of seasonal and student beers.
name: Olds College Brewery

description: ODB is a start up Brewery operation located in Dallas, NC
name: Ole Dallas Brewery

description: Ole Shed Brewing Company was founded by Mike Thornburg and Mike Ramsey in 2011
name: Ole Shed Brewing Company

description:
we're pretty sure that the beer made was part ectoplasmic mud intended as a 5th dimensional chrysalis for an almost immediate and rude awakening of shrimp-kind. once fed to the prawny bastards they grow strong and stout. they're tenuous ligament connections calcify and grow stronger and they can appear to read people's minds by a simple flexing of their delicious muscles. they're tv antenna antennas probe the air and gently wave in the breeze though the touch them is as touching rough-grit sand and glass paper and leaves tiny shards similar grabbing the white paint of a fire hydrant marker. 

we had no idea. we swear. 

we're just here's to brew beer, not help with the awakening of the earth's 6th cycle of developed beings. that being said -- all hail the prawn people! may their mighty and lesser claws be bound only by their own strength of will. let the buddha shrimp click and clackle their obscene language to the world.
name: Oliphant Brewing

description: Hand crafted Ales in the heart of Baltimore. Beer and Rock 'n' Roll, that's what it's all about!
name: Oliver Brewing Company

description: Ollermann Brewing Co is currently in the planning phase and hopes to become partners with a brewery or restaurant, with the long term goal of opening an independent brewpub. We currently do a monthly beer tasting night at the owner/brewer's house in the Denbigh area of Newport News, VA. If you'd like to become a part of these events, please send me a message. Thanks! - Aaron
name: Ollermann Brewing Co.

description:
Olvalde Farm and Brewing Company is a small, traditional brewery located on a family farm in Rollingstone, Minnesota. We aim to craft fine ales that honor ancient brewing traditions and culture.

Ale is a beverage made from the fermentation of cereal grains, accompanied in ancient times by other fermentable materials such as honey and tree saps. We aim to create ales that focus on the flavors of the fermentation, accentuate the flavor of the source material, and use herbs and spices only as complements. To this end, our ales are warm conditioned on their lees, unfiltered, and refermented in the bottle.
name: Olvalde Farmhouse Ales

description:
OLVI beers are made from carefully selected and mainly Finnish ingredients. The only exception is the hops which are imported from abroad because the weather conditions in Finland are not conducive to growing sufficiently high quality crops.

OLVI beers differ from one another in the selection of their raw materials as well as in their manufacturing methods. Olvi allows its beers to mature slowly and gradually, which is the only way as there is no shortcut to success.

All Olvi's beers are lager beers, which means that they are produced with bottom-fermenting yeast. Lager beers are either dark or light. The bottom-fermenting yeast ferments the beers in a cool temperature, which produces a very fresh, crisp taste and aroma. All Olvi beers are unpasteurized.
name: Olvi

description:
Olympic Brewery S.A. is a purely Greek and fast evolving company that was set up in January 2010. It owns the lager FIX Hellas brand, the first and most historical Greek beer and the premium lager FIX Dark brand, which created a new category in the domestic market of black beer. The ultra-modern privately owned brew house of Olympic Brewery, where all the products are produced, is located in Ritsona area, in Evia.

Since its establishment, Olympic Brewery has demonstrated that, alongside its investment program, it focuses on the development of the beer market in Greece, its great contribution to the national economy, the responsible investment on raw material and the support of the Greek farmers and producers. 

At the same time, Olympic Brewery is an example of a healthy Greek business overseas as it exports its high quality and tasty Greek beer to several dynamic international markets.
name: Olympic Brewery

description:
When Dr. Robert E. Lee and family decided to start a brewing company in Omaha, GA, (Yes, Georgia) it wasn't only because we enjoy a good local brew, but because craft beer isn't prevalent enough in South Georgia.

With the ideas of family, friends and quality always on our minds, we wanted to make beer that people enjoy. Not just sometimes, but every time you look at the Omaha Brewery label, taste the foam and pour a glass.

Our Brewer Nick Fowler, formerly of Atlanta's Red Brick Brewery, uses only the best ingredients (And trust us, there won't be beer unless it's fresh) and a clean, consistent method to boil and ferment a beer the general himself would enjoy.
name: Omaha Brewing Company

description: Over the last 10 years, Micro Brewery's have been popping up across the nation in record numbers. Think about it, there everywhere, you see them in every mall and on every street corner. Beer brewing is as much an art as it is science, and there are only a handful of Micro Brewery's with the right combination of equipment, knowledge, experience and passion to create truly exquisite hand crafted beer. One sip of any of Omaha Jack's hand crafted beers will convince you that you've stumbled into one of the best Brewery's in the state.
name: Omaha Jacks Grillhouse and Brewery

description:
Omission is the first craft beer brand in the United States focused exclusively on brewing great tasting craft beers with traditional beer ingredients, including malted barley, specially crafted to remove gluten.

We had a mission...to brew a great craft beer with traditional beer ingredients that everyone of legal drinking age can enjoy. Handcrafted beers made from barley, hops, water and yeast, brewed using a proprietary process to remove gluten. Well, mission accomplished. Here’s to great beer for everyone. 21 and over that is.

Brewed by Widmer Brothers Brewing in Portland, Oregon, gluten in Omission beers is removed through a proprietary brewing program and tested by two independent labs, and internally at the brewery, using the R5 Competitive ELISA gluten test. Gluten levels in every batch of Omission beer are reduced to well below the Codex standard of 20 parts per million (ppm) or less; test results for every batch of Omission beer are available at: www.omissiontests.com 

When referencing gluten, we're required by the TTB to tell you that Omission beer is fermented from grains containing gluten and crafted to remove gluten. The gluten content of this product cannot be verified, and this product may contain gluten.
name: Omission Beer

description:
We are a new craft brewery, coming soon to Mooresville. 

We have plans for a 7 bbl brewhouse and taproom.
name: OMMI Brewing Company

description: On Rotation, a craft beer laboratory, brewery, and taproom in the Lakewood neighborhood of East Dallas serves up “explosively experimental flavors” by brewing a variety of seasonals and one-off batches in addition to keeping 40 rotating taps full of their own brews and favorites from all over the world. We are open 7 days a week and fill growlers of any of the beers on our taps.
name: On Rotation

description: Madison's smallest brewery opened on Friday, July 6 2012. One Barrel Brewing Company is at the intersection of Atwood and Winnebago streets, a.k.a. Schenk's Corners, it's like a coffee shop, only with beer instead of coffee". With a staple of No. 2 Strong Ale, other usual suspects include Penguin Pale Ale (a Belgian pale ale), and The Commuter (a Kölsch-style ale), but the small brew system will allows up to 10 beers on tap at a time, constant rotation of new brews.
name: One Barrel Brewing

description: One Love Brewery, Tap Room and Wedding/Function Halls are located at the beginning of the Kancamagus Highway in Lincoln, NH. Stop in at the begining or end of your White Mountain journey and taste the flavors of what our brewery has to offer. We have two wedding/function halls that are capable of sitting between 60 and 120 people. Our Tap Room features our traditional and seasonal artisan beers, along with a fine selection of food to satisfy your hunger.
name: One Love Brewery

description:
We are a small microbrewery located south of Chicago, in Lansing Illinois.  Our tasting room serves eight different selections of our hand-crafted beer.
Our beer won't make you strong or handsome, but if you appreciate craft beer and want to meet some guys that are happy to make it, serve it, and probably drink it with you, stop by or give us a call
name: One Trick Pony Brewing

description: One Well Brewing produces hand-crafted beers and provides a place for like-minded folks to share ideas, art and culture in Kalamazoo, MI.
name: One Well Brewing

description:
One World Brewing is a small-batch hand-craft nano-brewery and ale house located at 10 Patton Ave in Downtown Asheville (in the basement beneath Farm Burger). We have a 1.5 Barrel system with 12 fermenters soon to be in constant rotation. There will be 10 taps at the ale house which will feature 6 of our flagship beers and 4 rotating taps offering a large variety of different beer styles from around the world, including local homebrewer recipes. Hoping to open our doors this spring!! Stay tuned for more!

Our mission at One World is to inspire our community and our region to participate and get involved with solutions to environmental and political issues that effect us all. Over a wide range of truly unique and delicious beers we can come together and figure out how to change the world for the better, one revolutionary idea at a time! "Positive Change Starts With You!"
name: One World Brewing

description: Washington County's first BrewPub. Right off of 494/61 in Historic Newport MN.
name: Opinion Brewing Company

description:
Opposition Brewing isn’t about doom and gloom, it’s about enjoying the time we have, while we have time left. It’s about great beer made simply. It’s about good friends, good times, and knowing that we should always live for the moment because it may all be over tomorrow.

At Opposition Brewing we love BIG beers. Be they brews with huge hop presence, big malt backbones, or prominent and unique flavor profiles, we prefer brewing and drinking beers that are approachable, but with the character necessary to challenge the mundane.

We offer a consistent selection of quality, small-batch, beers as well as rotating specialties. We brew weekly, guaranteeing some of the freshest beer on tap in the Rogue Valley. And we offer a truly unique, local, artisan experience.

We also hail from the great Pacific Northwest and choose to honor the ingredients produced here as much as possible in our brews. And while we enjoy the technology available to us now, we know that it could all go away tomorrow, so we believe in a brewing process that is distilled as far down as reasonably possible while still achieving consistently excellent results. 

So sit back, raise a pint, and let us ride this long black train together!
name: Opposition Brewing Company

description: Beer. It’s more than that. Beer is the earth, the sun and the seasons. It is the mood, your surroundings and present company. Beer is the compassion, knowledge, and life experiences of those who brew it. Beer is tradition and innovation. It is the embodiment of the community that surrounds it. Beer is who we are. Oracle Brewing has been created to raise the bar for beer, community, culture, and small business. Founded on the beliefs that beer should be appreciated, not expected; examined, not ignored; revered and not feared. Oracle represents the true artisanal spirit that is beer. We are beer.
name: Oracle Brewing Company

description:
Orchid Island Brewery is a small family owned and operated microbrewery in sunny Vero Beach, Florida. We are currently focusing on perfecting a small number of west coast-style IPA's and wild farmhouse ales. We pay homage to our agricultural roots by using local citrus zest, following the same tradition that Belgian Farmhouse breweries have since the 1600's. Orchid Island and Indian River County was built around the citrus industry. The area is widely recognized as a region that grows the planet's best citrus.
During winter months when citrus is in its peak harvest, cold snaps sweeten the citrus. If it freezes, it spoils however. What makes Orchid Island unique is its proximity to the ocean and the Indian River lagoon. During the worst winter cold fronts, the ocean and river have a warming affect on the island that keeps the fruit above freezing.
The combination of our area's geography and climate are what help make OIB beers stand alone.
