name: Orchid Island Brewery

description: Starting as an award winning home brewer, Logan wished to advance his passion into a career. So in his early 20's, he signed on for an internship at Standing Stone Brewing in his hometown of Ashland, Oregon. Shortly after becoming versed in the ways of a professional brewer, Logan moved to Denver, Colorado. There he advanced his career working at some of the most prestigious breweries in the area. After three years in Denver, Logan felt it was time to move closer to home and met up with Craig Coleman, of Neighbor Dudes and Ordnance Brewing.
name: Ordnance Brewing

description:
As a microbrewery, our focus is on providing a wide variety of beer styles in addition to fostering the local interest in the brewing of craft beer. We consider brewing to be a craft and, whether you are brewing in your garage or on a huge production system, brewing a good beer and sharing it with others is a great way to bring together friends or even an entire community. We are proud to live in a town that is currently supporting two brewpubs and a nanobrewery, and look forward to doing our part to be a leader in the craft brewing revolution.

People in the U.P. work hard, take great pride in what is produced locally and have answered the call in supporting and improving the local economy. The name "Ore Dock Brewing Company" was chosen because we see our local ore docks as grand and iconic reminders of Marquette and the U.P.'s past, present, and future identity. We hope to provide a product and establishment that our community can be proud of for many years to come!
name: Ore Dock Brewing Company

description: Oregon City Brewing Company is a family brewery dedicated to making uncompromising, quality beers.
name: Oregon City Brewing Company

description:
Welcome to South Florida's newest Brew Pub. We are brewing 8 different ORGANIC brews for you to enjoy. Offering 4 Organic Brews on tap at all times paired with HOMEMADE German and American Cuisine.
Come visit our casual atmosphere in the heart of Hollywood Beach, FL. 
Sit inside to watch the games on any of our five 60" screens, or have a seat on our terrace to enjoy the Boardwalk and Ocean views.
name: Orgainic Brewery

description: Oriental Brewery or OB is a South Korean brewery established by the Doosan Group in 1952. It was purchased by InBev in 1998. In 2009, it was sold by Anheuser-Busch InBev as the parent company sought to reduce its debt. It was sold to an affiliate of Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co.. Anheuser-Busch InBev has retained the right to purchase OB five years from its sale, at predetermined financial terms. Today OB produces several of Korea's most popular beverages including the OB, Cass and Cafri lager brands. All OB beers are brewed from rice, rather than the malted barley familiar to Western beer drinkers.
name: Oriental Brewery

description: Original Gravity Brewing Company is well worth the trip to Milan! This brewpub features unique handcrafted beers and pub sandwiches and snacks. Great atmosphere with an outdoor beer garden in the warmer months. See website for featured small batch beers.
name: Original Gravity Brewing Company

description: In 1997, Original Sin’s founder, Gidon Coll, set out on a mission to create a great American cider, both dry and natural. He extensively researched the history of cider and cider making and soon began sourcing the best apples and yeast strains. Supported by a local wine expert, he began mixing and testing in a small upstate New York winery, and brought his samples to NYC bars each week for feedback from owners, managers, and patrons. After six months, the first batch of O.S. was released to establishments in Brooklyn and Manhattan. Soon after, the product received critical acclaim from sources as diverse as The New York Times, New York Post, Paper Magazine, and Market Watch. Today, you can find our unique and acclaimed ciders in over half the country, with more regions being added every month.
name: Original Sin

description: They have a wide variety of beers made on premises, with more than a dozen on tap. Bar is is in an industrial area and is kinda bare, but it's got good beer, and good people, and that's what counts. Try the 'Monk-in-the-trunk' stay the hell away from the Winter Park beer.  Bottles, and kegs available as well.
name: Orlando Brewing Partners, INC.

description:
Orlison Brewing Co. lives by the motto, “Brew No Evil.” People drink beer to live and to celebrate life — nobody wants a glass filled with bad deeds. Orlison Brewing Co.’s clear lagers represent its good intentions. Its pure ingredients signify honesty toward life’s finer moments. Its crisp beers symbolize passion and direction. Orlison’s lagers are served cold, which embodies the company’s coolness and poise, while the full-flavored taste of its beers illustrates a full, free spirit and goodwill toward fellow men. 

Plain and simple, Orlison brews beers that make people happy.

Orlison Brewing Co. — Brew No Evil™.
name: Orlison Brewing Company

description: We love beer.  We believe in paying attention to every detail, no matter how small, to create the best possible beer we can brew.  It all starts with Brewmaster Asa Marsh-Sachs and his passion for brewing.  He brews with super filtered water, great malts such as floor malted Maris Otter, and hops from all over the world.  We don’t shy away from paying a bit more for exactly what we want, like the Mosaic hop in the Lightning Tree IPA.  Asa ferments the beer using a variety of different yeast strains to keep each beer tasting unique, and he filters all the ales except the Witbier.  Our custom built stainless steel glycol-jacketed brewery helps Asa get the results that he wants.  We sell over 95% of our beer by the pint or growler at the brewery and by the pint at Woodman’s.
name: Orono Brewing Company

description: Orpheus Brewing is an artisanal brewery overlooking Piedmont Park and the Beltline. With a lineup featuring saisons, sours, hops, and barrels, Orpheus Brewing is offering beers unique to the Southeast.
name: Orpheus Brewing

description:
Sovina was the first craft beer produced in Portugal, in Oporto.

A genuine beer, produced through craft methods, uniquely with water, malt, hops and yeast, no additives or preservatives and with yeast produced natural carbonation, thoroughly following traditional recipes.
name: Os Três Cervejeiros - Sovina

description: Osgood Brewing in Grandville, Michigan's Hometown Microbrewery
name: Osgood Brewing

description: Oskar Blues Brewery is part of the Oskar Blues Grill and Brew restaurant and was located in Lyons, Colorado, near the city of Boulder. The brewery is now in Longmont, CO - a much larger town just east of Lyons. Oskar Blues is unique in that it serves craft-brewed beer in cans, contrary to the normal practice of bottling micro brews. The brewery is owned by Dale Katechis, a native of Florence, Alabama who brought canned beer and southern fried foods together for an interesting twist on the micro-brew pub.
name: Oskar Blues Brewery

description:
Our goal is to always surpass your expectations!
 
 
Our philosophy towards beer and our customers:
-Grass roots approach to the craft
-We appreciate our competition and learn from them
-We listen to our customers and craft to their tastes
-All of our beer can be enjoyed in a session
name: Oswald Brewing Company

description: Craft Brewery specializing in IPA's and Sours
name: Other Half Brewing Company

description: The Otley Brewing Company Limited, colloquially Otley Brewery, is a brewery located in Pontypridd, Wales. Established in 2005, it has won several awards, including the Champion Beer of Wales in 2006. The head brewer is Charlie Otley.
name: Otley Brewing Company

description: Otter Creek has been hitting, hopping and dosing brews with creativity since acid-wash jeans were hip. Under the direction of brewmaster Mike Gerhart, we are undergoing a renaissance of rad, a rebirth of cool--throwing a bit of kind into the kettle whenever possible. Our hop-soaked ales are available throughout the Northeast and mid-Atlantic regions.
name: Otter Creek Brewing

description: Otto's typically offers a selection of 9-11 beers on draft. These include seasonal offerings as well as some of our favorite year-round ales and lagers including our special cask-conditioned ales. All of our beers are brewed on-premises at Otto's for the utmost freshness and quality control. They are made with the finest ingredients available, all of our skill, and a true love for the craft of brewing. Enjoy!
name: Otto's Pub and Brewery

description: This small brewery is located in Holland, Michigan. They rotate 10 unique craft beers on tap.
name: Our Brewing Company

description:
Our Mutual Friend is a brewery and taproom located in the Five Points neighborhood of Denver. For us, brewing beer began as an excuse to gather with our friends and ruminate on life, philosophy, music, food, and of course, beer. Once we got started, we grew more curious about the brewing process, honing our craft and experimenting with different methods and techniques. Along the way a fundamental question to our process was, how can we do more of this ourselves? Our desire to participate in every step of the grain to glass process led us to open Our Mutual Friend.

At OMF, our goal is to use local sources to brew local ales. This is why we malt and roast as much of the grain we use in our beer as we can. As a small maltstery, we have more influence over the quality and freshness of the beers we pour in our taproom, and more opportunities to source our ingredients locally. 100 percent of our barley is grown right here in Colorado. And as much as possible, we source our hops and specialty ingredients from farms in our state. 

Part of what we love about beer is its power to bring people together (hence our name!). We’re excited to be a gathering place in the Five Points neighborhood where locals and visitors alike can meet in camaraderie alongside a quality pint of ale. We believe in the power of neighborly acts and the spirit of neighbors taking care of one another within the local community. We at OMF support and strive for the Denver community to know each other better and enjoy a good pint in the same process. 

We are excited to see our city developing a local, world-class brewery community, and look forward to building relationships with our friends and neighbors, and collaborating with other breweries to cherish our Denver home and protect our collective local influence.
name: Our Mutual Friend Malt & Brew

description:
The Ouray Brewery is  open daily and offers seating on the only rooftop patio in the “Switzerland of America” — Ouray, Colorado. We also offer an intimate downstairs bar with 4 swings (you did read that right), a dining room on the mid-level of our pub and a mezzanine viewing area of our brew house.

We offer a full menu of juicy burgers,  fresh salads, apps and entrees. Try the Grilled Avocado Salad or our popular pulled pork sandwich.

Ouray has all the right ingredients — unspoiled scenery and water, a great local community and culture and close proximity to other great breweries. Come join us for a brew and a taste of all Ouray and Ouray Brewery have to offer.
name: Ouray Brewery

description:
Ouroboros Ales facilitates original recipe and flavor styles of craft brew for the finest of beer connoisseur.

Ouroboros, a beer wholesaler, has contracted with the wonderful people at Bayhawk Brewery in Irvine Ca, to make our proprietary recipes.

To capture the purity in handcrafted process’s through socially conscience means nurturing tradition, soul, and environment finishing with the finest product.
name: Ouroboros Ales

description:
Out of Bounds Brewing Company brings 16 years of Pacific Northwest brewing experience to Placer County and celebrates the Northern Californian lifestyle at it’s best. Chico-native and Head Brewer, Bruce MacPhee spent 10 years at the famed, Deschutes Brewing Company in Bend, Oregon before being hired by a Portland start-up, Coalition Brewing. Bruce has built a reputation for innovative handcrafted ales with English-style methodology and only using the finest ingredients from around the Pacific Northwest. The result is an extremely well balanced finished beer. It is for this reason, he has received numerous awards and recognition for his brewing techniques and recipes. Bruce brings his latest and greatest creations to Placer County and to his new Out of Bounds home. Come have a pint!
Setting trends, not following!
name: Out of Bounds Brewing Company

description:
The name came from friends in Massachusetts. Because our house was so far away from everyone we were named the Out.Haus. When I started labeling my homebrew, that was the name I decided to use.

I quit my full-time job on Friday, January 13, 2012 to focus all of my time and energy in creating a commercial brewery. After looking at various locations and out-buildings on the property I finally decided to convert part of the garage to the brewery.

On June 28 I finally got approval from the town to convert the garage. In July of 2013 I got a Certificate of Occupancy for the brewery from the town. On October 21, 2013 I got my federal approval. On November 8, I got my state approval. I have a fully licensed brewery.
name: Out.Haus Ales

description: To continually strive to offer unique quality food and beverages in a comfortable, festive setting. We will strive to create a feeling of comradery between and among employees and patrons in a safe and noncompetitive working environment that allows for continued personal and professional growth.
name: Outer Banks Brewing Station

description:
We are a very small-scale brewery and pub specializing in foreign and unique beers and eats.  Our brewery is a 1 barrel system (two kegs) which we use to create hand-crafted, more often than not, specialty ales.  Our brewery is based around experimentation, so our taps change frequently.  We usually do not brew the same beer twice, but will do so if enough people ask.

By definition, an outlander is a stranger, a foreigner, but here he is much more. This is how we see him: The outlander is the innovator; he is the one who drives change. It is the outlander, whether in mind or origin, who represents the ambitious, passionate pioneer who is willing to put everything on the line in order to make his dream come true. It’s often a simple dream, a dream to share his knowledge, his expertise with the ones who call him stranger. And certainly the public may reject his ideas, they may cast him back to where he came from. But does this ever worry the outlander? Never. Because the outlander believes in his ideas. He knows what he is offering is great and he knows others, once they put aside their prejudice, will know this too. He knows that someone who has invested their time, their life, their hopes and dreams behind something cannot fail. And he knows one last vital piece of information– that there have been many outlanders in this world before him and there will be many more to come.
name: Outlander Brewing

description:
OUTLAW Brewery and Tasting Room is Lake Havasu's preferred purveyor of craft adult frosty beverages. We are glad you found us on Brewery DB! Don’t forget to check in and like us on all the various social media sites in the interwb for special offers and discounts. Cheers! 
Input from our local patrons in the style and flavor of our beers in highly encouraged. We want you to have the best experience possible, so if you have a suggestion on how we can make things better let us know.  Do you have an idea for a beer? Let us know and we may just make it, and if we do you get the first Pint!
Want to Rock the Bandit? Stickers and Apparel are available at the Brewery and on our Website!
name: OUTLAW Brewery

description: Small batch brewery paired with "Bar 3 BBQ" restaurant in Belgrade, MT.  Our 2 BBL kettle and 7 BBL fermenters allow us the flexibility to make many seasonal beers.  We pride ourselves on producing a "new" or seasonal beer every month.  Currently with 8 beers on tap, plan on always finding our Session Pale Ale, Chocolate Porter, Amber Ale, Irish Cream Ale, along with our current seasonals.
name: Outlaw Brewing

description: Exceptional Indiana Beer
name: Outliers Brewing Company

description: Beer is our passion! We believe that food and drink should be wholesome, comfortable, delicious, and sustainable. Our brewmaster and owner/operator, Dave Mozel, offers consultation relating to all things beer and brewery related including beer and food pairing, beer development and recipes, and brewery equipment installation.
name: Outpost Brewing Company

description:
Oval Brewing is a start-up commercial brewery and tap-room, once open it will operate as a “social brewery” in Columbus, Ohio. It will be a production facility producing kegs and cans of craft beer for the local market. Attached to the brewery will be a tasting room where patrons can interact with the brewers, hang out, learn and -of course- taste.

OBC will have various social functions beyond creating excellent beer; the brewery space will be available as an event space for both public and private functions, a small entertainment venue, team building events, home-brewing classes and team-building workshops. We are also creating a “virtual boardroom” where customers can vote on upcoming beers and styles. These pieces will allow us to communicate directly with the our customers and community.
name: Oval Brewing Company

description: Connecticut's own Belgian style brewery.
name: Overshores Brewing Co.

description: Beer-to-go in the Southeast Valley?  Yes!  Wait … based on the address, it appears to be located in a neighborhood.  Located approximately 25 minutes from Downtown Chandler, Owl’s Orchard Brewery is a normal but very friendly dude selling beer out of his garage in Queen Creek.  If you’re at all interested in how beer is made — just ask.  He’s got an easy to see setup and is more than happy to tell you about it (as time permits).
name: Owl's Orchard Brewery

description:
OXBOW is an American Farmhouse Brewery, specializing in traditional Belgian farmhouse beers with contemporary American influence. 

We brew small batches of beer in a renovated barn on an 18 acre property in Newcastle, Maine.
name: Oxbow Brewing Company

description: Crafting Beer for the South's New Generation of Beer Connoisseur
name: Oxford Brewing Company

description: (No longer brewing)
name: Oyster Bar Bistro and Brewery

description:
Oyster City Brewing Company was founded in 2014 by Cassie Gary, Susan Gary, Rex Humphries and Bo Walker. Cassie, Susan and Rex, owners of Apalachicola’s Owl Cafe & Tap Room, have long shared a passion for fine wine and craft beer. Combine that with Bo’s experience in the brewing industry, and you have the recipe for a dedicated, ambitious craft brewery.
Seeds planted through years of experimentation and small-batch tinkering have borne fruit in the form of three unique brews to date – Apalach IPA, Hooter Brown Tupelo Honey Ale, and Mill Pond Dirty Blonde Ale. Seasonal beers are also in the works, and OCBC is now brewing delicious craft beer seven days a week. Contact us to learn more about Oyster City Brewing Company and find out how you can serve our beers on tap.
name: Oyster City Brewing Company

description: The Oyster House is a small micro brewery devoted to producing high quality, unique ales for beer and seafood lovers.
name: OysterHouse Brewing Company

description: We strive to make great beer. Beer that speaks to the quality and character of who we are and also to the region that we represent. We are proud to be in the Ozark Mountains, with its relaxed atmosphere and eclectic population of farmers, craftsmen, and captains of industry. At Ozark Beer Company, we make beer that brings neighbors together, and that all people lucky enough to call the Ozarks home can be proud of.
name: Ozark Beer Company

description: At Pabst Brewing Company, we make beer with history, with a sense of place. From Milwaukee to Motown, through the Pacific Northwest and back East again, our brands are like family and hometown friends. And we should know a little something about regional pride: Since we started in 1844, we've welcomed 24 new states into the Union. Today, Pabst crafts over 25 classic brews with strict adherence to original standards of quality. Our brands rack up national and international festival awards. Most important, they continue to make memories in the places that mean a lot to our consumers.
name: Pabst Brewing Company

description: PB AleHouse is the perfect place to catch a game, relax with friends, or enjoy a romantic evening out.We're also a great place for parties. Give us a call to book your event!
name: Pacific Beach Alehouse

description: We are a Hawaiian craft brewery with a solid lineup that covers a wide range of styles. Some examples are: Hawaiian Pale Ale (finishes with hints of Hawaiian orange peel), Wai Meli (Spiced mead made from macadamia nut honey, which is produced *only* in Hawaii), and Green Tea Ginger, a light beer that starts with the smoothness of four kinds of green tea and finishes with a hint of ginger spice.
name: Pacific Breach

description:
The PBC Philosophy is derived from the natural regions of the Pacific Rim. With a tip of the cap to our brothers and sisters around the ring of fire, we have molded our beers to reflect the lifestyles that are born from the Pacific coastal environment. Like the Pacific, PBC beers are Clean, Cold and Bountiful. Drawing upon years of brewing experience and knowledge, we have crafted our beers with the promise of mutually clean fermentations and bitterness.

At PBC, we believe beer is something that should be easy to enjoy, not a challenge. As such, PBC beers are eloquently hopped to produce a clean and balanced bitterness free of harsh flavors. Relax with a nice, cold PBC brew and get balanced.
name: Pacific Brewing Co.

description:
Pac Brew Lab started in a garage as a place for Patrick and Bryan to experiment with new beer flavors, styles, and brewing techniques.  What started out as a place to share new creations with friends grew into a bi-monthly, totally free event with hundreds of our “new” friends and great local street food vendors.
 
Patrick and Bryan brew small batches which allows for constant beer experimentation.  They have been known to create exotic beer styles such as their Hibiscus Saison, Squid Ink Black IPA, Chamomile Ale, Lemongrass IPA, and Szechwan Peppercorn Red ale, wine soaked oak aged Brown Ale.  Pac Brew Lab is always on the lookout for new ingredients and inspirations that will help them create new and tantalizing yet pleasing and palatable beers for the public.
name: Pacific Brewing Laboratory

description: Pacific Plate Brewing Company will create a unique canon of historic and Latin-American inspired Ales and Lagers. We utilize a combination of age-old techiques and modern scientific approaches to create a premium artisan product. Ultimately, we will beget a new reign of beer drinking experiences. After all, our motto is Nil Satis Nisi Optimum.
name: Pacific Plate Brewing Company

description:
Canada’s longest running, British Columbian-owned brewery was established in 1957 on a fresh water spring in Prince George, BC. Originally named Caribou Brewing, Pacific Western Brewing Company (PWB) has had seven owners over it's storied past and achieved many milestones. Including, being the first Canadian brewer to export to mainland China in 1991 and then to Russia in 1996. Along the way these achievements have shaped the BC beer backbone for over fifty years.

PWB Accomplishments

2005 - First Canadian Gold Medal Winner, Industry International Awards in Munich
2003 - First ISO 9001 Certified Brewery in North America
1997 - First Certified Organic Lager Beer in Canada
1996 - First North American Brewery Certified to ISO 9002
1996 - First Lager and Lime Beer
1995 - First Malted Herb Beer
1993 - First Ice Beer in Canada
1988 - First Dry Beer in Canada
1983 - First Brewery Operated Beer Store in BC
1982 - First Dark Mild Beer in Canada
1969 - First Malt Liquor in Canada
1965 - First Canned Beer in BC
name: Pacific Western Brewery

description:
More than a century ago the California citrus industry was born in our own city of Riverside. The citrus boom rapidly brought much prosperity and attention to the entire region. The Packinghouse Brewing Company name is a nostalgic tribute to the area’s original citrus packinghouses and the hard working laborers that brought about California’s “Second Gold Rush”.

PBCo. is honored to carry on the same tradition of a strong work ethic and support to our community.

The founders of PBCo. have blended a respect for our local cultural heritage with a passion for finely crafted micro brews. The result is an offering of signature styles that are as rich as the cultural backdrop in which they were conceived.
name: Packinghouse Brewing Company

description: Brewing small batch, hand crafted beer in a famous, picture-perfect Northern Michigan river town. In Grayling, we always PADDLE HARD!
name: Paddle Hard Brewing
Paderborner Brauerei Haus Cramer GmbH & Co. KG

description: Located in the Old Greyhound bus stations. PBW offers 4 Main beers with seasonal additions along with brick oven pizza, wings and sandwiches.
name: Paducah Beer Werks

description: Pagosa Brewing Company™ & Grill is Pagosa Springs' Award-Winning Brewery, recommended by Sunset Magazine, National Geographic & The New York Times. We feature Local, Regional & Wild-Caught Pub Fare available in our dining room as well as 10,000 square feet of tree-covered Beer Garden with festival tent, full sized-stage, professional lighting & sound system. Hope you can join us!
name: Pagosa Brewing & Grill

description: Our mission is to brew the beers WE like to drink, keeping them NON-CONFORMING, UNYIELDING, and always INTERESTING. Remaining environmentally and socially RESPONSIBLE as well as LOCALLY inspired and MOTIVATED. Always brewing the FRESHEST, highest QUALITY beer one can find resulting in CREATIVELY DAMN GOOD BEER.
name: Pair O’ Dice Brewing

description: Formerly Tom Cat Brewing - segued into Rock Creek Brewing in 1999.
name: Pale Ale Brewing Company

description: Brouwerij Palm is the brewery of the top-fermented beers from Brabant; in the rural settings of Steenhuffel between Antwerp and Brussels. The duchy of Brabant has a tradition of using all the best ingredients nature has to offer. The Brabant draught horse once was Belgium's most important export product. To emphasise how proud they are of their region of Brabant, Brouwerij Palm uses the Brabant draught horse as a logo for its top-fermented beer Special Palm.
name: Palm Breweries

description:
Opened by Ed Falkenstein and Louis Bruce in 1993 to create a locally-brewed alternative to domestic and import beers, Palmetto is South Carolina's oldest brewery and the first to open in the state since Prohibition. We make four year-round styles of beer, with every batch brewed in our twenty-five barrel brewing system.

Ed and Louis started making great beers after a windsurfing trip to Hood River Oregon. After finding inspiration and realizing that Charleston needed some better beer, they set up shop on Huger Street and have been brewing up trouble ever since. 

Wanna come see us?

Tasting Room hours are:
Tues-Thurs 3pm - 9pm
Fri-Sat 1pm - 10pm
name: Palmetto Brewing Company

description: We are a Gypsy Brewery from Palo Alto CA. We have brewed at multiple breweries in the Bay Area and at De Proef in Belgium. No matter where we brew, we always being a quality to our fans.
name: Palo Alto Brewing Company

description: Here at Panhead Custom Ales we apply every bit of our skill, creativity and impeccable taste to the business of brewing great craft beer. We love to strip a brew back to its essence and rebuild it in a way that honours tradition as well as the alchemy of creation. At our new brewery headquarters in Upper Hutt we’re turning out beers with character bursting from the glass, streamlined vehicles for malt, yeast and serious hopping. Enjoy them, share them and let us know what you think.
name: Panhead Custom Ales

description: Small brewery in central Finland, Jyväskylä.
name: Panimo HIISI

description: Finnish craft brewery and distillery located in the town of Pori.
name: Panimoravintola Beer Hunter's

description: Panther Island Brewing is located on the banks of the Trinity River in Fort Worth, TX. The brewery began in a small warehouse with a band of friends brewing beer, playing rock and roll and chasing dreams. The band of brewers spent three years crafting batch after batch of beer, and fine tuning their recipes. Hard work, persistence, and passion for brewing spawned a crazy journey that included getting funding to build a full scale brewery in a building that has housed some of Fort Worth’s oldest breweries. Although the journey has been wild, it is only beginning. We are proud to be part of Fort Worth’s craft brewing scene, and are excited for the opportunity to pursue our dreams.
name: Panther Island Brewing

description: Papago Brewing Company is located in Scottsdale, Arizona on the southwest corner of Scottsdale and McDowell Rd. We have 30 rotating taps and about 500 different bottled beers. Proud to be locally owned and operated since May 2001.
name: Papago Brewing Company

description:
Back in 1980 when Congress passed a law making home brewing legal, Jay Hebert, founder of Paper City Brewery, Co., Inc. began brewing beer for his personal consumption. At that time this hobby was quite unique. Jay knew then he would someday like to own a brewery and bring the beer industry back to Holyoke. In 1995 this dream came true. Jay, at this time, owned an old manufacturing warehouse on Cabot Street in Holyoke. He soon incorporated the Paper City Brewery, Co., Inc. From here the wheels were in motion, Jay spent most of his time in transforming the fifth floor of the warehouse into a functional, federally and state approved, micro-brewery. Under the supervision of head brewer Rick Quackenbush the brewery put out its first brew of Holyoke Dam Ale in November of 1996.

Today, Paper City Brewery continues to grow with the addition of a new Head Brewer Ben Anhalt, Assistant Brewer, Jason Todd and an additional flagship beer, Ireland Parish Golden Ale. We have also brewed various seasonal ales such as Winter Palace Wee Heavy and Cabot Street Summer Wheat.
name: Paper City Brewing Company

description: Pappy Slokum Brewing Co. was formed in 2011 when three partners came together with a common goal. That goal being to create uncompromised, high quality artisan ales and lagers here in West/Central Texas for West/Central Texas, just like the original Pappy did. The Pappy Slokum team brings 41 years of brewing experience to the craft brewing industry. With a combined 58 award winning beers along with 6 Brewmaster of year titles collectively. Pappy Slokum is a brewing force that stands alone. From the ice cold, easy drinking Local Yella, malty and dark McPappy's 80 Schilling to the Tom 23 Imperial Red whose flavors hit you like a shot from a hop howitzer. Pappy promises to deliver the flavor our beer loving followers require!
name: Pappy Slokum Brewing Co.

description: Modern brewing processes collide, headlong, into ancient beer. Therein lies the Paradox. The creative forces behind Paradox Beer have explored, wholehartedly, all facets of beer, brewing and drinking and have found the Bedrock of Beer. When all else is removed, Beeris Alchemey sprinkled with Paradigm dashed on the hopes of Artistic Grandeur. In our case we took Wayward Beers, unruly at best, and Bound them in the confines of Experienced Oak in the hopes that the sum would be greater than the parts... A lofty goal! One that the human condition aspires to?
name: Paradox Beer Company

description: 10BBL brewery located in the Adirondack Park.
name: Paradox Brewery

description:
Parallel 49's three founders grew up together in East Vancouver, less than 10 minutes from the spot where the brewery now stands.  Mike, Nick, and Anthony had been avid home brewers and craft beer enthusiasts for years before they finally decided to turn their shared passion into a full time gig.

In 2008, the three friends quit their day jobs and opened a restaurant that quickly became known as a mecca for craft beer enthusiasts in Vancouver.  As the restaurant business thrived, the guys turned their attentions back to the enduring dream of opening their own brewery.

The guys decided that it was time to stop talking and start brewing.  They teamed up with Graham With, a respected home brewer; and Michael Tod, a friend with a wealth of sales experience in the BC craft beer industry.  The newly assembled Parallel 49 team set out to create the unique brand of Vancouver craft beer that they had been thirsting after for years.
name: Parallel 49 Brewing Company

description: Nano Brewery specializing in small-batch craft ales and wines.
name: Pareidolia Brewing Co.

description:
Parish Brewing Co. is a nanobrewery (yes, nano! smaller than micro!) in Lafayette, Louisiana.  We supply Louisiana with uncompromising, craft brewed beer (or biere in our native cajun french).  Using only the finest ingredients, we'd never cut costs at the expense of flavor. 

Think of Parish as an upstart local brewery in cajun country doing battle against boring, tasteless swill.
name: Parish Brewing Company

description: Parkersburg Brewing Co. is a West Virginia Brewery in planning. Parkersburg Brewing Co. will serve as an adage to West Virginia traditions and it's blue collar roots. Owners and Brewers Justin Logue and Dan Curtis aim to create quality beers that will spur on new traditions while respecting the old. We aim to change people's perception of what beer is supposed to be in the mountain state. We are a people that respect a quality, hand-crafted product, why should our beer be any different? Follow us on our journey and help improve the state of beer!
name: Parkersburg Brewing Co.

description:
Hidden in Salem’s industrial corridor of Kessler Mill Road, Parkway Brewing is poised to breathe new life into this forgotten thouroughfare by Mason Creek. With easy access from the Hanging Rock Battlefield Trail, Interstate 81, East Main Street and Routes 311 and 419, everyone can easily find their way to the rivers of tasty goodness we’ll be pouring on site! Come by on for a flight & a look around. And of course, you’ll want to take home a refillable Growler as a mouth-watering treat for the family or friends. Or you might just want to drink it all yourself!

We have loads of fun events planned, so check back here often. Bands, Food Trucks, Belly Dancing, "Body By Parkway Runners Club," Craft Nights, Cornhole Tourneys, you name it, it can happen HERE. You never know what you’ll find going on at Parkway Brewing, but fun will reign, so stop by & check us out. Only one rule: No Bad Vibes!
name: Parkway Brewing Company

description: ParrotDog Brewing Limited is a craft brewing company first put into action by the home brewing partnership of Matt Kristofski and Matt Warner. Matt Stevens was later added to the grist and 2011 saw our first commercial contract brewing release, ParrotDog BitterBitch, on tap and in bottles in all good craft beer bars and outlets around Wellington and wider New Zealand. In late 2011, the decision was made to open our own brewery in Wellington City. After six months of planning and installation, the brewery is now in production in 2012.
name: Parrotdog

description: We intend to start by doing what’s necessary; then do what’s possible; and eventually we hope to be doing the impossible.
name: Partizan Brewing

description: Pronounced: Puh-tare-os and is the original name of the Cache la Poudre River. We are the second generation of craft brewing in Northern Colorado! We specialize in session ales and lagers but always have a 4-5 rotating taps as well. Come check out our tap room with a patio to enjoy Colorado's 300+ days of sunshine!
name: Pateros Creek Brewing Company

description: Patriot Joe's Ale is the craft brewery portion of the Heroes Brewpub in Anniston, Alabama. We specialize in small batch gourmet recipes.
name: Patriot Joe’s Ale

description: Paul's Oyster Bar is pleased to announce the addition of a microbrewery at their restaurant.  According to General Manager Caleb Hufstetler the brewery has been in the works for about a year.  Local, State ATF, and a Federal ATF brewery permit have been obtained.  German engineered equipment has been imported and placed at the restaurant and the first test brew is scheduled for next week.  A former Sweetwater brewery of Atlanta employee is consulting on the project and will be overseeing the brewing process.
name: Paul's Oyster Bar

description: The name of the Paulaner brewery refers to the order of friars that resided in Neuhauser Straße in Munich who were part of the order of Saint Francis of Paola. The monks had brewed beer for their own use since 1634. The beer that was permitted to be sold on holidays was a Bock style which gained local fame. After the abolition of the Neudeck Cloister in 1799, the building was converted into a penitentiary. Franz Xaver Zacherl, the brewer, purchased the former cloister brewery and continued the Starkbier tradition with the product Salvator, which is latin for Saviour. In 1861 the Salvatorkeller (Salvator cellar) was opened upon Nockherberg. In 1928 the brewery merged with the Gebrüder Thomas brewery creating Paulaner Salvator Thomas Bräu. 1994 saw the acquisition into the Kulmbacher brewery group with the affiliated producers Plauen and Chemnitz. A daughter company is the Auer Bräu AG Rosenheim. Paulaner belongs to the BHI (Brau Holding International AG), a joint venture between Schörghuber Ventures (50.1%) and with Holland's Heineken N.V. (49.9%).
name: Paulaner

description:
Paw Paw Brewing Company set out to bring the best brew to the area possible using the best ingredients. Putting people and community above all others Paw Paw Brewing Company will strive to integrate culture and local products while developing hand crafted brews. 

Paw Paw Brewing Company was established in January 2010 by brother-in-laws Ben Fleckenstein and Ryan Sylvester.
name: Paw Paw Brewing Company

description:
Our brewery currently runs a 15-barrel brewing system and offers four year-round beers: Payette Pale Ale, Outlaw IPA, Mutton Buster Brown Ale and North Fork Lager. In 2012, we made Idaho brewing history when we introduced Payette Pale Ale and Mutton Buster in cans. Be on the lookout for even more choices of canned beer in the future. In the meantime, you can find our beer in bars, restaurants, and retail locations including grocery and specialty stores throughout Idaho.

We chose the name Payette because it fits the way we live and work. Francois Payette was a French Canadian trapper whose name and memory is enshrined among numerous Idaho landmarks. The name has since become synonymous with an adventurous spirit that pervades Idaho's year-round outdoor lifestyle.
name: Payette Brewing Co

description: The Peabody Heights Brewery, located in the heart of Baltimore, MD is among the first breweries to be opened within the city limits of Baltimore in over 30 years. Its name comes from the original name of the Charles Village neighborhood in which it now sits. The brewery is the work of three entrepreneurs who hope to bring back to life Baltimore's long and storied tradition of brewing. Stephen Demzcuk, owner of the Baltimore Washington Beer Works and their popular, Raven Special Lager, has joined forces with J. Hollis B. Albert III, a local Baltimore businessman, and Patrick Beille of France, to bring this dream to life. Together, they hope to turn an old 48,000 square foot soda bottling plant into the largest production brewery in Baltimore.
name: Peabody Heights Brewery

description:
Peace Tree Brewing Company creates handcrafted, full flavored beers with a great attention to quality. 

Brewing great full-flavored beer is our passion, but we are also passionate about where we have come from and where we are going. As you might be able to tell, the name of our beers have connections to the places in our past, especially derived from memories and places in our community and our state.

Our name, Peace Tree Brewing Company, is also a reminder, a prompting of our past where different cultures met to discuss, trade, and come to agreements. The Peace Tree is a historic grand sycamore tree that was located near the town of Red Rock under what is now Lake Red Rock. Supposedly the old sycamore was a place where Indians met for generations, then became a meeting place for fur traders. Indian treaties were negotiated here and there is some speculation that it marks the Red Rock Line.
name: Peace Tree Brewing Company

description:
Rob and Debra Evans launched Peak Ales in 2005 and Stuart Wragg joined the business in October 2006. Over time Peak Ales now have a strong team of 8. Peak Ales have matured over the years, and we have now updated our kit to a 20 barrel microbrewery supplying both cask and bottled ales to local pubs, hotels and retail outlets. Alongside Rob, Debra and Stuart we also have three other brewers, Michael Robinson, Thom Bettney and Tom Neale, and our trusty Dave Spencer who multitasks as drayman and our business trouble shooter. 
Elly takes care of our customers, sales and events while Lou covers our accounts.
name: Peak Ales

description:
Peak is a small craft brewing company dedicated to making delicious, handcrafted ales using only the finest artisanal ingredients.

With roots in home brewing back in the 90s, brewer Jon Cadoux set about combining his love for beer with an ethic for sustainability. Whenever possible, he would go out and find ingredients from local organic farmers for his homebrews.  It was a defining day when Jon discovered that you don’t need to sacrifice flavor for sustainability, but that better ingredients actually made the beer more delicious.
name: Peak Organic Brewing Company

description:
Our brewery started with a dream and a 1984 Eagle Wagon and trailer packed with brewery equipment driven here from Colorado by an ambitious young brewer and his Dad. After a long and tumultuous journey involving disaster and triumph;  joy and heartache ~  they began to build. Following fourteen months of design, building and construction they finally fired up the brew kettle for the first time in December of 1999. Although the brewery was tiny and tucked in a basement on Pearl Street, the celebration and Grand Opening was enough to attract throngs of flavor starved people and get Mayor Medinger to tap the inaugural keg.

We have come a long way since. Today we brew, bottle and keg our beers from our new home in the historic La Crosse Footwear building with our expanded 30 barrel brewery. The new brewery has over six times the brewing capacity of the old Pearl Street Brewhouse. And while we spent the first 8 years slinging brews out to nearby pubs and restaurants in draught kegs only, in July of 2007, we unveiled bottled beer in six packs and cases.
name: Pearl Street Brewery

description: The Pearl Street Grill & Brewery features a full-grain brewhouse right in the main dining room.   All our beer is served fresh at the peak of quality.
name: Pearl Street Grill & Brewery

description: We are Texarkana's best new restaurant and first craft brewery, located in the heart of historic downtown! Our gastropub-style Dining Room and Beerhall have become the region's top destination for excellent food, delicious beer and cocktails, and fantastic service.
name: Pecan Point Brewing Company

description:
Pecan Street Brewing and Restaurant — a place to visit with old friends and make new ones! We are located in Johnson City, in the heart of the scenic Texas Hill Country, at 106 E. Pecan — directly across from the historic Courthouse.

We feature hand-crafted beers brewed on premise for the freshest beer you can drink! And for your friends who might prefer a glass of wine, we also have Texas Wines! 

Our menu includes brick oven pizzas, burgers and more, using fresh and local ingredients.

There is live music every Friday and Saturday night, with Sunday being the open mic night!
name: Pecan Street Brewing

description:
The Pecatonica Beer Company is rolling out a series of handcrafted beers brewed in small batches.  Our mission is to impress the craft beer enthusiast with well-balanced full-bodied beers.  We are offering these beers to celebrate the rich history of Wisconsin brewing.  Plus they were too good not to share!Nightfall Beer Glass

Most of our founders grew up close to the Pecatonica River and we all have connections to the region.  The Pecatonica River is home to  sportsmen and paddlers with many unique spots along the way perfect for kicking back.  In this spirit of the outdoors, we adopted the origins of the Pecatonica name – meaning “Slow Water”.  We have adopted the patient nature of the river in perfecting our brews and our Company’s brand echoes the dedication of all hardworking people that enjoy spending time with family and friends.   We look forward to meeting you this summer at the many beer festivals we will be attending.
name: Pecatonica Beer Company

description:
Peddler Brewing Company is a Brewery in Ballard, WA that will be opening its doors in a few weeks! It is a collaboration of Haley's dream of running her own customer-oriented business and meeting new people every day, Dave's dream of brewing and talking about beer every day, and their shared love of riding bikes. We will strive to be a gathering place for beer lovers and support bicycling as a great way to get around our beautiful city.

Peddler Brewing Company has a 7-barrel brewing system which means it can pump out up to 14 kegs of beer per batch. We plan to have 8 taps in our tap room with a few regular taps and a couple rotating seasonal taps. We also plan to have a guest tap or two of other WA state brews or ciders. Our indoor space will have a large bar and tables for guests to sit back and enjoy a taster tray or a pint. We will also have a growler and 32oz bottle exchange to take beer home, with a small deposit encouraging the return and re-use of bottles/growlers.

Decide to ride your bike to our brewery? Perfect! We have an indoor bike rack that holds 9 bicycles and will have a bike work station for you to do some tune-ups, pump up your tire, or easily fix that flat. The bicycle theme will be seen throughout the brewery from the faucet handles in the bathroom to the gears in our concrete counter top.
name: Peddler Brewing Company

description: Pedernales Brewing Company is proud to announce their highly anticipated opening in the city of Fredericksburg, Texas. Texas Hill Country's newest microbrewery will feature Classic and German-style beers. PBC’s impressive lineup of beers will include skillfully crafted lagers and ales. At this time we are offering our flagship brands; LOBO and LOBO Negro. “LOBO” is the name of the WOLF native to Texas and the Southwest.  Sadly, the wolf was almost wiped out by big ranchers some 100 years ago; not unlike the small craft brewers who were similarly annihilated by prohibition.
name: Pedernales Brewing Company

description: Peel Wood Fired Pizza, located in Edwardsville, IL offers wood fired pizzas, gourmet appetizers & desserts, craft beers and extensive wine menu.
name: Peel Wood Fired Pizza & Brewery

description: We might not be open yet, but the mission of Pelagic Brewing Company is to produce handcrafted, high quality, delicious beer through eco-friendly methods. Pelagic seeks to contribute to the community in Wilmington by supporting local artists, musicians, and promoting sustainability.
name: Pelagic Beer And Wine

description:
Welcome to the Pelican Pub Brew House. Darron Welch is the Brew Master here at the Pub. Before becoming the Brew Master, Darron was an assistant brewer for Adler Brau Brewery in Appleton, Wisconsin, but before that, he home brewed for many years in his hometown of Eugene, Oregon.

Darron was a key player in the creation of the Pelican Pub Brewery. He helped build the Pelican Pub from the ground up, designing the brewery layout and production flow as well as all of the fine Pelican beers.
name: Pelican Brewing Company

description: Penn Brewery tells the story of Pittsburgh’s European immigrants through its craft beer and homemade cuisine. Pittsburgh’s oldest and largest brewery, Penn is housed in the mid nineteenth-century landmark E&O Brewery Building in the North Side’s Deutschtown neighborhood, which was settled by German immigrants. Penn has been producing high-end craft beers since 1986, specializing in authentic, award-winning German-style beers brewed in the tradition of these immigrants, according to the strict quality standards of Reinheitsgebot.  Our beers’ great taste comes from real German hops and two-row barley, with no added corn or rice fillers.
name: Penn Brewery

description:
Penn Brewery has been producing high-end craft beers since 1986.  Penn’s flagship lineup features authentic German-style beers brewed in the tradition of Pittsburgh’s German immigrants, according to the strict quality standards of Reinheitsgebot.  
More recently, our lineup has been expanded to include other varieties including APAs, IPAs, fruit beers, and more.  The common thread that binds all of Penn’s beers together, however, is exceptional quality and craftsmanship.  We produce all of our brews in the classic, old-world way, without taking any shortcuts. We use copper kettles for optimal heat control. We employ double-decoction grain mashing to release fuller flavor in our lagers.  And we lager all of our beers in horizontal tanks for a cleaner, crisper finish. 

Penn Brewery is housed in the mid-nineteenth century landmark E&O Brewery building and is one of only a handful of working breweries with original beer caves still on premise.  And with our commitment to brewing the old-world way, we like to say that here at Penn Brewery, the tradition of our lagering caves lives on.
name: Pennsylvania Brewing Company

description: Family owned winery and brewery in "mid-coast" Maine. Also Penobscot Bay Brewery, Pairings at Winterport Winery (private events, cooking classes, the fun part of food), and Bay Brew Ice Cream - would you believe Stout ice cream?
name: Penobscot Bay Brewery

description:
Art, Science, and Belgian-Inspired Brewing in Geneva, IL. 

This began with a shared obsession for skillfully brewed beer, and the starved need for cultural redirection of our lifework. Blissfully content with an opportunity to help refine a discerning palate, preferably with beer in hand, a deeper passion and commitment to the cause has evolved into Penrose Brewing Company. The cultural shift already underway is a by-product of intention and specificity. You will want to be involved.
name: Penrose Brewing Company

description:
Once upon a time, two guys who had never met, had a glass of beer.
Who knew that years later, their love of beer would bring them together.

Elliott Eckland and Mark Robertson started this journey in 2009, and in October 2010 opened the doors of the Pensacola Bay Brewery. Focusing on local Pensacola landmarks and lore, the Pensacola Bay Brewery mixes a little Florida history in each pint.
name: Pensacola Bay Brewery

description: The People's Brewing Company provides high quality hand-crafted beer and education of the craft beer industry to the people of Lafayette and the state of Indiana while providing community leadership with environmentally friendly business practices. We offer a taproom and tours of our facility. Our staff is fully trained on the brewing process, beer styles, and beer production. We encourage our customers to become educated in craft beers and local beer history.
name: People's Brewing Company

description:
Starting out as a labor of love in our garage, Peoria Artisan Brewery is our dream come true. We love beers and if you do too, you've come to the right place! We brew in-house, several varieties of our own hand-crafted ales and lagers. All of our beers are special, unique recipes with variations of the standard styles.  
 
We place our emphasis on quality and freshness and our small batches ensure that what you are drinking today is fresh and unique.
name: Peoria Artisan Brewery

description:
ercival Beer Company was discovered in 2010, but wasn't launched until 2012. After home brewing for over three years, we felt compelled to share our great beer with other beer drinkers and our community.
﻿
Our desire was to brew and distribute quality Craft Beer Brands that can be enjoyed and appreciated by all, not just a few. In addition, we wanted to help showcase the diverse personalities of Boston. Thus, PBC set out to develop brands which directly represented  the diverse neighborhoods that make up Boston, Massachusetts. In particular, we focused our efforts at spotlighting the multi-ethnic neighborhood of Dorchester.
name: Percival Beer Company

description:
Our philosophy is to brew beer with the adventurous craft beer drinker in mind—focusing on hand-crafted, small batches of beer, using local, seasonal and organic ingredients as much as possible.

Our beers are influenced mostly by Belgian and American craft styles, but the addition of premium ingredients such as fruits, spices or wild yeast strains sometimes causes the beers to defy traditional categories. Our barrel aging program features a wide variety of beers aged in wine and spirits barrels, ranging from a Rye barrel-aged Mexican Chocolate Stout to a wild yeast-fermented Saison aged on Missouri wine grapes in French oak wine barrels. We strive to always achieve balance with each of our recipes, making our beers exceptional with food.
name: Perennial Artisan Ales

description: Looking forward to bringing some tasty brews to the downtown Durham area in 2015!
name: Perpetual Brewing

description:
Located 10 minutes north of downtown Grand Rapids, Michigan, our micro brewery and taproom is striving to bring a world class experience to every person who walks through our doors.

With a hospitality philosophy of treating our customers like they're guests in our home, we look forward to serving you.
name: Perrin Brewing Company

description: Neighborhood craft brewery and taproom located in the heart of the Perry District, Spokane, Washington.
name: Perry Street Brewing

description: Beer, Farm Fresh. Persephone’s 11-acre farm-based brewery prides itself on the FRESHEST BEER. We grow our own hops and use BC grain in every sip. Not content with simply making the best and freshest beer, Persephone is committed to making the world a better place through early adoption of ecologically positive systems and working as a social venture to employ people who need it most. Every can, glass, growler or keg you purchase helps us achieve these goals as a team, which now includes YOU! Thank you for your support and ENJOY THIS BEER!
name: Persephone Brewing Company

description: Persimmon Hollow Brewing Company is the dream of two great friends and award-winning home brewers who are ready to turn a hobby and passion into a career by turning a former parking garage into a brewery and tap room. We make craft beer accessible to all walks of life, from craft beer beginners to the most discerning palates.
name: Persimmon Hollow Brewing Co.

description: All natural microbrewed gluten-reduced BEER
name: Perth Brewery

description:
A 10 BBL micro brewery in Petaluma, CA.  We have 10 regular craft beers on the market, with the occasional seasonal and "let's make something cool!" beer.

Visit our small, cozy den - uh, taproom - and enjoy all of our craft beers plus 6 versions on nitro!  We don't have a kitchen, so you are welcome to bring your own food.  Kid and dog friendly (leashes, please).
name: Petaluma Hills Brewing Co

description:
Founded by homebrewer Pete Slosberg and Mark Bronder in 1986, helping to pioneer the craft beer movement.

Exclusively brewed under contract by Matt Brewing Company of Utica, NY, best known for their Saranac line.

Sold to the Gambrinus Company in 1998.

Sadly, ceased production in spring 2011 after declining sales under Gambrinus ownership.
name: Pete's Brewing

description: Located behind the Portola Hotel & Spa, Peter B's Brewpub is Monterey's original craft brewery. Executive Chef, Jason Giles and the brewing team combine great pub food and award winning handcrafted beer in a warm, friendly atmosphere. Enjoy the your favorite sports event on one of 18 HDTV’s or sit outside by the fire pits on the pet friendly patio. Peter B's Brewpub features Brewer’s Dinners in a private barrel room and a Mug Club Membership with a great community of home brewers, beer connoisseurs, and beer enthusiast.
name: Peter B's Brewpub

description: Honest, friendly, down-to-earth brewers delivering world class passion in a glass across D/FW
name: Peticolas Brewing Company

description: A Michigan Microbrewery. Join us in our Tap Room to experience made-on-premiss hand-crafted beer and light food offerings!
name: Petoskey Brewing

description: Petrópolis is a Brazilian brewery company headquartered in Petrópolis. The company has 4 industrial plants located in Petrópolis, Boituva, Teresópolis and Rondonópolis and operates in 13 Brazilian states, Germany and Paraguay.
name: Petrópolis

description: A Northwest & Belgian inspired 15-barrel brewery and tasting room serving lunch and dinner 7 days a week in Hood River, OR.  pFriem artisanal beers are symphonies of flavor and balance, influenced by the great brewers of Belgium, but unmistakably true to our homegrown roots in the Pacific Northwest. Although they are served humbly, each glass is overflowing with pride and a relentless aspiration to brew the best beer in the world. We’ll let you decide.
name: Pfriem Family Brewers

description: We love fermenting things. Malted Barley, Grapes, Apples, Honey, Peaches, Pears,... I'm not sure where this will end. We are a nano Brewery, Cidery, Winery, and soon to be Meadery. We create fresh menus every week filled with items designed to pair with our great beers, ciders, and wine.
name: Phantom Ales and Ciders

description:
The Phantom Canyon Brewing Company opened in December 1993, after almost three years in the planning. Phantom Canyon is located in the historic Cheyenne Building, which was built in 1901. Originally the local offices of the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad, the building was renovated in 1909 and re-opened as The Cheyenne Hotel (owned and operated by the Shafer family until 1963).

The Cheyenne Building was the first downtown restaurant to be placed on the National Register of Historical Places and is located on the first corner of the city. All addresses and street plans originate from the intersection of Pikes Peak and Cascade. The building is named after Cheyenne Mountain and Chief Two Moons of the Cheyenne Indian Tribe (whose stone visage looks over the front entrance).about image About PCBC

Our second floor boasts the most elegant billiard hall in Colorado Springs. The Phantom Canyon Billiard Hall opened in June 1996 and contains 13 pool tables, an entertaining jukebox, foosball tables, dart boards and big-screen TVs. It’s a popular destination for both the Happy Hour crowd and late night joy seekers. Late night specials and promotions complete the Billiard Hall ambience.

Our third floor Banquet Hall is the perfect place to host private parties or business gatherings. The hall was newly restored and opened December of 2001. It features rows of arched windows with gorgeous mountain views. Wood flooring and 12 foot high ceilings create an elegant space that can accommodate groups of 20- 170 guests. The Banquet Hall contains a full bar and kitchen which cater exclusively to third floor events. Reservations and bookings are arranged through our Banquet Director.
name: Phantom Canyon Brewing Company

description:
Part brewery, part cafe — and part haunted cellar — Phantom Carriage is now open in Carson. And like so many other craft brewery tasting rooms, Phantom Carriage occupies a commercial/industrial building, this one among the confluence of the 405, 110 and 91 freeways, just a few blocks from the home of the Goodyear blimp.

But unlike other brewery tasting rooms with sparse decor and little style, Phantom Carriage drips with atmosphere. 

Conceived by beer industry veteran (and self-proclaimed beer geek) Martin Svab as a Belgian beer cafe, the project grew when Simon Ford — a skilled and decorated homebrewer known on the Los Angeles scene for his downright fantastic sour beers — signed on. The “small-batch beer endeavor” launched, relying on other local breweries (chiefly Monkish Brewing in Torrance) for production capacity and storage space.

cComments
Got something to say? Start the conversation and be the first to comment.
ADD A COMMENT
0

After a favorable reception for the first beer -- a wild Belgian ale that found the sweet spot between tart, dry and funky -- the partners redoubled their efforts to find a local space to house the brewery. Carson welcomed the team with open arms, and a comparatively streamlined bureaucracy. 

The 7,000-square-foot location now houses a tasting room, a small pilot-batch brewhouse, a screening room where Svab hopes to both show his beloved classic horror films and conduct beer education classes, a kitchen focused on sandwiches and small plates.

Also, and most importantly, on premises: over 500 oak barrels previously used by wine and spirit producers. It’s the barrels that set Phantom Carriage apart, as the brewery will focus on wild, wood-aged, and sour beers. 

The brewery took its name from a 1921 Swedish horror film, and the house beers are often named after the luminaries of that age of cinema.

On a recent visit during the soft opening, the tasting rooms was comfortably full and three house beers were available (alongside a well-curated guest tap list and a drool-worthy bottle list).

Oude Muis is an aged version of the primogenitor brew, Cushing a potent golden sour ale that balanced a bracing tartness with a twang of funk, and Rathbone is a dark sour ale that added some fruitiness and a pleasant burnt-sugar sweetness. The latter was a particularly fitting match to the deeply hickory smoked brisket served simply on a baguette with au jus. Cold-brewed coffee is available on tap alongside the dozen beer taps, and there’s a small selection of wine and cocktails (Spanish-style charcuterie will also soon join the menu items). 

Article written by: JOHN VERIVE of the Los Angeles Times
name: Phantom Carriage

description:
Located in beautiful Central Oregon, in the town of Redmond, Phat Matt’s brewery benefits tremendously from the purity of its pristine natural water source, the majesty of the Cascade mountain range and the people that call this high desert oasis home. Originating in the snow capped peaks, the purist glacial fed water flows completely submerged into the volcanic aquifer, allowing us to brew the most flawless of beers.

The entire brewing process is overseen by founding partner Matt Mulder. Building on his talents as both chef & restaurateur, Matt’s canvas is no longer a plate of food but a pint of beer. Blending the purest water with the finest Oregon hops Matt then filters the beer for clarity, resulting in the perfect pint. 

Here at Phat Matt’s we fully embrace the philosophy that beer is for every occasion, anytime, anywhere.
name: Phat Matt's Brewing Company

description: Award winning micro brewery - CAMRA Gold. Small range of beers.
name: Pheasantry Brewery

description: This is, Philadelphia's one and only Philadelphia Brewing Company; brewers of fine hand crafted Ales from our historic brewery building in the Kensington neighborhood of Philadelphia. Like the history of brewing in Philadelphia the name Philadelphia Brewing Company has gone through many revivals. The same can be said of our brewery building - the former Wiesbrod and Hess Brewing Company complex in Kensington. At Philadelphia Brewing Co we take pride in our brews, our people, and our community. One person could never do everything that it takes to get beer into your glass. And it may sound obvious, but we won't brew anything that we wouldn't drink ourselves - you won't catch us drinking anything called Ultra unless it's a literal name meaning more flavor, more hops, more malt, more carbs. That's because we are Brewers; proud brewers of fine hand crafted Ales from our historic brewery building in the Kensington neighborhood of Philadelphia. Now that's out of the way; we will be starting out with four mainstay brews which will be available in draught and in bottles. Once we're stocked up on the core brews we'll start pumping out regular seasonal or specialty brews. The specialty series will be driven by our individual brewers and the desires and whims of the rest of our family.  The beer is flowing at Philadelphia Brewing co! You can find our four brands on tap at finer establishments all around town!
name: Philadelphia Brewing Co

description: Small town, BIG beer.
name: Philipsburg Brewing Company

description: We are a small-batch craft brewery located on the bottom of a medium-sized island on the left coast of a very large country.
name: Phillips Brewing Company

description: Located in Fredericton, New Brunswick, Canada, Picaroons Traditional Ales, brews traditional British-style ales using malted barley, hops, our signature Hampshire yeast and water.
name: Picaroons Traditional Ales

description: Pickled Pig Brewery is an independent brewery which is family owned and operated. Our objective is to supply our customers with premium pure hand crafted beer with no preservatives or chemicals at a great price and to be your local Tweed, Northern Rivers and Gold Coast beer supplier. We strive to be part of and contribute to our communities and maintain an eco friendly environment.
name: Pickled Pig Brewery

description:
Piece unites classic New Haven-style thin crust pizza with award-winning microbrews in a spacious loft setting. We opened in July 2001 after transforming a roofing company garage into a casual pizzeria complete with a skylite ceiling and sunken lounge area. Sports fans can catch events on a series of eleven 42” plasma TVs that span the length of the bar. Revelers pack the house for games and special events. 

Opened in July of 2001, Piece has been producing small batches of our hand-crafted brews in our seven barrel brew-house. Brewer Jonathan Cutler had nine-plus years of brewing experience, having brewed at some of the most well respected breweries in the country. He is also a graduate of the esteemed Siebel Institute and received formal training from the Master Brewers Association of America.

Brewer Jonathan Cutler has won nineteen major awards in five years of operation. In 2006 Piece and Jonathan won the prestigious World Beer Cup Champion Small Brewpub and Brewmaster Award. Be sure to stop by and try one of our award winning brews.
name: Piece Pizzeria & Brewery

description: We are a Brew Pub located in Machesney Park, IL., and specialize in handcrafted ales in a variety of styles. We use the finest barley, wheat, malts and hops to produce our tasty beers.  Join us at our brewery and try as many as seven of our own beers including SOUTHY BITCH SLAP American Irish Red, BLUE COLLAR American Wheat, HOPCORE American Pale Ale or anything else we may be brewing at the time.
name: Pig Minds Brewing Co.

description: The Pig Pounder Brewery is named after a beer launched by the Darryl's restaurant chain in 1988. It is a local microbrewery specializing in producing outstanding authentic UK style beers including types like an Extra Special Bitter, an English Dark Mild, and a classic Milk Stout, for local venues. The brewery also features an interactive tasting room, made for connecting with our guests and educating them more about beer.
name: Pig Pounder Brewery

description:
Pig's Eye Brewing Company was established in 2002.  The previous owner of the Pig's Eye brands, Minnesota Brewing Company, had gone out of business in June of that year.  We (two former Minnesota Brewing Company employees - Phil Gagne', the Brewmaster, and Jeff Crawford, the VP of Sales) formed Pig's Eye Brewing Company, and purchased the Pig's Eye brands from ... Minnesota Brewing company's creditors in September 2002. 

With the old brewery closed, and  limited resources at our disposal, we applied for, and received, permission from the Bureau of Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau to brew as an "alternating proprietor" at City Brewing Company - La Crosse, WI; a brewery with a longstanding brewing heritage, and a commitment to quality.  As an "alternating proprietor", we are a "brewery within a brewery", essentially renting brewing and packaging equipment from City whenever we are brewing and packaging our products.

Our inaugural brews of Pig's Eye Pilsner and Pig's Eye Light were started on February 18, 2003, with the 1st product run was on March 25, 2003.  To the chagrin of some of our loyal customers, we made the decision to drop the "Pirate" rendering of "Pig's Eye" from our packaging, in favor of a historically accurate portrayal of Pierre "Pig's Eye" Parrant.  In May 2004, in response to consumer interest in low-carb products, we replaced Pig's Eye Light with Pig's Eye Lean Light (the original Pig's Eye light beer).  Our product line expanded again in January 2006 - with the introduction of Pit Bull High Gravity Ice Malt Liquor, and again in June 2007 - with the re-introduction of Pig's Eye Ice.  We  also, for a short period of time, operated as an alternating proprietorship and packaged 24/12 Returnable Bottles at Stevens Point Brewery- Stevens Point, WI, but had to discontinue the production of the returnable bottle package due to increases in packaging costs. 

We started out in 2002 as a 2 man owner/operator brewer, and remain so to this day.  Beer is our life, and our livelihood - We, and our families, appreciate your interest and support!
name: Pig's Eye Brewing Company

description: Production brewery specializing in Lagers and fine Seasonal Ales. Founded by Edward Silveira, IV and James Mann in cooperation with Chief Falcon/Brewmaster Bryan Holloway
name: Pigeon Head Brewery

description: Pigeon Hill Brewing Company was founded on the ideals of community, tradition, and great beer.  We believe in creating a taproom that is a community gather space, steeped in rich local tradition, and fueled by pints of excellent craft beer.  Of course, our focus is the beer, and it is through unwavering attention to detail and a refusal to accept anything less than excellence that we craft beers we are proud to call our own.
name: Pigeon Hill Brewing Company

description: Pigeon River Brewing Co. is a bar and brewery in Marion, WI featuring our very own Pigeon River Beer, over 75 varieties of different beer, full bar and locally made fresh pizzas.
name: Pigeon River Brewery

description: Pigskin is more than a name, it’s an idea. Pigskin represents a feeling, a raw emotion, and a sense of total satisfaction. We deliver a feeling of “Victory in every sip.” It is our tagline and also our foundation. We offer exquisitely crafted beers that satisfy every fan like they just won the big game. We are committed to the “Pigskin Experience”: a top notch taproom and brewery, world class hospitality, and some of the best damn beers in the land. So come join us at Pigskin to watch the game, celebrate after a day of dominating at work, or just kick back and enjoy the high-quality beer you deserve!
name: Pigskin Brewing Company

description: We’re passionate about what we do. For years creating our own wines and sharing them through The Hudsonville Winery has been a dream come true. Still, who doesn’t like a good, handcrafted beer?  So, as we all still have our full time jobs, we’re launching Pike 51 Brewery to bring our passion to you.
name: Pike 51 Brewing Company

description: The Pike Brewing Company is a family owned brewery located in the historic Pike Place Public Market neighborhood. It was founded in 1989 by craft beer pioneers, Charles and Rose Ann Finkel. Pike Brewing handcrafts beers of character including the Pike Pale Ale, Pike IPA, Naughty Nellie, Space Needle IPA, Kilt Lifter, Monk’s Uncle, and XXXXX Stout along with seasonal offerings such as Harlot’s Harvest, Old Bawdy, Auld Acquaintance, Derby Lager, Saison Houblon, and Octopus Ink. The Pike Pub is known for local, sustainable and seasonal pub fare and for housing the world-famous Micro-Brewery Museum, illustrating 9,000 years of beer history.
name: Pike Brewing Company

description:
We established our Monument, Colorado brewery in 2011 as a place for our community to connect and come together. We believe the best beers are ones shared with friends and we hope that wherever you find a Pikes Peak Beer, it finds you in good company.

We would rather brew for our neighbors than notoriety, so our beers are personal expressions that stay faithful to classic styles. We’re lucky to be at the source of some the country’s finest ingredients. From our abundant grains and fresh hops to our pristine waters, we’re inspired by our landscape to make beer as solid and iconic as our namesake mountain.

Since receiving such an overwhelming response, we’ve made it a priority to give back to the community that’s been so good to us. Our seasonal beers support organizations that make our corner of Colorado such a great place to live. At Pikes Peak Brewing Company, we’re elevating the craft of beer and invite you to join us on our trek to the summit.
name: Pikes Peak Brewing Company

description:
Pinchgut Brewing Company is the result of a very passionate craft-brewer biting the bullet & going out on his own.

Award winning brewer, Gerard Meares has been brewing for a variety of small breweries in Australia since 2004. This brewing company is the result of a very passionate craft-brewer biting the bullet & going out on his own.
name: Pinchgut Brewing Co

description:
When asked, “Why we started brewing?” The common response back in 2009 was, “We like arts and crafts”. The brewing began in a small apartment kitchen on Pine St. in San Francisco on a stove that could hardly generate a boil. During the first night, it became apparent that we could create the beer that we wanted to drink and the collective that became Pine Street Brewery (PSB) was born. That was goal from the first night of brewing—it was love at first smell.

PSB moved into the historic Bourne Mansion in Pacific Heights during the Spring of 2010 and called this home until the Fall of 2011. Regular weekly brewing led to lots of experimentation and ten recipes that have become part of the core beer list. During “Brew Nights,” friends were made, a community was fostered and a brand was started.

Pine Street Brewery was designed so that our products would be available for many different palates in many different communities. There is a unique Pine Street in almost every area. We intend for our beer, interpretations of classic styles, to unite people across the US, one beer at a time.

Our philosophy is to provide a celebration through ales and togetherness. We are active in the community through volunteer work and partnerships with local charities.
name: Pine Street Brewery

description: Pinelands Brewing Co. is based in Tuckerton, New Jersey, right in the heart of the Pine Barrens. Creating hand crafted beers "As Pure As The Pines".
name: Pinelands Brewing Co.

description:
Pinetop Brewing Company was founded in 2012 by James Maloney with the intention of creating the first Micro-Brewery in Northeastern Arizona.

PBC opened it’s doors in November of 2012 and operated a Nano 1/2 bbl system. At first, Pinetop Brewing Company was just a small tap room with limited production and hours of operation. In the Spring of 2013 James upgraded his brewing system to a 3.5BBL and significantly added to his production capabilities. Now, the brewery has 4, 4BBL brite beer serving tanks and holds regular hours of operation.

PBC’s Head Brewer is Tom Piazza out of Pine, AZ. Tom has won several state awards for his beers. Prior to joining PBC, Tom ran Mountain Top Brewery in Payson, AZ, and he distributed his beer across the state. Tom brings with him many years of brewing experience. Tom is assisted by local firefighter, Mason Manhardt, out of Show Low, AZ.

PBC brews all of it’s beers out of the Pinetop-Lakeside location at 7,000 feet elevation. In addition to our outstanding beers, we also serve BBQ food and Pizza. We hope to see you at our Tap Room or enjoying some food on our outdoor patio.

PBC : “Small Town, Big Beer”.
name: Pinetop Brewing Company

description:
Founded in 2010, Piney River Brewing Company is a microbrewery dedicated to making distinctive craft beers that celebrate life in the Ozarks. Joleen and Brian Durham, owners, have lived and farmed in Texas County for many years, and they have enjoyed craft beer for a long time, too.

Today, Joleen and Brian live up the hill from the Little Piney River that flows into the Big Piney.  They benefit from multiple fresh water springs and a waterfall on their farm, and they continually find themselves drawn to the rivers that flow around their farm and throughout the Ozarks.

Joleen and Brian first made beer on the kitchen stove, fermenting it in the basement of their 100-year old farm house.  In July 2010 they partnered together to revive a 70-year old barn made from red and white oak trees harvested off the farm, and Piney River Brewing Company was born.

The barn, rechristened BARn, is home to Piney River Brewing Company.  Joleen and Brian began the craft brewery as a “nanobrewery”, brewing on a 10-gallon Sabco system.  In the fall of 2011, a 7-barrel brewhouse with an automatic canning line was put in place for the microbrewery.

Insane?...No, we're having the time of our lives!
name: Piney River Brewing Company

description:
We’ve been commercially making beer for our friends, neighbors and visitors of Brewer’s Pizza in Orange Park since early 2011. All that time Brewer’s has been serving Pinglehead Brewing Company’s handcrafted beers along side of some of the highest ranked beers America has to offer. The goal was to truly understand how our beer would stack up against the best of the best. Based on what Brewer’s customers have to say, our beers are not just competitive, they are usually their first choice.

If you really love pale yellow light lager, drinkable only when served ice cold (and in a frosted mug), then DON’T WASTE YOUR TIME TRYING OUR BEER. You probably won’t be able to appreciate it. If those awesome Superbowl beer commercials have convinced you that you “belong”, DON’T BOTHER LOOKING OUR WAY! Our craftsmen make BIG BEER, full of flavor with the most incredible ingredients available. We call it “Beer with Attitude!”

Venturing out beyond the walls of Brewer’s Pizza, Pinglehead Brewing Company will enable many others to enjoy their very own“Beer with Attitude!”
name: Pinglehead Brewing Company

description:
When first opened in 1957, the Pinnacle Peak was a general store and rest stop for travelers heading to nearby lakes.
