To boost sales of his small business, the owner decided to serve dinner on the weekends. It was a great success - and the rest is restaurant history. What started as a weekend cookout has grown into the world's largest western steakhouse with seating for 1800 people inside and outside for 2000.

Pinnacle Peak Patio is renowned for its delicious mesquite broiled steaks, casual western atmosphere, and its "NO NECKTIE POLICY." This "no necktie" tradition was started one night when a Phoenix executive came in for dinner. The original owner, wanting to keep the atmosphere in his restaurant casual, told the executive, "Either you take that tie off, or I'll cut it off." The executive did not take heed and was appalled when the owner pulled out a butcher knife and promptly cut off the offending cravat.

Wanting to be recognized as a victim of this absurd policy, the executive demanded that his tie be prominently displayed for all to see. The necktie was stapled to the rafters along with a business card identifying its victim. Pinnacle Peak is very serious about its "no necktie" policy and has cut over a million ties from unsuspecting customers.
name: Pinnacle Peak Patio Steakhouse & Microbrewery

description: Pinthouse Pizza is a craft brewpub serving Austin's finest pizza and world class beers. The Pinthouse Pizza brewing style is a hop-forward, American-fusion style that emphasizes the flavor and aroma of the beloved hop flower without the traditional bitterness associated with hoppy beers. We are proud to be working with some of the best hop growers in the country and are excited to be showcasing these flavor profiles.
name: Pinthouse Pizza

description: PINTS Brewing Company opened in 2012 as Oldtown/Chinatown’s first brewery since Henry Saxer’s original Liberty Brewing Co. opened in 1852. PINTS Brewing Co. is dedicated towards old school Northwest and British inspired ales using the best quality base and specialty malts along with Oregon grown hops. Brewed in small 3.5 barrel batches, our beers are designed to be complex, yet focused, and ultimately beg another pint.
name: Pints Brewing

description:
Pipeworks began, as many breweries do, in the stove top kettles and plastic-bucket fermenters of the home brewer. Beejay Oslon and Gerrit Lewis met while working at Chicago's famous West Lakeview Liquors, a haven for beer geeks in search of new and exciting brews from around the world. While working there, the two got to thinking it was time to turn their passion in to a business.

 The first steps in that long journey  took them to a the small town of Lo in the Belgian countryside. It was there that the Pipeworks boys lived and worked with Urbain Coutteau owner and brewer at the De Struise Brewery. While working there the boys honed their craft, learned the ins and outs of running a brewery, and had the opportunity to create their first commercially available beers. The success of these brews fueled their passion and prepared them for the work ahead of them.

 Upon coming back to the States the two began experimenting with pilot batches, formulating a business plan, and developing an image for Pipeworks.

 Now we are ready to bring what we've learned to the craft beer world!
name: Pipeworks Brewing Company

description: Pisgah Brewing Company is located in Black Mountain, NC about 10 miles east of Asheville. We specialize in brewing hand crafted certified organic beer. Please browse around to learn about our beer, where to find it and what it means to be certified organic.
name: Pisgah Brewing Company

description: Come be part of Pismo Beach's first microbrewery. We have six custom crafted beers on tap at all times, brewed daily on site from only the freshest and finest selected grains and hops.
name: Pismo Brewing Company

description: At Pitcher's Brewery we proudly serve handcrafted ales using the finest grains, hops, yeast and water to produce a quality product. Our original fresh craft brews contain influences from Belgium, Canada, English, German as well as America.
name: Pitchers Brewery

description: Pitchfork Brewing is Hudson's newest brewery. We will be making outstanding craft beers with a focus on high quality, locally sourced ingredients and an environmentally friendly business model. Our taproom will feature a variety of beers on tap as well as specialty firkins. In addition to stopping by for a pint or two, grab a bite at Paddy Ryan's Irish Pub next door, and take home a growler for later. You're going to love our beer.
name: Pitchfork Brewing Company

description:
From it’s beginnings in 1861, Pittsburgh Brewing Company has always been committed to a few things: deep roots in the Pittsburgh community, strong tradition, innovation, and of course, brewing great beer. We’ve been at it for over 150 years, and with every bottle we keep getting better.

OUR MISSION

Make Pittsburgh proud of its hometown brewery
Build on our proud tradition of excellence
Produce the best-tasting malt beverages in the country
Reinvigorate and maintain an iconic brand
Create high-quality jobs and provide healthy returns to investors
OUR VALUES
These core values are at the center of everything we do here at the Pittsburgh Brewing Company.

QUALITY
This means quality in everything: ingredients, the people we hire, the vendors we work with, our advertising, and of course, every beer we brew. We strongly believe that anything worth doing is worth doing well.

INTEGRITY
Integrity means honesty, transparency, and dedication to our values. We’re a proud part of our Pittsburgh community, and we love giving back.

TRADITION
We’ve been brewing for over 150 years and our brews reflect that expertise. Today’s Iron City Beer tastes just like it used to, but a little bit better every time.
name: Pittsburgh Brewing Company

description: We have been crafting great beer, great food, and good times here in Pittsfield since 2005. Our main philosophy is you get what you give.Throughout the year we source ingredients for our menu and our beer locally. We pride ourselves on producing the freshest food and beer in the Berkshires. Our pub serves as a community hub for locals and varied organizations. Our laidback environment, dynamic menu, and great beers makes the Brew Works the best brewpub in the area.We are located in the heart of downtown Pittsfield at:
name: Pittsfield Brew Works
Pivovar a pálenica Turák a vnuk
Pivovar a restaurace U tří růží

description:
This storied hotel with a brewery dating from the 19th century is a 3-minute walk from the Usti nad Labem train station and 2.9 km from the Střekov Castle. 

The simple rooms with refined furniture, parquet floors and photographs of the historic venue also feature free Wi-Fi and flat-screen TVs. Kids ages 3 and younger are welcome without charge.

Freebies include parking, a breakfast buffet and beer. A rustic-chic restaurant/bar and brewery features arched ceilings and shaded outdoor seating. Brewery tours are available. Other amenities include bike storage and cleaning facilities. Pets are welcome.
name: Pivovar hotel Na Rychtě

description:
Kout Brewery was probably founded after disappearance of Rýzmberk castle during the 30 year war. In those days first beer from Kout was brewed and the history of “Kout na Šumavě” Brewery began.

First written records are however dated later in the first years of the 18th century. Records mention the year of 1736 as the foundation year. The brewery bloomed in the era when it belonged to the earl kin of Stadions when it was gradually expanded to current shape.

When the Stadion kin died off at the beginning of the 20th century, the brewery changed proprietary repeatedly and from 1924 until the end of World War II it belonged to the Schönborn kin.
name: Pivovar Kout

description: The Vyškov brewery is a regional brewery that dates back to 1680. We offer a wide assortment of traditional types of beer drafted from premium selected sources in The Czech Republic and Moravia.
name: Pivovar Vyškov

description:
The historical beginnings of Pivovarna Laško reach back to 1825, when the mead and gingerbread maker Franz Geyer set up a brewery in the former Valvasor Hospital, which still stands today. One hundred and eighty five years have passed since then, with Pivovarna Laško growing from a local brewery to the leading producer of beer and together with other companies in the Group, into the leading producer of mineral and natural waters, non-alcoholic beverages and other beverages on the Slovene market.

Beverages production belongs to the more competitive industries, where multinational corporations, commercial companies and demanding users play the most important roles.

Pivovarna Laško and the Laško Group are embarking on a path of development with the following basic business orientation: to produce and sell innovative trendy products, maintain the market position of its own brand names on the domestic market and to attain again and expand positions in foreign markets achieved in the past.  Furthermore, to use the most advanced technology in the development of appropriate production and commercial programs which guarantee the top quality of beer, non-alcoholic beverages and mineral and natural water.

The umbrella brand Laško is represented by the following products: the Laško Zlatorog, the special beers Laško Club, Laško Dark, and Laško Light,  the light beer Export Pils and the sweet beverage Laško Malt with apple and peach flavours. In addition to the above brands Pivovarna Laško also produces the Bandidos product line, a beer with added aromas and in three different flavours: Bandidos Tequila, Bandidos Ice and Bandidos Sun. The Bandidos brand image was entirely renewed in spring 2010 to get even closer to its target population.

For special occasions Pivovarna Laško brews unique beers, such as the Jubilejnik and Eliksir beers. Pivovarna Laško entered an entirely new field in 2010, when it launched on the Slovenian market a novelty in the category of beverages, namely the apple cider, under the brand name iC Cider.  

Despite the harsh market conditions Pivovarna Laško, d. d. maintained its position of leading beer producer in Slovenia.

The Pivovarna Laško Group today includes producers of beer, mineral, spring and natural waters, non-alcoholic beverages, spirits and other alcoholic drinks, and syrups for the productions of drinks, and also a newspaper and publishing activity.
name: Pivovarna Laško

description:
A love affair with American style beers, too much home brewing experience and the need to get out of the office and start doing what we love saw Pixel Brewing Co established in May 2013.

Pixel Brewing Co is a little brewing company based in Sydney producing hand crafted beers brewed in seriously small batches using only malt, water, hops & yeast. All Pixel beers are unfiltered, un-pasteurised, bottle conditioned and full of flavour. Pixel Brewing Co is presently brewing under contract at HopDog BeerWorks until a suitable location for our own brewing facility can be found.

The name Pixel Brewing Co was born of time (mis)spent working in the IT industry by founder & brewer Kieran Allen.
name: Pixel Brewing Co

description: Chef Tom and Mamma Mia aren't the only folks that have discovered how great recipes using Mamma Mia Pizza Beer truly can be. Just ask the owners of Michel Angelo's Pizza & Pasta, Ream's Elburn Market, Josefs Elegante Meat and Deli, and the constantly growing list of fine establishments that now or will soon be featuring food products made with Mamma Mia Pizza Beer. Whether it's used in bread, crusts, meats and even fried fish batter, Mamma Mia Pizza Beer truly is expanding the meaning of The World's First Culinary Beer!
name: Pizza Beer Company

description:
Back in March of 1987 Gina and Vince Marsaglia, a pair of siblings in their 20′s, bought a struggling pizza place in the sleepy coastal town of Solana Beach, just north of San Diego. From a funky storefront on the famous Pacific Coast Highway the duo ran the “Pizza Port” with a classic menu of pizza and chicken wings to which they added their own “San Diego” twist.  The Original Pizza Port in Solana Beach

The parking was limited and the building crowded with simple hand-built picnic tables and a hodge-podge décor of surf-related paraphernalia almost at odds with the sophisticated flavors of the food. But word spread quickly and it wasn’t long before Pizza Port was a local favorite. 

Early on Vince took advantage of free space in the restaurant’s storage area to dabble with home brewing. The hobby took off and he was eventually brewing more than could reasonably be consumed at home. So at the urging of friends and fans, the Vince and Gina decided to go into the brewpub business. Pizza Port offered its first craft-brewed beers to patrons in 1992. 

Embracing the same “flavor-driven” principles that had made the pizza menu so popular, Pizza Port quickly gained a reputation in San Diego’s nascent craft beer scene. In 1997 the company opened a second location a few miles north of Solana Beach in Carlsbad, and a third in 2003 in San Clemente. The same year San Clemente opened (as well as the year after), the original location in Solana Beach won Great American Beer Festival “Small Brewpub of the Year”. 

The Pizza Port family’s reputation for great foods and craft beer continued to grow, making them landmarks not just for Southern Californians, but for beer lovers from around the world. In 2008 they opened a premium bottle shop with more that 600 craft beers adjacent to the Carlsbad locations, and by the end of the first decade of the 21st century, the Pizza Ports were a brewing dynasty. In 2009 the Pizza Ports won a staggering 9 medals at the 2009 Great American Beer Festival and Pizza Port Carlsbad was named “Large Brewpub of the Year”.
name: Pizza Port Brewing Company

description:
We believe our calling is to create beer and food with character and depth using the simplest and purest means. 

We strive to use unconventional ingredients, and will proudly state what we put into our beer and food.

We are inspired by those in the brewing community who are pushing the limits of what "beer" is, and can be. 

We wouldn't be here if it weren't for great breweries who came before us, and continue to inspire us.

We hope to do a little inspiring and influencing of our own.
name: Plan 9 Alehouse

description:
Plan 9 Brewing Co is a Las Vegas start up brewery focusing on specialty brews in smaller batches, with a belief that smaller is better. A care and dedication to the craft beer market.

Plan 9 Brewing Co is founded by Brew Master Steve who garnered his love of beer while living in England. The history of beer there was a true draw for Steve who studied the styles of Southern England to see how they differed from the rest of the world, and its that education that influences all of Plan 9 Brewing’s styles. Melding old world beer with the new world mentality.

Plan 9 Brewing Co will be bringing you on tap services to local area bars as well as 22 oz ‘bombers’ to select retailers.
name: Plan 9 Brewing

description:
A 2 Barrel capacity Nanobrewery, Planetary Brewing Company is dedicated to the production of ales of the highest quality.

Our mission is to create for our customers "An Otherworldly Experience," with an ever-changing lineup of supremely crafted ales.
name: Planetary Brewing Company

description: A microbrewery & restaurant located in the heart of historic downtown Springfield on the corner of 4th and Main in the Odd Fellows Building.
name: Plank Town Brewing Company

description:
Cleveland's new brewery project focusing on creating a new platform for aspiring brewers to produce great beers for sale to the public. Through our Platform Brewer's Group Incubator we are preparing accomplished home brewers to "go pro" through our hands on training and business development. 

We also brew high-quality craft beers for sale in our tasting room and throughout Northeast Ohio. Expect a mix of seasonal styles and homebrew inspired experimental beers. You never know what is next.....
name: Platform Beer Co.

description: Platt Park Brewery and Taproom was designed and developed to provide Denver and its surrounding areas with craft Ales and Lagers, with a focus on quality and not quantity. Platt Park Brewing Company is located in the historic Platt Park neighborhood at 1875 S. Pearl Street Denver, CO 80201. The tasting room attached to the production facility is filled with large community tables and board games to spark conversation while you enjoy award winning craft beers.
name: Platt Park Brewing Co.

description: A nice little sportsbar that desperately wants to be a brewpub. Good food and decent beers.
name: Plattsburgh Brewing Company

description: Titusville's only craft beer micro-brewery. Located in historic downtown Titusville in the 100 year old former Hardware Store. Brewmaster Ron Raike.
name: Playalinda Brewing Company

description:
Pleasant House Brewing Company is an independently owned microbrewery focusing on small-batch, true-to-style beers, especially traditional UK styles.

The original Pleasant House is an 1800s cottage that still looks out on the rolling green hills of rural Yorkshire, England. In the 1950s and ’60s, the Jackson family called Pleasant House home. Today, it is the inspiration behind husband and wife team Art and Chelsea Jackson’s Pleasant House restaurants and microbrewery. Our beers pair brilliantly with our award-winning, savory Royal Pies and other British-inspired, locally sourced specialties.

All of our microbrews are crafted on the premises in our historic 1887 building in Three Oaks, Michigan.
name: Pleasant House Brewing Company

description:
In the 17th and 18th centuries, pubs were just as important for social as for practical reasons. People met in pubs to share stories, news, ideas, and company over their pints. Today’s craft brewing industry is increasingly local, providing a chance to renew the community gathering role that pubs played in our past. 

To that end, we are using local talent in every aspect of our business, from spent grain to art to tap handles to logo and t-shirt design; we will also make every effort to promote other local breweries and businesses.

We will focus on producing small batches of technically-great, full-flavored ales that infuse pleasurable twists into classic styles… and sometimes blow style guidelines out of the water. It is also our intention to serve 4-5 categories of beer (I/IPA, Hoppy, Belgian, Malty, and Seasonal taps) but to continually rotate the specific beers served in each category so that we provide a new drinking pleasure on almost every visit.

At Pleasure House Brewing, we thrive on the idea of staying connected to the people who drink our beer!
name: Pleasure House Brewing

description: The brewery identity authentically reflects Nebraska history… homestead ideals of hard work, self-sufficiency, simple pleasures and wholesome refreshment. We are currently in final phases of fund raising.
name: Ploughshare Brewing Co.

description: We are Pocock Brewing Company – a family run craft brewery in Santa Clarita, CA. We start with a passion for quality craft beer, and a desire to share that beer with a thirsty public.
name: Pocock Brewing Company

description: Opened in the fall of 2012, Point Blank Brewing Company is an independently owned restaurant and microbrewery located in the historic downtown area of Corydon, Indiana.
name: Point Blank Brewing Company

description: We are a family-owned microbrewery, specializing in Belgian and other European-style beers.
name: Pokro Brewing Company, Inc.

description:
"Pollyanna" is defined as irrepressibly optimistic. It reflects the idea of finding something to be glad about in every situation.

Opening a production brewery and taproom is a time consuming and calculated process that certainly requires plenty of optimism. We want to share with you our beer, our passion, and the optimistic approach that has led us to this point.

We're excited to build new memories and experiences as well as enrich our local community by always keeping the glass half-full. We're opening soon, so hang tight!
name: Pollyanna Brewing Company

description:
Pontoon Brewing was founded by longtime pals and home brewers who are passionate about developing awesomely scrumptious beer for the Pontoon Lifestyle. Eric and Eddie began their relationship working in the same company in Atlanta, GA. Both shared the passion of home brewing and soon realized that home brewing together on the weekends became something they always looked forward to. Following long discussions about attempting our dreams we decided to share our passion and start Pontoon Brewing Company. The “Pontoon Lifestyle” came to be as the idea of escaping the daily stresses and relaxing on a pontoon boat. For those unaware, a Pontoon boat is commonly known as a slow moving party platform; it can’t go far and can’t go fast so might as well drink.
 
The Pontoon Brew Crew is currently brewing our beers with our friends and the very talented folks at Thomas Creek Brewery in Greenville, South Carolina with hopes of opening our own brewery in Atlanta, GA in the near future. In the collaborative spirit of home brewing and wanting to develop beer for beer drinkers, we would love to hear your thoughts.
name: Pontoon Brewing

description:
Ponysaurus is a new brewery based in Durham, North Carolina, focused on perfecting balanced styles and finding ways to make beers you’ve always imagined.

Yes, our logo is a mix between a mean-looking Tyrannosaurus Rex and a stately-looking Equus Ferus Caballus. What’s better than a pony, and what’s better than a dinosaur? Both. 

We look at beer with a kind of childlike wonder. Beer is alchemy, the holiest magic. And even though we take what we do very seriously, we never want to forget how magical it is. The name constantly reminds us of that.

When you glance at our label, it looks classic and refined. Then you take a second look and you realize it's a horse with tiny T-Rex arms.

We wanted the name to have the same effect as the beer. To make you look—and taste—twice.

Also, it's pretty damn unforgettable.

Oh yeah. That guy up there grinnin' like a shot fox? That's Keil Jansen, our Brewmaster. He's alright.
name: Ponysaurus Brewing

description: Populuxe Brewing is a nano-brewery (1.5bbl) open in the Ballard neighborhood of Seattle.
name: Populuxe Brewing

description: The beer giants of New Jersey’s past have paved the way for our alehouse to revolutionize the current beer scene in Newark. Proudly serving up craft beer straight from the fermenting tank, we are  Newark’s first brewpub, and one of only 12 in the state. At Port 44, the featured line up of home-brewed libations, mouth-watering American bistro cuisine, and our two-story bar, restaurant and brewpub provide a casual and relaxing place to kick back with friends and family.
name: Port 44

description:
There are eight brewing tanks, each with a different beer. The most popular so far have been the Pilsner and Hefeweizen. They also serve the popular English beer, Shandy, which is half Pilsner and half lemonade. They even have a real beer float which is topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. There is an extensive selection of imported and domestic bottled beers.

Their Gourm "A" Pizza crust is made the old traditional way by hand stretching the dough. Dough is made fresh daily. In fact, that was what June was doing in the kitchen when we got there. I had their delicious burger served with regular or sweet potato fries and Dale and Jan shared a pizza. What makes their pizza unique is that it has no sauce. According to June "Sauce can over power the pizza, the true flavor is in the dough and the 100% whole milk Wisconsin cheese. The Gardinara pizza is fresh cut vegetables marinated in oils and spices with a bed of provolone cheese. We made pizza every day for three weeks and found provolone to be the tastiest cheese for the Gardinara pizza.” Pepperoni or sweet Italian sausage can be added as well as a variety of veggies. Mozzarella and cheddar cheese are used on other pizzas.

On the menu they also have hot dogs, chicken wings, and sandwiches including the kid popular grilled cheese sandwich. Fried shrimp and onion rings are battered with their own craft beers.
name: Port Aransas Brewing Co

description: Opened in 2006, Port Brewing (and it's Lost Abbey Brand) continue to produce an extensive line-up of continental and American- inspired ales and lagers. Under the direction of visionary brewmaster and co-founder Tomme Arthur, the brewery has garnered dozens of awards in its seven-year history including the 2007 Great American Beer Festival Small Brewery of the Year, The 2008 world Beer Cup Champion Small Brewery and the 2013 Champion Brewery at the San Diego International Beer Festival. The company’s beers, many of which are aged in oak barrels for 12 months or longer, are universally recognized for their complexity, unique flavors and bold boundary-pushing styles.
name: Port Brewing Company

description:
The historic port city of Alexandria, VA has a proud tradition of brewing beer for the region that dates back to the 19th century. 

Port City Brewing Company is proud to revive, celebrate and continue this rich brewing history in our modern artisanal brewery right outside of our Nation’s Capital.  

We are an award winning brewery,  committed to producing world class quality beers without compromise for the DC and Mid Atlantic market.

Our mission is to be a reliable and innovative regional brewer of top quality beers that are delicious and well balanced, made from the finest ingredients available, and which celebrate their raw materials.
name: Port City Brewing Company

description:
Wisconsin's newest packaging brewery! Located in Wisconsin Dells, WI, 1 mile East of town on Hwy 23. (Hang a right into the Business Park). Craft-brewed beer and gourmet soda-pop! Tap Room Wednesdays through Saturdays so you can check out the Brewery and have a beer or soda pop "as fresh as it gets"!! Opening soon!

Packaging Brewery with a really cool on-site Tap Room. Craft-Brewed Beer & Gourmet Soda. A Relaxing, nice place to visit!
name: Port Huron Brewing Company

description:
Port Jeff Brewing Company is located at 22 Mill Creek Road, within the Chandler Square walking mall. The brewery features a 7 barrel system which is capable of producing 217 gallons (about 86 cases) per brew. Beers are packaged in keg, 22 ounce and special release bottle formats for distribution throughout Long Island, NYC, and West Chester County bars, restaurants, and other retail beer outlets.

The facility opened for production in October of 2011.
name: Port Jefferson Brewing Company

description: The original Port Townsend Brewing Company was one of the largest and longest operating breweries of its time. It was capitalized at $25,000 and established September 5, 1905 by George Watkins, Michael Hartman and N.W. O'Rear. Ernest Studerus, a well-known citizen at the time, served as brewmaster. The site of the old brewery was on the west side of Monroe Street between Water and Washington Street which now houses the Athletic Club.
name: Port Townsend Brewing Company

description: (No longer brewing)
name: Port Washington Brewing

description: Porterhouse is no longer brewing; the brewhouse has left the building. The restaurant is still open! (Seriously, I'm certain of this: brewer's a good friend, and I helped find the brewhouse its new home.)
name: Porterhouse Restaurant and Brewpub

description:
The Brewery: At our brewery, you'll find a peculiar mix of overly obsessive individuals passionately creating something the civilized world simply can't live without: Great Beer. Without their valiant efforts, our world would slip into darkness.

The Beer: We seek to brew the very best craft beer out of Portland. With our unique touches on classic styles and our constant efforts to innovate and lead craft brewing into new, uncharted territories, even the most discerning palates will find something they love. Two year-round offerings, four seasonals and a series of four big-bottle beers will make sure of that.

The City: Considered to be the epicenter of the American craft brewing resurgence, Portland, Oregon is home to more breweries than any other city in America. Portland Brewing was one of the first craft brewers in the city and created Portland’s original Amber Ale. A favorite throughout the years, when Portlander’s say “Gimme a Mac’s” it’s understood they want the crisp, distinct flavor that MacTarnahan’s Amber Ale is known for.
name: Portland Brewing

description:
Portland Cider Company was started in the fall of 2012 by an Oregonian and a family of British expats with the mission of bringing handcrafted cider in the English tradition to the northwest.

We don’t use concentrates, flavorings, colorings, or anything you wouldn’t want in your cider.

We just use the finest Northwest grown fruit. Always gluten free.

Drink it, it’s good!
name: Portland Cider Company

description:
Portner Brewhouse is inspired by South's largest pre-Prohibition brewery - The Robert Portner Brewing Company which was headquartered in Alexandria, VA from 1869 until 1916 when the State of Virginia passed Prohibition. Two of Robert Portner's great-great grandchildren are re-launching the business to share the experience of that era and celebrate the achievement of the American Dream. 

Portner Brewhouse will re-create a few of the Robert Portner Brewing Company's beer, serve classic and contemporary German-American cuisine and provide a unique service for aspiring brewers to test one of their recipes as part of its Craft Beer Test Kitchen program.
name: Portner Brewhouse

description: Portneuf Valley Brewing poured their first beer for public consumption in July of 1996. Owner and Brew Mistress Penny Pink had been brewing fine beers for the enjoyment of her family and friends for many years. After eight years of working at the Idaho National Lab, Penny decided to pursue her interests closer to home. Setting up her first commercial brewery inside Dudley's Sports Bar & Grill, her unique brews soon gathered a loyal following. Recognizing the need for expansion and with a desire to pour her beer from her own taps in a pub atmosphere where people could actually see the process of creating the beer they were enjoying, in March of 1999 Penny purchased the old East Idaho Brewing Company building at 615 S. First Ave in Pocatello.
name: Portneuf Valley Brewing

description: Portside Distillery is a micro-brewery and artisan distillery located Downtown Cleveland. Our location boarders the East Bank of the Flats and the Historic Warehouse District, and overlooks the Port of Cleveland and Lake Erie. We are a producer of small batch artisan spirits and craft beer made from the highest quality ingredients. We use time honored traditional distilling techniques along with modern brewing technology to create offerings for both the beer and spirit enthusiast. We are now distilling white rum and expect it to be in stores towards the end of November. We will start brewing beer in the next few weeks and plan to open a restaurant in May of 2013.
name: Portside Brewery

description:
The Portsmouth Brewery, New Hampshire's first brewpub, was founded in 1991, four years after its sister company, the Northampton Brewery, opened in Western Massachusetts. Peter Egelston, Head Brewer in Northampton from 1987 until 1991, moved to Portsmouth to set up the new brewery here. (Egelston is now the sole proprietor of the Brewery.) 

The brewing system consists of a custom made seven-barrel (210 gallons) JV Northwest brewhouse, two fourteen-barrel and three seven-barrel JV Northwest unitank (cylindroconical) fermenters, two fourteen-barrel horizontal fermenters (added later, in 1994), and twelve seven-barrel grundy cellar tanks. Originally, the Portsmouth Brewery opened with beer recipes from Northampton - Pale Ale, Old Brown Dog, Weizenheimer, Black Cat Stout, Blonde Ale, Golden and Amber Lagers - and these still comprise the core of the Brewery's full-time beers today. However, over the years, successive brewers have contributed many outstanding seasonal and specialty beers to the list.  All of the beers served at the Portsmouth Brewery are brewed right here on premise, with the exception of those beers, such as Shoals Pale Ale and Portsmouth Lager, brewed at Smuttynose Brewing Company, our sister company.
name: Portsmouth Brewery

description: The Portsmouth Brewing Company is Ohio’s oldest operating brewery, built in 1843. The PBC has revived a classic recipe from the 1840′s in Red Bird Ale, a version of the local steam ale. Also kept alive are the fundamental German style lagers brewed here after the civil war in Portsmouth Pilsner and Crystal Gold Lager.
name: Portsmouth Brewing Co

description: Postdoc Brewing Company's mission is inspired by a love of great beer, scientific endeavor, and the pursuit of a liquid dream.​
name: Postdoc Brewing Company

description:
Founded in 1852 by Gabriel Hail and John Albrecht, the Potosi Brewery began as a small brewery quenching the thirsts of area farmers, fishermen and miners. In 1886 Adam Schumacher bought the brewery and started brewing beer. In 1906, the Potosi Brewing Company was founded by Adam and his brothers Nicholas and Henry. At its peak, the Potosi Brewery had grown to be the fifth largest in Wisconsin, shipping a variety of labels including Good Old Potosi, Holiday, Garten Brau, Augsburger and others to destinations throughout the United States. In 1972 the brewery ceased operations and closed its doors.

The restoration of the Potosi Brewery began in 1995 when Gary David bought the ruined Potosi Brewery Bottling buildings. This nearly one square block of buildings had just suffered a major fire and most of the buildings were a total loss. After working three years to rebuild parts of what had been destroyed, Gary then turned his attention to the Brewery itself. Being awarded the high bid at the county auction he then enlisted the help of his friend Rick Tobin and cousin Denis David. It was the marketing genius of Denis and his wife Madonna in 1999 that brought the public on board through a community meeting. This meeting was overwhelmingly attended by the public and brought forth numerous suggestions as well as additional support. It was this gathering of the public that led to the formation of the Potosi Brewery Foundation in February of 2000.

In 2004, with restoration underway, the Potosi Brewery Foundation was selected by the American Breweriana Association to be the home to its national museum. According to Len Chylack, president of the American Breweriana Association, Potosi was selected over cities such as Milwaukee and St. Louis because of their passion for beer, brewery history and beer-making culture.
name: Potosi Brewing Company

description: Potter's Craft Cider is a revival of authentic American farmhouse cider. It is made using nothing but high-quality traditional cider apples, including Virginia Winesap and Albemarle Pippin. Our apples are grown locally in family-run orchards from the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Potter's Craft Cider is currently sold in bottles and on draft in Charlottesville, VA and surrounding areas. Email us at info@potterscraftcider.com or call 850-528-6314  to schedule a visit.
name: Potter's Craft Cider

description: Production brewery with tasting room and growler fills.
name: Powder Hollow Brewery

description: Powder Keg Brewing Company is dedicated to creating a community gathering place rich with conversation, laughter, friends and family. We are proud to share our seasonal, hand-crafted ales and lagers. We strive to spark community through beer.
name: Powder Keg Brewing

description: We make unique beer for the discerning drinker. We're not afraid of bold and adventurous flavors. Coming soon to Boise area.
name: Powderhaus Brewing

description: Powell Street Craft Brewery is a nano-brewery focused on producing high quality full flavoured handcrafted beers using all natural, and preferably, local ingredients. The brewery is located at 1830 Powell Street just west of Victoria Drive in an area that is quickly becoming Vancouver's "Brewery District".
name: Powell Street Craft Brewery

description:
The Power Club is a restaurant and microbrewery located in the heart of historic downtown, Auburn California. This is God's country. It is beautiful, scenic and filled with fun things to do. This town was built from a gold mining fortune and has been preserved in time through the diligent work of many historians. My beautiful wife Peggy and I settled in Auburn 10 years ago. Our son Adam Alexander Lee was born here.

At the Power Club we produce over 100 different varietals of handcrafted microbrews. The beer is crafted right here on premises and served fresh on tap. We believe that beer is one of the greatest gifts ever. It is a medium for custom personalization! As a master brewer, I make everything from Hefeweizens to IPA's. In total 110 different craft beers. Come taste my beer!
name: Power Club Brewery

description:
Power House Brewing Co. located in Columbus, Indiana, is a craft brewery with state wide distribution of its craft beer, made in our Columbus brewing facility.

We feature several beers in our Columbus Restaurant, The Columbus Bar, that are not available outside of the restaurant.
name: Power House Brewing Company

description:
Prairie Artisan Ales was founded by Chase and Colin Healey. Our thoughts and ideas on art and beer are expressed thru Prairie's saisons and barrel aged beers.
Our goal is to create beers that go beyond the middle of the country to reach people around the world.
name: Prairie Artisan Ales

description: Prairie Fire Brewing Company is collaboration of 7 local investors hailing from 7 different states sharing a common interest. Good Beer. We currently have 12 of our own beers on tap! We serve great tasting food! Stop in and try us for lunch!
name: Prairie Fire Brewing Company

description: Oliver Breweries was established in 1993, the brewing equipment being imported from the U.K., with the aim of creating authentic English Ales. Our hand crafted ales are brewed with imported malt and hops using a traditional single infusion mash technique and open fermentation with English Ringwood Ale Yeast.
name: Pratt Street Ale House

description:
PBC is well-established and highly successful, with a history of annual growth since inception. We foster a team oriented management style. We offer an excellent casual, yet professional, dining experience for our guests, never pretentious, emphasizing "fun & friendly... brewpub style" menu selections and service. We are high-volume, fast paced and right in the middle of all the action for the dozens of events that take place right outside our doorstep on Prescott's hometown Courthouse Plaza. We are community minded and involved in many local events and fundraisers. Our kitchen is a 99% scratch kitchen, providing a large & varied menu. Our bar is lively and we attract people of all ages and backgrounds. We are hands-on owners and look for managers with the same philosophy.

We’re also pleased to announce that Prescott Brewing Company, the MICROBREWERY, is now an extension of our brewery operations!  With the introduction of PBC’s Liquid Amber Ale and Ponderosa IPA in cans, we quickly outgrew our little 7-barrel brewhouse that’s been our workhorse since opening in 1994.  So we bit the bullet and built an off-site microbrewery production plant out by the Prescott airport in 2011.  The first 30-barrel batch of Liquid Amber was brewed by John and Lead Brewer, Jan, on December 27th, 2011 and was a true better- late- than- never Christmas gift!  Look for both brands increasingly available throughout Arizona.  And thus the story continues.  

PBC celebrated its 20TH ANNIVERSARY downtown Prescott in March of 2014….thanks to our many loyal supporters, locals and visitors alike. 20 years of hard labor...nah, not that bad, but 20 years in the restaurant business is a LONG time!  So, we’ll just keep on keepin’ on and are excited to expand the selection of canned product for distribution as production allows out at the airport location.

YOU are included amongst those who've allowed us to thrive, contribute to our community and keep 65-75 employees on staff all year long! As everyone knows, these have been difficult times for many. We believe every one of us knows personally of someone who has struggled these past few years with job loss, or a small business owner who has had to lay off a good employee, or maybe has had to close their business. Luckily, PBC is okay, thanks to YOU. Not to say we wouldn’t want more of the dining dollars out there...but we’re extremely grateful for the continued support of those in our community and visitors from literally all over the world. We’d like to remind everyone that each of us can make a difference in our communities by shopping local, supporting locally-owned, independent businesses, supporting our local charities and non-profits and volunteering for our favorite causes. Prescott is an amazing community...let’s keep it that way! THANKS A BUNCH!

John and Roxane Nielsen
name: Prescott Brewing Company

description:
We are a gypsy brewery, without a permanent brewing home. We like it that way, we can be whatever we want to be on a shoestring budget. What more do you want than that?

Our flagship beer is Jack D'Or. Jack is the mournful grain of barley you can see to the right. He is the soul of beer, nature's magician, creating sugar from starch and bringing together the Pretty Things to produce the substance we adore: beer.
name: Pretty Things Beer & Ale Project

description: A microbrewery born and raised in Greensboro, NC.
name: Preyer Brewing Company

description:
After many years of research (and many samples of beer) the decision was made by Janine Rose to build a craft brewery on site at Otway Estate.  Although a winery, Otway Estate has embraced beer and brewing as much as the love of fine wine.

Blessed with the availability of pure Otway rainwater, we brew all of our beers with this 'gift from the gods'.  It is well known that you need good water to make good beer and there's nothing better than water from the lush rainforest.
The brewery was commissioned in February 2007 with the release of the first two beers took place in March 2007.

At Prickly Moses Handcrafted Beer, we believe that beer is diverse in its colour, aroma and flavour and is not just limited to "yellow fizzy stuff".
We create beers to match an appearance, aroma and flavour profile - not a budget - so we use the best possible ingredients we can find.  Our repetoire of exciting beer recipes continuously grows and we're always keen to try something new.

We also believe that food is an important part of the craft beer experience and we're always trying to pair good food with our great beer.
We hope you enjoy our beer as much as we enjoy brewing it for you.
name: Prickly Moses Handcrafted Beer

description: We don't want to make the most beer. we want to make the best beer!!! pri-mal: very basic and powerful
name: Primal Brewery

description:
We are a family owned and run microbrewery. We simply love beer!! Always have, and always will. Our goal is to brew the best beer possible, using only natural ingredients and respecting the traditional art of brewing.
The beginning… Throughout our trips to Europe as a family, we have visited numerous Micros and specialized brewpubs and enjoyed amazing beer. When Cyprus joined the European Union in 2004 we were happy to see that many of the foreign beers we loved so much started being imported to the island!! Finally more quality and tasty beer options would be introduced to Cyprus.
Unfortunately as we soon found out something was terribly wrong…The beer we tasted and loved throughout Europe just didn’t taste the same…
Long sea transportation and storage time in hot conditions stripped a huge amount of the taste and character of the beer we longed to see in Cyprus.
Then we realized that it was up to us to get the job done. The year was 2008, we decided that we would not tolerate living in a beer desert any more. Prime Microbrewery was conceived.
After going to Hell and back we managed to open our brewery and share our passion for quality beer with the rest of our island. It was a long and hard voyage…
name: Prime Microbrewery

description: Prism Beer Company was started in 2009 by Rob DeMaria, a Philadelphia native who found artistic expression in making beer. Having studied film in his early college years, he always had an eye for seeing things differently. In fact, that creative thinking enabled his career in technology, but his artistic expression was still missing. So one day he decided to try his hand in making his own beer. Of course, he couldn't allow himself to follow the recipe
name: Prism Brewing Company

description: Prison Brews is a unique brewpub located in the historic east side of Jefferson City two blocks from the old Missouri State Penitentiary. Our nostalgic, relaxed environment soothes your mind while enticing your senses with a diverse food menu and large selection of handcrafted ales. The large outdoor patio and bocce courts provide a great way to enjoy a beautiful Missouri day. Break out of the ordinary and escape to Prison Brews!
name: Prison Brews

description: Prison City Pub & Brewery is a brewpub that serves pub food inspired by our travels, as well as craft beer made on premise meant to compliment our menu.  It 's a downtown gathering place for people who enjoy locally made beer and food.
name: Prison City Pub & Brewery

description: Now serving delicious food and amazing beer handcrafted on Main Street in Historic Downtown Yuma.
name: Prison Hill Brewing Co.
Privatbrauerei A. Rolinck GmbH & Co. KG

description:
At the world's largest wheat beer brewery, tradition and progress go hand in hand: our beer is brewed according to traditional recipes, but using state-of-the-art technology. Today, beer connoisseurs in Germany and around the world regard our traditional specialty beers from Erding, Bavaria, as the ultimate in wheat beer enjoyment.

The beginnings of Erdinger Weissbräu date back to 1886, the year in which construction of a wheat beer brewery in Erding was first officially recorded. After several changes in ownership, the General Manager at the time, Franz Brombach, bought the brewery in 1935 and re-named it Erdinger Weissbräu on December 27, 1949.

In 1965, the son of Franz Brombach, Werner Brombach, entered the business. He took over the private brewery in 1975 and still leads his father's successful business today. In addition to a strong emphasis on quality, Werner Brombach focuses above all on a targeted sales and promotion strategy with a clear brand identity, which highlights the values of the old Bavarian beer specialty and its superior quality standards.

Today, Erdinger weissbier stands for wheat beer enjoyment and the Bavarian brewing tradition. The traditional brewery has established itself as the national and international market leader for weissbier. As one of Germany's largest private breweries, Erdinger Weissbräu is among the leaders on the national German beer market.
name: Privatbrauerei Erdinger Weissbräu
Privatbrauerei Jacob Stauder GmbH & Co. KG

description:
Since 1878 the family-owned brewery has been producing regional beer specialities. Nine beer brands combine traditional brewing craft with modern trends. Exclusively 0.5 litre bottles with swing top caps are used for the bottling of all beers from "Privatbrauerei Moritz Fiege".

Regardless whether a beer is mild or dry, smooth or aromatic: The indicator of a good beer is its character. Its typical flavour makes it distinctive and tells it from other beers. In the manufacturing process "Privatbrauerei MORITZ FIEGE" cultivates the character of its beers.

The brands "MORITZ FIEGE Pils" and "MORITZ FIEGE Frei" are known for their announced hop aroma.
name: Privatbrauerei Moritz Fiege GmbH & Co. KG

description:
Pro Re Nata (Latin, “as needed") is doctors’ orders for treating what ails us. Enjoy P.R.N. Farm Brewery’s hand-crafted ales and lagers, one of the world’s oldest elixirs — “as needed.” Doctors’ orders!

The former Moose Lodge building has been under construction since January of 2015. Our doors are finally open to the public, and we are now offering 2 of our flagship PRN beers.
name: Pro Re Nata Farm Brewery

description:
Old World Brewing Traditions for a Modern World. 

Hoppy Ales and complex saisons are our passion. 

Beer+Love=Prodigy
name: Prodigy Brewing Company

description: We are a full restaurant and brewery! We brew on sight and have other local brewery's on tap.
name: Prohibition Brewing Company

description:
Located in Waterbury, the food and beverage crossroads, we feature New England’s largest and best curated selection of craft beer, proper cocktails, eclectic wines with a full menu featuring barbecue, vegetarian and cozy American fare.

Here at Prohibition Pig, we are a locally owned restaurant dedicated to bringing you the freshest, highest quality food possible. We make everything in house, fresh every day and use locally raised, all-natural meats, sustainably caught seafood and local produce when in season. We compost all biomass and recycle everything possible and are proud members of the Vermont Fresh Network.

We do not take reservations. Our dining room is hosted on a first come, first served basis. The bar and high tops are survival of the fittest.

Cheers!
name: Prohibition Pig

description:
Proof opened its Tennessee Street location in 2007- it currently houses our Retail Store, Modern American Pub, Pilot Brewery, Brew Lab and Tasting Rooms. Our Pilot Brewery is cranking out experimental & unique styles weekly that are only available on site and our tap list is ever changing.

Proof Brewing Co. is where you can enjoy two tasting rooms featuring 50 taps of the best Craft Brews available, over 200 Top Rated beers in the bottle and growlers of all 50 taps are available to go. PBC features an immense selection of Premium Liquor, Small Batch Bourbon, Vintage Whiskeys and Handcrafted Cocktails .

Our retail store, Proof Bottle Shop, has the largest selection of Craft, Import Beer and Mead in North Florida as well as handpicked Specialty Liquors & Boutique Wines.
name: Proof Brewing Co

description: Propeller Brewing Company is Nova Scotia’s best selling microbrewery. Our International award winning, all-natural, British-style ales and lagers are available at liquor stores, fine bars and restaurants throughout Nova Scotia. Ask for an Extra Special Bitter or an India Pale Ale, the Province's two best selling micro brewed beers, or drop by the downtown brewery and retail store to sample brewery fresh craft ales.
name: Propeller Brewery

description: Herbal Ales inspired by old world tradition and new world ingenuity
name: Propolis Brewing

description: Props Brewery & Grill is the location where great people come to meet, eat, and drink our amazing hand crafted beer. Bring the entire family or just come and hang out with friends to watch our brewer in action or catch the game. We are the center of all things sports and craft beer in Fort Walton Beach. So, come out to watch as we craft these amazing beers and most importantly relax, kickback, and enjoy a craft beer in our pub or outside in our beer garden.
name: Props Craft Brewery

description: Founded in 2007, Prospect Brewery is now one of the North West's leading independent real ale brewers. We are based in Standish near Wigan, a town with a strong mining history, and the brewery and the names of our beers are closely linked with the towns heritage and culture.
name: Prospect Brewery

description:
The Brewery was made by the Ziemann GmbH in 1963. It was installed at the Bucher Bräu in the German city of Grafenau and used there until 1984. In 1984 it was overhauled and sold to Brauerei Hümmer of Breitengüßbach, Germany, a village in the Franconian region of Bavaria.

Brauerei Hümmer started brewing beer in the Franconian village of Breitengüßbach in 1642. The brewery served the town for over 350 years until the spring of 2011. It made several styles including Altfränkisches Dunkel Bier, a rare specialty beer that we will revive in Denver.
name: Prost Brewing Company

description:
Pryes Brewing Company (pronounced "Prize") was founded in 2012 by Jeremy Pryes, a home brewer who spent years perfecting his recipes before launching his first beer to the public. Jeremy’s passion for brewing came from his love of building things from scratch, his culinary arts background and his first hand experiences with the local brewing scene, first as an official beer judge and then as a board member for the local Community Hops Garden. Driven by the process of creating and understanding how things are built, Jeremy’s

time working in the technology industry also helped him create a meticulous brewing methodology, tracking, measuring and honing his recipes.

Pryes Brewing Company is committed to creating balanced, stand alone beers. Each style grounded in it's history, but inspired through an exploration of techniques and ingredients.
name: Pryes Brewing Company

description:
Pub Dog Pizza & Drafthouse opened in 2001 on Cross St. in the historic neighborhood of Federal Hill in Baltimore.  It immediately became a hit with neighborhood residents, suburbanites, and tourists alike.

Pub Dog quickly became famous for our gourmet personal-sized thin-crust pizzas, fresh salads, and "Dog Deal" beers - 2 mugs of our own house craft beer for one low price all the time.  

We developed a loyal late night following by serving food every night until 1:30 and staying open until 2:00AM every night.

Pub Dog expanded outside of the city in 2007, opening a location in Columbia.

Pub Dog began bottling some of our house beers for sale to go in 2007.  The bottles are now available at both pubs and in liquor stores around the state.
name: Pub Dog Pizza & Drafthouse

description: A 2bbl craft brewery with a rotating selection of beer, soda, and kombucha.
name: Public Brewhouse

description:
In 2010, Josh & Beth Stacy and Josh & Trisha Goodridge--longtime
friends--opened Public House Brewing Company in Rolla, MO, the town's first brewpub.  But it was a long, long time in the works.  Like any business, there were big ups and downs on the road to the first pour and we think that story is worth sharing.  So here goes....
 
Josh Stacy grew up like any other kid in America, playing music, sports, and sharing his space with two siblings.  Totally normal--with one exception.  His father, Steven Stacy, was an award-winning home brewer.  Steve was brewing world class beers in his kitchen before most people had even heard of the hobby.
Josh grew up thinking every kid helped their dad bottle homemade beer on Saturday mornings before they could watch cartoons.   
Fast-forward a few years.  Stacy and Goodridge meet in junior high, become fast friends, and begin playing music together (and have been ever since).  Even more years went by.  Between the two there were graduations, marriages, children, careers, and beer.  Yes, beer.  At some point (memories are fuzzy) Stacy introduced Goodridge to drinking real, full-flavored craft beers.  It wasn't long before he introduced Goodridge to brewing real, full-flavored craft beers.  Goodridge was hooked.  

Many weekends were spent in the Stacy home garage milling grain, mashing in, adding hops, and pitching yeast.  The two took in as much of Steve Stacy's brewing knowledge as possible, brewing good beer and having a couple pints throughout the brew day.  That always loosened the tongue.  Next would inevitably come the conversation about taking this hobby to the next level.  

Goodridge heard this conversation more times than he can remember.  On a Sunday afternoon while leisurely enjoying a fine craft beer at home with his wife Trisha, he got a wild idea.  Enough was enough, he told her.  He immediately called Stacy and said, "I'm coming over to your house."  Goodridge passionately pleaded his case to Josh and Beth.  "Rolla needs fresh craft beer and we're the guys for the job." 

Josh Stacy wasn't a hard sell as he had always truly wanted to do this, but now they needed help from their wives to make this dream happen.  Thankfully, these wonderful ladies agreed to take the plunge and the four embarked on the treacherous journey together to bring fresh craft beer to Rolla.  Many trials and triumphs later, Public House Brewing Company opened its doors on December 16th, 2010, to a very thirsty populous. 

One week later, all the beer they had made was gone.  It was
a hit!  The Rolla area embraced its first and only craft brewpub and put Public House on the map.  Now the Stacys and Goodridges are fulfilling their dream of bringing hand-crafted beers of the highest quality to Mid-Missouri.  You are invited to come in and have a pint with us.  Cheers!
 
Now that you know our story, we encourage you to come in and share yours. No matter what the occasion, visiting The Public House Brewery is always an extraordinary experience.  
 
The team at Public House looks forward to welcoming you!
name: Public House Brewing Co

description: WA is brewed in Baltimore.
name: Public Works Ale

description: Microbrewery coming to downtown Tucson in Spring of 2014. Follow us for updates as we journey to opening day!
name: Pueblo Vida Brewing Company

description: Located in Dillon, Colorado Pug Ryan's has been one of Summit County's best steakhouse and craft breweries since 1975. Come try our award winning brews with a great steak, prime rib or fresh seafood.
name: Pug Ryan's Steakhouse and Brewery

description:
Pure Order Brewing Company produces it's beer in the spirit of the ancient German "Reiheitsgebot" which required that only four ingredients (hops, malt, yeast and water) could be used in beer production. 

Combining this tradition with the Santa Barbara lifestyle has made for a truly unique and satisfying beer that has the flavors of the richest German styles but with the relaxed drinkability that Santa Barbara inspires. 

Pure Beer. Pure Local. Pure Order.
name: Pure Order Brewing Co.

description: One of the fastest growing craft breweries in the UK, producing three award-winning beers.
name: Purity Brewing Co

description: Based in the Pacific Northwest, Pyramid Breweries began as Hart Brewing in 1984 and launched the flagship brand of Pyramid Ales.  In 1996, the company was reborn as Pyramid Breweries and currently offers craft beers produced under the Pyramid family of ales and lagers.  With breweries in Seattle, WA, Portland, OR, and Berkeley, CA, Pyramid also owns Alehouses at all three locations and an additional Alehouse in Walnut Creek, CA.
name: Pyramid Breweries

description: Quaff Bros. is the gypsy beer label owned and operated by the Party Source in Bellevue, Ky. It allows local breweries to showcase their talent through barrel aging projects.
name: Quaff Bros

description:
Quaff: To drink heartily and with gusto!

At Quaff ON! Brewing Company, 'Gusto' is part of everything we do. Our hand-crafted beers reflect our passion for the brewer's art and our commitment to creating beers that excite and delight the quaffer's palette.
Quaff ON! Brewing Company was formed in 2012 in response to the demand for the iconic craft beers we developed at Big Woods Brewing Company, our brewpub located in the heart of Brown County Indiana. Why 'Quaff ON!'? Because from the day Big Woods threw open its doors in 2009, Quaff ON! has been the rallying cry, the toast, and the salutation of our loyal fans.
When Big Woods founders Jeff McCabe, Tim O'Bryan and Ed Ryan decided to create Quaff ON! Brewing Company, they had one Master Brewer in mind to take Busted Knuckle Ale, Hare Trigger IPA, Six Foot Blonde and Timid Virgin Pale to new heights and a larger market. That Brewer is Mark Havens, whose reputation as a talented and committed 'creator of craft beers' is well known. Mark came on board in time to lend a hand in the conversion of our 60 year old bowling alley into the Quaff ON! brewing facility.
Once Mark got the new brewery up and running and our original Big Woods recipes were in production, Mark began introducing new beers, including Yellow Dwarf Wheat, a hopped up wheat that begs to be quaffed and Sadie the Goat Brown Ale, a hearty homage to the substantial beers quaffed by river pirates 2 centuries ago.
Currently Quaff ON!'s beers are distributed all over Indiana. Look for us at your favorite watering hole and in the craft beer section at package stores throughout the state. If Quaff ON! is not served at your favorite place, send us a note and we'll get it in there! If you're travelling our way, stop in and see us in Brown County and visit us in Nashville at Big Woods Village where you can enjoy fine craft beer, great food and the best in local entertainment.

"Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." - William Shakespeare
name: Quaff On! Brewing Company

description:
Quarry Brewing, L.L.C., located in historic uptown Butte, Montana, has brought handcrafted beer back to the mining city after a 40-year absence.

Chuck and Lyza Schnabel opened the Quarry on September 29, 2007. It has since garnered rave reviews from everyone who has tasted any one of the traditional-style ales produced on site.

Chuck, our Brewer, continues to brew rich, flavorful beers with only the finest ingredients available: choice hops, barley, yeast and filtered water. One taste will tell you: We Dig Beer!
name: Quarry Brewing

description: The Quay St. Brewing Company is located on the banks of the Black River in beautiful downtown Port Huron. A unique restaurant, bar and brewery, Quay St. provides a family, friendly, casual dining experience. We offer featured half-sandwich lunch specials as well as exquisite and affordable dinner entrees. And delicious micro-brewed beer is always fresh, cold and on tap! Stop in TODAY!
name: Quay Street Brewing Company

description: 15 barrel brew operation.
name: Queen City Brewery

description: A great little brewery with 10 beers on tap to fill your growler with or you can even brew your own.
name: Queen City Brewing

description:
It is difficult to argue with the more than 2.2 million reasons why our borough of Queens deserves a great brewery.

Collectively, we are a global phenomenon of old and new world beer drinkers from the first settlements of Maspeth, Flushing & Jamaica. We are small business owners hailing the streets of Jackson Heights, Long Island City & Astoria pursuing the Queensmerican dream. We are die-hard Mets fans, not fully understanding the meaning of 7th-inning-stretch, huddled together at the Cuckoo's Nest for 10 innings of Game 6. We are fearless graffiti artists leaving marks of immortality and demarcation at 5Pointz & PS1. We are the roar of the crowd smashing pint glasses from Arthur Ashe as Sampras serves us five heart-stopping U.S. Open Titles. We are more than 72 million passengers of JFK & La Guardia swapping stories of 16oz conquests with perfect strangers. We are Whitestone's New York Times bringing you the American iconic Sunday crossword as you sip your favorite hops over morning brunch. We are the world within a borough, and we celebrate it distinctively.

We are Queens Brewery, The Melting Barrel.
name: Queens Brewery

description:
Quest Brewing Company officially started becoming a reality in January 2012.  That is when Don Richardson and Andrew Watts met for the first time; each with thoughts of opening up a microbrewery in Greenville, SC.  Both had put together plans for their company vision and, as luck would have it, those plans mirrored each other!  The two joined forces and Quest Brewing Company was founded.

Once the business was formed, a brewery name was needed.  After weeks of brainstorming, the name ‘Quest’ rose to the top of our list.  We wanted a name that emulates that passionate and adventurous spirit of the Greenville community.

”People in Greenville are always on some kind of quest.  Whether it is to bike the entire Swamp Rabbit Trail or hike Table Rock, there is a very adventurous spirit here.  We wanted to embrace that.” -Quest’s Andrew Watts

Quest’s beer is meant to be premium and sought-after, much like a goal or quest.  The next time you are in Greenville, make it your quest to visit all our town has to offer.  Head to Falls Park.  Enjoy Main Street.  Most importantly, enjoy one of Quest’s hand-crafted beers!
name: Quest Brewing Company

description: Former brewer at Liberty Brewpub in Myrtle Beach is the owner/brewer at this new brewpub in the middle of golf country.
name: Quigleys

description: R&B Brewing Co. has always been, and will always be, just about as independent of a microbrewery as you’ll come across. Founded in 1997 by longtime friends and co-workers Rick Dellow and Barry Benson (the ‘R’ & ‘B’, respectively), R&B Brewing Co. was set up to stand in opposition to what the beer world had become – big, non-descript, faceless, and corporate. Combining over 60 years of brewing experience with some of the big guys, Rick and Barry sought to create deliciously hand crafted ales and lagers that would bear no resemblance to the world of big beer. Full-bodied and distinctly rich beer, using only the choicest malts, hops and yeast, would be the focus of the product, while the co-owners personalities would blend to create the marketing milieu – edgy, young, independent…definitely East Van.
name: R&B Brewing Company
R.S. Taylor & Sons Brewery and Tap Room

description:
R.Shea brewing offers a unique microbrewery and taproom experience. During opening hours we actually do the brewing, filtering and kegging in front of your eyes behind the bar. If you want to catch a local game, we have a side-room for watching your favorite local sports. There are many other areas to just relax, play chess or any of your favorite board games. 

We also serve some basic food like brats, nachos and pulled-pork sliders.

You can pick up 22oz bottles and growlers to-go.
name: R.Shea Brewering

description: Rabbit Hole Brewing is a craft brewery located in Justin, Texas which strives to create and maintain local, regional, and statewide brand recognition and loyalty with an inspired beer portfolio. Our focus is on producing high quality product which includes market under-represented beer styles, and new and unique interpretations of regional favorites. We insist on the same high quality of service and delivery of our product as we maintain during its production.
name: Rabbit Hole Brewing

description:
Rabbit’s Foot Meadery produces award winning mead - honey wine, hard ciders and our famous braggot. Our recipes and methods have been perfected over a period of more than fifteen years and combine the latest in fermentation technology with historical recipes to create unique mead - honey wine in a style that is like no other. All of our mead, ciders, dessert mead and braggots-honey ales, are produced using the finest honey available without the addition of added sulfites.

Our braggots are styled after many traditional ales but with a major twist - there is lots of honey added during fermentation. Sometimes up to 50% of the fermentable sugar. In many cases while they are modeled after more traditional styles, they are unique and stand on their own. Typically lower in hop aroma and bitterness to allow the honey to shine they are still quite enjoyable.
name: Rabbit's Foot Meadery

description: The Raccoon Lodge & Brew Pub is a family friendly restaurant and brew pub that offers comfort food alongside upscale pub fare. The building is also home to Cascade Brewing, which is praised for its Northwest sour style beers.
name: Raccoon Lodge & Brewpub

description: We love beer! So much to the extent that we decided to make our own. With over 50 years of drinking experience between us we believe that our ales and lagers have benefited from our longevity and knowledge. Feel free to contact us at anytime to learn more about us and our hand crafted suds. If'n you hadn't had a Race Street Brew before we wouldn't be suprised. We would be suprised though if you had one and didn't like it. Browse our site and learn about the different beers we have to offer and what we're getting into.
name: Race Street Brew Works

description: Radiant Pig Craft Beers began as a pipe dream for a couple of homebrewers in a small Manhattan apartment. After years of perfecting recipes, countless hours of researching (drinking beer) and a ton of trips to Brooklyn fetching ingredients, we finally got our very own brewing business off the ground. In February 2013, we brewed our first commerical batch of our flagship beer, Junior.
name: Radiant Pig Beer Company

description: Radius Brewing Company is a brewpub located in beautiful downtown Emporia, KS. In addition to our line of craft ales, brewed right in the middle of the dining room, we also offer a full food menu. The food, which is made from scratch in our open kitchen, includes: brick oven pizza, artisan soups, salads, and sandwiches, as well as a rotating Chef's menu in the evenings. Radius is open for business Wednesday-Monday, 11am-11pm, with the kitchen closing at 10pm.
name: Radius Brewing Company

description:
The story of Rahr & Sons Brewing Co. really starts when Fritz Rahr graduated from Texas Christian University. Fortunately for beer lovers in North Texas, Fritz not only fell in love with Fort Worth, but also fell in love with his future wife here. And in another fortuitous twist for all of us, Fritz’s wife, Erin, gave him the thumbs up when he announced that he would like to carry on the Rahr family tradition of brewing.

Fritz and Erin founded Rahr & Sons Brewing Co. in the fall of 2004. In five years, the brewery has more than doubled its brewing capacity - from 2,000 barrels per year to over 5,000 barrels per year and has won fifteen nationally-recognized awards, including a Bronze Medal at the 2008 World Beer Cup for Bucking Bock and 2009 National Grand Champion from the United States Beer Tasting Championships for Iron Thistle.
name: Rahr & Sons Brewing Company

description:
Raihouse Brewery was officially founded Dec 1, 2010, in the historic town of Aberdeen, North Carolina. Started by military veterans Brian Evitts (U.S. Navy), and Mike Ratkowski (U.S. Army). They met as managers of the same company and were drawn together by the same home brewing passion to make excellent beers. Brian has been an avid home brewer for almost 15 years, while Mike has always enjoyed the culture of breweries. They both felt there was a lack of their style of beer--beer focused on the malted barley and not so focused on the hops.

Railhouse Brewery currently offers seasonal and year-round beers, including the following: Mastiff Oatmeal Stout, KA-BAR Brown Ale, FCA IPA, Vanilla Porter, Barleywine, and Pale Ale. The brewery and pub is located at 105 East South Street, Aberdeen, NC.
name: Railhouse Brewery

description:
We are an artisan nanobrewery offering a selection of fine ales, each handcrafted in a small batch. Our products will rotate pretty heavily, but we will always have at least 3-4 beers available, and something for most tastes.

Upon our opening we will be only the second brewery in Blair County and the FIRST brewery in the City of Altoona since the 1970s.

Our beers will be available at finer establishments in the area and directly from our tasting room where you can sample beers, and purchase growler fills and merchandise. We will begin offering some bottled products in the fall of 2013.
name: Railroad City Brewing Company

description: Railway City Brewing Company is a small micro brewery located in the heart of downtown St.Thomas. We brew many different styles of beer including our Dead Elephant Ale, Iron Spike and monthly Seasonal offerings.
name: Railway City Brewing Company

description: Brewpub in Montgomery, AL
name: Railyard Brewing Co.

description:
Brewing quality beers with quality ingredients. While our tasting room is temporarily closed, you can find us in many fine establishments throughout the Puget Sound area. Watch for new locations being added!

Brewing on a 1.5 bbl system, selling kegs, growler fills, and hopefully bottling soon to follow! Silver Medal winner in the 2013 Washington Beer Awards for Belgian Bastard.
name: Rainy Daze Brewing

description:
Raleigh Brewing Company will house a 20 bbl brew system to produce 6 year-round beers, 2 seasonal beers, and various experimental beers. All of our beers will be available in our taproom, which is located at the brewery. The taproom will have dartboards, a comfy lounge, and a few TVs for those days when the game is on. 

Our beer will also be available to the public. Ask for it at your local watering hole! 

At Raleigh Brewing Company we intend to be a big part of the local Raleigh community. We plan to do that by staying as green as possible by reclaiming our water used to brew with, recycling, and conserving energy, donating money/beer/time to local charities, and opening up our space for local groups/organizations/events as much as possible. If there's anything you'd like to see us do, just shoot us an email! 

We look forward to opening our doors and serving you some hand-crafted beers, which will hopefully be at the very beginning of 2013! 

Cheers!
name: Raleigh Brewing Company

description:
The Ram is a private, independent, family-owned and operated restaurant business. We were born on February 26, 1971 when our founders took their entrepreneurial spirit and experiences they received making pizza and serving beer at Shakey’s Pizza Parlor to open their own restaurant. That first restaurant was called the Ram Pub, which was a “Deluxe Tavern” that served hot food, including cook-your-own burgers and steaks, along with beer and wine.


Since 1971, the Ram’s primary commitment has been to always provide our guests with superior quality food and gracious hospitality. Although Big Horn Brewing Company is now one of the largest brewpub companies in the country, the goal of our brewers continues to be to produce the freshest, most “drinkable” beer of the highest quality.
name: RAM Restaurant & Brewery

description:
Ramapo Valley Brewery New York was established in Hillburn New York in 2000. The company was the result of a small micro brewery that first started brewing in 1997.

Their unique brewing process and Recipes, along with the use of the valley spring waters, resulted in award winning beers. Over the next three years , the demand for their beers grew at such an astounding rate that the founders, decided to make the transition to a formal brewery, and Ramapo Valley Brewery was born.

RVB is the only Kosher certified brewery in the United States , and certified to produce Kosher for Passover beer.
name: Ramapo Valley Brewery

description:
Ramblin' Road is a small family-owned brewery located in beautiful Spokane, WA. We brew funky Belgian and hoppy NW style ales. Our 10 BBL direct-fire brewhouse allows us to produce just enough beer to satisfy thirsty patrons in our taproom and select local establishments. Our small batch ales often find their way into used wine and spirits barrels for additional aging and second fermentations to produce wild and sour ales!

We believe that the craft of brewing beer should be pursued just as you would embark on any great adventure – with an appreciation for history but without the shackles of convention. We approach beer as an artistic medium that offers endless opportunities for creativity, independence and innovation. While we do brew some traditional ales, we refuse to brew just the status quo.

Whether you are at our brewery in Spokane, a remote campsite in the mountains, or somewhere in between, we hope our beer brings your friends and family together to slow down and enjoy the simple pleasures of life.

We invite you to taste the road less traveled.
name: Ramblin' Road

description: Ontario’s first and only Brewery FarmTM is launching soon with unique beers that take their flavour and character from Norfolk County – this remarkable area known as Ontario’s Garden.
name: Ramblin' Road Brewery Farm

description: Alabama's Light Beer
name: Rammer Jammer Beer Company
Randy's Fun Hunters Brewery Restaurant and Banquet Center

description: Ranger Creek is a combined brewery/distillery proudly located in San Antonio, TX. We make beer and whiskey in our “brewstillery”, and we make it by hand one batch at a time with lots of love and attention. As a combined operation, we use much of the same equipment to make both our beer and our whiskey, and we can do this because there are a lot of similarities between the two processes. It’s actually a really cool process to see, and we invite you to come take a tour and learn about it for yourself.
name: Ranger Creek Brewing & Distilling

description:
Welcome to Rapp Brewing Company!
Home of hand crafted small batch artisanal Ales and Lagers.
Our goal is to bring you the finest examples of traditional beer styles using the best available ingredients.
We also offer you intriguing variations of traditional styles as well as exploring styles from past ages.
We use our creativity in the art of brewing and invite you to join us in that adventure.
name: Rapp Brewing Company

description:
Reducing our dependency on foreign ale...One pint at a time.

Increase awareness about the importance of choosing local. Support local farms, organizations, and charities. Grow the local, independent beer industry one customer at a time.

Local only. Draft only. We focus solely on local restaurants and bars. We only distribute within 200 miles of the brewery. The end.
name: Rapscallion Ales

description: Racquette River Brewing is 2 bbl production brewery located in Tupper Lake, NY. We brew small batch, hand crafted Adirondack Ales.
name: Raquette River Brewing

description: Based in Cambridge, MD on the banks of the Chesapeake Bay. We built our brewery in an 80 yr old former pool hall & bowling alley, with a goal of producing well-balanced American Pale Ales and Belgian inspired brews. Thank you for helping us make this dream a reality!
name: RAR Brewing

description: Situated in a beautiful 1931 red brick building, Rare Bird’s mission is to provide an unsurpassed dining and drinking experience in Traverse City. From our intimate reclaimed wood booths to the cozy and cool lounge and German bier hall style seating made from massive wood slabs that Nate and Tina sustainably harvested, we have a space for everyone to feel comfortable. The food menu features simple, familiar items served with a unique and exciting flair. Our ingredients are sourced locally when possible. Keeping with the local theme, our beer ingredients will include malt and hops grown in Michigan whenever possible. All of these qualities together make Rare Bird stand out in the crowd.
name: Rare Bird Brewery

description:
Rat Hole Brewing is a start up Nano Brewery in Central Oregon housed in a barn on 10 acres of rural ranch land southeast of Bend. A short walk from the brewery is the owners’ residence. The owners Al and Susan Toepfer, with Asst.
