Brewer & Marketing Guy Ken Deuser, and many more family members have spent two years taking a very run down barn that sits atop a 20,000 gallon cistern, into the great little brewery you see and taste today. 

Rat Hole will be brewing Red Ales, Porters, Browns, IPA's, Pilsners, Wheat and Specialty Beers. Some of the Specialty Beers will be seasonal brews such as Pumpkin Spice Ale, Hazelnut Brown, and Vanilla Porters as example. Other specialty beers will be a Summer Lemon Wheat, Saison, and a Blueberry Ale

Rat Hole Brewing handcrafts its beers in small batches under the close personal attention of their Head Brewer Al Toepfer & Asst. Brewer Ken Deuser. Using traditional brewing methods, Al & Ken ensure a "most excellent" taste consistently. We package our beer in bottles & draft kegs. 

Prior to becoming a commercial brewer, Al was a home brewer for many years. Ken Retired after serving 25 years in Navy traveling the world, and of course, tasting World Beers.
name: Rat Hole Brewing

description:
When it comes to beer, consistency is king. That’s why we have anchored our lineup with four meticulously crafted flagship brews.

In addition to the staples, we set the brewers loose on seasonal and artisanal options on a rotating basis. Our barrel aging and firkin programs will let us test and refine our more ambitious offerings.

We learned how to drink on tour. We learned how to brew in Germany.

In many ways, Ratio started in the punk scene back in the late 90’s. We cut our teeth by touring, playing out, creating zines, and working at labels. That DIY mindset prepared us for the challenges of creating and sharing our passions on our own terms. Over the years that energy has been channeled into brewing, learning the craft in Germany and honing our skills at some of the most respected breweries in Colorado. After moving on to successful careers in brewing, marketing, and finance; we have teamed up again for our most ambitious project yet - Ratio Beerworks.

With a state of the art 20 barrel system, we will have more than enough beer to go around. And the tap room will be as eclectic as the community that it’s built to support. The scene at Ratio is all about beer, but our art and music programs will ensure all of the senses are stimulated.
name: Ratio Beerworks

description: Raw Brewing Company was created from a passion for real ale and an idea that became reality. After several years of enjoying real ale David decided to have a go himself as a hobby to see if he could produce quality real ale. After several months it was clear that the product was good with the assistance from an army of tasters! It was time then to turn this passion and idea into reality Raw Brewing Company was born.
name: Raw Brewing Company

description:
Reading Brewing Company was an American beer brewing establishment founded by Philip Bessinger in 1886 in Reading, Pennsylvania.

Reading produced a Pennsylvania Dutch Lager at a volume of 1,200 barrels a year. The brewery raised its production to approximately 50,000 barrels a year by 1891. Reading suffered from difficulties after Prohibition began in 1920. From 1928 to 1933, the brewery was closed down. The facility itself was almost dismantled, but U.S. Marshals had trouble breaking the padlock on the front door and eventually left the plant intact. After considerable litigation, Reading brewery reopened in 1934. From 1934 to 1951 Reading ran a 'retro' advertising campaign which played on the nostalgia for simpler times.

In 1958, due to flagging sales, Reading re-branded as "The Friendly Beer for Modern People." The change proved successful in reversing the slump and Reading made strong sales that lasted into the 1970s.

In 1976, Reading ceased operations due to increasing pressure from larger macro brewers.[1] The label was purchased shortly afterwards by C. Schmidt & Sons. The brand changed hands several times until 1999, when it was again retired. In 2006, the Label was revived by Legacy Brewing, which produced original Reading recipes. In 2009, the Reading label and its recipes were purchased by Ruckus Brewing.
name: Reading Brewing Co

description:
Reads Landing Brewing Company is located in a historic two story, store front building right along the Mississippi River. With an unobstructed view of the river, you can watch the boaters in the summer and eagles in the winter while enjoying lunch, dinner, or just an afternoon snack.

Our menu offers a select list of locally produced fish, poultry, and meats. Our chef Casey prepares each with a southern flare that even northerners will enjoy. Don't forget to try our sweet potato tots. They are fast-becoming a favorite!

RLBC is currently serving locally produced craft beers on tap and now brewing handcrafted beer on-site. A nice assortment of craft and commercial brews are also available in bottles. The unique selections will change often with the seasons. For those who prefer other libations, we have a full bar and wine list as well.
name: Reads Landing Brewing Company

description: Welcome to the Texas Hill Country - the home of Real Ale Brewing Company, where a dedicated team of brewers produces quality handcrafted ales. Utilizing a 60-barrel stainless steel brewing system, we incorporate 100% malted grain, domestic and imported hops, and crystal clear water into our unique recipes. We've been brewing since 1996, and now you can find Real Ale all over the Lone Star State. If you don't see us at your favorite stores, bars, and restaurants, make sure to ask for us by name! Cheers and thanks for your support!
name: Real Ale Brewing Company

description: Bringing craft brews back to Cambridge this summer. Built on the belief that people should have a say in the beer they drink.
name: Realerevival Brewing

description: We are a craft brewery, located in sunny Virginia Beach, Virginia. When we say 'craft', we don't just mean small; we mean our beer is made with great care, using only the purest ingredients and smartest techniques. We don't just aim to create beers that satisfy, but rather to craft brews that inspire. We love what we do and that passion is inherent in every ounce of what flows out of our brewhouse.
name: Reaver Beach Brewing Company

description: John O’Brien never planned to own a brewery. In fact this was the last thing he imagined he would be doing with a background in engineering and a career as an engineering consultant and project manager in the construction industry. But after John was diagnosed with coeliac disease in 1998, and his doctor advised him that he could no longer drink beer, he set himself the mammoth task of creating his own gluten free craft beer that tasted just as good, if not better, than traditional barley based beer.
name: Rebellion Brewing

description:
Recess Brewing’s facility will consist of a three vessel 5-barrel brewery, 3 fermentors, and 6 brite/serving tanks. We will start operating with four year round beers, slowly working in a rotation of seasonal and specialty beers. The brewery will occupy the back 2/3 of the building and will be closed to the general public. Tours will be offered once we are up and running so stay tuned for this.

The other 1/3 of the building will house the taproom and will be open to everyone. The taproom will be able to seat about 50 people at a time and will be the only place to purchase Recess beer. In the taproom, customers will be able to sit and enjoy a beer with some friends or they can take a growler home with them. Food will not be served but patrons are more than welcome to order from an outside source or bring their own food.

A main focus at Recess will be the Community Supported Brewery program. This program will function similarly to community supported agriculture, in which consumers pay for weekly or monthly boxes of fresh-from-the-farm produce. Instead of produce, Recess will be providing fresh-from-the-brewery beer. For more details on the CSB program and what the benefits of becoming a member are, head over to the CSB page.
name: Recess Brewing Company

description: Sydney's famous King St Brewhouse is home to Red Tape Brewing Co.
name: Red  Tape Brewing Co

description: Red Arrow Brewing is the culmination of great friendships and talents. Our beers are crafted to be intriguing and untamed, just like us.
name: Red Arrow Brewing Company

description:
As the southeast's oldest brewery, Red Brick recently celebrated their 20th Anniversary. This milestone not only exemplifies their continuing commitment to amazing craft beer, but also signals a shift in focus for the brewery towards more innovative recipes and concepts.

Headed up by a small group of impassioned beer lovers including head brewer Garett Lockhart, Red Brick is determined to lead the charge in the south, putting out excellent beers such as "Hoplanta" IPA and the upcoming winter release "Sacred Cow" chai milk stout. They also take time to push the limits of brewing with the "Brick Mason" series, which the staff sees as their continuing masterpiece. Highlights from this series include "The Lost Years" old ale, "Black-Eye Rye" American black ale, and the most recent release "20th Anniversary", a 10% Imperial stout that was aged in Buffalo Trace bourbon barrels. Early accolades have already compared it to the hallowed KBS.

The future keeps looking brighter and brighter for this brewery, and the next couple years will see them growing and experimenting with diverse styles, collaborating with fellow breweries, implementing a new barrel program, and continuing to raise the bar for themselves in all aspects. After all, craft beer isn't just a product; it's a journey.
name: Red Brick Brewing Company

description: At Red Brick Road we handcraft ciders and perries, with only natural ingredients, based on traditional techniques with a twist of innovation and experimentation. As family cidermakers, we believe in real cider made from real fruit by real people.
name: Red Brick Road Ciderhouse
Red Brick Station Restaurant and Brewpub

description: Carbon Counties only Micro Brewery is now in Downtown Lehighton. Amazingly fresh brews with rich tastes and unique flavors. Stop by for your growler fills!
name: Red Castle Brewery & Distillery

description: Production brewery and taproom located in Winter Springs, FL.
name: Red Cypress Brewery

description:
Red Door Brewing Company opened in Albuquerque in 2014. The company was founded by five original members who came together with the hopes of forming the greatest light jazz/thrash metal fusion band in history. When it turned out most of the members were terrible musicians the team re-evaluated their skills and decided to capitalize on Wayne and Rob’s extensive brewing experience, passion, and education, and open a brewery.

Red Door Brewing Company strives to create a warm, welcoming atmosphere where you can grab an ice-cold, delicious beer and relax after a solid day’s work. We absolutely guarantee an environment free of rampaging gangs of rabid badgers which feed off chaos and lust for nothing but a dystopic, badger-ruled hellscape of a future. We are notably the only brewery in Albuquerque who has made that promise.Red Door Brewing Company opened in Albuquerque in 2014. The company was founded by five original members who came together with the hopes of forming the greatest light jazz/thrash metal fusion band in history. When it turned out most of the members were terrible musicians the team re-evaluated their skills and decided to capitalize on Wayne and Rob’s extensive brewing experience, passion, and education, and open a brewery.

Red Door Brewing Company strives to create a warm, welcoming atmosphere where you can grab an ice-cold, delicious beer and relax after a solid day’s work. We absolutely guarantee an environment free of rampaging gangs of rabid badgers which feed off chaos and lust for nothing but a dystopic, badger-ruled hellscape of a future. We are notably the only brewery in Albuquerque who has made that promise.
name: Red Door Brewing Company

description: The beers of the Red Dragon Brewery are inspired by the Celtic heritage of the Evans family whose ancestral roots are in Ireland, Scotland, England, and, most especially, Wales. It is in Wales that Evans is the fourth most common surname. The red dragon appears on the national flag of Wales, and has symbolized this Celtic nation for more than a millennium. So, it is with pride in this heritage that the Red Dragon Brewery is committed to producing the very finest of craft beers.
name: Red Dragon Brewery

description:
Red Ear Brewing is a small craft beer brewery based in Northern Kentucky. As we are locallyowned and operated it is our goal to support other businesses within the Greater CincinnatiMetropolitan area and utilize local products and services to bring you what you are looking for.  Quality craft beer!

You can be certain only the finest hops and grains are used in every batch of Red Ear beer and it isour goal to provide you, our family, friends, and neighbors, only the best tasting locally brewed  beer. This we can promise not only because we are the owners of Red Ear Brewing but moreimportantly because we love beer ourselves and are honored to produce it in our backyard wherebeer is a time honored tradition and not a fad.
name: Red Ear Brewing Company

description: Our craft beers are produced in small batches, by experienced brewers, using only the highest quality ingredients. Our brewers view these beers as a painter would his "palette", through which they manipulate grain, hops, yeast, and brewing techniques. We also encourage our brewers to add a little of their own creative flair.
name: Red Eye Brewing Company

description: Situated in an 11,000 sq. ft. warehouse, Red Hare Brewing Company has a 20 barrel brewhouse with a 120 barrel fermenting capacity. Making every day beer for beer fans everywhere, Red Hare’s flagship beer is Long Day Lager. Other year round Red Hare beers are Gangway IPA and Watership Brown. Keep an eye out for our Rabbit’s Reserve Series, limited edition, one-off batches that will be released four times a year.
name: Red Hare Brewing Company

description:
Red Hill Brewery is a unique beer and food experience on the Mornington Peninsula.  Opened in 2004 by Karen and David Golding with an 800lt steam fired brewery producing 3 main beers, Golden Ale, Wheat Beer and Scotch Ale.  Seasonal Beers are producing through the year including Xmas Ale, Imperial Stout and other unique powerful chalenging beer styles.

The cafe is committed to serving real food at the Red Hill Brewery Eatery. Our food is influenced b the great beer loving nations of England, Belgium and Germany where the favorite dishes have developed over centuries according to how well they match the famous beer styles.
name: Red Hill Brewery

description: Located in Cedar Park, Texas, Red Horn Coffee House and Brewing Co. offers fresh house roasted coffees and house brewed beer. With a focus on supporting other local artisans, Red Horn also offers locally sourced baked goods, charcuterie, cheeses, sodas, kombucha, wine, and a variety of sandwiches, salads and other artisan coffee and craft beer. Whether it’s sitting at the bar, lounging on a couch, or listening to local live music, our atmosphere is laid back and inviting. Come hang out with us.
name: Red Horn Coffee House & Brewing Co.

description: Michigan House Cafe & Brewpub is located in the heart of Historic Downtown Calumet across the street from the Vertin Building - the new home of Miskwabic Ed Gray Studio, Abbey Art Glass Studio, and an ever growing list of other artists.  The Sixth and Oak intersection is also conveniently located two blocks from snowmobile trails and Swedetown ski trails, and 11 miles from Mt. Bohemia.  The street level offers a full service restaurant and a vintage pub. Overnight lodging is available on the second floor (once the Hotel Michigan) with two suites that have been rehabilitated in historic fashion.  Red Jacket Brewing Company, Michigan's newest Brewpub, is beginning operation on the ground floor as well - following the historic Bosch Brewing tradition.
name: Red Jacket Brewing Company

description: Red Leg Brewing Company was established to provide the highest quality craft beer to honor the Men and Women who currently and formerly served in The United States of America. Our craft beers are developed with the utmost care, using only the highest quality craft beer ingredients. The craft beers that leave our facility will have the reputation that we strive for, continuing our service by providing those who serve with a craft beer they can be proud of.
name: Red Leg Brewing Company

description: Red Lodge Ales Brewing Company has been brewing fine craft beer since 1998. Our new facility is the largest Solar Powered building in the state of Montana, and our award winning beers are available throughout Montana, Wyoming, and North Dakota .
name: Red Lodge Ales Brewing Company

description: Red Oak Brew Pub was opened in February of 1991. In addition to brewing according to the Law of Purity, we decided not to filter or pasteurize our Bavarian Lagers to ensure the vitamins remain whole for that rich, mellow taste. Within months of opening the pub we began selling Red Oak to other accounts in the Greensboro area. In no time the 6 original aging tanks were maxed out so we added on to the building and installed 13 new tanks. By 2001 Red Oaks popularity had grown so much that we were brewing 24/7...and out of aging capacity. We began the search for a location to build a larger brewery with space to accommodate future growth.  After settling on a 12 acre tract along I 40/85 between Greensboro and Burlington in 2003...we began discussions with 3 Bavarian Brewery fabricators. Rolec of Cheming, Bavaria was chosen to supply the new brewery; and in 2005 construction began on the building to house it.  By the summer of 2007 Red Oak was ready to open the nation's most modern computerized brewing facility...consistently producing the Freshest, Purest, Bavarian Lagers in America.
name: Red Oak Brewery

description: Over the years, Red Rock has proven itself in the brewing community bringing home many medals from the annual Great American Beer Festival and a whopping 9 from the international competition, World Beer Cup. Other outstanding accomplishments include 20 medals from the North American Beer Awards and being named “Brewpub of the Year” by Brewpub Magazine in 2000. In 2007 Red Rock won "Large Brewpub and Large Brewpub Brewer of the Year" at the Great American Beer Festival.
name: Red Rock Brewing Company

description: The Red Star Brewery & Grille opened for business October 19th, 1998.  We had only five beers on tap, the Golden Light, American Pale, English Brown, Irish Dry Stout, and a Seasonal brew.
name: Red Star Brewery & Grille

description: A new Brewery hitting the Mid Michigan scene, right on your way from Grand Rapids to Traverse City just off of US-131!
name: Red Tail Brewing Company

description: Born from years of industry experience, Red Tank Cider creates real North West hard cider. We make cider because we have a serious, uncontrollable passion for it. We won’t stop. It’s not supposed to be easy. That’s why it tastes so good. We practice sustainable techniques in our cider house. We use only apples, yeast and natural sulfites to make our cider. We do not put in any chemical additives and present our craft in its natural form.
name: Red Tank Cider

description: The Red Truck Brewing Co is one of the fastest growing breweries in B.C. Red Truck Beer is a North Vancouver based operation that is focused on making and delivering the freshest beer available.
name: Red Truck Beer Company

description: Continuing the brewing tradition in beautiful Red Wing, Minnesota, the Red Wing Brewery produces a variety of hand-crafted styles, including historic Red Wing beers and our own root beer.
name: Red Wing Brewery

description: Specializing in small batches of big beers. We are located at 120 S Lewis Street in the Wharf district of Staunton VA. Our “Brewers Notice”, the federal license to produce beer, was approved by the Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau in Feb. 2013. We began making capital improvements to the leased space and assembling our equipment in October 2012. Our opening brewhouse size will be ~1.5 ba...See More
name: Redbeard Brewing Co

description: The Redchurch Brewery strives to create uncompromising modern beers. Our beers are distinctive and adventurous, bottle conditioned to allow them time to mature and grow. We never filter or pasteurise so that the depth of flavour and complexity we work hard to produce is preserved. We don’t tolerate bland flavorless beer and neither should you. We hope you enjoy redchurch beer as much as we do.
name: Redchurch Brewery

description:
RedDot BrewHouse at Dempsey is a passion that took almost a decade to materialize. Housing a brewery in a historical building that was rich in military history and set in lush tranquility was simply irresistible. An old dilapidated barrack was restored to what you see today with some of the original bricks that were 100 odd years old. 

In 2010, we found another beautiful historical building at Boat Quay, south bank of the Singapore River mouth, a river that was the source of entrepot trade and life in early Singapore. The second RedDot BrewHouse now offers our signature beers from a row of old Chinese shop houses which is rich in commercial history of our early Chinese settlers.

Beers, an age old historical beverage, to be enjoyed in age old historical buildings like Dempsey’s Tanglin Barracks (1860) and Boat Quay’s old commercial Chinese shop houses (1826). RedDot Beers, housed in rich history, rich in taste. Cheers!
name: RedDot BrewHouse

description:
The Redemption Brewing Company is a small brewery based in North London. Brewing since January 2010, we are passionate brewers of cask ale, committed to using the finest raw materials to craft beers with flavour, character and integrity.

We brew using traditional methods where time and patience are respected, where automation is subservient to the skill of the craft brewer. Our beers reflect our contemporary outlook, with subtle twists interwoven through beautifully balanced flavours.

The brewery strives to be environmentally sustainable. All our power comes from renewable resources. It costs a little more but makes us feel good. We source the majority of our malt and hops from the UK and then once we are finished with them the spent grains and hops are delivered to a local allotment to be used as compost.
name: Redemption Brewing Company

description: In 1981, Gordon Bowker and Paul Shipman started Redhook Ale Brewery in an old transmission shop in Seattle. Early missteps led to a cult following and eventually led to widespread acclaim that inspired countless craft brewers. Still, more than 25 years later, no brewery has been able to achieve the pure, unqualified Liquid Goodness of Redhook.
name: Redhook Ale Brewery

description: Launched on April 7, 2014, Redlight Redlight Beer Parlour and Brewery employs a 50 liter brew house, three 14 gallon temperature controlled fermentors, and five full sized oak barrels that are also used as primary fermentors. The brewery specializes in sour and wild beers. Just one year into our venture as professional brewers Redlight Redlight has already begun to develop a strong foot hold in the budding Florida brewing scene. . With our Head Brewer, Brent Hernandez, at the helm, Redlight brought home a Bronze Medal in the Wood Aged Sour Beer category at the Best Florida Beer Competition for our Belgian Sour Stout, Black Morning! We are small, but we are MIGHTY!
name: Redlight Redlight Beer Parlour & Brewery

description: Redline Brewing Company will brew and serve a variety of high quality, handcrafted and unique beers in our taproom in Burton, Michigan. We would like to bring something new and unique to the Burton area allowing everyone from construction workers to businessmen to sit down and enjoy a locally brewed beer. Although we will not have a food menu, patrons will have the option to bring in their own choice of food, or have food delivered from other local establishment; we will also have complimentary popcorn to snack on while enjoying a nice cold brew. Patriotic Pizza is located next to the brewery and are ready and willing to deliver to Redline Brewing Company customers. The taproom will offer numerous forms of entertainment to our guests including music, television, and games in a hot rod centered atmosphere.
name: Redline Brewing Company

description: The Redneck Riviera Brewing Project aims to bring top of the line craft beer and brewing education to the Gulf Coast area. We're currently putting the finishing touches on our brewhouse, which is located at Goat Lips Deli in Pensacola, Florida. Check back soon for details on our grand opening, slated for early 2015!
name: Redneck Riviera Brewing Project

description: Welcome to Redoak Boutique Beer Cafe, Australia’s most awarded brewery. Here at Redoak we strive to to give you the best beer and food experience, whether it is drinking our world-class beers or enjoying beer matched with carefully prepared snacks, meals or desserts. Why? Because it is all about offering you the best taste, quality, value and service.
name: Redoak Boutique Beer Cafe

description:
Our brewers are always looking for inspiration. It comes in many ways and leads to many great brewing innovations, like ur award winning Red Rock Rêve, barrel aged Belgian-style triple; the unique, dandelion-based Paardebloem created in conjunction with New Belgium Brewing Company; and Secale, a Bavarian-style doppelbock lager created with High West Distillery and aged in their rye whiskey barrels for six months.
From our wide variety of beers to our hand-crafted sodas, Red Rock's brewers brew it right.
name: Redrock Brewing Co.

description:
David Myers, known as 'Chairman of the Mead', founder of Redstone Meadery, is a romantic and wants to see mead once again enjoying the glory days of yesteryear. He started the Boulder, Colorado company with the 'natural philosophy' that he produce the highest quality honey wine on the market.

Because of this 'philosophy of mead', Redstone does not cork (to avoid oxidation) but instead uses swing top bottles. This ensures the mead will not breathe while cellaring plus offers a much longer shelf life once the bottle has been opened.

In keeping with the 'natural' approach, Redstone does not add any sulfites, a known allergen, as honey is it's own natural preservative. Redstone only pasteurizes the must (unfermented mead) and never boils. The company strives to feature the flavors of the fermentable as much as possible.

In 2003 Redstone Meadery brought the International Mead Festival (www.meadfest.com) to Boulder, Colorado and with that helped to establish mead as its own beverage category. Also at this time Redstone spearheaded the creation of the International Mead Association (www.meadfest.org) to help promote and educate the masses about the world's first fermented beverage.

Currently, Redstone products are distributed to 20 states across the U.S., making it the widest distributed wine from the state of Colorado and one of the most widely distributed meads in the country! From the Northwest to the Southeast, Ask for Mead!
name: Redstone Meadery

description: Brewpub that offers upscale dining in a casual atmosphere. Our lodge themed restaurant features: smoke free dining, award winning beer, woodfire pizza oven, steaks, wild game, live music, outdoor dining and much more. 2008 Great American Beer Fest Small Brewpub of the Year.
name: Redwood Brewing Co

description:
We desire to share our passion and interest in craft beer with everyone from the first time sipper to the seasoned enthusiast. Providing academic and hands on experiences are a big part of this desire to help people expand and trust their own senses.

All of our handcrafted artisan ales are served and properly aged, to deliver maximum flavor and character. Our expressive beers can be very complex and assertive, but the with the ultimate goal of proper balance. We only use premium domestic and imported malts and hops, Humboldt County water and our multiply yeast strains. You will not find any artificial additives or preservatives in our beers.

We trust that our craft beer and brewing techniques convey our philosophies concerning family, friends, community, education and living life to its fullest. Cheers!
name: Redwood Curtain Brewing

description: Reel Brew Co is a contract brewery that has a brick and mortar in planning with the City of Los Angeles.  Located in Van Nuys, California, Reel Brew Co aims to be the brewery for the entertainment industry in Hollywood.  We will be the first studio based brewery and will thus become the first "BREWDIO" offering an array of delicious beers.  We are a local brew for a local crew!
name: Reel Brew Co.

description:
The brewery is currently set up to brew 10bbl (310 gallons) of beer at a time. It may seem like a lot of beer (and it is!), but brewing on this relatively small scale allows us to maintain quality at a finite level that would be increasingly difficult on a larger system. However, our five fermentors, with a capacity totaling 80bbl, allows us to maintain a variety of beers on tap all year long.
 
The tasting room is situated right in the middle of the brewery and allows people to experience beer and what goes into producing it. Often times patrons of the tasting room get a front row seat to the actual brewing process as our brewers are working!
name: Refuge Brewery

description:
Since 1989, this beer is produced in our own brewery. 
The brewery is currently under construction, however, this is so, we hope to end of May 2009 and completed the production of a good house beer at the earliest. Here you will find detailed photos of the brewery
name: Rega Bräu

description: We are a husband and wife superduo (emphasis on the duo, less on the super) who are building a brewery from the ground up. Stay tuned!
name: Regimental Brewing Company

description: Regulator Brewing Company is committed to the support of local farms, the spirit of rebellion, and, of course, great beer.
name: Regulator Brewing Company

description:
Small family owned micro brewery .
They have a large range of beer styles, but they opened out of the gates with amazing sours.
name: Relentless Brewing

description:
The Olde Saratoga Brewing Company in Saratoga Springs, NY, is the wholly owned subsidiary of Mendocino Brewing Company in Ukiah, California, and has been bringing you the highest quality, fresh, traditional, all malt craft-brewed lager and ales since 1997. Brewing the five legend ales, the Mendocino Brewing Company was established in 1983 as the first brew pub in California and the second in the USA. The Olde Saratoga Brewing Company now brews, bottles and kegs of these famous ales for the entire East Coast.

In the year 2001, the Olde Saratoga Brewing Co. began brewing Kingfisher Premium Lager for the USA, joining three other countries worldwide who brew Kingfisher. Kingfisher Premium Lager is enjoyed in over 55 countries and is the world's #1 selling Indian beer. Olde Saratoga Brewing is the sole brewery for Kingfisher in the Northeast United States.

Alt Names: Olde Saratoga Brewing Company
name: Releta Brewing Company, LLC

description: We are a small batch brewery creating fresh, seasonal and unique ales and lagers. Looking to open early 2012.
name: Relic Brewing Co

description:
Offensively Delicious? Yes, that’s what our beer is. Always creative and always packed with flavor. This is beer for those who do the don’ts and don’t the dos, the Renegades. We don’t care about traditional styles, or following the trends, we care about making f’ing delicious beer that we are proud to serve.

Renegade was founded by Brian and Khara O’Connell in the summer of 2011 in the Santa Fe Arts District of Denver. Brian brought his offensively delicious brews, developed in his backyard, to Denverites to encourage social interaction and friendship.  Come down to our taproom, or ask for us at your favorite bar, restaurant or liquor store. Whatever you do, don’t be something you’re not.Be Renegade.
name: Renegade Brewing Company

description: RBC brews and serves world class beer in community minded little pub.  Four local restaurants deliver to your table. Enjoy the outdoor beer garden, hand-crafted sodas and sip award winning beer.
name: Republic Brewing Company

description: We're a couple of friends who tried to open a small brewpub in Sun Prairie, WI. We failed to raise enough money, but we hope this website will serve as a useful resource to future brewery owners.
name: RePublic Brewpub

description: Craft brewery in the heart of Plateau Mont-Royal.
name: Reservoir

description:
If you show up to theCHIVE office for a tour, the first thing that happens is you'll be led to theCHIVE's famous beer fridge. Taking a tour without a beer in hand is a silly thing. When you open the fridge you notice a selection of the best beers around. At your eye level you'll find curious row of humble beers marked 'KCCO' on masking tape. It’s time to share our special home brew. Resignation Brewery was born to make the highest quality beer possible here in America.

As theCHIVE moves forward, our primary interest is in connecting people. It's what our shirts do amazingly well. There isn't anything wrong with the digital likes, pokes, and winks in the digital space. But nothing beats a physical connection. - A room full of friends, laughter, and raised glasses. Now the Chivers have a great, American beer to toast.
name: Resignation Brewery
Restaurace a pivovar U Dvou koček

description: Resurgence Brewing Company is a brewery & beer garden located on the West Side of Buffalo. Our goal is to bring a memorable “beer experience” to the drinkers of the greater Buffalo region, whether at home, in a favorite bar, or at the brewery.
name: Resurgance Brewing Company

description: We are three-retired friends who believe that giving back to others is life's greatest virtue. We were raised on these basic ideals: Love for Community, Importance of Generosity, and the Need for Sustainability. History tells us that the invention of beer inspired the idea of community. When people come together to enjoy beer, amazing things happen: Friendships are sparked, stories are shared, ideas are cultivated. Beer is simply a social vehicle for people to discuss what really matters in life. Together we can be a driving force in giving back to a cause in your community. 20% of this beverage’s proceeds go to [insert charity]. With your help we can shift the purpose behind beer to generously give back to the community
name: Retro Beer Company

description:
We are a small family ran brewery in the Ballard district of Seattle, crafting tasty small batch brews.

Our story by grace!

Although only a month old at the time, our clever, thoughtful son, Reuben, came up with the idea of giving Adam a homebrewing kit for his birthday.  When Reuben and I took Adam to Bob’s (our friendly, neighborhood homebrew supply store) to pick up his kit, I was expecting to pick up a little tin of “beer mix” and a bucket to brew.  We were a bit surprised and overwhelmed by the seriousness of this beer-brewing business.  I thought, “Oh great, there’s more storage space gone once Adam gives up on this little hobby in a month’s time.”  Even though I rarely admit to being wrong now that we’re married, I couldn’t have been farther from the mark thinking that this would be an easily discarded hobby.  The first brewing system has been dwarfed by the upgraded and supersized brewhouse, and there has been no chance for the mash tun, brew kettle, or hot liquor tank to gather any dust!  Adam’s hobby turned into full-blown obsession, and in tribute to the little man who started it all, Reuben’s Brews was born!
name: Reuben's Brews

description: Reunion Brewing Company, Bringing the world together two beers at a time....
name: Reunion Brewing Company

description: With the largest number of cider taps in Portland (12), you’re sure to find something you like. I offer tasting trays, glass pours of old standbys and taproom-only specials including many ciders that never leave the building. Buy a growler to go, or take some bottles home with you.
name: Reverand Nat's Hard Cider

description: Brewers of fine malted beverages headed up by award winning brew master Sean Larkin.
name: Revival Brewing Company

description:
Revolution Brewing is Chicago's new hometown craft brewery. Our brewpub in Logan Square is a bustling, neighborhood institution where friends and families meet to enjoy the freshest beer in town. Opening our brewery has been a labor of love. We think you can see that in everything we do ranging from the details of our carved fists holding up our mahogany bar to the pungent hop aroma of our Anti-Hero IPA to our creative dishes like our bacon-fat popcorn.

The growth of craft breweries in the U.S. has been nothing short of a revolution and we're proud to be standing tall in this new crowd. The changing tastes of beer drinkers demand bigger flavors and more variety. That's exactly what we give you at Revolution Brewing. Our brewpub produces about 50 different beer styles each year. We've got session beers like Workingman Mild, hop-bombs like Double Fist and more bourbon barrel aged beers than you can shake a stave at. We have fun doing what we do and invite you to come in and join us.
name: Revolution Brewing

description:
At Revolution Brewing, our beer is made by humans for humans using only the finest grains, hops and water. It has not been pasteurized, centrifuged or filtered. There are no chemical additives or artificial ingredients.

We craft brew this beer just for you.
name: Revolution Brewing Co

description: Revolver Brewing is located thirty-five minutes southwest of Fort Worth in historic Granbury, TX. We are a Texas family owned business founded by father and son, Ron and Rhett Keisler, along with seasoned Master Brewer and Cicerone, Grant Wood. We don't take ourselves too seriously, but we take extreme pride in our craft. We believe we can brew world-class beer in the Texas countryside. We start with fresh water from our own Trinity Aquifer well and brew our beer incorporating seasonal local ingredients. We brew on custom made equipment built for us in the U.S. by proud craftsmen. We oversee our beer to the tap to ensure you are drinking the same beer we are. We believe that our knowledge of brewing, hard work and attention to each detail is evident in every beer we craft.
name: Revolver Brewing

description: Is somewhat of an open-ended project. Our brewers, George, Bob, & Eric come from diverse brewing backgrounds which we believe, despite butting heads occasionally, is a great strength to be harnessed. Rather than setting forth a staunch regiment of a certain style of beer, we want Rexx to grow and progress organically. The artist Robert Motherwell once said "A subject emerges from an interaction between my self, my I, and my medium." This is the same process we employ in the creation of our beers. Each beer is born out of a free flowing of ideas; a collaborative exchange of concepts between intellectual thesis and recipe. This then leads to lots of pilot brewing which often leads to further discussion of concept until ultimately either the beer style is determined by the concept or vice versa. This process allows for a great amount of freedom and creativity to already be present at the beginning of every new project.
name: Rexx Reserve

description:
Rhinegeist is a brewery out of Cincinnati, OH that was built within the skeleton of the old Moerlein bottling plant (built in 1895). Within these unique and historic walls, we brew 20bbl batches of beer that sings with flavor and delights us. The yin/yang of our brewing philosophy is hoppy/sessionable and we aim to brew beers where “the first sip calls for the third”.  We’re a small team with big dreams and tend to smile while we sweat. We brew those styles which are most compelling to our thirst and we certainly hope you enjoy our brews as much as we do.

Rhinegeist means “ghost of the Rhine”, and refers to our place here in the historic Brewery District in the Over the Rhine neighborhood of Cincinnati. At the turn of the century, this neighborhood was home to nearly 45,o00 inhabitants, most of them of German descent and 38 breweries. We hope to engender the spirit of camaraderie and hard work that we imagine those living and brewing in this neighborhood at that time embodied.

We self distribute our beer, which means each beer that you drink in a bar or restaurant is poured from a keg that we delivered cold in our refrigerated van (keep your eyes peeled for it around town). We like to keep beer as fresh as possible, which means that every keg we fill is immediately moved into cold storage where it sits until we load it onto our refrigerated van for delivery to the coldbox of each local account. Fresh beer is tasty beer, and that’s our favorite kind.
name: Rhinegeist

description:
Our bar carries 9 of our hand-crafted beers on draught and also one cask conditioned beer on a traditional British hand pump.

Our Scottish brewer brews over 30 different beer styles throughout the year, ranging from American style Wheat beers to Belgian Dubbels and Tripels and of course Scottish Ales.

Unlike other microbreweries - Our beers do not compromise on flavor!
name: Rhodell Brewery

description:
What happens when a village administrator, a farmer, a lawyer, a mechanic, and a veteran brewmaster come together with a shared vision for locally brew craft beer? A state-of-the-art brewery materializes in the heart of a small rural Alberta community.

Ribstone Creek Brewery has been brewing premium craft beer since the Fall of 2012. Five founding members came together with a shared passion for locally made, high quality beer. They were also determined to keep local, in the very town they all grew up in. And so they purchased a former tractor dealership in an historical building on the main street of Edgerton, Alberta and set about renovating.
name: Ribstone Creek Brewery

description: This brewery went out of business in 2010.
name: Richbrau Brewing Company
Ridge Cider Co. A Michigan Hard Cider Company

description: Ridgebrook Brewery began with a love for beer. Not the typical light lagers we’ve all had throughout the years, but craft beer; beer that focuses on flavor, aroma, color and taste. Craft beer opened up a whole new world of exotic tastes that, once discovered, prohibited our return to the standard light lager of our youth.
name: Ridgebrook Brewery

description: The story of Ridgeway starts with the end of another story. It’s a sad tale, the closing of the venerable Brakspear brewery in Henley-on-Thames, where the most famous and surely the best bitter in England had been made for centuries. The brewery, in operation since 1779, was sold off in 2002 in parts to make room for an upscale hotel, and everyone who worked there was let go. For beer lovers, the closing was not a complete disaster. Thankfully, Brakspear’s master brewer, Peter Scholey, was determined to strike out on his own. He set up shop as Ridgeway Brewing, not far from Henley, and has been putting out beers so good they could almost make you forget Brakspear altogether.
name: Ridgeway Brewing

description:
Our first cider press was made in 1906, and its making has been passed on to us as an endearing anecdote. At the beginning of the last century Mr Robustiano Riestra cut down a large tree, probably an eucalyptus, which was transported by two Asturian traditional carts to his house in Santa Olaya de Baldornón (Gijón), where he built a beam press. Don Robustiano already marketed under the brand name RIESTRA and he even owned a store in the popular district of El Llano in Gijón in the early years of the last century. Some years later, the company passed into the hands of his daughter Mrs. Etelvina Riestra who moved to the neighbouring municipality of Sariego when she got married to Mr Ricardo Riestra Hortal, where a new stage of the making of our cider began.

Working in those times was hard, laborious and very demanding, as they did not enjoy the technological advances which are available to us today. In 1947 a new cider cellar was built which meant both a major modernization and also a considerable increase of the production and the trading transactions. In 1985 Guzmán Riestra Riestra took over management of the company, who, in turn, passed the baton to his sons Raúl and Ruben Riestra, who are currently continuing the work started by their great grandfather, placing this family saga among the most traditional ones of the cider makers' guild.

2012 marks another step in the trajectory of this brand. The release of our first sparkling cider, Sidra Guzmán Riestra. This is a sparkling cider produced through the methode champenoise, with a second fermentation and aging in the bottle that has been received by critics and the public with great appreciation.
name: RIESTRA

description: Founded in 2013, Riff Raff Brewing Company opens in downtown Pagosa Springs, Colorado, in May 2013. The brewery—Pagosa Springs’ first downtown brewery—features artisan ales handcrafted in Riff Raff’s historic Victorian building.  Riff Raff also boasts being the second brewery in the world to use spring fed geothermal energy.
name: Riff Raff Brewing

description: All of our microbrews are brewed on premise with the highest quality of craftmanship. We offer four core brews year round.  Our brewer is constantly switching up our selection so make sure to come in often for his newest creation.  You'll leave happy every time - guaranteed.
name: Rifle Brewing Company

description: Hailed as One of the "Top 5 Local Breweries In The Nation", Right Brain Brewery is known for our culinary inspired beers using only whole ingredients, like Asparagus, Cherry Pies, or smoked Mangalitsa Pig Heads. When we're not busy fending off pirates on the Boardman Lake we like to throw art shows, concerts, and even yoga classes in our brewery. Some people love us, some people hate us, and others just don't understand, but we just want to teach you how to Keep Beer Curious.
name: Right Brain Brewery

description:
Right Proper Brewing Company will be a locally owned neighborhood brew pub in a Washington DC neighborhood

Washington, DC, needs at least two things: more affordable neighborhood restaurants, and at least one locally owned brewpub. 
Our objective is three-fold: We want to create a neighborhood gathering place that makes and serves well-priced delicious food and amazing fresh beer; we want to help our neighborhood thrive by investing in the community and its residents; and we want to anchor Washington, DC on the map as a destination for craft beer. Our business will invest in the growth and development of our employees as well as of our community.

We’ll take an innovative approach to small scale, “yeast-forward” craft brewing to produce artisanal ales and lagers in a comfortable, expertly designed casual old-world tavern. Serving fresh beer and affordable, high-quality American food, Right Proper will be a focus of pride for its neighborhood.
name: Right Proper Brewing Company

description:
RIIP BEERS ARE A LABOR OF LOVE
IT'S MOSTLY LABOR
BUT THERE'S SOME LOVE
IT'S PURELY PLATONIC WE PROMISE
SO GRAB YOURSELF A BOTTLE
YOU CAN START YOUR OWN LOVE AFFAIR
WE WON'T JUDGE
name: Riip Beer Co.

description: A bunch of guys and gals that have been brewing for years together decided to go for it.  They brew like true craft brewers on what would seem like a giant home brew system.  You can tell its all made with love and hard work.
name: Riley's Brewing Company

description: Located in Rincón, Puerto Rico, Rincón Beer Company will feature handcrafted brews made in-house, in addition to beer from Puerto Rico's microbreweries. We're located on the Rincón public plaza, across the street from the gazebo, next door to Brothers Pizza. We're currently working on permits and remodeling and hope to open in Fall 2013.
name: Rincón Beer Co.

description: Rincon Brewery is dedicated to providing the highest quality, full-flavored, malt beverages. Our inspiration originates from the beautiful Rincon Beach coastline to the fresh, thriving local Carpinteria farmlands. Combined, these “waves of grain” provide the ideal blend that define the essence of Rincon Brewery. With a strong commitment to preservation and restoration of our natural environment, we promise to bring you the freshest, most exceptional, hand-crafted beers the Central Coast has to offer. Our vision is to create an environment at Rincon Brewery, where along with serving the finest beers, friendships will be made, businesses will be shaped and conversations will be cultivated.
name: Rincon Brewery

description:
We take two things seriously
at Ringwood Brewery:
our beer and leisure time...

Along with creating quality craft ales, we are also relaxation enthusiasts.

Our motto is “Visit the Winding Downs” - a place to enjoy some quality time with friends.
name: Ringwood Brewery

description:
Brewery Rinkuškiai was established in the year 1991 in Biržai region known as Beer Country in Lithuania. The owners of the brewery – Rimantas ?ygas, Petras Kalkys and Sigitas Kalkys are proud of a strong company that has been constantly growing in the market. The brewery stands No5 in the market right after 4 largest breweries in Lithuania and holds 4 percent of the market share.

Rinkuškiai offers a wide assortment of beer – from light lager to strong stout beer. The brewery puts great emphasis on beer quality that is strictly monitored everyday. Rinkuškiai offers its customers several new brands of beer each year. The company sells beer in usual 0,5 liter glass and in 0,5 liter, 1 liter, 1.5 liter, 2 liter plastic (PET) bottles that are most convenient when traveling and at social events.

Brewery Rinkuškiai has been investing in innovations – the company has the most modern brewering equipment, new buildings were built and renovations made only a year ago. The company plans to implement ISO-9001 standard system and to extend beer export to United States, Germany, Latvia, Greece and the Scandinavian countries.

Rinkuškiai beer quality is the result of old traditions of Beer Country, experience of the past generations, and innovations of the modern days. That makes Rinkuškiai beer one of the most exclusive in Lithuania.
name: Rinkuškių Alaus Darykla

description: Formerly Blackthorn, Rinn Duin Brewing is crafting characteristically traditional, yet distincive English, Irish and Scottish Ales in the heart of the Jersey Shore.
name: Rinn Duin Brewing

description:
Rio Grande Brewery and Sierra Blanca Brewery - one brewery - two great brands!

Located just outside Albuquerque, in Moriarty NM, our craft beer is brewed in the wild west and is out of this world! We are excited about our craft and excited to offer fellow beer enthusiasts the best in locally made flavors
name: Rio Grande Brewing Company

description:
We believe Rip Current is the right name for our brewery as it reflects our vision for the brewery being a strong force that goes against the conventional beer style flow so as to change the entire beer landscape. We plan to brew uncompromising, assertive flavored ales and lagers bringing maximum variety to the southern California beer community.

At Rip Current Brewing, we plan to listen closely our customer’s preferences and use this to drive the wide variety of beer available at our tasting room and keg accounts. We will challenge drinkers’ pallets to enjoy new flavor experiences while not losing sight of what beers people demand on an ongoing basis. Our tap room will feature a rotating selection of seasonal and experimental styles complementing San Diego favorites like the IPA, Imperial IPA and hoppy amber. Rip Current will lever our extensive recipe library of award winning beers to maximize our customer’s enjoyment.
name: Rip Current Brewing

description: Rising Tide Brewing Company is a family-owned craft brewery located in Portland, Maine. We specialize in artisanal, hand-crafted ales brewed in small batches. Our beers are available in bottles and on draft in our tasting room in Portland's East Bayside neighborhood and at select locations in Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, and Vermont.
name: Rising Tide Brewing Company

description: Fresh and Flavorful Craft Beer in Redlands, California.
name: Ritual Brewing Co.

description: Making quality beer is always job number one. Everything else comes after that.
name: River City Brewing

description: River City Brewing Co. Is located in the heart of the Old Town district of downtown Wichita, and opened its doors in 1993. Since then, we've strived to push the envelope in brewing styles and seasonal offerings for your enjoyment. We offer 5 flagship beers, and 11 rotating seasonal offerings. We have a full bar and awesome menu, as well as live entertainment on Fridays and Saturdays. Come check us out and see what's brewing in Kansas! Cheers!
name: River City Brewing Co

description:
The River City Brewing Company in Sacramento, California is a fusion of brewing expertise, culinary artistry, experienced & friendly staff and relaxing yet vibrant ambiance.

The beers brewed here are traditional and innovated. With over 22 different ales and lagers brewed throughout the year, you are assured of a great selection and a satisfied palate. Visit our "Beer Offerings" page to view the current quiver of ales and lagers.

The California cuisine at RCBC is extraordinary, but don't take our word for it, we will let you make up your own mind after you try our signature Eggplant Napoleon appetizer or the Asiago Garlic Crusted Chicken or any of our Wood Fired Pizzas!

The open and spacious architecture with 20' ceilings creates a lively and fun atmosphere, or you can enjoy a more quiet tone in our banquet room that seats up to 50 people. If you want to, you can perch your party on our mezzanine (holds up to 25 people) for a view of the whole restaurant.
name: River City Brewing Company

description:
River Company Brewery is located in beautiful Fairlawn, VA and are mere minutes away from Radford University and Virginia Tech.

Our restaurant specializes in all natural beef which we dry age in house to produce a distinctly tender and flavorful steak. We have a wide range of flavors on our menu and feature nightly specials.

Our Chief Brewer produces all our draft beers in house, offering a wide variety of flavors to please every palate.
name: River Company Brewery

description:
Founded in 2012 by the Gray Family, River Dog Brewing has managed to make a splash in the rising tide of the Southern craft beer scene. Under the direction of Head Brewer John Federal, we’ve created an exceptional menu of beers, from Belgian ales to sours to one of the largest barrel aging programs in the South.
When you visit the South Carolina Lowcountry, you know that it’s more than just a place. It’s a way of life. Incredible people. Amazing food. Exceptional beer – brewed in Bluffton.
name: River Dog Brewing Company

description:
You don't have to be in a dead end job to feel like you aren't going anywhere.  That's the way we felt before River Horse.  We were finance geeks living in a world without soul.  Grinding it out everyday for a fee, wearing suits and kissing butt.

Then this brewery chose us...she forced us to ask ourselves, "Is this desk job really how I pictured my life?"  We answered that questions by taking over River Horse in 2007 and have not looked back.  We may not end up as the greatest success story on earth, but at least we had the balls to try.  Sometimes, for better or worse, your dreams get the best of you.

Just remember, it's a big world out there and cubicles don't have doors, so you can walk out anytime.  Come see us when you can.  We are located in Lambertville, NJ on the banks of the Delaware.  Thanks for supporting the cause.  Hope you enjoy the beer...
name: River Horse Brewing Company

description: Located along the banks of the beautiful Susquehanna River just across the river from Lewisburg, PA. Stop by and relax with a pint of one of our award-winning local brews and a plate full of delectable authentic Italian cuisine.
name: River House BrewPub

description:
River North Brewery is located just north of downtown Denver at 24th and Blake St in the ballpark neighborhood, at the southern tip of the up-and-coming River North Art District (RiNO for short). We focus on brewing Belgian-style ales and American style ales with a Belgian twist, but the truth of it is that we just brew the kind of beer we like to drink!

The brewery was founded by Matt Hess (with a lot of help from his wife Jess). Matt is a former engineer who now spends his time engineering the latest recipes for River North.
name: River North Brewery

description: Quality crafted beer for good hard working people. Don't float alone, bring a River Rat to the party...Mission subjected to change at any bend in the river...
name: River Rat Brewery

description: River Rouge Brewing Company is a Nano Brewery making unique Ales for the local community.
name: River Rouge Brewing Company

description:
Welcome to River Time Brewing! 

We are a small-batch brewery located in wonderful Darrington, WA on the bank of the majestic Sauk river.

Our objective is to provide a family-friendly atmosphere with fantastic beers, complementing the wonderful outdoor lifestyle that is Darrington and our Baker National Forest.
name: River Time Brewing

description: River's Edge is Milford, Michigan's, microbrewery and gathering place! We're located in a distinctive building on the Huron River and across from downtown's Central Park. We'll be providing several delicious craft beers on tap, as well as cask-conditioned ales, and a selection of our house-made wine! Come on in and pull up a chair at our bar or a seat on our patio overlooking the park and river. We're looking forward to seeing you!
name: River's Edge Brewing Co.

description:
Riverport Brewing Company will put the flavor back in your beer. Even though your first experience with beer probably wasn't as pleasurable as the hype made it sound—you persevered and learned to enjoy it anyway. The American beer industry has spent years and countless dollars on advertising trying to persuade us how our beer should taste. Now we invite you to find out what beer was meant to taste like. Using only the finest grains, hops, and water we are sure that once you’ve tasted our fresh craft beer you’ll discover beer all over again!

Riverport Brewing Company is nestled beneath the grain-rich rolling hills of the Palouse in Clarkston, Washington, near the confluence of Idaho's Clearwater River and the mighty Snake River.
name: Riverport Brewing Company

description: (No longer brewing)
name: Rivers Effortless Dining

description: Riverside Brewing Company is a craft brewery based in Western Sydney, Australia. At Riverside Brewing we are dedicated to brewing pure, natural, hand-crafted beers that are bursting with flavour and aroma whilst being free of additives and preservatives. Quality, not quantity, is what we strive for. Put simply, we brew beer that that our locals, craft beer drinkers and ourselves would find a pleasure to drink. All of Riverside's beers are brewed on-site in our brewhouse in Parramatta and are bottle conditioned and unfiltered to ensure the freshest beer possible.
name: Riverside Brewing Company

description: Welcome to the Rivertown Brewing Company, We specialize in brewing traditional Handcrafted Lagers and Ales, using only the finest and freshest ingredients available.  use the buttons to the left to find out "What Ales You"!
name: Rivertown Brewing Company

description:
If you have not been in to visit us yet, we look forward to meeting you. Otherwise, we appreciate having you as a patron. For those of you who didn't know, we have 4 exciting locations. Experience dining in or spend an evening with us enjoying your favorite hard-to-find beer.

Our Mission is to build genuine relationships with our guests, and to make a positive impact on the community. We further desire to offer excellent service, great beer and food made with TLC to our guests.
name: Rivertowne Brewing

description: We are a microbrewery located in Newburyport, MA dedicated to producing unique rustic beers. All of our beers are unfiltered, unpasteurized and bottle-conditioned to maintain the fullest flavor possible.
name: Riverwalk Brewing

description:
The Brewery is located in Hungary at Táncsics Mihály street 110. Csepel. The owner is ÉMI ’95 Bt.
1211 Csepel. They produce 9 dufferent types of beer.
name: Rizmajer Kézműves Sörház

description:
RJ Rockers Brewing Company became Spartanburg's first brewery in 1997, when owner and brewer Mark Johnsen set out on a mission to provide the people of the Upstate with the best microbrewed beer they had ever tasted. Mark, a New Jersey native, had loved brewing beer for his friends and family for years.

Following his service in the 1991 Gulf War, Mark was stationed in Germany as a member of the United States armed forces, and he took this opportunity to learn as much as possible about brewing from the experts. By the time he was honorably discharged from the service, he was ready to take his beer to the public.
name: RJ Rockers Brewing Company

description: Located in historic Jackson Hole, Wyoming, The Roadhouse Brewing Co. brews beer as bold as the Tetons. Our brewers started out as homebrewers and we remain true to our roots. We’re passionate about our beer, the brewing process, history and culture and embrace the many flavors and styles from around the world that define the craft beer family. The same thirst for adventure and exploration that brought us to the Tetons resides in every batch we brew. Beer by beer we strive to cultivate and enhance the local craft beer experience in Jackson Hole and our neighboring communities. Beer to the people.
name: Roadhouse Brewing Company

description: At Roak Brewing Co., our goal is to deliver the highest quality craft beer brewed with the highest quality ingredients by the highest quality people
name: ROAK Brewing Company

description:
"When it comes to making great beer, Roanoke Railhouse has a 1 track mind."


Anyone can brew beer. Brewing great beer, however, requires science and technology and we have what it takes.

Our brewmaster, Ryan Worthington has an International Diploma in Brewing Technology. He is a graduate of the World Brewing Academy/Siebel Institute of Technology in Chicago and the 
Doemens Academy in Grafelfing, Germany

Our optimized, custom built brewhouse gives our Brewmaster the right tools to brew great beer. This combination of talent and tools is our recipe for success.
name: Roanoke Railhouse Brewing Company

description:
Roaring Fork Beer Company was launched in 2013 by Chase Engel, a long time professional brewer with a dream of producing creative beers to match the changing seasons. From our home base in Carbondale, Colorado we brew and package exceptional beers for distribution throughout the Roaring Fork Valley. We are dedicated to producing fresh, approachable, and flavorful beers, while continuing to push the envelope with experimentation and barrel aging on a small batch scale.
 
Tasting Room Open M-Sat 2p-8p with brewery tours by appt.
name: Roaring Fork Beer Company

description: When Roc Brewing Co. began in the crisp cellaring walls of a suburban Rochester basement, they never imaged the future that was set forward. The ever infectious brewing bug had bitten both homebrewers Jonathan Mervine and Chris Spinelli. From the time the yeast was pitched it was unanimous this was their future. Joined by the emboldened encouragement of Chris’ mom and third partner Patty Spinelli, she was hooked by first sip. The new family began their many trials and tribulations of brewing, three tier law, legalese and to much to their chagrin ROC Brewing Co. was founded.
name: Roc Brewing Company

description:
Belgian trappist brewery.

The brewery is located inside the Abbey of Notre-Dame de Saint-Rémy, near the town of Rochefort, and has been brewing beer since 1595. There are approximately 15 monks resident at the monastery. The monks are very secretive about the brewing process, and the brewery is not open to the public, therefore much of the information publicly known about the brewery comes from only a few sources.

As with all other trappist breweries, the beer is only sold in order to financially support the monastery and some other good causes. The monks will not increase production based on demand or profit motives, but only enough to support themselves, resulting in a fairly limited supply of beer availability. In practice, there is currently no shortage through regular channels.

(Brewery  Abbey of Notre-Dame de Saint-Rémy)
name: Rochefort Brewery (Brasserie de Rochefort)

description: The Rochester Mills Beer Co. opened in 1998 in Downtown Rochester. Located in the historic Western Knitting Mill, the brewery is located on Water Street, just two blocks east of Main Street. Preserving the original character of the building, the brewery features original hardwood floors, columns, beams and exposed brick walls. The menu features a broad selection of eclectic American cuisine, all prepared with the freshest ingredients. From delectable appetizers, fresh salads, pizzas and pastas to delicious entrees and unique sandwiches, the menu has something for everyone and a kids menu is available. Special amenities include an outdoor patio, pool tables,  Greenhorn Music Night every Thursday starting at 9pm, and live entertainment every Friday, and Saturday nights starting at 10pm. The Martini Lounge is available for private parties.
name: Rochester Mills Beer Company

description: We are a local brewpub making making hand crafted beers and wood-oven fired pizzas in the Northland. We anticipate being in operation by the end of the summer, 2013.
name: Rock & Run Brewery

description:
Matt began the brewery in the basement of our home in 1997. Wow! I can't believe I let him do that! His first beer was Whitetail Ale. A nice crisp refreshing golden ale. I was really enjoying wheat beers at the time. I guess that's why I let him start Rock Art! The Brewery was ready to leave home and move to it's own place down the road in Morrisville, VT in 2001. We are still located there and now have a terrific space for people to come and visit. Come on by and say hello!

Our Mission is to offer our friends and family a wonderful beer at the end of the day!
name: Rock Art Brewery

description:
Our brewers eat, drink and sleep beer. They’re equal parts scientist, artist and beer geek. So, while every Rock Bottom brewer is passionate about their craft, they also put their own signature into every beer.

In other words, there is a unique beer menu at every Rock Bottom in addition to our core line up of consistent flavor profiles that you can expect at any Rock Bottom you visit nationwide.

But, you’re thirsty and want to know what beers you can expect down here, right?
name: Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery

description: We are a small production brewery in Columbia, Missouri focusing on brewing both classic and new styles.  We are currently only available in Mid-Missouri on draught but are expanding and will be adding a canning line in the fall of 2013.  Check out our facebook and Twitter pages for the latest news and updates on our new brewery.
name: Rock Bridge Brewing Company

description: Formerly Pale Ale Brewing - segued into Chesapeake Bay Brewing in 2001.
name: Rock Creek Brewing Company

description:
Welcome to Rock Harbor! We are located right in the heart of Downtown Rockland and serve fresh, high quality food and beverages. Our menu changes seasonally to take advantage of local ingredients and tastes. We have a dining area where customers have a great view of Main Street as well as a cozy horseshoe bar where you can watch all the sports games. We offer special events such as live bands, beer promotions and dinners, and much more! 

We offer a great selection of beer with 16 beers on tap daily, and Dan likes to change it up, so check them out often. We also have a full bar and experienced mixologists to create the perfect drink to suit your mood.

The brewery has been up and running since September. Dan is brewing on a regular basis to keep local, fresh Rock Harbor beer flowing through the taps. Be sure to check out his latest brews and stop in to tour the brewery and learn about the brewing process. He loves chatting about beers and recommending the perfect beer to every customer, so be sure to ask!
All our staff are here to make your dining and drinking experience the best ever. We look forward to serving you! Cheers!
name: Rock Harbor Brewing Company

description:
Making beer in Huntsville, Alabama! The Rocket City!

We are receiving some help from our friends at Blue Pants Brewing Brewery and will be contract brewing to start. We intend to move to full production soon thereafter!
name: Rocket Republic Brewing Company

description: Three years ago a group of Rockford natives made the decision to share their passion for fine beer and food with others in the form of a brewpub. Our home is the historic Prairie Street Brewhouse, an important part of Rockford’s history and currently coming back to life as a mixed-use development. Home to the original Rockford Brewing Company, this building was one of the first breweries in the nation, pumping out over 75,000 barrels a year and its peak. Our shiny new 15-barrel brewery is the backdrop to Rockford’s newest destination for handcrafted beer and food. We are proud and excited to bring this wonderful piece of Rockford history back to life and look forward to exceeding expectations.
name: Rockford Brewing Company

description: RBC produces world class beers using traditional and innovative brewing techniques and ingredients. As a company, we strive to create unique beers with influences from countries around the world including the United States, Belgium, Germany, the United Kingdom, and the newest emerging craft beer location that has the world watching; Michigan. Part of our niche is working closely with West Michigan farmers and local ingredients on a seasonal basis. We love to incorporate West Michigan agricultural products into our offerings!
name: Rockford Brewing Company

description:
Rob Leleszi and Ali Buinicky first connected over a rousing game of beer pong at a Christmas party in New York City in 2007. By their second date, it was clear that they would go on to do great things together-- it just took about six years to figure out what those things were. During that time, Rob cultivated his passion and skill for homebrewing and received an Associates Degree in Brewing Science from the Siebel Institute.  Then, with full support from Ali, he started an invaluable internship at Port Jeff Brewing Company in Long Island. 

It was a long commute from Brooklyn, and even longer work hours, but Rob's love for brewing only grew. His passion rubbed off on Ali, who had over the years become a self-professed beer snob, and she began reading up on the business side of brewing. Eventually it became clear that the two would open their own brewery.  They started scouting out the perfect locale for their business and stopped when they found the blossoming town of Derry, NH, in Ali’s home state.
name: Rockingham Brewing Company

description:
Rockmill is a small production organic brewery. Our beers are modeled after the brews of Wallonia, Belgium. Wallonia is the French-speaking region of the country located in the rural south along the French border. The water of this region contains a minerality very similar to the water profile found in the deep well located on our farm in Lancaster, Ohio.

Organic: We are committed to using all organic ingredients including hops.
name: Rockmill Brewery

description:
We are an Australian-owned and operated brewery lead by fifth and sixth generation convict descendants. Our craft beers will bring to life the true stories of early Australian convicts and settlers, beginning with traditional, great tasting ales - just like your grandfathers’ grandfather drank.

Rocks Brewing Co beers will amaze beer lovers with their complex and sophisticated flavours, which are achieved while staying true to our simple brewing process -
“Nothing but Barley, Hops, Water & Yeast.”

Our first batch of Red Ale was brewed September 2008. Since then we have created plenty of other beers, along with a cider.

Rocks beers are currently available on tap in selected pubs and restaurants as well as in bottles at good craft beer retailers. Keep an eye out for our distinctive logos on the taps and in the fridges of all good drinking establishments, we're bound to be there.
name: Rocks Brewing Company

description: When you need a burger and a beer, you better get to the Rockslide brewpub in downtown Grand Junction, Colorado. We’ve got handcrafted brews that keep our loyal local crowd coming back for more, and a menu for comfort food fans.
name: Rockslide Brewing Co

description: The Rocky Mount Brewmill is a concept that would transform a picturesque, historic mill into a multi-faceted brewery.
name: Rocky Mount Brewmill

description:
Good local brewery that is only interested in creating great beers.  The whole team here is a solid group who enjoy the different flavors available.  They are best known for their award winning cherry beer - Da Yoopers.  Prices are cheap and the beer is good!

This place embodies the true nature of home brewing by encouraging its staff to design and brew their own beer to sell.
name: Rocky Mountain Brewery

description: Brewing artisanal lagers and ales in Rocky Point, Long Island.
name: Rocky Point Artisan Ales

description: Rocky River Brewing Company is an award-winning brewpub and restaurant located in Rocky River, Ohio. The 5,000 sq. ft. dining and pub area, styled in a turn-of-the-century architectural style, offers a casual and family-friendly dining experience for lunch, dinner or late night excitement.
name: Rocky River Brewing

description: Douglas County, Colorado's oldest, and Castle Rock's onliest Brew Pub. Serving up American Grill and Crafted Beer since 1999.
name: Rockyard Brewing Company

description: In the spirit of the generations of Jordan brewers, the Roets Family would like to bring the craft of brewing back to the City of Jordan.
name: Roets Jordon Brewery

description: Rogers Beer is a contract brewing company in Rochester, NY
name: Rogers Beer Company

description:
Rogness Brewing Company specializes in creating small, handcrafted batches of beer. As decade long owners of a successful homebrew supply shop in Austin, TX, Forrest and Diane Rogness have experimented with many special hops and exotic ingredients. They are ready to share some of their more unique recipes with the world. Look for Rogness beers on draught, in cans, and bottles this Spring.
Forrest and Diane have been married for 13 years and have a 7 year old daughter named Anna. Forrest started brewing in 1990 and purchased Austin Homebrew Supply in 1999. He holds a degree in Photography.
Diane is originally from Iceland. She met Forrest at the University of Iowa and holds a degree in Art History.
The rest of the team is Dan Wheeler, David Heath, David Ebel, Mark Tovar, Tony Bailey, and Daron White. Including Forrest, they have over 65 years of brewing experience.
name: Rogness Brewing Company

description: Rogue Ales was founded in 1988 by Jack Joyce, Rob Strasser and Bob Woodell, three corporate types who wanted to go into the food/beverage industry. Rogue's first brewpub was located in Ashland, Oregon and was a 10bbl brewsystem. Rogue opened a second brewpub, 15bbl brewsystem, in May 1989 located in Newport, Oregon. Rogue closed its Ashland operation in 1997, after the great flood destroyed the place. In 1991, the 15bbl system, named Howard after John Maier's former boss, from the Newport brewpub was transferred across the bay to the current brewery and upgraded to a 30bbl system. In 1998 Rogue bought a 50bbl brewsystem, named Kobe. Kobe is the only brewsystem in use. Tours: We offer brewery tours every day at 3 pm (followed by a distillery tour at 4pm). Go up to the bar inside the brewery (Brewers on the Bay) and check in with the bartender and the tour will commence. Please call ahead if you have a large group and or to verify the tour time...Brewer's on the Bay phone is 541-867-3664. The view from Brewers on the Bay includes the marina (outside), and the bottling line and brew kettles (inside).
name: Rogue Ales

description:
The Rohrbach Brewing Company has been brewing handcrafted ales and lagers in Rochester for over a decade! Loyal Rohrbach customers from near and far continue to prove that there is a market for premium high quality lagers and ales.

All of our ales and lagers are made with only the finest ingredients available worldwide; two-row malted barley from Belgium and the freshest hops from Europe and the Pacific Northwest . Our lagers and ales are delivered cold and fresh, with no artificial preservatives or flavor deteriorating pasteurization, which insures that your customers enjoy them at their peak freshness.
name: Rohrbach Brewing Company

description:
In 1431 monks from the monastery founded in Straubing Metten a brewery restaurant. In 1929, the parade began in the summer of basement of the highway. Here the deep storage cellars were ideal for cold storage of the beer. Until today in our traditional brewing process of beer produced. We use only the best raw materials that we process gently and fermented with yeast from pure bred to beer. We leave our beers time to mature in the storage cellar. Through love and the passion of all employees are Röhrl-quality beers beers by master craftsmen. Brewed according to the Bavarian Purity Law of 1516.

In 2008, took over the family owners Sillner the traditional brewery Röhrl. The brewery Röhrl has always been a family business with a centuries-long tradition in Straubing.
name: Röhrlbräu Straubing

description: Created by Co-Owners Lars Bennett, Brandy Friday, Mark Heffernan, and Sue Heffernan, Rök House Brewing Company is pleased to be finally serving you, our loyal Rökmeisters, the craftiest brews we can muster!
name: Rök House Brewing Company

description: Rolling Meadows Brewery began as an appreciation of good beer and a desire to create a fine product utilizing the abundance of natural resources on our family farm. When Caren Trudeau and her son, Chris Trudeau established the brewery in 2011, they drew upon their combined experiences of homebrewing, craftsmanship and design detail to create the Rolling Meadows brand. Together with Connie and Dustin Regan they have been crafting Rolling Meadows' signature beers- Lincoln's Lager, Springfield Wheat and Abe's Ale- and bringing them to the Springfield area.
name: Rolling Meadows Microbrewery

description: Rooftop handcrafts its beers in small batches under the close personal attention of our brewers. Our highest priority is brewing high quality and consistent craft beer, with an eye towards innovative and unique beer recipes.
name: Rooftop Brewing Company
