description:
Rooie Dop is a craft brewery from Utrecht, The Netherlands. Rooie Dops wants to make awesome beer. Flavorful, sometimes experimental beer. Brewers and craft beer drinkers are passionate about beer and want to have a good time and good beer. And we totally agree on that.

We like to brew flavorful, interesting beers. American beer styles, such as a hoppy India pale ale and a full bodied imperial stout, are our favorites. However, we also like to use unconventional ingredients in traditional beers as well. We dont’ care about style guidelines, we care about flavor.

Also Rooie Dop does a lot of collaboration brews. We’ve already made collaborations with breweries from the Netherlands, England, Denmark and Brazil. It’s fun to develop a recipe together and to learn from each other. And of course having fun with what you like most, brewing, talking about and drinking beer.

By exporting our beers to other countries, we show the rest of the world that craft beer is growing in the Netherlands. And with success: early 2013 Rooie Dop was awarded the title “Best new brewer in the Netherlands” by the international website RateBeer.com. Rooie Dop is now exporting to over 20 countries and is one of the fastest growing breweries in the Netherlands.
name: Rooie Dop

description:
Pittsburgh is a city steeped in a rich history, climbing up from numerous hillsides, to spanning and wrapping around the banks of the three rivers.

With the northern banks of the Allegheny and Ohio rivers serving as the background, the Rooney Family opened their first family pub on the corner of Corey and General Robinson Streets, later to be home to Three Rivers Stadium.

The Rooney family is famous for their Irish roots, football, racetracks and soon will be known for another part of their storied past: BEER! Their roots go back to the turn of the 20th century when Dan Rooney (Father of Art Sr. – “The Chief”) opened their family pub on the corner of Corey and General Robinson Streets, later to be home to Three Rivers Stadium.

In 1933, the family would expand the business to brewing at the General Braddock Brewing Company, in Braddock, Pennsylvania. Four Beers were produced: Rooney’s Irish Red Ale, Rooney’s Lager, Rooney’s Pilsner and Veterans & Civilian Pilsner / Lager blend. The handcrafted family brewing heritage continues today, at the historic Pennsylvania Brewing Company. The Rooney’s celebrate both its Celtic and Pittsburgh Pride with the next generation of brews with Rooney’s Old Irish Ale and Rooney’s Lager.
name: Rooney's Beer Company

description: Roosevelt Brewing Company and Public House is eastern New Mexico's premier craft brewery. We specialize in craft ales and lagers, served up alongside delicious wood-fired cuisine. There's something for everyone at Roosevelt Brewing Company.
name: Roosevelt Brewing Company & Public House

description: Paris Kentucky's FIRST Micro Brewery located in the heart of the downtown business district in an restored 1880 Main Street Mercantile Store Front.
name: Rooster Brew

description: Roosterfish Brewing’s history begins in 1990 when the Wildflower Café was founded by owner Doug Thayer.  A microbrewery was in the original plans for the business but was not feasible at the time due to the high cost of equipment and space.  The Wildflower Café had enormous success, which helped the inspiration for the Crooked Rooster Brewpub’s opening in 1998, again founded by Doug Thayer.  Throughout the running of these side-by-side businesses, Doug always had brewing on his mind and began to experiment in 2002 with home brewing.  Receiving excellent feedback on his brews from several beer aficionados, Roosterfish Brewing’s first official beer, Black Walnut Nut Brown Ale (now known as Original Nut Brown Ale) was unveiled at the Crooked Rooster and Wildflower Café in 2004.  This was shortly followed with the Butternut Pale Ale, now known as Dog Tooth Pale Ale.  The drastic name changes occurred because the originals were rejected due to “implied ingredients” that weren’t actually present in the beers.
name: Roosterfish Brewing Co.

description: Opened in 1994, Kym and Pete Buttschardt opened the first Roosters Brewing Company on Historic 25th Street in Downtown Ogden. Roosters in Layton opened in 2005.
name: Roosters Brewing Co

description:
Roots Brewing Company Inc was founded by home brewers and friends, Jason Parrish and Russell Scimeca, who desired to share their love of well-crafted beers with others.

Our brewery is a local original. It has been custom-designed and fabricated, in part, in Central New York State.
name: Roots Brewing Company

description:
Roscoe, New York; also known as Trout Town USA is internationally recognized as one of the best outdoors town in the world. It has received awards and honors from numerous publications including World Fishing Networks, Ultimate Fishing Town in 2011.

The people that make up the Roscoe Beer Company are folks that enjoy the great outdoors, embrace their community and value all the great things our great country has to offer. We are business owners, mothers, fathers, fishermen, Hunters, bikers, horsemen, educators and hikers. We work hard, play hard and absolutely enjoy a great beer when the time is right! We all have very strong ties to Roscoe and believe that a town as all American as ours deserves a beer of its very own!
name: Roscoe Beer Company

description:
Harkening back to old world brewing styles, Roscoe’s Hop House uses the highest quality malts and hops to bring forth this smooth, bright-flavored Amber Ale. With a nod to the past, this nicely balanced, true ale is brewed using traditional brewing methods for a unique flavor profile.  The password to our best kept secret is found inside the bottle.

This is brewed by Genesee Brewing Co.
name: Roscoe's Hop House

description: We are a beer production facility with a tap room. You can purchase beer by the pint or take a growler home. Also, coming soon you will be able to pick up a keg for special occasions.
name: Roseville Brewing Company

description:
The Roslyn Brewing Company has been brewing hand-crafted and full-flavored beers in the old world tradition since 1990. Our beers are excellent, full-bodied, German-style lagers reminiscent of those brewed by the immigrant miners in our hometown of Roslyn, Washington at the turn of the century. We use only the finest ingredients, including malted barley grown in the Northwest, hops grown in the Yakima Valley, and ice cold snow-fed water from the heart of the Cascades, to produce a full-bodied brew with a flavor that some say has been missing in domestic beers since the enactment of Prohibition.
Our goal is to continue Roslyn's tradition of brewing excellence and bring it to beer lovers everywhere. Try one of our signature lagers today in our taproom or at your local watering hole. We think you will agree that you can taste the tradition of quality.
name: Roslyn Brewing Company

description: Founded in December of 2008, this company has been working hard to develop beers that can take the world by storm. Before there was a Roth Brewing Company, the guys started as most new breweries do, with homebrewing. After hearing endless rave reviews of their beers, they decided to jump in head first and open this amazing company. It might be said that prophecies were fulfilled on the day that they took up brewing, but only time shall tell..
name: Roth Brewing Company

description:
In the middle of one of the most beautiful landscapes in the Biosphere Reserve Rhön, we are at home. Where today man and nature work hand in hand, the protection of nature enjoys a special status. With the awareness of this responsibility we brew with passion, now in its fifth generation of our family brewery, special beers of the highest quality that are typical of our landscape.

Today, enjoy the unique pleasure of this unadulterated taste of original purity as many beer lovers far beyond the borders of the Rhön addition have.
We cordially invite you to taste our specialty beers and discover what makes Rother beers different from others. Cheers.
name: Rother Bräu

description: With nine different varieties of hops growing at my Kerhonkson farm house, there will always be something new to try on tap.
name: Rough Cut Brewing Co.

description:
We like beer. And word on the street is you do too. So you’ve been petitioning with your boss for beer breaks instead of smoke breaks, and trying to get a tap handle installed in the lunch room. There’s nothing wrong with that. That’s thinking outside the box right? 

Here at Rough Draft, we like to reward that forward thinking with handcrafted beers that are as unique in character as those who drink it. We favor style over perfection and take joy in sharing our great-tasting creations with those who simply love to try new beer. 

The beers that prove to be winners in our tasting room will be the ones we put into distribution.
name: Rough Draft Brewing Company

description:
Roughtail’s mission is to create award-winning beers that push the limits of what a beer is perceived to be, while producing what customers want it to be.

Roughtail Brewing Company will be a local brewery specializing in craft-brewed beers brewed according to our award-winning proprietary recipes. Craft beer is defined as beer produced in small batches by independent breweries in the traditional manner. Moreover, it is beer produced with a focus on quality, detail and taste, which differentiates itself from the mass marketed light lagers such as Budweiser and Miller.
name: Roughtail Brewing Company

description:
Round Guys Brewing Company, located in Lansdale, PA, developed from the ghastly mind of chief Round Guy and head brewer, Scott Rudich. Looking for a quick exit out of the treacherous confines of the corporate world, Round Guys Brewing Company jumped onto the scene in late 2011, early 2012 and hasn't looked back. 

In 2013, Round Guys Brewing Company made waves by brewing up a now renowned BerlinerWeiss (Featured in Draft Magazine 10/13 and scored a 91. Featured on Brewers Network). In 2014, Round Guys Brewing Company received city wide recognition for placing a top 3 beer in the Philadelphia region's Beervitational during Philly Beer Week with Fear of a Brett Planet, a 100% Brettanomyces fermented Pale Ale. 

Other beers in its portfolio include Round Guys Brewing Company's goto Sundown Saison and the ever beloved Kiss Off IPA. 

The brewery features a full menu on site, including 1 specialty cask beer along side four seasonal, monthly, and rare offerings.
name: Round Guys Brewing Company

description: Small small brewery focused on quality craft beer. Growler sales only at this time.
name: Roundabout Brewery

description:
A microbrewery on the Rosal Island in Finnish archipelago.

Quality beer for quality times.
name: Rousal Brygghus

description: (No longer brewing)
name: Routh Street Brewery and Grille

description: Rowdy's Brew Co. is a micro brewing beer machine that builds bad ass beers. But even more awesome is the on premise tasting room for you to try said bad ass beers all at once, or one at a time, what ever floats your cute little precious adorable boat... But wait! There's more! At our tasting room you can fill a growler and go home and drink all by your self! Hold on, hey maybe you should come back, it was probably lonely drinking that growler on your own. Besides, it's empty now, you need to refill it anyway. Sweet! Welcome back! We missed you, for reals!
name: Rowdy's Brew Co

description:
Where we make the good stuff…
The building where the brewery is located was built in the early 1900′s. It is located on North Third Street within two blocks of the historic square and Franklin County Courthouse in Chambersburg. A three-story, industrial all-brick building consists of 20,000 sq. ft in total area. The brewery is currently located in the basement and is 5,500 sq. ft. of classic brick and old pine timber, which has been restored to its original look and texture.

The brewhouse that christens this humble abode traveled from Anchorage, Alaska. It is a 7 BBL JV Northwest Electric System and is paired with three 20 BBL fermenting tanks allowing Roy Pitz to brew twice a day. At this point, the brewery can brew up to 180 kegs per month at maximum capacity.
name: Roy Pitz Brewing Company
Royal Bavaria Brewhouse, Restaurant and Biergarten

description:
The Royal Oak Brewery opened in 1995 in trendy downtown Royal Oak, Michigan. Located one block east of Main Street, it has become an area institution. The comfortable atmosphere and hometown feel make it a destination for locals and visitors alike. The brewery serves 6-7 fresh beers on tap daily.

The Royal Oak Brewery brews our award winning ales and lagers on a 14 Barrel Specific Mechanical system. The brewing system was custom fabricated to fit precisely behind our large bar where our guests can interact with our brewer, Tim Selewski, and enjoy a pint at the same time. With the design of our brewhouse and our state-of-the-art beer delivery system, the Royal Oak Brewery can offer up to 7 house beers on tap at any time. To continue to produce the best possible product, we use only the 4 basic ingredients in our beer: water, malt, hops and yeast. We purchase the highest quality ingredients from around the world to produce the freshest and finest beers available in Oakland County. For more information about our brewery or to setup a tour, please contact our brewmaster, Tim, at the Royal Oak Brewery.
name: Royal Oak Brewery

description:
For 22 years, the Rubicon Brewing Company has been a jewel of a capital city culture. It’s not just because of the award-winning fine ales and great food served up by the Rubicon. Within the past four years, under the auspices of owner Glynn Phillips, the Rubicon has become renowned for its community outreach and philanthropic efforts. It’s support for Sacramento kids and various people in need that has transformed the Rubicon into a vital cog of Sacramento life.

“This pub is part of the community, and I don’t just mean geographically,” said Glynn Phillips, owner of the Rubicon since June 2005. “It’s important for us to give back as much as we can to show our appreciation. I really feel like we’re connected with the people and that they can trust that they’ll feel at home here.”

Brewmaster Scott Cramlet has felt so at home that he’s stayed more than two decades. In October 2006, he experienced a thrill very few craft brewers achieve in their careers: stepping on stage to receive a gold medal at the Great American Beer Festival. Cramlet won for his Winter Wheatwine, and followed that achievement with a silver GABF medal in 2009. In the craft brewing industry, consistent victories in the respected blind-panel tasting contest bring international acclaim.

“We’ve gone through so many different phases during my time here, but we’re very happy with things right now,” he said. “There is a lot of hope for future and expanding our business. We hope to double our capacity and get more of our products in bottles and more of a market presence -- not too huge but bigger than we are now. I’m certainly very proud to work for a place that has been around so long and has its place in history. We are not the new kid on street. I tell people how long I’ve been at the Rubicon, and I hear people say, ‘Wow, that’s impressive.’”

In some ways, the transition from founder Ed Brown to Phillips was more than a decade in the making. Brown had known Phillips since the 1970s as the good friend of Brown’s nephews in the Bay Area town of Moraga. As Phillips paid his dues in the craft brewing industry – first at Great Basin Brewing in Sparks, Nev., and next at Marin Brewing in Larkspur – Phillips kept in close contact with Brown. Buoyed by his management experience at Marin Brewing, Phillips was confident that he could handle the passing of the baton at the Rubicon.
name: Rubicon Brewing Company

description:
Ruckus Brewing Company brews products of exceptional quality, re-invigorates brands of historical significance, and services a growing craft brew market with products that satisfy the most discerning pallets."

With Ruckus Brewing you’ll find a commitment to produce high-quality, full-flavored beer by applying both European and American brewing processes. Our line of ales, lagers, and IPAs contain a unique blend of whole flower hops, Belgian grains, selects malts, and the finest spices to satisfy the taste buds of even the most inexperienced beer drinkers.
name: Ruckus Brewing Company

description:
Good times, great food and hand-crafted ales are served up daily at Rudder's Seafood Restaurant  & Brew Pub.  Soak up the ambiance as you dine on fresh seafood and sip premium brewed beers, brewed on-site at South West Nova’s only microbrewery restaurant. 

Just a five-minute walk from downtown, this business is famous for its delicious seafood, excellent service and spacious wrap-around deck overlooking Yarmouth's waterfront.  The 18th- century beamed ceilings and thick plank floors of Rudder’s Seafood Restaurant are part of the draw for thousands of locals and tourists annually. 

Live entertainment can be enjoyed most nights of the week. A 12-slip floating dock marina is located on the property for the convenience of nautical guests. Rudders also offers customized private banquets and meeting facilities.

Recognized as the social hub of the waterfront, this landmark is a lively place year-round.   Expect smiles, attentive service and the occasional song from Rudder's carefully selected staff.
name: Rudder's Seafood Restaurant & Brew Pub

description:
Our philosophy is simple:
Create a fun and exciting atmosphere
Serve authentic made from scratch food
Provide gracious and hospitable service
Deliver it all at a great value

To guarantee excellence we buy the highest quality ingredients and prepare them to bring out the best flavors in every dish. Our chicken wings are cooked fresh daily to ensure our signature taste. Fresh and never frozen chicken breast, pork, mahi and salmon are delivered daily.

We buy only grass fed "all natural" steaks and hamburgers to ensure the highest quality. We support local farmers by purchasing our seafood and produce locally whenever available. Our desserts, pizza dough, and house specialty "Chipas" are made daily from scratch as are all our sauces, dressings and soups.

We promote friendly, unobtrusive service delivered with a smile. Most important to us is you, our guests. We strive to be a neighborhood restaurant where families with children, professionals on business, or couples out on a date can all feel welcome and comfortable.
name: Ruddy Duck Brewery and Grill

description:
2014 rolls around, and after 11 years of planning, the idea began to be a reality. Rutherford County’s first brewery was born. Our mission is to provide our customers with fresh, local brewed beer and a relaxing and fun atmosphere to enjoy it in.

Our logo has both personal and local meaning. It is a tribute to our best friend, Merlin, the Great Dane who passed away in 2013 at the ripe old age of 9. We are animal lovers, so honoring our best friend is important to us.

Since Rutherfordton has been pronounced many different ways, we wanted to embrace the community, and  the “Ruff’ton” pronunciation.
name: Ruff'ton Brewhouse

description: Craft brewery focused on ales.
name: Ruhlman Brewery

description: Captain Frank Ruhstaller was California’s Premier Pioneer Brewer. He embodied the Spirit of California, partnering with local hop and barley farmers to grow the finest ingredients for his beers. 134 years later, Ruhstaller remains committed to the Captain’s legacy. Our beer is made with California hops and barley, grown by farmers we know and trust like Dave & Dia Utterback of the historic Signorotti Hop Ranch in Sloughhouse. When you enjoy a Ruhstaller, you experience the rich, nuanced flavors only California Grown ingredients can deliver. Enjoy!
name: Ruhstaller Beer

description:
Set between Intercourse and Bird-in-Hand, PA, and located on the second floor of the Lancaster Beer & Wine Gallery, Rumspringa Brewing Company offers the best in craft-brewed beers in the heart of Lancaster County. The area’s first nano-brewery produces tastes to satisfy everyone from a citrusy IPA to a robust Stout. 

Rumspringa offers the best in craft-brewed beers in the heart of Lancaster County. Located on the 2nd floor of the newly remodeled Lancaster Beer & Wine Gallery, there’s a taste to satisfy everyone from a citrusy IPA to a robust Stout. Visit the Barn Cafe for all your favorite Rumspringa beers on tap, plus Mount Hope Wine flights and delicous Lancaster County favorites.

Sow your wild oats at Rumspringa Brewing Company in Intercourse, PA!
name: Rumspringa Brewing Company

description:
The Run of the Mill Public House & Brewery is a 14 barrel brew pub specializing in hand-crafted beer and casual pub fare. All of our beers flow directly from our brewery.  We use only the finest imported malts and domestic hops available to bring you the tastiest and finest selection of beers.

Owner Geoff Houghton renovated an abandoned Mill and made it a place where business men and women meet, families gather and friends hang out.

In addition to our house-made beers, we have an eclectic Pub menu featuring home made food. Our talented chefs serve delightful appetizers, wraps, sandwiches, vegetarian fare, hearty entrees and imaginative daily specials.  Come in make yourself at home and enjoy a fresh brew and meal.
We are located on Saco Island in Saco Maine.  From Memorial Day to Labor Day come enjoy our outdoor seating and bar overlooking the Saco River, we offer a grill menu and raw bar.
name: Run of the Mill Public House and Brewery

description:
"Where Good Friends Meet" located in the historic Oakland Pharmacy in Kalamazoo, MI

We're a small boutique brewery featuring over 8 hand-crafted beers on tap. We're unique by offering live entertainment 6 nights a week and never a cover. BYOF (Bring Your Own Food) or order in for delivery by one of the many local food joints.

Experience the down home, relaxed atmosphere where the beer pours freely and there's never a cover. Make sure you visit Captn Stooby our mascot.
name: Rupert's Brew House

description: Rush River Brewing Company  in River Falls, WI provides locally brewed ales throughout Wisconsin and Minnesota. Owner/Brewers Nick Anderson and Dan Chang started the company in 2004 with the help of a third partner, Robbie Stair after relocating to Minneapolis from Seattle. Robbie owned a farm in scenic Maiden Rock, WI just above the confluence of the Rush River and Lake Pepin. After converting a pole barn into a fully functioning brewery, the trio produced a limited quantity of draft-only beers while steadily building a reputation  for brewing high quality ales. After two and a half years of growth, it became evident that bottled beer was the next move to be made. Luckily, the town of River Falls, WI came to the table with an offer to build a custom building for a brand new brewery. In 2007, the new facility opened its doors with the addition of a refurbished bottling line, and additional fermenters. The new Rush River brewery was now poised to increase production and distributorship. We now have ten distributors in two states and produce nine brands including seasonals. Our small size still allows us to experiment with new styles, while the larger capacity for brewing and storage keep our regular brands flowing out the door.
name: Rush River Brewing

description: Rushing Duck brewing Co. is a small craft brewery based out of Orange County, NY. Our plan is to produce a wide variety of tasty beers. Hoppy, malty, American-styled, Belgian influenced, barrel aged, sours, you name it. First and foremost we will be brewing beer that we like to drink. We hope you do too.
name: Rushing Duck Brewing Company

description:
Located in Strawberry Hill, Surrey, British Columbia, Russell Brewing Company has been brewing premium craft beer since 1995 using the finest ingredients available. Our beer is 100% natural and has no preservatives.We don't pasteurize which means we dont kill the taste you drink our beer just the way it is brewed. 

Fanatical about beer, we believe that the passion and quality that goes into creating Russell beer comes through in the taste. 

Our sister brewery, Fort Garry Brewery is Manitobas oldest microbrewery and has been producing original beers since 1930. Both Russell Brewing and Fort Garry Brewing are wholly owned subsidiaries of BC-based Russell Breweries Inc. a public company listed on the TSX Venture Exchange (TSX:V:RB).
name: Russell Brewing

description:
Russian River Brewing Company (RRBC) was originally owned by Korbel Champagne Cellars in Guerneville, California and was founded on their historic and beautiful property amidst vineyards and redwoods near the Russian River. When Korbel decided to get out of the beer business in 2003, they generously offered the brewmaster, Vinnie Cilurzo and his wife Natalie the rights to the brand. Russian River Brewing might be something completely different now if it weren't for this incredible opportunity.
On April 3, 2004, Vinnie and Natalie reopened RRBC as a brewpub in downtown Santa Rosa to great success and began self-distributing to nearby clients. In 2008, they opened a production brewery about 1 mile from their brewpub allowing them to triple production, take on more accounts locally, and distribute some beer in 4 more states.
name: Russian River Brewing Company

description: Welcome to the first brewery in Gaston County. Respect Your Heritage.
name: Rusted Mill Artisan Ales

description:
Kenosha's Oldest Brewery
Stepping in to Rustic Road Brewing Company is a unique experience, right in the heart of downtown Kenosha. We make our own beers right on site in small batches in the old Wisconsin artisan style. We pride ourselves in being unique enough to stand out, but unassuming enough to be enjoyable by everyone. We love great beer and love to share it with Kenosha!
name: Rustic Road Brewing Company

description:
Well this story starts about twenty years ago when Me and the Mrs. were a just a little younger. See the city life didn’t do it, neighbor’s too close or just plain freedom of the country, Something got us seeking a different path? We moved out from the Capital city to our new Beaver dam address, 30 acres with an old barn and a pond near here is home and home is good. Wouldn’t trade it for another pond anywhere! Peaceful country living, it feeds the soul, drink some in as you spend a little time with us. 

We got busy, raised the little ones up, built a business and worked hard on the old homestead remembering to be grateful each day for the life we have carved out. What a long strange trip it has been so far! We have learned ambition and hard work get you where you want to go, it just takes some time and a lot of patience! 

Austin and I Started brewing several years ago, we loved cooking together and drinking too so it was a natural progression. Brewing and sharing with friends our fresh all grain brews became an obsession for us. Our passion is to brew great local beers by sourcing the finest quality ingredients available and creating craft recipes that highlight the best qualities of those ingredients. Please stop by our brewery to enjoy the freshest beer available. After you have tried one we hope you will agree,“You never forget your first Beaver”
name: Rusty Beaver Brewery

description: Western New York's newest craft brewery specializing in hand crafted brews that are just a little different
name: Rusty Nickel Brewing Co.

description:
If our building could talk it would speak of rugged workers who got by on the determination in their hearts, the strength of their backs and the dirt on their hands. We proudly dedicate every ounce of our beer to those whose efforts have forged the American work ethic. So grab a cold one and pay tribute to the past by making the most of the present.

Our team of passionate craft beer enthusiasts firmly believes in making great beer that is fun and approachable. We know that putting a smile on your face is just as important as putting a beer in your hand, and we plan on taking over the world one state and one craft beer drinker at a time.
name: Rusty Rail Brewing Company

description:
The mission of Rusty Truck Brewing Company is simply to brew great beer in a great place. The cool climate, access to wonderful water and the best Oregon grown hops, makes Oregon, and especially the Oregon coast, a great place to brew great beer.

We strive to use the best possible natural ingredients and old fashioned hands on brewing methods to make small batches of unique, distinctive and great tasting brews.

At the same time, we are striving through our enterprise to help our local economy by increasing tourism, providing local employment and supporting other local businesses and community based charitable organizations.
name: Rusty Truck Brewing

description:
The vision of Mary Ann and Mike Brigham – creating a neighborhood pub featuring hand-crafted beers brewed on site in gleaming copper tanks. The vision became a reality when the Brigham’s opened Ruth McGowan’s Brewpub in 2002. Since opening, Mary Ann and Mike remain hands-on owners

There are copper tanks which have become part of the Pub’s unique and cozy ambiance. Everyone who walks through the Pub doors is immediately made to feel at home by the friendly staff. The beers brewed on site have won many awards. All the elements of Mary Ann and Mike’s vision.

Brewmaster, Tim Gallagher, supplies the Pub with a selection of beer for any taste preference. Since Tim started brewing, he has created new popular beer recipes, production has more than doubled and their signature Cloverdale Ale has skyrocketed in popularity. CLOVER- DALE beer is now served on tap at several venues around the county, as well as sold in bottles at a number of retail outlets.

The Pub’s team (service staff, kitchen staff, Tim, Mary Ann and Mike) is dedicated to brewing the best hand-crafted beers, serving good food and keeping the atmosphere friendly.

Expansion is in the future to keep up with the demand for Ruth McGowan’s beer.
name: Ruth McGowans Brewpub
Saarfürst Merziger Brauhaus am Yachthafen GmbH

description: Since 1995 Sackets Harbor Brewing Company operates one of New York State’s oldest continuing microbreweries featuring both a working brewery and dining establishment situated on the shore of Lake Ontario.
name: Sackets Harbor Brewing Company

description: Sactown Union Brewery is a Production Brewery with a Tasting Room located in East Sacramento, CA (just three short blocks from Sac State!). We are community oriented, and celebrate history's social catalysts - those that bucked the status quo to make the world around them a better place! "We're not just brewing Beer; We're brewing Community."
name: Sactown Union Brewery

description: Goodyear, AZ first full production craft brewery and full service restaurant. Founded in 2011 honoring our countries military and first responders.
name: Saddle Mountain Brewing Company

description: Welcome to Saddlebock Brewery - the first production brewery in Northwest Arkansas. Since 2012, we've been brewing fine, European-style beers in an environmentally friendly facility. Saddlebock Brewery was named by Yahoo Travel as one of the coolest craft brewery tours in America, and Steve Rehbock, our founder, was recognized this year as an Arkansas Eco-Hero.
name: Saddlebock Brewery

description: SAGRA Beer is a young and dynamic Brand of craft beer that was born with the idea of changing the concept of beer in Spain. Under the obsession of developing a product with a 100 % Castilian flavor and making available to the already extensive Castilian cuisine , a product non-existent until now : Castilian beer.
name: SAGRA

description:
The Sailfish Brewpub is located in downtown Ft. Pierce in the 'Edgartown' Neighborhood. It is on the west side of the street between AE Backus Ave & Ave D. 

Stop by and sample our beers then stick around and enjoy a pint, or two…

The Brewpub is 21 and over only and please drink responsibly!
name: Sailfish Brewing Company, Inc.

description: Saint Archer Brewing Company was founded on a unique strain of creative talent: World-class brewers. Artists and musicians. Surfers, skateboarders, and snowboarders…. All coming together with passion and commitment to express our collective true love — handcrafted beer. Saint Archer's been a long time in the tank and we hope you taste our appreciation and gratitude in every sip.
name: Saint Archer Brewing Company

description:
Saint Arnold Brewing Company, located in Houston, is Texas' Oldest Craft Brewery. Our goal is to brew world class beers and deliver them to our customers as fresh as possible making them the best beers in Texas and Louisiana. Our customers are beer lovers - people that appreciate great, full-flavored beers.

Our small crew does everything at the brewery: brew the beer, filter the beer, keg the beer, bottle the beer, sell the beer and drink the beer. For us, this is a passion, not a job. We believe that this comes through in the beers we make. Our beers have soul.

We brew several different beers; some are year round, some are seasonal and a few are single batch brews. They are available in bars, restaurants, grocery stores, liquor stores and warehouse stores throughout Texas and Louisiana.

Our first keg of beer was shipped on June 9, 1994. Founded by Brock Wagner and Kevin Bartol, we chose Houston because, other than living here, this was the largest city in the country that did not have a microbrewery. Brock was a longtime homebrewer and had considered opening a brewery as far back as college, although that was quickly dismissed as a silly idea. Seven years after graduating, Brock revisited the idea, enlisted Kevin's help and the brewery was off and running. Kevin has since left the business after a bitter battle. (Just kidding - but don't you wish people wrote that when it was the truth?).

Please visit us if you are in Houston. We have a public open house every weekday at 3:00 PM and every Saturday starting at 11:00 AM.

Cheers!
name: Saint Arnold Brewing Company

description:
Saint Benjamin Brewing Company is a nano-brewery operating in Philadelphia, PA. The brewery is located in the historic carriage house and stables of the now defunct Finkenauer Brewery. The quickly growing brewery is known for their reinterpretation of classic styles, and designing new creations such as Inca and Liaison Saison. 

The business was established in 2010, and opened its doors in 2014.
name: Saint Benjamin Brewing Co.

description: Le Saint Graal est la première brasserie artisanale à ouvrir à Sainte-Thérèse. Depuis la fin octobre 2010, les amateurs de bières de spécialité peuvent se rendre sur la rue Turgeon, près du Cégep Lionel-Groulx, pour déguster les créations de Pascal Fex, tout en ayant la chance de déguster des produits d'autres microbrasseries québécoises, telles que Hopfenstark, Brasserie À la fût, Brasserie Dunham, Dieu du Ciel!, ainsi que les cidres signés Michel Jodoin. De la nourriture est aussi proposée sur place, allant de simples grignotines à des mets plus complets.
name: Saint Graal

description: New York State Certified Farm Brewery
name: Saint James Brewery

description: SJMB is a 15bbl brewery with a 32 seat tasting room. Our beers are currently being sold a liquor stores, bars, and restaurants across NW Indiana.
name: Saint John Malt Brothers Brewing

description: World-class Artisan Lagers
name: Saint Patrick's Brewing Company

description: Saint Somewhere is a small batch brewery, located in Tarpon Springs, Florida. We specialize in traditionally brewed, hand crafted Belgian Style Ales. Our first offerings are... Saison Athene , a bottle conditioned Saison with a spicy and moderately hoppy profile true to the traditions of the farmhouse ales of Wallonia. Lectio Divina,  brewed in the spirit of the abbey ales of Belgium. Brewed with the same care and attention to the Art of Brewing that is practiced in the monastic breweries of Belgium. Pays du Soleil, brewed with palmetto berries and hibiscus should be out this fall!
name: Saint Somewhere Brewing Company

description:
The brewing traditions of Saku Brewery reach back to the beginning of the 19th century. Then the Saku estate was owned by count Karl Friedrich Rehbinder who built a distillery and a brewery on his estate. The brewery was first documented in October 1820. It is believed that the production of beer, for the purpose of sale to pubs and taverns begun during the autumn of that year. From the end of 19th century onward Saku has remained among the leading breweries in Estonia.
In 1991 joint venture Saku Õlletehas was established. Since January 27, 1998 the shares of Saku Brewery were traded in the list on the Tallinn Stock Exchange. On September 20, 2008, the shares of Saku Õlletehase AS were delisted from Tallinn Stock Exchange. Today 100% of the shares are owned by Carlsberg Breweries.
Through large investments, Saku Brewery has become the market leader on the Estonian beer market. According to market research by ACNielsen in March 2009, Saku Brewery held 38,7% of the local market share. The total sales of beer by Saku amounted to 59 million litres in 2007.
Beverages of Saku Brewery are exported amongst other countries to Sweden (the only Estonian beer in the Systembolaget is Saku Kuld), Finland, Netherlands, England, Germany, Ireland and Canada. Saku's exports during the first five months of 2009 amounted to 3,12 million litres.
name: Saku Õlletehas

description:
When you're in the area for a visit or a resident of the NorthShore, Salem Beer Works is the spot to enjoy Bold American Food and Award Winning Beer. Along with the stellar service, warm inviting interior, seasonal patio and proximity to the Salem waterfront, Salem Beer Works will make your day or evening a memorable one.

Salem franchise of Boston Beer Works.
name: Salem Beer Works

description:
Salish Sea Brewing Co. is focused on providing the best the region has to offer in fine hand-crafted ales and lagers.

Jeff and Erika are regular people with real dreams. Erika and Jeff were friends in early college years who found each other later, dated, got married, started a family, then asked each other, “What do you really want to do in life…(when you grow up)?”  They liked beer, liked making beer, liked having a good time, and liked sharing their likes with others.

Their first homebrew settings were humble: Jeff’s nose sticking deep into a carboy of fermenting beer in a friend's small apartment.

They evolved from the stove top with extract batches, to setting up a small, all-grain batch brewery (8 gallon kettles - Thanksgiving turkey frying pots -  on propane burners with converted coolers for mash tuns) on the back porch,  to bigger and bigger goals.  From a 5 gallon pot on the stove (with a batch of extract syrup), to a 10 gallon converted cooler (with cracked grain), and kegs turned to kettles, to working on a 15 barrel brewery creating batches that go state to state, national, international...  They made batches at home for themselves, their friends, for weddings, parties, etc..  and realized this is what they wanted to do for a job.   Jeff apprenticed with a professional brewer (local celebrity Skip Madsen of Pike, Boundary Bay, American, etc…) and learned the pro angle of the trade.   They have seen the evolution, gone through it, appreciate it, and are happy to be where they are today.

Salish Sea Brewing Co. is a 10 bbl (310 gallon per batch) establishment.  We hope to brew twice a week, offering a variety of ales and the occasional lager and pilsner. 

Jeff and Erika have a  6-year-old little girl and a 2-year-old son.  They are family oriented and hope for the brewery to be family approachable.   Families are welcome, but this is a brewery with a tasting room, not a playground (we do not cater to children).  Please respect our space and the space of others.  Minors must be accompanied by an adult. 

Our roots are solid, our goals are lofty, but our dreams, aspirations, and hopes are high.  We want to create a place to showpiece our beers, invite your friends and families, and for you all to have a great time.

The Salish Sea Brewing Company is the real deal!

We have three 10bbl fermenters in place, the 10bbl bright tank, kettle, and mash up and running!  Please join us for a beer soon.
name: Salish Sea Brewing

description: We are located in downtown Vancouver, WA. The brick building is covered with ivy and has an open patio where, in warm weather, you can relax and enjoy one of our many fine hand crafted brews. Salmon Creek Brewery has brewed exceptional handcrafted ales since 1994. Starting as a small brewery and distributor in Woodland, WA, Salmon Creek Brewery now continues to offer artistically handcrafted  beers of European inspiration with a personal touch given by our Master Brewer. Over the years, Salmon Creek has maintained its commitment to innovation, exceptional quality and customer service.
name: Salmon Creek Brewery & Pub

description:
Salt Creek Brewery in Bedford, Indiana is Lawrence County's first and only craft brewery. Located in a comfortable and uniquely converted service garage north of Bedford on East Trogdon Lane.

This state of the art brewery was once a popular service garage. The former "alignment pit" at Salt Creek Brewery now serves as what may be the only open pit brewery in the U.S.
name: Salt Creek Brewery

description: Salt Springs Brewery plans to open summer of 2015, and will feature craft beer along with farm to table Tapas, stone fired pizza, fresh salads and more.
name: Salt Springs Brewery

description: Saltwater Brewery is more than a craft brewing company, it's a way of life. We are a team of native Floridians whose roots and values spur from a lifestyle that revolves around the Ocean.  This attachment and desire to maintain the world's greatest wonder, is what drove us to pursue a way to give back while continuing to refine our taste for our unique quality craft beers.
name: Saltwater Brewery

description: Craft brewery in Huntsville, Alabama
name: Salty Nut Brewery

description:
Our 1-barrel system nanobrewery will feature rotating brewers from local homebrewer clubs and local breweries. We’re excited to source local ingredients and work with experimental hops to create unique beer recipes. As always, we will do our best to include sour and wild ales into the mix.
Beers produced by the system will only be available in-house at Salud Beer Shop.
name: Salud Beer Shop
Sam Choy's Breakfast, Lunch, Crab & Big Aloha Brewery

description:
The Old Brewery at Tadcaster was established in 1758. It is Yorkshire’s oldest brewery. Traditional methods of brewing have been retained at The Old Brewery. The brewery still has its own cooper making and repairing all its oak casks. All Samuel Smith’s naturally conditioned draught beer is served from the wood. The original well at The Old Brewery, sunk in 1758, is still in use, with the brewing water being drawn from 85 feet underground.

Samuel Smith’s ales and stouts (except draught Sovereign and Extra Stout) are fermented in ‘stone Yorkshire squares’~ fermenting vessels made of solid slabs of slate ~ which give the beers a fuller bodied taste. 

The yeast used to ferment Samuel Smith’s ales has been of the same strain since the nineteenth century.  Samuel Smith’s grey Shire horses are stabled behind the Angel & White Horse, the pub next to the brewery.
name: Samuel Smith Old Brewery

description: We are a multi-tap brew pub/sports bar, pouring 7-10 house beers along with 40 guest beers. We offer a pub style menu to accompany our great tap list.
name: San Diego Brewing Co.

description: Family-owned craft microbrewery in the city of San Fernando. Tap room open Thursday-Saturday 12-10, Sunday 12-7.
name: San Fernando Brewing Co.

description: The San Luis Valley Brewing Company began with a desire to offer the finest in craft brews and fine food in an inviting atmosphere -- a place where community thrives. Scott and Angie Graber create the brews on the premise, our culinary staff prepares wonderful food, and local designer Kris Gosar has created a setting where it is easy to savor both. The Brewery opened in March, 2006. We invite you to browse around our website and learn more about us.
name: San Luis Valley Brewing Co

description:
Established in 1890, La Fabrica de Cerveza de San Miguel, Southeast Asia's first brewery produced and bottled what would eventually become one of the bestselling beers in the region. Within the span of a generation, San Miguel Beer would become an icon among beer drinkers.

By 1914, San Miguel Beer was being exported from its headquarters in Manila to Shanghai, Hong Kong and Guam. A pioneer in Asia, San Miguel established a brewery in Hong Kong in 1948, the first local brewer in the crown colony.

Today, San Miguel Beer--the Company's flagship product--is one of the largest selling beers and among the top 10 beer brands in the world. While brewing beer is the company's heritage, San Miguel subsequently branched out into the food and packaging businesses.
name: San Miguel Corporation

description:
The San Pedro Brewing Company is owned and operated by James Brown. James opened the restaurant in November 1999, after four months of construction to expand the former John T's Tavern, which had been in operation from the early 1990's until its closure in 1998.

The restaurant features great food, fresh ales and lagers brewed on the premises, live entertainment weekly, the finest in spirits, a kids menu, catering and party facilities, and the friendliest staff in San Pedro! Please take some time to browse our web-site. Come visit us soon and let us know what you think!
name: San Pedro Brewing Company

description: Sanctuary Brewing Company is dedicated to giving you a Relaxed and Entertaining craft beer experience.
name: Sanctuary Brewing Co.

description:
The two founding members of this amazing endeavor began as homebrewers. They ate their barley, smelled their hops and eventually grew up to be big and strong! After winning a few awards and having accolades from just about every single person who ever drank their beer (they wish), they knew it was a calling and not just a hobby. 
​
Sanctum is the natural extension of the way Jason and Scott live their lives. Their value for community, giving back to those who need it and pursuing excellence in all their endeavors is reflected in Sanctum as a company. "Why can't we use beer to help the world?" has been a common thought throughout the building process. And that's why they have decided to consistently give a portion of proceeds to charity. Every pint. Every keg. Every brew . Now every Sanctum drinker can boldly proclaim they are the most generous beer drinkers in the world!
​
Sanctum exists to be a light in the dreary world. To look mediocrity in the eye and say "no sir, I don't like it!" To push the limits of what being a craft brewery means, and to look spiffy doing it!
name: Sanctum Brewing Company

description:
The Sand Creek Brewing Company began on a dairy farm in Downing, Wisconsin, about 20 miles northwest of the city of Menomonie. After homebrewing on the family farm for years, homebrewer Cory Schroeder teamed up with Jim Wiesender to found the brewery in 1999.

Using equipment scrounged from various industries, such as a converted pudding tank for the brew kettle, the pair launched a successful business, brewing the beer just steps away from the chicken coop and a busy dairy farm.

Their Sand Creek Golden Ale and English Style Special Ale, available only on draft and in half-gallon growlers, soon developed a reputation throughout Wisconsin's many brew fests. With a capacity of only about 150 barrels per year, the brewery, now with a third owner on board, quickly outgrew the little farm shed converted into a brewhouse.

Hoping to remain in the Dunn/St. Croix counties area, the company looked for a suitable place to relocate, but came up empty handed. Then opportunity knocked in the form of a phone call one evening from their friend in Black River Falls, Pioneer brewing's brewmaster Todd Krueger. The brewery was for sale.

In March of 2004 the combined forces of the two breweries officially formed the new Sand Creek Brewing Co. of Black River Falls, Wisconsin.
name: Sand Creek Brewing Company

description: Sandford Orchards is a traditional farm business, pressing juices and ciders for an ever growing market, both here and abroad. Our methods are simple and so is our ethos: we only bottle the best. We are enormously proud to have been recognized for our endeavors. We are a family business full of passion for our products, we believe that Devon ciders and juices are the best in the world – we want you to taste them!
name: Sandford Orchards

description: We are a multi award winning Brewery in the Professional Division Competitions in the State of New Mexico.  We are a small Micro Brewery that concentrates on Quality, Not Quantity.   We brew all grain beer for the best products.  We have the finest BBQ and smoked meats anywhere in the State of New Mexico.  We smoke all our meats with Pecan Wood from Las Cruces, NM.  Come see what we are about, You won't be disappointed!
name: Sandia Chile Grill & Brewery

description: Founded in 2013, Boulder’s Sanitas Brewing Company is regarded for their signature blend of tradition and innovation as well as their use of only the finest ingredients. With a passion for exploration, Sanitas epitomizes the wild spirit of Colorado with a variety of premium beers.
name: Sanitas Brewing

description:
Our brewery and tap room are now open at:
101 E. Alma Ave.
San Jose, CA 95112
name: Santa Clara Valley Brewing

description: Located in beautiful Santa Cruz, Santa Cruz Aleworks makes some of the BEST beer.
name: Santa Cruz Aleworks

description:
The Santa Fe Brewing Company is a small operation with just a handful of friendly employees. Next time you are in the neighborhood, stop by, grab a cold one and say hello.

We are located in sunny Santa Fe, New Mexico right at the "top of the Turquoise Trail."
name: Santa Fe Brewing Company

description:
In 2007, the historic Valley National Bank, in Downtown Chandler was transformed into a destination for Craft Beer and food lovers alike with the opening of SanTan Brewing Company. Our goal at the brewpub is to provide a neighborhood spot where family, friends, and colleagues can gather and enjoy a cold pint of freshly brewed beer using only the finest malts, hops, and barley!

In addition to our core beers on draught year round, Brewmaster Anthony Canecchia keeps things exciting for SanTan fans by releasing specialty seasonal beers, small batch specialty beers, a weekly Cask Conditioned Ale as well as guest beers from brewers both local and around the nation. Like the Brewmaster says “Craft Beer for Beer Drinking”.
name: SanTan Brewing Company

description:
Sante Adairius Rustic Ales is a small, but daring, brewery located in the coastal city of Capitola, CA, just south of Santa Cruz.

Sante Adairius is a brewery founded on respect for quality and authenticity. We focus our attention on producing well-constructed beers with an eye towards simplicity and character. SARA takes liberty in emulating those memorable beers, their brewers, and the experiences they foster, never forgetting those giants on whose shoulders we stand.

Our approach to beer making is one of whimsy, highly inspired by the Belgian tradition, but also in harmony with brewers all over the world who push against boundaries of style with a nudge, not a shove. Often our beers are barrel-aged, usually in wine barrels, with various yeast and bacteria. As often as not though, Sante Adairius brews beers more approachable and traditional in nature, yet no less flavorful or distinctive.

Owned and operated by us, Adair Paterno and Tim Clifford, Sante Adairius Rustic Ales is our attempt to bring people together over great beer. SARA is an expression of our many years of beer geekery, the rabbit hole of tasting every beer we could get our hands on, and trusting we could contribute to the canon of those beers of the highest esteem. We believe great beer comes first. We stay true to our brewing roots. We take seriously the fact that we are brewing for you, and for ourselves. We appreciate your interest in our efforts. Sante!
name: Sante Adairius Rustic Ales

description:
We're located in the industrial unit on the corner of McGilchrist and 19th St., Salem

10 barrel brewery and tasting room with fifteen Santiam Brewing craft beers on tap.

Featuring a dedicated cask bar (at cellar temperature), with an additional four cask conditioned ales on tap from our beer engines.
name: Santiam Brewing

description: Our original location at Sapphire National Golf Club offers over 80 Micros, Imports/Belgiums and Domestic beers, wines and our Award-Winning piping hot Wood-Fired Pizza cooked in our very Rustic Mountain setting. Our scenic views of mountains, lakes are the best in the area! We offer a full menu including rustic pub and casual food, chef specials, daily specials while enjoying our many TVs throughout our restaurant. We have Live Music on select nights and many theme events.
name: Sapphire Mountain Brewing Co

description:
Begining of the industrial development in Bosnia and Herzegovina started with the opening of Sarajevo brewery in 1864. Sarajevo brewery was the only European beer company to keep continued production in the periods of two empires: during the Otoman empire and the Austro-hungarian monarchy. By the end of 19th century, production at the Sarajevo brewery reached 22000 hl, prior the First World War production was at 116000 hl and in 1916 – it has climbed to 150000 hl. From 1965 to 1980, Sarajevo brewery has recorded a steady growth that dropped in period from 1980 to 1984.

I took over the Sarajevo brewery leadership in 1984. Steady growth during the following years reached from 299000 hl to 784000 hl in 1991. Agression on Bosnia and Herzegovina from 1992 to 1995 did not haltered the production and our natural water wells provided much needed clean water for the Sarajevo population. Latest war created damages to Sarajevo brewery esteemated 20 million dollars.

From 1995 to 2009, Sarajevo brewery strategic focus was to rebuild damages and to modernize company for what we invested over 80 million Euros. Today, Sarajevo brewery uses most modern technology combined with untouched traditional roots of water quality and tehnological processes.

In 1996, we have installed line producing concentrated juices and can filling. Iin 1997, we constructed facilities for filling the non-alchocolic beverages as well as PET packing with capacity for 12000 bottles / h. In 1998, we signed three year contract with Coca-Cola to service their production. From 1998 to 2002 Sarajevo brewery modernized our beer production line to „state of the art“ technology. In 2002, we signed an agreement with PepsiCo producing lines of refreshing and nonalcoholic drinks from Pepsi's program.

Today, Sarajevo brewery production has climbed significantly producing 800000 hl of beer and 1.000 000 hl of nonalcoholic and refreshing beverages per year.

Sarajevo beer has reached number of countries gaining more and more recognitions daily in Austria, Australia, Croatia, Serbia, Kazakhstan, Switzerland, The Netherlands, Kuwait, Libya, Slovenia, USA and others. Soon enough, number of other countries enjoying our superb beer will be added to this list.
name: Sarajevska Pivara

description: A comfortable neighborhood brewpub with a focus on classic NW handcrafted ales and quality food.
name: Sasquatch Brewery

description: First brewery in Macon County.
name: Satulah Mountain Brewing Company

description:
Saucony Creek Brewing Company is a forward-thinking craft brewery proudly fashioning hyper-local beers from farm to pint in an effort to keep glass-clinking camaraderie alive and well. We’ve recognized that a truly spectacular beer possesses the power to erase all boundaries and unify individuals no matter what their differences may be.

In an industry where newbies continue to emerge and strive for originality, Saucony Creek Brewing Company is destined to break the mold with authentic, small-batch creations accented by an open-minded, “say we won’t” type of attitude. Despite our tiny town presence, there’s a world of passion and experience dripping from each Saucony sip.

It was a professional X Games and action sports career that sent a younger version of Saucony Creek Brewing Company’s current Founder and Owner, Matt Lindenmuth, hopping from country to country where artful inspiration, diverse cultures and unique individuals prevailed around every corner. He soaked it all up and particularly felt fascination for craft beer at the age of thirteen in Belgium. Fast forward through US Snowboard Team training, Guinness World Records, NBC’s Gravity Games and a collection of injuries,  it was time to leave behind one crafty career and begin another one. With some newfound free time, Matt took his long standing hobby of home brewing to the next level and began the formal process of launching Saucony Creek Brewing Company.
name: Saucony Creek Brewing Company

description:
Saugatuck Brewing Co. is a traditional Irish style pub that features 15 house-made drafts, hard cider and wines. All beer is produced on site in our 13,000 square foot Brew House. The full menu includes light snacks and unique entrees, along with home made desserts.  We offer 6 mainstay styles in bottles along with 3 seasonals and many specialties.

We feature the only brew-on-site facility in West Michigan. With five copper kettles, an array of natural ingredients, and over 100 recipes, we invite you and your friends to be the Brewmaster for a day. Create your own unique ale and return in two weeks to bottle 60 - 22 oz. bottles of fresh beer with a custom label of your choice.

The Singapore Room is our multi-purpose banquet facility. This includes a 4 tap bar, wine service and customizable menus. The Singapore Room can be rented out for a variety of events including birthdays, graduations, weddings, rehearsal dinners, etc.
name: Saugatuck Brewing Company

description:
Artisanal Belgian style ales making you feel good on so many levels.

After years of perfecting our recipes and with the use of only the best grains, hops and yeast, we feel our beers are raising the bar to the next level for the craft brewery movement. Grab a bottle of one our beers and decide for yourself, knowing that you're helping to Save The World one beer at a time!
 
We offer beer brewing classes and tasting parties by appointment only,
name: Save the World Brewing Co.

description: Obsessive in our search for exceptional flavours we are on a mission to raise people’s expectations of beer and make others as passionate about great beer as we are. We believe that things made by hand in small batches taste better. That’s why we combine the best, natural ingredients in tiny batches to create the best tasting beer we possibly can. We strive to create beautiful, handmade beer packed full of flavour. Beer designed to accompany good food, good friendship and to serve as one of life’s little pleasures.
name: Savour Beer

description:
Traditional Beers Brewed For Today! Knoxville, Tennessee

Marble City Brewing Company became Saw Works in May 2012.
name: Saw Works Brewing Company

description:
Opening in the Spring of 2012 on the boardwalks of the Muskoka Wharf in the heart of Gravenhurst, Ontario; Sawdust City Brewing Co., will be a small brewery with an attached tied-house.  Now, for everyone not affiliated with the provincial government, that simply means that Sawdust City will be makin' fresh, tasty beer and will be servin' local, tasty food.
Why a "tied-house" you ask?  Well, we here at the Sawdust City Brewing Co., we not only love beer, but we also love what beer can do!  Beer has the unique ability to bring people together.  We love to see people gatherin' together to eat great food, listen to great music or just to simply talk and tell some great stories. 
So along with makin' some fantastic beer, we set about lookin' to create a place where you could do all those things under one roof.  And we wanted to do it right here on the shores of Lake Muskoka.
So once the dust flies in 2012, come on down to the Sawdust City Brewing Co. and enjoy some great beer, some great food and some great company!
name: Sawdust City Brewing Co

description: Sawtooth Brewery is Ketchum's local brewery. Come see us in the tap room for a pint from one of our 13 craft beers on draft!
name: Sawtooth Brewery

description: Welcome to SBC Restaurant & Brewery, where culinary excellence and brewing expertise has been a Connecticut staple for 11 years. We are more than a restaurant; we’re a friendly neighbor with your comfort in mind. We are more than a brewery; we are a stylish escape with endless possibilities.
name: SBC Restaurant and Brewery

description: Established in 2012, The Scantic River Brewery introduced the crowd pleasing Hampden Pale Ale. This year will bring plenty of excitement to beer lovers, with the introduction of our new line of IPA's, "The Trail Ale IPA" series. With several months of testing and sample runs, we have finally finished and fine tuned the first of four IPA varieties.
name: Scantic River Brewery

description:
Scarlet Lane Brewing Company’s mission is to be your humble brewer promoting knowledge and continued betterment in the art of beer making. We will have fun while being excellent stewards to the community, the environment and our employees. 

Beer Cultivates Wisdom and Friendships
name: Scarlet Lane Brewing Company

description:
The name really says it all. Four Army veterans got together one day to brew beer and talk about movies, music, video games, and life which then turned into a regular home brewing event. Not too long afterwards, it was noticed that the city of Waco, Texas didn't have a microbrewery to call its own to accommodate a growing music scene and its relaxed college atmosphere. It only seemed obvious what the next move would be.

Even though the brew-masters and owners are Army Veterans, the name Scars & Stripes stands as tribute all military veterans as a thank you for the sacrificing that has been done so everyone can live free. The mentality behind this company is not your Captain America patriotism, but rather one that embraces Independence and freedom for all with no judgement for lifestyle choices.

We will be Waco's only micro brewery! Our beer will be self distributed around various stores and restaurants in the Central and Northern Texas area but we will also have regular taste testings for anyone who is of legal drinking age to take a tour of the brewing facility and to get a free try of the craft beer we are creating. Shirts, glasses, stickers, and growlers will be available for purchase.
name: Scars & Stripes Brewing Company

description:
In the Early 1970's Geoffrey Scharer, a 4th generation publican of Picton visited England for the international Brew Ex-Trade Fair, where he found the inspiration to brew German Style Beers here in Australia.

Against all odds, convinced that he could make high quality, natural beers Scharer set off about perfecting his recipes and methods. In 1981 he received the recognition he deserved in the form of the first (on Premises) brewing License ever awarded in Australia. He then set about setting up the first Pub Brewery.

In 1987, Scharer opened George IV Inn in Picton where we tapped his traditional style perfected brews. This huge step paved the way for many of the fantastic craft beers now brewed and enjoyed throughout Australia today.

In the early 1990’s Scharer operated and lived in the Australian Hotel in The Rocks where his famed ales (Lager and Bock) were the only beers on tap. If one was to ask for a different mainstream beer, they would be told upfront ‘we don’t sell that shit here’ and moved onto the next pub down the road. Geoff was a larrikin and larger than life itself.

In the early 2000’s Geoff sold the pub and brewery on one condition ‘the recipes never changed’ and to this day – they haven’t.

In May 2012, Geoff the man known as ‘one of the Grandfathers of Australian Craft beer’ passed away in his sleep. A huge loss of one of the legends of the industry; his legacy will forever live on in his beers.
name: Scharer's Little Brewery

description:
One of few breweries that still brew their beers the authentic way. This means only natural ingredients are used, no filtering and no pasteurisation is applied. Ever since we've started our brewery, the quality of our beers has been our most important concern. 

Most of our beers are connected to old folk stories, for example "De Lamme Goedzak" or"De Dulle Griet". The brewery and its beers are a true monument for beer tasters.
name: Scheldebrouwerij

description:
Schilling Beer Co.'s lagers and ales are inspired by centuries-old Belgian, Czech and German beer-making, yet are defined by their modern relevance and creativity. Our gourmet wood-fired pizzas are topped with the freshest ingredients and make the ideal accompaniment to our beer.

Schilling is proud to brew world-class lagers and ales for our community and friends. Come visit our craft brewery and riverside taproom (a restored 18th century grist mill) in the pristine White Mountains in Littleton, NH (just off Main St).
name: Schilling Beer Co.

description:
In 1631, King Gustav from Sweden took the city of Aschaffenburg. Legend has it, that the sweedish troops soon found out, that there was no single drop of beer in the barrels, while preparing the Johannisburg castle for the royal court.

As it happened, there was a foot soldier by the name of Joseph Lögler amongst this troops, who was proficient in brewing beer. The short form of Joseph is “Sepp” or “Seppel” for “little Joseph”. Obviously, by making beer the brave soldier Seppel was of much better use to the King of Sweden, because he was going lame due to an old battlefield injury to the leg. The injury was the cause for his nickname “Schlappe-Seppel”.

The beer of the brave soldier was very well received because of its excellence and very soon after the first brew, he had to make more beer. In the end, he stayed behind in Aschaffenburg, after the Swedish troops had left. He settled as a cooper and brewer. The Schlappeseppel Beer was born.
name: Schlappeseppel

description: Schlossbrauerei Stelzer is a small mom & pop shop located in the small Bavarian village of Fattigau.
name: Schloßbrauerei Stelzer Fattigau

description: The brewery Eggenberg is for over 200 years in the family and can be up to the 14th Stöhr Century has a long tradition of brewing beer look back. Upper Austria's largest private brewery is located in the picturesque Salzkammergut region, generated where only the best domestic raw materials, the famous beer. The revitalized modern vaulted rooms of the castle of Westraktes Eggenberg are available for events.
name: Schloss Eggenberg

description:
The Schlossbrauerei Au-Halltertau respects the tradition and heritage of quality traditional premium brewing. For more than 400 years the brewery has been taking care that the local traditional beers are supplied regionally as well as internationally.

It is no longer important how advanced we are and how much technical support we use during our daily processes. The most important aspect for us is that we keep our traditional heritage. As we know the saying "New is not in comparison with the word better".

The Schlossbrauerei Au-Halltertau respects the tradition and heritage of quality traditional premium brewing. For more than 400 years the brewery has been taking care that the local traditional beers are supplied regionally as well as internationally. The first documented brew master was the royal court brew master named "Schweiger" in 1590. At that time the Noble Freiherr Baron von Thurn was the lord of the castle. He was the fourth noble lord since 990 a.d through 1281 a.d that ruled in Au Hallertau.

Since 1846 the Noble rulers and Baron Freiherren Beck von Peccoz have ruled and resided in the magnificent "Moated Castle" in Au i.d. Hallertau.

The noble family of Baron Freiherren Beck von Peccoz is still living in the castle an in the meantime it is the 6th generation.

At present Baron Freiherr Beck von Peccoz is making sure that the Castle Brewery stays a traditional brewery together with the necessary vision into the future to create a sustainable traditional premium quality future.

Michael Baron Freiherr Beck von Peccoz’s utmost desire is not to miss a successful sustainable future and at the same time to keep up the 6 generations of writing a successful historical event for the Castle brewery and it history.

The Brew Master Mr. Stefan Ebensperger is supporting the Baron with his highly qualified experience and skills. The necessary emotions and bindings towards a brewing heritage that has been passed down for generations is needed. Tradition is naturally one of the highest priorities for Mr. Ebensperger due to our traditional purity laws dating back to 1516 a.d therefore you can be assured that the quality is a premium German and he says, "It will also stay like that". Since 1516 the Bavarians have known how important the quality of the ingredients and the brewing process actually are. Beer was known during the Middle Ages as the same significant value as bread. As a part of the staple die, it was also germ free and full of healthy calories. During that time the average citizen spent a good 20 percent of their income on beer.

On the 23. April 1516 the Bavaria Duke Wilhelm IV. Executed and introduced the famous Bavarian Purity law into the Bavarian Parliament in Ingolstadt with the famous words: "Just like beer in Summer an in winter as well as the county or province it is brewed or served" Since that day it is prohibited to brew beer for the German market with anything else apart from hops, malt, water and yeast. In 1918 the Weimarer Republik accepted the Bavarian purity law into its republic, therefore the Bavarian purity then became a German law. Under the purity law or Bavaria and Germany the Castle Brewery, inspects, insures and stores all its quality premium beers as in the past historical way the Castle Lords and Brew Masters did.
name: Schlossbrauerei Au-Hallertau
Schlossbrauerei Fürstlich Drehna der Germania Brauerei

description: Two words: cool & dark. Schmohz Ales and Lagers, like many quality craft beers, are not pasteurized. While this helps them taste fresher and more full-flavored, it also means that extended exposure to warm temperatures may cause them (especially if they are unfiltered) to taste, well, less fresh. So keep 'em cool! As for the dark part, let's just say that sunlight can negatively affect some brews (it makes 'em smell "skunky"). That's why we put our beers in light-blocking brown bottles and take extra caution to keep them out of the way of direct sunlight.
name: Schmohz Brewing Company

description: The wheat beer specialists of the Schneider brewery are regularly awarded at international competitions. This proves that they are justly considered as world classics. A unique variety of distinguishing wheat beer specialties is being brewed at Bavaria’s oldest wheat beer brewery strictly following the Reinheitsgebot. The brewer, Georg Schneider VI, presents his family of wheat beer specialties:
name: Schneider Weisse

description:
In 2006, homebrewing pals Marcus Connery and Matt & Heather McClung decided to take their hobby to the next level and go pro. Purchasing a half-barrel system, they began brewing a keg of beer at a time out of an ActivSpace unit under the West Seattle Bridge. Beginning in January 2007, they distributed their beer to restaurants and taprooms all over the city of Seattle.

As demand for their beers increased, the Schooner EXACT founders expanded into a larger, 10 -barrel system. The brewery moved to the South Park neighborhood in early 2009, and to its current SODO location on 1st Avenue in 2010. After Marcus Connery passed the reins of the brewery over to Heather and Matt to pursue the next chapter in his beer adventures by opening a beer broker/ consulting business, Matt and Heather quit their teaching jobs to pursue their brewery dreams full time.
name: Schooner Exact Brewing Company

description: A brewpub in the heart of the city Schorndorf with a distinctive ambience of an industrial building of 1895.
name: Schorndorfer Gasthausbrauerei Kesselhaus

description:
In Oberasbach, tucked in the middle of the wonderful Franconian lake region, we resolutely uphold true brewing craftsmanship.
Franconia is a stronghold of time-honored brewing practices. At our brewery, deep in Franconia, our beers are steeped in tradition. Innovation, however, is no stranger to us. We love beer, and we brew it with a passion.
A.D. 1996: During an era of falling beer consumption and aggressive concentration in the beer market, I decided to build a brewery. Though small, I wanted to build a brewery with the intent of brewing beers of the highest quality.

Worlds away from the usual offerings of run-of-the-mill breweries who make mass-produced beer, we brew specialty beers for those who still cherish handmade tradition. We have continued to expand the niche for our strong beers and have remained steadfast in the face of stiff competition.

All the might of Franconia is brewed into our Schorsch Bock and our Schorsch Franconian Wheat, both of which contain 13% alcohol. They are the strongest beers in Germany and at the pinnacle among the world’s strongest.

Our Schorsch Bock 16 has broken every record. It is the strongest lager beer in the world.
name: Schorschbräu

description:
Schouskjelleren Mikrobryggeri brewpub opened its doors to the general public on October 1st 2010, becoming the second brewpub in Oslo.

The brewpub is located in the cellar of the old Schous Bryggeri on Grünerløkka and is owned by the people behind Olympen, another great beer place in Oslo. Brewmaster, John Hudson, has created half a dozen beers to be brewed and served at the brewpub, most notably the OSB (Oslo Special Bitter), the Thunder Bear Stout and the spicy Garden of Eden. The atmosphere in the brewpub has more in common with German and Czech beer halls than with Norwegian pubs, with its vaulted brick ceiling, massive fireplace at the end of the hall and its rustic wooden furniture. The place radiates age. But the brewery is brand new and state of the art, with four 500 liter storage tanks supplying the bar.
name: Schouskjelleren Mikrobryggeri

description: Minnesota's First Winery & Brewery!  Family-run business created award-winning wine and small batch custom brews in a beautiful vineyard setting in Waconia, MN.  Experience flagship and unique style brews by the flight or pint in the brand new modern rustic tap room overlooking a lake and vineyard.
name: Schram Vineyards Winery & Brewery

description:
Create great craft beer and build experiences surpassing the ordinary through education, responsible community interaction, and sustainable business practices

The craft-connoisseur's utopia. Flawless representation of the most influential styles. Plus a full portfolio of permanent, perennials, and limited editions that ever-explore our globe's limitless range of brew styles and accents. 

So set aside any preconceived notions about beer, and Raze Expectations!
name: Schubros Brewery

description: Once upon a time... the brewery's co-founder, optimist and perpetual dreamer – Mike Dallas - decided to turn his love of craft beer, homebrewing, and sharing his passion with others into a plan to open a brewery. Jen, his wife and pragmatist, was a bit skeptical after supporting so many of Mike's "loves," including the guitar, woodworking, and the bagpipes, as well as "careers" including the Air Force, law and public administration. But it was Mike's drive, paired with Jen's new found interest in craft beer, and the intrigue of being a business owner, that eventually led her to support his dream and transform their lives into brewery owners.
name: Scorched Earth

description:
Scorpion Brewing is a startup brewery in Calvert County Maryland.  Our beers should be ready in 2013!
 
Brian Dailey has had a passion for brewing and beer for many years and since the world will end in 2012 I figured, hey lets just start brewing and selling my craft beers to the great people of southern Maryland.
name: Scorpion Brewing

description: Scottish & Newcastle plc was a "long alcoholic drinks" (LADs) company with positions in 15 countries, including UK, France and Russia. It was headquartered in Edinburgh, Scotland, UK. In the last 20 years, S&N expanded significantly from its home base to become an international business with beer volumes growing almost tenfold. It was listed on the London Stock Exchange and was once a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index but it was acquired jointly by Heineken and Carlsberg in April 2008, with the company's assets being split between them. The trading name "Scottish & Newcastle UK" continued to be used, until November 2009, to denote the UK trading operation of Heineken International until it was renamed "Heineken UK". The Scottish & Newcastle name lives on through the former "S&N Pub Enterprises" leased pub division which has been renamed "Scottish & Newcastle Pub Company".
name: Scottish & Newcastle Breweries

description: Scottsdale Beer Company embraces the tradition of the early American brewing industry, prioritizing freshness and craftsmanship, and thriving to be wholly local. Through plate and pint, we honor time-tested techniques and traditions balanced with creativity, invention, and the occasional oddity. Inspired by the work of the masters from past generations, we’re offering up the concoctions of this era's expert craftsmen. We gladly offer you an open invitation to visit your community's brewery, meet the people that make your beer, and eat and drink in contentment.
name: Scottsdale Beer Company

description: Scratch Brewing Company is a farmhouse brewery located 5 miles from the Shawnee National Forest in Ava, Illinois. The brewery focuses on farmhouse beers and other styles enhanced by the innovative addition of local ingredients, including: nettle, elderberry, ginger, dandelion, maple sap, hickory nuts, wild carrot seed, cedar, and others.
name: Scratch Brewing Company

description:
Scratchtown Brewing Company is a start-up craft brewery in Ord, Nebraska. We are currently constructing a new facility in downtown Ord. We expect to be operational by mid-year 2013.

Our passion is making and drinking great beer. Our mission in Central Nebraska, like Central Europe, is to craft a local beer culture that celebrates the wonderful variety of beers and build a viable industry in rural Nebraska.

In Ord, we are blessed to live among some of the most fertile land in the world, with access to some of the freshest, cleanest water on the planet - the Ogalala Aquifer. Our climate helps make our home an ideal brewers paradise, much like the old country.
