We're fond of the Bohemian and Polish heritage that built Ord and the Loup Valley. We brew a wide variety of beer, but will always brew with a nod to the heritage of our home.
name: Scratchtown Brewing Company

description: Scuttlebutt beers are brewed with the Northwest’s finest ingredients - barley from Vancouver (WA), hops from Yakima and Mabton (WA), a proprietary yeast from Odell, (OR) and some of the nation’s finest drinking water from the Spada Reservoir in the Cascade Mountains. We look forward to many years of brewing consistent, high quality beers as well as discovering new fun beers that will please your taste buds as well as ours.
name: Scuttlebutt Brewing Company

description:
Sea Cider is a farm-based cidery located on the Saanich Peninsula just minutes from Victoria, on Vancouver Island. Our ten acre farm is home to over 1,300 apple trees, made up of over 50 varieties of heritage apples.

Sea Cider opened its farm gate for business in 2007 when owner Kristen Jordan purchased the property with a vision of creating an organic farm and orchard and producing traditional fermented artisan ciders. Since then, we’ve grown to an annual cider production of over 7,000 cases and growing. We continue to pride ourselves on crafting traditionally fermented ciders from organically grown apples, and our award-winning cider is now available throughout B.C., Alberta, Manitoba, Washington State, Illinois and Oregon.
name: Sea Cider Farm & Ciderhouse

description: Today, Sea Dog Brewing Company operates brew pubs in two locations. The Sea Dog in Topsham occupies a scenic spot on the Androscoggin River. The Bangor location overlooks the historic Penobscot River. Both locations serve a full menu of handcrafted ales and creative pub fare with a flair. Being authentic is important to us. Our beers are brewed in a traditional style using only the highest quality ingredients like imported English two-row malted barley and British top-fermenting yeast. Our English brewing style results in brews with a distinctive, refreshing taste and crisp finish unique to top-fermented beers.
name: Sea Dog Brewing Company

description: Sea Level Brewing Company first opened their doors November 26th, 2007 as the first and only microbrewery in the Annapolis Valley, N.S. Located in Port Williams, Nova Scotia we share accommodations, and work in partnership with The Port Pub: Gastropub and Bistro.
name: Sea Level Brewing Company

description: All of our carefully hand-crafted, brewery fresh ales are made using only water, malt, yeast, and hops. Our brewmaster uses the finest two-row Harrington pale malted barley, specially roasted barley malts, hops from Oregon and Washington, and select brewers yeast to produce our beers right here on the premises.
name: Seabright Brewery

description: Irish Brewpub and Texas Grill
name: Sean Patrick's Irish Pub and Texas Grub

description: Opened in 2012, Seapine is dedicated to brewing classic styles and we strive for perfection in every pint. Stop by and grab a pint, fill a growler, or just say hello!
name: Seapine Brewing Company

description:
We are brewers, musicians, surfers, lovers, fighters, gardeners, mechanics, star gazers, dog lovers, tide watchers, loud laughers, fish catchers, and triple dog dare-ers.  We also have the best bonfires on the planet.    

We believe that the only thing in the world better than drinking Oregon brewed craft beer is drinking Oregon brewed craft beer in an awesome place like Seaside. Fill out our contact info section and we'll keep you updated on what we're up to.
name: Seaside Brewing Company

description: Seattle Cider Company is Seattle’s first cidery since Prohibition, bringing true craft cider back to Seattle and across the country. Bridging the gap between wine and beer with flavorful, small-batch cider, Seattle Cider’s initial offerings – Dry and Semi-Sweet – break the mold of overly sweet cider, bringing the natural flavors of Washington apples to the forefront.
name: Seattle Cider Company

description: At Sebago Brewing Company we brew our beers from all malt. We use American grown 2-Row, caramel, chocolate, black, roasted barley and Munich malts from Briess Malting Company. Our grain silo holds 50,000 lbs. of American 2-Row Pale malt. We purchase our grain by the truckload and the bulk grain is blown into the silo from the grain truck. We use 75-80% of this grain in all of our beers. Then we measure our specialty malts into the mill. At this point we crush the malt so that the husk's are cracked open and the "meat" of the grain is exposed.
name: Sebago Brewing Company

description: We are a one-barrel nanobrewery located in Whitewater, Wisconsin.  Our name comes from Whitewater's historic nickname.  From around the turn of the century to the 1930s, locals referred to the town as "Second Salem" due to its reputation as a site of witches' gatherings at the Witchtower (the Starin Park water tower), strange murders, unearthly creatures in the lake, and other unexplained phenomena.  South central Wisconsin is also the stomping grounds of the Beast of Bray Road, a werewolf-type creature that was sighted on numerous occasions in the early 1990s, and the Wild Man of La Grange, a strange character apprehended by local authorities in 1929.  We are not sensationalizing these strange events, figures, and architecture.  They are a part of our collective past: one that makes our town unique, and one that provides a rich variety of stories to translate into beer.
name: Second Salem Brewing Company

description: Second Self Beer Company is a brand new craft brewery in Atlanta, Georgia. We believe layers of character and flavor can be built to be greater than the sum of its parts. Our no compromise approach to both ingredients and techniques ensures a quality craft product for our consumers. No shortcuts. No extracts. Only the best for our beer and it shows in the flavor. We've worked to make sure our product is not only excellent to drink but is easily paired with food, making it a perfect choice for any occasion. We draw inspiration for our recipes from our experiences and surroundings. Currently Second Self is available on draft at local restaurants, bars and growler shops.
name: Second Self Beer Company

description: Secret Engine is brewing hand crafted, small batch beers that we like to drink and sometimes share with you. Gypsy for now, looking forward to having you in our tasting room, once we settle down. For now we are “The Bachelor of Beers.”
name: Secret Engine Brewing

description:
Apples were the last thing on our mind.
That is, until we found ourselves nurturing an abandoned apple orchard back to health on our new family farm, nestled just three miles from Avila bay.  Our relationship blossomed and so did the trees.  One taste of the fruit set us in a new direction - California Hard Cider.  We hope you enjoy! 
Our cider-maker Chris Lemieux started making wine with us in 2007.  Highlights include 92 pts California State Fair and Silver medals at the San Francisco International wine competition and Los Angels international wine competition (Domaine Le Mieux wines) and his expression on California Hard Cider - Apple forward with a nice complex subtle tart finish - like biting into the perfect apple.  By far the most popular Hard Cider on the Central Coast - See Canyon Hard Cider is available in over 165 retail outlets and is on draft at 22 locations.
name: See Canyon Hard Cider Co.

description:
SMALL TOWN, BIG NUTS!

At Seguin Brewing Company we use a combination of old and new brewing techniques to bring you delicious hand crafted beer.  Driven by our passion and our taste buds, we refuse to settle for a poor product.  We hope that you'll enjoy our beer as much as we enjoy brewing it for you.  Drink local. Drink craft.
name: Seguin Brewing Co.

description: Excellent beers in this small brewpub located on the lower level of a former Penna. Governor's Mansion.  A small space and limited food menu is more than made up for by the excellent brews.   Known as the 'Pub' by our locals. Great premise made beers, small healthy menu with veggie friendly items, friendly staff and loyal regulars. no tvs!
name: Selin's Grove Brewing Co.

description: Why open a Belgian themed brewery in North Idaho? Well, we live here. We love it here and we’re not moving. Second and most importantly, we love Belgian beers. From a refreshing, spicy Saison to a tongue twisting sour or a rich malty Trappist and everything in between, Belgian beers have something for every palate.
name: Selkirk Abbey Brewing Company

description: Seminar Brewing, LLC is a small, dedicated group of craft beer brewers in Florence, South Carolina. Our brewers include Bryan Fisher, John Mattheis, and Travis Knowles. Our business manager and founding partner is Dave Peters.
name: Seminar Brewing

description:
To provide a constant variety of exceptional, hand-crafted beers in a casual setting where families, friends, and neighbors experience consistent quality and engage in worthwhile conversation.
Sentinel Peak Brewing Company is a 3 BBL (that’s 90 gallons at a time!) nanobrewery which will offer a rotating selection of craft beers along with a few house favorites. Our inspiration comes from many sources including, but not limited to, travels we’ve had and suggestions from friends. We look forward to sharing our brews with you soon!
name: Sentinel Peak Brewing Company

description:
Sequoia Brewing Company Bar & Grill was started in October
of 2003 by Scott and Michele Kendall who purchased Butterfield Brewing Company in February 2000. Butterfield's started in the Spring of 1989 with award winning Brewmaster Kevin Cox in the heart of the historical Tower District, Fresno, California. The Micro Brewing Company and Restaurant is known as a neighborhood icon in Fresno. Scott and Michele changed the name to wholesale their beer throughout the United States.

Kevin continued on as Sequoia's Brewmaster, putting together a creative mix of 11 unique ales and lagers on tap brewed with the finest ingredients including monthly special beers, wines, specialty drinks, and their homemade Root Beer. Recently, Rick Bouke took over as Brewmaster, and is responsible for the high quality and craft beer character our customers have come to expect. Sequoia's menu offers great food with the freshest ingredients, serves Certified Angus Beef, prepares their sauces and items from scratch and offers fresh daily fish.

Sequoia offers a menu for all ages in a warm and comfortable atmosphere, where everyone knows your name. Sequoia is a hot spot for live music featuring the best local bands and a private party room. A second location with a mountain lodge atmosphere, rock fireplace and a patio was opened in Northeast Fresno in July of 2005 at Piazza del Fiore. Along with the same great beers on tap, there is a full bar at the Champlain location.
name: Sequoia Brewing Company

description:
We are a veteran owned and operated craft brewery, in Savannah Georgia, dedicated to honoring those that have put their lives at risk and their country and community first.

We will donate a portion of our revenues to assist charities that support service. 

Our dedication to this cause is unique and our approach to craft beer is equally unique.

While brewing our year round beers on a large scale we maintain a small batch Research and Development division to enable experimentation and innovation using locally available ingredients to connect our farmers and consumers with our beer and our mission.
name: Service Brewing Company

description: Seven Arrows Brewing Company creates a relaxed, social and enjoyable environment that provides high quality and true to style beers.
name: Seven Arrows Brewing Company

description:
The 7Barrel was opened April 20, 1994 by renowned brewer Gregory J.  Noonan. While Greg is no longer with us, his tradition lives on through the dedicated patrons that enjoy the unique, friendly atmosphere of a neighborhood pub and brewery.  In continuing this tradition, the 7Barrel family welcomes you to visit us and celebrate our 20 years in the neighborhood.

Under the ownership of Upper Valley locals since 2010, we here at the 7Barrel are focused on continuing to provide our customers with high quality fare, great craft beer, and the enjoyable and unique atmosphere people have come to expect from our establishment. 

Visit our website and like us on Facebook to stay in the know with all of latest news and event dates.
name: Seven Barrel Brewery

description:
Silverton, Oregon has much to offer. Known for its beautiful landscape of Silver Falls State Park and home of the Oregon Garden, it is rich with color and flavor. The town is lined with antique and coffee shops, restaurants and murals, but no micro-breweries, until now.

Seven Brides Brewing is changing that!

Several years ago, three dads and two uncles would gather on a Saturday in one of their garages to master the art of home brew. Before long, the salesman of the group said, “You know, this is good enough to sell.” So the friends set out to do just that.

The name “Seven Brides” actually came from the dads’ kids. Between three of them, they have seven daughters. With the rising cost of wedding nuptials, the guys decided they needed to sell enough beer to pay for their daughters weddings. Each of the girls has a beer named after her.
name: Seven Brides Brewery

description: Located in Southside Jacksonville, Florida, Seven Bridges serves a wide variety of fresh seafood, steaks, chicken, salads and pizza. The restaurant features a working brewery, bar, championship billiards, as well as semi-private dining areas for groups and parties. The outdoor heated patio is a favorite gathering spot after a long work day, or even a relaxing day at the beach.
name: Seven Bridges Grille

description: SEVENTH SON BREWING HAS BEEN PRODUCING EXCEPTIONAL BEERS AT THE INTERSECTION OF 4TH & 4TH IN COLUMBUS' HISTORIC ITALIAN VILLAGE SINCE APRIL OF 2013.   IT TOOK NEARLY THREE YEARS FOR OUR DREAM TO BECOME REALITY; BUT WITH THE HELP OF PRIVATE INVESTORS, A HUNTINGTON SMALL BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION LOAN, COURSEWORK AT THE SIEBEL INSTITUTE OF CHICAGO, TALENTED DESIGNERS, PATIENT ARCHITECTS, EXTENSIVE TASTING (DRINKING), INTENSIVE RECIPE FORMULATION, INSPIRATIONAL BREWERS, AND COUNTLESS HOURS OF PLANNING OUR BREWERY IS COMPLETE.
name: Seventh Son Brewing Company

description: Seward Alaska's only Brewhouse and Restaurant serving award winning beers by Consultant Brewer Kevin Burton and great Alaskan food by Matthew Zimny.
name: Seward Brewing Company

description:
Shackett’s Brewing Company, Bristol, NH

Shackett’s Brewing Company is a Nano Brewery, founded in 2014.  Dedicated to creating true to style, artisanal ales and lagers and an unlimited number of whimsical beers, our mission is to provide local, fresh alternatives to mass-produced beers.   Cheers, RJS
name: Shackett's Brewing Company

description: We make good beer without regard for profits, share holders, or market shares. We will never sacrifice quality simply to make a buck.  So grab a brew, pull up a patch of grass, and join us in the shade.
name: Shade Tree Brewing Co.

description: Shades of Pale beer is all about the recipes, and adding subtle twists to classic styles.  Our goal is to create uniquely-brewed, handcrafted beers, with a consistent quality that brings people back.
name: Shades of Pale Brewing Company

description: The Shadows Pub & Grill comprises the East wing of the historic Cheyenne Union Pacific Depot, built in 1886 and widely acknowledged to be one of the most beautiful railroad stations in North America! For a light bite to a full meal or just something cold to drink . . . Join us at Shadows Pub & Grill!
name: Shadows Pub and Grill

description:
At the Shamrock we take pride in brewing fresh craft brewed beer with influences from around the world.  Adhering to traditional German, English, Irish, Belgian, and American styles, we use the best ingredients available to produce the highest quality product.  As an American craft brewery, we occasionally brew outside the box, creating new and unique beers that push the envelope.

Our beer recipes are formulated and brewed in house, using premium domestic and imported malted barley and other grains such as wheat, oats, and rye.  Our base 2-row barley is the freshest around, malted right here in southern Colorado by Colorado Malting Company.  We use the choicest hops from the Pacific Northwest and yeast strains carefully chosen by our brewer.  We never use additives, preservatives, or pasteurization in our brewing process. We also never filter our beer. Enjoy
name: Shamrock Brewing Company

description: At Shannon Brewing, we are passionate about great beer—all natural, beautiful, wholesome, easy-drinking beer! Shannon Brewing Company’s great beer comes from a profound commitment to our “old-world” brewing process, the best natural ingredients available and a VERY patient aging process.
name: Shannon Brewing Company

description: Sharp's Brewery was founded in 1994 at Rock, Cornwall. The success and growth of our young Brewery has been phenomenal with Sharp's now the largest brewer of cask conditioned beer in the South West ( Industry sources) and Sharp's flagship brand Doom Bar is the No. 1 Cask Beer in the UK*.
name: Sharp's

description:
True to nature, true to the craft

It's the motto of ShawneeCraft, a summary of our philosophy, and the ideal to which we aspire. We call it the fidelis philosophy.

We’re true to nature because environmental impact is a consideration in every decision we make. We honor the nature of materials that we work with. No shortcuts, no artifice. We’re true to the craft because we honor traditions of workmanship perfected by centuries of well-trained hands.

The Fidelis Philosophy took root in the fertile soil of Shawnee-On-Delaware, Pennsylvania. Our village, bounded by wooded hills on one side and the Delaware River on the other, enjoys a mild and varied climate, plenty of water and sun, abundant plants and wildlife and friendly, talented people. We are captivated by this nature and its possibilities. And our location- less than 100 miles from both New York City and Philadelphia- makes it only natural for us to broadly share the Fidelis Philosophy.

In a world of mass-production, our products are handmade. In a world of homogeneity, our products represent a defiant individuality. In a world without roots, our products embody a tangible sense of place. We aspire to eat what we grow, to drink what we brew, and to build what we use. And we’d like you to experience a taste of this lifestyle yourself- in the form of ShawneeCraft beer.
name: ShawneeCraft Brewing Company

description:
Shebeen Brewing makes craft beers in Connecticut from fresh local ingredients like hops and concord grapes.  Shebeen or Sibin in Irish is defined as "An unlicensed establishment or private house selling alcoholic liquor". 

With 25 years of brewing experience, Shebeen was founded on the philosophy of brewing unique and artfully crafted beers.  Dare to be different.  Slainte
name: Shebeen Brewing Company

description: Sheep Mountain Brewery is a nano brewery at the foot of Sheep Mountain in southeast Wyoming. Find our beer at O'Dwyers Public House in Laramie Wyoming.
name: Sheep Mountain Brewery LLC

description: Steve Gorrill, the "Count of Whitefield" - Owner and Brewer, homebrewed for ten years prior to establishing the microbrewery in April of 1995. Specializing in unique beer styles, the flagship brew is Pemaquid Ale, a full-bodied Scottish ale (O.G.. 1.052) with a hoppy finish (great with hearty food).
name: Sheepscot Valley Brewing Company

description:
The brewery consists of several areas within a total floor space of 5600 square feet. The areas on the main floor include the pub, brew house, bottling area, fermentation and conditioning rooms, and the warehouse. The pub, brew house and bottling areas are open to the public. There is a mezzanine level on which our business office, lab, and grain mill are located. The mezzanine level also contains a customer seating area.

The pub is located in the front of the brewery. There is seating for 7 at the bar, 22 at the tables on the main floor and 20 at tables on the mezzanine. The brewery, BOP (the acronym for brew-on-premises), and pub are open the same hours, so beer and food is always available during our open hours and while you are brewing.
name: Shenandoah Brewing Company

description: A small brewing company based in Sydney's Inner West.
name: Shenanigans Brewing

description: Shepherd Neame is an English regional brewery founded in 1698 in Faversham, Kent. It is the oldest brewer in Great Britain and has been family-owned since 1864.
name: Shepherd Neame

description:
Sherwood Brewing Company opened its doors on August 31, 2006 in the Hayes Center Shoppes plaza on Hayes Rd. north of Hall Rd. (M-59) in Shelby Township, Michigan.

We serve only the finest hand-crafted beer, wine, and sodas, all made in our on-site brewing facility.

Sherwood Brewing Company is proud and honored to be the recipient of WDIV's "4 the Best" award for Best Brewpub for four consecutive years (2007 - 2010) as voted by you, our customers.
name: Sherwood Brewing Company

description: Sherwood Forest Brewers...enchanting today’s Merry Men and Women with a taste of Merry Olde England – in Merry Ole New England! Cheers!
name: Sherwood Forest Brewers

description:
Shine Restaurant & Gathering Place is a place for us all to nourish ourselves through food, community, dance, education and celebration. It is hub for us all to share our gifts, to explore, and to have fun doing it. It truly is a place where we can all Shine.

The Blissful Sisters, previously of restaurant and music venue Trilogy have been in the creative process of Shine for the past few years. So much in their individual life experiences and the amazing people they have connected with over the years have been a huge inspiration for the concept. They feel that NOW IS THE TIME where we need a sense of community — to eat, heal and live well — it is so important to our well-being. Shine is a gift for all of us.
name: Shine Brewing Company

description: Our humble beginnings started in the Summer of 1995 in Ship Bottom, NJ. Back then we made our first batch of beer using a home brew kit that consisted of a plastic bucket, large spoon, bottling bucket and some bottle caps. We hardly knew what what would be ahead of us 16 years later! We learned a lot over the last 16 years and feel that we really refined our craft. We are a small (Nano) brewer...See More
name: Ship Bottom Brewery

description: On January 3rd, 1995, The Ship Inn was proud to become the first brewpub in New Jersey to brew beer since prohibition. Nestled in the scenic Delaware valley, The Ship Inn provides a comfortable pub atmosphere to enjoy the British inspired foods with locally sourced and ecologically responsible ingredients, and craft-brewed ales. The Ship Inn building
name: Ship Inn Brewpub

description:
Nova Scotia has a long history as a center for shipbuilding excellence; especially our schooners. We have built champions, a Canadian Icon for our country's Dime and now a second Nova Scotia Sailing Ambassador.

ShipBuilders Cider continues Nova Scotia's 400-year history of making cider from our world famous orchards. Shipbuilding and cider making; Craftmanship runs generations deep in Nova Scotia.

ShipBuilders Cider takes pride in making no substitute for quality, creating an outstanding craft cider, incredibly crisp and refreshing, a distinctly Nova Scotian cider.
name: ShipBuilders Cider

description:
Welcome to Shipwrecked Restaurant, Brew Pub & Inn, Door County’s Only Microbrewery!

Stop in for one of our hand crafted ales while you’re in Egg Harbor or ask for 6 packs at your favorite retailers throughout Northeastern Wisconsin.
name: Shipwrecked Restaurant and Brewery

description: Since 1994, Shipyard Brewing Company has been brewing fine quality products with a wide range of style profiles. We use only top quality ingredients and pride ourselves on the consistency and freshness of our products. All our beer is hand crafted from recipes developed by master brewer Alan Pugsley, one of the most influential people in the craft brewing movement in North America.  Shipyard is available in 35+ states around the country and markets for our freshly brewed, hand-crafted beers continue to expand.
name: Shipyard Brewing

description: New Brunswick Canada's smallest production Nano Brewery. Simple craft beers that are "As Natural as our Landscape" completely unfiltered all natural brewing. Cheers!
name: Shiretown Beer

description:
Shmaltz Brewing Company is an American craft brewing company that brews He'brew Beer. Shmaltz is known for blurring beer styles and using puns, art, history, and pop culture in every aspect of its products. 

Founded as the first and still only "Jewish-celebration beer," proprietor Jeremy Cowan established the company in San Francisco in 1996 with the first 100 cases of He’brew Beer hand bottled and delivered throughout the Bay Area in his Grandmother’s Volvo. He’brew now sells across 35 states, through 40 wholesalers and nearly 5,000 retailers. 

After 17 years of being an outspoken cheerleader for contract brewing, Shmaltz recently broke with tradition and opened its own New York State production brewery in Clifton Park, NY, 10 minutes north of Albany’s capital district. Shmaltz’s new home boasts a 50-barrel brewhouse with 30,000 barrels of annual capacity. The new brewery packages 12 and 22 ounce bottles and kegs of their diverse core and seasonal favorites, and hosts fans and beer tourists in their new tasting room for tours, barrel-aged previews, and special releases.
name: Shmaltz Brewing Company

description: Shock Top is a traditional Belgian-Style wheat ale. It was originally created in 2006 as a seasonal brew under the name Spring Heat Spiced Wheat. After collecting gold in ’06 and bronze in ’07 in the Belgian White category at the North American Beer Awards, we decided to brew year-round and switch the name to Shock Top.  We couldn’t be happier with our decision.
name: Shock Top Brewing Company

description: Shoreline Brewery is a brewery and restaurant located near the shores of Lake Michigan in Michigan City, Indiana. Twelve beers are always on tap, including the World Beer Cup Award winning Beltaine Scottish Ale and Singing Sands Oatmeal Stout, and seasonal beers such as Samuel Jacksons Black IPA, Bavarian Bombshell Black Lager, and the Barrel Aged Imperial Stout Lost Sailor. In the eight years of existence, Shoreline Brewery has evolved and grown into so much more than just a brewery.
name: Shoreline Brewery

description:
In April of 2004 we opened the doors to Short’s Brewing Company in the quaint Village of Bellaire.  Beer was the mission, and liberation was the movement.  With a lot of elbow grease, blind ambition and a little luck, the quest to create a community pub in Northwest Lower Michigan began to take shape.  The philosophy was to bring an appreciation of craft beer to the north with product education and creativity.  The process of appreciation through education we call beer liberation.

Today Short’s Brewing Company continues the effort to educate and liberate consumers.  We take pride in our hands on, mom and pop approach and the energy we put into the quality of our beer, food, staff, customers and facilities. We believe in the power of the smallness.   We intend on remaining a smaller, state wide beer distributor and focusing our energies close to home (the SBC Michigan stimulus package).  Our goal is to get to a comfortable production volume, enjoy what we do and love life in Northern Michigan.
name: Short's Brewing Company

description:
Shrub Steppe Defined: 

"Shrub" refers to the most abundant plant species that grows in this ecosystem. 

"Steppe" is a Russian word that means a vast treeless plain.
Shrub steppe is a type of natural grassland with a discontinuous overstory layer of shrubs such as low lying sagebrush; distinguishable by elevation, climate, and other unique characteristics. Prior to urban development, shrub steppe historically dominated the landscape in eastern Washington. When fortunate enough to find an undisturbed section of these perennial grasses, sagebrush, and rimrock outcrops, a shrub steppe will overwhelm you with its sweeping vistas and stark beauty.
name: Shrub Steppe Brewing

description: Nano brewpub located north of Pittsburgh in the historical town of Zelienople, PA.  We offer a wide selection of beers & full menu completely from scratch.  If the Shu Fits, Drink It.
name: ShuBrew

description: Owned By Carlsberg
name: Shumensko Pivo

description: Family-owned production brewery and tasting room in Westlake, Ohio exclusively featuring our hand-crafted ales.
name: Sibling Revelry  Brewing

description: Sick N Twisted Brewery selects local ingredients for our unique beers. Join us and relax on our patio with your friends or sit by the fire and indulge in some twisted fun!! Come lube your palate with us; after all Micro Brews are the new Social Lubricant...
name: Sick N Twisted Brewing Co.

description: A 100% barrel-aged, mostly barrel fermented, gypsy brewing project.
name: Side Project Brewing

description:
Visit our tasting room - The Sidebar - adjacent to the 5th Quadrant. Enjoy a variety of barrel aged and seasonal specialty beers, available in limited quantities and only in the tasting room.

The Sidebar is open Fridays from 4pm to 10pm and Saturdays from 2pm to 10pm. Stop by to taste some of our fine ales, buy a bottle or two of our ales to go, or purchase a keg for those special occasions.

The Sidebar is the venue of choice for most of our release parties. Want to join in the fun? Sign up for our newsletter, or follow us on Facebook/Twitter and be in the know.

Keep the Sidebar in mind for meetings and get-togethers. The Sidebar is available for private parties and special events Sunday through Thursdays.
name: Sidebar

description:
Sideswipe Brewing is a nano brewery in Columbus, Ohio.  They are known for their palate-punching beers.

Taproom Hours
Thursday 5pm-9pm
Friday & Saturday 5pm-10pm
name: Sideswipe Brewing

description: Sidhe Brewing Company is woman-owned and operated, but welcoming to all. One of our core missions is to be a local, East Side business, contributing to the economy and culture where we live. We also consider ourselves to be fringey folk, and as such we seek to provide a fun place for all the folks we love to come and hang out. We strive to make excellent beer that will appeal to the widest segment of society possible, but we will also provide other beverages to those who don’t choose to indulge.
name: Sidhe Brewing Company

description:
The Celtic people regarded the apple tree as the tree of love and the apple itself as the fruit of luck… Cider would probably be esteemed as the blood of Asturias.

For nearly a decade we have being producing natural cider in the heart of Asturias, following traditional methods while always taking full advantage of new technology . We invite you to find out more about us on this website where we’ll show you the best of ourselves, our cider, our cider evenings... our home.

Carlos Glez. Ballesteros
name: Sidra Fanjul

description: Since 1925, Trabanco has been synonymous with a prized cider obtained from one of the best apple varieties selected and prepared using only methods unchanged for centuries, traditional methods that solely have been adding conditions recommends common sense and imposes ultimately modernity.
name: Sidra Trabanco

description:
Master artisan cider maker, Dominic LAGADEC follows a very precise method to develop his craft SAGARNO, literally apple wine. He is called the "Maître de Chai".

Our ciderhouse has a production capacity of about 26,415 gallons.

The kupelas (lightning) are maintained at a temperature of 53.6° F for an optimal preservation of aromas and the typical beaded Sagarno. They are made with chestnut or oak and have a capacity of 790 to 2,640 gallons.

Unique in the Basque Country, the ciderhouse has the distinction of being opened to guests during Txotx. In Txopinondo, the "Maître de Chai" opens the kupelas in agreement with the dishes you have chosen: TXOTX!
name: Sidreria Txopinondo

description: The Urbitarte cider, cider outside the traditional route, was founded in 1991 in Ataun. Located in the Ergoiena neighborhood gets lots of visitors from neighboring Navarre, since it is directly connected. It is located in a mountainous enclave, and facing the vicissitudes of winter, remains open until almost the end of spring, so that people can use the visit. Currently produces around 150,000 liters of cider per year.
name: Sidrería Urbitarte

description:
Located in Moriarty, New Mexico and also known as Rio Grande Brewing Company. We currently brew during the year 10-12 of our own Brews. We now have a full 1/2 acre Beer Garden complete with horseshoes, bocci ball a couple of grills and pleanty of seating.

We  Bottle 17 different beers for distribution.

Ben Couger is the brewmaster and Rich Weber still brews as well.  With a total of 11 people including office staff we anticipate brewing about 9100 barrels this year. 

Our Brewery is open 6 days a week and always ready to offer up a cold pint or give a tour of our Brewery.

Come on by and see what may be brewing or being bottled. 

We also do contract brewing for Abbey Beverage, Premier Beverage (Isotopes Amber and Blonde), Guns & Oil Brewing and Rodeo Cold Brewing. 

Always a good time here at Sierra Blanca Brewing/ Rio Grande Brewing Company!!
name: Sierra Blanca Brewing Company

description: Sierra Leone Brewery Limited's (SLBL) core values - respect, enjoyment and a passion for quality - help to define our corporate culture and working methods. They are fundamental to the way we do business today, they support our drive towards economic, environmental and social sustainability
name: Sierra Leone Brewery

description: An interesting microbrewery -- brewpub -- that started brewing in 1998.
name: Sierra Madre Brewing Co.

description:
The Sierra Nevada Brewing Company was established in 1980 by homebrewers Ken Grossman and Paul Camusi. Camusi retired in 1998 and sold his share in the company to Grossman.

Located in Chico, California, Sierra Nevada Brewing is one of the most popular craft breweries currently operating in the United States. Its Pale Ale is world renowned, and the brewery produces almost 700,000 barrels of beer per year. Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale is the second best-selling craft beer in the United States, behind the Boston Beer Company's Samuel Adams Boston Lager.

Sierra Nevada's specialty brews include the winter seasonal Celebration, which is similar to the pale ale, but hoppier; and Summerfest, a lager which is citrusy and sunny.
name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company

description: Jerry Sietsema Sr. operated his orchard and family farm from the Grand Rapids location from 1934 to 1995. After that time Sietsema Orchards moved to 8540 2 Mile Road in Ada Michigan, where it resides today. Although the farm was fully operational and proving to be a success, the goods produced were sold on mainly a wholesale level to a Grand Rapids area packing house. Beginning in, 2010, we decided to expand our business and our dream. This is where the 3rd, 4th, and 5th generation of Sietsema Orchards & Cider Mill hope to thrive and grow. We are committed to providing quality produce, and by opening our doors to the public, providing a family farm experience that we hope you enjoy here in West Michigan.
name: Sietsema Orchards

description: Life For Beer - Beer For Life
name: Sigma Brewing

description:
Our two greatest passions are music and beer. Signature Brew brings them both together. Music provides the drive for making beers that are challenging, engaging and refreshing.

First and foremost we want to make beers, inspired by music, that we are proud of and love drinking. That is the beginning and end, of why we run Signature Brew, but let’s fill you in on the inbetween...

Signature Brew began life as a three man (Dave, Tom & Sam) crusade against the monotonous nature of the beer at all the gigs we had played, and been to, over the years. When the music on stage was a labor of love and art, we didn’t want to enjoy it with passionless, uninspiring and insipid lagers.

In 2011 we began trying to change this. We spoke to a few bands we knew to see if they’d be interested in brewing with us (they were), and so we set about taking our home brewing to a commercial level.

The new ‘Signature Brew : Originals’ range launched in 2014, crossing musical and beer boundaries. Taking creative control for ourselves and using our experience from the last 3 years to make beers that everyone will enjoy and appreciate.
name: Signature Brew

description:
Sigtuna Brygghus arrived in 2005 at ölentusiasterna Peter Forss ', David Meadows ' and Dan Lundgren's initiative. With their history as leading personalities since the 1980s behind the new Swedish ölboomen project was a unique experience.

Sigtuna Brygghus ' beer was originally the luxurious new interpretations of historical ölstilar and they made quick success. The small-budgeted production was exceeded after only one year.

With inspiration from American craft beer a la New York and Boston was launched, among others, the East River and East Coast Pale Ale, which in a short time have become bestsellers in Sweden with microbrewery standards.

From 2009 to 2011, when the brewery with the help of partner Galateas investment could be expanded, sexdubblades sales. Sigtuna Brygghus sped up as one of the biggest brands in Swedish hantverksöl.

The product portfolio, with both delightfully flavorful session beer that exciting experimentbrygder, has made itself a reputation internationally and in several exhibitions. Not least through many awards at Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival in recent years.

In the fixed range includes 3 stock and ale, all available at Systembolaget. Each year brewed a wide selection of seasonal and specialty beers, which won prizes and a warm reception.

Discover Sigtuna Brygghus ' beer so you can understand why.
name: Sigtuna Brygghus

description:
Steve and I got into business together in 1990 when we opened our first restaurant, Top Notch Burger, in East Bremerton. We operated with a menu of fresh, made-to-order hamburgers, fresh cut French Fries and real ice cream shakes. Our 2nd location was here at our Silverdale location. We had fun and we still have Silver City Guests ask us about 39 cent hamburgers and grilled onion burgers. We miss 'em too, but we proved it's real hard to put the big hamburger chains out of business. It isn't as easy as it looks.

In 1996 we decided to switch gears and get into the Brewpub business. We sold our Bremerton location and remodeled the Silverdale location into what it is today.

We operate today on the same principles as we did when we opened our first Top Notch Burger. We work hard at making sure each Guest leaves happier than when they arrived. We work hard side-by-side with our staff and train them to treat their Guests like you would treat a Guest in your own home.
name: Silver City Restaurant & Brewery

description: Established in 1999, Silver Creek Brew Company formed from a local home-brewers’ club. We opened our brewpub in Cedarburg’s historic grist mill in 2002, and have been brewing our own craft beers, based on the club’s recipes, in-house since 2004. We currently brew four year-round beers and four seasonals, plus our classic blonde root beer.
name: Silver Creek Brewing Co

description: Silver Gulch Brewing and Bottling Co. has been in operation since February 1998 in the small mining community of Fox, Alaska, located about 10 miles north of Fairbanks on the Steese Highway. Silver Gulch Brewing grew from brewmaster Glenn Brady's home-brewing efforts in 5-gallon batches to its current capacity of 24-barrel (750 gallon) batches.
name: Silver Gulch Brewing Company

description: Silver Moon Brewery is a craft brewery, restaurant and live entertainment venue located in downtown Bend, Oregon. We serve a variety of hand-crafted micro brews and a tasty pub menu in our fun and casual taproom.
name: Silver Moon Brewing

description:
The Silver Peak Restaurant and Brewery was born from a friendship and a dream. We came up with the concept in the late 80?s, about seven years after we met.
We’d been talking about opening a business together for years. We eventually narrowed the field down to the idea of an upscale, modern-version of the classic brewpub. Then in 1991 the idea became a goal. That goal was to create a unique place in Reno; a restaurant and brewery where the service was as good as the food and the beer was worth coming back for; a place where locals could meet friends after work, or treat their dates and clients to original and delicious dishes.
name: Silver Peak Brewery And Restaurant

description: A small brewery deep in Ontario wine country working to make delicious, high quality beer.
name: Silversmith Brewing Company

description:
Our beers are hand crafted in small batches on a five-barrel system. The volume we produce allows a hands-on approach to every beer we create.

The Tap Room has 6 brews on draft during the summer season. Our canning line is running and we are in production year-round. You will find our canned beer at liquor stores throughout the western slope of Colorado.

At the beginning of 2011, we expanded our distribution to the entire state of Colorado.
name: Silverton Brewing Company

description: Simpleton Craft Ales is a San Francisco brewing company. Our focus is to create delicious, balanced, hop-forward ales.
name: Simpleton Craft Ales

description: Sin City Brewing Co. is a Las Vegas-based microbrewery launched by long-time Gordon Biersch Director of Brewing Operations Richard Johnson. Produced to satisfy both the microbrew savvy drinker and those with a preference for a traditional domestic style beer, Sin City beers accentuate the indulgent nature of Las Vegas. The beers are brewed in small batches (100 kegs at a time) using traditional methods, premium raw materials and a strict adherence to the Rheinheitsgebot, the 1516 German beer purity law that differentiates Sin City beers from the big guys. Sin City beers are brewed and distributed exclusively in Las Vegas.Sin City Brewing Co. also features a popular retail line that is available through its online store and its branded microbrew bars at Miracle Mile Shops, The Grand Canal Shoppes and Flamingo Las Vegas.
name: Sin City Beer Company

description:
Our mission is to brew beers built for the venturesome beer drinker, those unafraid to stray from the beaten path of simple flavors established by breweries much larger in size but not in creative energy.

As our name implies, we will be brewing at a slower rate of production than any of these monstrous breweries-designing and creating our hand crafted ales at one relatively slow pace, our "single speed", allowing each to emerge as a small artisanal batch formulated from recipes that include fresh, local, seasonal and organic ingredients.
name: SingleSpeed Brewing Company

description: Siren Craft Brew exists to encourage more people to enjoy, fall for and experiment with craft beer.
name: Siren Craft Brew

description: Craft beers, brewed without a purpose, for a greater purpose. One need not imagine Sisyphus happy, especially when his stomach is filled with beer.
name: Sisyphus Brewing

description:
Six Rivers Brewery is a proud member of Humboldt Made.
We pride ourselves on being the culmination of good food, great beer and love of a good time; providing quality and distinctive beer and menu items, utilizing local and organic ingredients whenever possible. “The Brew with a View,” is situated on the top of the hill in McKinleyville, California over looking the Pacific Ocean. PS: Remember, when it rains, we pour! It's always happy hour when it's raining!
name: Six Rivers Brewery

description: Six Row Brewing Company produces quality ales from the site of the old Falstaff Brewery at 3690 Forest Park Ave., in the Midtown area of St. Louis, near St. Louis University. Our Old Plant No. 1 Pub is open to the public and features our craft brewed beers along with selections from other craft breweries and wineries. Stop by and enjoy a pint soon! Then, take home a growler to enjoy one of St. Louis' finest craft beers till your next visit!
name: Six Row Brewing Company

description:
Based in Erina on the beautiful N.S.W Central Coast, situated between sydney and newcastle and proudly the Coast's first homegrown craft brewery . We are 100% locally owned company with a 100% locally made product. 

Established in 2012 and officially opening our doors in 2013, Six String Brewing Company is all about great beer and great music! The idea of opening up their own brewery was spawned in 2009 after long term home brewer Chris had had enough of the IT and corporate world took to convincing old school friend, Adam that it was more than just a great idea. After a number of 'research trips' to Western Australia, New Zealand and the U.S it was a good 12 months before the idea got off the ground and the reality of what was involved began to hit home. After a number of false starts and a marathon of bureaucratic hurdles  the current location was secured in 2012 and the real fun of setting up the brew house and taproom began. 

Six String Brewing company has in the short time its been open has with chris' brews and Adams sales expertise gone from strength to strength and hope to continue spreading word of the craft beer revolution happening across Australia starting with the Central Coast.
name: Six String Brewing Co

description: Six Ten Brewing is a locally owned and operated brewery opening soon in the Town and Country neighborhood of Tampa. With over 20 years of brewing experience we produce craft beer in a variety of styles which we will proudly serve in our tasting room while guest can enjoy a front row seat to view the brewing process.
name: Six Ten Brewing

description:
Sixpoint Craft Ales was founded in 2004 by Shane Welch, a former homebrewer that originally grew up in Milwaukee. The microbrewery is located in a 7,000-square-foot (650 m2) factory in in Red Hook, Brooklyn that formerly manufactured filing cabinets. Sixpoint began business by only distributing kegs to local bars and restaurants; instead of bottling its beer, filling growlers at bars were the only way for customers to drink the beer at their homes. 

In 2011 Sixpoint launched initial canned  offerings of 16 oz, year-round styles Sweet Action, Bengali Tiger, Righteous Ale and The Crisp.  Further releases have included the 12 oz Resin and 3Beans, as well as 16oz seasonal offerings such as Apollo and Autumnation.
name: Sixpoint Brewery

description: Characters Brewing Beer With Character Since 1995
name: Ska Brewing Company

description:
With roots dating back to the Klondike Gold Rush of 1898, the Skagway Brewing Company first opened its doors in 1897 to serve the thirsty prospectors who had abandoned everything to head North and strike it rich in the gold fields. During its heyday, the Skagway Brewing Company and its brew master Herman Barthel, the most technologically adorned brewer on the West coast, produced up to 30,000 barrels of beer per year and had a bottling operation on site. Multiple breweries operated out of Skagway during the peak of the Gold Rush and by 1900 competition was fierce amongst them. With the Skagway economy on a decline due to the fervor of the gold rush ending and growing prohibition support, the Skagway Brewing Company closed its doors in 1904. In 1916, the “Alaska Bone Dry Law” was passed effectively ending the making and consumption of alcoholic beverages in the Territory of Alaska.

In 1997, a local entrepreneur reopened the Skagway Brewing Co. in the Golden North Hotel until 2002 when it again ceased operations. With the brewing tanks collecting dust and locals thirsty for microbrews, South Dakota native and long time Skagway resident, Michael Healy spotted an opportunity and bought the equipment in 2007. Operating in a brand new building, the Skagway Brewing Company again fired up the brew tanks and on July 4th, 2007 opened its doors once again much to the pleasure of locals and visitors alike. This bustling business keeps growing, frantically brewing to keep up with the high demand of its brews and quality-dining menu. We invite you to stop by 7th and Broadway for a fresh pint, delicious food, and a good time.
name: Skagway Brewing Company

description:
Skeena Brewing Company is rich in tradition and offers beer drinkers one of the most refreshing beer tastes imaginable -- Wolfgang's Premium Lager Beer.

The concept for a German Style Beer was born in 1997 when Ontario beer consumers were beginning to show interest in international flavours. Our expert brewers chose only the best ingredients for its creation, and our finest German style lager is brewed in small batches using world famous Hersbrucker hops and premium malted barley.

Wolfgang's® beer is cold filtered and sterile filled.

No additives or preservatives are used in the brewing of this premium, all natural, and great tasting beer.
name: Skeena Brewing Company

description: Sketchbook Brewing Co. is a nanobrewery in Evanston, IL, producing finely-crafted small-batch beers for local consumption.
name: Sketchbook Brewing Company

description: Craft beer is exploding across the nation and across our own state of North Carolina. Skull Camp Brewing is very excited to bring the love and passion of craft beer to the Elkin area.
name: Skull Camp Brewing

description:
Incorporated in December 2011, the Skull Coast Brewing Company, Inc., is a new entity formed for the express purpose of brewing and distributing handcrafted artisan ales, and whose history has yet to be written. Prior to its formation, Dave Fox launched and operated the Skull Coast Ale Company, a limited liability company (LLC.), located in Fort Mill, South Carolina, organized in 2009. Without the investment dollars needed to start his own brewery, the Skull Coast Ale Company operated as a “Contract Brewing” or “Beer Marketing” company, in craft beer terms. For those unfamiliar with the terminology, the company contracted with other breweries to produce its beer recipes, and marketed the products under the Skull Coast name.

After months of recipe development and searching for a brewery to contract with, Dave Fox brewed Skull Coast's first beer on St. Patrick's Day, 2010, in Virginia. The result was Maelstrom IPA; a true west coast style India Pale Ale, aggressively hopped with seven different Northwest hops. After months of traveling back and forth between South Carolina and Virginia to brew and transport kegs (roughly seven hours each way), Dave sought out a second contract brewing relationship closer to home. Unfortunately, every Carolina brewery Dave approached was at or near capacity. Undeterred, Dave created his own capacity. In the first of its kind contract model, Dave purchased his own 60bbl fermenter and bright tanks, and placed them in another brewery.

The Skull Coast Brewing Company is the continuation of a lifelong dream. The brand was born in a small Charleston library after looking at a local map drawn in the 1700's, during the Golden Age of Piracy, with the words "Skull Coast" etched along the Carolina coastline. The Skull Coast products matured and our understanding of the beer business was developed during our contract brewing experience, under the Skull Coast Ale Company. Now, with a new entity, our own facility and unrestricted in our growth, the Skull Coast Brewing Company hopes to become a lifelong part of your history.
name: Skull Coast Ales

description:
You've noticed the sky reaching beams coming out of the old Avalon Cinema building... You noticed that the street was blocked all day as we installed our brew tanks... You've noticed Sky High Brewing & Pub!

The Tasting Room is officially open on the mezzanine level; we will open the whole space in sections as each new level is ready. We plan to install as many bike racks as we can... and encourage two-wheeled transportation. :)
name: Sky High Brewing & Pub

description:
Slanted Rock Brewing Company, LLC was founded in Meridian, Idaho on June 2011 by Bob Lonseth and Vincent Melchor. The Partners and additional investment from John E. MacCrisken has financed the start-up of this venture.

Slanted Rock plans to start Operations in Fall 2012 with a 15 BBL Brewhouse, 2-15BBL Fermenters, 1- 30BBL Fermenter, 1-15BBL Brite Tank and 1-30BBL Brite Tank. Production volume will be packaged in kegs initially with hopes of adding bottle or canning in the future.

Keg Sales will be self-distributed initially, with future distribution outside of Idaho. Retail Customers can buy kegs and pick-up direct from the location at a discounted keg price. Individuals can also purchase kegs in the following sizes: ½ BBL, 1/6 BBL

The brewery location will open a tap room where Slanted Rock and other selected craft brewers will be on tap. Sample flights, pints, half pints & growlers will be available for sale.
name: Slanted Rock Brewing Company

description: SlapShot Brewing Co is a startup brewery in Chicago. We will be brewing on our 3.5bbl brewhouse with a focus on beers brewed with locally sourced ingredients. Brewing small batches will allow us to bring you a line of unique session ales as well as some pretty awesome seasonals.
name: SlapShot Brewing Co.

description: Slate Creek is a little know tributary to the St. Joe River deep in the mountains of North Idaho. Hidden by steep rugged canyon walls, Slate Creek has long been a secret spot for anglers and whitewater explorers. Slate Creek Brewing Co., like the mountain stream it is named after, is a secret spot for craft beer explorers, serving up adventurous, rugged and beautifully hand crafted ales for those daring enough to explore the un-trampled path. Discover the secret spot in your own backyard.
name: Slate Creek Brewing Co.

description:
The Sleeman brewery is located at the edge of southern Guelph, approximately 80 kilometres West of Toronto.

Established by John Sleeman, with a lineage that extends over five generations, John takes particular pride in his heritage. In fact, when it comes to beer tradition, his grandfather George A. Sleeman wrote the book on it - literally. 

John's family's brewing tradition in Canada extends back to 1834 when John H. Sleeman arrived in Ontario from Cornwall, England. By 1851, he started the first Sleeman brewery to be located in Guelph, Ontario, brewing small 100-barrel batches. 

The passion that drove John's great-great-grandfather to begin his renowned Canadian brewing tradition is the same passion that runs through John's veins today - and we look forward to passing on the tradition to many more generations to come.

An art as much as a science, beer making depends equally on the talent of the brewmaster and the quality of the ingredients. 

Premium brewing employs a time-honoured process in which natural ingredients are blended in myriad combinations and brewed in small batches to produce beers that range from contemporary light brews to 'Old World' dark stouts.
name: Sleeman Breweries Ltd.

description: Sleeping Giant Brewing Co. brews unique craft beer with quality ingredients to delight novice and sophisticated beer drinkers in our community. We strive to mirror the evolving craft beer resurgence of North America by providing flagship, seasonal and limited edition brews. We will motivate and educate our consumers to not just drink their beer, but to EARN IT with a balanced lifestyle.
name: Sleeping Giant Brewing Co.

description:
The Snow Goose Restaurant and Sleeping Lady Brewing Company is located in downtown Anchorage, Alaska. It overlooks Cook Inlet, with the second highest tide in the world (38 feet) and the active industrial port of Anchorage. On clear days, North America's highest peak, Denali (Mt. McKinley) stands majestically to the north. To the west sits our brewery's namesake, Sleeping Lady (Mt. Susitna). Please join us for our fine hand crafted beers and Alaskan influenced entrees!

The Goose was one of the first Brew Pubs in Anchorage. We have won numerous national and international awards for our finely craft ales. Our dining room is sandwiched between our award winning brewery and our wonderful views to the north. Our upstairs Pub has two walls of windows extending the views. On a cold day, you can sit by a warm fireplace with a hot meal and a cool beer. Our two outdoor decks off of the Pub offer mountain views, radiant sunsets, military aerobatics, and an active port.
name: Sleeping Lady Brewing Company

description: Dream. Play. A Lansing based brewery and distillery.
name: Sleepwalker Spirits and Ale

description: Established in 2009, Sleepy Dog Brewery has been brewing hand crafted beer for wholesale distribution throughout the state of Arizona. Our commitment to brewing consistent, quality beer with meticulous attention to detail has helped us consistently grow our distribution every year. Our products can be found throughout the state of Arizona and soon in Southern California. We supply beer to hundreds of bars and restaurants and most all major grocery and retail chains.
name: Sleepy Dog Brewery

description: Sleepy Owl Brewery is a nano brewery, located in Historic Downtown Kingsport, Tennessee.
name: Sleepy Owl Brewery

description: A small brewery formerly operating on a working farm, but now located at the Poulsbo downtown waterfront. Specializing in distinctive beers. Many beers feature an ingredient from nearby farms. Best known at this time for their rhubarb IPA, stinging nettle pale, and dandelion bitter. A truly unique experience!
name: Slippery Pig Brewery

description: Sloop brewing is a true nano brewery located in the Hudson Valley region. A Nano brewery is a licensed brewery using a brewing system of less than 4 barrels.  Brewing at this level allows us to spend more time crafting each and every beer to be exactly as it should be. Additionally, our local distribution ensures that every Sloop beer you drink will be fresh out of our brewery.
name: Sloop Brewing

description: Slopes Restaurant is Northern Maine's finest dining establishment! Slopes offers the only micro-brewery north of Bangor with a fine selection of hand-crafted beers. Our food is also world-class with a premium selection of Angus Beef to StarBucks Coffee and desserts that are world-famous!
name: Slopes Resturaunt And Brewpub

description: Slow Boat Brewery began in 2009 when two Americans met and bonded over their shared longing for the beers they grew up drinking in the states. As one of Beijing's first microbreweries, our beer is made in small batches using unhurried methods. No preservatives, no chemicals, just delicious craft beer that's kept cold from the brewery to your glass.
name: Slow Boat Brewery

description: A full production brewery and accompanying restaurant opened in 2004 by the owners of Sly Fox Brewhouse & Eatery in nearby Phoenixville. The 20bbl brewhouse packages a wide range of beers in 12oz cans, 22oz bottles and 750ml bottles. Pikeland Pils, a multiple GABF Gold Medal Winner, and O'Reilly's Stout, a nitro-poured, draught-only beer named after brewer Brian O'Reilly's grandfather are among its most popular beers, on and off premises, as are such Belgian-style delights as Incubus Tripel, Ichor Quadrupel, Saison Vos & Black Raspberry Reserve. Sly Fox is also noted for its Bock Beers (see listing for the Phoenixville pub for more details) and annual Christmas Ale.
name: Sly Fox Brewing Company

description: Small Batch Beer Co. is a brewery and handcrafted cocktail bar in downtown Winston-Salem, NC. Soon to be located in the Kopper Kitchen building, our goal is to give every patron a unique taste and experience each time they come through the door.
name: Small Batch Beer Company

description: Small Town Brewery makes specialty beers that utilize unique ingredients with an unmistakable taste of nostalgia.
name: Small Town Brewery

description: Smartmouth Brewing Co. makes beer, thinks beer, talks beer and drinks beer.
name: Smartmouth Brewing Company

description: Colorado Springs brewery specializing in session beers. We have medium beers, not mediocre.
name: Smiling Toad Brewery

description: Smith Rock Brewing is actually located about 9 miles south of its namesake in the town of Redmond. It’s Redmond’s 3rd brewery which originally opened up as a brewpub with a half-barrel brewing operation. In addition to it’s own brew, this neighborhood brewery serves up some food and boasts a pretty good gust tap list. If you live in Redmond and love craft beer, there’s no doubt you’ve already stopped in – but if you are passing thru, or visiting the town, stopping in is a must!  Cheers!
name: Smith Rock Brewing Company

description: Smog City Brewing is a Los Angeles based brewery devoted to putting its mark on the craft beer scene with exceptionally balanced and creatively inspired beers.
name: Smog City Brewing

description: We are a locally owned company and group of friends who are very passionate about Texas BBQ, good Texas craft beers, and live music. We've had a vision of a business that could bring the very best in these things together, and now our vision has become reality. Smoke 'n Hops will brew our own beer on site, smoke our own Texas-style BBQ, and bring in prominent musicians as well as local acts with ties to the community. It is very important to us to tie these things in with a fun, family-oriented environment. Therefore we have installed a playground so the younger ones are having fun while the older ones are at play.
name: Smoke'n Hops

description: We are a natural gathering place for any televised sporting event or just a great meal. Inside you'll find one of the largest working micro breweries in the state of TN. And don't forget the live entertainment nightly.
name: Smoky Mountain Brewery

description: Telluride, Colorado's only brew pub!
name: Smugglers Brew Pub

description: Smuttynose was founded in 1994 by the folks who started the Northampton and Portsmouth Breweries. We brew a wide range of beers, from our year-round beers: Finestkind IPA, Old Brown Dog, Robust Porter, Star Island Single and Shoals Pale Ale; our seasonals to The Big Beer Series & our rare Smuttlabs releases; we brew something for everyone in the 24 states where we sell beer. Smuttynose is excited to begin production in it's new state-of-the-art, energy-stingy brewery in early 2014.  Please come visit for a tour or a bite in our restaurant.
name: Smuttynose Brewing Company

description: Evanston brewpub and smokehouse. Craft beer, wood fired pizza, and Texas inspired BBQ. Reservations strongly encouraged.
name: Smylie Bros. Restaurant & Brewery

description:
America's most award-winning small brewery since 1994 offering a wide array of lagers and ales with hand-crafted cuisine. Locals and tourists alike co-mingle in a friendly and casual environment.

Make yourself at home at Snake River Brewing in the heart of the Teton Mountain Range. All roads, trails, bike paths, climbing routes and ski runs lead to “The Brewpub”! After a day in the great outdoors how can you not partake of a tasty malt beverage and a delicious meal
name: Snake River Brewing

description:
The Sneeuberg Brewery and deli is essentially a one-man show and the beer and cheese served here are made by the owner. Even the coffee is roasted on site.

The beer is free of preservatives or additives using only malt, hops and natural spring water. There are three difference ales: the crisper more bitter Karoo Ale, the slightly sweeter Honey Ale and the smoky dark Roasted Ale.
name: Sneeuberg Brewery

description:
Walk between six tall lodge poles that flank the entrance of Snipes Mountain Brewery & Restaurant, push open the big double doors, and come on in. A unique pub and dining experience is waiting for you.

Find a seat at the oak bar, in front of the fireplace, or on the wrap-around patio.

Designed to reflect the surrounding countryside, there's plenty of wide open spaces for everyone. Separate banquet rooms are also available and children are always welcome!
name: Snipes Mountain Microbrewery & Restaurant

description: We are a group of people with a passion for beer, the outdoors and for having a good time. Currently under construction, we hope to be open by Christmas.
name: Snitz Creek Brewery

description:
We are a small private company, located in historic downtown Snoqualmie, Washington.  Founders Pat Anderson, David McKibben, Dave Eiffert, LeRoy Gmazel and Tom Antone did not have the sense to know that you had to be crazy to start a brewery in 1997, when most of the rest of the world thought the craft brewing industry was going down the tube, so 13 years later, here we are.

Our products are now available in 22 oz bombers at the brewery and in an ever increasing number of stores between Bellingham and Olympia, as well as in eastern Washington and northern Idaho.
name: Snoqualmie Falls Brewing Company

description: Idaho Falls' newest and finest brewing and grill establishment.
name: Snow Eagle Brewing

description: A departure from the traditional, Snowbank Brewing focuses on innovation and a passion for the Colorado lifestyle.
name: Snowbank Brewing CO

description:
Snowshoe Brewing Co. was founded in early 1995, with a mission to brew great beer and create a diverse menu of good food. Our brewpub & restaurant was opened in Arnold, Calaveras County, in the former location of The Meadowmont Inn, overlooking the golf course. 

Our brewers have created award-winning ales that have ale lovers throughout Central California and the Sierras asking for a Snowshoe at their favorite pubs and restaurants. The staff at our restaurant wants to ensure that your meal is enjoyable… served with our Snowshoe hospitality!

The beer is bottled in Calaveras and brewed using a 15-barrel brewhouse, three 15-barrel fermenters and three 30-barrel fermenters. Our specialty beers include India Pale Ale, Westridge Winter Ale, Cutthroat Strong Ale, Oktoberfest, Irish Red, Porter, Midnight Moon Oatmeal Stout.
name: Snowshoe Brewing Company

description:
The Snowy Mountain Brewery is located in beautiful Saratoga, Wyoming and is the anchor brewpub for the Saratoga Resort and Spa.  The Saratoga Resort and Spa consistently draws people from all over Colorado and Wyoming due to its unique offering of a variety of amenities in one location--such as an on-site brewery, mineral hot spring pools, great food, western-styled rooms, jeep, ATV and snowmobile rentals, a golf course and a full-service spa.  

The Snowy Mountain Brewery is gaining in exposure and was featured recently in Travel Pulse’s “5 Unique Beer Vacation Spots in the U.S.!”  The name Snowy Mountain is fitting for the brewery as it sits adjacent the majestic Snowy Range Mountains, in southern Wyoming. Boasting 8-10 different craft beers throughout each season, the Snowy Mountain Brewery is one of the fastest growing breweries in Wyoming and surrounding states. The famous brewpub, with a throw-back to the wild west, is adorned with big game mounts and bar-stools made with six-shooters and patinated saddles and features a full pub menu with selections that compliment Saratoga's finest craft beers.
name: Snowy Mountain Brewery

description: A combination Winery and Brewery located on a high hill on the South Side of Omaha. From light American style lagers to barrel aged Imperial Stouts there is a great variety of beer to sample brewed here on our premise. Great music venue with seating up to 2000 and live music year round.
name: Soaring Wings Vineyards and Brewery

description:
Hand crafted California beer by using quality ingredients and traditional European methods, while striving to promote health and wellness of humanity in our world.

We strive to produce top quality craft beer by using traditional European methods merged with the California flare and style; beers that Californians would be proud to call their own and to be enjoyed by all around the globe. As the core mission of our company, we also plan to contribute to local, regional, national and international organizations involved with preventive care and promotion of human health and well-being.
name: SoCal Beer Company

description: Sociable is driven by a pretty simple vision.  Cider should be much more than the lightly-alcoholic, made-from-concentrate, sweet apple juice boxes that currently dominate the shelf space.  Sociable ciders are well carbonated, dry and always made from real apples.  Simply put, they should be enjoyed like great draught beer. Sociable is not just hard cider, we're much more.
name: Sociable Cider Werks

description: Located in the Inner Sunset district of San Francisco, Social Kitchen is a friendly neighborhood brewpub with a full restaurant.  Find Social's beers at local bars and restaurants as well.  Our wide array of beers is ever changing and evolving, but you can always expect a mix of American, English, and Belgian ales as well as a lager or two.
name: Social Kitchen & Brewery

description:
Sociedade Central de Cervejas was established in 1934, with the aim of selling the beers produced by the former breweries, Companhia Produtora de Malte e Cerveja Portugália, Companhia de Cervejas Estrela, Companhia de Cervejas Coimbra and Companhia da Fábrica de Cerveja Jansen.
 
Centralcer – Central de Cervejas, E.P. is incorporated in 1977 following the merger of Sociedade Central de Cervejas, S.A.R.L. (incorporated in 1934) with Cergal - Cervejas de Portugal, S.A.R.L. (incorporated in 1972).
Centralcer – Central de Cervejas, S.A. was therefore created as a result of the above-mentioned company’s conversion into a joint stock company, regulated according to Decree-Law no. 300/90 of the 24th September. The Company’s total share capital is privatised in 1990, and it is the first operation of this kind to be undertaken in Portugal. The Bavaria Group purchases a shareholding in Centralcer - Central de Cervejas, S.A., and becomes one of its main shareholders.

Based on a strong leading position and the establishment of a winning team, Sociedade Central de Cervejas e Bebidas strategic objectives are an increased focus on its brands, consumers and clients, the creation of an atmosphere of success, operational efficiency and innovation.
name: Sociedade Central de Cervejas

description: Societe Brewing Company is a production brewery founded in San Diego, California by fellow professional brewers Travis Smith and Douglas Constantiner.  In 2012, Societe Brewing Company began production and opened its doors to a warm welcome from the San Diego craft beer community.  The brewery and tasting room occupy a 16,000 square foot facility in Kerney Mesa, in the eastern part of San Diego.  Societe Brewing Company focuses on hoppy Out West ales, Belgian-inspired Old World ales, and dark and flavorful Stygian ales.  The brewery also features a 3,000 square foot barrel room, and there are intentions to release a line-up of barrel-aged sour beers in the future.  Societe’s beers are available locally throughout San Diego, and also available at the tasting room.
name: Societe Brewing Company
Société Frigorifique et Brasserie de Tunis

description: Founded in 1996 on Federal Way, the brewery originally crafted beers for local restaurants. As our passion developed we moved to up onto the Boise bench in 2002. Our humble beginnings started with just a four barrel brewing system. In 2009 we upgraded to seven barrels. In 2012 we opened Our new production brewery on Fairview and Cloverdale which is 12,000 square feet, with a twenty barrel brewing system in place. That allows for 12,000 barrel production per year.
name: Sockeye Brewing

description: Solarc Brewing is a craft beer co. based out of Los Angeles CA.  Started by two avant-garde artists and crafty tinkerers Archie Carey and Saul Alpert Abrams make small batch specialty beers that experiment with alternative ingredients while still keeping a well balanced strong drinkable brew.
name: Solarc Brewing

description: Debuting in 2012, Solemn Oath Brewery features an array of American, Belgo-American, traditional, wood-aged and experimental beer styles. We're excited to join our Illinois craft brethren in providing you with another quality-focused, local option to satisfy your craft beer needs.
name: Solemn Oath Brewery

description: The brewery resides in an historical building that was built and operated as a movie theater from 1930 to the 1950's. Come join us for a pint, delicious food and the most spectacular view of Mt Hood's craggy North Face from our back patio.
name: Solera Brewery

description: We brew our beers to fit like your favorite pair of jeans.
name: Solid Rock Brewing

description: New brewery focusing on core Belgian styles.
name: Solvay Society

description: Small upstart looking to offer solid tasty local beer. We will focus on improving standard styles by using the best ingredients and taking the time to craft a beer that truly is better, and not just good. No frills. No "clever new ingredients!" Just solid tasty local beer.
name: SoMe Brewing Company

description:
Slumbrew is all about the synergy between craft products and every day consumption. Well conceived, locally-sourced, quality products should be an every day part of our lives – not a unique occurrence. This is the spirit of Slumbrew.

Slumbrew is the research & development brand and concept of Somerville Brewing Company. Our mission is to brew unique, ingredient-driven beers that challenge common notions of what a beer should taste like. It is the result of nearly 15 years of beer travel and research by Caitlin Jewell and Jeff Leiter; and a decade of Jeff’s homebrewing recipe formulation.

We produce a lot of small-run, pilot beers at the Slumbrew Beerlab, but only a small number make their way to commercial production. The Somerville Brewing Company contracts with regional breweries to make the best recipes for wide-spread commercial release, but each recipe is an evolving process of refinement. This model for beer production provides an opportunity to experiment with innovative local ingredients to produce craft beers that stand apart from typical formulations.
name: Somerville Brewing Company

description: An increasingly popular brewery from Coxhoe near Durham in the North East of England.  The brewery is named after a famous poem by Elizabeth Barrett Browning.
name: Sonnet 43 Brew House

description: Sonnisaari is a small brewery established in Oulu,Finland at 2014. Passion for making beer and for the modern beer culture caused us to establish a brewery. Locality and latest fashion in international beer culture combine in our beers.
name: Sonnisaari

description: Bringing you handcrafted, delicious hard ciders from Healdsburg, CA! Organic & Gluten Free.
name: Sonoma Cider

description: We are committed to producing excellent quality craft beer as well as providing interesting historical narratives to augment your tasting experience.  We have three screens with a Direct TV sports package for all the games and we are open for Monday night football with great food and $4.00 Imperial pints.
name: Sons of Liberty Aleworks

description:
It is the mission of Soo Brewing Company to produce beer that the people of Sault Ste. Marie can be proud of – beer that meets and exceeds the highest standard, our own. Our products will be unique and innovative, yet hold true to the old-world brewing traditions of our ancestors. The product will be affordable, allowing everyday people the opportunity to enjoy great hand-crafted beer.

The profits made by Soo Brewing Company will be put back into the community whenever possible. Employees of Soo Brewing Company will be treated like family, paid a livable wage and given the opportunity to advance through hard work. All employees will be fully knowledgeable about the product, the process and culture of beer and will treat customers as they would guests in their own home.

Soo Brewing Company will strive to promote beer culture and responsible enjoyment of the product, and will be relentless in our effort to improve the quality of the product and the efficiency by which it is produced. Soo Brewing Company will be a shining example of corporate ethics and social responsibility, and above all, enjoy what we do every day.
name: Soo Brewing Co.

description:
Our tasting room is located inside the brewery complete with all the sounds, aromas, sights and sensations of a working production brewery. We have up to 11 of our beers on tap for $4/glass as well as non-alcoholic, small-batch Ginger Ale made right here in the brewery.

We have snack food such as smoked salmon and cheese from Crimson Cove Smokehouse, cookies from Mirracole Morsels and peanuts from CB's Nuts. If you have a big appetite, you are welcome to bring in food of your own or order something for delivery while you are here.

Children are welcome in our tasting room.
name: Sound Brewery

description: A North Dakota Brewing Company. Locally owned brewpub/restaurant in Minot, ND.
name: Souris River Brewing

description:
South Austin Brewery was established in 2014. South Austin Brewery has two flagship beers. Kol-Beer and our (TPA) Texas Pale Ale.  Kol’ Beer is our award winning Kolsch style beer and has quickly become a local favorite and the go to beer for many a Texan. A subtle malt character, balanced with the right amount of hops. Clean, crisp and refreshing. 
TPA is the state’s first Texas-style IPA, a sessionable and easy drinking, everyday IPA. Hoppy, clean and balanced. 
The Luckenbock is our traditional German style bock beer Garnet in color, big in flavor. Malty, earthy and crisp. 
We added two new beers this spring, Six-String Saison and Crossroads Coffee Stout. Six String is our non traditional take on the Franco- Belgian style farmhouse ale. Complex flavors. Spicy, citric and funky. The Cross Roads is a coffee stout with a unique blend of roasted barley, chocolate malt and oats. Infused with fresh roasted Brazilian micro lot coffee. Big, malty, roasted flavor. 
The latest addition to the line up is our Evel Ale. A Blonde All American Ale. Brewed in honor of the iconic daredevil Evel Knievel. “There’s a little Evel in all of us”
name: South Austin Brewery

description: Our mission is to “Build a stronger community, one brew at a time.” That means the community of brewers, of craft beer drinkers, of foodies, of local food producers, and of course, South Bend. We plan to celebrate and support South Bend, honoring its long heritage of brewing and food producing by making great beer and backing it up with locally sourced food. Sustainability is hard at work in South Bend and it’s a core tenet for us. Adaptive reuse is a philosophy we’re embracing fully and you’ll see it throughout our pub. We are fiercely proud of this city and it is an honor to have it as part of our name and be part of its renaissance.
name: South Bend Brew Werks

description:
The brainchild of a couple of friends, South City Ciderworks started out of necessity. The necessity for an every-day-drinking, not overly sweet, and rationally sized canned cider.
