Our goal is to create a hard cider that can be enjoyed by everyone whether it's 100 degrees out or 30 degrees out. We strive to make a product that isn't overly sweet but not like a brute that leaves you yearning for sugar water after every sip. Our preferred method of delivery doesn't require you to devote large amounts of time, money, or energy to consume. Lastly, but most important, is our goal of giving back to our community. At South City Ciderworks we recognize the importance of community involvement and philanthropy which is why we are devoted to giving back.
name: South City Cider

description:
South County Brewing Co. is located in beautiful southern York county PA. 
Brewing handcrafted Ales and lagers on a production system with an onsite taproom for retail sales.
name: South County Brewing Company

description: South Fork Brewing is part of the great expansion of quality craft beer on the western side of the Twin Cities! Delano is a fantastic city that embraces the "Spirit of Community."
name: South Fork Brewing Company

description: A micro brewery that produces traditional English ales in the heart of the South Hams region.
name: South Hams Brewery

description:
The South Park region in central Colorado is well known for its long ranching history.  It also has a long brewing history which we are now honored to be a part of.  In the 1870s, the Leonhard Summer started the South Park Brewery in Fairplay also known as the Summer Brewery.  He brewed a South Park Lager that was famous throughout the area.  Another brewery, Trout Creek Brewery, opened in Fairplay in the 1990s, brewing excellent ales.

South Park Brewing opened in September 2014 started by husband and wife, Paul Kemp and Megan Sebastian.  They moved to the South Park area in 2006, falling in love with the natural beauty of the area.  Since Paul began brewing beer nearly the same time, they both felt there was a need to have a brewery in the Fairplay area.  After many years of business plans, searching locations, and perfecting beer recipes, the perfect opportunity arose with a great location and large enough space to grow the brewery.  We are located in the Rocky Top Plaza at the only stop light in Fairplay.  We are pleased to be the only brewery in Park County.
name: South Park Brewing

description: The South Shore Brewery is dedicated to producing flavorful, innovative products. We use the best of traditional techniques and tap the resources of originality from our professional staff.
name: South Shore Brewery

description:
The South Street Brewery was founded in 1998, and is housed in the renovated H. H. Hankins Hay and Grain warehouse built in the late 1800’s. Old brick walls, hardwood floors and thick timber pillars provide a striking setting for our custom built brewhouse and a spacious, welcoming atmosphere in which to enjoy our fresh, handcrafted ales and lagers as well as our seasonal fare.
Our commitment to on-premises brewing ensures that only the highest quality ingredients are used and that the beer is always fresh. This commitment has earned us regional and international praise but more importantly, results in a wide selection of styles and new, creative recipes that we hope will continually have our customers discovering new favorites.
Our menu also reflects our dedication to originality and fresh ingredients. We offer a seasonal menu as well as nightly specials, including an eclectic sampling of Contemporary American, Asian-Pacific, Continental, Creole, Caribbean and regional Southern dishes.
Our cuisine and libations are all served in a friendly, relaxed manner that challenges the idea that excellence necessitates pretense. We hope you enjoy your visit to South Street and that you return soon.
name: South Street Brewery

description: The word about the quality of our beer began to get around the metro New York region as soon as we turned on the spigots and started to serve it in our Southampton restaurant. Almost from day one, leading restaurants, pubs and taverns have requested our crafted brews for  their own patrons. Our Brewmaster, Phil Markowski  has personally directed the flow of our ales and lagers into the finest outlets. Our Mission is to offer a wide variety of specialty ales and lagers.  Our small batch brews range from classic farmhouse styles to traditional sessions beers to be enjoyed year-round.
name: Southampton Publick House

description: Southbound Brewing Company is the first production microbrewery located in Savannah, Georgia. Southbound released our first brew on May 15, 2013, and we aspire to become the most innovating and exciting yet. We want to use our backgrounds, skills, and insights to shed light on the beauty of the craft beer industry to our local community. By bringing the American beer revolution to Savannah's back door, we hope to cater to the tastes of the South by tantalizing your taste buds and keeping things interesting!
name: Southbound Brewing Company

description: We are a local micro brewery based in Hendersonville, North Carolina (about 20 miles south of Asheville). We look forward to seeing you in the tasting room!
name: Southern Appalachian Brewery

description:
At Southern Barrel Brewing Company, we’re combining the beauty of old with a taste of the new. The brewery was recently built in Bluffton, SC but it’s been a long time coming. We are proud to brew delicious craft beers there 24 hours a day 7 days a week. Our bar, beer garden and Tavern restaurant offer a seasonal menu featuring locally sourced ingredients and beer fresh from our brewery. We have year-round staples on tap as well as seasonal selections and limited runs. Also be sure to look for our specialty beers in the coming months brewed in whiskey, wine, tequila and rum barrels to bring you a unique kind of beer. Our indoor and outdoor seating was created to suit any mood, whether it’s dinner with the family or relaxing in the beer garden with friends.

At Southern Barrel Brewing Company you can relax, grab a bite and a brew and just…enjoy.
name: Southern Barrel Brewing Co.

description:
Our Brewing Company was established in 1988, being re-named to Southern Bay Brewing Co. in 2005, so we have a long history in the beer business with traditional and innovative beers available.

Our Beers and Ale's are subject to very strict quality control and laboratory microbiology testing throughout all stages of production. Samples of each package product batch are subject to stringent Quality Control procedures before dispatch. Our Beers and Ale's are naturally brewed.

To ensure we produce the best product available, we have implemented many filters, sterilization processes and optional pasteurization. We want to ensure our product is at it’s best and remains that way for your peace of mind. We produce great crafted beer from a dedicated team of Brewers.
name: Southern Bay Brewing Co.

description:
We are a locally owned and operated brew pub in Florence, S.C.. Our focus is to use local products, promote local bands and give people in Florence a place to call their own. So if your a local this place is for you. If your from out of town come in and see exactly what Florence has to offer.

Southern Hops offers handcrafted beer accompanied by great food and live music, as well as a level of service that defines southern hospitality.
name: Southern Hops Brewing Company

description:
Then we invite you to sample the hand-crafted brews of the Southern Oregon Brewing Company.
Brewed with uncompromised standards in Medford, Oregon, we’re dedicated to producing a full line of tantalizing brews using old-world brewing techniques and only the finest natural ingredients.

Served at discriminating restaurants and bars, one sip and you'll know that you've discovered something quiet extraordinary… beer that has been crafted by beer lovers for beer lovers.
As a Southern Oregon owned crafted brewery, we’re dedicated to the highest standards of quality and returning a percentage of our profits to the local community.
name: Southern Oregon Brewing Company

description: At the helm of Southern Pacific’s 15 barrel specific mechanical system is Andy French, whose clean, dry, true-to-style beers are the main features of a drinks lineup that boasts many attractions, including unique guest brews and high-caliber specialty cocktails
name: Southern Pacific Brewing

description: Southern Peak Brewery is a neighborhood brewery and tavern coming to Apex, North Carolina in mid to late 2015
name: Southern Peak Brewery

description: Southern Pines Brewing Company is a craft brewery that produces the highest quality beer for your community.
name: Southern Pines Brewing Company

description: Southern Prohibition Brewing launched in April of 2013 with two simple goals: brew great beer and help make Mississippi a great place to live. Our 22,000 sq. ft. warehouse was a furniture showroom when originally constructed in 1941. After some renovations, the microbrewery in Downtown Hattiesburg houses a 20 barrel brewhouse. With three 60 barrel and four 40 barrel fermenters, Southern Prohibition currently has the capacity to produce 5,000 barrels a year.
name: Southern Prohibition Brewing

description:
Located in Conroe, Texas, Southern Star Brewing Company will provide Texans(and others) new craft beers to enjoy from our 10,000 square foot warehouse. 

Production began in March of 2008 with our signature beer of Pine Belt Pale Ale which is in our distinctive 16oz can or in kegs. This has now expanded to include Bombshell Blonde(12oz cans) and Buried Hatchet Stout(12oz cans), but both are also kegged. These will just be a few of the ales we will be offering as we expand into seasonal batches, plus we just started our PRO-AM line of brews where home brewers can compete to have their recipe produced at our brewery(with the help of the creators if they desire). The winning entry will also be entered into the GABF. 

Thanks to the help of our five distributors, we are able to get our brews to a variety of locations(including grocery stores, beverage shops, pubs and restaurants) throughout Texas and a few other states including Alabama, Florida, Indiana, Kentucky, Ohio, and South Carolina. Unfortunately due to laws in Texas we can't tell you where you can buy our beers, but we are working at trying to get them to as many of your favorite craft beer establishments as possible.
name: Southern Star Brewing Company

description: Southern Tier Brewing Company was founded in 2004 by Phineas DeMink and Allen Yahn with the vision of bringing small batch brewing back to a region rich in brewing tradition. In 2003 Skip and Phin purchased the defunct Old Saddle Back Brewing Co. in Pittsfield, Massachusetts. All the equipment was removed and brought back to Lakewood, New York and set up at its new 10,000 square foot home, The Southern Tier Brewing Company. The Brewery began operations in February 2004 distributing regionally. By 2005 sales covered the majority of the New York State and the eastern half of Pennsylvania. In the beginning their two Flagship brands were a Pilsner and Mild Ale. Oh yeah they also brewed IPA! As it turned out the flagships were a flop and the IPA was a huge success. They next launched a line of seasonal beers which have gained great success. Since the beginning, Southern Tier has experienced steady growth, currently distributing to over 25% of the United States. Multiple expansions have been made to keep up with demand and the brewery continues to be innovative by producing new products.  Keep a look out for new products coming to stores near you.
name: Southern Tier Brewing Company

description:
Welcome to SBC Restaurant & Brewery, where culinary excellence and brewing expertise has been a Connecticut staple since 1997. We are more than a restaurant; we’re a friendly neighbor with your comfort in mind. We are more than a brewery; we are a stylish escape with endless possibilities.

Our Branford, Stamford, Southport, & Milford locations offer tasty menu selections for brunch, lunch and dinner. Dining out should be a unique experience, and the staff at our five restaurants will ensure excellent service, delicious food and a memorable time. So bring in your family and friends and share in the SBC experience. Your table awaits...

SBC’s 27 home-brews are processed with the finest natural ingredients and will satisfy all patrons - from the casual taster to the sophisticated connoisseur. We invite you to sample our incredible selection in our comfortable dining rooms or distinctive taprooms.
name: Southport Brewing Company

description: Spangalang Brewery is a destination brewery located in Five Points Colorado.
name: Spangalang Brewery

description: Spaten has been a leading exporter of German beer for more than a century. We played a crucial role in establishing the present superior worldwide reputation for German beer. The basis of our continuously expanding export figures was a healthy pioneering spirit that led us to set up a network of committed import partners at an early date. Today people all over the world take pleasure in drinking original Spaten beers, not only in the neighbouring states of France, Austria and Switzerland, but also in Italy, Spain, Scandinavia and the United States.
name: Spaten-Franziskaner-Bräu

description: In a typically foggy San Francisco summer in 1997, we were determined to bring our unique West Coast-style beers from the underground to the masses. Defiantly producing small batches of beer in a secret warehouse in San Francisco’s long forgotten Butchertown District, we quickly gained a fiercely loyal following with bold, complex beers and striking 1920’s imagery. Starting with a single, iconic beer that immortalized the spirit of the bootleggers who persevered when America’s taps ran dry—a bold, hoppy amber ale known as Prohibition Ale—we now brew a wide array of acclaimed beers from hoppy pale ales to stouts aged in whiskey barrels. After 16 years of making great beer in the Bay Area, we have grown by leaps and bounds, yet we still produce many of our beers on the original steam-fired brewhouse that started it all.
name: Speakeasy Ales and Lagers

description: Founded in 2011 by Dimitri van Kampen, Spearhead Brewing Company is a family-run craft brewery located in Toronto, Canada. At its heart is the partnership of Dimitri and Martin Villeneuve, a passion for real beer and a dedication to brewing Beer Without BoundariesTM. At Spearhead, we believe in beer's unlimited potential. We don't adhere to the limitations set by traditional style definitions. We use unusual ingredients and brewing methods to make all-natural craft beer in small batches that is so distinctive and delicious we hope it cannot be judged by ordinary standards.
name: Spearhead Brewing Company

description: Our mission is to brew the finest ales in the Northeast. We want to make sure that our beers are approachable to people just starting in the craft beer world, yet with enough complexity for the beer geek. Our goal is to brew several year round beers with a diverse lineup of seasonal and one time beers.
name: Spellbound Brewing

description:
pendrups is a brewery with 1000 dedicated employees and with total sales SEK 3,1 bn. It is a family company, founded in 1897.

The Spendrup family with Fredrik Spendrup as CEO and Ulf Spendrup as vice CEO among others, is today very active in the company.

Spendrups unite strong traditions with innovations. Today, the fourth generation of Spendrup works at the company and many employees have worked with us for decades.
name: Spendrups

description:
The Spey Valley Brewery is nestled in the heart of Speyside brewing small batches of real ales. 
We've been meeting and exceeding the quality of bigger breweries, despite our small size for over 5 years. 

Beware of cheap imitations!
name: Spey Valley Brewery

description: Beers are being distributed around Long Island and the city now. We will be posting new locations as the beers go on tap so keep checking back.
name: Spider Bite Beer Co.

description: Spinnaker Bay Brewing is a woman founded, built, owned and run brewery.
name: Spinnaker Bay Brewing

description: We are a Chicago nanobrewery committed to brewing proper beer and delivering it to Chicagoans one case at a time.  We brew on a 3.5 bbl brew house and offer 12oz cans in 6 Packs, 16oz cans in 4 Packs, and 22oz bombers.  A few kegs pop up in town as well.
name: Spiteful Brewing

description: Spoetzl was founded in 1909, and claims to be the oldest independent brewery in Texas. A group of businessmen incorporated Shiner Brewing Association and placed Herman Weiss in as the company's first brewmaster. In 1914 a German immigrant brewer named Kosmas (or Kosmos) Spoetzl co-leased with Oswald Petzold with an option to buy in 1915. Spoetzl had attended brewmaster's school and apprenticed for three years in Germany, worked for eight years at the Pyramids Brewery in Cairo, Egypt, and then worked in Canada. He moved to San Antonio in search of a better climate for his health, bringing with him a family recipe for a Bavarian beer made from malted barley and hops.
name: Spoetzl Brewery

description:
Spoonwood Brewing Company is located at the former home of the Montour Railroad. Over the past 50 years, the site has transformed from a concrete railroad arch to a restaurant designed from two railcars.

Today, both of those railcars are being repurposed as an attraction for a children’s park in Dubois, PA, and the site has been repurposed and redesigned to house our 15-barrel brewery.
name: Spoonwood Brewing Co.

description: The Sportsman Brewing Company a pub nano-brewery housed in the Sportsman, Huddersfield. Our mission is to brew our own unique real ales which will be available at the Sportsman, the West Riding Refreshment Rooms the Cricketers Arms and Stalybridge Buffet Bar.
name: Sportsman Brewing Company

description: After fifteen years of brewing experiments and research - such as malting, milling, and roasting grain, recreating historical beer recipes, and brewing in his wife's kitchen - Jerry Grandle decided it was time to take things to a new level. In September 2014, the Spotted Dog Brewery opened, run by Jerry and his wife, Susan. The brewery is named after Ryleigh, the family's bluetick hound. Our beers have been enjoyed in many states by family and friends, from California to New York. Now that our doors are open to the public, we are proud to be Mesilla's only microbrewery and gladly share our beers with the Mesilla Valley and its visitors.
name: Spotted Dog Brewery

description:
Here at Sprague Farm & Brew Works we practice the "mixed mashall arts." 
We embrace untamed and extreme brewing ideas along with our common sense philosophy: 
"Approach your day (and your beer) the Sprague way!"
name: Sprague Farm & Brew Works

description: Established in 1985, Sprecher is Milwaukee's Original Microbrewery. We brew over 20 different beers as well as 8 gourmet sodas, including our world famous Sprecher Root Beer.
name: Sprecher Brewing Company

description: Located in Conestoga, PA in the heart of Lancaster County.
name: Spring House Brewing Company

description: An anchor to the re-birth of downtown Springfield since 1997, Springfield Brewing Company is a must-visit destination for beer and food enthusiasts traveling the area. Springfield Brewing Company is truly a wonderful facility, staffed with a great group of individuals. We bring together the finest brewing ingredients in one of the world’s best small brewing facilities to brew excellent beers. Local before local was cool, our kitchen matches our brewers passion for craft brewed beer with their made-from-scratch dishes with local products. We have no hatchet men or Madison Avenue suits on our staff; just a group of hard-working local business owners in search of excellence. Our mission is to brew inspired beer, produce excellent food, offer a superb facility while arming SBC with a personable staff. Cheers!
name: Springfield Brewing Company

description: Squam Brewing is a small, one barrel craft brewery operated out of a barn in Holderness, NH. We brew in a 55 gallon BoilerMaker kettle which we've retrofitted with two 5000 watt electric heating elements.  We ferment in 42 gallon stainless conicals (Blichmann Fermenators). Starting in August of 2010 we began selling our beer exclusively in 22 ounce bottles to stores in the Lakes Region.
name: Squam Brewing

description: Inspired by the pioneering spirit of those who traveled the Oregon Trail in the pursuit of a dream, we offer Square Mile Hard Cider. We set out to reinvigorate an enduringly classic American beverage with a blend of apples hand-selected for the perfect balance of sweet and tart.  Our hard cider pays homage to the fortitude and perseverance of the original pioneers.
name: Square Mile Cider Co.

description: The Square One Brewery & Distillery began operations as a brewery /restaurant in February of 2006. In August of 2008 Square One became the first microdistillery restaurant in the state of Missouri and one of the first in the country. We believe that our approach to the alcohol beverage program is unique and very different from that of other restaurants. We believe in crafting the products we serve whether it is spirits, beer or food. By combining the expertise of our distiller, our master brewer, and our chef we are committed to creating an amazing array of flavors and tastes for our customers.
name: Square One Brewery & Distillery

description:
Although much has changed (now three locations and a microbrewery), we remain firmly dedicated to our original goal; provide our customers world-class handcrafted beer and food in a warm, friendly environment.

As Squatters grew we embraced the Triple Bottom Line philosophy of People Planet Profit. We source healthy ingredients and use environmentally friendly products and services from within our local eco-region. We develop long-term relationships with farmers, growers and suppliers so we know exactly what is, and is not, in the products we buy. We choose to support local non-profit organizations. We buy BlueSky wind power and are continuously working to reduce our carbon footprint.

We believe these and other practices contribute to a healthy community and environment, locally and globally, making our city a better place to live, work, and drink world-class Squatters beers.
name: Squatters Craft Beers

description:
We are a brewpub located in Soldotna, AK. We specialize in handcrafted ales and stone fired pizza.

At St. Elias Brewing Company, we believe in handcrafting innovative, high quality, world class beers. Our beers match the personality of our business, fun and lively, yet historic and eclectic. Brewing on a 7 barrel brewhouse, we promise our product will arrive fresh in your glass, as beer was intended. Why should your beer travel across the country to your glass, when you can get one fresh from across the room?
name: St Elias Brewing Company

description:
We are an artisan brewery in Inner West Sydney specialising in high quality, hand crafted beers.

The goal of St Peters Brewery is to produce draft 
and packaged beer products for the general market, within our neighbourhood, using environmentally sustainable methods, with the specific goal of high quality products with minimum environmental impact.
name: St Peters Brewery

description: Meadery/Winery in northern Michigan producing a full line of still meads 12% abv and draft meads 6.5% abv.
name: St. Ambrose Cellars

description:
Saint Boniface Craft Brewing Co is a nano-brewery located in Ephrata, Pa. After years of brewing and competing with each other for kudos in their local community, Mike Price and Jon Northup decided to join forces and produce the best beer that we—using our combined brewing experience—could produce.

Saint Boniface is the name of the patron saint of brewers, the saint also associated with converting Germany to Christianity. St. Boniface saw the unconverted Saxons worshiping Thor and knew something must be done. The humble saint took an axe to the massive Thor Oak, which was sacred to the Saxons, in order to show them that his God was mightier than theirs. With fierce and repeated blows he leveled the massive tree; those around him feared God and were converted to Christianity.

The deed of Boniface provides an elegant analogy for our own mission at Saint Boniface Craft Brewing Co. Mike and Jon have witnessed many beer “pagans” worshiping the false gods of the big beer industry and see that it is time to take a Boniface-like swing at converting some of those people to a better way of life, one full of rich, tasty, more satisfying brews.
name: St. Boniface Craft Brewing Company

description:
We like to keep things as locally as we can.  The hops we use come from one hop farm in the Yakima Valley.  The brewers grains are from the Okanogan Valley and the yeast comes from Hood River, Oregon.  
 
Come taste what our taproom in Moses Lake offers.
St. Brigid's Brewery Taproom: "Because beer should taste good!"
name: St. Brigid's Brewery

description:
To introduce ourselves to you…

Amy: a former Silicon-Valley sales and marketing manager, turned stay-at-home mom, had an itch to share her husband’s delectable brews with the masses, while simultaneously contributing philanthropically...

Aron: our Windsor Fire Captain & hero is dedicated to artfully creating very gratifying brews...

St. Florian's Brewery donates a minimum of 5% of our profits to fire-related & community-based organizations. We parent two toddlers who love St. Florian’s Brewery as much as we do.  Our young lads cannot wait to take over the family business someday & do all that they can to contribute to its success today.  We proudly teach them the ropes of the brewing process & the importance of strong business ethics at their young age. Together we are St. Florian’s Brewery: determined to have the happiest of customers & most delighted imbibers.
name: St. Florian's Brewery

description: Over 300 years ago in 1710, John Smithwick began brewing his first Ales, although the Smithwick’s story started long before then. He chose the site of an ancient monastery, St Francis Abbey in Kilkenny City, to position his brewery. John was inspired by a tradition of brewing on this site, the foundations of which were laid four centuries earlier. Back in the 13th century the Franciscans established an Abbey, with its own well, on the banks of the River Nore in Kilkenny. Whilst brewing and barley cultivation are recorded in Irish Annals from the mists of time, the strong brewing tradition that exists in Kilkenny started with these monks who would have brewed their own light ale for their visitors, using water from St Francis' Well. To this day the Abbey stands proudly at the heart of the brewery and continues to inspire our brewers.
name: St. Francis Abbey Brewery

description:
Saint Francis Brewery opened in the Spring of 2009 to great popularity and success.

Known for our hand-crafted beers,  Brewmaster Scott Hettig has built upon our foundation of five beers:  Kolsch, Amber Ale, Nut Brown Ale, Weiss and Oatmeal Stout to feature a Bohemian Pilsner, Double Red Ale, Belgian Triple and many more.

These wonderful beers are complimented by the great food Executive Chef Ron Wolf creates.  When you stop in, make sure you try our ribs!  They are made with our signature Oatmeal Stout BBQ Sauce
name: St. Francis Brewery

description: From humble beginnings as a "Brew on Premises" BOP establishment located in a store-front in a strip mall in Virginia Beach in 1991, B. A. Brewmeister has come of age as a brewery of craft beers with its 'brew haus' and 'celler' sharing a 10,000 square foot facility located at 204 Challenger Way in Hampton, Virginia. B.A. Brewmeister currently trades as The St. George Brewing Company & Olde Richmond Ale Company.
name: St. George Brewing Company

description: St. John Brewers is amped about the recent release of Green Flash energy drink in cans.
name: St. John Brewers

description: Brewery & Gastropub located inside the old St.Joseph's Church located in the Lockerbie area, just south of Mass.Ave. in Indianapolis
name: St. Joseph Brewery & Public House

description:
Mariano Meconi was born in the village of Faleria, Italy in 1895. At the age of 13, Mariano emigrated from Italy to Windsor, Ontario, Canada. As a young man, after school Mariano worked at the Studebaker auto factory in order to supplement his preferred vocation of wine making. 
 
In 1921 at age 26, Mariano founded Border City Wine Cellars, quickly changing the name to the Meconi Wine Company. Following the repeal of Prohibition in December of 1933, Mariano moved his flourishing wine making enterprise across the river to Detroit in 1934. 1936 was the year Meconi moved the family to its present location in Paw Paw, in order to be closer to the acclaimed Lake Michigan Shore grape-growing region. With the move came a new name, The Italian Wine Company. 
 
In 1941, during World War II, Meconi strategically countered rising antifascist sentiment in the United States by switching the name of the company once again, from The Italian Wine Company, to St. Julian Winery. 
 
In the last name change of the company, Mariano Meconi humbly paid homage to the patron saint of his native village, Faleria, Italy. All Italian villages have patron saints and San Giuliano, nee St. Julian, stands as the saint that protects the village and the citizens of Faleria. 

With a rich history, St. Julian still produces some on the long-time favorites, including Sholom Kosher Wine and our award-winning Solera Cream Sherry. Over the past 15 years, St. Julian has focused on producing a new line of single varietal wines. The grapes come from the best vineyards in Southwest Michigan, producing top quality wines. In 1999, Braganini Reserve Meritage was “born” establishing a small lot production of dry, single varietal wines. As excitement from the President and Winemaker grew, St. Julian now has over 15 Braganini Reserve wines ranging in many different winemaking styles. 
 
For over 92 years, the Winery now known as St. Julian Wine Co., Inc. has produced award-winning products. From the first shoots of the Michigan spring through the harvest and barrel tasting of late fall, the family tradition that has flourished transforms grapes to wine, fruit to nectar, as passion and science converge bottle after bottle, case after case.
name: St. Julian

description: Bringing craft beer to the North Country!
name: St. Lawrence Brewing Company

description: Located in a restored railroad hotel built in 1879 in downtown DuQuoin, Illinois, 90 miles east of St. Louis. Opened in August 2014 as a microbrewery and restaurant.  Serves pizza, sandwiches, great appetizers and more.  Owners are bikers and sponsor a bicycling club.
name: St. Nicholas Brewing Co.

description: St Pete Brewing Company is the home of St Pete Orange Wheat and will be producing more beers once we open our downtown location.
name: St. Petersburg Brewing Co.

description: Owned and operated by Donald and Liz Staas and now open Thursday, Friday, and Saturday through the month of August while we work to build our inventory for you! We hope to add expanded hours by September. Staas Brewing features a wide variety of original, all-grain craft craft brews and a cozy tasting room/bar. All beers are brewed in small batches and on premises at 31 W. Winter Street. Follow us on Instagram and Twitter too. While we do not have a kitchen, Mashita Noodles, a gourmet food truck, will be parked out back every weekend and serving up delicious and new food.
name: Staas Brewing Company

description:
Stadium Brewing Company is known as much for our fantastic food as we are for our magnificent micro brews and fabulous cocktails! Anytime you come in you'll be treated to delicious appetizers and a full bar with skilled servers and bartenders who can make you anything you desire.

Stadium Brewing Company offers a unique experience setting it apart from all other restaurants! Our uniqueness is defined by the combination of a brewery, sports bar and fine dining with a great ambiance.

Try one of our hand-crafted brews by acclaimed Brew master, Greg Schneider or our pepper crusted ahi tuna from Executive Chef, Octavio Montoya, renowned teacher at the Laguna Beach school of Culinary Arts, known for creating a fusion of multi-cultural classic dishes prepared with a creative twist.
name: Stadium Brewing Company

description:
Mantorville Brewing Company dba Stagecoach Brewing Company, LLC

Visit us for a taste of the old days in this old-time setting.
Tours available by appointment only.
name: Stagecoach Brewing Company, LLC

description:
Microbrewery Stallhagen Ab was set up in 2004 by a group of beer enthusiasts. It currently has over 1600 shareholders. The first brewery on the Åland islands was established back in the 1850's, but Stallhagen is now Åland's only brewery, with a production site at Grelsby, 18 km from Mariehamn.

The initial aim of the brewery was to produce good craft beers, mainly for the Åland market. However, with its flavorful products the company has quickly won innumerable friends outside Åland, and Stallhagen beer is now sold in both Finland and Sweden. Steadily increasing demand and investments in higher production capacity have led to a growth in sales volumes and made the Stallhagen brand well-known to beer-lovers generally, not just the growing flock of experts and connoisseurs.
name: Stallhagen

description: A small brewery in Seattle. About as small as you can get, actually.
name: Standard Brewing

description: Because our love for craft beer may only be surpassed by our love for drinking it with good food and friends in a comfortable and fun atmosphere, we created Standard Brewing Company, a microbrewery and pub dedicated to setting the standard for session beers and beer-grain pizza. All Standard Brewing Co. beers are brewed on site, in our shiny three-and-a-half barrel brewery by our awesome team of die-hard brewers.
name: Standard Brewing Company

description: Ashland's only full service brewpub is housed in an historic building with a light industrial character. We offer our own freshly brewed handcrafted ales and lagers, including seasonal and other specialty brews.  All Standing Stone Ales are made here at the brewery in ten barrel batches using over 80% organic malts.
name: Standing Stone Brewing Company

description: Providing craft beer to Miamisburg, Ohio.
name: Star City Brewing Company

description:
Starboard Brewing Company is a nanobrewery now open.  A nanobrewery is a small brewing operation that is loosely defined as having a brew system that produces less than 4 barrels of beer. We will be producing in 1 barrel batches. In addition to brewing, our beers will be served in our tap room in pints, flights, and growlers. Our concept is to constantly bring new beers on tap. Unlike larger breweries, we will not have 4 or 6 flagship beers and a couple seasonals, there will always be a variety of something new and fresh. Of course we anticipate having a few house favorites that may, by request of our patrons, make there way back into the lineup from time to time. This is going to be quite and adventure! 

A little bit about who we are…Amanda and Patrick Surfus (and Preston) are living in Sturgeon Bay, WI and have been long time local residents of Door County. Patrick has been brewing at home for over 8 years. We’ve always thought a small brewery is something that Sturgeon Bay has needed, and hope you do too!…Here we go!
name: Starboard Brewing Company

description: Located in the historic mill district of Manchester New Hampshire, Stark Brewing Company has won dozens of award in the last 2 decades for their craft ales
name: Stark Brewing Company

description: Starkey's Lookout is a new concept tasting facility located about nine miles north of Watkins Glen at 5428 State Route 14 in Starkey, New York. Starkey's will feature SencaHayes and Twisted Screw wines, G.C. Starkey beer, and a variety of appetizers and hor 'doeuvres that will pair well with one or the other.
name: Starkey's Lookout

description: Nestled in the pine forests of Carrboro NC, Starpoint Brewing is bringing the freshest and best tasting ales and lagers to the locals. We are looking forward to serving the triangle and beyond!!!
name: Starpoint Brewing

description:
In the mid-90s, Mark Thompson returned to his native Virginia from Portland, OR, ready to begin crafting artisanal beer using his own recipes. He found the perfect spot in Charlottesville, VA – an historic storefront on Main Street that was once home to the state of Virginia’s first craft brewing operation. In September 1999, Starr Hill Brewery was founded. Named after the local neighborhood, the brewery shared its space with the legendary Starr Hill Music Hall. Since then Starr Hill's delicious craft beers have become a favorite to visiting beer lovers, musicians, and music fans from around the world.

In response to the growing demand, Starr Hill moved from this small operation to a larger facility several miles outside of town in 2005. The brewery and tap room are still based in Crozet, nestled in the rolling foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Starr Hill's year-round, seasonal and limited-release brews are now enjoyed in bars, restaurants and music venues in the Mid Atlantic and Southeast and are also available at many grocery and convenience stores throughout the region. Among the most award-winning breweries on the East Coast, Starr Hill has won 21 Great American Beer Festival, World Beer Cup and Great British Beer Festival medals.

Led by Brewmaster Robbie O'Cain, Starr Hill's team is striving to make creative and world-class beer every day. Join us as we write the next chapter in our story of Virginia craft beer.
name: Starr Hill Brewery

description:
After several years as home mead makers, we are thrilled to be opening Starrlight Mead. We have had a fantastic time making mead and meeting mead drinkers from all over the world, and now its our turn to share our love of mead with all of you!

Becky Starr, Owner, Sales/Tasting Room Manager
Ben Starr, Owner, Wine/Meadmaker

We first discovered mead in CA at the Southern California Renaissance Pleasure Faire. Several years later, we found friends that were home brewing mead with good results. We decided to try our hand at it too.

In February 2006, we entered our first competition and took Best in Show out of over 210 entries in the home mead-maker category at the International Mead Association’s Mead Festival. The competition was judged by seven professionals in the mead industry; including Ken Schramm, author of The Compleat Mead Maker, and meadery owners from around the world. The Best in Show prize was selected from the gold medal winners in nine categories. Our “Starrlight Mulled Apple Cyser” was awarded not only the gold medal in the cyser (mead made with apples) category, but was also selected as the best overall representation of mead making. It was at that point we decided to try creating a business from our love of mead.

Ben shares his expertise and love of brewing by conducting demonstrations and workshops on mead making in the local community. We also organize and conduct the local Mead Day celebration each August (since 2005) and are a key part of the product tasting team for mead reviews on Gotmead.com. Becky worked with Chatham Hill Winery for 2 years learning tasting room and wine club management. We are members of the Chatham County Beekeepers Association, and the NC Winegrowers Association.
name: Starrlight Mead

description: Starving Artist Brewing Co. is a production only facility producing beers full of awesomeness. Get a hold of us to schedule a tour of our massive brewery... Cheers
name: Starving Artist Brewing Co.

description:
Denver fire station turned brewery + taproom

5280's 2014 "Best New Brewery" 

Westword's 2014 "Best Taproom - Ambience"
name: Station 26 Brewing Co.

description:
Steadfast Beer Co. proudly produces delicious, Gluten-Free craft beer! Look for our first offering, Steadfast Sorghum Pale Ale, in the Gluten-Free section of your favorite Capital Region beer stores! If you want your local bar or restaurant to carry our beer, please tell them to email us - we'll take care of the rest!

We are dedicated to producing Gluten-Free beers that are high in quality and full of flavor. Every day, more Americans are switching to craft beer because IT TASTES GOOD! For those folks who follow a Gluten-Free diet by choice or by necessity and still want to experience the taste of craft beer, Steadfast Beer Co. thinks outside the box, while thinking about what's inside the bottle. Creatively-written recipes and attention to detail make Steadfast a Gluten-Free beer that you can trust!
name: Steadfast Beer Company

description: Welcome to the Steam Plant, home to Stacks Restaurant a premier restaurant and the Steam Plant Brewing Co. and Pub. Located in a completely renovated historic landmark in the heart of downtown Spokane! Just look for the twin smokestacks!
name: Steam Plant

description:
The Steam Whistle story begins in the spring of 1998 when three friends were on a canoe trip in the Ontario heartland. Greg Taylor, Cam Heaps and Greg Cromwell had all been colleagues at one of Canada's premier microbreweries producing quality beer in the late 1980's and 90's - before it was bought out by a national brewer and closed down. As they sat around the campfire, the self-named "Three Fired Guys" dreamed of running their own brewery one day.

To make a Pilsner that would compete with the best in the world. They wrote a plan and quickly attracted investors with their vision and passion.
name: Steam Whistle Brewery

description: Steamworks gets its name from the famous Gastown steam line that runs through our premises. The Gastown Brewing Company, which is located onsite and brews Steamworks beers, uses steam to fire its kettles. The instant heat of steam allows for greater brewing finesse, and most importantly great tasting beer. Whether you're in the mood for a thirst quenching Lions Gate lager, or a full bodied HeriocaTM Oatmeal Stout, we've got a beer to please your palate.
name: Steamworks

description:
Steamworks Brewing Co. opened its doors in Durango in September 1996. A favorite watering hole for locals and visitors alike, our brewpub has much more to offer than award-winning craft beer. Known as a town meeting place, Steamworks enjoys a bustling, fun environment.

Steamworks’ culinary program is unmatched in the region in both breadth and quality of offerings. Our “gastropub” fare includes regionally-raised meats and sustainable seafood. Healthy salads, delicious pizzas, spicy Southwestern-style dishes, and vegetarian & gluten-free offerings provide something for everyone who’s hungry.  Stop by to discover what’s “on tap.” Hang with the locals. Catch a game.  Enjoy a fresh beer and outstanding food. Every day promises a screaming deal and fun to be had!
name: Steamworks Brewing Company

description: Steel String Brewery is coming to Carrboro, North Carolina. A small brewery committed to producing consciously crafted, locally committed, superior quality ales.
name: Steel String Brewery

description:
Here at STB we believe in working our ass off for what we believe in, following our passion, giving back to and working with the community that supports us, being conscious of the world around us, producing the best quality product we can and kicking back with great beer at the end of the day.

We are a small MN craft brewery with big dreams of staying small.
name: Steel Toe Brewing

description: Steelhead Brewery has been serving up delicious food and award winning beers since 1991.
name: Steelhead Brewing Company

description:
In 1957 the New Zealand Minister of Finance, Arnold Nordmeyer threatened to cut international beer imports as part of his "black budget" and challenged New Zealand's brewers to "come up with an international-style lager beer". Lion Nathan produced a beer the following year named Steinecker, named after the company whose equipment the beer was made in. The beer's name was changed in 1962, not in response to a challenge from the Steinecker company, but to distinguish it from Heineken.

In 1973 Steinlager was launched in the United States and an American consultant suggested that to become successful the company should change the colour of their bottles to match that of other premium beers. As a result, the original brown bottle colour was changed to green.
name: Steinlager

description:
It was as simple as waking up one morning with a crazy idea – perhaps not initially realizing it would later become an award winning one! Stellenbrau Brewery owner, Deon Engelbrecht struck gold when he made the decision to venture into the world of craft brewing.

During a visit to the KZN, Deon enjoyed a few craft beers with friends. Rising the following morning for a run, he did not expect to be feeling so refreshed, despite having the proverbial ‘few too many’ the night before. It was at that moment that he knew he wanted to brew his own craft beer and that the only place to do that would be Stellenbosch – a town filled with heritage…and thirsty students!

In 2011 the wheels were set in motion. Discussions with technical specialists took place and building of the brewery infrastructure was well underway. Hard at work to brew a quality craft product, Stellenbrau launched their first beer in 2012, the Craven Craft Lager, which was voted top lager at the Global Craft Beer Awards in Berlin in 2014 – a testimony to Deon’s foresight and vision.
name: Stellenbrau

description: At Stem Ciders, we are committed to creating ciders of the highest quality that honor the purity and complexity that is inherent to the apple. We can’t wait to introduce you to your perfect cider match. We are dedicated to reviving the cider tradition, which goes far beyond what you enjoy in your glass. We hold our growers in the highest regard, and by fostering relationships with them we reward their hard work and promote the regrowth of heirloom apple cultivation. We love our home-base in Denver, and embrace the Colorado lifestyle that makes us lug a bottle to share up a mountain to enjoy a drink with a view. Most importantly, we love nothing more than seeing that smile on your face when you have your first sip of one of our crisp, refreshing ciders.
name: Stem Ciders

description: In its heyday, Sterling Beer was a premium Pilsner beer in the American standard style. It was available in bottles, cans and on draft. Its market area included Indiana, Illinois, Kentucky (very popular in Greater Louisville), Ohio, Tennessee, Georgia, Alabama, Mississippi and occasionally a few other states. Sterling Beer was brewed continuously from 1863 until the early 2000s when its latest owner, Pittsburgh Brewing Company, stopped making it after the company emerged from bankruptcy. The brand is in limbo and it will probably come back some day.
name: Sterling Beer Company

description: Steuben Brewing Company is a farm brewery that produces New York State labeled beer. We utilize ingredients that are grown and produced in New York State. We strive to make great beer that supports local farmers.
name: Steuben Brewing Company
Steve and Clark's Brew Pub and Sausage Co. #2

description: The Stevens Point Brewery is steeped in a history that has transcended the trials of the Civil War, the Great Depression and Prohibition. More than 150 years later, the Stevens Point Brewery continues to successfully brew quality beer, just as the brewery’s founders, Frank Wahle and George Ruder, did in 1857. This undeniable endurance is a testament of why the Stevens Point Brewery, in Stevens Point, Wisconsin, is the 5th oldest continuously operating brewery remaining in the United States. Today, the Stevens Point Brewery is proud to be Wisconsin-owned and independently operated.
name: Stevens Point Brewery

description:
Stewart Brewing has a custom built ten barrel brewery located South of Edinburgh. All equipment has been sourced and modified to Stewart Brewing's specific requirements to create the highest quality beer.

The location was chosen so that Stewart Brewing can conveniently supply the On Trade market in Edinburgh, the Lothians, Glasgow, Fife and Central Scotland. We also supply our beer direct to customers too in our 5 litre minicasks
name: Stewart Brewing

description:
Established in 1995, we are New Castle County's 1st brewpub.

It has always been our goal to provide the best handcrafted beer, fresh food & impeccable service.
name: Stewart's Brewing Company

description: At Stickman we will be producing a constantly rotating variety of open fermented and wild style beers available both on draft and in an extensive bottle collection. Keep coming by to see what's new. In addition, keep an eye out for our 8 signature brands which will be brewed regularly.
name: Stickman Brews

description:
Since 1492, we brew here at our single site brewing beer with the Salzburg best spring water from the nearby Unterberg.

As the largest private brewery in Austria, which is as independent and successful independent family business, we want to continue to be the most popular beer of the Austrians. Therefore, we focus on the art of brewing at the highest level of quality and so consistently.

In order to brew good beer, it requires a lot of brewing experience and the right G'spür in dealing with the raw materials. That's why we talk about the art of brewing!
name: Stiegl Brauerei zu Salzburg

description: We are an independently owned Wisconsin family beer company.  We have been brewing beer for well over a decade now, and are very excited to finally be able to legally bring you our favorite.  Wisco-Disco is a deep amber colored beer, with rich malt and hop flavors.  We brew this beer with a small amount of milk sugar (or lactose).  This gives Wisco-Disco its smooth body, and makes it a perfect match to pair with your favorite cheeses. Wisco-Disco is brewed with five different malts, and four giant hop additions for huge flavor, then cold filtered for perfect clarity and refreshment!
name: Stillmank Beer Company

description:
"A sincere artist is not one who makes a faithful attempt to put on to canvas what is in front of him, but one who tries to create something which is, in itself, a living thing." -Sir William Dobell

The goal of Stillwater Artisanal is just that, living art. Although packaged within a medium often overlooked for its artistic merits, our desire is to offer something new and intriguing. We present more than just a fine crafted beverage, rather an occasion that evokes an emotion and inspires contemplation. For art is not a sum of actions but rather an approach to life. We draw our inspiration from the world around us, whether that be a season, location, or even humanity itself. Our intent is to encapsulate this muse exhibiting an artistic rendition to the best of our abilities.
name: Stillwater Artisanal Ales

description: Stilt House Brewery, Inc. is a production-based microbrewery located in unincorporated Palm Harbor, Florida. With a focus on full-flavored, high-ABV ales, the microbrewery will be utilizing high-quality ingredients with a touch of flare and pizazz. By adding excellent ale offerings to the local craft beer scene, Stilt House Brewery will be furthering Florida’s burgeoning market for these unique and highly sought-after products.
name: Stilt House Brewing

description: A new production brewery and tap room in the planning stages, located in the historic Stockyards District of Kansas City.
name: Stockyards Brewing Co.

description:
We established Stone & Wood Brewing Company in Byron Bay in 2008 after many years of working in the beer business. Our dream was to quit ‘working for the man’, shed the corporate garbage and get back to basics.

As the original brewers of Byron Bay we built our brewery here at the eastern tip of Australia, in a part of the world where people enjoy having a beer when relaxing after catching a wave, catching a band at the pub or just catching up with friends. It’s that sort of place.

We brew beer for times like these, beers that the locals, and the growing number of craft beer drinkers around the country, and of course ourselves, would find simply good to drink.

There’s a lot to love about Byron Bay … the beaches … the music … the people … the pubs. These are just a few of the reasons why we brew and bottle our beer in one of the greatest places on earth. This little town in Northern New South Wales has influenced everything we do at Stone & Wood.

Not only has it helped shape our philosophy of trying to take things slowly and keeping it simple, but the natural beauty, on the edge of the Pacific Ocean, and the laid back vibe were the inspiration for our beers.

‘Byron’ is a destination for visitors from around the world and we’re always grateful we get to call the place home.
name: Stone & Wood

description: Founded by Greg Koch and Steve Wagner in 1996, San Diego-based Stone Brewing Co. is the 10th largest craft brewer in the United States. Stone has been listed on the Inc. 500 | 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies list nine times, and has been called the “All-time Top Brewery on Planet Earth” by BeerAdvocate magazine twice. The multi-faceted company will be the first American craft brewer to independently own and operate facilities in Berlin, Germany and also has plans to open operations east of the Mississippi. Known for its bold, flavorful and largely hop-centric beers, Stone has earned a reputation for brewing outstanding, unique beers while maintaining an unwavering commitment to sustainability, business ethics, philanthropy and the art of brewing.
name: Stone Brewing Co.

description:
1989 was the year this particular brewery was established. At the time, it was Wisconsin’s third Brewpub. Since that time #1 and #2 have vanished leaving Stone Cellar Brewpub the oldest, continually running Brewpub in the state of Wisconsin. All this in a building built 151 years ago to house a brewery!

We brew in 7 barrel (217 gallon) batches on an old, yet reliable brewhouse and can produce up to 1,000 barrels per year. We also have a small bottling line which allows us to sell bottles of our beers right from our bar.

Stone Cellar beer to go!
6 packs and growlers of Stone Cellar beer can be purchased in our bar area to enjoy at home!
name: Stone Cellar Brewpub & Restaurant

description: Stone Corral Brewery is a craft nano brewery located in Huntington, Vermont. We be opening in August. Our goal is to provide our local community with fresh, great tasting beer. Check out stonecorral.com for information about our beer
name: Stone Corral Brewery

description: Stone's Throw Brewing is the creation of four guys who met in the local home brew club, the Central Arkansas Fermenters.
name: Stone's Throw Brewing

description: Stonecutters Brewhouse is a 4 barrel brewhouse located in central Vermont in the small town (pop. 9000) of Barre. Barre is the sister town to Montpelier, which is the capital of Vermont. Stonecutters is a locally owned and operated.
name: Stonecutters Brewhouse

description: We make beer for those who seek deeper experience, abundant flavor, and more adventure. We strive to make the highest quality, full flavored beers to satisfy those with the highest beer IQ’s and those who are new to craft beer.
name: Stoneface Brewing Company

description: Stonefly Brewing Company (AKA Stonefly Brewery) has been a staple of the Riverwest neighborhood since 2006. With an onsite dedicated beer geek brewing staff, Stonefly has released a number of festival award winning brews and gained a very great respect among local and national beer drinkers alike. Stonefly's kitchen also has reason to boast with an amazing Friday Fish Fry, and a weekend must brunch menu that will more than satisfy any taste. And last but not least is Stonefly's consistently entertaining stage lineup. Stonefly always keeps the stage hot with bands and entertainment for all ears and eyes.
name: Stonefly Brewing Co

description: We are a Reno Brewery Company with a great selection of delicious microbrew ranging from our dark porter to our honey pale ale.
name: Stoneyhead Brewing Co.

description: Here at Stony Creek Brewery, we think there's nothing better than drinking a true craft beer. Craft beer is an adventure and a destination. It tells the story of our local flavor. You see, it's not just a beer to have, it's a beer we’ll have with you.
name: Stony Creek Beer

description: Storm Brewing thundered onto the market in June of 1995 with a brilliantly balanced ale called Red Sky Alt which was reminiscent of the great German Alt Biers of the Golden Years of European brewing. The instant success of Red Sky quickly established the reputation of Brewmaster and owner, James Walton. He is perceived as an innovator and as a stickler for quality by both the media and the trade. Recent expert evaluation rated Storm Brewing's Hurricane I.P.A. among the best in the whole of Canada.
name: Storm Brewing

description:
Smithfield, VA

It will be the first brewery in Western Tidewater that produces European-inspired craft beers, using locally-raised hops and grains when possible. The tasting room will have a European flare, giving our guests a relaxing, family-friendly place to enjoy their favorite ales, lagers and stouts.

Storm Forge's tasting room is hoping to achieve Gemütlichkeit, a German word that refers to a situation that induces a cheerful mood, peace of mind with connotation of belonging and social acceptance, coziness and unhurry.
name: Storm Forge Brewing Company

description:
Consider our taproom your new living room. Watch a live show on one of our music nights or catch a game on one of our big-screens. Order some food from our list of delivery companies or share a bowl of popcorn from our snack collection. Make yourself at home. 

Our beers explore a wide range of styles and dimensions from our light, crisp, Golden Ale to our dark and intriguing Black Ale. Aside from our staple brews, we offer a range of seasonal styles that explore the beautiful and ever changing seasons of the Yampa Valley. Have a style you’re really craving? Let us know and we just might make it!
name: Storm Peak Brewing Company

description:
Storm&Anchor is a small swiss craft brewery. We are hop heads and you‘ll thaste that. We use only fresh and natural ingrediants coming from around the world. Our passion is to experiment with all those flavours and create new brews, so there is no year-round range. Some beers come back, others are brewed for a single edition.

It’s all about the love for craft brew.
name: Storm&Anchor Brewing Company

description: Look for our beers across town starting in January. Come have a beer with us at our location in February!
name: Stormbreaker Brewing

description: Now open just two blocks from Lake Michigan in the lakeside town of Frankfort, MI, a small brewery crafting ales within the time-honored Belgian brewing tradition of ignoring time-honored brewing traditions.
name: Stormcloud Brewing Company

description:
Our Mission: To support the community in Colorado through the sharing of beer and beer knowledge of the finest quality. By using only the finest ingredients and best practices, we provide people with beer that inspires them in the art of craft brewing. Our knowledgeable, professional and friendly staff enjoy serving craft beer while discussing the craft brewing process. In this way, together with other craft breweries, we are changing the face of beer and it's consumer.

We value: quality, collaboration, open mindedness, integrity, accountability, community, humility, family
name: Storybook Brewing

description: Over 26 years, Stoudts Brewing Company has grown and evolved from a small brewery with limited draught distribution, to a packaging regional microbrewery with distribution in 17 different states, producing over 10,000 barrels a year. Even with the growth over the years, one thing has always remained constant, and that is the attention to detail that goes into every batch of handcrafted beer that is traditionally brewed, packaged and sold with passion by our small team of hardworking dedicated employees. A tradition that was started by Ed and Carol Stoudt who both continue to spread the gospel of craft beer!
name: Stoudts Brewery

description:
Stoup Brewing – The Art and Science of Beer

At Stoup, our craftsmanship is a testament to our commitment to the art and the science of beer. As scientists, we hold the microorganisms and chemical processes that create beer in the highest esteem. As artists, we revel in a good pour. The dual disposition honors traditional styles perfected by earlier brew-masters as well as elevates craft brewing by continually seeking a better pint.

Our brewery will communicate a respect for both the art and science of beer by cultivating a warm and communal environment – a place for friends to gather and for enthusiasts to chat with the brewers over a well-fashioned, delicious beer.
name: Stoup Brewing

description: Locally Sourced Globally Inspired Cuisine, Our Own Craft Brewed Ales & Elegant Lodging in an 1830s National Landmark Inn.
name: StoutHearted  Brewing Company

description:
We are working hard to provide our hometown of Huntsville, Alabama with top quality, full flavored beer in styles ranging from English brown ales to American Imperial IPA’s and everything in between. You can find our beer on draft at many local restaurants,bottle shops, and bars. If we’re not already on tap at your favorite hang-out, please ask them why not!

Straight To Ale’s products are distributed throughout our great state of Alabama, as well as our friendly neighbors: Tennessee, Mississippi, Georgia, and Florida.
name: Straight to Ale

description:
Strand Brewing Co is located in Torrance, CA - along the southern coast of Los Angeles County - nestled in and amongst the sleepy beach communities collectively known as The South Bay.  

We currently distribute our beers throughout Southern California via Wine Warehouse.  Though our focus is currently on the greater Los Angeles and Orange County areas, we can be found as far south as San Diego and as far north as Sacramento 

It is with great pride that we continue to be part of the growing craft beer culture here in L.A.  We hope to produce outstanding beer for years to come.
name: Strand Brewing Co

description: Strange Brewing Company, opened in May of 2010, was Denver's first successful nanobrewery, brewing on a one-barrel homebrew setup. Though we have expanded to a 10bbl system, we kept our original setup and brew a 1bbl experimental every Wednesday. With 12 taps in our Tasting Room, you're sure to find something you like.
name: Strange Craft Beer Company

description: Our story is not unlike many a beer journeyman before us—we’re intoxicated with the mystery of fermentation, the possibilities of taste, and chasing after unexplored horizons. Our goal is simply to make beer —
name: Strange Land Brewery

description: Strangeways Brewing is a one-of-a-kind, 8,400 square-foot production brewery that is open to the public daily.  It houses multiple tasting room spaces along with outdoor seating, and always has 25+ unique beers on tap.  RateBeer named Strangeways “Best Brewery Tap Room in Virginia” in 2014/2015.  Outfitted with a 20 barrel brewhouse, this is where we unhinge the status quo, break through the boring, and invite the unknown.  Make Strangeways Brewing one of your adventure destinations for regular tastings, tours, event/private party bookings, and whatever strange events we come up with.
name: Strangeways Brewing

description: Stratford Brewing Company started in the summer of 2004 in the distinctive city, Stratford, Ontario. It produces a signature pilsner that's as delectable as the scenic setting in which it's brewed. Stratford Brewing Company upholds the highest standards in craft brewing, producing premium beer brewed in small batches using the best ingredients. A Stratford Pilsner will delight the most discerning drinkers -- it's Beer As You Like It.
name: Stratford Brewing Company

description:
Welcome to Strawn Brewing Company! If you work hard and enjoy great craft beer like we do you have found the right place. Join up with the brothers Strawn and see what it takes to build a microbrewery.

Two brothers who work hard and love making beer are opening a local microbrewery in Fairburn, GA. Check back often to see how a brewery gets built.
name: Strawn Brewing Company

description: Knowing fellow competitors, adventurers, and explorers seek beers with flavor and character, we founded Strike Brewing. Our goal is to create distinctive beers for active individuals who can’t just stand on the sidelines. Enjoy Strike’s unique session beers with friends in conversation and celebration. These beers were brewed to reward hard work and fuel the “fire within.”
name: Strike Brewing Co

description:
A name as important to the success of Detroit as Ford or Chrysler, the Stroh family began with humble roots, brewing beer in a family-owned inn during the 18th century in Kirn, Germany. In 1848, during the German Revolution, Bernhard Stroh, having apprenticed at his father side, immigrated to the United States. He established his own brewery in Detroit in 1850. Stroh named his new company Lion's Head Brewery, adopting the Lion's Crest logo from the Kyrburg Castle in Germany – the same crest that adorns Stroh beers today

After establishing the brewery, Bernhard's son, Bernhard Jr., continued its expansion. A firm proponent of tradition and quality, he introduced the European method of fire-brewing to America. The fire-brewing process uses a direct flame rather than steam to heat beer-filled copper kettles. The resulting higher temperatures intensify the aroma and body of beer, resulting in a more flavorful brew.

During Prohibition, the Stroh family operated the business under the name The Stroh Products Company, producing near beer (beer with its alcohol extracted), birch beer, soft drinks, malt products, ice cream, and ice. Though production of most of these items ceased when Prohibition ended in 1933, Stroh Ice Cream can still be enjoyed at parlors today.

The Stroh Brewery grew alongside the other titans of Detroit industry. In 1964 the company made its first move toward expansion when it bought the Goebel Brewing Company, with an eye towards national distribution. As other national brands began to enter the Detroit market, Stroh began to aggressively pursue other markets.

In 1973, Peter Stroh's willingness to depart from years of tradition enabled Stroh's to survive, but the changes were hard to swallow for many Stroh's employees. Stroh broke the company's tradition of family management and recruited managers from other companies. He also introduced a light beer, Stroh's Light.

Though the brewery encountered many difficult times, the tradition and quality of Stroh's has never changed, and the quality of Bernhard's family-owned beer continue today, with Stroh's and Stroh's Light.
name: Stroh Brewery Company

description:
We love beer! We have a passion for brewing it, sharing it with our friends and of course drinking it. We wanted to do something we love, a dream turned into reality and strong arm brewing was born. 

We have spent the last few years perfecting our brews and now you can enjoy the fruits of our labor with us. When you are as committed as we are to the process, use the best ingredients and understand beer like we do the end result is nothing short of wonderful. 

So join us by gathering a few friends and tilting back a chilled pint glass filled with one of our signature brews. We thank you for doing so and know you will love it as much as we do.
name: Strong Arm Brewing

description: Strong Rope Brewery, owned and operated by Head Brewer Jason Sahler will create distinctive American Ales. From classic American styles to Wild American ales and unique seasonal offerings that use the freshest vegetables, fruits, herbs and spices. While serving many of the ales on Draft, the brewery will also have a strong cask and bottle conditioning program, showcasing all the nuances of the full American flavors in the more subtle cask and bottle conditioned environment. Building on the local movement, StrongRope will feature regional ingredients and focus on distribution within 200 miles. In addition, the brewery will serve as a learning center, aiming to educate consumers on the qualities of true craft beer, with frequent classes and events.
name: Strong Rope Brewing

description:
Stubborn beauty brewing company is committed to brewing unique, full flavored beers that enrich the lives of our consumers and to being a positive presence within the communities we serve.

Through creativity, innovation and experimentation stubborn beauty produces a diverse line of beers. while respecting brewing tradition we also employ a healthy dose of both revolution and evolution. to revolt is to be american. we are bound only by the limits of our own imagination.
name: Stubborn Beauty Brewing

description:
Stumblefoot Brewing Co. has set out to make some of the most interesting styles of beer we can think of. We want our beer to be an artisan experience of local flavor. 

Stumblefoot Brewery is in its second year of joining the ranks of new breweries. We have setup in San Diego's North County - in San Marcos, CA. This area has become known as a mecca for beer. And all you need to do be a part of it is ... Represent!

Stumblefoot is a name that personifies the boot strap and prototyping format we have gone about creating our brewery. The name pays tribute to our willingness to experiment.

We decided to come up with a definition that incorporates the essence of our experience:
Stumblefoot – \’stəm • bəl • fut\ (noun) 
1) The art and science of gaining new knowledge through the happenstance of interesting encounters. Fortune favors the prepared.
See also: Organic, sharing, open-minded, kismet, lucky
name: Stumblefoot Brewing Co.

description: (No longer brewing)
name: Sturgeon Bay Brewing

description:
When the Calwer Eck opened in 1987 it had been Stuttgart's first micro brewery and one among only a few in Germany. Since that day we are brewing the Calwer-Eck-Bräu following our own recipe. It is a bottom-fermented, natural cloudy beer, fresh from the cave. Although it is strongly liable to the German Purity Law dated 1516 it is different to most other beers, since we are not filtering or pasteurizing it but bring it directly from the brewery to your table.

In order to make your stay a most pleasant one, we serve homemade Swabian delicacies with the freshly brewed beer. You can have a look on our traditional micro brewery directly from your seat in the restaurant and you can join a guided tour upon appointment. There are no separate rooms in our pleasant and friendly pub but we´ll be pleased to reserve the requested number of seats for you in one of our most comfortable places of the pub to make your stay with your friends or collegues most enjoyable.

If you come with a larger group of people you have the opportunity to rent the whole restaurant where we will spoil you with our speciality buffets. It will be a pleasure to help you with the combination of your menue and to create the right atmosphere for your stay. Our catering service will bring our home-made delicacies to ever place you want. We will be pleased to handle the whole organisation of your event. Please do not hesitate to contact us in time so that we have all opportunities to meet your requests.
name: Stuttgarter Lokalbrauerei Calwer-Eck-Bräu

description: We make beer!
name: Sub Noir Brewing

description: Welcome to Suds Brothers Brewery, Fruita’s premie​r brewery and restaurant located in the heart of Downtown Fruita. We offer an extensive menu of great traditional pub fare which can be paired with one of our handcrafted beers, brewed on site.  In addition to its exceptional food and beer menu, Suds Brothers has a full bar.  Offering weekly cocktail specials, local wine, cider, and a variety of Moscow mules.  Suds Brothers Brewery serves lunch and dinner every day.  Happy hour is Monday-Friday 4-6, with $3 pints and $2 off appetizers, what better way to unwind after work!  Come down and check us out!  Be sure to look at our upcoming events, for live music and other happenings.
name: Suds Brothers Brewery

description: Sudwerk brews and bottles Swiss Beer in Zürich Oberland.  Unlike others that brew “Pale Ale Style”  Our beer is brewed on an Authentic British Pale Ale Brew House using the finest English Pale Ale Malt, American Hops and Yeast.  I have been brewing American Pale Ales since 1982, back in the days when I brewed 20 Liters at a time as a homebrewer.  Today I brew 2000 Liters at a time (more friends then back then).  I grew up in Northern California during the Microbrewery Revolution and you will taste that in my beers. Of course I never pasteurize our beers or add anything artificial.  Trust me when I say, Beer coming from Pfäffikon to your dinner table will taste fresher than beer brought in a container traveling 2 months over the ocean.  Don’t just take our word for it, Biergenuss Magazine calls us “The Rothschild of Beer”. Thanks to all of you for making Western Rider the number one selling Pale Ale in Switzerland. Unlike many other brands, we are not brewed in Germany or in another Kanton and then sold as a “Local” or “Swiss Beer”. We are also not a big beer factory, owned by a European neighbor.  With every Sudwerk Beer, you are enjoying an Authentic Pale Ale produced here in Switzerland, by a family owned and operated “Kleinbrauerei”/Microbrewery. With every Sudwerk Beer, you enjoy the true meaning of Swiss Quality and the results of good old fashioned hard work.  You can find us in larger COOP Stores in the German and French speaking parts of Switzerland, on the Bahnhofstrasse in Jelmoli, Rio Getränke, Drinks of the World as well as in over 100 Restaurants and Hotels. In Zürich, we are distributed by Heineken Distribution, Intercomestibles AG and Schatt Getränke. Quality without compromise. If you are ever in the neighborhood, come by and visit us!  And do follow us on Twitter and Facebook.
name: Sudwerk

description: With a foundation of over 25 years of brewing authentic German-style craft lagers, Sudwerk focuses on hand crafted beers that showcase the nexus of German tradition and West Coast brewing innovation.
name: Sudwerk Brewing Co.

description: Sugar Creek is bringing Belgian-inspired beer to the Carolinas and beyond.  The Sugar Creek Brewing philosophy combines the watchful eye of a Trappist Monk with the technical precision of a nuclear engineer to craft fresh, full-flavored  beers that are immensely satisfying and intensely drinkable. Using unique combinations of aromatic yeast strains, domestic and imported hops and award-winning malt varieties, Sugar Creek infuses traditional recipes with modern tastes and techniques to create beer that nourishes both mind and body.
name: Sugar Creek Brewing Company

description: Our brewery name Sugar Ridge was chosen to depict the character of the beers brewed here.  We brew heavier ales with full rounded flavors leaving behind a portion of the residual malt sugars to balance slightly to the sweet side......the sugar ridge.  With a variety of ales to choose from, we're sure you'll find one to enjoy.
name: Sugar Ridge Brewery
Sullivan's Black Forest Brew Haus & Grill

description: Summit Brewing Company is a regional craft brewery in St. Paul, Minnesota that brews a wide selection of popular beers. It is sometimes mistakenly believed to be a microbrewery, even though Summit's output is in the top 50 of breweries in the United States, approximately 80,000 barrels of beer per year. Their flagship beer, an American pale ale (branded Summit Extra Pale Ale) is especially popular in the Twin Cities area.
name: Summit Brewing Company

description:
Sun King Brewing Company is an Indianapolis-based craft brewery with a focus on continually creating traditional seasonal and unique specialty beers. 

Sun King rolled its first keg of beer out the door in July 2009 and since that time has grown into the second largest brewery in Indiana, producing over 27,000 barrels of beer in 2014 while selling all of it in Indiana. Sun King's beers have been awarded multiple medals at the Great American Beer Festival and World Beer Cup.

Located in a downtown Indianapolis warehouse, Sun King was the first full-scale production brewery in Indianapolis since 1948. Sun King beer can be enjoyed at fine bars/restaurants and liquor stores throughout Indiana or in their Tasting Room, located in the brewery at 135 N. College Avenue.
name: Sun King Brewing Company

description: Sunken City is the new brewery at Smith Mountain Lake. We will start pouring beer in May!
name: Sunken City Brewing Company

description:
We love our beer. In a region that has taken microbrews to a whole new level, we pride ourselves on brewing awesome craft beer that includes the lighter side of brewing as well as the killer hoppy fare.

We’re just as proud of our outrageous service. Great beer needs to be shared. We’re positioned to do just that here in Sunriver and beyond. Whether we’re serving customers in our brewpub or working with our distributors and their outlets, our awesome beers are brewed to be relished. You’ll crave our high-quality, easy-drinking beer and we’ll do whatever it takes to share the love.
name: Sunriver Brewing Company

description: Outer Sunset's newest family-friendly restaurant and brewery.
name: Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company

description:
The seven barrel system that looms behind the floor to ceiling glass in our Brewer’s Den is the fruits of our labor and February 14, 2006 marked a new chapter in our history. You see, this was the day that the first three beers brewed on site flowed. We know we are biased, but in our minds the beer had never tasted as good as it did that day.face of the “Big German” Uwe Boer that we all know and love. He works magic in his craft and the passion that he shows for brewing fills the glasses as his award winning beer dispenses from our taps. We now boast our own regular taps but his innovation in our seasonal ales and distinct brewing style is what keeps our bar stools full and the place hopping. We can hardly keep his cask conditioned ale on tap as our customers are known to consume the kegs in record time.

“Great Beer, Great Food and Great Service” became our motto as we plugged through the first few years and now the slogan is what we live by. Our fantastic customers and great staff are what makes us who we are and how we stand out in the sea of new restaurants that pop up daily. It is our great customers that made it so easy to push forward into brewing and our loyal staff that helped to smooth over the transition. We continue to grow and change over time just as any business wants to do but it is remembering the little things that have gotten us to where we are today. After all in today’s crazy hectic world it is the little things in life that make it all worth it.
name: SunUp Brewing
