description: All Superior Lakes Mead is handcrafted using the finest of ingredients.  We use raw Michigan honey, straight from the beekeeper and never processed.  Most of our fruit is direct from Michigan farms.
name: Superior Lakes Wine & Mead

description: Located less than five miles from Surfer’s Point, Ventura’s Surf BreweryTM. The only craft microbrewery kegging and bottling their own beer in Ventura County. Tasting room and HomeBrew supplies as well.
name: Surf Brewery

description: The Surinaamse Brouwerij is the only brewery in Suriname and the proud brewery of Parbo beer, the famous national beer in Suriname.
name: Surinaamse Brouwerij

description:
While you're enjoying the full-bodied flavor of the beer, remember that it was more than 10 years in the making. We think it was worth it. We hope you agree.
 
Surly: The anger fueled by the inability to find good beer.

"We brewed beer for people who didn't know they wanted to drink it until they had it." - Omar Ansari
name: Surly Brewing Company

description:
Susquehanna Brewing Company delivers prosperity and enjoyment to our Northeastern Pennsylvania (NEPA) customers and consumers through our quality, craft beers made locally in an environmentally responsible fashion.

We’re beer people. It’s in our blood. 6th generation and going strong. Back before it was hip to brew beer, our grandfathers’ grandfathers spent time crafting the perfect, drinkable beer right here in northeastern Pennsylvania. The beer brewing torch has been passed down, and now it’s our turn. To make the kind of beer you can enjoy all day long, if you’re so inclined. And we have to admit, someti...See More
name: Susquehanna Brewing Company

description: Sutter Buttes Brewing is an excellent local brewery, quick to become your favorite place to grab a bite or a crisp drink at the end of the day.  The light atmosphere and friendly staff make it a nice place to relax while still presenting itself as a fine local eatery.  It is a microbrewery and taproom, offering good beers and ciders as well as both lunch and dinner.
name: Sutter Buttes Brewing

description: Svaneke Bryghus  is situated on the rocky island of Bornholm – also known as The Pearl of the Baltic Sea and famous for its unique and beautiful nature. In these inspiring surroundings, Svaneke Bryghus produces exclusively unfiltered quality beer under the name of Bornholmer Bryg (Bornholm Brew). Brewing unfiltered beer is a conscious choice because the beer maintains all its flavour and aromatic nuances, giving the beer extra character. The brewery is thus proud to have won several prizes in Denmark for its quality beer.
name: Svaneke Bryghus

description:
Why is our another beer? Because it is still the same.
Quality ingredients are now commonplace, it is unnecessary to separately highlight. For the same ingredients but cooks most breweries here and in the rest of Europe, and yet the result is different, why?
What is critical is how these raw materials we process and how we use the technology of production. Give the same raw material cookbook from school cafeterias, chefs from restaurants and chefs on the corner of a first class hotel and the resulting dish will also be completely different.
Production of modernizing, automating some processes, we try to conserve maximum energy and strenuous labor. But all this only where modernization does not affect the technological process of beer!
Strictly, sometimes meticulously, we stick to compliance with the procedures used in the manufacture of beer, made famous in the Czech Republic in the second half of the last century
name: Svijany

description:
Founded in 2008, upon the foundation of our great state, we raised our roof to brew world-class beers and establish ourselves as Florida’s brewery. Having travelled through lands far and close, and finding inspiration along the way, we are proud to be here, proud to be Inherently Floridian.

It has been our mission since day one to be Florida's brewery. We love our neighbors, but we're focused on providing our state with the beer it deserves.

That's only a small part of it.

Have a look around, from our brewery, to our logo and branding, to our beer, you can see that we live, love and are Florida. From now until the horizon, Swamp Head Brewery is Inherently Floridian.
name: Swamp Head Brewery

description: 10 Barrel Brewery & Taproom by Brewmaster Ben Pierson
name: Swamp Rabbit

description: Established in 1989, our on-site brewery is rightly proud of its award winning beers. We brew a wide selection of British-style ales and German and Canadian beers that are created with old-world care and without compromise. No syrups, sugars or "adjunct" are used in our 100 percent grain mashes—only barley and wheat malts, plus oatmeal in our special stout. All of our specialty malts are imported from the UK, as is our unique strain of yeast. The ales are naturally carbonated and left to settle or "fine" at cold temperatures, rather than being filtered. Filtration can remove much of the goodness from beer along with the haze. Another negative practice our Brewer avoids is pasteurization. Our natural and healthy brews are more lightly carbonated than the factory product, and served at a palatable 45 degrees F to bring out the fullness of the flavour for which we strive.
name: Swans Hotel, Pub & Brewery

description: Enter Mount Hope Mansion where the year is 1899 and the 20th century is emerging. The greatest minds of the time have gathered to discuss new ideas and inventions that will impact future generations forever. However, some are willing to do anything to ensure their greatness, even commit murder. Join the great Sherlock Holmes and his faithful friend Dr. Watson at the Murder Mystery Dinner Theatre for this interactive “who-done-it.” Who will be the victim and who will be the assassin? It’s elementary, my dear!
name: Swashbuckler Brewing Company

description:
We are Sweet Mercy Brewing Company and we are founded on the idea that the truth can be tasted in every sip of our handcrafted beer. Indeed, our slogan “Stay True to the Brew” means that you can trust that we brew our beers with the belief that drinking a beer can be a supreme sensory experience. We brew in small batches, paying close attention to the details, so that each beer is a unique creation of flavor. We use only the freshest ingredients, meaning we use no adjuncts or additives that may detract from the beer’s purity of aroma and taste. As such, each glass of Sweet Mercy beer represents honest brewing values.

At this time, we are a brewery-in-planning. We are diligently working on making our brewery dreams a reality. We’re in the process of searching for a great location to open shop, as well as gathering the funding to put together a larger brew system. You can follow us here or on Instagram and Twitter as we make progress in reaching our goals. We’ll keep you amply updated. In the meantime, we’ll continue brewing and serving up samples of our delicious beer at various events around town. Come enjoy a pint with us. We’re sure you’ll agree with us that staying true to the brew is a philosophy that shines through with every swig of our beer.
name: Sweet Mercy Brewing

description:
Creating Oconomowoc's first brewpub just off Old Hwy 16, behind Schwefel's in the industrial park. New home of award-winning beer of Mark Duchow. Planning to open late 2011 if we can get through all the permits and inspections.

Providing highest quality craft beer complemented by small plate fare highlighting, baked, steamed and fresh food. Wisconsin wines and distilled products available.
name: Sweet Mullets Brewing

description:
February 17, 1997 marked the official beginning of SweetWater Brewery, and a new style of brewing and selling beer in Atlanta as the boys wandered around Atlanta in an old van with Freddy's dog Badger. After ending up on the wrong side of the tracks a few times, they were finally pointed in the direction of Virginia-Highlands and found a few bars willing to take a chance on them. "We'll give you a shot as long as your dog stops begging for leftovers on our patio" was the cautious approval they needed to get the brand rolling.

SweetWater's second and current location is in Midtown Atlanta, adjacent to Ansley Park, in the Armour Circle Industrial Park just off of Piedmont and Monroe. The boys saved all of their pennies to buy the 25,000 square feet of brewing goodness and smack in the middle of all the action. Since the company began we've wanted to be closer to our homes, the bars and stores that sell our beer, and all the good folks that drink it. Fortunately seven years of great growth gave the company that opportunity. We learned a lot from that location and left all those mistakes behind as we built our new home. SweetWater Brewing Company has been here since 2004 and it feels good to be settled in. Our new home has enough capacity to brew 100,000 barrels of beer a year (A few more years at this rate.)
name: SweetWater Brewing Company

description: Swift Cider is a small-batch, craft hard cider company from Portland, Oregon. The reincarnation of Outcider LLC, Swift carries forward the same dedication to fresh-pressed apples, wholesome local ingredients, slow-and-cold fermentation, wild yeasts, and intensely delicious flavor. Aidan Currie is the head-cider maker, founding owner, and obsessive fermentation sage. Aidan's small batch blends will begin releasing in the summer of 2014. Identified by a Volume number and flavor description, each batch is one of a kind and truly handcrafted. We encourage you to try each Volume and experience the incredible organoleptic spectrum of locally made hard cider.
name: Swift Cider

description:
Swift Current Brewing Co is part of the Stark Brewing family.

Batches are hand crafted on a 2 bbl brewing system.
name: Swift Current Brewing Co.

description:
Located in Burlington, Vermont, Switchback Brewing Company was founded in 2002 by a formally trained master brewer and his friend, the vision was to concentrate limited resources into making just a few beers to achieve the highest quality possible. The success of Switchback Ale beer has driven constant expansion for over 7 years and made the release of three Rotating Specials, Roasted Red Ale, Porter, and Slow-Fermented Brown Ale possible. Thank you for your support!

As in the beginning, Switchback continues to rely on word of mouth to increase sales, which have expanded into New York, New Hampshire, and Southern Maine. Switchback now brews several thousand barrels of beer each year, but its beer is only available on draught or in 1/2 and 1/6 barrel size kegs.
name: Switchback Brewing Company

description: Switchyard Brewing Company is coming to Bloomington and we are really excited about it. Keep up with the project, news updates, FAQ's and connect with us.
name: Switchyard Brewing Company

description:
We have proud roots in home brewing and North Carolina, and we have been humbly perfecting some of our favorite recipes over the last 10 years.  We are incredibly excited to share them in the months to come.  Justin was born and raised here in Charlotte, and we couldn’t be happier for our brewery to become part of the city's dynamic and growing craft beer scene.  

If you love good beer as much as we do, we can't wait to have you join us in the taproom for a pint or two.  It's not long until we're pouring.
name: Sycamore Brewing

description: From the heart of Surry Hills the Sydney Brewery is dedicated to creating the best craft beers in Australia. Brewed lovingly by hand in small batches, each variant is designed to epitomise the local style, personality and people of the suburbs that make this city great.
name: Sydney Brewery

description:
The Syracuse Suds Factory was founded on January 19th, 1993. It is located in the historic Amos Building in downtown Syracuse, New York. The Syracuse Suds Factory became the first commercial brewery in Syracuse after 31 years. Our first beer was brewed on March 20, 1993 and first tapped on April 17, 1993. At this time we were the only brewery in Syracuse, New York.

The Syracuse Suds Factory also has the claim of being the first brewery, in Syracuse New York, in 31 years to commercially ship its product to other outlets. On May 7th 1995 we shipped our first keg to Jack London's, a pub in Sidney New York. From that point on we have shipped to other accounts outside of Syracuse as well as local accounts.
name: Syracuse Suds Factory

description: Located in Hungary, at Damjanich street. Szarvas. They produce 10 different types of bier. The owner is Szarvasi Atta Ltd.
name: Szarvasi Sör

description: Located in Fonógyári út. , Szeged, Hungary. The owner is Sörker 96 Ltd. They produce three normal quality beer and two premium ones.
name: Szegedi Sörfözde

description: Located in Hungary at Szent András street. 11. in Békésszentandrás. They produce 8 different types of bier. The owner is the Agro-flott Ltd.
name: Szent András Sörfőzde

description: Restaurant Søgaard Bryghus is Aalborg's micro-brewery, which also houses a restaurant. Søgaards Bryghus is divided into two floors with its restaurant on the ground floor and brewery in the basement. In the brewery, you have the opportunity to follow the brewing process. Restaurant Søgaards Bryghus serves well-prepared food made ​​from seasonal ingredients, which means that the menu follows the seasons. For dinner, you can enjoy the brewery's own beer and if you wish guidance on what beers to match the food, this is also possible. On Sundays Søgaards Bryghus offers sn great brunch buffet with freshly squeezed orange juice, scrambled eggs, bacon, charcuterie, pâté, fruit, brownies, homemade jams and much more.
name: Søgaards Bryghus

description: T&R Theakston Ltd is an independent, family brewing company founded in 1827 located in the Yorkshire Dales market town of Masham, North Yorkshire. The company is controlled and run by direct descendents of the founder Robert Theakston, great-great grandsons, Simon, Nick, Tim and Edward Theakston.
name: T&R Theakston Ltd

description:
When Wilson Barr and Tommy Hester met at Williams College in 2007, both were pitchers on the Varsity baseball team. However, they quickly realized their love of baseball was more than equaled by their love of a good drink. Despite the desolate landscape of college get-togethers where there was a strong emphasis on a drink's quantity over quality, Wilson and Tommy were able to find a shared interest in the craft beer industry. When they started an alcoholic beverage company, their adventurous attitudes translated into a desire to create a product that was truly new and exciting. The result was T.W. Pitchers’ Snake Bite®.

While in college, Wilson lived in Europe and discovered that generations of British pub-goers have enjoyed blending lager and hard apple cider. He was astonished to learn the popular concoction had only sparingly made its way across the pond to the United States. Ready to undo this injustice, he returned from his trip and founded W.G. Barr Beverage Company. Tommy was brought on board, and the dynamic duo got to work bringing Snake Bite – a bottled blend of lager and cider - to the thirsty people of America. T.W. Pitchers’, which stands for "Two Williams Pitchers’," or "Tommy and Wilson, Pitchers," was immediately settled on as the brand name.

After months of hard work and many late nights spent taste testing, Wilson and Tommy launched T.W. Pitchers’ Snake Bite in San Francisco. Armed with their Airstream office, a little bit of know-how, and a whole lot of gumption, Wilson and Tommy are committed to quenching your thirst, one bottle of Snake Bite at a time. Cheers!
name: T.W. Pitchers'

description: It is a great time to be a Beer Lover in Boise and TableRock Brew Pub is proud to have been serving this community since 1991.  We are dedicated to our beers and committed to our beer lovers.  We invite you to taste, experience and enjoy our authentic, full-bodied, hand crafted Beers.
name: TableRock Brewpub and Grill

description:
Featuring small, handcrafted batches of beers. Specializing in beers that apeal to non-beer drinkers, beer drinkers, and foody types.

Our promise to you is to not make boring beer! We are located within the Amocat Cafe in downtown Tacoma.
name: Tacoma Brewing Company

description: We are a craft brewery in Truckee and Tahoe City, CA. Our brew pub is in downtown Tahoe City, right on the shore of Lake Tahoe across from Commons Beach. In addition to our specialty ales and lagers, we have a full bar and full menu featuring smokehouse BBQ meats, wood-fired flat bread pizzas, fish, pasta, gourmet and traditional pub faire as well as innovative dishes such as our Cajun Seared Ahi Nachos. We have vegan/vegetarian options, the pub is family friendly and has a kids menu. The pub also has outdoor patio seating, a full bar and a great rustic interior set among our collection of french oak barrels with aging beer.
name: Tahoe Mountain Brewing Company

description:
TailGate Beer was founded by a 21-year-old homebrewer, Wesley Keegan. The story goes, Wesley was approached by his father, Tim, one day about what he was going to do with his life. As an ocean lifeguard and co-owner of a bar, Wesley thought he had it made. His dad informed him of a trademark he had won in 2004 and subsequently protected in contest from Anheuser Busch. The name was TailGate Beer.

Tim thought TailGate Beer was something special. As an avid sports fan and tailgater, Tim implored Wesley to take his homebrews that people loved drinking and brew TailGate Beer! Wesley, having put himself through college at San Diego State University, grew up modestly. The gift of TailGate Beer was a generous one but, unlike some tales of entrepreneurism, didn’t come with startup funds.

They both agreed the name was solid and the marketing would one day be fun, but Wesley was emphatic that the beer had to be excellent. From there, Wesley took what he liked to brew, and brewed in Southern California. All initial beers were brewed and packaged in kegs and glass bottles. Wesley entered into the Great American Beer Festival in 2007 and although no formal awards were won, TailGate Beer was a hit! This drew lots of attention from beer fans from all over the country. The common response was “great beer!” and “great name!” So with confirmation of Wesley’s biggest apprehension – people loved the beer – TailGate Beer was born.
name: TailGate Beer

description: At Take 16 Brewing Company we take pride in attention to detail, giving you the great tasting beer you’ll come to expect and enjoy. We offer the best in craft beers. Take 16 Brewing Company is proudly located in Luverne, Minnesota.
name: Take 16 Brewing Co.

description: We are a small, premium brewery based in Parsonsburg, MD. It is with pride that our brews are themed on folk lore. Tall Tales have been told for years, stories of real and fictitious people who do unbelievable and amazing things. These stories have become part of our culture and heritage. The legends of Paul Bunyan, Blue Ox, Calamity Jane, John Henry, Red Headed Step Child, Annie Oakley, Buffalo Bill and Excalibur. These are just a few of the legendary stories that have been told over the years. Stories that have been passed down from generation to generation. Our brewers have carefully developed beers that would be worthy of each legendary tall tale. These brews appeal to many different tastes. We are certain you will find something to delight your palette!
name: Tall Tales Brewery

description: Tallgrass Brewing Company was founded by Jeff Gill in 2007 and now offers a full line of award-winning craft beers produced in a 60,000-square-foot facility located near the Flint Hills in Manhattan, Kansas. Through its Grain-to-Glass™ program, the brewery is dedicated to providing consistently remarkable beers by emphasizing quality in every aspect of production. As the largest brewery in Kansas and major regional brewery with distribution in 14 states, Tallgrass fearlessly explores, creates and shares new beers with fun, positive and exciting branding. For additional information, visit www.tallgrassbeer.com.
name: Tallgrass Brewing Company

description: Tamarack is nestled beneath the Rocky and Mission Mountains in Lakeside, Montana, near the shores of beautiful Flathead Lake. High ceilings, fascinating architectural details and a warm ambience help make The 'Rack the best spot in the Flathead Valley to relax with great food and handcrafted ales. The creek side patio is the perfect place to hang out and enjoy the outdoors with friends and family. Tamarack is proud to be a casual brew pub where people can enjoy simple yet wonderful pub fare and ales in an unassuming and friendly atmosphere.
name: Tamarack Brewing Company

description:
Our family founded the Tampa Bay Brewing Company in 1996 to satisfy Tampa Bay’s thirst for a better beer and great food at a reasonable price. It’s still a family affair, with mother and son serving as general manager and brewmaster respectively.
Our original location was a two-story brick building that used to house horses on 15th Street here in the historic Ybor City district.
Needing more space for our ever-growing fan base, we moved to our current location on the plaza level of Centro Ybor in 2006 with both indoor and open-air patio seating.
name: Tampa Bay Brewing Company

description: Tandem Ciders is founded on the principle of sustainability. Based on products of local growers, we will create fine varietal and specialty hard ciders with a commitment to simplicity, support of the surrounding community, and respect for the environment.
name: Tandem Ciders

description:
An artisan brewery dedicated to the craft of 100% Brettanomyces ales and barrel aged sours. 

Tampa area. Opening 2015.
name: Tangent Brewing Company

description: South Fayetteville's friendly neighborhood pub featuring fine house made ales and slow cooked seasonal pub cuisine.
name: Tanglewood Branch Beer Co.

description: Taos Mesa Brewing is a microbrewery, restaurant and indoor/outdoor venue on the spectacular Taos Mesa. We feature our own hand-crafted beer on draught, wine, delicious homemade food, premier live music and the best mountain-view sunsets in Taos.
name: Taos Mesa Brewing

description: Tap & Screw brewery is Cincinnati's first microbrewery on the west side, featuring on premise brewed beer, freshly made food, and local wines.
name: Tap & Screw Brewery

description:
Formerly 2 separate entities (The Haverhill Brewery & the Tap Brewpub) we have decided it's in everyone's best interest to consolidate into one, singular brand. That is why as of October 1, 2012 we became The Tap Brewing Company!

The Tap Brewing Company is located inside a nearly 120 year old mill that at one point was the epicenter of Haverhill's massive shoe manufacturing industry. High ceilings, dark grain wood, exposed brick and rich character. We highlight the history of the building without it becoming an intrusive element. Our style is simplistic and straight forward, both in atmosphere and menu. We're right in the middle of a bustling downtown that sits along a beautiful river which our large deck overlooks for an incredible outdoor dining experience in the Summer months. Or heck, a pint during a snowstorm. Our hope is to provide you with a great meal, great beer and outstanding service in a laid-back atmosphere. A mellow, all-encompassing brewpub experience.
name: Tap Brewing Company

description: Here at Tap It Brewing Company, located in SLO Town, USA in the heart of the Central Coast, we’re true to our roots and true to our word. We like to take a laid-back approach to almost everything we do. But there’s one thing we’re absolutely serious about – our beer.
name: Tap It Brewing Co

description:
A tribute to “The Noble Experiment”, Tap Room No. 21 embodies an American spirit of perseverance. During the heyday of the Roaring Twenties, corruption was rampant, lawbreakers became icons and speakeasies replaced saloons. As an ode to the repeal of Prohibition, our best kept secret and most cherished contraband is available for you to enjoy among your crew of notorious bootleggers. 

The ban has been lifted -- Drink openly, rest easily, and pay no heed to “speak easy”.
name: Tap Room No. 21 Brewing Company

description: Tapistry Brewing has one goal: creating excellent craft beer. Whether it’s a classic English robust porter or an experimental dark smoked imperial saison, we craft our beverages with purpose, conviction and the highest quality ingredients available. Our beer is hand-crafted in beautiful Bridgman, MI, just one mile from Lake Michigan. Our taproom features 20 taps as well as an artisan menu and a relaxing beer garden for sunny summer days. We also distribute in kegs throughout Southern and Western Michigan. Look for our beers in the Grand Rapids, Kalamazoo, Lansing and Ann Arbor markets. We are passionate about craft beer. Tapistry Brewing—combining artistry and chemistry.
name: Tapistry Brewing

description:
Brewmaster Victor Novak brews approximately 1700 kegs, or 26,000 gallons of beer for TAPS on an annual basis. His repertoire includes 31 to 35 classic styles of European and American alesand lagers, of which seven are currently on tap, plus one cask ale (see below). Victor also provides two beers for the Manzella family's second restaurant venture, The Catch, in Anaheim.

From the extraordinary leadership of General Manager Chris Snyder, our extraordinary culinary team, the expertise of Brewmaster Victor Novak, to a dedicated wait staff, our people are genuinely passionate about providing exceptional service. With all this going for us, it's not surprising that TAPS has grown into the leading dining destination in Orange County.
name: Taps Fish House & Brewery

description: We're a family owned and operated Microbrewery located in the heart of Tatamagouche, Nova Scotia. In 2014 we converted an old butcher shop into a community brewery where we make small batches of tasty handcrafted beer.
name: Tatamagouche Brewing Company

description: Taxman Brewing Company is dedicated to crafting unique, artisanal Belgian-American ales. Located in Bargersville, IN (30 minutes south of Indianapolis), our brewery and gastropub provide the perfect "farmhouse" destination.
name: Taxman Brewing Company

description:
Taybeh Brewery is a Palestinian brewery founded in 1994. The brewery is located in the West Bank village of Taybeh, 35 kilometers north of Jerusalem. It produced its first beer in 1995 and has since developed a global cult following. It has been described as a pioneer microbrewery in the region, being that it predated the first Israeli microbrewery, The Dancing Camel, by about ten years.


Milestones:
By 2005 the company was only able to produce 300 cases a week locally due to conflict with Israel. Taybeh beer sold in Europe is brewed and bottled in Belgium with the license held in Germany.

In 2005, an annual Oktoberfest-style beer festival was launched. Dubbed the Taybeh Beer Festival, it opens in the beginning of October.

In 1997, Taybeh beer became the first Palestinian product to be franchised in Germany, where it was brewed and bottled for sale in Europe. Taybeh beer is also exported directly from Taybeh to Sweden.

In 2008, an Australian named Lara van Raay produced a documentary called Palestine, Beer and Oktoberfest Under Occupation, which focuses on the Taybeh Brewery and the Khoury family.


Products:
There are four varieties of Taybeh Beer: Golden, Light, Amber, and Dark. 

In 2007, a new non-alcoholic beer variety was to be launched specifically for the local Palestinian Muslim market. 

The original brand was Taybeh Beer Golden. The Taybeh Beer Dark and Taybeh Beer Light were introduced for the 2000 celebrations in the Holy Land. The Dark variety follows a classic style of the way monks brewed beer in the Middle Ages in order to fortify themselves during their fasting.
name: Taybeh Brewing Company

description: We provide Tecumseh, Lenawee County, and surrounding areas with a warm and inviting neighborhood tavern in which we proudly serve eclectic and award-winning, house-made craft ales and lagers accompanied by an evolving menu of classic, high-quality pub fare using fresh and local ingredients. Our goal is to provide consistently friendly service.
name: Tecumseh Brewing Company

description: Teds Brewery offers 2 special high fermentation beers. Made with pure ingredients to the Belgian and Dutch tradition to paying off flavors, so far, known in Bolivia.
name: Ted's Cervecería

description: Early American brewers adapted traditional European brewing techniques to the unique ingredients, climates, and tastes of the New World. At Telegraph Brewing Co., our beers are handcrafted in that same manner at our brewery in Santa Barbara, California. Making use of as many locally grown ingredients as we can, Telegraph's ales embody our philosophy that a local brewery should reflect the traditions of its region. Our goal is to produce uniquely American beer styles that are imbued with a spirit of invention and creativity, but always with a nod toward history.
name: Telegraph Brewing Company

description: The mission of Telluride Brewing Company is to produce premium hand-crafted, artisan ales that embody the spirit, culture and pride of Telluride for the enjoyment of the most discerning beer lover.
name: Telluride Brewing Company

description:
The Teme Valley Brewery is a craft producer of cask and bottle-conditioned beers. Opened in 1997 to brew for The Talbot in Knightwick, Worcestershire (www.the-talbot.co.uk), the brewery has expanded and now sells directly to pubs and specialist off-licences across the West Midlands.

We are proud that all the hops we use are grown in Worcestershire, Herefordshire or Shropshire and all the barley used to make our malt is grown in the UK.
name: Teme Valley Brewery

description:
It’s taken almost one hundred years, but Evanston can once again call itself home to a Temperance movement. But this time there’s beer. In fact, this one is all about the beer. Aside from that tiny detail, Temperance has always been about making life better in ways big and small. We think that’s a worthy goal, and one that only comes about by being open to the possibilities. It’s something we think about with the beers we brew and the things we do. (And when you join us, you will too.)
Welcome to a new Temperance movement.
name: Temperance Beer Company

description: A progressive brewing company producing big flavour beers since 2010.
name: Tempest Brewing Co.

description: We're an Australian Craft Microbrewery with a fantastic bar open Thursday - Sunday every week. Come in for a beer, meal or snack with a view of the brewery.
name: Temple Brewing

description:
Ten Fifty-Five Brew Works was founded in 2011 by a couple of local Tucsonans, who share a few core beliefs. We'd like to share those with you.

So...we like beer, and we really like good beer. We want to put good beer in reach of those that want to enjoy it, and help nurture the developing brew culture in Tucson. We want to make beer for beer drinkers like us; adventurous beer drinkers that are just as likely to try something new as they are an old favorite. We are committed to the idea of the local nano-brewer; a small batch company using fresh ingredients and open minds to make some great tasting brew. Look for us soon, we'll be looking for you.
name: Ten Fifty-Five Brewing

description: Ten Mile Creek Brewery is located in the historic downtown walking mall of Helena, MT. Ten Mile Creek plans on continuing the tradition of bringing great beer to Helena.
name: Ten Mile Creek Brewery

description:
Our mission is to brew unique and flavorful beers that break through traditional style guidelines and enhance the beer-drinking experience. Come along with us as we explore new flavors and create new styles that will have us all celebrating the good days.

Craft beer transforms four simple ingredients into something great. At Ten Ninety, we further this transformation to produce refreshing yet complex and challenging beers from unique ingredients and processes. As we reach beyond traditional combinations of water, malted grain, hops, and yeast, we are unapologetically proud to say that we brew extraordinary small batch beers meant to be thoughtfully enjoyed. Simply put, Ten Ninety is craft beer elevated.
name: Ten Ninety Brewing Co.

description: Ten Pin is a brew pub located in Moses Lake WA.  It co exists inside of Papa's Casino and Sports Lounge.
name: Ten Pin Brewing Co.

description:
Ten Sleep Brewing Company is located in the Smith Family barn snuggled at the base of Signal Cliff, one mile west of Ten Sleep, Wyoming.

Yes we are in a barn… so don’t be surprised to see chickens pecking at spent grain, brew cats sawing Z’s, or a herd of deer headed by on their way to an evening dinner.  Our facility features a 7 BBL stainless brew house in a beautiful rural setting. We produce high quality craft beer in a variety of flavors, and feature a tap room on site where locals and visitors come to view brewery operations while enjoying a pint and possibly some chow. We opened for business in the Fall of 2013, and our beer is currently on tap in many fine establishments across Wyoming. We believe Ten Sleep Brewing Co. is the first brewery in a barn in Wyoming and we would love for you to come visit!
name: Ten Sleep Brewing Company

description: At Tenacity, we strive to brew extraordinary, creative beer to serve and celebrate our community.
name: Tenacity Brewing

description: Tenaya Creek was established in 1999 by Tim Etter and his brothers and sisters. Tim's background in brewing started in his college days at the University of Utah in Salt Lake City. In early 1993, his roommate at the time introduced him to the art of making beer. This smalltime hobby of making beer in a tiny apartment blossomed into a fulltime career, brewing commercially. Towards the end of 1993, Tim attended UC Davis in Northern California to study Fermentation Science. Upon returning to Salt Lake, he aligned himself with a startup brewery called Uinta Brewing Company. The concept for this startup was to brew the freshest beer available in the State of Utah while limiting the alcohol percentage to 3.2 by weight (4% by volume). It was wildly successful, providing locally made beer for the ski areas and the many tourists that visited Utah.
name: Tenaya Creek Brewery

description: Dedicated to producing & enjoying high quality craft beer, while appreciating music & the many other fine traditions & charms of Tennessee, U.S.A.
name: Tennessee Brew Works

description:
The passion comes from Giuseppe Collesi and Roberto Bini, who together are taking Collesi beers to every part of the world – from the United States to Japan, from Russia to Northern Europe – accompanying them in their constant and continuous growth. The experience comes from Collesi master brewer Marc Knops, from Belgium, who right from the start has worked to make Imper Ale a perfectly balanced beer with great appeal, true to the Belgian Trappist brewing traditions of which he is one of the foremost exponents.

The Collesi distillery, situated at Apecchio, a delightful countryside town in the province of Pesaro and Urbino wedged between the regions of Marche, Umbria and Tuscany, first started distilling with the pomace of the 2000 grape harvest, using an elegant steam-bath still to produce batches of five varieties of grappa and two other distillates bearing the names of the vines from which they were obtained: Verdicchio, Sangiovese, Bianchello del Metauro, Montepulciano and Lacrima di Morro d’Alba.
name: Tenute Collesi

description: South Florida's first microbrewery and winner of a Silver Medal at the 2011 Great American Beer Festival, Tequesta Brewing Company is an organically certified brewer, with over 40 different specialty beers a year. You're bound to find something you love!
name: Tequesta Brewing Company

description:
Terrapin Beer Company was born when two brewers met while working together at a microbrewery in Atlanta. Looking around at what other breweries in the SE were doing, Spike and John felt they could make a contribution. Realizing that anyone could make just another pale ale, brown ale or stout, Spike and John set their sights on crafting beers unlike any that were currently available in the SE.

Terrapin introduced its first beer, the Rye Pale Ale in April of 2002. Six months later while only available on draft in Athens, Terrapin’s sole offering won the American Pale Ale Gold Medal at the 2002 Great American Beer Festival.  Only six months old, Terrapin had arrived in style!
name: Terrapin Beer Company

description: German-inspired beer and cuisine crafted with our city’s heritage of greatness in mind.
name: Territorial Brewing Company

description: Testing adding a brewery from iOS
name: Test Add Brewery

description: This brewery is for testing purposes only
name: Test Brewery

description: Texas ale project is the first brewery to be built from the ground up in the city of Dallas since the late 1800's. That’s over 120 years, folks. We have worked very hard to get where we are today, and we are proud to introduce our ales to you.
name: Texas Ale Project

description: Texas Beer Refinery is a new Brewery concept seeking to change the game of craft beer brewing and distribution by offering a unique approach to selling high quality and custom beers across Texas. Our plans are to open a BrewPub in Kemah, TX where our beers will be brewed onsite. We look forward to serving you soon. Cheers!
name: Texas Beer Refinery

description: The Texas BIG BEER Brewery is a small brewery located in Southeast Texas out in the woods just South of the Big Thicket. Owned and operated by John & Tammy McKissack, our goal is to start up a small debt free brewery with no pressure to brew more beer, just to make more money to pay to some bank! Brewing great beer is a craft, which should be appreciated, enjoyed and savored. We believe that if we live a simple life, make wise decisions, put in an honest days work and brew the best craft beer we can, the bottom line should take care of itself.
name: Texas Big Beer Brewery

description: We are a Texas brewery that promotes the rich heritage and storied history of the Lone Star State.
name: Texian Brewing Co

description:
Just Who Are "Those Guys"?

"Those Guys" represent the anonymous many among us all. Those guys built our bridges and our skyscrapers. Those guys built the roads we travel on, the airplanes we fly in, the cars we drive, and the houses we live in. Those guys serve their country, protect our children, put out our fires, and collect our trash. Those guys work in our offices, teach in our schools, raise our food, and serve us in restaurants.

Reaching stores in 2010, Those Guys Beer, an all-natural, all-malt lager, brewed and bottled in the U.S.A. is now available to all 'Those Guys.'
name: TG Enterprises, Inc

description:
THAT Brewery, just off the Arizona Trail in Pine, AZ is a place for people who like beer! We like beer – like to drink it, brew it, tip it and sing songs about it. Opened June 2012. THAT Brewery craft brews are available in many of your local pubs. Come up to Pine to see it all in action - great craft brews (THAT Brewery concoctions and other locally brewed guest craft beers), food, wine, volleyball, horseshoes and good times in the great Northern Arizona cool air. It’s a beautiful drive along the Mogollon Rim with an awesome destination - great craft beer from the source! By the way, we're good people too - actively a part of many charity groups in the area including: Friends of Tonto Natural Bridge, Mountain Village Foundation, Pine Strawberry Business Community, Pine Strawberry Fuels Reduction, AZ Trails Association, RiffRaff Club and the Justice McNeeley Foundation (childrens medical needs charity). We reach out and do all that we can in order to help these and many more groups in the area with fundraising, donations, organizing events and are always happy to give our time!
Cheers!
name: THAT Brewery & Pub

description:
We’ve been making cider for over 100 years and the world around us has changed quite a bit.

With some things we’ve moved with the times, and with others we’ve stuck to what we know to be right. Like recipes and ingredients that have been with us since 1904, or our oak vats that make our cider so distinctive.

These decisions aren’t always easy, a farm and the family who run it are linked by more than just a farmhouse.

Decisions that are made echo down the generations, like how William Thatcher's decision to start making cider over 100 years ago has shaped everything that has happened on the farm since.

Fortunately, to help us find our way we’ve always asked one important question - what’s going to make the best cider?
name: Thatcher's Cider

description:
Our onsite brewery is one of three operated in London by the Laine Brewing Company. Each site has a five brewer’s barrel brewery, which means each time we craft a batch we produce another 1,440 pints. 

Our aim at the brewery is to make consistently great beer using the finest ingredients from around the world, taking inspiration not only from new world styles but also from the great historic styles that made the East End of London the brewing metropolis it was and thankfully still is. 

After fermentation, all the beers are cask conditioned before being dispensed through our hand pumps that span the pub’s attractive long bar just in front of the brewery, guaranteeing a fresh pint every time.
name: The Aeronaut

description: The Alchemist is a 7 barrel brew pub specializing in hand-crafted  beer and casual pub fare.  All of our ales flow directly from our  basement brewery, which was designed and installed by our brewer and  co-proprietor John Kimmich.   We use only the finest imported malts and  domestic hops available to bring you the tastiest and finest selection  of beers in Vermont!
name: The Alchemist

description: Producing the finest hand made beer using our own innovative brewing process, which melds the ancient art of brewing with traditions of wine & champagne production. With great ambition and intention, we open the window to mystery with every fermentation!
name: The Ale Apothecary

description:
When the Rasmussens purchased the building, they thought it would be the perfect place for a brewery. They decided to put the brewery in the basement of the building, allowing for guests to look down into it from the dining room or tour it.

Jason Rasmussen has worked countless hours perfecting the beer and learning the ways of a brewer. He enjoys creating new flavors and learning as much as he can about the art of brewing.

Brewery tours are offered upon request. Or, you can just come taste them all with one of our samplers or growlers!
name: The Angry Minnow

description:
Welcome to the Corner Brewery and Beer Garden! Our operation is sort of like a reverse mullet - with the party up front and the business in the back.
Our public space is a sunny bar and tasting room with a big outdoor beer garden and a covered deck. Behind the scenes, we are a production brewery producing and bottling Arbor Brewing Company brand beers for distribution throughout the state. 

In addition to the beers we brew for distribution, we usually have a few special treats available only on tap at the Corner.
name: The Arbor Corner Brewery

description:
brewery/venue/restaurant/ 
/good people
/nice place to hang
/creative community

--beer makes it better.
name: The Austin Beer Garden Brewing Company

description: Serving fine food and drink to the Sugarloaf area for more than forty years, has often been compared to a fine English pub.  While all affectionate flattery is graciously accepted, and most certainly appreciated, the management harbors certain reservations about being equated with most English pubs, the characteristics of which might not necessarily lend themselves to the western Maine mountain community.  Our prominent, esteemed, and highly experienced research team of Reynolds, Jones, Mulligan and Roy, have recently completed an extensive study of the supposed Anglo phenomenon, has concluded, and can unequivocally substantiate the following...
name: The Bag and Kettle

description: We are a Bakery and Brewpub featuring homemade sourdough breads with awesome, creative sandwich combinations melted between slices of these delicious breads and served with hearty side dish options as well as homemade soups and freshly chopped salads.  Our beers will feature a balanced selection of supremely drinkable session beers designed for those just adventuring into the microbrew scene for the first time, a hearty rotation of big, bold and beautiful masterpieces for the experienced beer drinker and an incredible selection of rarely scene in Summit special guest taps.  As if the wonderful aromas weren’t enough, our amazing views and fun live music will keep you around for another round and constantly coming back for more!
name: The Bakers' Brewery

description: The Barber Shop brewpub is located in downtown Dripping Springs, Texas in a historic building that began life in 1924. In its earliest life, the building served as a garage before later becoming a barber shop. In addition to a well-considered selection of popular local, national, and international beers and wines, we have a tap or two of our own special brews!
name: The Barber Shop

description: The Barking Duck Brewing Co is a NEW brewery to open in Charlotte, NC! Providing a new and fresh approach to craft brewing!
name: The Barking Duck Brewing Co.

description:
The Barnet Brewery is located at the back of The Black Horse pub and our Italian brewer Edo Raimondo brews fantastic real ale ranging from pilsners and light ales to dark rich bitters. The brewing equipment on site are the original tanks from the Federation Brewery in Newcastle Upon Tyne which were scourced from Brendan from Iceni Brewery in located in Norfolk.
Pop in and have a look around the brewery and come and have a chat with Edo who will be more than happy to show you what he does.
name: The Barnet Brewery

description: The Beer Company is a locally owned restaurant and brewery. Our hand crafted brews have fresh ingredients and a great, rich taste. We brew just feet away from where you'll enjoy your quality beer and delicious meal. If you appreciate quality, you'll love The Beer Company.
name: The Beer Company

description:
New York Farm Brewery Tap Room and Market

I brew small, controlled batches using Brew Magic's advanced Recirculating Infusion Mash System (RIMS). The result is smooth, delicious pale, red, stout and medieval gruit ales - or any beer you care to custom order. Each bottle is filled by hand and conditioned at optimum temperatures. In 2012, I received my licenses for Bly Hollow Brewery, d.b.a.The Beer Diviner.
name: The Beer Diviner

description:
The Beer Research Institute is a gathering place where people can meet over a pint and a good meal. The tap list will be ever changing and the food is made from scratch. As the name implies, we will be innovative in our brewing and in the kitchen.

Our focus will be specialty runs of craft beer focusing on aggressive West Coast style American ales and Belgian style ales. We're just a couple of Beer Geeks who like to make great beer! Our kitchen will offer scratch made craft food that will pair perfectly with our unique beer offerings.
name: The Beer Research Institute

description: The Beer'd Brewing Co. is a nano brewery located in Stonington, Connecticut. We will welcome visitors into our tasting room to sample our offerings and purchase half gallon growlers for takeaway. Also an exclusive selection of local bars and restaurants will offer our ales on draft.
name: The Beer'd Brewing Co.

description: The Benjamin Beer Company is dedicated to the passion, art and science of craft brewed beer.
name: The Benjamin Beer Company

description: The Big Cheese Pizza Co. and Brewery is one of the few pizza places in Southern California that brews its own beers. We currently have eight different beers. We also have seasonal beers that will make their debut throughout the year.The preliminary restaurant to sample our product would be the Riverside, CA location which is where we brew our fine product.
name: The Big Cheese Pizza Co. & Brewery

description: “St. Anne, help me! I will become a monk!” Thus cried Martin Luther as a summer thunderstorm bore down on him in Stotternheim, Germany in 1505. These words marked the beginning of a momentous shift in religious history, but as you’re about to see, they led to some great beer, too.
name: The Black Abbey Brewing Company

description: An English style pub with it's own built-in brewery. Four kinds of beer brewed just a few feet from where it's served. Plus hundreds of local and craft beers on cask, tap or bottle.
name: The Blind Pig Brewery

description: A place where visual and performance art are combined with having a good time. A locale for artist's and people who appreciate the arts.
name: The Blue Grasshopper

description: An experimental microbrewery for the Pittsburgh region and beyond. Creating exceptional craft beers for a growing community of people that share our constant sense of curiosity.
name: The Brew Gentlemen Beer Company

description: The BREW Kettle opened its doors in the fall of 1995 as Ohio's First Brew-On-Premise Microbrewery.  From that first day it has been our goal to provide our customers with the guidance, equipment and the freshest ingredients to produce quality, hand-crafted beers in an environment that is professional, safe and fun.  Fourteen years and 35,000 batches later, we are still committed to our customers' needs and desires. We invite you to visit our brewery to have a "look-see", visit with our expert brewing staff, or try brewing a batch from our "tried-and-true" recipe list.  we guarantee you'll be hooked!
name: The Brew Kettle, Taproom and Smokehouse

description: Craft Brewery and Coffee House with a great south faced Brew Garden that is  Dog friendly
name: The Brew on Broadway

description:
Our small batch brewery allows us the flexibility not to be limited by popular fads, current trends or industry pressure in crafting our beers.

Our Brew Masters have been fully empowered so that there are no limits on creativity or style. We only ask that they do what they do best and brew with passion and love. We will also be featuring an impressive selection of guest draft handles and bottle selection to help compliment our own beers.

With a small kitchen onsite, we will be creating a fresh and local menu for our customers with an emphasis on quality ingredients that pair superbly with our brews. We want to create a comfortable and relaxed atmosphere for our customers, so that they can enjoy the environment no matter what time of the day, nor what the occasion is.

The Brewer’s Cabinet will focus on spreading awareness of the local brewing community. We hope to feature local commercial breweries and their great beers, which we hope will lead to a series of collaborative projects in creating new beers. We want a strong local home brewing community, that is part of the brewery, with the invitation to come in and help design beers with our brew masters. We truly want to be a “Brewer’s Cabinet” for the Reno area!
name: The Brewer's Cabinet

description: We are Erie’s exclusive brewpub & restaurant serving up fresh handcrafted ales paired with a unique menu of exceptional quality. Come & join us for a meal in the breathtaking Rotunda. Grab a booth or pull up a stool in the old Tap Room. Maybe you’d like something a little more intimate? How about private balcony seating for two? Or perhaps it’s a thrill you’re seeking? Then join us for summers in the Trackside Beer Garden where you can enjoy a pint of ale as the trains go barreling by.
name: The Brewerie at Union Station

description:
From this country’s very beginning, brewing was commonplace on farms. From the incomparable Oxford Companion to Beer: “Like many gentlemen farmers of his day, Thomas Jefferson’s estate included a brewery.” Radical Brewing, the highly regarded and entertaining source on the history and craft of beer, includes Jefferson’s recipe for “Plug Nickel”, Jefferson’s version of pale ale, and another for George Washington’s “Small Beer” (a recipe Radical Brewing, by the way, calls “crummy”).
It was only the Industrial Revolution and improvements in the transportation of goods that spelled the demise of hand crafted, small batch beers brewed locally on farms, much as they spelled the demise of many farms themselves. This is all a long way around the barn to suggest that brewing beer was an integral part of agriculture as this country once knew it, as opposed to the agribusiness we see today.
Here, we’ve embarked to follow in the footsteps of the founding farmers. As the on-site brewers, the Brewers of Nye Hill Farm, we strive to source local and American ingredients and, of course, our own farm produce. We brew in single barrel batches in our barn-based brewery that overlooks our orchard, pastures and fields, and we’ve aptly named our flagship series of Pale Ales, “Nye P.A.”
name: The Brewers of Nye Hill Farm

description: Handcrafted microbrewing on a 150 year old farm. Live music, large deck and The Vineyard at Hershey all on location.
name: The Brewery at Hershey

description: With 31 taps and over 100 bottles, The BrewHouse is a place to find local, regional, and international beer styles in a casual atmosphere. Focused on staying off the beaten path, grizzled beer geeks and those just learning about craft beer will find something new and different with every visit. Wine is also available and focuses on finding unique offerings, as well. Craft sodas are also part of the beverage lineup.
name: The BrewHouse

description: Brewhouse Tap room Beer and Hard Cider.
name: The Brewhouse Chama New Mexico

description: Lets have fun with beer outdoors, because we don't have much room in the brewery. So come play Disc Golf, Walk in the woods or hang out on the patio where you can enjoy a fresh brew and surf the net.
name: The Brewing Lair

description: Work worth doing. Beer worth brewing.
name: The Brewing Projekt

description:
We're a small craft brewery in the South Bronx, New York and have a maniacal love for two things in this world: beer and the Bronx. Cheers!

The Bronx Brewery is a craft brewer and distributor based in the South Bronx. It launched in 2011 by a small team with two things in common: a maniacal focus on creating high-quality beer and a passion for the Bronx. Its traditionally-crafted ales use only premium and minimally-processed materials to create fresh, bold beer from a borough known for its own uniquely bold character. The team is enthused to bring a rich brewing tradition back to the Bronx and craft a beer that the people of the Bronx and New York City can be proud to call their own.
name: The Bronx Brewery

description:
A boutique craft brewery located in Orange County, California specializing in experimental and barrel aged beer. Our name is a fusion of 'brewery' with our family name, Rue.

Our calling is to create beers with character and depth using the simplest and purest of means. We do not filter or pasteurize our beers. Most of our bottled beers gain carbonation through bottle conditioning, allowing carbonation to naturally occur through a secondary bottle fermentation. We strive to use unconventional ingredients, and we will proudly state what we put in our beers.
name: The Bruery

description: The Byron Bay Brewery Bar / Restaurant is the home of Byron Bay Premium Ale and is one of Byron's newest attractions. Our Pale Larger is now available in Liquor Land, First Choice and Vintage Cellars bottle shops around Australia.
name: The Byron Bay Brewing Co

description:
If the Cannon Brewpub had an old man, it would be Jim Newman. A U.S. Army Ranger, Jim had just returned Stateside from Haiti when he attended a party hosted by Dr. Jack Blalock. At the soiree, he was introduced to a kindred soul named William Gantt. Their conversation soon turned to the quality of beer in Columbus. Needless to say, the tone was bitter and the language seasoned with expletives. When Jim explained that in Oregon, where he came of age, there was a vibrant scene of restaurants and bars that housed their own microbreweries that crafted their own distinct beers that could only be enjoyed at the source, Gantt understandably replied, "$#@*!".

What began as a conversation soon became an obsession and, in 1996, the firm Warner and Worth was incorporated to see their shared dream come true.
name: The Cannon Brewpub

description: Explosive Craft Beer from Caerphilly. A Perfect Range of imperial, one-off series and of course core beers
name: The Celt Experience

description: As a popular gathering place, our pride is in serving American steakhouse classics, paired with the city’s finest handcrafted beers brewed on site. But we are much more than a steakhouse, offering a great experience at an affordable price, with hand-cut chops, fresh seafood and an extensive wine list, all in a unique turn of the century bank transformed into one of Washington’s hot spots.
name: The ChopHouse & Brewery

description: Nestled in historic Lawrenceville, this turn of the century cathedral church turned Brewpub offers a heavenly atmosphere! Enjoy our award winning handcrafted brews and American "Eclectic" cuisine.
name: The Church Brew Works

description: The Collective is Fort Worth's first franken-monster of a brewery.  We're an unholy marriage of production brewery and badass taproom.  Ride your bike down to the near southside and hang out in our taproom, talk beer, play jenga, eat some chips and sample some of our beer you can't get anywhere else.  You can also hop in your gas guzzler and check out the beers at your favorite watering hole.
name: The Collective Brewing Project

description:
The Commons Brewery is a small craft brewery located in Southeast Portland, Oregon. We are inspired by European brewing tradition and Northwest grown ingredients. We take a very hands-on approach to brewing our small batch beers.

The Commons was born as Beetje Brewery in the garage of Mike Wright on a 1 barrel nano system. It did not take long before Mike was dreaming of expanding the operation and upgrading to a true commercial system. That dream was realized with a new space and a new 7bbl system.
name: The Commons Brewery

description:
At The Corner Café and Brewery we are much more than a business that serves great meals.  We are a comfortable corner restaurant with a terrific and unique menu and our own brewery.  Patrons enjoy creative breakfasts, lunches, dinners or excellent wines and amazing hand crafted beers. 

The atmosphere incorporates an eclectic and warm interior with local Lighthouse Center of the Arts member’s paintings.  Our cast of characters at The Corner Café top off the genuinely relaxed and fun experience at this unique and quirky restaurant.
name: The Corner Cafe & Brewery

description:
The Dayton Beer Company is a multiple Award Winning Brewery and was voted  Dayton’s Best Microbrewery in 2014.  Our Pilot Brewery and Taproom is located in Kettering, Ohio.  We are in the process of opening our Production Brewery and Bier Hall in Downtown Dayton.

We are proud to be the first true Microbrewery in the Dayton area in over 50 years. All of our beer is hand-crafted with no automation in small batches with our own unique recipes. This allows us to create beers tailored with our own vision and style.

The Dayton Beer Company remembers all those who came before us and treasure their legacy by naming our core brews after them. Be sure to look for us at your favorite watering holes and retailers. As always, we encourage everyone to stop by our brewery to enjoy the fruits of our labor and relax and have fun in our cozy tap-room.
name: The Dayton Beer Company

description:
The Distillery is an award winning high energy bar and restaurant that offers fantastic ambiance and service for any drinking and dining occasion whether it's business, pleasure or a celebration.
 
We created a restaurant that offers a large selection of draft beers, a diverse menu of American fare, non-stop sports viewing entertainment and play a heady selection of classic rock music on a state-of-the-art audio system to ensure that all the bases are covered. On December 11th, 1980 the original Distillery Restaurant opened on Mt Hope Avenue in Rochester, New York. It quickly became a spot for locals who met over good food and cold beer to discuss the various issues of the day, catch up with friends, make new acquaintances and celebrate life.
name: The Distillery Restaurant

description:
We love beer.

We love it because it tastes good and makes us feel better.

We also love that the very best of beers need not cost the earth. The finest wines may be delicious, but they can cost thousands. Beer is democratic, and always has been through its rich history. 

There is a theory promulgated by folks who have read more books than we have. It runs that man invented agriculture in ancient Sumeria not to feed himself, but to grow grain crops to make beer. This theory would suggest that beer lies at the very root of civilization. Who are we to disagree?

At the Draft House we love to source, cellar and pour the very best beer. And hear a story or two along the way.
name: The Draft House

description: An award winning micro brewery, specializing in Ales, Pilsners, and Stouts
name: The Dreamweaver's Brewery

description: We are a small packaging microbrewery located in Farmville, North Carolina. We sold our first beer in August of 2004. We specialize in beautiful, delicious, full flavored dark beers. When we brew, we’re happy and we dance. During fermentation, we sing softly to the yeast. Please try our beer and enjoy a taste of contentment!
name: The Duck-Rabbit Craft Brewery

description: We're just three dudes who love craft beer, and that's why we're here. Our brewery is located in Torrance—the heart of Southern California's craft beer phenomenon. The Dudes' are focused one creating amazing beers made of the best ingredients we can get our hands on. Thirsty? Let's start a session!
name: The Dudes' Brewing Co.

description: An innovative brewery that specialises in strong, bottle conditioned ales in Durham, North East England.
name: The Durham Brewery

description:
We ain't serious about a lotta things, but beer ain't one of 'em!™ Available in DC, VA, and CA, The Fat Cat™ Beer Company, LLC is dedicated to providing a palate worthy handcrafted beer experience. Iconic packaging, award worthy beer, competitive pricing and an all round good attitude makes us Fat Cat™ indeed.

We believe in maintaining the smallest carbon footprint possible which is why we contract brew our own recipes (a/k/a Statements of Process for all you beer geeks) and why most if not all of our beer is packaged in a can. Our Fat Cat™ Lager was the FIRST handcrafted beer in a can when it made its debut in 1995!
name: The Fat Cat Beer Company

description: The Filling Station Microbrewery is located in the historical railroad depot with beautiful views of the Boardman Lake and directly on the T.A.R.T. bike trail. Our flatbreads and microbrews use the freshest ingredients available. David Cannizzaro, head brewer, uses a 10bbl & 3bbl brewing system which allows him the freedom to create small batches of craft brews in a variety of styles.
name: The Filling Station Microbrewery

description:
Micro brewery in Staten Island, New York.
Unforgettable Beer, Brewed in The Forgotten Borough.
name: The Flagship Brewing Company

description: The Freehouse is the Minneapolis North Loop’s brewpub. We feature a wide selection of handcrafted beers and food that ranges from comfort to unique. We open each day at 6:30am and are open late. Join us from “Breakfast to Beer!”
name: The Freehouse

description: From the heart of the Malvern Hills in rural Worcestershire, Friday Beer brings you a range of bottle-conditioned ales. From Elgar, to radar, to C S Lewis, Malvern has long been associated with excellence, and we strive to continue this tradition, with a relentless focus on quality, flavour and careful design that draws its inspiration from the Malvern Hills Area of Natural Beauty.
name: The Friday Beer

description: Born in the majesty of the Rocky Mountain Front, which also lends us our name, The Front Brewing Company is one on Montana's newest breweries. Located a stone's throw from the beautiful Missouri in the West Bank One development in Great Falls, we began brewing in the summer of 2012. Using Montana's finest barley coupled with only the highest quality speciality malts, hops, yeast, and good clean water we use only the best ingredients in our beer. Our beer's which are unique versions of classic and modern beer styles pay homage to the great brewers of yesterday and today, while inspiring the future. We believe in beer made RIGHT here to be enjoyed anywhere. Cheers
name: The Front Brewing Co.

description: The Gahan House located in historic downtown Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, is Charlottetown's authentic pub specializing in great pub fare and handcrafted ales. Follow us on twitter @gahanpub.
name: The Gahan House

description: Small batch artisan ales, live entertainment, diverse menu specializing in healthy options, artist receptions and art gallery.
name: The Gallery Brewery

description:
We are proud to offer a twist on the classic brewpub; serving handcrafted ales and lagers brewed on premises, providing “food lovers dining” which emphasizes a seasonal menu using local and sustainable ingredients and consistently delivering exceptional service. What more can you ask for?

Also known as Shawnee Craft Brewery
name: The Gem and Keystone

description:
We strive to make fresh, handcrafted, honest beers that can be enjoyed by all.  All of our beer is made within the four walls of our restaurant, which means that when it hits your glass it is the freshest beer you can get.   Our beers are never filtered or pasteurized and are always full of character and flavor.  We brew styles from American and Belgian to anything in between.  We typically brew our beers with four ingredients: malt, hops, yeast and San Antonio water.   However we have been known to add things like coffee, fruit, spices, and anything else that might catch our fancy.

At The Granary we love beer as beer helps to enrich our lives.  We take our beer and food seriously and we hope to politely challenge people’s perspective of how beer can be paired with food.  We believe that every meal that is served can be made better when paired with the right style of beer.  This is not your grandma’s beer.
name: The Granary 'Cue & Brew

description: The Keefe brothers expanded into Toronto in 1991 after starting up the Granite Brewery in Halifax six years prior. Granite Brewery produces a wide variety of brews and is focused on bringing a rich, classic, old English taste to the public palate.
name: The Granite Brewery & Restaurant

description:
The Great Dane Pub & Brewing Company was established by college friends Eliot Butler and Rob LoBreglio. The two dreamed of starting a Brewpub that offered many varieties of house-brewed ales and lagers and hearty made-from-scratch pub fare to accompany the beers. The original Downtown location opened in November 1994 and expanded with the addition of a pool hall in 1996. The wild success of the first Great Dane led to the decision to open more pubs in the Madison area.

The Fitchburg Great Dane began operations in 2002 and the Hilldale pub followed in 2006. In 2009, the Hilldale pub expanded its brewery and opened a 4,000 square foot pool hall. Additionally, in May of 2009, the first Great Dane outside of the Madison area debuted in Wausau, Wisconsin. The Wausau Great Dane added a 100 seat beer garden and outdoor bar in the spring of 2011. In November 2010, the fifth Great Dane began operations in Grandview commons, off of Cottage Grove Road on Madison's east side.
name: The Great Dane Pub & Brewing Company

description: The Grifter Brewing Company began in early 2012 when three home brewers were given the opportunity to take their recipes from the backyard, to a brand new shiny stainless steel brewery in Sydney’s Inner-west.  Since then the three have been honing their skills and unleashing their hand crafted ales across Sydney & Australia. Quality over quantity is always the motto as they focus on producing unique beers that remain highly drinkable. No corners are cut with the use of high quality ingredients and traditional brewing methods.
name: The Grifter Brewing Co

description: Serving Beer, Cheer and Food in Mt. Horeb, WI. 12 handcrafted beers on tap.
name: The Grumpy Troll Restaurant and Brewery
The Hearthstone Grill & Small Batch Brewery

description: Good rotating selection of beers from distinct breweries. Good food as well.
name: The Hop Yard

description: Ilkley Brewery was re-established in the town after a gap of nearly 100 years in 2009. We have a clear philosophy - to brew world class beers distinctive in style, flavour and character. When we say we are passionate about beer, we mean REALLY passionate and this is clearly expressed in our award winning range of beers and ales. Our philosophy starts with the raw materials we use, water from The Yorkshire Dales, the finest English malted barley and hops, sourced by our brewer from all over the world. We let those simple ingredients speak for themselves and combine them with skill and patience to brew beers that are balanced, exceptional and just
name: The Ilkley Brewery Co.

description: As Denton's first craft brewery, we hope to brew great beer and bring it to everyone we can!
name: The Independent Ale Works Company

description: Interesting eclectic taproom, awesome deck, sweet view of the hardware and great beer.
name: The Industrial Revolution Brewing Company

description: The brewery springs from the need to have more good beer. Beer deserving of a certain attention. Beer that forces you to confront and consider what you are drinking. Upfront hops, lingering bitternesses, warming alcohols, bodies of malt. Lengths and depths of flavour. We make Pale Ales, India Pale Ales and old school London Porters and Stouts towards these ends. Bottled alive, to give them time to grow.
name: The Kernel Brewery

description:
The Kingston Brewing Company is Ontario's oldest brew pub, established in 1986, and is Canada's oldest wine-producing pub. Beers, wines, ciders and soda pops are made on the premises.

Food is pub standard with unique twists with beer used in many of the recipes. A courtyard and street-front patio, as well as a banquet room (known as the Dragon's Lair), makes this pub is a must visit.

A large collection of beer memorabilia and pub photos will also keep your eyes busy for days and inspire more than a few conversations. The building itself is an 1800's-era brick and stone — originally used as a telegraph office — and the original vaults are still in use.
name: The Kingston Brewing Company

description: The first and only brewpub in legendary downtown Sturgis, SD. We opened our doors in July 2014 and are open 7 days a week. We are brewing on a 10 BBL system and distribute kegs throughout SD. We offer 5 year round beers as well as several rotating selections. The kitchen is open thru lunch and dinner and serves up some great food.
name: The Knuckle Brewing Company

description:
Beer. Food. Music. It is based on these fundamental ingredients - the trifecta of entertainment - that The LAB Brewing Co. was born.  We take them all -- our beer, our food, and our music-- equally seriously. And we take great effort to combine them all to create a haven for all who share our appreciation for drinking, eating and being merry.

Beer lovers rejoice. With more than 25 handpicked microbrews on tap we have you covered. And that’s before adding our house brews, handcrafted by our brewmaster on site to the mix. From the aggressively hopped IPA Bad Influence to the oh-so-strong Take Her Home Belgian Tripel, our house brews not only pack a punch, but they are sure to awaken your taste buds. Beer aficionados and casual drinkers are encouraged to seek out our head brewer Roger for a tour of the premises or to talk shop.

Large stunning copper fermentation vessels align the restaurant and contribute to a unique dining experience. The setting is a perfect match for our eclectic American cuisine. Menu favorites include BBQ duck quesadilla, white lasagna and Alaskan cod in a hazelnut sage brown butter sauce. No, this isn’t your typical “bar food” – though the LAB Burger is to die for. Everything is fresh farm to table.
name: The Lab Brewing Company

description: We are Portland’s only craft beer brew lab. We support the creativity of local brewers, creating limited edition small batch brews in our 3.5-bbl Hopmaster system from Portland Kettle Works. Come in to taste batches of every recipe brewed on-site.
name: The Labrewatory
The Library Restaurant and Brew Pub

description:
We’re a craft brewery that produces premium beer in small batches where quality, not quantity, is our main concern. We produce beer with flavour and aroma. It’s that simple.

We don’t compromise on ingredients and we make sure that they are plentiful in each batch. We couldn’t make the beer we are passionate about if we cut corners. Yep, we admit to being just a little bit fussy.
name: The Little Brewing Company

description: Over one hundred years ago, the building known as the Palace Livery provided a vital service making it a unique gathering place for residents of and travelers to Southwest Michigan. This former horse stable has been brought back to life as The Livery. Located at 190 5th street, in the Arts District of downtown Benton Harbor, Michigan, the Livery features 12 taps of "Hand-Forged Microbrew", 2 Real Ale taps, an outdoor bier garden, free WIFI, and a Café serving great food. Music and other live entertainment are regularly featured in The Upper Livery entertainment venue. You must be age 21 or older to enter The Livery. People under age 21 must be accompanied by parent or legal guardian.
name: The Livery

description: The Lone Wolfe Brewing Co., is a one-man, one-barrel, sustainable nano-brewery, located in the heart of downtown Wolfeboro, NH. Dedicated to brewing hand-crafted, small batch ales, the brewery features a tasting room, with an ever-rotating tap list.
name: The Lone Wolfe Brewing Co.

description: Founded in 2006, Port Brewing and The Lost Abbey produce an extensive line-up of continental and American- inspired ales and lagers. Under the direction of visionary brewmaster and co-founder Tomme Arthur, the brewery has garnered dozens of awards in its seven-year history including the 2007 Great American Beer Festival Small Brewery of the Year, The 2008 world Beer Cup Champion Small Brewery and the 2013 Champion Brewery at the San Diego International Beer Festival. The company’s beers, many of which are aged in oak barrels for 12 months or longer, are universally recognized for their complexity, unique flavors and bold boundary-pushing styles.
name: The Lost Abbey

description: The Lost Borough Brewing Company is the realization of a dream for three life long friends Dave Finger, James Meyer and Dan Western in search of the perfect pint of craft beer brewed right here in the Rochester. After years of experimentation with all styles of artisan beers we have decided to leave our mark by opening a local brewery where we can share our passion with others and provide truly difference craft beer experience.
name: The Lost Borough Brewing Co.

description:
A family-friendly restaurant featuring Prime beef burgers, thin-crust pizza, and craft-brewed beers, including 6 brewed on the premises.

When you name your restaurant after Trappist monks who've spent centuries perfecting their craft, you're serious about your beer. That's why we hired a master to craft our house brews, and why our beer list spans the globe. With everything from refreshing pilsners that match the lightness of our thin-crust pizza to dark, rich ales that stand up to our decadent burgers, you're certain to find a new favorite at The Lucky Monk. We're sure that our Prime beef burgers — served with hand-cut fries — will be the juiciest you've ever had. Our other house specialty, pizza, is crisp and generously topped with fresh ingredients. And we round out our menu with vibrant, flavorful salads; a handful of classic, satisfying American entrées; and some sweet surprises.

Whether you're settling in at our bar or relaxing with your friends and family in our comfortable dining room, our delicious food and drink and warm welcome are sure to elevate your soul.
name: The Lucky Monk

description:
The Mansfield Brewing Company is a small batch brewery that produces high quality craft beers for the discerning drinker.
The Mansfield Brewing Company produces premium, naturally brewed beer.
Made with the finest quality malted grains and hops, producing refreshing beers with hop aromas and malt flavours. Our beer is naturally brewed, with no preservatives or additives. Bottle-conditioned beer may contain a small amount of sediment.  Like our Pale Ale brewed with a portion of Crystal malt along with dry hopping late in the fermentation makes for a refreshing beer with hoppy aromas and malty flavours.
name: The Mansfield Brewing Company

description: We use no preservatives and only the finest ingredients at our on-site microbrewery: malted barley, hops, yeast and pure water. Our beer begins in our grain silo out front, is converted into "mash" with the addition of water, then ferments and ages in our custom-designed brewhouse—assuring our customers will receive the freshest pint possible. And there are seven ways to try our award-winning brews: by the pint (16 oz.), by the half yard (25 oz.), by the pitcher (64 oz.), by the hopper (116 oz. mini-keg), by the Mini Mash (any four beers on tap), by the Mondo Mash (4 oz. glasses of each of our 9 drafts), or by the Growler (take it to go!)
name: The Mash House Brewery & Chophouse

description: Located in the heart of Hagåtña, the Mermaid Tavern & Grille is Guam's only brewpub restaurant, serving daily specials and Guam's only locally brewed beers.
name: The Mermaid Tavern & Grille at The Great Deep Brewing Co.

description: The Mitten Brewing Co. is a new, vintage baseball-themed nanobrewery that expertly pairs handcrafted beers with gourmet pizzas.
name: The Mitten Brewing Co

description: The Monk's Cellar is a Belgian/European inspired pub specializing in Belgian and British style beer and food.
name: The Monk's Cellar

description: The Noble Pig Brewhouse is Kamloops' first and only Microbrewery that combines house made craft brewed beer and a unique beer fusion cuisine. It is an unpretentious neighborhood spot in a welcoming, comfortable atmosphere.
name: The Noble Pig

description: We brew a variety of beers ranging from classic to extreme. We also have a home brew supply shop at our place that has the best prices in town. We will also special order for you.
name: The North Brewery

description: The Oak Brewery is a pico brewery located just outside Brussels, in Tervuren. Started 8 years ago by two beer geeks, it has resumed activity in 2012.
