description: VonScheidt Brewing Co. is Twin Falls' home town pub & brewery. Featuring the best live music in the Magic Valley and local beers brewed in house by brewmaster Pat VonScheidt. Delicious food is served daily and we're open till the last cat leaves!
name: Von Scheidt Brewing Company

description:
More than a decade ago Johannes von Trapp started thinking about brewing his own beer, for guests of the resort. His dream was to produce an American version of the tasty Lager he has enjoyed over the years on his trips to the countryside near his ancestral Austrian home. 

Johannes' dream became reality in the Spring of 2010, with the opening of the Trapp Family Brewery. The modest facility (60,000 or so gallons a year) is located in the lower level of the DeliBakery (formerly the Austrian Tea Room), where draughts of the heavenly concoction will be available year round.
name: Von Trapp Brewing

description: Brewers of Artisan Beer Styles and is not a brewpub.
name: Voodoo Brewing Company

description: We are bringing back the Craft in German Lager's here in the United States. Keeping it exclusive and tasty per every batch we create.
name: W Brewing

description: Wabash Brewing is a small craft brewery that focuses on fusing art with science to make truly great beers.  New Brewery for a New Year! We will be opening on January 2nd from 1 - 9 PM.  Join us for our opening day with $10 growlers and $5 pints.  We will have all four of our core beers on tap, as well as a few early stage R&D beers!
name: Wabash Brewing

description: St. Paul’s first craft brewery to open on the west side of St. Paul, just a stones-throw from the Wabasha Caves. Come on in, enjoy a pint and take a growler of your favorite brew home with you.
name: Wabasha Brewing Company

description: History Wachusett Brewery founders Ned, Kevin and Peter developed a significant appreciation for beer while attending Worcester Polytechnic Institute. Adventures in biking, canoeing, and hiking that led the trio to the northern New England states allowed them to visit some of the first operating craft breweries. Armed with a we can do this attitude the three cast off from their careers in engineering and biology to found the Wachusett Brewing Co. in 1993. Wachusett Country Ale was introduced to beer fans of Massachusetts the next year after lots of experimenting to get the formula just right. When Wachusett opened, the three designed and built most of the equipment; did the brewing and filling, selling and delivering, and everything else that a small startup brewery needed. Ned, Kevin and Peter are now backed by some of the most passionate and capable co-workers in the industry. Wachusett Ales continue to be hand crafted with the finest ingredients available, bottled and kegged in our Westminster facility. The three have never strayed from their plan to brew and sell the freshest, highest quality beers possible.
name: Wachusett Brewing Company

description: The Wacker Brewing Company is reborn, a symbol of both Lancaster's rich brewing heritage and the industry's resurgence.
name: Wacker Brewing Company

description: WBC was founded by two families with an entrepreneurial spirit and a love of craft beers. Waconia Brewing started as many breweries have, with the gift of a home brewing kit which fueled a dream to take their passions to the next level. WBC is the realization of that dream, created for all to enjoy. Our taproom features 4 namesake beers in constant supply as well as ever-changing seasonal selections and limited edition specialty brews available by the glass or to take with you in one of our growlers.
name: Waconia Brewing Company

description: Our Brewpub & Grille in the Five Mile area is named after legend Rube Waddell, the eccentric baseball pitcher with a wicked curve and a blazing fastball, Waddell’s Brewpub & Grille is proud to offer Spokane’s Best Draft selection! Pouring some of the best Craft Brew’s in the Inland Northwest as well as our own beers brewed right here at our restaurant. Waddell’s is always rotating over 80% of our 50 tap handle line up. If IPA’s are what you crave then look no further then here with over 15 hoppy IPA’s on hand. Great brew’s, food and friends what every pub wish they had. Come to Waddell’s where you can meet new friend’s and buy your old mate’s a proper pint. Cheer’s!
name: Waddell's Brewing Co.

description: Waganupa Brewing is a nano-brewery, hand crafting small batches of premium artisanal beer, only days fresh and made entirely in Chester.
name: Waganupa Brewing

description:
Welcome to Wagner Valley Brewing Company, established in 1997. We are a small craft-brewing operation located in the Finger Lakes region of western New York. 

The brew system at Wagner's is an imported 20-BBL German-style, steam fired, four-vessel brew house, specifically designed for decoction mashing.

Wagner Valley Brewing Company is unique by adhering to the Reinheitsgebot of 1516, a German Purity Law that states: "Only the finest Malt, Hops, Yeast and Water can be used in the production of beer". This quality standard, used for our standard beers, in conjunction with with our Brewers' talent has resulted in Wagner Valley Brewing continuously winning the most prestigious of brewing awards, capturing numerous G.A.B.F., World Beer Cup and Tap New York medals.
name: Wagner Valley Brewing Company

description: Waikiki's first ever brewery!
name: Waikiki Brewing Company

description: The sum of experiences between John and James means a variety of beers including ales, pale ales, stouts and IPAS. Sometimes, a dry hard cider will make an appearance. The Wakarusa Brewery will offer a few flagship beers with a mix of crafted seasonals.
name: Wakarusa Brewery

description: Wakonda is the central Oregon Coast's very own nano-brewery located in beautiful Florence, Oregon.
name: Wakonda Brewing Co

description: For over 180 years beer has been brewed in Königseggwald. 1820 was built by the Earl of Königsegg the "Counts Königsegg'sche brewery". In 1874, the brewer Fridolin Härle acquired the brewery. Between 1874 and 2003, the privately owned brewery was the families Härle. In 2003, over 1,200 shareholders, the brewery saved from closure and founded the KING EGGER WALDER BRÄU AG.
name: Walder Bräu

description:
Walkabout Brewing Company was established in 1997 in Central Point, Oregon by founder and head brewer, Ross Litton. A native of Perth, Australia, Ross has been a resident of Oregon for 21 years.

Walkabout brews have traditionally been available primarily in Southern Oregon; however distribution has now been expanded to include all Oregon and Southern Washington. The beers can be found on draft in bars and restaurants and in bottles at stores and markets.

 Walkabout bottles Worker's Pale Ale, Jabberwocky Strong Ale and Point the Bone IPA in 22oz bottles. Walkabout is distributed by Point Blank Distributing in Portland, Bend and the Willamette Valley, Summit Distributing in Southern Oregon, Bigfoot Distributing on the Oregon coast and by Alpha Distributing in Washington State.

Walkabout products are brewed in a 7 barrel brew house in Medford, Oregon. The brewery is not only a manufacturing facility but houses a tasting room with a large patio and outdoor area, dock sales are available.
name: Walkabout Brewing Company

description: Walkerville Brewery is a well appointed microbrewery located in the City of Windsor in a district known by locals as Walkerville. Situated within the area developed by Hiram Walker over 150 years ago, we are proud to compliment our neighbours, the C.C. Brand Centre and Pernod Ricard to form this modern day distillery district. The brewery occupies an 18,000 square foot building once known as “Surge Plant 16” and is located only blocks away from the original Walkerville Brewing Company established in 1890. Walkerville Brewery aims to be the social fabric of its community by creating a culture that best exemplifies our community-minded conscience. Through the development and creation of quality beers, we aim to identify then satisfy the needs of our diverse target markets. By handcrafting unique styles in small batches using only quality barley, hops and pure water, we will deliver fresh flavourful beers to our customers. Operating under high quality assurance standards, professional production, outstanding sales support and market deliverables, we aim to grow our market from its core of Windsor/Essex and develop outward as demand dictates.
name: Walkerville Brewery

description:
Wallace Brewing Company, 15-barrel microbrewery, began selling its beer in January 2009, in historic Wallace, Idaho.

A collaborative effort of Wallace’s Chase Sanborn, Dean Cooper, Rick Magnuson and the Zanettis, the brewery pays homage to the town’s notorious past, creating a brand of beers with mining and bordello-inspired monikers such as ‘Dirty Blonde’, ‘Jackleg Stout’, ‘RedLight Irish Red Ale’, and ‘Idaho Select Light Lager’ .

“We want to brew in the honest spirit of the mining heritage,” General Manager, Chase Sanborn said. “It’s not only the prevailing reputation of the town, but also one that can elevate the Wallace Brewing brand.
name: Wallace Brewing Company

description:
Boulder's Original Brewpub and winner of multiple Great American Beer Festival® awards including the 2008 Silver Medal & 2010 Gold Medal in the "English-Style Dark Mild Ale or Brown Ale" categories for "Old Elk Brown Ale"

We are located in the heart of downtown Boulder with great food, great service & great people!
name: Walnut Brewery

description: For 100 years, Walter’s Beer was as much a family tradition as it was a refreshing malt beverage. The Walters family toiled through fires, Prohibition and fierce competition to deliver the classic recipe that gave generations of beer enthusiasts a reason to relax at the end of the day. Your time has come to experience this bold, historic brew.
name: Walter's Beer

description: Wander Brewing is a production craft brewery located in Bellingham, WA. Wander was created to produce both traditional and innovative ales and lagers while maintaining our commitment to sustainable practices in our community.
name: Wander Brewing

description: Local Flagstaff, Arizona microbrewery with an insatiable lust for exploring the world around us through fermented delights.
name: Wanderlust Brewing Company

description: The most no-nonsense member of the 3 Brothers family, stepping into War Horse Brewing Co. is like stepping back in time into a WWII pilots hangout. WE WANT YOU to join us for a cold one at War Horse Brewing Company.
name: War Horse Brewing Company

description: Dayton based craft brewery committed to brewing proprietary beer styles and warped interpretations of existing styles.
name: Warped Wing Brewing

description:
Our hand-welded brewery has the capacity to brew 250,000 liters of beer per year. Everything that can be manually operated on this scale is in fact done manually. This gives our Head brewer Kyle Wolak and Assistant brewer Lan-Xin Foo the opportunity to refine the beers down to the smallest details.
When two front-runners like 3Floyds and Mikkeller team up, it means there are no compromises made on anything.
name: Warpigs

description: The Warsteiner Brewery was founded in 1753, and today is one of the largest privately held breweries in Germany. Its flagship is the Warsteiner brand, one of Germany’s leading premium pilsener brands.
name: Warsteiner Brauerei

description: Wasatch Beers (Schirf Brewing Company) was formed when Greg Schirf found his way to Utah from Milwaukee,America’s beer capital, only todiscover that his newly adopted home state did not have a brewery of its own. Recognizing a need and an opportunity, he committed to rectify this situation. In 1986, Schirf opened the first brewery in the resort town of Park City and named his beers after the majestic Wasatch Mountains that rise just east of Salt Lake City. In July 1989, Schirf Brewing opened its new company headquarters and the first brew pub in Utah at the top of historic Main Street in Park City.
name: Wasatch Brewery

description:
The color of this cider is a beautiful pale-straw while the delicious aromas and flavors are robust and balanced as you would expect from the cool climate orchards of eastern Washington. Fragrant apple pie and fermented apple notes form a great presentation. 

As you sip this cider, imagine yourself among the apple trees during the fall harvest. This cider matches perfectly with seafood and poultry and would complement fruit salads as well. It also pairs nicely with cold sandwiches, fresh fruits or served slightly warmed with a dash of cinnamon on a chilly evening. 

One to three years of cellar potential exist with this still (non-carbonated) cider.
name: Washington Gold Hard Cider

description: Wasserhund Brewing Company, meaning "water dog" in German, was born from a love of the beach, dogs, and German beer. We aspire to bring the German beer culture to Virginia Beach in the best way... by brewing the highest quality ales, lagers, and meads and providing the environment to enjoy them with family, friends, and strangers.
name: Wasserhund Brewing Company

description: Welcome to Watch City Brewing Company. As both a restaurant and brewery it is at the core of a vibrant dining scene in the Metrowest. Since 1996 it has consistently provided its customers with fresh, handcrafted beer and intensely appetizing and delicious meals. Watch City beer is highly regarded on both a local and national level, winning distinctions for a number of the styles produced at it’s Moody St. locale. Much like the jeweled pocket watches this city once manufactured, there’s a professional respect for the craftmanship of it’s Brew Master, Aaron Mateychuk. The beer is always satisfying and never sparing for flavor or character.
name: Watch City Brewing Company

description:
We love brewing. We offer high quality craft beer, brewed on premises and
served directly from our tanks. Our patrons feel like they’re in the middle of a brewery...because they are. On brew day and during fermentation you will experience all the wonderful sites, smells and sounds of the brewing process.

You will find familiar and not-so-familiar styles on tap. We like to keep things interesting—there’s always something new. While somewhat conservative in the big tanks you never know what we'll put on tap for small batches. Toasted coconut stout anyone?
name: Water Street Brewing Co.

description: (No longer brewing)
name: Water Tower Brewing

description: Coming in 2015 to downtown Wilmington, North Carolina. Great Beer Brewed Here! A cozy industrial area off Front Street, where Art and Beer converge.
name: Waterline Brewing Company

description: Great People! Great Fun! Great Beer! Private, exclusive brewpub. Not open to the general public. Admission only to members and their guests. Membership by invitation only. No exceptions, ever. Trespassers will be shot. Survivors will be shot again.
name: Waterway Brewing Company

description: Located at 236 Main St. Vista, CA 92084.  Head Brewer James Petti was formerly with Karl Strauss.  Opened December of 2014 with 6 beers on tap.  3BBL direct fire system.
name: Wavelength Brewing Company

description:
We're restless, investigators and even crazy sometimes.

We don't settle with things the way they are.

The tireless search for new ideas, new recipes and new ways of making beer is what drives us.

We question methods, contest and challenge the traditional techniques of production. Innovation is always present in everything we do. We don't rest until we deliver the best beer possible.
name: Way Beer

description: The Society was established for the promotion of knowledge and interest in Craft Beers and Heritage Ales, and to establish a commercially viable microbrewery that will employ local people in Nova Scotia. We intend to make the very best beer in Nova Scotia, we will be supporting our local economy and we will be bringing alive the heritage of a noble and honorable profession again.  For an honest beer makes its own friends and our beers and ales will be very honest, living up to the flavor and taste that our Braumeister and brew-team demand.
name: Wayfarers' Ale Society

description:
The Wayward Brewing Company is a new craft brewery that is currently being established in the once grungy, but now trendy, inner-west part of Sydney Australia.

Our philosophy is all about brewing great beers that don't always fit with traditional styles. Someone once said that Wayward meant "being lost, but on purpose".

We might not have our own brewery space (yet), but all of our beers are created by us and we take 100% responsibility for the product that ends up in your glass.

We happily admit that we are beer geeks, but we’re definitely not trying to prove we are more clever than the next brewer by designing the wackiest beer that only our fellow beer geeks will appreciate. We believe there is a fine line between different and undrinkable and are happy being on the more drinkable side of that line. We can't promise that we will never stray into more odd concoctions, but we'll warn you if we do.

As well as being beer nuts, we're food nuts too. Wayward beers are great on their own or we think even better served with food.
name: Wayward Brewing

description:
Founded by Jay and Lori Wince in 2006 Weasel Boy Brewing Company began brewing operations in July of 2007. The brewpub brews mostly traditional style ales specializing in well balanced session strength offerings. 
Winners of GABF medals in both 2010 (bronze) and 2012 (gold) for their Anastasia Russian Imperial Stout, Weasel Boy is well recognized for brewing high quality products. 
The brewpub offers artisan pizza made with fresh local ingredients, supports local art and music, and regularly participates in community events benefiting local causes.
name: Weasel Boy Brewing Company

description:
The Wedge Brewing Co. is located in the lower level of the Wedge Studios situated in the River Arts District of Asheville, N.C. The building is a classic brick warehouse adjacent  to the railroad tracks. The original use of the structure was probably as a food warehouse. The space the brewery is in at onetime stored slaughtered hogs.

We chose this location because it is in the last frontier of Asheville.

We chose this specific space because it is a perfect fit for our brewing system and gives us great outdoor potential.
name: Wedge Brewing Company

description:
The Weeping Radish is the Oldest Microbrewery in North Carolina. 25 years ago it was illegal for breweries to sell their own beer directly to consumers; they had to go through a distributor. This made it impossible for microbreweries or small brewpubs to exist. In 1985 Uli Bennewitz went to his local senator and together they passed a bill allowing microbreweries to sell their own beer on site. A year later on the July 4th, 1986 the Weeping Radish Brewery opened for business. 
 
Raised in a small village in Bavaria, Uli was determined to bring the high quality beer he was used to across the ocean to North Carolina. A Master Brewer came over from Germany and brewed the first batches of Corolla Gold, Fest, and Black Radish. Strictly adhering to the Reinheitsgebot Purity Law of 1516, all Weeping Radish beers are brewed using hops, malt, yeast and water â€“ no additives, chemicals or preservatives. 
 
Our beer list has expanded over the years and currently on draft in the pub we have the OBX KÃ¶lsch, IPA 25, and Radler as well as our original Corolla Gold, Fest and Black Radish. And for those of you with a sweet tooth we make a fantastic Root Beer!
name: Weeping Radish Farm Brewery

description:
Weird Beard Brew Co are two award-winning homebrewers wanting to take their passion for drinking and creating great hand-crafted beers out of the kitchen and beyond the garage.

After winning prizes in homebrew competitions at both the local and national level, coupled with great feedback from fellow beer geeks, Gregg and Bryan made the decision to take this passion to the next level and go pro.

No gimmicks, no crap and never knowingly under hopped. Just great hand-crafted beer brewed in West London with the best ingredients, knowledge, and respect for process, and a little insanity.

But why stop there? We don’t believe in being stereotyped. We love upfront in-your-face hop focused beers, but are we only going to brew these? Hell no! We love beer, and we will brew whatever we want, whenever it suits us.

At Weird Beard we aim to continue making experimental, no-holds-barred beers that we feel excited about and we want to drink.

Inspired by the American and burgeoning British craft beer movement, along with great music, exquisite food, epic beards, and the outstanding beer community in our hometown of London, Weird Beard Brew Co will not compromise on anything to bring the best flavours to the beer, whether it is the roasted specialty grains in a stout or the newest hops in an IPA. We create beers that push the boundaries of style, forcing the consumer to stop and think about the drink in front of them, to confront the misconceptions of what ale and beer should or can be, and who drinks it? 

And before you ask, yes, Gregg and Bryan do sport some very impressive facial hair. Here at Weird Beard Brew Co we are all about the beards, but not so much the sandals. We are passionate about good beer, no matter where it comes from or how it is dispensed. You will find us in bottle shops, on cask in real ale pubs and in the best London beer bars on keg.

Weird Beard Brew Co is a full on, no compromise brewery, brewing great tasting and genre-busting beers...hold on to your taste buds and come along for the ride!
name: Weird Beard Brew Co.

description: Welde represents authentic, independent brewing and the pleasure of exclusive beer. For over 260 years, our brewery in Baden has used the best raw materials, traditional craftsmanship and innovative ideas to create first-rate beers. Beers as they should be: perfectly crafted and with a unique taste.
name: Weldebräu GmbH & Co. KG

description: WeldWerks Brewing Company is a locally owned and operated craft brewery which opened in downtown Greeley, Colorado in late February, 2015. We execute our unique and original product line with the highest quality ingredients, a state-of-the-art brewing system, and the newest brewing practices. We select malt, hops, and yeast to suit each recipe specifically, using the best ingredients available.
name: WeldWerks Brewing Co.

description:
Wellington Brewery in Guelph has brewed its fine ales and lagers since 1985. The brewery's architecture imitates that of a traditional 'oast house,' a building once built especially for drying and packing hops, a key ingredient in Wellington's select recipes. The brewery, named after the first Duke of Wellington, uses natural ingredients and patient brewing methods to produce ales of timeless distinction, not unlike the Duke himself. 
Wellington Brewery is proud to be celebrating 25 years of craft brewing in 2010. Please visit our website to find out all the exciting things we will be doing this year to celebrate our 25th Anniversary!
name: Wellington Brewery

description:
Wells and Young's Brewing Company is the epitome of all-round business excellence, demonstrating sustained growth for its beers and stockists whilst combining traditional family values with innovation and development. 

Firmly placed as the UK's largest private brewing company, it is fiercely independent, and with an enviable portfolio of some of the UK's most loved cask beers and speciality lager brands.
name: Wells and Young's Brewing Company

description: A local, small town, small batch Micro-brewery started by two guys with a dream. Many styles of beer will be brewed and made available to the public for the purpose of information and enjoyment. We can't sell the beer yet, yet. We intend to start selling soon though...
name: WelznGarnr

description:
Owned and operated by Brandon and Amanda Wright, Chicago Brew Werks and Werk Force Brewing are driven by a true passion for craft beer and community. Chicago Brew Werks is a full service brewing supply shop with a retail location in Plainfield, IL and web orders ship nationally. We are proud to hold the the Midwest’s largest selection of malted grains and we are the exclusive hops dealer in Chicagoland for Hop Head Farms. From the first time homebrewer to the professional, find everything you need to take your beer to the next level at Chicago Brew Werks.

With a foundation in homebrewing, Werk Force Brewing produces unique batches created by outside-of-the-box thinking. Utilizing the extensive ingredient selection available at Chicago Brew Werks, Werk Force Brewing stays on the cusp of the industry by brewing with experimental hops and yeast strains. Currently, Werk Force brews are available in house through our Tap Room.
name: Werk Force Brewing Co.

description:
Based in West Bend WI Lithia is committed to brewing quality beer to benefit the community. The Beer That Made Milwaukee Jealous!

In the Lithia Beer spirit and tradition, Lithia is based not only on the finest natural, quality ingredients and processes, but also on extremely pure, hand-crafted, mineral-containing water. West Bend Lithia Beer  is a serious beer drinker’s beer, not a chemically concocted, watered down, commodity beer...it’s simply more beer and less water. Lithia Beer contains no corn or rice grains. 

Only the finest hops, and slow roasted, as well as other malts, are utilized. A true pre-Prohibition brew. Lithia Beer is serious beer for serious beer drinkers.

“A great beer that’s 
great for the community too” ™

Recreating the Lithia Beer line, as with all good brews, will be a work in progress. Our first brew, Regner Red, a great Rich, Crisp & Creamy Style Red Ale, a very smooth, drinkable brew, was developed in the great spirit of Lithia beer of the past before prohibition. Popular tastes in beer have changed and matured, as have the brewing process and ingredients. We have chosen to develop extremely high quality, natural beers that will be popular with the sophisticated customers of our time and in our community. We utilized the same process to roll out other Lithia Premium Beers such as Bucky Blonde Ale, arguably the most complex, richest blonde beer ever brewed.

Most importantly, Lithia Beer will again, and exclusively, be based in West Bend & Washington County, where it belongs. It’s heritage will now continue to benefit our community for hopefully, the next hundred years. A portion of Lithia Beer proceeds are donated to The Museum of Wisconsin Art, The Washington County Historical & Humane
Society’s, and rebuilding Regner Park plus many other area charities.
name: West Bend Lithia Beer Company

description:
WEST is a brewery, bar and restaurant situated in the Templeton Building on Glasgow Green. 

WEST is the first UK brewery to produce all of its beers in accordance with the Reinheitsgebot, known as the German Purity Law. This means that we only use the four core ingredients, water, malt, hops and yeast in brewing all of our beers, adding no artificial additives, colouring or preservatives. The rich complexity and diverse range of flavours in our beers comes from pure ingredients, expertly brewed, with no shortcuts. 

WEST Brewery. Glaswegian Heart. German Head.
name: West Brewery

description:
West County Cider continues the centuries-old cider making tradition and adds some modern refinements.

We provide a wide variety of hard ciders for the table, from very dry to sweet. Some have a champagne-like flavor, while others are more robust with tannins from traditional American and European cider apples.

We use fruit from our own orchard of traditional and untraditional cider varieties as well as apples grown by other New England orchards. Commercial yeast is added; occasionally we use the wild yeast on the apples. West County Ciders stand out by the simplicity of our ingredients: whole apples, a little yeast, and a bit of sulfite (found in nearly all wines). No sugars, water, flavorings, sorbate, carbon dioxide, or concentrates are used in any of our ciders, allowing for a crisp, clean apple taste in every bottle.
name: West County Cider

description: Our passion is making high quality craft beer, so we built a state of the art brewery in West Okoboji, Iowa. We have access to some of the best water in the world, and it's a quality you can taste.
name: West O Beer

description:
West Sixth Brewing founders Ben, Brady, Joe, and Robin all came to the same conclusion at about the same time – Lexington, KY needs more high quality local craft beer. Since we came from very different backgrounds with diverse sets of experiences and talents, we joined forces to create beer that can be enjoyed not only by craft beer experts, but also by those who just want something tasty to drink after going for a bike ride.

Though we all got to this point in our lives in different ways, we strongly agree on West Sixth’s goals. We will provide a taproom and beer garden where the beer list is never the same but that is always local. We will be a brewery that measures its success not only by making great craft beer but also by how it helps our community. We will always strive to protect our environment even if it costs us more to do so. And last, but not least, we all share a desire to create the best beer possible and to be an integral part of building a great beer culture for our great town.
name: West Sixth Brewing

description: We are on our final steps to get started and we are very excited. We will have a couple of different beers to choose from. We will also have beer kegs for rent for parties,weddings,restaurants, etc.
name: Westbend Vineyards & Brewhouse

description: Westbrook Brewing is a new craft brewery in Mt. Pleasant, SC. Our mission is to make the most interesting, drinkable, and generally awesome beer possible. We love experimenting with different ingredients and brewing techniques, and we hope you’ll have as much fun drinking our beer as we do making it.
name: Westbrook Brewing Company

description: Oroville's first micro-brewery.
name: Western Pacific Brewing

description:
WRBC beers will be available at local bars, restaurants, and retail stores. Please check back frequently for updates on where you can purchase our tasty brews. 

We will also hold brewery tours with tastings on Friday evenings and Saturday afternoons, two weekends each month. Please check back for updates on when the tours will begin.
name: Westfield River Brewing Company

description: Imagine a little, community-focused brewery looking to make thirsty neighbors and friends a great product, then find it tucked away in a casual, friendly setting and you are at the Westminster Brewing Company! Located in our namesake city on the Front Range of awesome Colorado, this production brewery's main objective is to serve our community and help craft beer fans, both seasoned and the newly initiated, find the varieties and flavors they desire.
name: Westminster Brewing Co

description: The Weston Brewing Company was first established in 1842 by German immigrant John Georgian. Georgian brought the tradition of lager brewing with him when he settled in Weston. The brewery was designed to utilize ice from the river during winter and lagering cellars dug deep into the ground to create ideal conditions for his beer which needed to be stored below 60 degrees for more than six weeks. In creating the brewery, the Weston Brewing Company became one of the first lager breweries in the United States.
name: Weston Brewing Company

description: "Today, our traditionally produced, award winning draught and bottled products are not only available throughout the UK, but are exported to more than 40 countries worldwide. From supermarkets to local off licences, in hotels, restaurants, pubs and clubs you will find Westons products, continuing in our heritage of quality."
name: Westons Cider

description:
Westport Brewing Company is the first microbrewery on the Washington Coast since 1944 when Pacific Brewing Company closed its doors. Emulating traditional brewing conditions, we brew our beer with local water without amendments, regionally grown hops, and domestic malts. We take advantage of our unique location, on a peninsula between the Pacific Ocean and Grays Harbor, to ferment our beer in polyethylene fermenters at ambient temperatures. This results in smooth, clear, unhurried beer with sparkling clarity, deep, complex flavor profiles, and remarkable consistency between styles.

We currently brew 19 styles of beer and are always exploring new recipes to appeal to the craft-wise thirsty palates of the region.

We currently brew in a 3-Barrel brewhouse but have plans to expand in the near future.

Our brewery welcomes visitors Thursday through Monday, noon to 6PM, each week to sample our wide variety of beer, visit with Mark and Robin and enjoy the beauty of Westport and the Washington Coast!
name: Westport Brewing Company

description: The Westvleteren Brewery is a Belgian brewery founded in 1838 inside the Trappist Abbey of Saint Sixtus of Westvleteren in the Belgian municipality of Vleteren, not far from the hops-producing town of Poperinge and the medieval city of Ypres. The brewery and its beers are usually referred to as Westvleteren. The brewery's three beers have acquired an international reputation for taste and quality, being considered by a percentage of beer aficionados and judges to be "the best beer in the world" (for Wesvleteren XII, a Quadrupel) as well as the limited availability of the beers which are not brewed to normal commercial demands, but are sold in small quantities weekly from the doors of the monastery itself, to individual buyers after reservation only.
name: Westvleteren Abdij St. Sixtus

description:
Just a few guys with a passion for great beer.
​
Quality - Every minute of every day we strive to make our beer the best. The process starts well before the raw materials are at our door. Our brewer, Preston works like a master chef/mad scientist in balancing malt, hop and yeast character months before we even order the ingredients.  

​

Community - Being born and raised in Arizona, we are passionate about our community. Let's not kid ourselves either, downtown has come a long way and we want to keep that progress going.

​

Exploration - We look locally and internationally for our inspiration. Whether it's southwestern ingredients from our back yard or unique spices, coffees and malts from Asia, Africa and Europe...we will never stop exploring.
name: Westward Brewing Co.

description: A nanobrewery that makes awesome interesting beer and provides a nice place to drink it
name: Wet 'N Reckless Brewing

description:
The Wet Dog Café was founded in 1995. The Brewery was added in 1997 under the name Pacific Rim Brewery. The name of the Brewery was changed to Astoria Brewing Co. in 2005 to commemorate Astoria’s First Brewing Company which was established in 1872. The Wet Dog was named after….the original owners dog…he loved the water and was always WET.

Our Brew Master uses only the finest ingredients to create our exceptional beers. Each beer is handcrafted using a wide range of hops & grains, thus creating unique flavors. It takes approximately 2 weeks for grain, water & hops to become our tasty brews. Our brewery has a 4 barrel system & in 2008 we added two 8 barrel fermenting tanks allowing us to produce over 800 barrels annually.
name: Wet Dog Cafe & Astoria Brewing Company

description: Born from a friendship and chance to drink on the job, Billy Jack and Loren started a journey to make beer for themselves.  What grew out of that was the opportunity to create  something for others.  We quickly realized that our experiments needed to be captured and recreated due to popular demand.  This created a year long journey to acquire the needed  regulatory approval.  In January of 2013, it all became official and we were able to open to the public.  Our dream has shifted a few times but the desire to create something loved and consumed by many hasn't changed.  It has been a wonderful and stressful journey so far and we can't wait to see where it takes us next.
name: Wet Head Brewery

description:
Established in 1995, Weyerbacher Brewing Company, Inc. was founded in the historic city of Easton, Pennsylvania. We bring artistry, mischief and adventure to the world of brewing so every Weyerbacher beer is an incredible experience.

We, the brewers of Weyerbacher, are continually pushing the envelope of taste experiences, obliterating style guidelines and having a blast while we're at it! Cheers!
name: Weyerbacher Brewing Company

description: Bringing locally produced beer (by locally produced people) to Wakefield, RI.
name: Whaler's Brewing Company

description: Wharf Hill Brewing Company is a full-service restaurant and brewpub serving our own craft beers, a wide range of other microbrews, a choice selection of wine, and full bar. We are located in a circa 1906 building in the heart of Historic Smithfield, Virginia, within walking distance to many shops and quaint attractions. Our interior is completely made out of reclaimed wood, from 19th- and 20th-century structures in Isle of Wight County and Suffolk. A friendly neighborhood pub to grab a pint and a pretzel, meet old friends, and make new ones.
name: Wharf Hill Brewing Co.

description: Restaurant, Brewery, Bier Garten and Craft Beer Bar.    All with beautiful views, great food and beer in a fun atmosphere on the water in downtown Brattleboro Vermont.
name: Whetstone Station Restaurant and Brewery

description:
Located in Whistler, British Columbia this brewery has a solid rotation of beers consisting of :
Black Tusk Ale, Whiskey Jack Ale, Bear Paw Honey Lager, Powder Mountain Lager and Lost Lake IPA. As well as frequent seasonal offerings.
name: Whistler Brewing Company

description: Founded in 2009, White Birch Brewing has been consistently dedicated to the creation of thoughtful, heartfelt ales for the fun loving beer drinker. Providing beers that range from historical, to contemporary, to the avant-garde, each batch of beer is carefully brewed by hand, and left unfiltered for an exceptional depth of flavor.
name: White Birch Brewing

description:
Opening November 2010 in Richland, WA, White Bluffs Brewing has been creating great brews since day one. 
We started as a 2 bbl brewery, grew to a 7 bbl brewery and are now expanding to a 15 bbl brewery....and we are excited!
Our love of beer, quality ingredients, and 25+ years of experience gives us more than one reason to serve Richland, Kennewick, Pasco and the Northwest with great beer.

Stop in and say hi, we'd love to give you a tour and hang out while you enjoy our humble brewery!

We say "we brew beer with character for people with taste,"  Check us out and find out why.
name: White Bluffs Brewing

description:
We love beer. We love trying new beers, tasting unique flavors, and talking about how amazing craft beer diversity can be. White Flame started with home brewing in our garage and grew into something none of us imagined.


We may not take ourselves seriously, but we take our beers to heart. We put everything we have into our beers for you, and us, to enjoy.

We are proud to be part of the craft beer explosion in Michigan, and are honored to stand with our fellow breweries as representatives of Beer City USA.

What could be better? Brew beer, drink beer, talk beer.
name: White Flame Brewing Company

description: White Labs Inc. was founded in 1995 and supplies breweries, wineries and distilleries with fresh yeast and related products, including analytical services. White Labs was the innovator of pitchable yeast.
name: White Labs Tasting Room

description: White Lion symbolizes grace with limitless boundaries, the consumer being part of something bigger than them; positioned between lessons taught and possibilities inspired by their energy and spirit.
name: White Lion Brewing Company

description: White Pony is a micro-brewery located in Padova (Italy). We brew our beers in Belgium and Italy. All our Beers are handmade, unfiltered & unpasteurized
name: White Pony microbrewery

description:
As a small batch brewery, White River Brewing Company specializes in traditional European beers, particularly styles from Belgium, Britain, and Germany, all with an American twist. With uncompromising quality, at White River Brewing Company we work hard to make each flavorful, complex sip, a special occasion. With every batch we use only the finest ingredients available, individually chosen to add layers and complexity to each of our products.
 
Quality Craft BeerDesigned to appeal to the weekend warrior and discerning enthusiast in all of us, our four staple offerings and seasonal rotating beers are adding steam to the craft beer revolution in Southwest Missouri, and delivering a unique experience in every bottle.
name: White River Brewing

description: The White Squirrel Brewery and Taproom will be opening in Bowling Green, Kentucky in 2015.
name: White Squirrel Brewery

description:
White Street Brewing Co., proud to be located in historic downtown Wake Forest, is a small, locally owned independent manufacturer of craft beer. You can enjoy White Street's flavorful handcrafted ales and lagers in restaurants and bars throughout the Triangle and beyond. Or sit down in our taproom where you can see the entire brewing operation and let us pour you some brewed-on-the-premises goodness.

While snacks are available in our taproom, we are not a restaurant. Our focus is brewing beer and we're not only passionate about it, but we're darn good at it, too. From tours and t-shirts to dart leagues and other special events, you will discover Something's Brewing on White Street.
name: White Street Brewing Company

description:
Whitehorse Brewing is located in Berlin Pennsylvania a few blocks from mainstreets lower diamond. The brewery is located on the edge of the farms that surround Brothersvalley and Somerset county. Our name comes from "Whitehorse Mountain" located right outside of Berlin, where we hunt, play and live.  Whitehorse beers are all natural and made from water, yeast, barley and hops. Some of our seasonal beers will feature natural flavors like brothers valley real maple sugar from our maple trees, and other natural local flavors.

We brew beer here because, well we love it and local is how we have always lived. To us Whitehorse isn't part of a new "slow food movement" it is just our way of life. We pride ourselves in using as much local product as possible and maintaining our natural rural roots in creating the beers we know you will love.

At Whitehorse we believe being environmentally concious and sustainable is important. For example our grains are recycled by giving them to a local farmer who uses it for feed for his livestock which causes no waste into the local environment.

We work to ensure our recipes and products are something we love but also you absolutely enjoy and will also appreciate the perfection we put into them. Please enjoy our beers as much as we enjoy creating them.
name: Whitehorse Brewing LLC

description: The first Craft brewing in Marysville Washington. Dedicated to producing ales of the highest quality for all beer enthusiasts. Opened March 1, 2014, Whitewall just celebrated their first anniversary. Started out on a small nano brewery (2BBL), Whitewall is in the process of more than tripling production as they put together their 7BBL brewhouse.
name: Whitewall Brewing Company

description: Whitewater Brewing Company believes in the pursuit of the ultimate balance between work and play. Our adventures live on through the stories we share with the good people we surround ourselves with. We recognize the important role that good beer plays in sharing these moments, so we work hard to carefully nurture a hand crafted beer using the highest quality ingredients brewed under small batch conditions. The result is a variety of beers worthy of the adventurous spirit inside us all. Whitewater Beer is brewed by friends, for friends.
name: Whitewater Brewing Company

description: Whole Foods Market Brewing Company is the first of its kind—a brewpub located right inside America’s favorite natural and organic grocery store. With an unlimited array of fresh ingredients on site, the beer and food menus  feature an exciting array of local and seasonal flavors. Our Head Brewer Dave Ohmer loves to incorporate local produce, fresh herbs and innovative flavor combinations that reflect the diverse and beloved tastes of Texas.
name: Whole Foods Market Brewing

description: a craft lager brewery in Longmont, Colorado
name: Wibby Brewing

description: Wichita Brewing Company offers a welcoming neighborhood brewpub experience, including 9 flat screen televisions to watch your favorite games, friendly staff, and great entertainment. We are local beer enthusiasts, and we have carefully hand-crafted a variety of unique beers for your enjoyment. We also have an exciting menu of appetizers, pizzas and sandwiches, all baked in our wood-fired pizza oven. So, stop in for lunch with your co-workers, bring the family for dinner, or meet your friends for a few brews after work. We're waiting for you!
name: Wichita Brewing Company

description: We at Wicked Barley aim to provide a warm and inviting atmosphere which will include a covered patio, a waterfront beer garden, and a boat dock in addition to our nearly 2200 sq ft tap room. We will also have our own 73-car parking lot because let’s be honest, parking in this town can be miserable sometimes!
name: Wicked Barley Brewing Company

description:
Wicked Beaver is a West Texas Craft Brewery, formed in Spring of 2009. We are a hands-on Brewery, with no automation to speak of, this keeps us in touch with every batch of beer we brew.

On an old dirt road, far from the beaten path, deep in the midst of no-where lives a Wicked Beaver. Why is he Wicked, you may ask? He is Wicked from the ways of the world, so many demands, too many deadlines, minor appreciation, and never enough time. So with little more than the stick in his hand and the Hops in his hanker chief, he journeyed West. Upon arriving in the West he hopped from the tailgate, choked on the dust, and kicked a tumble weed rolling his direction. This is the West, the place full of opportunity “he asked himself” and sighed but after a few Wicked Cold months, the landscape began to change, grass became lush green, trees bloomed and the flowers opened. The Wicked Beaver found the warm days, and cool nights were perfect to pursue his passion.

The Wicked Beaver and his brewing partners have been Brewing Craft Specialty Beer’s in secret for years, perfecting the fragrant aroma by blending only best hops and hand selecting the Malted Barley for the most unique varieties of flavors and textures. The Wicked Beaver is ready to share his unique creations with you!
name: Wicked Beaver Brewing Company

description: Wicked Weed Brewing is based in Asheville, North Carolina. Opened in December 2012, the original brewpub (91 Biltmore) consistently hosts 25+ beers on tap including hop-forward, West Coast-style ales, open fermented Belgians, and barrel-aged beers. With the opening of the second location, The Funkatorium, in October 2013, Wicked Weed is striving to become one of the leading producers of barrel-aged sour and wild beers in the Southeastern United States. Wicked Weed Brewing was awarded a gold medal for both 100% Brettanomyces Serenity in 2013 and Mompara Honey Ale in 2014 at the Great American Beer Festival. Wicked Weed most recently opened 50-barrel production brewery that will allow for wider distribution in the Southeast.
name: Wicked Weed Brewing Company

description:
Wicks Brewing Company is not your typical Brewery. Besides brewing up barrels of delicious Craft Beer and having a full tasting bar, we offer our guests other amenities as well. 

If you are an avid homebrewer or wish to jump into the hobby of homebrewing, we carry everything you need to brew your own Craft Beer or Soft Drinks at home...yes, Soft Drinks as well. There’s no tastier Root Beer than one you made yourself. 

If you would like to brew your own Craft Beer or Soft Drinks, but don’t have the room to do it at home or just plain don’t want to own the tools & equipment, we have that covered as well. We have six separate stations where you can brew your own Craft Beer or Soft Drink right here at Wicks Brewing. This system is known as a Brew on Premise (or BOP). All you need to do is choose one of our recipes you would like to try and we will walk you thru the whole brewing process using one of our BOP stations and the ingredients from our stock.

Hungry?...Well, we can take care of that as well. We have an onsite, fully stocked kitchen. The delicious choices on our menu range from appetizers to salads to hardy meals and even desserts. 

Make Wicks Brewing your next destination for fun & relaxation, you’ll be happy you did.
name: Wicks Brewing Co

description:
Widmer Brothers Brewing is located in beautiful and brew-friendly Portland, OR. Our publicly-held brewery employs over 150 people who are as passionate about quality craft beer as Kurt & Rob themselves.

We opened the brewery in 1984, and built a new 40-barrel brewing system in our current Russell Street location in 1990. We've grown steadily ever since. In 1996, we completed installation of a state-of-the art 250-barrel brewhouse, bringing our capacity to 220,000 barrels per year. In 1996, for the first time in our brewery’s history we also installed a bottling line, capable of producing 500 bottles per minute. In 2008 we added six new 1500-barrel fermentation tanks that increased our capacity to 450,000 barrels per year, and added a new keg filling line capable of filling 300 kegs per hour.
name: Widmer Brothers Brewing

description: Wiens Brewing Company was born with a homebrew kit in the family kitchen back in 1995. Over the years we grew up and branched out, but the joy of homebrewing and our dream of having our own brewery never left us. In 2012 the dream finally became a reality with the opening of Wiens Brewing Company! We love hops, and strive to make unique and distinctive handcrafted beer with quality ingredients. We hope that you will enjoy drinking them as much as we enjoy brewing them!
name: Wiens Brewing Company

description:
The Wig and Pen Tavern and Brewery is a Canberra institution for those who appreciate the value of a truly good beer or cider. Opened by Lachlan McOmish in 1994 and still going strong- the pub moves from strength to strength with its delicious beer and warm, friendly atmosphere. The bar features local wines, an excellent selection of spirits as well as 15 beers and 1 cider, which are all masterfully brewed by the brilliant and award winning Richard Watkins. As an added bonus, 4 of our beers are traditional real ales which means they are cask conditioned and hand-pumped (a rare find in Australia!) The kitchen also serves up some excellent English pub food including burgers, bangers and mash, cheese platters and curries.

So come along and enjoy all that we can offer because, in the words of Lachlan McOmish, "Life is too short not to enjoy the finest quality beers."
name: Wig & Pen Tavern & Brewery

description: Plan on brewing Czech beer using authentic Czech ingredients and methods. In planning stage.
name: Wilber Czech Brewing Company

description: Wild Beer, Wild Yeasts, Wild Ingredients, Wild Ideas, Wild Ambitions...
name: Wild Beer Co.

description: The World's Best Cider. Produced and packaged in the shadow of the Great Colorado Rockies. Indulge your senses with all our different ciders. Get Wild!
name: Wild Cider

description: Donkey Punch Brewing Co. features full-flavored craft beers like no others. We hope to see you come out and experience the punch!
name: Wild Donkey Brewing Co.

description: One of Washington's new artisanal breweries, Wild Earth Brewing handcrafts its products in the foothills of the Cascade Mountains. Brewed in small batches for our onsite taproom and limited distribution of kegs and bottles around the area. We aim to continually challenge ourselves through unique production methods and ingredients to bring our customers the best beer possible. Stop by our taproom for the latest bottle offerings, growler fills, or to enjoy a fresh pint of our latest batch.
name: Wild Earth Brewing

description: Wild Goose Brewery was purchased by Flying Dog Brewing Company.
name: Wild Goose Brewery, LLC

description: Wild Heaven is a Georgia company created by lifelong Georgians - founder Nick Purdy (also Publisher of Paste Magazine) with beer recipes designed by Trappeze Pub owner Eric Johnson. Our core year-round portfolio is focused on world-class beers designed to offer something new to the beer landscape—not simply creating our version of what everyone else is doing.
name: Wild Heaven Craft Beers

description: Handcrafted Lagers & Ales, Brewed on Site! Available by the Pint, Growler, Can, or Keg!
name: Wild Onion Brewing

description: Wild Ride Brewing is a production brewery and Tap Room located in the heart of downtown Redmond, Oregon. Planning began in late 2011, and the beers began flowing from the taps at Wild Ride Brewing on May 10, 2014. We are now open 7 days a week with food options available from the food cart community located in the parking lot just off our patio outside of our family-friendly Tap Room.
name: Wild Ride Brew

description:
Wild Rose Brewery, located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, is a craft brewery that produces bottled beers and draught ales available to beer lovers in pubs, restaurants and liquor outlets all across Alberta.

All Wild Rose beers are unpasteurized and preservative-free. That's not because we are lazy; rather, it's a conscious choice to offer beer lovers the best products available in Canada. That quality is reflected in our six bottled beers and our draught-only classic ales.
name: Wild Rose Brewery

description:
Currently a homebrew shop and nano - brewery serving growlers of beer and rootbeer. We offer homebrew demonstrations every saturday at noon! 

Look for our Pub coming later this fall
name: Wild Wolf Brewing Co

description: Wild Woods is a microbrewery in Boulder, Colorado that creates handcrafted beers inspired by the outdoors. Our beers begin with recognizable styles and are brewed to highlight elements of the wilderness.
name: Wild Woods Brewery

description:
Wildcard Brewing Company was just a dream until experience, encouragement and circumstance made it a reality. The idea behind the name Wildcard is to pursue the unknown. Wildcard Brewing Company’s owners left stability for chaos, moved to England to learn the craft of beer making, and started a business in an uncertain economy, all in pursuit of a dream. You’d call them crazy, adventurous, unpredictable....a wildcard. Our story is one of the unexpected; a place where there are no limits, where perseverance and a free spirit will turn dreams into reality. 

It started when Jeff and Jenny brewed two beers to give away as wedding favors at a brewery in San Luis Obispo where they went to college. Homebrew projects and burst bottle explosions ensued in the years after. But a casual passion soon turned career as Jeff and Jenny headed to England. Jeff studied brewing science at the University of Sunderland and Jenny conducted “research” in various local pubs. Once back in the states Jeff headed straight for the most competitive brewing location, the Pacific Northwest. Now 4 years later the pair are back in Jeff’s hometown of Redding building out their production brewery.

Wildcard is small startup business focused on brewing flavorful beers and enriching the communities that enjoy them. Spending dollars locally is just a part of that commitment. We will source products and services within 500 miles of our facility as much as possible and intend to exclusively sell beers within that same area. Supporting local businesses not only has great economic impacts but environmental as well. We don’t want to just do business in the Redding community we want to be a part of it. It is important to give back as much as possible to the community and we will make it a point to donate and get involved in local causes and efforts.
name: Wildcard Brewing Company

description: Planned micro-brewery specializing in non-traditional beers, including Lambics, Rauchbier, barrels aged Stouts and Sours. Currently experimenting with recipes, and setting up funding. Expected opening year is 2017
name: Wilde Yaupon Brewing Co

description: Wildlife Brewing and Pizza was founded in 2003 by Owner & Head Brewer Ric Harmon. Since then we have been serving up Award-Winning Micro Brews, Tasty Pizza Creations, and delivering Great Service.
name: Wildlife Brewing and Pizza

description: Four region dudes and a chick dedicated to making the best brews possible!
name: Wildrose Brewing Company

description: Wildwood Brewery is a organic craft brewery in Western Montana committed to building an integrated brewing/farming system where all wastes are used as value-added input.
name: Wildwood Brewing

description: Wiley Brewing Company is a "Genius" entrepreneurial brewery in the early stages of development. Specialities include "Estate" and "Big" brews for the courageous beer drinker.
name: Wiley Brewing Company

description: Wiley Roots Brewing Company is a small, artisan craft brewery that opened in Greeley, Colorado in June of 2013.
name: Wiley Roots Brewing Company

description: Scottish Craft Beer - Microbrewed For Maximum Flavour. A brotherhood of brewers, creating unique beers while enjoying life beyond the mash tun. Creating & selling exciting new & historical brews worldwide.
name: Williams Brothers Brewing Company

description: Willie’s Brew ‘n’ Que is DC’s premier BBQ restaurant and sports bar. Willie’s focuses on the art of low and slow barbecue cooking. Located in the Nation’s capital a hop skip and a jump from Nationals Park, we cook a wide variety of BBQ items with influences from across the country. Our focus is on making simple food delicious, and pairing it with great drinks and a lively sports atmosphere.
name: Willie's Brew & Que

description: Our original Main Street Café was founded in 1991, and began operations as a small deli in the old Capitol Theatre building on Main Street in Willimantic, CT. Occupying both the lobby and concession area of the theatre, seating was limited to 50 people. After 3 years we were bursting at the seams and made the move to 877 Main Street, another historic building. There we expanded to a full service restaurant and featured American craft-brewed beers and an extensive menu.
name: Willimantic Brewing Company

description: Serving the best food and craft beer in Lake County, featuring live entertainment 3 nights per week in an amazing atmosphere. Come see what's brewing!!
name: Willoughby Brewing Company

description: New microbrewery in Syracuse NY specializing in American style ale.
name: Willow Rock Brewing Company

description: Homegrown from a small Homebrew shop to a 11,800 sqft facility,Wilmington Brewing Company is excited to serve you fresh local beer straight from the tank to your glass. Located right in the middle of Wilmington, WBC includes a 3bbl brewery, tasting room, and a Homebrew supply store. We look forward to seeing you soon!
name: Wilmington Brewing Company
Wiltse's Brew Pub and Family Restaurant

description: Good Beer for Good People
name: Winchester Brewing Company

description: Locally owned and operated Cidery here in the Shenandoah Valley.
name: Winchester Ciderworks

description:
Wind River Brewing Company is located at the base of the Wind River Mountains in downtown Pinedale, Wyoming. Our brewery is the spot for those who appreciate the art of handcrafted superior brews with a wide range of flavors and notes. We brew award winning beers, created in-house using only the finest ingredients and pure glacier water.

"We are known for having legendary beer and the best food in town." If you're looking for a quick bite to eat or want to relax and sample our entire selection of beer we welcome you to join us at Wind River Brewing Co.
name: Wind River Brewing Company

description: Beautiful beaches, a great climate, superb golf courses, fishing, nearby mountains and the world's best whisky, the Moray Coast is a great place to live. Now, Windswept Brewing Co Ltd have added award winning local ales to the list of Moray's attractions.
name: Windswept Brewing Co

description:
We are the first, and only, licensed and bonded cidery in the Piedmont of the Carolinas.  We produce various types of Award Winning Hand-Crafted Hard Ciders with a commitment to sustainable agricultural practices.
 
As an extension of Windy Hill Orchard and Cidery, we are family owned and operated and located in York, SC.
 
Please be sure to visit our facebook page and our orchard website for details about upcoming events, product news, and hours and directions.
name: Windy Hill Orchard & Cidery

description: Craft brewing has been a passionate sideline for Freycinet winemaker Claudio Radenti and partner Lindy Bull for more than a decade. Hazards Ale was originally brewed at the St Ives brew-pub in Hobart; currently it’s being produced by Australian Independent Breweries in Sydney using Tasmanian grown malted barley and hops. The beer’s spiritual home is undoubtedly the Hazards Bar at Freycinet Lodge where you can enjoy this fruity, amber ale while gazing at the pink-tinged Hazards rock formation opposite.
name: Wineglass Bay Brewing

description: Inspired by Tacoma's legacy of honest hard work, Wingman Brewers strives to create a strong selection of spirited, full-flavored beers for the South Sound region.
name: Wingman Brewers

description:
Winter Park Beer Co is Florida’s first pico brewery serving unfiltered homebrew to the masses.

Our goal is to become a brewery that not only serves great beer but is also involved in the community. Winter Park Beer Co. is a new breed of brewery designed to educate those interested in beer and brewing while creating high quality unfiltered beer.
name: Winter Park Beer Company

description: A Bristol based brewery. Find our beer at destinations across the country and further afield. We hope you enjoy the drinking as much as we did the brewing.
name: Wiper and True

description:
he Wisconsin Brewing Company brewhouse we're building is an exciting mixture of old world, artisan craftsmanship and state-of-the art brewing technology. Built in Hudson, WI, our German-engineered Huppmann Brewhouse will be capable of producing in excess of 100,000 barrels of Wisconsin craft beer annually. The tradition and history behind Huppmann goes back more than 130 years—perfect for true craft beer.

In addition to a great brew house, we have a one-barrel Pilot Brewery on site to develop many of our beers, as well as an event center for parties and other events. The event center also has a gift shop, where you can buy Wisconsin Brewing Company apparel, gift items, and of course, beer.

Put all these pieces together next to a scenic pond with access to bike trails and plenty of beautiful landscape and you can have one heck of a brewery experience.
name: Wisconsin Brewing Company

description: MOOSEJAW, with their 15 barrel "copper-clad" brewhouse, serves 10 different styles of hand-crafted microbrews. They have the capacity to brew 500-1000 gallons of beer per day. Brewmaster Jamie Baertsch is feverishly working on seasonal flavors as well. These brews can be enjoyed at any of the three bars located within the brewpub.
name: Wisconsin Dells Brewing Co.

description: WISEACRE is a craft brewery committed to top quality, uniquely flavorful beer that appeals to passionate & progressive people through education & good times.  The brewery name comes from a term of endearment/scolding their grandmother used on the young troublemakers.  Brothers Davin & Kellan Bartosch dreamed up WISEACRE many moons ago & have been on an extensive quest procuring top-notch experience from around the globe to deliver the crunkest brewery possible in their groovy hometown of Memphis, TN.
name: Wiseacre Brewing Co.

description: We are an artisanal Denver brewery fueled by dreams and inspired by the limitless potential of craft beer since 2011…Join us on our journey!
name: Wit's End Brewing Company

description: Our little family started at the Witch's Hat in South Lyon in 2007 when we said "I do". When life dealt us lemons we decided to make beer. Here we are - trying our hand at the Beer Lover's Dream. Give us a taste :)
name: Witch's Hat Brewing Company

description:
Our brewery is dedicated to brewing great tasting beers, supporting sustainable agriculture, and minimizing our impact on the environment.

100% Organic Hops and Malts
name: Wolaver's Fine Organic Ales

description: We are locally owned and are located in the heart of Vancouver Island. We are passionate about craft beer and about producing the best quality beer possible. Our beer is sold in bottles, growlers and kegs. We encourage you to try our beer and to continue to check back regularly for upcoming events, new products and where to find our beer. But you are always welcome to stop in and sample our beer and to meet our staff who are inspired daily by producing phenomenal beer and ensuring it gets out to beer lovers every where.
name: Wolf Brewing Company

description: Wolf Creek Brewery was founded as a brewpub in 1997 as "Wolf Creek Restaurant & Brewing Co." by Rob and Laina McFerren.  Brewer, Rob, has won many awards for his varied beer styles, including "Howlin' Hefeweizen" (Bavarian Hef) and "Midnight Howl" and India Black Ale.  In 2013, they expanded brewery operations and built a production facility in the Mann-Biomedical Park in Valencia.  June 2nd, 2014 marks the date of their first bottling run.  Cheers!
name: Wolf Creek Restaurant and Brewery

description: WOLF HILLS BREWING CO is a craft brewery located in historic Abingdon, Virginia. The brewery takes its name from the original appellation that Daniel Boone gave to the wilderness that became Abingdon. Tradition holds that Boone and his hunting companion spent a sleepless night along a hill on the Great Road after their dogs encountered a pack of wolves, which had a den in a nearby cave. Drawing from this rich history, Wolf Hills Brewing CO melds together time honored brewing methods using only the highest quality ingredients with modern beer styles inspired by the wide array of fragrant hops from the Pacific-Northwest. Wolf Hills brews in small batches that are only distributed in the Virginia Highlands. The result is a level of fresh, savory beer that is unmatched in this region. Discover one of our many styles for yourself . . . you’ll be howling for more.
name: Wolf Hills Brewing Co

description:
A family owned and operated craft brewery and restaurant, created as a result of our long and deepening love for both craft beer and food. WRB was born through the deep desire of the owners to create a gathering space for other craft beer and food lovers in the downtown Columbus community. Our goal is to build a microbrewery and restaurant that becomes a proud member of the community, where we provide our patrons with the best possible dining and drinking experience.

Our wonderful staff and team strive to offer the highest quality craft beer and a casual, comfortable restaurant environment inspired by a new American menu featuring fresh and seasonal ingredients.
name: Wolf's Ridge Brewing

description: Wolfe Brewing Company has just opened in Pagosa Springs Colorado. Hand-crafted micro beers brewed on-site. Full menu available as well. Open 11am daily.
name: Wolfe Brewing Company

description:
Wölffer Estate Vineyard is unquestionably a beautiful place. But the creation of it spanned over three decades and required a creative vision, an ability to bring dreams to reality and a great deal of dedicated hard work by many people. Christian Wölffer possessed the vision and, with the meticulous care of his professional team, built this special place – Wölffer Estate Vineyard.

The original parcel of land was a potato farm with an old farmhouse in what is now the middle of the estate. Over the years, as more acres were acquired, paddocks and stables were added and, in 1988, the vineyard was founded. This 55-acre vineyard is part of a 175-acre estate with boarding stables, 30 paddocks, an indoor jumping ring, and a Grand Prix field. Both the stables and winery have a European character and, from these former potato fields, world-class wines have come forth. Wölffer Estate Vineyard is an American winery in the classic European tradition.
name: Wolffer

description: We are the proud brewers of Michigan's Most Drinkable Beers. We are the only microbrewery in Michigan that specializes in making lagers for everyone. What does this mean? It means that from light to dark, every beer we brew is designed to be a beer you can love.
name: Wolverine State Brewing Company

description:
Wonderland Brewing Company is a new small batch brewery in Broomfield, Colorado, and our goal is to turn every frown upside down. Big dreams, a big property, and carefully crafted beers are our not-so-secret ingredients to do so. With 9,000-square-feet of space, 94 parking spots, and over an acre of outdoor fun, Wonderland Brewing Company offers a unique craft beer experience to beer-buffs of all sorts.

How can you get a unique craft beer experience at our brewery, you wonder? Hold a ping pong match on one of our six tournament-style ping pong tables that adorn our tasting room, burn those hard earned beer calories al fresco on our basketball courts, or simply take a seat in one of the largest tasting rooms around and enjoy a quality, hand-crafted brew. Thanks to our shocking space that's ideal for corporate outings, private parties, farmers markets, classic car shows, yoga classes, and more, Wonderland Brewing Company is an oasis for the community and beyond.

Enough bragging about our property, though. Wanna know why we chose to dive into the brewing industry?

Our passion for people, happiness, and the magic behind making beer inspires our team to bring the community together to celebrate life and cherish the ritual of beer. We truly treasure craft beer's gift of rallying friends and family, and we are excited for the opportunity to bring joy to beer-fanatics. Our head brewer values the art and science of brewing beer and has a philosophy entrenched in care for his creations, which will be discovered during every sip of our quality brews.

When you visit Wonderland, you'll find a creative crew that is committed to making you smile.

Please know that standards are set high for Wonderland Brewing Company in all aspects of our brewery.
name: Wonderland Brewing Company

description: Wooden Bear Brewing Company — Indiana’s newest microbrewery — is the first-ever brewery in Greenfield.  The brewery provides a casual, laid-back atmosphere where friends can gather and families can enjoy time together in beautiful downtown Greenfield.  Wooden Bear is located in the former Gant Opera House, which opened in 1895 just next door to Greenfield’s first firehouse.  All of our beers are hand-crafted with a lot of love, a little hops and the hope of making fellow craft beer lovers smile.
name: Wooden Bear Brewing Co.

description:
The Wooden Legs Brewing Company name is tongue in cheek homage to Judge Wilmot Wood Brookings. Judge Brookings is a significant figure in history of South Dakota. The county and city were named after him although he only visited the city twice.

In February 1858, Brookings rode a horse from Sioux Falls to the Yankton area during a blizzard. His horse slipped and fell into Split Rock Creek in the freezing weather. Brookings made it safely to Yankton, but his wet legs had suffered such severe frostbite they both needed to be amputated. He spent the rest of his life using a pair of squeaky, wooden legs.
name: Wooden Legs Brewing Company

description: Wooden Robot is a new urban farmhouse craft brewery that will be located in Charlotte, NC!
name: Wooden Robot Brewery

description: A contemporary artisan brewery focused on a unique beer experience. Located in the heart of Sonoma County. Opening Spring 2013...
name: Woodfour Brewing Company

description:
Imaginative brew creations concocted by husband and wife team Rob and Keely Landerman, Dusty Schmidt, and Tom Dolan.
Handcrafted. Imaginative. Idahoan.
name: Woodland Empire Ale Craft

description:
We like to be outside, in the woods.  We love great beer.  Hops too.  We also happen to make some pretty damn good beer, we hope you'll think so too.


We found a great spot to make and share our beers.  We brew on a 5 bbl electric brewhouse and double batch into our 10 bbl jacketed fermenters once a week. (of course jacketed! Temperature control is a top priority in our brewery...).  We brew something new every week.  

Barrel aged beers (locally sourced barrels, lucky for us!) and cask ales will be two of the main focuses at Woodland.

Our hope is that you can stop by Woodland, check our our test planting of 18' tall rows of lupulin goodness, all while drinking either some ridiculously fresh ales fermented with locally grown ingredients OR a well aged Big 'Ol Beer.  Something new every week to try and multiple new offerings on Cask every Tuesday. 


Hope to see you soon.


-AJ, Keith, and Nick
name: Woodland Farm Hop & Fermentation

description: Custom Brewing Services and Brewpub at the Whistle Stop
name: Woodman Brewery

description: The Downtown Grill & Brewery is a nice brewpub downtown with patio seating on Gay Street as well as a back porch. The atmosphere is lodge-like with rich wood and copper brewing equipment. There is also a private room you can rent upstairs.
name: Woodruff Brewing Company

description: Adventurous beer for curious drinkers. Brewed fresh in San Francisco and Oakland, CA.
name: Woods Beer Co.

description: Brewhouse located in historic downtown Woodstock.
name: Woodstock Brewhouse

description:
The Woodstock Inn opened in 1982.

The Woodstock Inn Brewery began brewing beer in 1995 on a 7 barrel system. We started as a Brew Pub with 8 different beers. As demand for our beers grew we added a 30 barrel production facility in 2012. We have two breweries on our property. The seven barrel brewery brews for our restaurant and does limited releases. The 30 barrel does all of our production and bottling. We do Brewery Tours every day at noon, seven days a week. There is a $5.00 charge, a pint glass a tasting is included. We also have a cask ale always on in the Brew Pub.  
 
The Brewery is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner, 7 days a week. We also have 33 well appointed guest rooms, we also have a function room for 165 for weddings and gatherings.  Please stop by for a visit.
name: Woodstock Inn Station & Brewery

description: Woodward Avenue Brewers, or “WAB”, as we're affectionately called, is much more than a restaurant or bar. Established in 1997, The WAB has become a landmark along Woodward Avenue in Ferndale and has welcomed visitors – those in the neighborhood and those far and wide – for more than 16 years. Pioneers of the craft brew scene, WAB is the go-to gathering place for patrons to enjoy handcrafted brews, great food, friendly atmosphere and the action on historic Woodward Avenue.
name: Woodward Avenue Brewers

description: Woody’s Brewing Co. is a dream of many decades that has finally evolved from a love to consume and brew beer, to all other activities involved with it. We are a brewery that started out with three men’s passion to deliver good beer in a great atmosphere. We are believers of the do it yourself attitude and feel that mantra shines through in our high quality and artfully perfected ales. So... Do it yourself! Because it's your actions that matter.
name: Woody's Brewing Company

description: Wop's Hops Brewing Co. is Sanford, Florida's first microbrewery. Come sample our fine Ales in our tasting room and beer garden. Dog friendly.
name: Wop's Hops Brewing Company

description:
Working Man Brewing is Livermore’s newest brewery, located at 5542 Brisa Street, just off of Vasco Road.  Getting the brewery up and running has been a labor of love for the owners, taking the better part of 18 months to turn the space into a full production brewery.  We are excited to finally bring our love of beer and commitment to quality to Livermore, the Tri-Valley, and beyond.

Our story is one of two independent breweries, Mt. Diablo Brewing and Working Man Brewing Company, coming together to work on one common goal.  Both companies were founded by award-winning home brewers who have a passion to bring high quality, well crafted beer that is fresh and local.  A chance meeting brought these working men together; a shared vision now combines forces under one name, Working Man Brewing Company.

The company’s brewers have each have spent years working to perfect great beer recipes.  Beer geeks at heart, both will tinker and tweak the ingredients until the product is just right.  The main goal always being to make a beer they could be proud to share and proud to drink. We never let a beer go out the door that we don’t believe in.
name: Working Man Brewing Company

description:
Winery Exchange was founded in 1999 and is headquartered in Novato, California, USA. The company maintains regional sales offices around the United States and international offices in the United Kingdom and Spain.

Winery Exchange is the only full-service, corporate brand, beverage alcohol company that sources beer, wine and spirits from the finest regions worldwide. The company was founded with the intent of blending extensive industry expertise with cutting-edge business practices. The result is a dynamic, fast-growing company poised to take advantage of new trends in the beverage alcohol industry.
name: World Brews, Winery Exchange

description: Worcester's only brewery.  Winner of numerous awards including the 2014 US Open Grand National Champion.
name: Wormtown Brewery

description:
Backed by the support of countless friends and neighbors, Worth Brewing Company opened on March 17, 2007. Its owners, the husband-and-wife team of Peter Ausenhus and Margaret Bishop, have lived near Northwood since their purchase of a nearby farmhouse and acreage in 1998. Nebraska natives, Peter and Margaret lived and worked in Minneapolis for many years before moving to Worth County, where Peter’s grandparents had lived and farmed and where Peter had spent much time as a boy.

 Having already established Margaret’s engineering business in downtown Northwood, the couple turned next to Peter’s passion – brewing great beer. For 24 years, Peter has brewed award-winning beer, winning contests, teaching others and perfecting classic recipes along the way. He’s a BJCP National Beer Judge, has brewed professionally with Summit Brewing Company of St. Paul, Minn., and worked on staff at one of the country’s most popular brewing supply shops.

Worth Brewing Company is Peter and Margaret’s way of helping to reintroduce a great tradition – the locally owned brewery serving hand-crafted, high-quality, distinctive beers for the enjoyment of locals and lucky visitors.
